text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Working within our India Operations, you help the wider Large Customer Sales (LCS) team in North America better serve advertisers by focusing on delivery against clients goals, providing insights and impacting the business growth for the region. You continue to hone your account management skills, supporting Google's top advertisers and agencies by providing the best possible consultation on AdWords, Google Display Network and YouTube auction platforms.
With a rapidly growing array of Sales teams, it's important to have experienced leaders who guide our client Sales teams to success. You will lead a team in India which supports North America. You will also oversee coaching of high-performing teams that use consultative skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions. You will work with the Sales Leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. You help Sales Managers to drive their teams to deliver on ambitious targets, and roll up their sleeves to partner with clients to exceed business growth across markets and verticals. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team and you take an analytical approach to sales management.Responsibilities
Build a team that becomes a center of excellence for all campaign management-related activities, and continually identify activities that could be done centrally and help in seamless transition of the same.
Manage teams of Account Optimizers to deliver excellent performance, develop their digital marketing expertise and mentor them, providing supportive career evaluations and facilitating professional development plans.
Coach on implementing best practices and analytical insights to ensure that quarterly targets are met.
Identify process improvement areas and solutions, and share and encourage best practices across both local and in-country LCS teams.
Lead and execute on plans to identify, standardize and centralize activities-related support for our North America LCS team, both from India and abroad.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in global sales support/global sales management.
Preferred qualifications
Project management experience and/or proven ability to deliver across a variety of teams.
Understanding of the full range of Google products, with the ability to coach team members on how to implement and optimize them.
In-depth knowledge of both online and offline advertising solutions and media landscape.
Comfortable with numbers and complex analyses, with the ability to synthesize results, draw conclusions and convert them into business opportunities.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
title: Head of India Large Customer Services

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As a Google Account Executive, you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions. Google has become a leader in this space because we've developed effective products and services targeted to marketers and consumers. The primary responsibility of the Account Executive is to drive and grow new business with Google’s top advertisers. You'll manage business relationships to ensure that the clients' needs and requirements are met. This will require you to serve as their advocate within Google while collaborating with other Google teams to provide them with a comprehensive portfolio of solutions and options. This is a client-facing role requiring deep industry expertise, proven sales ability and a broad base of industry contacts.Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with a team to drive growth with new and existing customers.
Develop high-level relationships to serve as a trusted consultant with major customers to optimize their advertising.
Generate business plans to define your strategies and tactics.
Understand and adapt to Google's ongoing product and technology developments.
Manage multiple cross-product opportunities and projects.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media.
Preferred qualifications
8 years of relevant experience in digital advertising sales.
A deep understanding of the industry's issues, a vision for its growth and a commitment to advance Google's forward-looking strategies within the marketplace.
Knowledge of and established relationships within the advertising industry and the relevant industry vertical.
Knowledge of traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
Willing to travel.
title: Account Executive, Retail

text:
Google is a universally recognized name. The Localization team helps Google's ideas and products look, feel and sound natural to users in their own countries. We collaborate with international Engineering, Product and Marketing teams to steer products through the localization process and ensure successful launches across the globe. Our team is an international collection of enthusiastic, creative and knowledgeable people who excel in a fast-paced, culturally diverse environment. You are an excellent communicator who plays a strategic role by building relationships with partner teams to establish needs, deadlines and budgets. You will flex your project management skills in order to ensure that our Localization process runs effectively and efficiently.
As Americas Language Services Manager, you are responsible for delivering high-quality localized products and content. You will work closely with Engineers, Product Managers, Content Authors, Marketing Managers, and Language Specialists. You are a self-starter, proactive, collaborative and dedicated to meeting deadlines and producing results. You thrive working in a culturally diverse and fast-paced environment. You have a background in people and project management.
The Google Localization Team translates and adapts Google’s products, marketing materials and support content into many languages. Localization supports Google’s continuous innovation and fast-paced launch cycles, working across multiple functions and locations. This means that Localization team members need to be proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, and able to work well in a fast-paced, multi-cultural and team-oriented environment.
Responsibilities
Act as primary liaison for all high-level issues related to localization support for direct reports and oversee the overall project management workflow for Language Services.
Understand challenges and opportunities of an agile development environment, adapt best practices to new technologies and/or development methodologies. Identify and minimize risks in the localization process. Develop and implement processes to increase efficiency and decrease cost and time to market for localized products.
Drive quality initiatives by engaging local marketing, Localization Project Managers and Product teams. Consider impact to Language Services team when making decisions. Drive teamwork at a global level. Develop a deep knowledge of the market and target user base and ensure linguistic quality meets market's expectations. Represent Google within the localization industry.
Develop and maintain relationships with local and cross-functional teams, building a strong internal network to address linguistic issues. Drive initiatives to improve collaboration with related teams.
Identify areas of development for direct reports; guide them toward necessary resources and steps for improving.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in a customer-facing or vendor management role.
Relevant experience including direct people management.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in the localization and online marketing/advertising industry.
Ability to thrive in a remote office
Ability to communicate effectively to a variety of audiences.
Ability to give and receive feedback effectively, especially in difficult situations.
Solid coaching and mentoring skills.
Strong leadership and influencing skills.
title: Americas Language Services Manager
locations: São Paulo - State of São Paulo, Brazil

text:
As a Partner Operations Manager, you will work closely with various functions within gTech Partners as well as other cross-functional groups and act as "voice of the partner" and help with influencing product strategy and feature prioritization discussions. You'll help field escalations, manage bugs, synthesize user feedback reports and drive process improvements. You will also manage high-touch support operations team, work closely with internal teams to create and streamline support operational processes, provide training to support teams, as well as develop detailed documentation and process diagrams. You may also be responsible for developing external help center content and partner education materials for our partners and/or users. You are analytically minded, self-starting, detail oriented, data drive, and skilled at solving problems and explaining complex issues.Responsibilities
Become the go-to product expert, manage escalations from support teams, drive onboarding of new businesses, and build strong working relationships with cross-functional points of contact, such as: Product Management, Engineering, Partnership/Sales, Marketing, PR, and Legal. Engage and partner with key Product decision makers to communicate and realize support goals.
Identify, drive, and optimize the operations support plan, leveraging support team members and Google technologies.
Maintain a pulse on user feedback, provide prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges, and provide meaningful feedback to product teams to improve the user experience.
Compile, analyze, and report out on workflow metrics, summarizing partner support metrics. Use data to independently and proactively optimize existing processes and develop new processes and infrastructure to improve internal efficiency, partner satisfaction, and product experience and write compelling, clear Help Center pages and external facing communications and create rich media.
Oversee localization process and help develop global partner education strategy.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of relevant experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience creating inspiring, benefit-oriented, consumer-focused help content or user education materials. Experience working in internet products and technologies.
Experience working in technology, journalism, education, support operations, and/or consulting
Experience with management of a vendor workforce, including: workflow set up, training, quality reviews, and handling escalations. Working knowledge of SQL, Linux and a scripting language.
Proven ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously and drive projects to completion, with minimum guidance and high attention to detail.
Ability to work independently on project deliverables in a fast-paced ambiguous environment with proven success in project management, execution and multi-tasking.
Outstanding presentation skills as well as verbal and written communication skills.
title: Partner Operations Manager, Partner Solutions

text:
Google's legal department is at the center of an information law revolution, and you're at its core. As a Legal Specialist, you are a driving force behind the success of your Legal team, ready to roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, conduct legal research and coordinate communications across the team. As you closely support your team, you may find yourself working with multiple groups within the Legal Department, internal clients across Google, and external parties. You're an independent thinker who isn't afraid to ask questions, and you're organized in a way that never overlooks the details.
The focus of this role will involve managing and improving existing processes as well as creating new processes and overseeing their implementation. You will be managing and organizing information and documentation for the benefit of the teams which you support to improve their efficiency and effectiveness and acting as an expert and thought leader in high impact areas.Responsibilities
Develop processes to test and report on search query results against large data sets in proprietary formats.
Provide recommendations based on linguistics and objective analysis to legal team used to evaluate efficacy of search terms and search term revisions.
Support a wide variety of quality control processes including final validation of search criteria applied against large data populations.
Provide on-going support to case teams in all areas of advanced search techniques.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of work experience at an eDiscovery vendor, law firm, in-house legal department or comparable experience.
Experience in areas of SQL, including experience writing queries to generate customized reports.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with LAW, Concordance, Summation, Recommind, Nuix, Relativity or other discovery software.
Background in Linguistics and/or database query language; Knowledge in utilizing advanced functionalities with VLOOKUP in Google Apps or other spreadsheet software. Strong proficiency with Google Apps.
Proven track record of working with large data sets in a logical, mathematical way.
Knowledge of document review management applications, data manipulation, data conversion, and data analytics.
Ability to handle multiple tasks under challenging conditions and to work as a team player.
Excellent problem solving ability, verbal and written communication skills, and strong logical reasoning abilities.
title: Legal Specialist, eDiscovery Analytics

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As a Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) Industry Manager, you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions to some of Google's largest partners. Google has become a leader in this space because we've developed effective products and services targeted to marketers and consumers. As an Industry Manager you will drive and grow new business with Google’s top advertisers. You'll manage executive business relationships to ensure that our clients' needs and requirements are met. This is a client-facing sales role requiring deep industry expertise, proven ability and a broad base of industry contacts.
Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with a team to drive business growth with new and existing customers.
Build and foster long-term C-Level relationships with regional and in-country client decision makers, as well as their agency counterparts, to be able to build and carry out long-term digital strategies and optimize their advertising growth.
Be responsible for the development and management of global, regional and/or local Joint Business Plans across various Google products and services and channels, sometimes working in partnership with global/regional team members.
Generate business and vertical plans to define your strategies and tactics.
Support client(s) with the creation of large scale advertising programs (e.g. sponsorship campaigns, cross-market product launch or brand campaigns). Develop scalable and leading edge solutions for client(s) in order to optimize their business growth and maximize use of Google products (Search, Video, Display, Mobile, etc). Help enable our clients and agency to execute digital to true capacity through the right level of training, tools and metrics.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience in an advertising sales, business development and/or online media environment.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in media planning, negotiation and measurement.
Experience collaborating and consulting with major customers (often across markets and geographies) with the goal of extending relationships, increasing the client and agency base and optimizing advertising growth.
Proven success in sales and/or marketing. Strong background in client relationship building, client servicing, and solution-based selling (internal or external).
Knowledge of traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
Established relationships within the advertising industry and the CPG industry vertical.
A deep understanding of the industry's issues, a vision for its growth, and a commitment to advance Google's forward-looking strategies within the marketplace.
title: Industry Manager, CPG

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.
College Recruiters play an essential role in fueling Google’s growth with extraordinary talent. In this position, you will implement staffing strategies to provide a qualified and diverse entry-level or intern candidate pool. You will ensure hiring manager and team preparedness during the interview process and that interviews are conducted efficiently and professionally. This position demands an uncommon balance of creativity and drive, along with interpersonal savvy and basic analytical skills. You must have a proven ability to consistently and positively contribute in a high-paced, changing work environment as well as the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks and manage work time efficiently.
Responsibilities
Work effectively with a large volume of candidates. Manage the candidate process and act as a candidate advocate.
Manage the offer process.. Evaluate skill level and expertise.
Partner with the University Programs team to help position Google as the top destination for students and entry-level candidates. Keep candidates continually informed with quality communications throughout the hiring process.
Keep partners apprised of and involved in work by communicating information and status to project leads and team members, coordinating work cross-functionally and influencing peers, project leaders and/or managers
Solve problems and produce solutions by collecting and analyzing data, identifying alternatives when circumstances change and seeking out additional responsibilities

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of work experience in recruiting or university programs

Preferred qualifications
Experience negotiating compensation packages.
Proven organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and succeed in an environment with competing demands.
Proven ability to take initiative, use consultative skills and build strong, productive relationships.
A track record of demonstrating a strong work ethic, integrity and personal accountability
Passion for improving the customer experience with customers broadly defined as candidates, new hires, hiring managers, and recruiters. Demonstrated ability to develop recommendations and implement solutions to promote ongoing improvements to Google's recruitment efforts based on client needs.
Strong passion for campus recruiting and working with candidates who are starting their careers. Strong communication, interpersonal, and client services skills; ability to clearly communicate in discussions and written documents.
title: College Recruiter

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.
Responsibilities
Develop and deploy applications that support and change fundamental assumptions of how IT works.
Partner with internal teams to define and implement solutions that improve internal business processes. Work closely with analysts to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Build internal solutions, with custom front-ends (web, mobile) and back-end services that automate business processes.
Maintain the highest levels of development practices including: technical design, solution development, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution; Write clean, modular and self-sustaining code.
Integrate third party products into internal systems as well as support and upgrade implemented systems.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in designing and implementing enterprise applications and solutions.
Experience implementing, configuring, customizing and integrating third-party software solutions. Experience developing business applications including front-end, data storage and application integration.
Development experience in Java/JavaScript.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Computer Science or related field.
Demonstrable experience working with third-party system APIs and web services.
Experience in systems integration using message-based middleware (e.g. JMS).
Strong skills using SQL and relational database management systems (Oracle, MySQL, Sybase, SQL Server).
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and comfort with high service level expectations.
title: Application Developer, Legal

text:
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, Street View to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge the technical and business worlds as you design services that our customers love. You'll work with Googlers from Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Finance, to name just a few. You have a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you will be part of shaping Google's next moonshot.Responsibilities
Launch products.
Identify market opportunities and define product vision and strategy.
Understand customer needs and gather product requirements.
Develop new products and enhance existing products.
Engage closely with the engineering team to help determine the best technical implementation methods as well as a reasonable execution schedule.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Product management or product design experience with an online technology, advertising or mobile company.
Preferred qualifications
MS, MBA or PhD in a technology- or business-related field.
Hands-on software development experience.
Understanding of Cloud or infrastructure technologies.
Deep understanding of the Internet and developer platforms and the cloud ecosystem (particularly around IaaS).
Entrepreneurial drive with appreciation of user-experience, business and commercial issues.
Excellent written and oral communication and presentation skills.
title: Product Manager, Google Cloud Platform

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
Driving the efforts for the high tech partnerships within Google’s Channel Sales Partners in the United States, you will have a unique opportunity to be a key, high-visibility player in Google’s Channel Sales partnerships strategy. Your main role will be to develop and execute on newly launched partnerships between companies, both software and hardware and Google’s Channel Sales partners ecosystem. You will be a key individual to triangulate between the high tech companies, Google’s Large Client Sales teams and Google Channel Sales partners that fulfill services for the (VAR) Value Added Re-seller channel.

You will be required to influence, educate and build trust with the field teams and encourage them to guide their own VAR community toward working with a Google Channel Sales partner. You will assist in ensuring that we are growing our Channel Sales partner’s advertising business growth through Google’s product suite. In addition you will be a key thought leader in the overall Google High Tech and Co-Op funding strategy.

You are required to have a proven track record in building digital marketing businesses from the ground up, inclusive of business operations and associated financials in restructuring businesses for success across product, finance, operations and sales excellence. 

You will have a sharp, analytical mind that can solve complex problems. You will be required to develop close relationships with key industry leaders and executives in the digital and mobile space, and serve as part of a motivated team that is working with the world's largest publishers and agencies to push the boundaries of the online ad serving and monetization industry.

You need to possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to resolve contractual, technical and financial issues with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.Responsibilities
Work directly with the Field Marketing teams and leaders of high tech partners to ensure they are trained and able to communicate Google Partner’s value proposition to their Re-seller community.
Develop and own the partner strategy, strategic account plans, and key executive relationships - including growth opportunities, action planning, and business growth forecasting.
Maintain a thorough understanding of the Partner Business Solutions suite and its competitive advantages, actively monitor the competitive landscape and provide feedback to Google’s Product development team.
Be the first point of contact for partners around all key areas (operations, financial, training, product enhancement, monetization etc.)
Lead cross-functional and international efforts to identify business opportunities and solve partner issues.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with high tech companies.
Experience in growing digital marketing businesses from the ground up in structuring all aspects of the business, including financials, operations, product, sales, customer acquisition and profitability to drive Google advertising spend.
Extensive strategy development/partnership management or business development experience.
Strong analytical and reasoning skills with respect to technical, contractual and financial negotiations.
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills - with experience interacting and building relationship with senior-level executives.
title: Strategic Partner Manager, High Tech

text:
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Quantitative Analysts work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing and interpreting huge data sets. Using analytical rigor and statistical methods, you mine through data to identify opportunities for Google and our clients to operate more efficiently, from enhancing advertising efficacy to network infrastructure optimization to studying user behavior. As an analyst, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Associates and Marketing teams to adjust Google's practices according to your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.
As a Quantitative Compensation Specialist, you will develop technical tools and applications to help scale compensation practices at Google. In addition you will get programmatic experience with Google’s global pay programs. You are a quantitatively-minded individuals with an interest in the intersection between finance, computer science, data modeling, and business strategy. You must have the ability to handle multiple tasks, create innovative tools, posses the ability to handle sensitive information and make sound decisions with a strong desire to manage details and deliver results.

Opening Date: Wednesday 6th May 2015

Closing Date: Wednesday 3rd June 2015

Competitive rates of pay apply.
Responsibilities
Design and build web applications, processes, tools, and models to inform compensation program decisions and forecast, report, and/or analyze compensation business outcomes.
Produce ad hoc analyses with rapid turnarounds based on business requests.
Research, develop, and administer compensation programs and monitor program success.
Partner with other Compensation Associates and HR Business Partners to solve compensation-related business problems and provide compensation guidance.
Manipulate (often) large data sets in complex ways to tease meaning from the numbers.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Mathematics, Business Administration, Computer Science, Finance, Statistics or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in Ajax, JavaScript or Python, database design and SQL.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master's Degree in related field.
Deep interest in analyzing data and the ability to quickly conceptualize and implement client or model requirements.
Advanced spreadsheet skills and familiarity with statistical packages and/or SQL.
Excellent communications skills and solutions and client service-oriented, with an emphasis on creativity and diligence.
title: Quantitative Compensation Specialist
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
On Google for Work's Cloud Platform team, we help customers around the globe build applications on the same world-class technical infrastructure that powers everything from AdWords to YouTube. It’s our mission to change the way the world uses cloud computing through our best-in-class infrastructure. Whether working with aspiring startups or Fortune 500 companies, our technical sales experts make it their mission to free our customers from the hassle of dealing with infrastructure so they can focus on what they really care about: building and delivering their products.
This is a front-line customer-facing role responsible for the “first touch” a potential prospect will receive from the Google cloud platform team. You will liaise and collaborate cross-functionally with sales teams, partner management and marketing for optimum account coverage and penetration in the targeted regional territory with the ultimate goal of driving qualified pipeline for the sales team.Responsibilities
Work jointly with sales counterparts in profiling and ranking accounts for technology/market fit.
Establish coverage and engage senior line of business level and IT executives in key target accounts.
Implement key outreach techniques to generate introductory meetings with key decision makers on behalf of field account team, and develop strong market/vertical account knowledge to effectively engage key decision maker.
Develop and execute creative sales campaigns to existing client and prospect base and develop targeted sales campaign approach with solution focused messaging.
Minimum qualifications

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in sales and market/business development at a high-tech company.
Ability to speak and write English and Spanish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
“Inbound/outbound” demand management, SaaS, CRM and Salesforce experience.
Strong project management skills and experience in managing complex, global and cross-functional projects.
Ability to work effectively across the wider team of senior Sales, Sales Finance, Sales Operations, Partnership, etc.
Good understanding of the technology market, and a strong interest in Cloud Computing.
Highly analytical, with a strong lean for data and metrics to drive business decisions.
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
title: Cloud Platform Market Development Representative

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The Mobile App Sales team has big ambitions and global reach. You will engage deeply with sophisticated mobile-first businesses, exceed targets, and drive change to accelerate Google’s position in the fast-growing and strategic business of app install.
As an Americas App Developer Acquisitions Specialist, you will be part of a team dedicated to helping mobile application developers that are new to Google grow their business using Google products and services. You will advise clients on marketing strategies which will help them achieve their user acquisition goals, and serve as an expert and advocate for mobile app developers within Google. In this position, you will proactively reach out to clients with solutions and insights to drive app discovery and engagement.
Responsibilities
Prospect new clients and react to inbound customer requests.
Secure new clients by presenting customized mobile marketing solutions.
Work closely with the Account Management team to ensure clients achieve their advertising goals.
Manage pipeline effectively and develop a strategy for long-term sustained success.
Thrive in forming cross-functional relationships with New Business Sales, Online Partnerships Group, Developer Relations and other stakeholders to realize advertiser goals.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in an advertising sales or business development role.
Preferred qualifications
Proven track record of exceeding sales goals.
Strong understanding of the app developer ecosystem
Demonstrated self-starter who thrives in a team environment.
Extremely proactive, organized, responsible and proven ability to work well with a team.
Strong communication skills and the ability to pitch comprehensive advertising solutions over the telephone to high-end prospects.
title: Americas App Developer Acquisitions Specialist, Mobile App Sales

text:
Technical writers communicate complex information clearly, concisely and accurately, and without relying on jargon. As a technical writer, your role involves tasks such as writing conceptual overviews and procedures, reading and writing example code, or updating help center queries and FAQs. Technical writers play a big part at Google. They are a key link between engineers, marketing associates, developer advocates, as well as all the external users and developers, tying together many vital but disparate parts of the Google ecosystem.
With a unique cross-functional perspective, you will be responsible for interviewing members of the Engineering team and developing subsystem design documentation for hardware and software components that comprise the Google self-driving car.
Responsibilities
Gather information from technical personnel and create subsystem design documents.
Create and maintain process flow diagrams and boundary diagrams.
Ensure consistency in documentation across multiple documents (i.e. all documents have the same structure and look and feel and use consistent nomenclature).
Support technical meetings by updating documentation in real-time during the meetings.
Maintain status chart of completion rate of documents.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Technical writing experience developing component and/or process documentation.
Experience working with Google docs and spreadsheets and process flow drawing tool (e.g. Visio, Lucidcharts).
Preferred qualifications
Experience documenting embedded systems.
Experience reading and understanding source code written in C++.
Familiarity with functional safety processes.
Familiarity with basic mechanical and electrical systems.
title: Technical Writer (Automotive), Special Projects

text:
Google's Treasury team is on a mission to optimize the return on Google's financial assets. As a member of this team, you're always looking for innovative ways to help Google invest for the future while limiting volatility and material surprises. In addition to risk busting and asset management, you work collaboratively to administer business insurance programs and stock programs, and provide financial analysis support to our internal teams. You make creative yet calculated decisions that are backed by both experience and your extensive knowledge of the economy and financial industry.
Google's Tax and Treasury teams consist of strong, creative performers with deep expertise in their respective fields. We contribute to our company's growing global success by dealing with challenging issues and concepts and then applying them to rapidly evolving business models. In Treasury, we provide funding, risk management and mitigation support as well as investment oversight. The Tax group is responsible for global tax planning and compliance, defending the company in tax audits, and ensuring that the company accurately reports its tax matters in public filings.

In this role, you will work within the Treasury team to develop creative financing solutions for Google’s products and services. The scope of work ranges from project management, partnership development (internal product teams and external bank partners) and streamlining operations for existing programs.Responsibilities
Partner with various Product and Sales teams to evaluate, structure, and execute financing plans and growth initiatives
Collaborate with Product and Business Development teams to manage the operational components of various financing partnerships, while identifying and driving business growth opportunities
Develop and maintain partnerships with financial partners, while facilitating contract negotiation and program implementation
Manage the planning, reporting, and analyses for project teams and executive leadership
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree, with evidence of quantitative coursework such as finance, economics, mathematics or accounting or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in an FP&A, Accounting, or Consulting position.

Preferred qualifications
Extensive knowledge of spreadsheet software, presentation software and SQL.
Self-starter with enthusiasm and ability to successfully build an innovative financial services business in a fast-paced, unstructured, and collaborative environment.
Superior analytical skills, impeccable business judgment and the ability to communicate and influence management team.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
title: Treasury Analyst, Google Financing

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.
With your technical expertise, you build business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution.
As a Business Systems Analyst, you will help drive projects to improve finance processes that the company manages through the business applications it builds and uses. 

You are an experienced generalist, IT or business analyst. You have the ability and interest to work on a range of different types of projects and business processes, and have a background that demonstrates this ability.
Responsibilities
Partner with internal business teams in developing delivery roadmaps, and defining business processes and associated system requirements.
Organize and manage project work to drive predictable delivery.
Participate in system implementation projects (requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution).
Support and upgrade implemented systems.
Architect innovative solutions to automate and scale business systems.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience in implementing and customizing vendor software and/or building custom financial applications.
Experience with Oracle E-Business Suite Application and/or Vertex.
Experience in one or more finance functional areas (e.g., order management, receivables, advanced collections, tax).
Preferred qualifications
Experience integrating financial systems and processes as part of company mergers and acquisitions.
Participation in several full system implementation life-cycles (analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; strong analytical skills and a demonstrable bias toward action.
title: Business Systems Analyst, Financial Systems

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
The Brand Studio is a passionate team of creative thinkers tasked with shaping the future of Google brands by deepening the love of our users. Our integrated team of creatives, technologists, strategists, and delivery practitioners are tasked with ensuring creative excellence across the Google Marketing landscape, delivering one integrated Google brand experience, and defining the Google Marketing way.
By embracing user insights, strategic thinking, beautiful design with provocative execution, we strive to create delightfully intuitive and delightfully inventive experiences that will define the future of our brand.
In order to bring this vision to life, Google leadership has formed a new organization called "The Google Brand Studio" where the foundational voice of Google can create meaningful experiences through interactive storytelling, emotional film-making, great brand identities and product experiences. We strive to blur the lines between product, code, ​strategy and art.​Responsibilities
Design and conceptualize digital assets and branding collateral for events, software and services, packaging, retail, iconography, environmental and other projects and design elements.
Work and maintain relationships with external experience, design, production, and ad agencies.
Lead art direction for product photography.
Execute several project deadlines in a fast-paced and agile environment.
Deliver and concept strategic and iconic user experiences through beautiful, well crafted, aesthetic design.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience at a creative agency or an in-house team.
Preferred qualifications
Experience collaborating with a team on large scale design projects as well as experience working in an agile, fast-paced environment.
Experience in or curiosity for mild coding and front-end web development.
Possess an integrated portfolio of identity design, graphic design, packaging, websites, apps and artifacts.
Demonstrate a creative thought process for design, consumer insights, branding, and the user experience.
title: Designer, Brand Interactive, Brand Design

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. With an Internet connection that is 100 times faster than today’s basic broadband speeds you will help to write the next chapter of the internet. You will develop and execute strategies that create a lasting, positive impact on communities throughout the US.
Responsibilities
Develop and execute brand marketing campaigns that drive awareness, engagement and product adoption for Fiber. This involves working across the spectrum of marketing communications - from branding and positioning to creative development and media planning.
Tell great stories that inspire a future of super fast Internet.
Ensure all aspects of Fiber marketing communications are on brand, consistent, focused on the user, and employ best practices.
Develop and lead a stable of creative and media partners in pushing the boundaries on brand and digital marketing.
Refine and enforce the Fiber brand (including voice, look and feel, and personality).

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience at a creative interactive agency or in-house interactive team.

Extensive experience leading interactive marketing efforts.
Expert in managing a breadth of marketing agency partners and developing best in class creative work.
A seamless operator in a fast-paced, quickly changing environment.

Demonstrated digital marketing skills, pushing the limits of technology to tell stories and bring product experiences to life in new and remarkable ways.

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
There's always more information out there, and often, the information that matters most is what's nearest to you. The Geo team is made up of our geography, search and discovery experts. When we're not mapping the Amazon rainforest, we're recommending the best slice of pizza in your city, providing directions on how to get there, and letting you share your experience with your friends and neighbors. From Google Maps to Google Now, the Geo team helps our users navigate the world around them. 

Educating, engaging and retaining Local Guides is the heart of what we do. As Community Manager, you’ll work as part of a team to ensure we’re building scalable community programs, across both your home city and remote markets, to get users excited about taking local actions on Google Maps and other Geo products. The role requires up to 30% travel to remote markets in the same region.Responsibilities
Lead and inspire regional teams to devise strategic plans to educate, engage and retain City Experts through scalable programs, with the goals of building a community who generate high-quality content on Google and Google Maps
Work with regional and program leads to set and track impactful goals across every team
Work with Marketing and regional leads to devise, implement and report on impactful, locally relevant campaigns
Work with regional leads on internal team promotion, from ensuring internal site is maintained by team to sharing impactful, concise case studies with stakeholders and producing a monthly internal newsletter
Manage budget allocation and accruals for global team
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience leading cross-functional, international teams and projects.
Experience in planning, managing and executing events.
Preferred qualifications
Relevant, professional social media and/or online Community Management experience (advanced working knowledge).
Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams located around the globe in different timezones.
Large-scale budget assessment and management experience.
Ability to maintain confidence and professionalism when leading others through ambiguous and complex situations; influence and negotiate diplomatically and fairly with a range of stakeholders.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment.
Excellent communication, teamwork, and client service skills; ability to clearly communicate in discussions and written documents, and to deliver regular updates and feedback clearly and tactfully.
title: EMEA Regional Community Lead, Local Guides
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
Google Play is growing at a rapid pace, serving millions of Android users, both new and existing, with apps and games that are innovative, useful and entertaining. You will be part of the Google Play Partnership Development team, focused on helping developers build successful businesses using the Android platform and Google Play.

As a Business Development Manager for Google Play Apps and Games, you will use your strong business acumen and extensive industry knowledge to acquire, drive and build a pipeline of amazing Android apps and games. You will also help partners manage business growth creation on Google Play.Responsibilities
Become the primary point of contact for key Apps and Games partners
Work with the cross-functional team (Product, Engineering, Marketing) to grow the ecosystem of Google Play
Track and understand key partner metrics to understand the health of developer businesses
Communicate best practices to partners to support the strategic priorities of Google Play
Define partnership strategies and execute go-to-market plans. Communicate effectively with Mandarin and/or Cantonese and English speaking clients
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant work experience in the areas of mobile apps and games, mobile business, distribution channels, and competitive landscape.
Experience sourcing, managing and negotiating with partners.
Preferred qualifications
Proven experience working with partners, e.g. in the gaming and/ or mobile industries.
In-depth experience operating within and leading cross-functional teams (product management, implementation, legal, finance, marketing, etc.).
Proven track record in creating and executing against a pipeline.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about complex issues and develop thoughtful recommendations and action plans.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, fluid, and collaborative environment.
Communication skills in English and Mandarin or Cantonese.
title: Business Development Manager, Google Play Apps and Games

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The Community and Social team, which is part of the Customer Operations, Research and Engagement (CORE) team in Global Customer Experience, focuses on making customer support scalable, unlocking the opportunity to deliver increased engagement and features for a vast number of customers online.
As an AdWords Community Manager within the Community and Social team, you will advocate for Google AdWords and other advertiser-related products (Shopping, AdWords Express, Google My Business, etc.) by presenting a friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, human presence and by supporting our users online.
You will be responsible for managing and growing our Italian AdWords Community by identifying, cultivating and managing relationships with product and community influencers through forums, conferences or wherever they are! As a proactive and motivated Community Lead for the Italian market, you will manage local AdWords Community and Social channels, achieve Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for market; manage key stakeholders; and program and distribute Googlers’ and user-generated content on the Community.Responsibilities
Manage the local AdWords online community to keep it active and vibrant on a day-to-day basis.
Be fully accountable for the local operational targets (Demand, Supply, SLAs): traffic, new cases, time to first response, resolution, content creation and innovation, Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) and AdWords feature adoptions.
Be responsible for internal stakeholder management by managing the presence of Googlers in the Community and advocating within Google.
Collaborate with the Operations language team, local marketing, and Editorial to provide best-in-class content tailored for local audience to drive feature adoptions.
Develop relationships with top contributors/key influencers; grow number of contributors.
Minimum qualifications
Ability to speak and write in English and Italian fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in managing online communities or user discussion groups.
Solid understanding of current social media landscape.
Technical skills e.g. HTML, Java, CSS.
Strong communicator who is able to represent Google online in a positive way and build authentic relationships with users.
title: AdWords Community Manager (Italian)

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Account Manager primarily focused on a single global client, you'll manage relationships with clients, which means you need to be a focused, proactive self-starter and be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Additionally, you're an advisor and consultant, as well as a client advocate within Google. You will be part of the Large Customer Sales (LCS) team.Responsibilities
Take responsibility for the management of clients.
Report on figures internally and take ownership with the leader of your vertical.
Serve as a liaison with clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities.
Provide campaign updates and ensure that our advertisers are satisfied with their business growth.
Manage ongoing customer training in all AdWords-related tools.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience within account management, sales or marketing.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience in managing and optimizing paid search campaigns for large, complex clients, with experience in Adwords and Google Display Network.
Demonstrable media experience in business development, client relationships with the ability to deliver results under pressure.
Experience in communicating new product features/betas actively with clients and assisting in the implementation process.
Knowledge of online ads, especially for search and display ads and campaign performance management.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment.
title: Account Manager, Lifestyle/Home and Personal Care Vertical

text:
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making, and our People Operations (HR) organization is no exception. As a People Analyst you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who wonders "what if?" and then seeks out the solution. You weave stories with meaningful insight from data.
As a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next. To be effective in this role, you’ll need a strong technical and quantitative analysis background, an exceptional ability to distill and communicate complex data, and an interest in (and aptitude for) thinking through the multiple perspectives when looking at a piece of analysis. Using your technical skills, business acumen and creativity, you will build tools to automate reporting and generate insight that will allow clients to quickly and accurately see how our key business products and processes are performing.Responsibilities
Become an expert in the data available in disparate sources, and use this data to execute sophisticated quantitative analyses to produce actionable insights.
Build dashboards using common Google data visualization technologies to give stakeholders ongoing visibility into key metrics.
Present analyses in key cross-functional forums to enable decision-making, and collect requirements from these stakeholders for follow-up analyses.
Structure and perform analysis independently, and conduct research to uncover the insights that support our recommendations.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree with an emphasis on work of a quantitative nature (Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics), or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of work experience handling data sets, summarizing data into metrics, and conducting analyses.
Data analysis, with experience in database querying (SQL).
Spreadsheet software experience (e.g., Google sheets or other spreadsheet software).

Preferred qualifications
BA/BS degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related technical field.
Extensive experience with data visualization tools.
Familiarity in one or more of the following areas: Coding (e.g., C/C++, Python, Java), Databases and querying (e.g., SQL, MySQL, MapReduce, Hadoop), Front end development (e.g., HTML, JavaScript, CSS), Statistical analysis (e.g., R, Stata, SPSS, SAS).
Data-driven and highly analytical, and able to translate data and trends into powerful strategies and compelling messaging.
Ability to self-start and self-direct work in an unstructured environment, and comfortable dealing with ambiguity.
Excellent communication skills and solutions and client service-oriented, with an emphasis on creativity and diligence.
title: People Analyst, Tech HR

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about protecting users from fraud, spam and abuse. You will work with numerous teams across Google, including Engineering, Product, Operations, Legal, and Sales, to navigate challenging online safety situations at Google speed (fast!). You will also apply your strong technical and program management skills to help develop scalable solutions to protect Google's users.Responsibilities
Develop and manage the Anti-Abuse Engineering vision and roadmap for one or more product areas, in collaboration with senior leadership in Product and Engineering.
Work with abuse-fighting teams to define, communicate and prioritize their requirements for engineering.
Work closely with engineers, product managers, and internal users to get high-quality products and features through the software project lifecycle.
Measure the impact of abuse-fighting systems and processes, collect feedback, identify and prioritize improvement opportunities.
Create business cases to enable effective resource allocation decisions. Educate and train teams across Google about protecting users from fraud, spam and abuse.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in in Computer Science, Statistics, or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Project management experience.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
2 years of full time industry experience.
Experience working in collaboration with software engineers on a daily basis, with knowledge of database design and other data storage solutions.
Experience managing cross-functional teams, and cross-team technical projects through evaluation and analysis of data and business needs. Experience interacting with senior-level executives.
Familiarity with one or more of the following languages: C, C++, Java, JavaScript or Python, with excellent knowledge of web technologies (HTTP, HTML). Familiarity with agile methodologies.
Excellent business acumen, written, and oral communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Technical Program Manager, Product Quality Operations

text:
The Hardware Operations team is responsible for monitoring, maintaining and deploying the state-of-the-art physical infrastructure behind Google's powerful search technology. As an Operations Engineer, you'll deploy and maintain Google's advanced Data Center Server and Network Infrastructure. You'll also participate in or lead local project teams on larger installations and develop project contingency plans.In this role, duties range from the physical deployment of data center-related technology to working closely with the various stakeholders. It will fall to you to ensure that our goals, missions and projects are successfully delivered, and, more importantly, that they are repeatable across our global array of data centers. This position offers a great introduction to the wider engineering world at Google. Depending of your area of interest, capabilities, and geographical mobility, you will have the opportunity to develop either within Hardware Operations or move towards software development, engineering, networking operations or our project management groups.
Responsibilities
Contribute and lead efforts/projects in the deployment, maintenance, and support of current and new data center infrastructure.
Lead complex troubleshooting and resolve critical or escalated technical issues over a significant population of affected equipment.
Help test and troubleshoot new complex server hardware components and designs.
Configure and troubleshoot Linux OS related issues on our servers. Participate actively in on-call rotations to support our data center infrastructure, which may include occasional after hours, weekends and national holiday shift work.
Lead and take part in the development and of processes and documentation for new areas of work or knowledge. Mentor, train and guide new team members.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to lift/move (25kg~) equipment as required. Ability to work non-standard work hours as needed including working weekends, holidays and shift-based schedules.
Preferred qualifications
Experience as a team, project or technical lead,
Experience working extensively on data center server and networking hardware, with a solid understanding of the infrastructure at a high level.
Advanced experience/understanding of hardware architecture, maintenance and repair.
Advanced level Linux skills, including installation, systems administration and troubleshooting. Advanced Networking knowledge, including topology and protocol understanding.
Strong people and communication skills.
Ability to speak and write English fluently in a professional working environment.
title: Data Center Hardware Operations Engineer

text:
The Brand Studio is a passionate team of creative thinkers tasked with shaping the future of Google brands by deepening the love of our users. As part of this team, you work with many kinds of creative thinkers all tasked with ensuring creative excellence across the Google Marketing landscape. Your goal is to deliver one integrated Google brand experience, and to better define the Google Marketing way. By embracing user insights, strategic thinking, and beautiful design paired with provocative execution, you strive to create delightfully intuitive (and delightfully inventive!) experiences that will define the future of our brand.
As a Performance Media Marketing Manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Nexus, Chromebook, Search, YouTube, Chrome) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's biddable media. From determining appropriate media plans, bid strategies, advanced analytics and insight generation, you help shape the marketing of the product and growing its loyal customer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, Corporate Communications, Legal, Webmasters, Product Development, Engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.
You're a strategic and deeply analytical marketer who will join the Global Media Team. You will be responsible for shaping and driving biddable programs to drive direct response and brand awareness/consideration for Google. You’ll be expected to bring a strategic vision while still be able to execute and tackle the tactical challenges to get things done. You are someone who isn’t afraid to get their hands dirty to get the job done. You will work closely with Product Marketing Managers to create advanced biddable media plans to drive great content discoverability and conversion, ultimately resulting in a delightful user experience. Additionally you will work closely with Google’s central media team to help drive innovation in every media program we execute.Responsibilities
Serve as the primary lead on key biddable media programs and manage all tactical aspects of running campaigns.
Drive data-driven analysis and insights to improve campaign effectiveness and value to the business (This includes advanced analytics to measure online-to-offline contribution, mobile-to-offline contribution, cross-channel impact and end-to-end development etc.).
Lead world-class customer experience testing and optimizations throughout the customer journey (ad creative, ad placement, landing page experience, conversion forms, post-conversion relationship, A/B and multivariate testing, etc.).
Work closely with Product Marketing Managers' (PMMs) to help drive success in meeting their goals.
Partner with the cross-channel leads for integrated campaign program development.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
4 years of biddable and direct response media experience managing complex, large-scale campaigns. Combined client-side and agency experience, with experience working on large brands.
Biddable platforms experience to acquire target audience at scale with efficiency. Experience using mobile tracking and attribution methodologies (e.g. AdWords, DoubleClick, Google Analytics and other 3rd party digital and mobile ad serving and tracking platforms.)
General web analytic methodologies experience to measure post-click user actions. Experience driving hires/working in a staffing environment.
Experience in forecasting and managing to forecast. Demonstrable technical skills with a strong point of view on how to best leverage the following against your campaign goals and a genuine passion for the media industry.
Strong business acumen and proven track record of creating senior management-level presentations. Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills and the ability to use data to drive actionable insights.
Proven track record of using biddable media to acquire, engage, and nurture users throughout the funnel. Superb program management skills with extreme attention to detail.
title: Performance Media Marketing Manager

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. As Industry Analyst, you have the ability to leverage internal and 3rd party data-sets to build creative and compelling business cases to accelerate digital adoption across Singapore working with agencies and client teams. This is a position that requires a sharp, analytical mind, and an entrepreneurial spirit. Armed with deep knowledge of Google products, marketing trends, individual client needs, and macro agency knowledge, you’ll brainstorm, develop and refine compelling, and customized concepts, marketing plans, narratives and stories. You are data driven in your approach and are skillful in analyzing/interpreting business issues and translating them to solutions.
Among your many attributes, you are analytical but practical, persuasive, self-starting, a natural leader, strong communicator and skilled at solving problems and explaining complex issues. You possess excellent communication/presentation skills at the senior level as well as the ability to work closely and constructively with all areas of the business. You're particularly adept at story telling, and are comfortable working in a dynamic, challenging environment.
Responsibilities
Lead the development of business-relevant conclusions from analysis and the effective communication of them; own specific data-sets and related analysis.
Support industry and thought leadership development including market research and econometrics.
Define and prioritize results-focused analysis and research to support sales objectives and cross-functional coordination.
Utilize and translate existing data and tools into actionable insights and strategies for clients.
Develop best practices and benchmarking initiatives and tools to optimize client relationships. Communicate effectively with English-speaking clients.
Minimum qualifications

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or advanced professional degree.
Experience with spreadsheet software and data analysis tools.
Knowledge of the media industry in Singapore.
Exceptional presentation development skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.
