text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.
As a YouTube Partner Monetization Quality Assurance and Support Associate, you will play an active role in changing the media landscape. You will help uploaders succeed with their video endeavors. In this role, you will train other team members and help them perform. You will also resolve escalations from within the team and from other teams. Based on feedback and from your own insights, you will contribute to improving systems, processes, policies, and resources to educate millions of YouTube partners, and help make them successful.
You are a great communicator and someone who others love to collaborate with. You help co-workers to improve their performance and develop their skills. At the same time, you roll up your sleeves to get things done, for example to improve the team’s day-to-day operations. You have a track record of being proactive, making constructive suggestions, and coming up with incremental improvements as well as step changes. You have strong troubleshooting and analytical skills and demonstrate sound judgment about when to take escalations to the next level.
Last but not least, you want to make big things happen, have fun along the way, and keep a positive attitude even when things get hectic.
Responsibilities
Train new team members effectively, ensure high quality of monetization review decisions, and optimize team workflow.
Educate partners on how to monetize content on YouTube, both at scale and individually.
Serve as the monetization policy expert on the team.
Manage and draw insights from the YouTube Monetization Forum to identify monetization issues, and develop proposals to improve user experience, policies and processes.
Resolve escalations from within the team and other functions.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of experience in identifying and implementing improvements regarding systems, processes, policies, and/or resources.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in the internet industry, scaled support and education.
Experience with and/or an understanding of coypright.
Tech-savviness and thorough understanding of video, YouTube, and the internet.
Technical skills such as SQL and basic coding.
Affinity towards data-driven decisions, paired with exceptional analytical skills.
Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
title: YouTube Partner Monetization Quality Assurance and Support Associate

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
Driving the efforts for the Traditional Media partnerships within Google’s Channel Sales Partners in the United States, you will have a unique opportunity to be a key, high-visibility player in Google’s Channel Sales partnerships strategy. Your main role will be to develop and execute on launched partnerships between traditional media companies, including broadcast, print and radio, and Google’s Channel Sales partners ecosystem.
You will influence, educate and build trust with traditional media companies and help to develop their digital marketing businesses as a Google Channel Sales partner. You have a proven track record in building digital marketing businesses from the ground up, inclusive of business operations and associated financials in restructuring businesses for success across product, finance, operations and sales excellence.
You have a sharp, analytical mind that can solve complex problems. You will develop close relationships with key industry leaders and executives in the digital and mobile space, and serve as part of a team that is working with the world's largest publishers and agencies to push the boundaries of the online ad serving and monetization industry. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to resolve contractual, technical and financial issues with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.Responsibilities

You collaborate with key stakeholders to determine future direction of work.
You are an experienced Tech Lead who is excited about bringing wearable computers to the workplace. BA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.

Master's degree in Computer Science.
Experience in video processing and/or video streaming
Familiarity with the Eclipse IDE, GitHub, and Android SDK
Familiarity with Linux kernel, device driver APIs, chipset, and Android.

text:

text:
Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Mechanical Engineer you design and evaluate our data center systems, identifying product requirements and contributing to research and project planning. From the chip to chiller, you are responsible for designing and optimizing an architecture that will scale with Google's continued growth.With your technical expertise, you lead and manage projects, develop product and process improvements, provide consultation to others and help facilitate training and development.
You will create manufacturing drawings and assembly and process instructions from CAD models, prototype assemblies, etc.
You will manage of the complete Bill of Materials (BOM) in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM). You'll author new parts and sub-BOMs and drive engineering change orders (ECO's). You will work directly with vendors and contract manufacturers to see parts through manufacturing and oversee technical problems on the assembly line. You will make minor updates to CAD models and own simple designs supporting the production line.
Responsibilities
Create manufacturing documentation (drawings and detailed work instructions).
Manage nonconforming material through the MRB process to ensure it is identified, appropriately dispositioned, tracked and reported.
Assist in the identification and resolution of manufacturing issues, both internally and at suppliers. Manage and facilitate the root cause investigations and corrective actions.
Investigate the ability of suppliers and production processes to meet defined specifications and quality standards.
Provide mechanical measurement support to identify or solve potential material issues. Assist development with statistical tolerancing.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Mechanical Engineering, Product Design or equivalent practical experience.
CAD modeling and drafting experience.
Experience with manufacturing methods for mechanical parts.
Preferred qualifications
Mechanical engineering/design work experience.
Work experience overseeing an assembly line.
Supply chain management.
Excellent technical writing and communication skills.
title: Mechanical Engineer, Production, Skybox

text:

10 years of experience in logistics/supply chain industry with experience in international freight management.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.

text:
Security is at the core of Google's design and development process: it is built into the DNA of our products. The same is true of our offices. You're an expert who shares our seriousness about security and our commitment to confidentiality. You'll manage the security staff who keep our Googlers safe and our world-class technologies and facilities secure. You'll collaborate with our Facilities Management team to create innovative security strategies, investigate breaches and create risk assessment plans for the future. You believe that providing effective security doesn't come at the expense of customer service - you will be our bodyguard (and our long lost pal).
The Events and Protective Services team focuses on providing security strategy for Google events as well as security logistics for Google employees. You will have Executive or Dignitary Protection (DP/EP) experience as well as significant experience organizing the security logistics of a non-security event, partnering cross-functionally with stakeholders and interfacing with high level executives or principals.
The event security requirements include performing site assessments, advances, coordinating contract security personnel in partnership with site security and internal regional security managers, organizing access control, as well as arrangements for the senior or high visibility attendees including employees and guests. Budgeting experience is a must, including being able to scope security resources and stay within a prescribed budget for events and travel.Responsibilities
Manage a team of Event and Protective Services Specialists and perform all functions of their role when necessary, including worldwide travel to support events and executive travel.
Serve as a liaison to executives and stakeholders for all matters regarding high risk/visibility travel or events.
Conduct audits and other research to identify process deficiencies, areas of improvement and efficiency for the team.
Develop strong relationships with domestic and international law enforcement and government counterparts, as well as private sector peers worldwide to help facilitate travel and event security.
Travel internationally and domestically up to 50% of the time.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience managing members of a team with either EP/DP or event security responsibilities.
5 years of experience conducting EP or DP in various locations, including internationally or event security planning.
Preferred qualifications
Experience analyzing intelligence and threat reports to determine the risk level to a location, event or person so that resources can be scoped appropriately.
Bilingual.
title: Strategic Events and Protective Services Manager

text:

Your job is to accelerate product development by helping developers help themselves.Glass team is in need of SETs with a strong passion for building tools, promoting software quality and team productivity, and bringing a great testing culture to the team. If you're interesting in building test automation frameworks, scaling testing infrastructure, creating an overall automation strategy for the team, and partnering with other engineers to build testing infrastructure concurrently with product development, Glass team may be a great fit for you. You will be building tools to help developers to be more productive, write better quality code, and test it themselves.Responsibilities

Work with the development and test engineering teams to automate testing.
Conduct research on emerging technologies.
Analyze and decompose a complicated software system and design a strategy to test this system.

Scripting experience in Python.
Coding experience in Java.

Extensive knowledge of Unix/Linux environments.
Deep knowledge of internet technologies.
Excellent coding skills in C, C++.

text:
This position will be based in Nashville, TN.
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Field Operations Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You have strong interpersonal, analytical and communication skills. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

Lead and manage build teams to excel in the last mile deployment of Google Fiber’s Multi-family Dwelling Unit (MDU), Small and Medium Businesses (SMB), and Community Connection construction across the market/metro area.
Manage program goals, scope, schedules, budget, contracts and vendor resources to ensure timelines and production costs are aligned across multiple markets. Implement and manage QA/QC, risk register and action items. Report production and quality metrics with informative analysis on daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Establish scalable tools and processes across markets that monitor contractor performance including quality control, appropriate forecasting of building resources, billing against budget, and contract. Work with and communicate progress to internal stakeholders and ensure that projects are scoped properly and handed off seamlessly for network deployment.
Work closely with cross-functional teams including Google Fiber Outside Plant/Network Operations/Sales/Business/Customer Service in coordinating all project activities, resource requirements and business goals. Work with product suppliers and the Google Fiber supply chain to ensure material quantities are met and ensure everything meets Google Fiber design specifications.
Prioritize and multitask projects, and see them through to completion as individual and team contributor. Set team goals and foster innovative and creative work environment.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of contract and program management experience in the telecommunications or infrastructure industry.
5 years of experience building teams and managing direct reports.
Preferred qualifications
Bachelor's degree in electrical, mechanical, civil engineering or other field, MS degree or MBA.
PMP or PgMP certification.
Experience in scaling processes for new business/start-up.
Knowledge/experience with project management tools such Primavera P6.
Knowledge of FTTH technology and industry.

text:
Google's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. Retail Sales Manager have the unique opportunity to create a long-lasting relationship with our top partners. You cultivate these existing partnerships to make sure they can take full advantage of Google's ever-growing suite of offerings. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to see win-win opportunities with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.
Our Hardware Sales team lead an important piece of Google’s mission. It is tasked to manage all of the hardware devices through which our consumers experience our services. The team oversees the commercial aspects of all products made by Google (i.e. Chromecast, etc.), all products made with Google (i.e. Chromebooks, Nexus, etc.) and all of the products made using Google (e.g. Android, etc). You'll be responsible for implementing and optimizing relationships with partners in the region/country that distribute hardware built using our Android and Chrome platforms, and enhance the proposition around those products and platform.
You'll be the primary partner contact, driving the implementation and optimization of our collaboration and driving tactics designed to improve the usage and distribution of Google’s hardware, platforms, applications and ecosystem services. As such you will need to have a deep understanding of Android, Chrome OS, and related hardware (e.g. Chromecast, Nexus) in addition to Google’s ecosystem of applications and services such as Play Content, Search, and other Apps. You'll track and analyze key metrics, proactively resolve business and technical issues with our partners and identify new partnership opportunities. Some of the attributes you'll bring to this job include strong attention to detail, outstanding communication and negotiation skills and a collegial personality.
This is a cross-functional role: you will be working closely with Marketing, Operations, Product Management/Engineering, Sales and PR teams in country as well as across the region and globally.Responsibilities
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the regional Internet, distribution and retail markets.
Identify and lead exploratory discussions with potential partners. Manage new strategic Chrome partnerships and maintain strong direct relationships with partners.
Forecast and report sales and other key metrics, track actual progress toward forecasts, drive new business opportunities and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of business issues with partners.

Manage growth of our hardware products, and use of promotional budgets to ensure targets are being met and exceeded.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Related business development, program or partner management experience in an Internet, software platform, or hardware company.
Demonstrable project management experience, with the ability to lead and handle multiple time-sensitive projects.

Sharp analytical skills with ability to clarify and summarize complex issues.
Superb communication skills, with the ability to comfortably interact with partner’s and Google’s executive management.

text:

Build strong partnerships across Google (e.g. business, product, engineering, real estate, finance, legal).

Experience leading people.

MBA or advanced degree.
10 years of relevant work experience in consulting and/or technology.
Extensive experience leading complex cross-functional programs from inception through implementation.
Demonstrated team leadership capability (including recruiting and coaching/mentoring). Demonstrated ability to lead through changing business needs and environments.
Ability to move fluidly between the high-level, strategic view and the more granular aspects of execution, with an ability to communicate and plan at both levels.
Outstanding project management, analytical/problem-solving, stakeholder management and communication skills.

Excellent public speaking skills with experience presenting to large technical audiences.

text:
It’s never been a more exciting time to work in media. The industry is changing at a rapid pace, as technology has given journalists and new media entrepreneurs more tools to research, create, and distribute their content than ever before. The News Lab at Google is our effort to empower innovation at this intersection of technology and media. Our mission: to collaborate with journalists and entrepreneurs to build the future of media with Google. We do this through a global outreach effort to empower technology-driven storytelling in newsrooms, with a focus on data-driven insights from Google Trends and a partnership-focused approach to creating new projects that foster unique innovations in newsrooms and startups.

As our News Lab Lead in Germany, you’ll be the founding member of our News Lab team locally. A savvy media industry expert, you have a critical understanding of Google’s technologies, and are a passionate advocate for how Google can strengthen newsgathering and storytelling. An operations whiz, you run a pipeline-driven partnership outreach effort to [French/German] media partners, connecting with journalists through events, newsroom visits, online trainings, and more. An excellent communicator, you’re comfortable teaching a room full of media experts how to use Google technology. Comfortable with data, you’re able to build unique and lasting editorial partnerships that leverage Google Trends to deliver new insights on what’s happening around the world. A creative entrepreneur, you’re at your best with media partners and innovators, developing insightful partnerships that leverage technology to strengthen a robust and independent press. Last but not least, you are a team player who loves working on a purpose-driven team that operates with high creativity and velocity.
Responsibilities
Build a strong pipeline of regular partnership outreach to media partners in [France/Germany], conducting regular “Google 101s” in newsrooms that teach journalists how to use Google tools. Partner with journalism organizations, associations, and unions to hold joint technology training workshops.
Hold community events that bring together entrepreneurs and journalists from a variety of organizations to collaborate together around new technologies for storytelling.
Build editorial partnerships focused on Google Trends - delivering data-driven insights to media partners in unique ways.
Develop partnerships with innovative organizations in the media and content space, leveraging Google technologies to deliver new ways of sharing information that can be scaled to other partners.
Bring an entrepreneurial spirit to work everyday, conceiving of new opportunities and avenues to help the media industry grow with Google.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak in English and German fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Significant experience working in the media industry or similar content-driven industry.
A deep knowledge of and passion for technology, and a strong track record using technology and online tools in innovative ways.
Ability to manage several concurrent projects with timely deliverables; excellent organizational skills.
Excellent public speaking and interpersonal skills.
title: News Lab Lead, Google

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
Google Life Sciences is recruiting research scientists (at all levels) with experience in genetics and genomics to support the development of novel disease diagnostic technologies and biomarker discovery projects such as the Baseline study. You will also support our internal research programs that seek to fundamentally advance the state of the art in instrumentation, methods, and computational biology in related areas.Responsibilities
Design, develop, and execute experimental research projects of high complexity.
Develop novel experimental and analytical tools for high throughput sequencing-based assays.
Evaluate and recommend new emerging technologies in relevant fields.
Create scientifically rigorous visualizations, communications, and presentations of results.
Contribute to the generation of standard protocols and intellectual property.
Minimum qualifications
PhD degree in genetics, genome sciences, molecular biology, bioengineering, bioinformatics, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Hands-on experience working with nucleic acids and massively parallel sequencing platforms.
Method development experience in one or more of the following specialized areas: whole genome sequencing, functional annotation, epigenetic profiling, SNP/CNV calling, phasing, microbiome analysis, RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, DNase-seq, Hi-C, genome editing, or other innovative approaches to interrogate biological systems using sequencing as a readout.
Preferred qualifications
4 years of post-graduate experience in an industrial, startup, or academic setting.
Experience in a biomedical startup environment.
Experience with methods for single cell isolation and characterization.
Fluency in standard bioinformatics tools, Python, Perl, and R.
Familiarity with the design and use of microfluidic devices for high throughput biology.
Strong analytical and organizational skills. Excellent written and oral communication skills.
title: Genomics Scientist (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:

text:

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. text:

text:
The Operations Order Management Logistics team makes sure physical deliveries happen on schedule so Google's virtual world keeps humming. As a member of the team, you help manage the logistics and transportation of vendor deliveries. From global deployments of servers to the delivery of networking gear, you need to make sure the right equipment arrives at the right location at the right time. What you oversee is often overseas, and you work with international governmental organizations to ensure imported equipment arrives smoothly. You also work with internal customers to measure and define processes, constantly using data to improve our systems.
As a Logistics Compliance Program Manager, you will be working in Google’s Logistics group which makes sure physical deliveries happen on schedule so Google's virtual world keeps humming. As a member of the team, you ensure imports and exports of high tech equipment (servers to networking) happen in a predictable fashion. You’ll also assist other subject-matter experts, business units, and other stakeholders on the development of new policies and processes. You will have experience in applying international trade principles, concepts, and practices within a Logistics team to enable compliant export and import of shipments. You also have an ability to interact and influence at all levels throughout a large, geographically dispersed company and possess strong negotiation skills.
Responsibilities
Manage and maintain Global Classification database that houses HTS and ECCN classifications, as well as workload management of classifiers.
Manage and maintain “Other Government Agency” (OGA) requirements in the global trade knowledge repository.
Supervise day-to-day import/export activities of on-site brokerage support team members to ensure timely clearance instructions are provided to customs brokers and problem shipments are addressed.
Work with customs brokers or freight forwarders globally to ensure trade compliance.
Provide guidance and training to business units and internal customers on fundamentals of import/export compliance.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in trade compliance.

Preferred qualifications
Strong domestic and international experience working in a collaborative, cross-functional environment.
In depth knowledge of HTS and ECCN and independent ability to perform such classifications.
Knowledge of fundamentals of import/export compliance and ability to review and interpret import and export regulations and requirements, in collaboration with the Legal team.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced business with frequent and rapid priority changes; be action and results oriented, flexible, hardworking, a team player, and a motivator.
Strong project management skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, strong analytical skills and decision making abilities.
title: Logistics Compliance Program Manager

text:
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is what you get when you treat operations as if it’s a software problem. Our mission is to progress, protect, and provide for the software and systems behind all of Google’s public services - Search, Ads, Gmail, Android, YouTube, and AppEngine, to name just a few - with an ever-watchful eye on their availability, latency, performance, and capacity. 
This is an unusual job, unlike others in the industry. Like traditional operations groups, we keep important, revenue-critical systems up and running despite hurricanes, bandwidth outages, and configuration problems. Unlike traditional operations groups, we also have full access to and authority to fix, extend, and scale the code to keep it working and harden it against all the vagaries of the Internet. We hire people from both systems and software backgrounds. Strong candidates will have experience with both. 
Just as what we do is unique, where we do it is unique too. At Google, we have the good fortune to have developed many interesting systems ranging from planet-spanning databases to near real-time scalable data warehousing to fault-tolerant datastream joining. In SRE, we flip between the fine-grained detail of disk driver I/O scheduling to the big picture of continental-level service capacity, across a range of systems and a user population measured in billions. We own those products in production. We drive reliability and performance across massive scale by mastering the full depth of the stack. We literally do learn something new every day - usually surprising things - that have the potential to transform the lives of billions of our users around the world.
As a Systems Engineer on the SRE team, you will work on large-scale system design and troubleshooting, and be fluent in systems programming and/or automation. You will have a desire to tackle the complex problems of scale which are unique to Google. Familiarity with running production environments at scale is crucial in this job along with an in-depth understanding of Unix systems internals, and networking.Responsibilities
Design, write and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Google's services.
Solve problems relating to mission critical services and build automation to prevent problem recurrence, with the goal of automating response to all non-exceptional service conditions.
Influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale distributed systems.
Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning.
Conduct periodic on-call duties using a follow-the-sun model.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more of: C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Go, or scripting experience in Shell and Perl.
Experience with network theory, e.g. TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, etc., MAC addresses, IP packets, DNS, OSI layers, and load balancing.
Experience working with Unix/Linux systems from Kernel to Shell with experience working with system libraries, file systems, and client-server protocols.
Preferred qualifications
Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
In-depth knowledge of operating systems (processes, threads, concurrency issues, locks, mutexes, semaphores, monitors and how they work).
Familiarity with algorithms, data structures and complexity analysis.
Systematic problem solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.
title: Systems Engineer, Site Reliability Engineering

text:
Google is known for its speed and clean design, and our websites must also be fast and clean. Our Static Content Developer team creates and maintain Google's web sites. As a Static Content Developer, you collaborate with Marketing and Engineering teams to create compelling, efficient and accessible web pages. You work independently on many projects, but also take directions from team members across the organization. The impact of your work is huge as millions of users traffic our websites every day.
As a Static Content Developer, YouTube.com will be your primary domain, with your web content taking center stage in product launches, events, and marketing campaigns. You will partner with Product, UX, and your team to build front-end web experiences. You will use your experience to drive medium to large-sized tasks and projects while exercising considerable independent judgment and discretion.

You will be responsible for the creation of high quality, world-class web content for desktop and mobile devices. You will engineer front-end components that will present information in new, innovative, and creative ways. Your work will require a focus on compatibility, accessibility, and internationalization.

Your components should be modular, reusable, and well documented to the benefit of the greater team. You will experiment with emerging technologies and discuss their merits with fellow team members.
Responsibilities

Advise, collaborate with, and synthesize feedback from Marketing, Product, and Engineering partners.
Fulfill several project requests simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines.
Push technology, challenge established thinking, and discover new ways of approaching (and solving) a problem.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience developing websites and applications.
Experience with mobile development, including responsive design; experience with content management systems.
Preferred qualifications
6 years of experience developing clean, valid, and compatible websites and applications.
Experience with WebGL and JavaScript libraries (e.g., Closure, AngularJS, GreenSock) and Canvas/CSS animation.
Basic understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript development.
Fluency in one or more of the following: Java, C/C++.
Strong consistency and attention to detail.
Excellent leadership, communication, project management, and organizational skills.
title: Static Content Developer, YouTube

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
As a Technical Program Manager, you will partner with Engineering and Product teams across the globe, working closely with Legal, Privacy and management to evaluate Google’s products, services and infrastructure for privacy. Your experience in privacy, audit and compliance processes will be integral as you review projects through design, development and launch phases. This role requires a special combination of privacy expertise, technical experience, organizational skills, and the ability to influence. Part of this role will also be to help iterate and improve privacy processes and infrastructure. You will handle multiple projects with tight timeframes and deadlines.Responsibilities
Manage the Google privacy review process.
Facilitate privacy discussions between different functions at Google including Product, Engineering, Privacy and Legal teams.
Help identify priorities and develop solutions to protect user privacy.
Lead internal process improvement projects, including the development and implementation of internal tools.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Program management experience.
Preferred qualifications
Bachelor's or Master's or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field.
CIPP Certification.
Experience working on or with Privacy or Security teams. Experience working with Legal teams and external regulators.
Experience working in software product development with intimate familiarity with SDLC.
Proven ability to show solid judgment and make balanced decisions under pressure.
Proven ability to prioritize tasks and adapt strategies to changing or conflicting requirements. Strong written and verbal communication skills.
title: Technical Program Manager, Privacy

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

Development experience.
Background experience as an Information Architect, Solutions Architect including Knowledge Management and domain expertise in Legal systems and technologies.

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
As a highly motivated Program Manager you will have demonstrated experience in the area of complex, multi-disciplinary, and geographically dispersed data center design, development, construction and commissioning projects. You will provide project management of large-scale data centers, computer farms, networking, AC power distribution/conversion, and cooling methods at multiple scales. This role manages complex schedules, budgets, and broad inter- dependencies. You will have extensive experience managing large scale technical projects in a rapidly changing industry, be able to tolerate ambiguity, and demonstrate problem solving leadership with limited oversight.

Central to growing this infrastructure is deploying new technologies that enable Google to deliver our next generation of web services. Our research and engineering teams continually reinvent the design of our data centers and supporting infrastructure; it will be the NPI TPM’s responsibility to ensure these new technologies are inserted as quickly as possible, yet not any sooner than when those technologies are ready. 

Given the durations of construction projects, effective technology insertion will require quantifying the risks and benefits the new designs bring. Given the large number of groups affected by new data center designs, you will be responsible to ensure all interdependent stakeholders are engaged in a clearly defined process. Given the global footprint of our infrastructure,you will also be responsible for ensure fast, seamless localization. Key elements of the NPI function is ensuring the technology is mature at point of insertion including clear decision criteria Risk mitigation and planning for new technologies and building future flexibility into current site and building designs.
Responsibilities
Plan and execute new technology development, roadmaps and insertion timelines
Optimize insertion planning to capture maximum value to Google of new technologies
Lead cross functional teams within Google to ensure technology insertion
Work with R&D, supply chain, construction, and deployment teams
Work with design teams to ensure technology development and maturation for production cross-functional team alignment and prioritization of initiatives with clear understanding of key deliverables, dates and resource plans. Prototype when applicable.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Electrical, Industrial, Mechanical, Civil or Manufacturing Engineering, or Construction Management or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience with program management and development of new data center or critical facilities technology

Preferred qualifications
MS or PhD in Civil, EE, ME, Industrial Engineering, Construction Management or related technical field
10 years of relevant work experience with both manufacturing and construction
Experience managing complex programs spanning technical and disciplines
Strong analytical, technical, problem-solving, negotiation, communication, and organizational skills.
title: Data Center New Product Insertion Technical Program Manager

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google, aimed at enabling next generation Internet connectivity. The Google Fiber team is deploying a Fiber-to-the-Home network capable of delivering gigabit connectivity and enhanced TV products to consumers. The Network Operations Team is responsible for the design, deployment and operation of the network equipment, facilities and systems needed by this leading edge broadband project, with the Video Engineering team specifically focused on the design and evolution of our TV delivery infrastructure.

As a Video Engineer, you will help design the next generation of the Google Fiber TV Video network and service. You will be familiar with equipment common to video headends including receivers, encoders, groomers, NMS and monitoring systems. You will also be familiar with industry standards for in-stream event signaling like SCTE 30 and 35. In the new IP-enabled TV world, your skills in the video headend are complemented by your expert understanding of multicast and unicast IPTV delivery, including MPEG2-TS over UDP and RTP, HLS, and MPEG DASH.Responsibilities
Test and evaluate emerging technologies and platforms for their inclusion in the Google Fiber network, including interaction with vendors on product selection.
Create system-level and detailed designs for the distribution of video services across an all IP network.
Manage cross-functional and third-party resources for the implementation of system designs.
Work with internal and third-party resources to design automation systems for the configuration and management of the video network.
Work with other Google groups and the industry to advocate and improve video and IPTV standards, as well as platforms and technologies, providing a feedback on real deployment experience and needs.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Civil Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in an IPTV service provider.
Operational experience with IPTV headends, including IRD, encoders and CAS.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with IP-backhaul of HD-SDI, 3G SDI and ASI; Experience with conditional access systems and IP DRM.
Knowledge of network routing protocols for IP, Source Specific Multicast and PIM.
Expert knowledge of H.264, MPEG2, ATSC and DVB-S S2,T. Exposure to upcoming compression technologies like JPEG2000 and HEVC/H.265.
Good background in IP networking.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English with the ability to influence others with your stellar network engineering solutions.
title: Video Engineer, Google Fiber Network Operations

Help the globe "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies, and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile, and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Partner Business team member, you drive the Google for Work business relationship with key partners by analyzing partner business performance, identifying methods of increasing partner and Google returns and identifying opportunities within partners. You also coordinate across Google departments/groups to deliver on opportunities. You love customer-facing and jump at the chance to engage with customers, provide them seamless support, and keep them with Google.

We are looking for a business development professional to lead Google for Work’s strategic customer engagement, Sales Strategy and Business Development team. To do this will require deep business partnerships and trusted relationships with senior decision-makers; a clear articulation of Google’s value proposition in general and Google for Work’s in particular to CxOs at a select list of the largest institutions in the world. You have a proven ability to activate and scale programs and superb communications skills to articulate Google’s solutions to external and internal partners alike.

As the Director of Global Business Development, GfW, you will be responsible for business development with some of Google’s largest and most advanced potential customers. In this role, you will ensure Google’s work solutions (including Google Apps for Work, Maps for Work, Android for Work, Chrome for Business, and Google’s Cloud Platform) translate to a sound and relevant technology platform for these top customers. You will create a strategy, build a team, and create these critical relationships with potential customers by bringing Google’s innovation and technology platforms magic to solve their burning business problems. You will provide thought leadership and ensure high levels of productive client engagement across teams. You will partner closely with Google for Work leaders across all markets, and be seen as a collaborative thought partner in building Google’s business with these top customers.

The measures of success will be significant creation of deep relationships, trusted advisor status, new opportunities with these companies, and being recognized internally and externally as an expert in helping these business thrive in the new world of cloud, mobility, and Google scale.

This is not a Direct Sales role, but rather one that opens doors and creates opportunities for hand-offs to our Go-to-Market teams.
Responsibilities
Develop a growth strategy for our largest customers in order to maximize penetration of Google technologies and products to help customers transform.
Work closely with others to significantly up-level Google’s use of research and insights tools with top customers. Use adoption and customer cohort analysis to prove in a data-driven way to customers that it pays to embrace cloud-based platforms.
Build and foster deep relationships systematically with senior clients, CxOs, industry experts, global strategic partners, and Google leaders.
Direct the team responsible for critical global accounts.
Define, review, and agree to a clear set of priorities, joint initiatives, and roadmap with our largest customers. Create joint motions with top partners using their understanding of our customer base and their tight connections to their business problems.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in creating new markets and customer relationships. Experience working with strategic partners (e.g. Global System Integrators, consulting companies etc.)
Experience in project managing growth strategy programs.
Preferred qualifications
Tenured experience leveraging relationships with Global System Integrators, consulting companies, and other influencers in a high technology industry. Established network of contacts within Global 2000 or Fortune 500.
Credible experience as an advisor to senior technology decision makers on strategic plans: expert understanding of how the C-suite builds and views technology as a strategic asset to their business. Expert on how Google technologies can shape these institutions' abilities to compete (both for business and talent), innovate, and deliver shareholder value.
Proven track record of enabling multi-million dollar agreements and strategic long-lasting, trusted partner relationships.

text:

You're a visionary who optimizes for efficiencies and never stops seeking improvements -- even small changes that can make a huge impact. You generate ideas, communicate recommendations to senior-level executives and drive implementation alongside facilities technicians.
As a Data Center Facilities Manager, you will be responsible for leading a large team in 7x24 data center operations. You will be responsible for meeting Service Level Agreements (SLAs) with internal teams on uptime, efficiencies and cost. You will grow the campus team to meet the needs of the business. You will leverage technical talent across the campus and identify key hiring needs for regional data centers.Responsibilities
Plan and execute campus operational budgets, expense forecasting, and manage the established budgets.
Set strategy and plan deployments across multiple data center sites.
Lead efforts to integrate Google-wide strategy and execution with internal and external business partners.
Create strategy for long-term cost effective operations, focused on total cost of ownership.
Demonstrate critical thinking and innovation in approaching traditional data center problems and emergent challenges.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Critical facilities management experience, including facility, technical and team management.
Experience managing a multi-site or multi-region critical facilities portfolio.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in related engineering field.
Solid experience collaborating with other business units to meet company goals and standards.
People management and leadership skills with an ability to influence at all levels.
Willing to travel up to 20% of the time.
title: Data Center Facilities Manager

text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.
As the Head of Global Partner Program Operations Team for YouTube, you will lead and support global and Region-level strategic and operational initiatives and processes, and you will work closely with the YouTube Online & Operations leadership team across all of the functions, as well as with counterparts in the other regions. 

Your team will work across a broad set of issues, such as running core operational processes including partner channel acquisition and account management and recommended opportunities. You'll define and deliver partner support strategy and operating models. You will be leading/supporting regional cross-functional initiatives (e.g. partner development programs impact, scaled creator development strategy and impact, global spaces impact, partner educational initiatives impact.)

The YouTube Head of Global Partner Program Operations Team team provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of processes, goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.Responsibilities
Manage the delivery of the core strategic planning and operational processes - including quarterly account management planning, acquisition strategy, programs and support impact
Work with the global and regional leadership team to define, launch, and drive critical strategic, organizational and operational initiatives
Define, structure and execute major strategic and operational initiatives – developing work plans, gathering and synthesizing relevant data, leading analyses, and developing final recommendations
Lead cross-functional teams to get work done, driving recommendations through to implementation, and ensuring insightful learning from the initiatives
Prepare presentations and clearly communicate findings and recommendations to global and regional leadership team and beyond. Facilitate global best practice sharing and operational consistency
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Management experience in technology, advertising or consulting context.

Preferred qualifications
Sales and/or operations experience. Experience in structuring and implementing scaled initiatives with operations teams.
Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence including the ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives.
Good networker and influencer, with strong interpersonal skills, able to work across various Google functions
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as the ability to communicate with technical teams.
title: Head of Global Partner Program Operations, YouTube

text:
Applications will close on Friday, May 22nd. All hiring will be complete by the end of May 2015. Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.

Note: Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and our recruitment team will determine where you fit best based on your resume.

The apprenticeship is offered in the following areas:

Large Customer Sales: Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build strong businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across Search, Video and Mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Google for Work: We've helped millions of employees and organizations around the world "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Google for Work team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter. Our technical and Sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

People Operations: Google's People Operations roles are focused on redefining "human resources" and preserving Google's unique culture in the way we attract, hire, develop and reward talented people.Responsibilities
Responsibilities and detailed projects will be determined based on your educational background, interest and skills.

Currently enrolled in a Master's degree program and maintaining a student status throughout the apprenticeship. Priority given to candidates graduating in 2016.

Previous internship experience in Sales, Advertising, Consulting, Analysis, Customer Service, Marketing, Finance or related fields.

text:
As a member of the Executive Communications team based in Mountain View, you will be part of a small team which produces employee communications and events for Google executives. You will work with members of your internal client team on communications initiatives, projects and programs. You will support the work of the team to create strategic communications campaigns, come up with innovative ways to engage employees that are in tune with Google's culture, write communications, business update presentations and talking points. You will also collaborate with internal partners as needed across functions (PR, Policy, Legal, HR, Operations, etc.) and geographies.
Things happen quickly at Google, to succeed here you need to be creative and entrepreneurial, a self-starter who gets things done and isn't afraid to take risks and try out new ways of doing things.Responsibilities
Develop, write, and edit communications for senior executives, including emails, Google+ posts, and presentations.
Develop creative strategies for communicating to employees: plan the frequency of and vehicles for communications, and coordinate across different areas of the business and the company.
Coordinate and execute logistics around events, email aliases, and internal reorganizations.
Project manage internal communications strategic plans and initiatives, from beginning to end.
Interact with and influence executives, and provide advice that reflects an understanding of their business and leadership style.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in media, government or non-profit environment, with a focus on writing and/or editorial responsibilities.
Preferred qualifications
Graphic designer with excellent creative and visual skills, including slide design, with experience using Google Slides and other presentation software.
Demonstrated ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high-stress environments.
Effective team player who can lead efforts across disciplines.
Proven communicator - excellent written and verbal communications skills.

text:
The gTech Ads team is a solution-generating force that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. In addition to troubleshooting on the customer side, we work with Sales, Product and Engineering teams within Google to develop better tools and services to improve our products based on the evolving needs of our users. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.
The Global Support team in gTech Ads plays a critical role in Google's success, supporting Sales teams, advertisers and products that enhance business potential by consistently providing scalable product solutions, reliable information based on efficient, consultative analysis, accurate implementations and timely communications. Alongside our support and troubleshooting work, we partner with Sales, Product Management and Engineering to focus on developing innovative, scalable support solutions that effectively serve our growing customer base. 

As a Support Specialist, you will work closely with advertisers and the global Sales teams to drive troubleshooting and implementation support. In this role, you will become an expert, focused on handling troubleshooting and/or implementation tasks so that the Sales teams can concentrate their efforts on client-specific activities. You will be focused on providing the highest quality of support to both our Sales teams and the advertisers that they work with.
Responsibilities
Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service while also troubleshooting and resolving issues from Sales teams and Google's advertisers.
Manage sales and customer inquiries through live chat, requests and other channels.
Work directly with large advertisers as well as internal Sales teams.
Provide emergency expert support during non-office hours when required.
Contribute to the development of internal products, carrying out one-off projects as required for large advertisers.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write English and one of the following languages fluently and idiomatically: Dutch, French, German, Italian, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, or Turkish.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in using AdWords or other online display advertising systems.
Familiarity with the ad serving industry and internet technologies (JavaScript, HTML, Flash).
Extremely proactive, organized and responsible with the proven ability to work well with a team.
Customer focused with strong communication skills and client facing experience.
Fluency in additional languages.
title: Support Specialist (Multiple Languages Available), Global Support Team
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
To Apply:Click the “Apply Now” button and submit your resume in English in a PDF format (in your resume, be sure to include your expected graduation month and year and availability for internship). A cover letter is not required. Applications are due by Friday, July 31, 2015 at 11:59pm PST. Our team will review applications on a rolling basis and reach out to applicants shortly if selected for a next step. We appreciate your patience while we consider your application. We will accommodate your school schedule when determining the start date and duration, and relocation support is available on a case-by-case basis.As a Legal Intern, you will work as part of a team handling a wide range of legal matters in Sydney. You have an understanding of and interests in intellectual property and Internet related laws including privacy, content regulation and online commerce. In this role, you will be responsible for various legal projects including researching case laws closely related to Google’s business or managing key commercial contract templates. You are an outstanding law student who thinks creatively and strategically and enjoys working on complex issues. You are eager to pitch in when needed to assist our rapidly growing businesses and you have the ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a collegial, fast-paced team environment.

Be challenged. Make an impact. Do cool things that matter.

Responsibilities
Conduct legal research as assigned in such as areas copyright, competition, privacy, and regulation of Internet intermediaries in Australia and possibly other countries
Review draft legislative bills or proposals that may affect Google’s business
Participate in the legal review of new product launches
Review and process a variety of standard legal agreements
Assist in optimizing processes and internal workflow and any other related task that the in-house Legal Team may request during the 
Legal Internship
Minimum qualifications
Be currently enrolled in the penultimate year/ final year of a full time LLB degree
Be able to complete a minimum of 3 months (maximum: 6 months) full time internship at Google’s Sydney office starting in October/November 2015. We will accommodate your school schedule when determining the start date and duration.
Returning to education on a full-time basis upon completing the internship
Legal analysis and research experience.
Preferred qualifications
Excellent analytical skills, with an ability to see both detail and big picture issues.
Strong interest in recent developments in the field of Internet related laws and knowledge of online technologies and services.
Strategic problem solving abilities.
Leadership role at university and/or external associations.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
DoubleClick is the world’s leading end-to-end media buying platform, providing ad technology across all aspects of the buying process from ad serving to analytics. We call this suite of products DoubleClick Digital Marketing (DDM).

Programmatic buying represents a significant portion of current digital media spend, opening up new opportunities for publishers and advertisers to match audiences with relevant and compelling ads in a scalable and efficient way.

Media Buying Solutions (Dublin) provides class leading account management and support to our most complex and impactful DoubleClick customers across EMEA, working with agencies and end clients to deliver superior performance across the stack.Responsibilities
Lead a team of DDM Account Managers to deliver business and performance objectives, focusing on campaign delivery, customer Key Performance Indicators and product levers
Work with internal stakeholders to develop robust and scalable support structures for DDM account managers and end clients
Partner with internal support teams to deliver seamless support per client segmentation
Partner with other Google Sales teams to deliver a coordinated service approach to common advertisers
Represent a portfolio of clients and agencies, working closely with partners to understand their needs and deliver best in class account manager and campaign performance
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in marketing, business, communications, other related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working with Account Managers and managing escalations to resolution within the Portfolio.
Experience working with Sales/Solutions teams to ensure client transition from contract signing to engagement.
Preferred qualifications
Ability to act with a high degree of autonomy and deliver results under pressure and to tight deadlines.
People management experience, managing an effective team and achieving big, well-defined goals and effectively working with distributed team members.

text:
As an App Solutions Consultant, you will be a member of the Google Play Apps and Games Business Development team. Our team works across different groups within Google to help partners build the best apps and games on the Android platform and become successful in reaching and engaging their targeted audiences through Google Play.
In this role, you will review and provide feedback on apps to Google Play partners to help them optimize their offerings for Android. To excel in this role, you will have a keen eye on app usability and design as well as expertise in cross-device optimization and development best practices. You will work closely with cross-functional teams on day-to-day execution, as well as provide insights to improve business processes related to internal and partner support.
If you are a person who thrives on working with the latest and greatest apps from the developer community and making impact in a fast-paced environment, this position will be perfect for you.Responsibilities
Lead cross-regional team of solution consultants that deliver app design and usability reviews, functional tests and consultation on platform best practices to 3rd party developers.
Plan, manage, coordinate large-scale complex technical projects involving cross-functional teams and work on new initiatives, workshop and launches.
Define quality criteria for apps with product and engineering teams.
Anticipate, build and document new test cases and feedback as new platform capabilities evolve.
Measure operational efficiencies and provide on-going input in process and scalability improvements.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with developing or testing Android and/or iOS apps and games running across multiple device form factors.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with development, product management, business development and/or sales support in developing mobile apps and games.
Experience in planning, coordinating and managing several large-scale, complex technical projects to deliver quality results within project deadlines.
Understanding of Android platform and Google Play Services.
Strong cross regional and functional leadership and collaboration skills.
Proven ability of working with developers and partners to develop applications, consult and recommend improvements. Ability to engage on technical and design-related issues.
title: App Solutions Consultant
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Security is at the core of Google's design and development process: it is built into the DNA of our products. The same is true of our offices. You're an expert who shares our seriousness about security and our commitment to confidentiality. You'll manage the security staff who keep our Googlers safe and our world-class technologies and facilities secure. You'll collaborate with our Facilities Management team to create innovative security strategies, investigate breaches and create risk assessment plans for the future. You believe that providing effective security doesn't come at the expense of customer service - you will be our bodyguard (and our long lost pal).
An Investigator on the Global Investigations team partners with People Operations (Human Resources), Employee Relations, Internal Audit, Information Security, Legal, Ethics and Compliance, and others to keep Google safe everyday. You have strong interviewing techniques, believe nothing is too small or too big to take on and are comfortable presenting to any level of the organization in a true partnership with our stakeholders. Customer service and flexibility are keys to success in this fast-paced organization.Responsibilities

Develop protocols and practices to assess and mitigate threats to company assets and manage crises, as well as deliver threat assessment services by collecting, evaluating and disseminating accurate and timely intelligence information to appropriate managers.
Investigate possible violations of Google's Security/HR/Finance policies, Code of Conduct or other business conditions and provide appropriate reports to management summarizing the findings.
Conduct audits and other research to identify process deficiencies which could allow inappropriate business conduct, and recommend protocols and policies to address those weaknesses.
Develop strong relationships with domestic and international law enforcement and government counterparts, as well as private sector peers worldwide.
Participate in the planning of company events to ensure a safe and secure venue for participants.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience conducting sensitive investigations in a private sector/public sector environment.
Preferred qualifications
Investigative/Interview Certification through a national or internationally recognized organization.
1 year of experience conducting diverse investigations ranging from work place violence, threat mitigation, financial crimes, corrupt practices, thefts and insider threat.
1 year of experience in supply chain investigations.
Bilingual.
title: Investigator

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Technical Product Specialist - Tokyo.Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind every system is the Ad Serving Operations team to make sure that happens flawlessly. As a member of the team, you are a technical consultant with the dual role of being both client-facing and growing systems from the back-end. An expert in our tools and operations, you provide support, answer field inquiries and troubleshoot client issues. Beyond client-facing issues, your expertise also gives you the insight to recommend product and system improvements to our engineering teams. Your interactions on both sides ensure that when clients advertise with Google, their back-end systems never miss a beat.
As a Technical Product Specialist, you work with colleagues throughout Japan, APAC and global counterparts sharing your advanced knowledge of Google products and advising clients on the best strategy for them to achieve their desired results. Among your many attributes, you are a self-starter and you have a strong desire to learn. You also boast experience in customer service, sales, marketing or consulting. You will have a proven record of analytical problem-solving and the ability to proactively identify and take on product needs in a fast-paced environment.Responsibilities
Provide outstanding technical support and build successful long-term relationships with both internal and external clients for internal workflow applications and sales tools.
Collaborate with sales, product and technical teams to ensure offerings are delivered on time and meet expectations.
Troubleshoot, escalate and respond to product support requests from advertisers and sales teams.
Implement, troubleshoot and support ad serving systems and other Internet-based applications and analyze support data to identify trends and communicate actionable insights to product stakeholders and sales.
Develop support plans and provide implementation training, consulting services and best practices to sales counterparts.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in system development, technical customer support, QA, or workflow support.
Business level communication in Japanese and English.

Preferred qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with Internet technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, SQL databases and scripting languages such as PHP, Python.
Experience with search market or online ad sales.
Ability to interface with engineering teams. Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
title: Technical Product Specialist

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
The Google Assist team within Google for Work plays an integral role in optimizing our online channel. The team focuses on not only engaging Apps trials but also experimenting with scalable solutions to improve trial conversion and improve customer lifetime value.

The Global Programs team within the Assist team is the hub of strategy, online UI experiments, process, data analysis and optimization for the Assist team. Our goal is to unite all of our regional teams through strong processes, systems and vision. 

You are a Program Manager who will join the Global Programs team, and help take our organization to the next level. The team is responsible for managing new launches, metrics and reporting, designing the next generation of our customer experience, and connecting the Support and Sales organizations. You will need to be flexible, nimble and tenacious in managing multiple projects at once. Projects will include operational and process improvements, vision and strategy for the future of the Assist organization, and analysis on the Assist team's performance.Responsibilities
Develop and communicate the vision and strategy for the future of the Assist organization.
Improve operational ROI through the identification of new opportunities for impact.
Develop and execute process improvements to increase efficiency of our representatives on phones.
Manage programs and experiments across multiple teams and regions.
Collect customer and product insights to funnel to the Product teams to impact improvements to the product.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in project management, operations or consulting.

Preferred qualifications
2 years of experience in a consulting environment or program management environment.
Highly analytical, with a track record of being a strong problem solver, capable of translating analysis and insights into actionable business plans.
Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities and able to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines.
Ability to effectively operate with high energy and flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
A self starter who is able to initiate and execute complex, cross-functional projects with minimal guidance.
Demonstrated leadership capabilities and excellent interpersonal skills.

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis.
