Our Hardware Sales team lead an important piece of Google’s mission. It is tasked to manage all of the hardware devices through which our consumers experience our services. The team oversees the commercial aspects of all products made by Google (e.g. Chromecast, etc.), all products made with Google (e.g. Nexus, Chromebooks, etc.) and all of the products made using Google (e.g. Android, Wear, etc).

As the Carrier Sales Lead, Nordics you will be responsible for implementing and optimizing relationships with carrier partners in the region/country that distribute hardware built using our Android and Chrome platforms, and enhance the proposition around those products and platform including driving of business growth through Direct Carrier Billing on Android devices. You'll be the primary partner contact, driving the implementation and optimization of our collaboration and driving tactics designed to improve the usage and distribution of Google’s hardware, platforms, applications and ecosystem services, including the Play Store. You will need to have a deep understanding of Android, Chrome OS, and related hardware (e.g. Chromecast, Nexus, Chromebook) in addition to Google’s ecosystem of applications and services such as Play, Search, and other Apps. You'll track and analyze key metrics, proactively resolve business and technical issues with our partners and identify new partnership opportunities. Some of the attributes you'll bring to this job include ability to operate at C-level, strong attention to detail, outstanding communication and negotiation skills and a collegial personality. 

This is a cross-functional role and you will be working closely with Marketing, Operations, Product Management/Engineering, Sales and PR teams in country as well as across the region and globally.Responsibilities
Manage our hardware products and business growth from Google’s ecosystem services such as the Play Store and Direct Carrier Billing, and use of promotional budgets to ensure targets are being met and exceeded.
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the regional hardware and mobile telecoms markets
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and International teams globally to structure and execute business initiatives, develop work plans, lead analysis and develop and communicate final recommendations.
Forecast and report key metrics, track actual progress toward forecasts, drive and evaluate ROI of promotional and new business opportunities and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of business issues with partners.
Work with our legal team to negotiate and execute complex agreements with key partners.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Related sales management, business development or partner management experience in an Internet, software platform or consumer electronics company.
Ability to speak and write in English and one or more of the Scandinavian languages fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Significant experience in the mobile telecoms industry and existing network of C-level relationships.
Related sales management, business development or partner management experience in an Internet, software platform or consumer electronics company.
Ability to interpret legal documents and work with lawyers to complete agreements.
Demonstrable project management experience, with the ability to lead and handle multiple time-sensitive projects.
Sharp analytical and detail-oriented skill with ability to clarify and summarize complex issues.
Superb communication skills, with the ability to comfortably interact with our partner's and Google's executive management.
title: Carriers Sales Lead, Nordics - Stockholm or Oslo

text:
The Finance Operations team manages Google's cash transactions on a global basis and ensures that Google's incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to manage our complex set of transactions. You thrive on making processes more efficient and scalable, you work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations and you proactively minimize operational risk. Externally, you collaborate with our outsourcing partners and internally, you collaborate across the five areas of the Financial Operations team: Global Revenue Operations, Procure to Pay, Electronic Payment Services, Business Process Outsourcing, and Payroll.
This role is on the Payments Compliance Operations team within the Electronic Payments Services (EPS) group. You will be responsible for managing various Compliance Operations processes and teams, with a focus on Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Sanctions screening and/or Know Your Customer (KYC) reviews. In this role, you will manage a large team conducting the day-to-day Payments Compliance Operations processes to ensure Google stays in continuous compliance with government regulations, contractual obligations, and internal policies. You will drive compliance cross-functional initiatives to continuously enhance our processes, while balancing the need to support an ever growing business and staying within our regulatory compliance obligations. 

You must have experience running the operations of a large team at scale, considering factors such as capacity planning, scheduling and process improvement methodologies, in a global environment.Responsibilities
Manage Google’s Compliance Operations team focused on Sanctions Screening and Know Your Customer/Identity verification processes.
Monitor the health of our AML, Sanctions and/or KYC Compliance Operations, including producing metrics and management reporting to Head of Compliance Operations and other key stakeholders.
Handle priority escalations which will require interfacing with multiple functional areas, using diverse tools to investigate cases and acquire information.
Interface with multiple functional areas to develop and/or enhance our compliance systems and processes, including Compliance Policy, Engineering, Legal, Operations, Finance and Product Management.
Lead complex projects including process optimization, design, and implementation of operations processes with quality metrics and quality programs. Develop and/or enhance training manuals for Compliance Ops analysts. Present AML, Sanctions and/or KYC processes to auditors (internal and external) and regulators upon request.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience managing a high-volume operations in the payments, money transmitter or banking industry in Compliance Operations.
Experience with US and UK AML, Sanctions, and/or Know Your Customer regulations.
Preferred qualifications
CAMS-certification.
Strong knowledge of payments compliance regulations (e.g. AML, KYC, Sanctions).
Ability to query large data sets, using methods such as SQL, SpotFire, etc.
Superior analytical and investigative skills combined with the ability to navigate through ambiguity in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
title: Commerce Payments Compliance Operations Process Manager

text:

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. This role is to be a “chief operating officer” supporting our global brand clients' business in the Americas. Additionally, as a close business partner to our client teams, you will be leading the innovation, design, and roll-out of new sales processes/programs while helping to maintain core operations.Responsibilities

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
As part of the Network Planning and Business Analysis team, you will deliver dashboards, tools and custom analyses that are used by the broader organization to efficiently plan, operate and optimally scale Google Fiber’s network. Your work products provide key insights that are used for capacity planning, cost optimization, topology optimization, network availability/reliability and network operational excellence.Responsibilities
Develop and enhance dashboards and tools as needed, to facilitate efficient monitoring, planning and analysis of the network.
Establish requirements for software development by others and be a constant source of feedback during the development cycle.
Apply data mining techniques to problems such as event correlation and root cause determination.
Develop and prepare appropriate metrics to ensure that the network and NetOps (Network Operations) are performing to standard.
Model network projects and plans to evaluate their technical and financial merits.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in operations research, computer science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with statistical analysis and/or data mining, as well as network modeling and/or analysis.
Coding experience in one or more languages (e.g., Python).
Experience in development of lightweight (web-based) tools.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in networking, operations research, computer science or a related technical field.
Experience working on network monitoring and planning problems of complex scope on large-scale service provider networks.
Experience with network modeling software (Cariden, WANDL, OPNET, etc.) or in-house custom software.
Experience in demand forecasting, Monte Carlo simulations, network analysis, performance metrics and operations research for demand-based networks.
Familiarity with OSP networks and IP networking.
Strong analytical skills.
title: Network Operations Business/Planning Analyst, Google Fiber

text:
As an Administrative Business Partner, you're at the heart of your team's business operations and activities and the soul that keeps your team moving forward. You anticipate the needs of your managers and team members and help them stay focused on their projects by resolving operational and administrative issues before they arise. You move quickly with the changing environment and are up to date with the latest Google products and services. You also use that knowledge to strategically support your team's projects. In addition to being organized and analytical, you possess the strong business judgment and communication skills needed to interact with a variety of people and job functions.
Administrative jobs at Google are staffed by excited, organized, and dependable people driven by a common company goal: to help us accomplish great things. Working behind the scenes, you'll make a significant impact on the people we support as well as on Google users around the world. You're adept at leading and managing a variety of simultaneous projects, which requires the particular talent of being able to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.Responsibilities
Perform an extensive array of administrative tasks (manage calendars, book travel, and schedule facilities and equipment).
Coordinate duties for multiple offices.
Build efficiency and effective responsiveness into existing operations, and help define new operational strategies.
Mentor new team members.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of direct executive support experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience serving as a project lead from conception to completion.
Interest and experience in using technology and the Internet to improve work efficiency.
Comprehensive knowledge of process, project and program management theory and practices - and the ability to apply them when solving operational issues.
Ability to quickly learn new tools and technologies.
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with a diverse range of people and job functions.
Expectation of complete confidentiality on all business matters.
title: Administrative Business Partner

text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. The Commerce Operations team’s mandate is to support, educate, and ultimately retain a fast growing global YouTube user base across a wide variety of products (Shows/Movies, Paid Channels, Music Key etc.). We achieve this through our High Touch Support channels (Email, Phone, Chat) and our Online Help channels (Help Center, Google Help etc.).
As a Commerce Product Specialist you’ll closely work with our High Touch Support Lead on initiatives to drive our CSAT globally and be responsible for escalations. Specifically, you will manage our global Quality Assurance (QA) program, reviewing emails, chats and calls to ensure they meet our global quality standards. You will lead global calibration sessions with all vendors managers, review our sampling guidelines and provide timely updates on progress. In this role, you will also be acting as our global training lead, ensuring our agents are fully equipped to support our users. As such, you will update, revamp, create new training materials and will put in place a comprehensive training plan for agents. Finally, you will be responsible for maintaining/updating and organizing all internal and external communications. You have outstanding project management skills and a strong attention to detail combined with a deep understanding of the online video market.Responsibilities
Lead YouTube's Customer Relationship Management (CRM) strategy and closely work with Commerce Engineering on developing roadmaps.

Partner with Product and Engineering leadership; drive issues to resolution using data and analyze/monitor key metrics.

Scale YouTube's user support model by identifying and driving the implementation of automated and innovative support solutions.

Knowledge of real-time communications infrastructure (phone, chat and video).

Self-starter with ability to work independently and on multiple initiatives at the same time; excellent project manager.

text:
People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be a champion of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching your clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.
As Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) for Employee Relations and Investigations in APAC, you will work in conjunction with the Employee Relations and Investigations team, other Human Resource Business Partners, Employment Legal, Integrity and Governance, Ethics & Compliance, Security and Internal Audit to advise on employee relations issues, including reorganizations, performance management, disciplinary issues, and where appropriate, to conduct quality investigations on people issues/grievances for our offices located in APAC countries. 

Using your knowledge of applicable local employment laws and practices, you will devise, follow and advise on appropriate protocol for APAC-based employee relations issues and investigations, and develop appropriate investigation documentation and recommendations for management. Working closely with our Legal, Compliance and People Operations (Human Resources) departments, you will interpret policies and procedures and advise on fair and equitable employment practices in terms of both company culture and local laws and practices. You will also be a generalist who will provide human resources advice, expertise and counseling in the areas of performance management, coaching/development, compensation, organizational development and restructuring. This is an individual contributor role.
Responsibilities
Partner with HR Business Partners and other Global Investigations teams to ensure that the investigation process in APAC is handled in a fair, timely manner and consistent with company culture and local requirements
Provide pragmatic advice and counsel to HR Business Partners on general employee relations issues in APAC. Assess and document local best practices for investigations, reorganizations and performance management in APAC countries, and maintain storage and access of this information for internal users
Provide project management coordination and guidance for HR Business Partners and managers on APAC-based reorganizations and reorganizations encompassing APAC countries. Ensure that APAC based investigations are thorough and include: understanding of the allegations, appropriate interviews, analysis and documentation, and recommendations for conclusion and course of action
Prepare, track and maintain appropriate investigation and reorganization data and documentation for APAC based investigations and reorganizations
Develop and provide training and guidance to APAC HR Business Partners and managers regarding employee relations issues, investigations, reorgs and managing performance, localizing existing training materials where applicable
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of (or equivalent) Employee Relations experience gained in either an HRBP role or Employee Relations Advisory role including running and advising on disciplinaries/investigations, reorganizations, performance issues or a qualified solicitor in employment law.
Experience working with employment law principles.
Preferred qualifications
CIPD qualified (or equivalent).
Knowledge of and experience with APAC employment law principles.
Attention to detail and ability to multi-task. Strong analytical and problem solving skills with ability to organize and analyze data.
Ability to establish strong cross functional relationships at all levels and geographies. Ability to listen, but also persuasively convey opinions and recommendations.
Proven project management skills with demonstrated ability to manage global projects
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
title: HR Business Partner, Employee Relations and Investigations, APAC

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
The Network Deployment Division plans, designs and builds the network. The Field Teams provide detail designs and build packages and configures and installs network gear including running cables, hardware setup and decommissioning old gear as we're in a constant upgrade cycle.
As a Field Team Lead, you play a critical role in executing the build-to plans that Google Capacity management team develop to meet the demands of internal customers and Google Internet users. You will coordinate the efforts of Network Planners, Network Designers, Field Team Engineers, Supply Chain and Logistics specialists, Vendor Management Specialists and a wide variety of other specialist critical to the build of a complex and robust network.
As a Team Lead you drive execution on a large portfolio of complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. Working with technical program managers you plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes driving project schedules, identifying and resolving risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical decisions with engineers. You also exercise strong managerial skills in guiding fields teams towards meeting deadlines under stress.
Responsibilities
Guide the detailing of high level designs into deployable schedules and build packages.
Generate implementation plans and field team schedules and provide technical leadership and guidance during deployment activities.
Oversee engineers who Install, commission, test and accept new deployment activities on global projects. Guides Career Development for all team members.
Oversee network documentation, assure proper updating and maintaining network drawings and plans, and generate Bill of Materials to support/manage appropriate equipment procurement.
Work with Network Capacity Management to assess risks and potentials in alignment with forecasts and high level build to plan.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
Relevant experience and people management experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with network design, installation and maintenance for service providers or large enterprise networks; a broad understanding of network theory, technologies and the operation of optical transport and IP network systems.
Experience with field-based work in POPs, carrier hotels, data centers and Central Office environments.
Experience creating rack elevations and other planned/install/as-built documentation.
Strong ability to manage people, able to drive execution while furthering the personal needs and aspirations of your teams members
A strong understanding of network design, equipment and infrastructure.
Excellent written/verbal communication skills.
title: Network Deployment Team Lead

10 years of relevant work experience in consulting; software, Internet and/or media industries; and/or early stage companies.

text:
Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. Being a Talent Discovery Specialist at Google means discovering superstars in hard-to-reach places. Working on one of our functional staffing teams, you’ll play the role of detective — using all kinds of tools and resources to uncover the best untapped talent in the world. Once found, you’ll engage with these candidates, learn about their aspirations and interests and help them connect with roles, teams and opportunities at Google. In addition, your problem solving skills help recruiters and hiring managers scale programs and improve workstreams.
As a Talent Discovery Specialist, you play a key role in bringing the most talented people in the world to Google. You provide critical support to the business by finding great candidates for open roles and addressing staffing needs quickly yet purposefully. You are detail-oriented and conscientious, and have an eye to improving our internal system data while developing viable candidates for our stakeholders.
As part of a global team, you gain exposure to the inner workings of Google and partner closely with teams across staffing to help meet our clients’ ever changing business needs.Responsibilities
Generate high value passive talent for Google’s immediate business needs leveraging existing talent pools and discovering new talent pools through competitive intelligence and other sourcing methods.
Improve data integrity within our internal systems.
Manage projects with multiple stakeholders, both ongoing and on an ad hoc basis.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Consulting and/or project management experience.
Preferred qualifications
Relevant work experience sourcing/recruiting/lead generation at agency, in-house, or executive search.
Experience with market research and talent mapping.
Proven ability to consistently and positively contribute in a high-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks and manage time efficiently.
Demonstrated curiosity to learn about different/new sourcing techniques.
Flexible (ability to work across different time zones) and able to think quickly.
Deadline and detail-oriented. Excellent problem-solving, communication and facilitation skills.

text:

Working directly with our Sales, Sales Operations, and Engineering teams, you'll be focused on improving the online experience of our clients by providing consulting services on products like AdWords API, YouTube customized brand channels and other Google technologies for online advertising. Also, you will create and present business arguments and proofs of concept (prototypes) built on various Google APIs and serve as communicator and advocate of these technologies throughout the region. This means you'll be interacting closely and frequently with our customers on both technical and non-technical levels.

Solve customers' business issues with Google technology, brainstorming with the Sales team on technical propositions to enhance customer websites.

Provide technical consulting and propose feasible solutions according to products' Terms and Conditions.
Propose, design, create and present prototypes, demos and proofs of concept to a wide variety of audiences, which include marketing professionals and engineers.

Application development experience, within Unix or other environments; Excellent coding skills in Java, Python or C++.
Strong technical background in Web technologies such as HTTP, HTML, XML, DNS, TCP/IP and experience with web services (SOAP, Atom, JSON).
Working knowledge of databases and an ability to construct complex SQL queries (knowledge of CouchDB, MongoSD or Hadoop).
Ability to adapt your presentations to the technical level of the audience and comfort with presenting technical materials to large groups.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Product Expert, Tokyo Partner Plex - Tokyo.Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. At Partner Plex, we interface with senior marketers from customers that span every vertical. Every customer today faces extremely tough challenges as they work to build their brand in this increasingly complex digital landscape. And when they book a workshop at Google Partner Plex, they are making a significant investment in their time and have extremely high expectations about what we deliver in a Partner Plex experience. Most customers come here thinking that we know things about their brand that they don’t or perhaps we think about their brand in a slightly different way. Thus, the need for deep insights (not just analytics) about a customer’s brand are essential to ground each workshop and start every session off successfully. 

Your objective is to help uncover and create a compelling narrative/hypotheses that will inspire, engage and educate global marketing executives media, digital and traditional ad agency executives and industry thought leaders to drive incremental business with YouTube and Google product solutions. It requires creative problem solving in a fast-paced environment with firm deadlines. Your mission, along with the team, is to bring to life, in a physical space the power of Google in building brands.Responsibilities
Be one of two product leads for the Partner Plex team to drive awareness, understanding and adoption of our brand building solutions by leading highly engaging product workshop sessions with Google’s largest customers
Be an expert in all aspects of our video advertising products, especially with regard to YouTube and AdWords for Video but also have deep working knowledge of Google’s other products, particularly Display, DoubleClick, Shopping/Wallet, Maps, G+ and Mobile.
Be aware of top competitors' products and offerings in the space. Consistently deliver competitive updates and intel so that the BrandLab team is up to speed and has the most relevant knowledge possible.
Engage with and propagate product knowledge to the Partner Plex team, Sales leadership and BrandLab customers by ensuring that the experience includes impactful best practices and a detailed repertoire of case study examples (and constantly finding new and unique examples to compliment our wide range of business verticals on both B2B and B2C).
Work cross-functionally with BrandLab team, Sales, PMs, PMMs, PR, Legal and Partnership teams to guarantee readiness and appropriateness of content and partner with Product and Engineering leadership to ensure ongoing two-way communication on new product developments and product recommendations that emerge from Partner Plex sessions.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Business level communication in Japanese and English.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of product management experience having worked directly with product development teams at Google or other tech companies that focus on advertising and monetization.
Experience in advertising sales or marketing with the strategic ability to translate our product value proposition into consumer marketing terms.
Strong understanding of AdWords, YouTube, Mobile, GDN, DoubleClick and G+ ad products including the product development lifecycle.
A real go-getter with a proven track record in high productivity, intense work environments.
A great connector who can work cooperatively and proactively with teams inside and outside the Partner Plex team
Demonstrated excellence in being able to showcase technology in all forms (apps, content, social, mobile, video) to all levels of understanding. Our clients will range from the CEO/CMO to the head of digital, social, media etc., and everyone in-between.
title: Product Expert, Tokyo Partner Plex

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Advertising Operations Associate, you help the SMB Sales and Operations team better serve Google's worldwide user base for our AdWords product. This fast-paced sales and support team quickly identifies and resolves customer concerns and contributes to the growth of our programs. Your objective is to continue to hone your account management and relationship-building skills, supporting some of Google's top advertisers and agencies by providing the best possible service via phone, email, or chat. 

Your specific responsibilities could include developing compelling advertising solutions for brand advertisers, or developing scalable support solutions. You work within a diverse team with colleagues across the region sharing your advanced knowledge of Google products and advising our clients on the best strategy for them to achieve their desired results for a number of emerging markets in Southeast Asia, a rapidly growing and exciting region. Among your many attributes, you are comfortable with a rapidly changing environment, and you have a strong desire to learn. You also bring experience in customer service, sales, marketing or consulting.Responsibilities
Provide outstanding customer service and sales support to Google's advertisers, publishers, and/or users.
Manage customer inquiries by phone, e-mail, and/or live chat.
Implement creative ways to improve our client relationships and business growth through sales and promoting other Google products.
Provide strategic advice and help solve issues by working closely in a consultative role with clients.
Communicate effectively with English and Bahasa Indonesia speaking clients.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Experience or internships in sales, customer support, account management, marketing or consulting.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail.
Demonstrated capacity to lead and/or motivate others around you.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Bahasa Indonesia.
title: Advertising Online Specialist (Bahasa Indonesia)

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, Street View to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. Google products are the lifeblood of who we are. The Google Wireless team works closely with our product team and engineers to guide products from conception to launch, and with our business partners to generate profitable streams.
The Google Wireless team is looking for a talented engineering professional who can lead and be a key in-region focal point of business and technical contact between the Original Device Manufacturers (ODMs)/Partners and the teams at Google.
You will involved in all aspects of product development starting with concept, prototypes, tooling, quality, test, manufacturing, logistics. This includes establishing business and technical relationships with ODMs and overseeing engineering qualifications, new production introduction, production readiness, and product quality. You have a basis for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.
Responsibilities
Provide on-site product development support at key ODMs and Google partners for new and sustaining product design concepts, design quals, prototype builds, quality and process improvements. Support Design for Manufacturability (DFM), tooling bring up, approve first articles, cycle time/process improvements, quality audits. Create, approve work instructions and assembly guides as needed.
Provide comprehensive business and technical support to Google's global manufacturing partners during development and production builds. Assist and oversee implementation of IQC, OQC, Quality Control Plans, PFMEA, Audits.
Resolve product development, manufacturing and field challenges by applying knowledge and skills, escalating design, manufacturing, and product test issues to others within the organization when appropriate.
Identify, initiate, and drive design and process improvements that to optimize cost and yields and eliminate pain points while maintaining exceptional quality.
Support central quality engineering for auditing suppliers, provide on-site support for RMA issues, enabling the production ramps at suppliers per Google standards.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of electronics product development experience.
Preferred qualifications
Proven experience in launching high volume and complex projects within schedule, cost and quality constraints; experienced in leading projects with Original Equipment Manufacturers, Contract Manufacturer, ODM, JDM; supplier selection and qualification (wireless products).
Practical design, development or manufacturing experience in electronics industry.
Proven experience in leading product development, New Product Introduction, supplier development, quality and FATP activities. Expertise in Design for X, Development Verification Testing, Bill of Materials Management.
Strong understanding of product development processes (concept to EOL); proven experience in design and process optimizations.
Proven experience developing solid, effective technical relationships with contract manufacturers, OEMs, ODMs; proven experience in implementing and maintaining product reliability and quality procedures.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in both English and Mandarin. Travel as needed both domestic/internationally (30%).
title: Technical Program Manager, Access, Asia

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, StreetView to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. Google products are the lifeblood of who we are. The Google team works closely with our product team and engineers to guide products from conception to launch, and with our business partners to generate profitable streams.
The Google Access team is looking for a talented engineering professional who can lead and be a key in-region focal point of business and technical contact between the Google ODMs/Partners and the teams at Google, Mountain View.
Responsibilities
Work with engineering development team to design and validate production line test fixtures.
Work with partners to install test fixtures in factory and troubleshoot.
Provide hardware oriented feedback to the factory software engineers.
Assist engineering team with system bring up, and design validation.
Support team in debug, trouble shooting, and failure analysis investigation.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in EE or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience in hardware architecture, board design and board bring-up experience.
Experience with high speed signal validation such as ISI measurements; Experience with advanced fine pitch components, and PC board technologies.
Experience with standard RF/wifi interfaces (802.11,CDMA,UMTS,GPS,Bluetooth) at chipset, baseband, and antenna integration levels.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working with product line testing for consumer products and working with OEM, ODM, JDM, and CM Partners (or some subset of these).
Familiarity with CPU internal architecture, SW development from firmware through system level, and security.
Understand entire product development process for mass volume production design, with a focus on DFM (design for manufacturing) and DFT (design for test).
Familiar with industry standard CAD tools such as Orcad, Concept, Allegro.
Solid understanding of the system development process including symbol creation, schematics, and board design and development, as well as board and system bring up and debugging.
title: Hardware Engineer, Access

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
Our objective is to ensure accessibility to Google products and services, including Google Search, Cloud and YouTube, by working in close collaboration with suppliers and network operators worldwide. You like the idea of implementing networking solutions that deliver front-end serving content to billions of users around the world. You will manage cross-functional projects that require working with all organizational levels and groups specific to growth and development of the Google backbone, data center, peering and content distribution networks. You have a strong background in network engineering, network content distribution, network operations, technology deployment or computing sciences and is essential for your success in this role.Responsibilities
Work with core teams to develop and articulate tactical plans and long term strategy for Google’s backbone and content distribution requirements. Initiate new programs in response to need and be the catalyst for winning support and driving them through the execution phase.
Manage various programs of work, engage teams and engineers, set the pace for development, deployment and delivery of networking systems and infrastructure. Develop and prepare project documentation, process maps, presentations and tracking reports to provide detailed current status of each project.
Use technical judgment to drive project delivery, technology reviews, challenge proposals and build consensus.
Analyze numerical network performance and system performance data and translate into recommendations and actionable plans. Provide strong quantitative analysis focus, requiring interpretation of technical and commercial information from structured and unstructured sources.
Present your team's analyses and recommendations to internal stakeholders, including executive management.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience coordinating and scheduling projects throughout the entire lifecycle.
Experience with managing migration-style projects; projects that involve technology qualification, upgrades and changes during maintenance windows.
Experience supporting or driving technical programs in network deployment/engineering, product design, network content delivery or data center networking within telecommunications or Internet industries.

Preferred qualifications
Master's degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Knowledge or demonstrated experience with software/cloud applications
Demonstrated experience defining system and/or process requirements, building, integrating, and/or delivering large-scale layer 2 and layer 3 network systems.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in an ambiguous and busy operations environment, and deliver outstanding results in a timely manner.
Outstanding organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization abilities; an excellent attention to detail.
title: Technical Program Manager, Network Engineering

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
Google has one of the most advanced and innovative operations environments on the planet. Google's Global Infrastructure Group (GIG) is at the core of preparing for Google's continued exponential growth. When we're not deploying our next data center, we focus on forecasting, planning, and integrating the latest technologies into the delivery of our data centers, networks, and servers across Google’s production environment. Our team works closely with partners worldwide to support the growth of Google's products and services and to provide the infrastructure that will take the company to the next level.
As a Demand Planner, you should demonstrate domain expertise in leading projects related to demand planning, supply-demand matching, inventory management, and procurement. In this hands-on role, you will be responsible for developing the demand plan that will enable GIG and our customers to meet our objectives related to data center, networking, and machine delivery. You will work closely with customers, supply chain managers, engineering and supplier partners to implement processes and systems that directly support Google’s rapidly growing hardware infrastructure.Responsibilities
Design/generate consensus and statistical demand forecast reports and continuously improve forecasting techniques, method, and approach.
Evolve and maintain documentation and standard operating procedures for demand planning processes and systems.
Establish and utilize best methods (statistical models, processes and software tools) in creating forecasts and respective inventory targets.
Drive build recommendations based on forecasted demand models and scenarios.
Perform data analysis and modeling to establish correlations and market trends.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Economics, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant work experience, including experience in supply chain operations/manufacturing.

Preferred qualifications
Proven track record of achieving objectives on schedule and within budget.
Ability to successfully work across multiple levels of an organization with experience leading cross-functional process improvements.
Excellent analytical skills, tenacious problem solver with strong verbal/written communication and facilitation skills.
title: Program Manager, Demand Planner, Global Infrastructure

Responsibilities
Develop Google’s relationships with Business Directors, Strategy and Broadcast/Screen teams of our agency partners.
Manage relationships with specific agency accounts, drive business opportunities with our vertical teams, create and execute the strategy, trading terms and execution of annual agency partnership plans for Google and build the businesses capabilities of our agencies.
Assess the agency Google product capabilities. Build and deliver high-impact training program to fill gaps.
Translate data into compelling, actionable plans and recommendations for our agency partners.

text:
As a Product Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.
As a Product Marketing Manager you're a flexible, hardworking marketeer with demonstrable knowledge about Google. You will plan and execute major business-to-business (B2B) initiatives for the Ukrainian market. You will be in charge of positioning and promoting Google's business products to achieve measurable business results across multiple channels. Your end goal will be to recruit small and medium advertisers through efficient campaigns designed to increase awareness, education and product adoption. You will also be required to analyze the results of marketing programs to optimize investment.Responsibilities
Manage marketing acquisition strategy to recruit SMB advertisers for Google.
Understand customer, product and media channel development and opportunities.
Create, execute and analyze marketing programs to achieve and optimize business targets, and plan campaign and channel mix.
Manage third party relationships with agencies and vendors in advertiser acquisition programs
Act as valuable marketing partner and Ukraine market advocate across Google.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in Ukrainian, Russian and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Practical commercial experience with segmentation, product portfolio and channel strategy development.
Experience in B2B marketing, business development, sales or strategy with small and medium businesses (SMBs).
Strong analytical skills and proven track record of managing ROI campaigns and measurements.
Understanding of the search, online advertising or web publishing market.
Combination of strategic ability and executive leadership.
title: Head of SMB Marketing, Ukraine

text:
As the Design Development Manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
From the beginning, Google has focused on providing the best user experiences possible. Whether we’re designing a new Internet browser, a tweak to the look of our homepage or the introduction of a retail installation, we take great care to ensure that our efforts will ultimately serve our users and customers well. At Google, we see being great at something as a starting point, not an endpoint. We set ourselves goals we know we can’t reach. Yet. By stretching to meet these goals, we inevitably get further than we expected. Through innovation and iteration, we aim to take things that work well and improve upon them in unexpected ways.

For the Retail Marketing team, our very simple goal is to bring the best of Google innovation - from products and services to partnerships and brand experiences - to even more people around the world. We work internally with teams across the Google organization, as well as in close collaboration with outside retailers, operators, manufacturers and many others, to bring our shared vision to life. Our Retail team are a group of entrepreneurs dedicated to delivering the ultimate pathways for customers to experience the magic of Google. If you have a passion for creating amazing customer experiences and for technology - and want to join a fast-growing team as we embark on this revolutionary journey - then this might be the place for you.Responsibilities
Manage the global store planning direction for Google’s Retail Programs. Design the store layout within 3rd party environments including fixture configurations, site survey reviews and store drawings as required by planning briefs.
Provide thought leadership on Google’s approach to solving for premium positioning and representation within complex global store environments will be required daily.
Manage agency partners managing drawing teams, workflow, space planning exercises, approvals, schedules, and budgets.
Partner closely with regional retail leads. Have a keen understanding of global environments within the consumer electronics and telco channels will need to be demonstrated.
Partner closely with the Retail Design and Programs Team, gTech (Operations), manufacturers/installers and is expected to ensure all store planning strategies including guidelines, and store drawings are well defined and communicated.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience at a design firm, ad agency or in-house marketing communications/creative services department.
Preferred qualifications
6 years of architectural experience and demonstrated mastery with CAD, Illustrator, Cinema 4D software, or similar.
title: Design Development Manager, Global Retail

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
Program managers have comprehensive knowledge of technologies and processes, and understand the business commitments of our customers. You will own our interactive, database-driven service catalog from conception to deployment. You will work with cross-functional groups across Corporate Engineering/Technical Infrastructure to clearly define our services, solutions, and deliverables. You will also collaborate with the teams responsible for the integration of acquisitions to ensure that the catalog reflects their delivery capabilities as well as meets the needs of our acquired organizations.
Responsibilities

Build strong relationships across the Google Technical Infrastructure team and work with these groups to achieve consensus around our service offerings.
Define the service catalog needs and deliverables. Create the catalog from source material provided by cross-functional teams. Own the authoring, publishing and on-going maintenance of it.
Provide technical implementation of the service catalog database.
Develop formal processes to implement and reflect changes.
Identify customer service trends. Recommend corresponding system improvements and drive change to our offerings.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in programming and scripting (e.g., Python, SQL).
Preferred qualifications
Significant experience as a leader in a consulting and IT service organization. Experience managing an IT portfolio.
Knowledge of Google technologies and infrastructure including networking, security, corporate systems and infrastructure, system administration and operations, and the software development lifecycle.
General knowledge of compliance standards in the IT industry.
Proven focus on customers' needs.
Strong understanding of technical concepts in IT. Knowledge of systems and tools, and new developments in the IT industry.
Problem-solving and analytical skills, impeccable business judgment, and attention to detail. Ability to assess problems as they arise in order to plan, design, and implement suitable solutions.
title: Program Manager, Service Portfolio

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
As a member of the Access and Energy Partnerships team, you’ll be responsible for establishing strategic partnerships that enable and scale new and existing products and projects at Google. You’ll use your entrepreneurial instincts to identify partnerships that can enable Google’s next generation of products and services. You’ll work closely with Product, Engineering, Strategy and Operations, and Legal teams to develop partnerships strategies, influence product vision and establish go-to-market plans. You will run the partnerships process from start to finish: opening doors with potential partners, leading exploratory talks, building business models, getting consensus with senior executives and managing partners to deliver results.Responsibilities
Manage partner relationships by building strong long-term relationships that deliver value to Google and partners.
Build consensus with senior internal and external executives and present proposals.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute projects and products, develop work plans, lead analyses, and develop and communicate final recommendations.
Develop partnership strategy based on research, expertise and understanding of the Access sector (e.g. Wireless, Wi-Fi, fixed line infrastructure, spectrum, etc.) landscape and trends.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
5 years of partnerships, market/business development experience and/or sales experience in the technology sector.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or BS degree in Engineering or relevant area.
Proven ability to handle ambiguity, to work collaboratively with internal and partner contacts and to influence cross-functional teams.
Ability to ramp up quickly on new technologies and to quickly identify relevant partners in order to launch and scale projects and products.
Ability to perform research on and assist with execution of several time-sensitive project at once in a fast paced environment with minimal direction.
Strong analytical and reasoning skills with technical, contractual and financial issues as well as strong written and oral communication skills.
title: Partner Development Manager, Google Access
