text:
To apply: Please complete BOTH parts of the Fall Business Internship application: 
Part 1. Click the “Apply Now” button to submit your resume and unofficial transcript. Cover letter is optional. 
Part 2.  Complete the Fall Internship Supplemental Application.

In the supplemental application, you will have the opportunity to select your preferred job functions and locations, however, you will be reviewed for all functions and locations. Final decisions will be made based on business needs and your relevant experience.

Applications are open on April 6th and will be due by June 14th, 2015 at 11:59pm PT. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis starting late April and it's in your best interest to apply early. All hiring will be complete by the end of August. Dates are subject to change and it is recommended that you check back regularly. Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.

At Google, one Googler can make a huge impact, and it’s no different with our interns as they’re our key players in our daily innovation. As a Fall Business intern, you’ll have the opportunity to work on projects core to Google’s business, whether it be with our Small and Medium-sized Businesses (SMB), People Operations (POps/HR), Marketing, or Google Technical Services (gTech) organization. Our intern recruitment team will determine where the best fit will be based on your application.

Our internship will expose you to the technology industry, as well as provide opportunities for personal and professional development. From being challenged to collaborating with a team, you can join our internship to make an impact. 

Interns at Google are offered competitive salaries and enjoy many Google perks. Relocation may be provided depending on your proximity to the Google office where you’ll be interning.

Application Deadline:  The application deadline is 11:59PM PT June 14th, 2015, but we will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis starting late April 2015 and until all roles are filled. To be considered for this internship, both parts of the application need to be completed by or before the deadline.

Have additional questions? Please contact fallbizinterns@google.com  and/or review our FAQs.Responsibilities
Specific responsibilities vary by project area.
Minimum qualifications
Be currently enrolled in a 4-year BA/BS program, in any major, at a university in the United States.
On track to graduate either in December 2015, Spring 2016 or December 2016. Students on track to graduate in December 2015 must be concurrently enrolled in school (i.e., taking course credit for the internship, an online course, etc.).
Have authorization to work in the United States.
Commitment to working 40 hours per week throughout the fall semester in the Google office where the team is located.
Preferred qualifications
Relevant sales, customer service, programs, or analytical work experience.
Advanced spreadsheet modeling experience.
Programming experience in either Java, SQL, HTML, Python, C, or C++.
Proven ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail.
Proactive, independent worker with the demonstrated capacity to lead, motivate and work well with others.
Excellent presentation skills.
title: Fall Business Internship, 2015

text:
When leading companies decide to "go Google," it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. But the Google for Work Sales team can't do it alone. Once educational institutions, government agencies and other businesses sign on to use Google for Work products to make their work more productive, mobile and collaborative, you come in. As a Google for Work Sales Engineer, you assist fellow Sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the Product Marketing Management and Engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google for Work products.
Google Cloud Platform is a set of modular cloud-based services that allow you to create anything from simple websites to complex applications. It externalizes the best of how we run the worlds largest SaaS company and makes our infrastructure, software and processes available to all. Google Cloud Platform delivers the full promise of the public cloud - on-demand provisioning of infinite capacity running on world-class infrastructure without any upfront commitment.

Traditional developers are just now discovering the unique power and instant scale made available to them through Google Cloud Platform -- Compute Engine, App Engine, Container Engine, BigQuery, Cloud Storage, and more. Regardless of size, businesses can move from start-ups to household names overnight, with almost no infrastructure costs. Whole new industries and solution spaces are being defined and developed right now and cloud services are leveling the playing field across the board.

We're on a mission to completely change the world of enterprise computing, and you'll not only have a front-row seat for the action -- you'll be helping shape and execute the strategies to help customers "go Google" for their core business. You will become a trusted advisor to our clients and prospects, and help them get as much value out of our Platform as possible. You are also a strong ally to our Sales Googlers, using both technical and business skills to move the agreement forward as efficiently as possible. We optimize for growth and ensure customer success by providing end-to-end services to our clients.Responsibilities
Use your technical expertise to help a client determine if Google Cloud Platform is right for them.
Work with the Sales team to identify and qualify Platform opportunities through a formal sales process. Conduct full technical discovery, identifying pain points, business and technical requirements, “as is” and “to be” scenarios. Architect client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
Take full responsibility for the technical aspects of the sales cycle including general evangelism, introductory meetings, supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional supporting technical resources. Identify and handle key customer technical objections, prescriptively guiding them to success.
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google Cloud Platform value proposition and unique differentiators, using whiteboarding, slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and RFI response documents.
Work hands-on with Google's Enterprise Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments. Make recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution, providing “best practice” advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud Platform effectiveness.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience serving in the capacity of a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer facing role (including working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team).
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field with experience with Big Data, PaaS, and IaaS technologies.
Experience in and understanding of data and information management - especially as it relates to Big Data trends and issues within businesses; hands-on experience using and/or managing databases. Know your way around Map Reduce, Hadoop, Spark, Flume, Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, BigQuery.
Experience architecting and developing software for scalable, distributed systems.
Working knowledge of Linux, Web 2.0 development platforms, solutions, and related technologies (HTTP, Basic/NTLM, sessions, XML/XSLT/XHTML/HTML), understanding of DNS, TCP, Firewalls, Proxy Servers, DMZ, Load Balancing, VPN, VPC).
Web application development and integration. Software development platforms and solutions to include J2EE, Java servlets, JavaScript, Python, GO, PHP, ASP, CGI, Ajax.
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT Technology space.
title: Google for Work, Cloud Platform Sales Engineer

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.Responsibilities
Maximize business growth potential and drive incremental growth across export retail client portfolio.
Build strong relationship with customers, proactively identify and solve their problems.
Work with the client to implement Google’s latest product features and maximize their campaign performance for better ROI.
Manage ongoing customer training of all AdWords related tools.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Hands-on campaign management experience using Google AdWords platform.
Analytical work related experience.
Excellent analytical and communication skill.
Fluent in both English and Chinese Mandarin, capable of another foreign language.
title: Account Manager, Export Retail

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
An Account Analyst requires a sharp, analytical mind and an entrepreneurial spirit. You will be both creative and quantitative in this role. Armed with deep knowledge of Google products, marketing trends and individual client needs, you will brainstorm, develop and refine compelling, customized marketing plans and then deliver them to the Sales team in advance of client-facing meetings. You identify integrated, data-driven business opportunities based on internal and external tools analysis and work with Account Management (AM) and Account Executives (AEs) to identify business opportunities.
Responsibilities
Develop both industry-specific and general market analysis to deliver insights regarding market and competitive trends, auction dynamics, and other data-driven analysis. Analyze client benchmarks, industry snapshots and present client mailshots.
Gather and use data from different internal and external sources and turn it into insights that help clients realize their opportunities.
Develop smart, integrated, research-based proposals and presentations to enhance Google's reputation with client(s) as a consultant and partner. Quantify high impact opportunities with clear traffic, performance and budget recommendations.
Develop scalable and leading edge solutions for client(s) with with AEs and AMs, in order to optimize their returns and maximize use of Google products (Search, Video, Display, Mobile, etc).
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with highly analytical work, working with data to identify trends and make recommendations in investment banking or consulting.
Advanced level of proficiency with complex spreadsheets/analysis and putting together presentations.
Proven ability to work cooperatively and proactively with staff inside and outside the department.
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Demonstrated excellence in witten and verbal communication.
title: Account Analyst, Automotive Account, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
We are accepting applications for our September program. The deadline to apply is July 6, 2015 at 11:59pm (Pacific Time). Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our search engine and tools serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services. Google is invested in increasing the pipeline of computer scientists and software developers, particularly those who are historically underrepresented in the field. Many aspiring computer scientists could benefit from a program that bridges the gap between academia and industry.

Google Engineering Residency Program is a 1-year program open to all qualified graduates who received a degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering within the last year (or who will receive a degree by the summer of 2015). It combines CS education with hands-on software engineering experience in a supported, closely mentored cohort. In addition to an intensive industry-focused curriculum, the Engineering Residency Program provides residents with a strong foundation in CS (as it applies to real engineering problems) and experience working on complex programming projects with Google engineers.
The Engineering Residency Program is open to all qualified college graduates and is committed to addressing diversity in our company and in the technology industry. Those who are members of historically underrepresented groups in the technology industry are specifically encouraged to apply.Responsibilities
Participate in a one year residency program combining industry-focused Computer Science education and practical software engineering experience.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Eligible to work in the United States.
Preferred qualifications
Experience programming in C, C++, Java and/or Python.
Expertise in data structures, algorithms and complexity analysis
Strong work ethic and a willingness to learn.
title: Engineering Resident, University Graduate

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
Sales Operations (Sales Ops) is the global team that makes sure Google’s complex business runs smoothly. Experts in driving process improvements and consistency, team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of getting things done. The Global Productivity and Tools Team is responsible for leading sales tools efforts to support the Global Business Organization (GBO), partnering with Sales, Global Solutions, Engineering, Operations and Finance.
You will be a key member of the Sales Ops team, working on a cutting edge platform that builds client customized pitch materials at scale. Sales teams at Google spend a major portion of their day with pitch preparation (identifying products and solutions, doing customer research and creating/reviewing decks). We believe this tool can drastically simplify and accelerate pitch preparation and improve pitch quality through smart automation. You will work directly with content developers as well as product managers and engineers to creatively define and build templates via data pipelines and models. The work you do will reach thousands and potentially touch every one of Google’s clients.
Responsibilities
Consult with content creators across GBO (Global Client and Agency Solutions, Large Customer Sales, Small and Medium Businesses, Agency, Publisher, Marketing and Google for Work) to explore potential dynamic data-driven insights and visualizations as the evidence that supports pitch storylines.
Identify data sources and design database models to support one or more pitch templates.
Write and maintain the business rules, logic and SQL queries that surface the appropriate data outputs for slides.
Work cross-functionally with the Engineering and Product Management teams to design new platform features and to implement source-of-truth data initiatives.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of work experience in similar analyst roles, including experience with high data volume environments in software, internet, media or telecom industries.
Database experience in architecting, designing and developing backend databases, including experience in SQL coding across standard relational environments (e.g. Oracle, Teradata, MySQL, etc).
Preferred qualifications
Product and project management experience.
Front-line sales and service experience.
Familiarity with programming languages (Java, Python, C++, etc.).
Expertise with the Google sales tool ecosystem.
Ability to build strong relationships and work effectively cross-functionally.
Advanced analytical, quantitative and statistical problem solving skills.
title: Data Analyst

text:
The gTech Ads team is a solution-generating force that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. In addition to troubleshooting on the customer side, we work with Sales, Product and Engineering teams within Google to develop better tools and services to improve our products based on the evolving needs of our users. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.
The Global Support team in gTech Ads plays a critical role in Google's success, supporting Sales teams, advertisers and products that enhance business potential by consistently providing scalable product solutions, reliable information based on efficient, consultative analysis, accurate implementations and timely communications. Alongside our support and troubleshooting work, we partner with Sales, Product Management and Engineering to focus on developing innovative, scalable support solutions that effectively serve our growing customer base. 

As a Support Specialist, you will work closely with advertisers and the global Sales teams to drive troubleshooting, and implementation support. In this role you will become an expert, focused on handling troubleshooting and/or implementation tasks so that the Sales teams can concentrate their efforts on client-specific activities. This is a specialist role focused on providing the highest quality of support to both our Sales teams and the advertisers they work with.Responsibilities
Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service, troubleshooting and resolving issues from Sales teams and Google's advertisers.
Manage sales and customer inquiries by live chat, tickets, and other channels.
Work directly with large advertisers as well as internal Sales teams.
Contribute to the development of internal products and provide emergency expert support during non-office hours when required.
Carry out one-off projects as required for large advertisers.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in Spanish and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
2 years of experience in an online advertising role.
Experience in using AdWords or other online display advertising systems.
Customer focus and client facing experience.
Familiarity with the ad serving industry and internet technologies (JavaScript, HTML, Flash).
Extremely proactive, organized, responsible, and a proven ability to work well with a team.
Excellent communication skills. Fluent in Portuguese.
title: Support Specialist, gTech Ads

text:
As an Administrative Business Partner, you're at the heart of your team's business operations and activities and the soul that keeps your team moving forward. You anticipate the needs of your managers and team members and help them stay focused on their projects by resolving operational and administrative issues before they arise. You move quickly with the changing environment and are up to date with the latest Google products and services. You also use that knowledge to strategically support your team's projects. In addition to being organized and analytical, you possess the strong business judgment and communication skills needed to interact with a variety of people and job functions.Responsibilities
Perform an extensive array of administrative tasks (manage calendars, book travel, and schedule facilities and equipment).
Build efficiency and effective responsiveness into existing operations, and help define new operational strategies.
Mentor new team members.
Serve as a lead and manager of small projects.
Coordinate duties for multiple offices.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of general administrative experience.
Experience serving as a project lead.
Preferred qualifications
Interest and experience in using technology and the Internet to improve work efficiency.
Comprehensive knowledge of process, project and program management theory and practices and the ability to apply them when solving operational issues.
Ability to quickly learn new tools and technologies.
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with a diverse range of people and job functions.
Expectation of complete confidentiality on all business matters.
title: Administrative Business Partner

text:
Google is a universally recognized name. The Localization team helps Google's ideas and products look, feel and sound natural to users in their own countries. We collaborate with international Engineering, Product and Marketing teams to steer products through the localization process and ensure successful launches across the globe. Our team is an international collection of enthusiastic, creative and knowledgeable people who excel in a fast-paced, culturally diverse environment. You are an excellent communicator who plays a strategic role by building relationships with partner teams to establish needs, deadlines and budgets. You will flex your project management skills in order to ensure that our Localization process runs effectively and efficiently.
Google's mission is to make all of the world's information universally accessible and useful. We take that seriously for far more than just products in English language. Help us make sure that Google is useful and fun for our international users.
You have a passion for language and want to help shape Google’s voice in your market or region.Responsibilities
Work closely with Google's translation and review vendors to ensure localization quality, and monitor language quality data. Develop a good understanding of market expectations for localization quality and how Google's products fit in the market.
Form a critical part of the Google in-country “go-to-market” team with Marketing, Product and PR to drive localization of Google products. Work closely with local teams to develop specific terminology for new features and products, and shape the Google voice for the local market/region.
Work with localization project managers and other teams at Google to identify and address linguistic issues. Maintain language references such as terminology databases and the style guide.
Ensure quality of high-priority products and highly visible materials through quality assurance and bug fixing, taking a hands-on approach as necessary.
Understand challenges in the localization process and lead broad language quality improvement initiatives at the language and team level, as well as upstream.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as an Indonesian translator, linguist, copywriter, writer or editor.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master's degree.
Experience within creative, localization or the online marketing/advertising industry.
Ability to relate to ambiguity, work independently and be able to chart direction of projects.
Detail-oriented, quality-focused and proactive, with strong ability to manage projects.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to manage multiple and diverse stakeholders across businesses and leadership levels.
title: Language Specialist, Indonesia (Bahasa speaking)
locations: Special Capital Region of Jakarta, Indonesia

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
As a Strategic Partner Manager, you will provide strategic account and relationship management to a portfolio of customers that includes many well-known brand sites. You will be responsible for driving our business forward by promoting the full Google suite of publisher and developer products. The primary online advertising solutions you will be promoting are AdSense and the Ad Exchange for desktop publishers, and AdMob for mobile publishers/apps developers. A key focus will be providing the right product mix for a partner across the full range of your online properties. You will organize and execute on Online Partnerships Group Partner events, build new partnerships with key online companies in your market and develop innovative new ways to help partners grow their advertising earnings with Google. You’ll also contribute to the development of strategies for your market.Responsibilities
Build trusted, strategic relationships with partners and develop a thorough understanding of their business challenges.
Add value to our partners' business by proposing the optimal Google monetization solution.
Provide creative ways for partners to improve their business with Google’s monetization solution.
Cross-promote new products or features that will have a positive impact on partner investments.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and French fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Experience in publisher yield management, ad operations and/or sales/account management.
Knowledge of and a keen interest in online Display and mobile advertising.
Detail-oriented and analytical with the ability to prioritize, plan and organize sales activity.
title: Strategic Partner Manager (French), Online Partnerships Group

text:
Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. You will lead and motivate a team of direct reports to achieve amazing performance goals. You'll work closely with the executive management team to set and develop business strategies. You will draw insights from analytics to make our people process smarter and more efficient. You will use your strong communication skills to tell rich, meaningful stories using data and influence decisions. You will develop strong relationships across the organization, working collaboratively with clients, peers and key leaders to drive results for your team, the department and clients.
The Staffing Manager for Product Management will lead a very strong team helping to build and grow one of the most critical functions at Google. Our Product Managers (PMs) are responsible for defining and launching Google's products across a variety of countries and markets. Google PMs are different than many of our industry peers. They include former Directors, Chief Technology Officer (CTOs), Software Architects, and Entrepreneurs. This is one of the most visible teams to our executive management group as they are responsible for all of our consumer experiences - our number one priority at Google. The PM Staffing Manager will have responsibility for developing strategies to hire exceptionally talented PMs all over the world.Responsibilities
Provide clients and candidates with enticing and compelling experiences during the recruiting and hiring process.
Manage and inspire a team to deliver results across a complex regional matrix while effectively communicating all critical dimensions of staffing business plans with global leadership teams and support organizations.
Create and implement global staffing business strategy to achieve an annual hiring plan that emphasizes quality and diversity of hires, process efficiency and strong client management with senior business leaders globally.
Collaborate with Finance, Operations, HR Business Partners and Staffing Effectiveness teams. Lead staffing portion of headcount planning and staffing resource planning processes.
Communicate all critical dimensions of staffing business plans with global leadership teams and support organizations while managing and influencing complex partner relationships to ensure overall staffing objectives are met.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
10 years of combined experience in internal recruiting, executive search and consulting with demonstrated success in building out, leading or managing teams of high-performing individuals at a Global scale.
Significant exposure to recruiting - gained either through growing and managing a large team, as being part of a staffing organization, or through direct recruiting experience at the college, industry or leadership level.
Proven leadership with a vision and strategy for recruiting in a highly dynamic organization.
Integrity and values-based leadership skills.
Strong analytical skills and ability to work with metrics, numbers, and trends.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a proven ability to take initiative and build strong, productive relationships; an ability to identify and galvanize this complex web of relationships and dependencies to holistically solve problems and seize opportunities.
title: Staffing Manager, Product Management

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
You will work with Account Managers (AM) and cross-functional teams within OPG to identify and acquire prospective publishers through direct interactions. You will work with both the AMs in the South East Asia (SEA) team as well as team members in the Inside Sales Organization (ISO) to develop business for SEA.
Responsibilities
Work with APAC ISO leads and pod Managers to identify the market potential. Communicate effectively with teams/clients in English or their respective local SEA languages.
Prospect for new publisher partners, identify new sales opportunities and create a business pipeline.
Take responsibility for demand generation through outbound calls.
Support solution sales, and provide consultative sales to publishers by uncovering their business needs, and presenting them Google’s online monetization solutions.
Meet monthly targets, as well as contribute to the overall pod targets.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience in sales, publishing and digital advertising.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Self-driven and ambitious with polished skills to close deals.
Fluency in one of the local SEA languages (Chinese, Malay, Vietnamese, Bahasa, Thai, etc.).
title: Business Acquisition Manager, SEA

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
Google for Work Technology and Solutions [GTS] mission is deliver simple, innovative business systems that enable our business and partners to thrive. GTS works with our business, partner and project teams to build systems for all aspects of the business: business intelligence, CRM, order management, billing, sales and support systems and marketing.
In this role, you will create and lead the GTS strategic planning process for the systems portfolio of projects. You will drive the creation, management and execution of the GTS portfolio roadmap. You will manage and lead either directly or indirectly a team of systems project managers to deliver systems to our business and partner teams. You will lead efforts to provide transparency to the stakeholder teams for the GTS strategic plan. You will have a passion for collaboration and a drive to deliver systems that exceed your stakeholder’s expectations.
You combine clear communication with strong program leadership skills and a solid commitment to providing stakeholders with an excellent customer experience. Help Google for Work grow and continue improving businesses the world over.Responsibilities
Implement clear and transparent systems strategic planning process for Google for Work systems for a cross functional team including systems Engineering, Product, Partner, Marketing, Sales Operations, Order Management, Sales and Support Operations.
Engage and drive stakeholder management and transparent communications across Google for Work and its partners.
Lead, grow and inspire a team of highly motivated Program Managers.
Foster collaboration across Google for Work business, partners, product development and systems teams.
Drive operational execution of GfW Systems portfolio objectives across the GfW systems organization.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of program management experience in systems or product development environment.
Experience working in technical environment with an emphasis on continuous process improvement.
Experience working with senior business stakeholders and managing competing priorities.
Preferred qualifications
15 years of program management experience in systems or product development environment.
5 years of leadership experience, with the demonstrated ability to motivate and cultivate a results-oriented development team.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment across all levels of an organization.
Ability to lead cross-functional, international projects using a structured approach.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
title: Head of Systems Portfolio Management, Google for Work

text:
At Google, we aim to foster Googley work environments that are collaborative, friendly and fun. The Facilities Management team brings our spaces to life as you oversee the daily operations of our offices. While roles with similar names at other companies can be far more mundane, you're a creative, organized customer service specialist, who takes pride in seeing things run smoothly and efficiently. You go out of your way to make sure your clients are not only satisfied, but singing Google's praises. You're comfortable in a fast-paced environment with the highest standards of excellence. You aren't afraid to have fun with your job, and bring an enthusiasm, dedication and a collaborative spirit to build and maintain office spaces that facilitate some of the world's most cutting edge innovation.
As the Food Services Manager, you will be responsible for an outstanding service culture and operations of all Northern California (NorCal) Food program affiliated venues, experiences and activities in the region. You will be supporting the Regional Food Service team and collaborating on a partnership level with the vendor and supplier partners. You will also be responsible for maximizing experiences across food service operations that contribute to the high performance of Googlers.

In this role, you will monitor progress against program strategies/objectives, budget, headcount and project plan progress providing regular program updates to management on progress and issues. To enhance the end user experience and the impact and/or effectiveness of the Global Food Program, you will build strong relationships and partner with Googlers (employees) and partners (internal and external) at all levels. You will report to the NorCal Regional Food Services Manager.Responsibilities
Contribute to the development and subsequent roll out of a variety of food programs that include Cafes, Micro Kitchens, mobile programs and commissaries.
Support a consistent, efficient and effective delivery of operational food services in NorCal while maintaining the program’s IT Strategy, financial processes, vendor relationships and cost control/reduction mechanisms.
Collaborate in the development, implementation and ongoing refreshment of the Google food program’s high standards of service to the Google community through collaboration with the Vendor Partner training manager to implement Google Food training programs that align with the Google Food program’s service culture.
Gather relevant data to identify and evaluate potential risks within the food services operations while implementing process improvement strategies and ongoing compliance with the food program’s quality assurance program.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and share this knowledge and relevant material with all NorCal food service operations partners with an eye towards continuous improvement in all areas of operations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS in hotel management, nutrition, or related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in food service management or hospitality with emphasis on multiple site operations, contract and event management within a global organization.
Experience developing and managing budgets (including capital budget justification).
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree.
Strong financial, contract management and purchasing skills. Ability to analyze reports, metrics and trends.
Ability to be strategic and detail-oriented with strong analytical skills to evaluate and summarize data.
Ability to think, plan, and execute on multiple projects simultaneously with little direct supervision.
Excellent planning skills; including attention to detail, information organization, timeline tracking, and comprehensive communication and collaboration across many teams and at all organizational levels.
Multiple language skills.
title: Food Services Manager

text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
The Consumer Insight Analyst ensures that the voices of Google users are heard. You have detailed knowledge of our constantly evolving product suite to ensure that user feedback flows to the Product team and fuels innovation. You represent the voice of the user and design, and lead the user insight strategy for Google products like Chrome, Google+, Android and Maps. You will use your analytical skills and strategic perspective to recommend solutions that will help shape our products, improve user satisfaction and create more engagement with our products. You are motivated to solve problems through data, enjoy learning new statistical tools and have an affinity to turn complex data into valuable insights.Responsibilities
Represent the user voice by analyzing data on top user issues and feedback.
Implement and manage all appropriate user feedback channels to gain user insights to be shared with the Product team.
Design, develop and complete analyses for regular user insights and strategic deep dives.
Effectively prioritize and communicate user needs, make recommendations for product or process changes and influence various audiences.
Coordinate and collaborate with cross-functional partners as necessary.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
Experience with analytical and presentation tools including statistical software like R and SPSS.
Experience in SQL.
Experience in one qualitative and one quantitative research methodology.
Preferred qualifications
4 years of experience in a technology-related, analytical role including 2 years of experience with quantitative research methodologies in user research, support operations, consulting, etc.
Proven experience with survey design and analysis.
Ability to work effectively cross-functionally with proven track record of driving results.
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
title: Consumer Operations, Consumer Insight Analyst, Multiple Products

text:
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is what you get when you treat operations as if it’s a software problem. Our mission is to progress, protect, and provide for the software and systems behind all of Google’s public services - Search, Ads, Gmail, Android, YouTube, and AppEngine, to name just a few - with an ever-watchful eye on their availability, latency, performance, and capacity. This is an unusual job, unlike others in the industry. Like traditional operations groups, we keep important, revenue-critical systems up and running despite hurricanes, bandwidth outages, and configuration problems. Unlike traditional operations groups, we also have full access to and authority to fix, extend, and scale the code to keep it working and harden it against all the vagaries of the Internet. We hire people from both systems and software backgrounds. Strong candidates will have experience with both. Just as what we do is unique, where we do it is unique too. At Google, we have the good fortune to have developed many interesting systems ranging from planet-spanning databases to near real-time scalable data warehousing to fault-tolerant datastream joining. In SRE, we flip between the fine-grained detail of disk driver I/O scheduling to the big picture of continental-level service capacity, across a range of systems and a user population measured in billions. We own those products in production. We drive reliability and performance across massive scale by mastering the full depth of the stack. We literally do learn something new every day - usually surprising things - that have the potential to transform the lives of billions of our users around the world.
As a Staff Systems Engineer on the SRE team, you will work on large-scale system design and troubleshooting, and be fluent in systems programming and/or automation. You will have a desire to tackle the complex problems of scale which are unique to Google. Familiarity with running production environments at scale is crucial in this job along with an in-depth understanding of Unix systems internals, and networking.
Opening date: March 18th 2015
Closing date: April 16th 2015 
Competitive Salary Applies.
Responsibilities
Design, write and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Google's services.
Solve problems relating to mission critical services and build automation to prevent problem recurrence; with the goal of automating response to all non-exceptional service conditions.
Influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale distributed systems.
Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning.
Conduct periodic on call duties using a follow-the-sun model.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more of: C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Go, or scripting experience in Shell and Perl.
Experience working with Unix/Linux systems from kernel to shell and beyond, with experience working with system libraries, file systems, and client-server protocols.
Networking: experience with network theory e.g. TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, etc., MAC addresses, IP packets, DNS, OSI layers, and load balancing.
Preferred qualifications
Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
In-depth knowledge of operating systems (processes, threads, concurrency issues, locks, mutexes, semaphores, monitors and how they work).
Familiarity with algorithms, data structures and complexity analysis.
Systematic problem solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.
title: Staff Systems Engineer, Site Reliability Engineering
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Being a Channels Manager at Google means finding people in hard-to-reach places. Like finding needles in a haystack, our team of sourcers are responsible for discovering the most talented people in the world. As a Channels Manager on one of our functional staffing teams, you play the role of detective -- tapping into all kinds of tools and resources to uncover the best untapped talent out there. Once spotted, you engage with these passive candidates, learn about their aspirations and interests and help them connect with roles, projects and opportunities at Google. You are both scrappy and resourceful, are able to listen to what candidates have to say and then and connect them with the Google magic. As a manager, you support team members to exercise independent thinking and make rapid progress towards goals. Working closely with your team to deliver results, you remove roadblocks and ensure that projects and tasks are appropriately resourced.
As a Manager within the Channels organization, you will strategically partner with Staffing leadership to understand the nature and availability of Google’s Talent Pipelines. You will be responsible for directing the strategy and operations of a large and segmented sourcing team, and managing employees' day-to-day functions, anticipating personnel and resource issues, integrating with the business side of the company and ensuring project plans are adhered to.
You'll manage team/function metrics and performance and ensure the team's personal growth and career development. You'll also partner with recruiters and hiring managers to generate ideas, leverage resources and share information that facilitates a global sourcing strategy taking into account global trends inside and out of Google.Responsibilities

Oversee the management and development of a team of sourcers.
Design and implement highly effective, results-driven sourcing strategies, practices, and infrastructure for current and future, global hiring needs. Develop consultative business partnerships with Directors to maintain a strong finger on the pulse of business and sourcing activities.

text:
Google's legal department is at the center of an information law revolution, and you're at its core. As a Legal Assistant, you are a driving force behind the success of your Legal team, ready to roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, conduct legal research and coordinate communications across the team. As you closely support your team, you may find yourself working with multiple groups within the Legal Department, internal clients across Google, and external parties. You're an independent thinker who isn't afraid to ask questions, and you're organized in a way that never overlooks the details.
You will support our anti-corruption and supply chain social responsibility teams in particular and, when requested, support the overall program goals of ethics and compliance. You are self-motivated, positive and able to think programmatically. You are also passionate about how technology can improve how we do things. In carrying out your responsibilities, you will gain an in-depth knowledge of supply chain social responsibility and anti-bribery laws.Responsibilities
Support the Ethics and Compliance (E&C) team’s social responsibility program manager in conducting ethics risk assessments of Google suppliers, including supporting the audit process and assisting in ensuring that audit findings are properly addressed and closed.
Support E&C’s due diligence program manager in the execution of Google’s Third-Party Anti-Corruption Due Diligence Program. This includes researching, analyzing and remediating red flags raised during the due diligence process and liaising with Google employees hiring these third parties to discuss findings.
Assist in training Google employees on the company’s anti-corruption policy as well as Google’s supply chain social responsibility goals and processes.
Work with other legal assistants in tracking code of conduct questions and pre-approval requests that come to the Ethics and Compliance team, and deliver metrics.
Assist attorneys and program managers in developing documentation that communicates Ethics and Compliance programs to internal and external stakeholders.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of experience working in a related field such as consulting, law or ethics and compliance.
Experience in analyses and in working with spreadsheets.
Preferred qualifications
Ability to prioritize and manage numerous simultaneous projects under deadline pressure.
Flexibility and willingness to work on a broad range of legal matters.
Advanced spreadsheet skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills and highly team-oriented.
Excellent analytical skills, as well as exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

text:

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. You have a passion for the Venture Capital space and a keen interest in cloud computing. You will help VCs, Accelerators and their portfolios leverage the value of Google’s cloud and influence platform choices for the next generation of startups. Strong knowledge of Public Cloud, including Platform and Infrastructure as a service.

text:
Help the globe "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. On the Sales Operations team, you help fellow Sales Googlers by performing budgeting, planning, and analysis activities--and your passion for the magic of Google products like Apps and Chrome. Your razor-sharp insight means you excel at customer segmentation, acquisition and retention. You marry clean communication with strong analytical skills and a solid commitment to providing customers with a Googley customer experience. You also peer into the future for us; you examine and analyze statistical data to forecast marketing trends and to identify potential new markets for Google for Work. Help Google for Work grow and continue improving businesses the world over.
As a Strategic Initiatives Lead you will be part of one of Google’s fastest growing business units - Google for Work. Our mission is to push the boundaries of what businesses can do with Google’s help, surfacing, testing, and validating game-changing solutions for enterprise customers. This high visibility team works on strategic initiatives that includes new opportunity analyses, mergers and acquisitions diligences, and prototyping new products and testing them with customers.
You will be the point person for special projects and often be in situations requiring you to navigate ambiguity, structure the problem, conduct research and analysis and present your recommendations, while managing all stakeholders.
A strong aptitude to learn and get up to speed quickly will be important for success in this role. Familiarity with business SaaS industry and landscape.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization abilities with excellent attention to detail.

text:

The Partner Business Solutions (PBS) team works directly with large, sophisticated partners to develop and harness the value of their online content. Our partners represent publishing, entertainment and commerce companies as well as other emerging verticals. BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Experience at a management consulting firm or corporate strategy role
Impeccable business judgment, with professional distinction in thought leadership and innovation; experience regularly presenting to senior management
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills; proven ability working with large datasets and driving actionable insights
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate colleagues and collaborate effectively across different teams

text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
As a Software Engineer in Google Taipei, you will work on Chrome OS, Chromebooks, Chromecast, and future Google devices. Chrome OS is an open source, lightweight operating system designed for speed, simplicity and security. A Chromebook is a new, faster computer running Chrome OS as its operating system. With your technical expertise, you will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance new products and features.Responsibilities
Work on Chrome OS, Chromebooks, Chromecast, and future Google devices.
Participate in various projects including OS kernel, firmware, drivers, audio, video, graphics, factory software and related server-side software.
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and enhance new products and features.

BA/BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
MA/MS or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field.
Experience with Linux kernel and device drivers.
Experience with embedded systems, chipset bring-up, multimedia, or browser development.
Strong understanding of algorithms and data structures concepts.
Strong C/C++/Java/Python programming skills.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).

text:

BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience in implementing and customizing software and/or building customized applications.

text:
Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Networking Test Engineer you make sure that our massive and growing network is operating at its peak potential. You have hands-on experience with complex networking equipment, a deep understanding of networking protocols, test design and implementation chops and a background in IP network design. It's your job to make sure Google's cutting-edge technology can perform at scale.
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
As a Network Solutions Test Engineer, you will work with the other network engineers, test engineers, product managers, program managers in ensuring that our next generation Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) network and applications are delivering the best possible service to our customers.Responsibilities
Design, develop, and execute test plans for networking features, equipment, and system solutions.
Work with network architecture team to certify new platforms or solutions.
Work with development teams to verify network management system.
Work with other Google groups and external suppliers to ensure a consistent test approach and a culture of continuous improvement.
Sustain production network by reproducing issues and working with external suppliers on fixes.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related engineering field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of testing experience in networking area.
Experience with standard L2/L3 protocols such as IGP, LACP, STP, RSTP, VRRP, 802.1x, etc.
Experience in access networking protocols, 802.1ad, PIM/IGMP. Experience with networking systems including TCP/IP, Ethernet, IPv4 and IPv6.
Preferred qualifications
Network Automation experience in development framework, network platform, software testing and in scripting languages such as Python.
Experience or familiarity with testing and automation of IOS-XR or Junos based platforms.
Experience with end-to-end system testing.
Experience involving manual and automated testing using test platforms such as IXIA or Spirent.
Experience in Linux, C/C++ and scripting skills.
Knowledge of Service Provider Networks and Protocols such as BGP, ISIS, RSVP, LDP, MPLS, L3VPN, L2VPN etc.
title: Network Solutions Test Engineer, Google Fiber

Validate FEA models by experimentation, hands-on testing and tear down of failed products
Create and manage packaging material data base for modeling analysis

7 years of industry experience (including time working towards advanced degrees) in mechanical modeling for flip chip package technology.

Experience with mechanical and thermal properties on packaging materials including underfill, TIM, substrate and lid attach adhesive.
Experience in CPI (Chip Package Interaction) and thermo-mechanical modeling of large die flip chip BGA packaging technology, experience in applying Finite Element Modeling (FEM) for packaging design and material selection to meet packaging reliability requirements.

Preferred qualifications
PhD in Mechanical Engineering
Experience in mechanical analysis for systems including heat sink attach, IT system, rack, data center infrastructure
Ability for thermal modeling
Ability to work in a cross functional team environment.
Interview feedback tem

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Incubation Product Lead, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
Our mission is to push the boundaries of what businesses can do with Google’s help, surfacing, testing, and validating solutions for enterprise customers. This high visibility team operates as a collection of small fast-paced startups, prototyping the next products for Google. Our team includes Engineers, Technology Managers, and Business Analysts, working in pods to ideate, design, develop, and launch novel, business-generating products.
You will team with Engineers and customer-facing Googlers to scope, structure, and execute product pilots with a range of customers to demonstrate proof-of-concept, assess long-term scalability, and build a compelling business case for significant financial investment from Google. This will require you to think critically about solving immediate ground-level problems while staying abreast of industry trends and tangential product roadmaps to evolve your successful pilot into full-scale launch plans.
Your scope will include all aspects of system design, prototype development, testing, documentation, training, implementation, reporting, and initial support and maintenance. Along the way, you’ll also work with Legal, Marketing, Partnerships, Sales, and product groups to plan at scale while executing in pilot.
Day-to-day, you will be rolling up your sleeves to dig into technical problems, collaborating with Engineers on product trade-offs, driving a weekly cadence of user-testing and feature releases, keeping internal stakeholders informed of progress, and presenting results to senior leaders at pivotal milestones. Navigating ambiguity, anticipating points of friction, and managing political complexity should all come naturally to you.
Your personal motto is some version of “think big, start small, scale fast.” You are an entrepreneur at heart, well-versed in a broad range of technologies, and excited to join a fast-paced group. You naturally gravitate towards action and would thrive on wearing multiple hats to shape the future of Google for Work Incubation product successes. You are equal parts political savvy and analytical, and are viewed by peers as a thought leader, influencer and relationship-builder.
Responsibilities
Translate business objectives into technical requirements to enable rapid prototyping, agile iteration, and visibility into meaningful near-term metrics.
Stay close to end users for earliest detection of success signals or necessary shifts in prioritization. Build, maintain and evolve strong relationships across Google, galvanizing cross-functional teams to achieve customer delight.
Evaluate third-party tools, data, and platforms for potential go-to-market partnerships. Manage multiple pilots, synthesize learnings, craft data into compelling presentations, and oversee the graduation of the prototypes to production.
Surface near-term Google for Work business growth opportunities as they arise, and contribute to ideation of future Incubation team products.
Coach and support teammates and be a cross-functional team-player. Add good humor to a stellar team culture.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of program management experience managing large scale technical efforts.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or equivalent.
Professional experience in product management, Business Development, Sales Engineering, or other related role in a technology-related field. Familiarity with Google for Work business and products.
Track record as a successful entrepreneur, or launching a new product within an established tech company.
Proven track record of leveraging your business acumen to strategically assess and help solve client needs
Strong analytical, problem-solving, organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization abilities with excellent attention to detail. Self-motivated and comfortable operating in a rapidly changing work environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a focus on translating technically complex issues into simple, easy to understand language for a broader audience.
title: Incubation Product Lead, Google for Work

text:
Applications are due by June 22, 2015 at 11:59pm PST. Our team will review applications on a rolling basis and it's in the candidates best interest to apply early. All hiring will be completed by August 2015. Thank you for your patience while we consider your application"
Software Engineers at Google are researchers and developers who yearn to create and implement complex computer science solutions. Our engineers develop massively scalable, distributed software systems and also collaborate on multitudes of smaller projects that have universal appeal - which requires research, awareness, interactivity, and asking questions. You build strong competencies in data structures and algorithms, along with a technical fascination for how stuff fits together. You need to have a solid foundation in computer science in order to consistently come up with new ideas as well as strive for a deep understanding of our products and services in order to continually improve upon them. We focus on being a collaborative, global organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skills and a keen eye for quality.As a Software Engineer, you will work on our core products and services as well as those who support critical functions of our engineering operations. Depending on your background and experience, you will be working in one of the following areas:

Product and Systems Development
Whether it's finding new and innovative ways to advance search quality, building computing platform and networking technologies, automating the indexing of videos, or continuing to refine and scale complex auction systems (just to name a few), you will be developing solutions to some of the most challenging technical problems out there. You will research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offerings and collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information. Examples of specialist domains: UI development with AJAX and similar technologies, security, embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers).

Engineering Productivity
As a software engineer in the Engineering Productivity organization, you'll use your software design, analysis and programming skills to create innovative automated testsystems. This isn't a job in which you'll simply debug and run test cases, in fact that only scratches the surface. The test team undertakes a broad range of challenges on a daily basis, designing and building intelligent systems that can explore various use cases and scenarios for distributed computing infrastructure. Just imagine trying to design and build an automated testing system for something that's never been done before. There are no text books that can help you learn this, which is why we have some of the best and brightest engineers working in this group.

Site Reliability
Software engineers working in Site Reliability are involved in every facet of Google's production and work on the cutting edge of cloud-based computing. As a member of this elite team you are in the thick of everything involved with keeping Google running, from code-level troubleshooting of traffic anomalies to maintenance of our most cutting edge services; from monitoring and alerts to building new automation infrastructure. Software engineers on this team love to create robust and scalable software that scale to tens of millions of users. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day, and work with just about every other engineering and operations team to provide services and applications that are quintessentially Google - fast, reliable and accessible to all.
Responsibilities
Perform specific responsibilities which vary by project area.
Minimum qualifications
Currently pursuing a BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
Preferred qualifications
Currently pursuing a MS degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship
Experience in systems software or algorithms
Knowledge of Unix/Linux or Windows environment, and APIs.
Familiarity with TCP/IP and network programming.
Excellent implementation skills (C++, Java, Python)
title: Software Engineering Intern, Fall 2015

text:

It’s where we spend so much of our time so technology should get out of the way so ideas have space to grow and inspiration is free to strike at any moment.
