Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Small businesses are diverse! We have innovated in scaling programs reaching out proactively to small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), and the UMM (Upper Mass Market) team is one such program within the SMB Revenue Programs organization. We have an exciting opportunity to engage 1:1 with a new segment of customers who will power the next level of business growth in SMB. If you are passionate about sales, growing the business, leadership and building teams, this is the right role for you!

In this role, you will be responsible for growing and guiding a high performance sales team, made up primarily of vendor partners, that will engage with existing Mass Market SMB customers in Japan. You leverage your entrepreneurial drive to coach and mentor third-party sales teams to target, educate and persuade customers to embrace Google's latest advertising products and technologies. You will set standards to provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You will build a sales team capable to identify business goals of clients, understand the details of existing campaigns and help clients with the relevant opportunities to meet their needs.Responsibilities
Ensure that the sales team is successful; build and mentor a highly efficient AdWords Sales team.
Keep up-to-date on AdWords product knowledge and provide product coaching and training to ensure that sales representatives have the Google product and internal tools/process knowledge needed to be successful.
Partner with the vendor management team to develop coaching initiatives for sales representative improvement, regularly reviewing and evaluating the service quality of sales representatives against quality and compliance guidelines; ensure that sales representatives provide awesome customer service while meeting their daily business targets.
Track and perform analysis of key success metrics so as to identify opportunities to improve the team’s performance; handle customer escalations and ensure that they are appropriately addressed; project manage the quarterly business cycle along with other key stakeholders from the UMM Revenue team.
Be an on-site Google point of contact to answer regular product, workflow and sales strategy questions from the team, and develop strategies to address them at scale. Participate in cross-functional projects with the wider SMB Solution team to develop and implement our solution business strategy for the SMB business.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with AdWords, campaign building and optimization, as well as Google tools and policies.
Ability to speak and write English and Japanese fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of sales/sales enablement experience.
Demonstrated experience mentoring and coaching others to be successful.
Ability to manage vendors properly (understand skill levels, different cultures and incentives, and bring the best out of them for optimal outcome).
Ability to work independently.
Ability to build strong relationships and communicate effectively.
title: SMB Sales Coach

text:
This position is based in Alameda, CA.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, Street View to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users.
Google[x] is the moonshot factory within Google. Google[x] is the place where uncomfortably ambitious, world-changing new ideas such as such as self-driving cars, Internet from balloons and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. Google[x] projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a better place.
The Makani project, which resides within Google[x], is developing an energy kite that generates more energy at lower cost than conventional wind systems. Makani’s kite uses less material and accesses more consistent wind at higher altitudes.
Makani is looking for individuals with proven success to support our growing field operations activity. As a Makani Field Operations Associate, you will work on complex, multi-disciplinary projects in support of Makani’s product development. You will be expected to split your time between Mountain View, Alameda and your relevant project sites, which may be located domestically and/or abroad. The Field Operations Associate will report to Makani’s Field Operations Manager.Responsibilities
Identify and coordinate the delivery of project site support infrastructure and logistics.
Manage on-site personnel at multiple project sites simultaneously.
Assist with project site construction management.
Conduct directed research and analysis to support near-term operational decision making and the development of an operations and maintenance strategy.
Collaborate with Makani Engineering and Operations to scope and define project requirements and work with Google’s cross-functional teams (e.g. Transportation, Security, Real Estate Workplace Services, Marketing) to successfully deploy Makani projects in a controlled and timely manner.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree (STEM discipline) or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of project management experience or equivalent practical experience in operations or logistics.
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree in Operations, Logistics or MBA.
Experience bringing a new technology to market or experience in the energy sector, working with developers or utilities.
Proven ability to perform a variety of complicated tasks with the ability to adapt and excel in a constantly evolving environment.
Detail oriented, versatile and innovative.
Team player with a positive attitude.
Demonstrated strong analytical, oral and written communication skills.
title: Field Operations Associate (Makani), Special Projects

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
The Channel Partnerships team focuses on building and managing long-term relationships with partners that scale the sales and management of Google’s advertising products to the long-tail of Small- to Medium-sized Business (SMB) advertisers. We are focused on empowering the millions of SMBs with Google AdWords and other advertising solutions. Members of this team work cross-functionally across Google’s organization, gain broad exposure to a range of Google products, and will interact daily with leading partners from large media companies to venture backed start-ups across across Southeast Asia (Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Vietnam, Indonesia, Philippines, etc.).
As a Strategic Partner Manager, you'll be responsible for managing relationships with a portfolio of our leading channel partners. The role requires high levels of entrepreneurial and strategic thinking as you help our partners define their strategic direction in the digital marketplace now and going forward. You’ll work with our partners to help them build their capabilities and work with them to develop the capacity to manage advertiser relationships over the long-term. You will have demonstrated strong performance in a commercial partnership/business development role, and can work in a rapidly changing industry, tolerate ambiguity, and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight.Responsibilities
Identify potential partners to achieve Google’s objectives in the SMB market and build a pipeline of opportunities based on existing/new contacts.
Structure proposals including partners benefits, targets, requirements, incentive structure, legal and operational implications.
Ensure partners are fulfilling their contractual obligations and that Google is providing the required support for them to do so.
Lead implementation of various initiatives cross-functionally (marketing, sales engineering, account management, training) to identify roadblocks and provide strategic recommendations for partners.
Communicate effectively with Vietnamese-speaking clients.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
5 years of work experience, including commercial partner management, business development or strategic consulting experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Industry experience working directly with traditional media companies or SMBs.
High degree of enthusiasm for commercial management, data analysis and technology.
Ability to speak and write in Vietnamese fluently and idiomatically.
Excellent communication skills in English.
title: Strategic Partner Manager, (Vietnam Market) Channel Sales

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
Googlers around the world rely on the stability and security of our Corporate Platforms in order to get their jobs done. As a Technical Program Manager within the group responsible for Google’s internal operating systems, you will be part of a global leadership team that creates tomorrow’s technology solutions today and puts those solutions in the hands of Google employees around the globe. You bring a passion for pushing the edge of technology and use that passion to facilitate large-scale enterprise adoption of cloud-based computing and mobile technologies. You have a solid technical foundation and the flexibility, talent and aptitude to learn new technologies and to lead a variety of projects and teams across the organization.
You will focus on Client Platform Hardware as a part of the team that determines what hardware we deploy to Googlers for corporate use. This includes notebooks, desktops, servers and mobile devices. You channel your passion for technology and keep up with the fast paced world of consumer electronics, working with our various vendor teams (both internal and external to Google) in order to select hardware that delights every Googler that uses it.
Responsibilities
Conduct ongoing research and produce hardware reviews of various hardware types (notebooks, desktops, servers and mobile devices).
Work with partners (both internal and external) to conduct performance and usability testing of various hardware devices.
Monitor quality of existing deployed hardware, triage and assign issues. Coordinate fixes across multiple teams.
Communicate schedules, priorities and status to all levels in the company.
Play a key role in the advancement of technology used within Google.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in consumer hardware.
Preferred qualifications
A degree in Computer Science.
3 years of relevant work experience with 2 years of specific industry experience.
Experience with multiple operating systems (Unix/Linux, Mac OS X, Chrome OS and Android).
Exceptional skills influencing, teaming and delivering solutions in a highly complex, always changing and nebulous environment.
Outstanding organizational, prioritization and multitasking skills.
Excellent oral/written communication, interpersonal and analytical skills with a strong passion for all things technical.
title: Technical Program Manager, Client Platform Hardware, Corporate Platforms

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
We’re looking for an analytical storyteller -- Someone who looks at data and sees meaning. As a Marketing Analyst on the Google+ Brand Marketing team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of social at Google. 

The Google+ Brand Team is a group of people passionate about creating a world class social media presence at Google. You will be an integral part of this team. You’ll be in charge of creating a strategy for analyzing and reporting on the progress of the marketing efforts. You’ll be asked to answer ‘so what does this mean to me?’ on a daily basis. You’ll lead the charge in new ways to test our effectiveness, and as a result shape the way we market.Responsibilities
Create processes for measuring ongoing brand equity using brand awareness and product traffic as Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Help construct brand campaign goals, track performance and report results.
Work cross-functionally with engineering to understand user growth and engagement metrics.
Evaluate effectiveness of brand initiatives in driving desired results; make recommendations to improve tactics as necessary.
Become a data mining expert that team members turn to for support on conversion tracking and setting up campaigns for measurement success.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in marketing analytics and brand metrics for multiple brands and/or clients.
Preferred qualifications
Experience directly managing the definition, build and deployment of analytical functions in a marketing campaign.
Experience using guidelines, structure and metrics to improve the creative process.
Experience working outside of technology.
Familiarity with Google Analytics, Google Consumer Surveys, product analytics dashboards and/or other brand tracking tools.
title: Marketing Analytics Storyteller, Social

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. You lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. As a Program Manager for the User Research team, you'll combine expert project management skills with a passion for user experience research to help your team improve the designs of products that are used by billions of users. You’ll work cross-functionally and collaborate with managers, designers, user researchers, research assistants and engineering teams to plan research projects, define milestones, assign resources, assess risks and help projects meet deadlines. You will also manage all project-related communications to team members, executives and other stakeholders. You are a user research expert, a master planner and a flexible project manager who can balance multiple projects that sometimes span continents.Responsibilities
Understand strategic priorities and work with Researchers, Product Managers, Engineers and Designers to make the most impact possible under tight schedules.
Identify team needs with regards to research tools and processes. Implement or drive required changes to make sure team members are working at optimum efficiency.
Coordinate and lead the work of a team of junior research assistants.
Provide clear communication to cross-functional team leads and senior management regarding project status, resource requirements, issues, and priorities.
Identify risks proactively, prioritize them and create plans to resolve in a timely manner.

BA/BS degree in a user experience related field or equivalent practical experience.

MA degree in a user experience related field.

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
As a member of the Demand Management team, you will engage with reps and senior executives on our Sales, Marketing and Operations teams to design and execute experiments, initiatives and insights programs that will drive changes to Product, Marketing and Sales processes. You will use your project management skills and innovative thought processes to find solutions that will help improve evolving inbound workflows. You will also be expected to contribute to the long-term operational strategy model, and continuous improvements of business processes. A key part of your role will be managing the relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
You will work closely with our vendor manager and partners to build the scale and flexibility our business needs to take it to the next stage of growth. Highly creative and detail focused, you are the kind of person who never stands still, rolls their sleeves up, loves the challenge of running multiple concurrent workstreams, and is driven by a passion for setting and exceeding challenging targets.Responsibilities
Collaborate with Google for Work Sales and Marketing team to plan and execute Inbound demand generation campaigns and initiatives for the EMEA market either through own efforts or via a vendor partner.
Manage and lead projects across multiple stakeholders, and educate stakeholders on style and guidelines for projects.
Develop senior-level relationships (Director, VP level), to serve as a trusted consultant with major stakeholders, to define strategies to manage and increase the supply.
Present management with clear insights and recommendations into drivers of business growth, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), market trends, risks, and opportunities leading to identification of new business opportunities and business growth-enhancing sales actions.
Collaborate with vendor manager to deliver against core metrics (lead conversion, pipeline); define, evaluate, and continually improve Inbound management processes.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in marketing, project management or in a consulting firm.

Experience in market researching modeling; ability to plan, execute and manage marketing campaigns.
Highly analytical, with a track record of being a strong problem solver, capable of translating analysis and insights into actionable business plans.
Passion to drive collaboration and deliver high-quality highly-complex projects across teams.

text:
As a Merchandising Manager in EMEA, you will help build and maintain Google Play's merchandising program on handsets, web and tablets. Based on your digital content retail experience, you will coordinate and launch effective online features and promotions. You bring to the table strong retail instincts, sharp analytical abilities, and impeccable oral and written communication skills. You are comfortable working cross-functionally with product, design, marketing, engineering, and other teams to develop an innovative user experience. It’s important that you be able to work both independently and collaboratively to develop new content features and scalable merchandising processes. You’ll also have a track record for successful prioritization, meeting critical deadlines, and enthusiastically tackling challenges with an eye toward problem solving.
As Head of Merchandising Games for Google Play in Europe, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA), you will direct regional merchandising efforts for our Games vertical. You will drive overall merchandising strategy (inventory management, user acquisition and retention, promotions, etc.), manage a regional team of merchandisers, set benchmarks for success, analyze performance metrics and advocate for new platform level merchandising capabilities. 

Your role will impact users by directing regional merchandising efforts for the Games vertical. You will be responsible for leading a team of Merchandising Managers, develop the overall merchandising strategy and deliver against performance metrics. 

You will work across multiple countries and functions (Business Development, Marketing, PR, Merchandising, etc.) and be a leader within the broader Games vertical team. You bring extensive strategic experience and strong merchandising/analytical marketing experience, a fanatical devotion to user experience, and superb organization, communication, and team management skills as well as a track record of beating traffic, conversion and business goals and a strong understanding of the EMEA games ecosystem.
Responsibilities
Partner with other regional Games leads from other regions to understand trends and best practices and jointly develop the global Apps merchandising strategy.
Develop deep insights for the Apps vertical, understanding the user segments and lifecycle, ecosystem challenges, competitive landscape and partner needs.
Champion merchandising vision and goals to both internal and external partners.
Analyze internal data, market research and industry trends to select products to promote.
Drive regional strategy for promotions, user segmentation and content partner co-promotion opportunities.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in a merchandising/analytical marketing leadership role for an online commerce, retail or content business.
Experience with online merchandising.
Preferred qualifications
Proven ability to develop detailed knowledge of a business area/vertical and drive strategic and operational change across multiple markets, delivering against business targets.
Proven strategic capability.
Strong analytical skills, with an ability to analyze research or performance data and apply that analysis to optimize merchandising strategy.
Proven ability to work with Product/Engineering teams to scope new requirements and deliver them for a user-facing commercial organization.
Strong leadership and people management skills, with ability to both nurture creative and drive operational process and discipline.
Ability to advise on strategies and product requirements to enhance platform-level merchandising capabilities.
title: Head of Merchandising Games, Google Play
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:

You are an experienced outbound manager who has strong people management and business operations skills as well as a proven track record in strategic thinking and senior stakeholder management. 3 years of direct people management experience.

Experience leading teams with a strong focus on coaching and mentoring. Demonstrated success developing sales teams and meeting goals.
Strong track record of relationship building and influencing skills with senior stakeholders.
Excellent business sense, problem solving, project management, analytical and reporting skills.
Strong leadership, organizational, communication, interpersonal and teamwork skills.

Google has one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. Your team is responsible for providing the total quality program to deliver state-of-the-art data center infrastructure.
As a Data Center Lifecycle Program Manager, your main objective will be to create a world-class efficiency program and assure that standards are met throughout the data center lifecycle, including but not limited to construction, commissioning and operability. You will be expected to measure quality control success in terms of performance, reliability, safety and information traceability. Your goals will be to increase productivity, decrease product cost and improve product reliability. Your role will act as a Total Quality Manager (TQM) and include making sure that manufacturing or production processes meet international and national standards and will look at ways to reduce waste and increase efficiency. When vendors build parts for our infrastructure, you're right there alongside ensuring manufacturing processes are repeatable and controlled.
You collaborate with Design Engineers, Construction and Operations to determine Google's infrastructure needs and product specifications. Your work ensures the various pieces of Google's infrastructure fit together perfectly and keep our systems humming along smoothly for a seamless experience. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google data center teams to work within international regulations. You are a strategic leader who possesses the ability to work with several internal stakeholders through effective relationship building, influence and communication. You demonstrate analytical thinking through data-driven decisions. You have the technical know-how, charisma and ability to work with your team to make a big impact. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and a strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical and program acumen to manage.Responsibilities
Provide modeling services for data center components and as requested by other project teams. Provide key process characterization capability and feasibility analysis for new suppliers and technologies.
Define the charter of the team and ensure appropriate links with other organizations.
Build a global and leveraged footprint to effectively manage technical requirements and production integrity for all major suppliers. Develop and deploy defective product verification and Return Materials Authorization (RMA) strategies.
Drive closed-loop corrective/preventative actions through the supply base as required.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of work experience in a related field managing and working with third-party vendors.
Experience in risk/issue analysis.
Product and functional management experience in operations and engineering.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in engineering or related technical field.
Industry experience in construction and data center equipment OEMs.
Proven track record of leading projects in a technology-intensive industry.
Demonstrated top quartile performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
title: Data Center Lifecycle Program Manager

text:
Google's Publisher & Distribution Solutions (PDS) team makes sure that our external partners are able to grow their businesses using Google's products. Technical Account Managers are advertising and technology experts who serve as liaisons between our biggest partners and Google's Engineering and Sales teams. They not only serve as Google gurus but also identify new opportunities where our products can better help our partners' businesses. Our suite of products is growing and PDS Technical Account Managers help us understand exactly what our partners need.
Our relationships with external partners should run smoothly, and Google's PDS team, within gTech, makes that happen. PDS's Technical Account Managers are online advertising and technology consultants and liaisons between our partners and Google's Engineering, Product and Sales teams. You expertly lead implementations and integrations for a variety of our product lines. We also provide support to our publisher partners, from deployment to ongoing support of daily business.

As the technical expert, you work closely with the partner Sales teams to monitor our products' performance for our top clients, develop tools that address their technological and business needs and identify opportunities that scale and grow Google's partner business. You are a specialist in Video Advertising, with technical knowledge and operational experience in one or more of Video on Demand (VoD), Dynamic Ad Insertion (DAI) or Live Streaming. You will be involved in the consultancy and support of publishers using DoubleClick Video AdServing and Yield Management products: DoubleClick for Publishers (DFP) Video and Ad Exchange Video, along with Live Streaming/DAI technology from mDialog.Responsibilities
Help partners in their day-to-day challenges by delivering innovative and scalable solutions to their problems and troubleshooting their issues.
Perform implementation reviews, advocate new product features and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
Assist clients in the adoption of new products via upgrades and migrations to develop their long term success.
Identify, drive, and optimize the business growth from partners and ad-networks by leveraging Google, DoubleClick and mDialog technologies.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Experience in video advertising, ingestion, VoD, DAI or Live Streaming.
Excellent coding skill in C, C++ or Java.
Good scripting language knowledge such as Bash, Python, PHP.
Strong troubleshooting skills in common web technologies, such as XML, HTML and HTML5, JavaScript, Flash.
Strong team player and a creative thinker; ability to work well in a cross-functional team environment.
Excellent communication skills.
title: Video Technical Account Manager, Publisher and Distribution Solutions

Google's Publisher & Distribution Solutions (PDS) team makes sure that our external partners are able to grow their businesses using Google's products. Technical Account Managers are advertising and technology experts who serve as liaisons between our biggest partners and Google's Engineering and Sales teams. They not only serve as Google gurus but also identify new opportunities where our products can better help our partners' businesses. Our suite of products is growing and PDS Technical Account Managers help us understand exactly what our partners need.
Our relationships with external partners should run like well-oiled machines, and Google's PDS team within the Google Technical Services team (gTech) makes that happen. You participate in negotiations and you lead implementations and integrations for a variety of our product lines. We also provide support to our publisher partners, from deployment to ongoing support of daily business.
As the technical expert, you work closely with the partner Sales teams to monitor our products' performance for our clients, develop tools that address their technological and business needs and identify opportunities that scale and grow Google's partner business. The suite of Google Products where our expertise is engaged include DoubleClick Ad Serving Technologies including DoubleClick For Publishers (DFP) and Yield Optimization, AdSense, AdMob and Web Search Syndication, and distribution of Google Services such as Chrome.
Responsibilities
Identify, drive, and optimize the business flow from partners and ad-networks by leveraging Google technologies.
Help partners in their day-to-day challenges by delivering innovative and scalable solutions to their problems and troubleshooting their issues. Perform implementation reviews, advocate new product features and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
Assist clients in the adoption of new products via upgrades and migrations to develop their long term success, and improve product offerings by providing client feedback on features to Product Management and Engineering.
Guarantee the technical aspects of client integrations (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance.
Analyze and optimize the development of existing clients to ensure their success with the Google suite of products for partners.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Good scripting language knowledge such as Bash, Python, PHP.
Ability to work well in a cross-functional team environment.
Strong troubleshooting skills in common web technologies, such as XML, HTML, HTML5, JavaScript and Flash.
Excellent project management skills and attention to detail as well as experience working with external clients in a sales environment.
Data analysis and good data-driven decision-making skills.
title: Technical Account Manager, Publisher and Distribution Solutions

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
Come join a fast-paced, results-driven team taking creative approaches to manufacture cutting-edge new hardware products, in a collaborative hands-on environment that provides every tool and resource you need to get things done at large scale. Tight tolerances, unusual materials and design constraints, and the interactions of multiple disciplines keep your days varied, interesting, and challenging.
Google's custom-designed equipment makes up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Manufacturing Operations team is responsible for providing the manufacturing capability to deliver this state-of-the-art physical infrastructure. As a Hardware Automation Engineer, you evaluate the product designs and create the processes, tools and procedures behind Google's powerful search technology. When vendors build parts for our infrastructure, you're right there alongside ensuring manufacturing processes are repeatable and controlled. You collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design Engineers to determine Google's infrastructure needs and product specifications. Your work ensures the various pieces of Google's infrastructure fit together perfectly and keep our systems humming along smoothly for a seamless user experience.Responsibilities
Develop and implement high precision factory and manufacturing automation processes in a high volume and fast-paced environment.
Architect, design, and develop a wide variety of automated/mechatronic systems (hardware and software) for MFG/lab environments.
Evaluate existing factory processes and identify opportunities for savings and improvement through the use of automation technology. Provide justification to move forward with project ideas and establish validation procedures to determine acceptance of factory automation solutions into development builds as well as mass production.
Manage detailed requirements definition, review and approve system designs and oversee implementation and partner with Design teams to identify applications for newly emerging automation technologies on upcoming products. Identify and manage suppliers and contractors for system design and integration.
Assess feasibility of a manufacturing technology for a given part design. Plan validation exercises to demonstrate initial feasibility as well as manufacturing capability.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or similar field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience leading new product launches and new process development within manufacturing operations.
Experience with industrial automation components and suppliers (conveyors, stages, robots, pneumatics, cameras, lighting, etc.).
Preferred qualifications
Engineering management experience.
Experience working with manufacturing software systems (MES, SPC, etc.).
Experience doing engineering in high-volume manufacturing environments.
Experience with cameras, imaging, and machine vision.
Understanding of manufacturing statistics and experimental design.
Excellent communicator and team player. Willing to help and ask for help.
title: Hardware Automation Engineer (Manufacturing), Google Glass

text:
At Google, we know building trust with users comes hand-in-hand with the dependable quality and reliability of our products. The Advertising Technology team helps ensure that our advertising products work effectively for our customers. When a Sales team colleague escalates an issue relating to a product such as AdWords or AdSense, we dig in, using our technical expertise to find the solution. You use your strong computer science background to answer technical questions from colleagues, partners and clients regarding ad specifications and technology. Your communication and sales skills come in handy when you break down complex product features and present them in an easy-to-understand manner. With an array of internal tools at your disposal, you troubleshoot ad functionality and display issues, working on higher-level projects to improve the team's operations. All of your efforts go toward ensuring that our ad products are working and our customers optimize them to deliver desired results.
The Global Support team within gTech Ads plays a critical role in Google's success. It provides high quality support to our Sales teams consisting of resolving issues in across Google Ads products (technical, billing, policy, implementation, etc.) and supporting real-time interaction channels (e.g. Google Video Conferencing) with customers. The Global Support team offers 24x5 service and it achieves this through globally consistent, scalable processes and through troubleshooting innovation (e.g. automated solutions and proactive/preemptive support).

As the Global Support Manager, you will oversee a team providing outstanding support to Sales teams and advertisers across Greater China. You will also be expected to ‘move the needle’ on core operations. This will involve developing efficient workflows, identifying opportunities for seamless support between teams, and designing new services that will provide faster and better support to Sales teams and advertisers. You have a passion for delivering excellent customer service and a drive for continuous improvement. You also have exceptional leadership, influencing and change management skills. You are ready to work side-by-side with your team, motivate and mentor managers and team members, and drive alignment across different functions and regions.
Responsibilities
Lead a team of support specialists. Grow and develop talent while providing vision and setting direction for the team.
Provide strategic insights and lead continuous improvement efforts in customer service and operations.
Drive business results by tracking key operational metrics, identifying process improvement opportunities and delivering flawlessly on strategic projects.
Partner with Sales, Sales Operations, other gTech Ads teams and partners on initiatives to improve business and advertiser support.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of experience building teams, hiring and developing people.
Strategy and/or operations consulting experience at a management consulting firm or a corporate strategy organization.
Proven ability to partner closely with senior cross-functional stakeholders and influence successfully across organizational boundaries with strong customer mindset.
Strong business judgment with ability to problem-solve complex business issues in a fast-paced, evolving team environment.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage across multiple, often time-sensitive initiatives, delivering flawless results.
Exceptional leadership, analytical, written/verbal communication, and interpersonal skills.
title: gTech Ads Global Support Manager

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have experienced, charismatic leaders who guide our client sales teams to success. As a Country Client Lead, you will lead and coach a strategic account team that uses consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions. You also work with the Sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. You will help teams deliver on ambitious targets and partner directly with clients to exceed business and merchant growth goals. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.Responsibilities
Manage the core Sales team and engage with cross-functional talent to deliver insights, ideas and customer service that drives business growth for our clients and for Google.
Develop and foster C-Level and senior management relationships with the client and its agencies.
Analyze data trends and client performance, develop solid strategic plans, and lead preparation and delivery of strategic presentations and narratives.
Attract, develop and retain the very best talent in all roles across the team.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience with sales management in consumer goods and/or advertising/Internet.
Management experience.
Ability to speak English and Bahasa Indonesian fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MBA.
6 years of experience in the digital industry, in marketing, brand management or advertising sales.
3 years of sales management experience.
Strong knowledge traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
title: Country Client Lead, Indonesia, Global Client and Agency Solutions Organization (GCAS)
locations: Jakarta, Special Capital Region of Jakarta, Republic of Indonesia

text:
Google's products are known for their clean design, ensuring users can quickly and easily find what they're looking for. As an Engineering Designer, you leverage your strong technical background and understanding of "good" design to look for ways to streamline the user experience. You work closely with the product managers and development engineers throughout the entire production cycle. You design everything from high-level product flow to detailed UI mockups and then use your expert scripting skills to make your designs a reality.
As a Human Factors Designer, you're a strong user advocate who contributes to the success of Google's wearable products through Human Factors research and design. You will provide expertise and lead the research projects to yield solid design insights. You will participate in the Industrial Design portfolio development and product definition to ensure that our products strike the right balance between user experience, profitability and innovation. You must think both strategically and tactically to support both long-term and short-term objectives.

You are part of a team that’s responsible for creating, expressing and executing iconic, consumer focused experiences throughout the entire product journey.Responsibilities
Drive human factors design research from concepts through project execution on multiple aspects of the user experience, particularly of wearables.
Work closely with Industrial Designers, Hardware Engineers, Marketing, User Experience Research and Product Leadership throughout the stages of the product development.
Draw from the field of human factors to inform design direction. Conduct research in human factors and related fields such as anthropometry, ergonomics, biomechanics, etc.
Contribute new user-research approaches that complement human factors such as contextual and qualitative research.
Work with researchers to oversee user studies as they collect and analyze user behavior through server logs, online experiments, benchmark studies, lab studies, surveys, ethnographic research and other relevant methods.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in industrial design or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in the field of wearable devices.

Preferred qualifications
Master's degree in Human-Factors, Ergonomics, Industrial Engineering or related field.
15 years of experience as a user-experience professional or human factors engineer, including experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices.
Experience with communication devices.
Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of different
research methods, including when and how to apply them during each
product phase.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.
title: Human Factors Designer

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
At Google, we organize and change around our users and customers. Google's advertising sales team embodies that pursuit. We're devoted to finding relevant solutions that meet our clients' changing advertising needs. We focus on how Google technology can enable the world's biggest advertisers to enjoy immediate and accountable communication with the consumer. Advertising sales team members strive to identify our clients' business challenges, to collaboratively shape solutions that drive their strategic initiatives, and to keep them educated and informed in the ways that current and future Google products can enhance their online and/or offline presence. Working with creative, media, strategic planning, digital and search agencies, our agency sales team promotes the benefits of search marketing and explains how our products can enhance customers' campaign strategies.
Responsibilities

Discover agency needs by researching, listening, asking questions and analyzing campaigns within and across industry verticals serviced by an agency.
Transfer agency knowledge (including correct terminology) to the sales and support teams.
Establish, verify and maintain clear, realistic expectations with key agency contacts and Google partners.
Enable sales efficiency and effectiveness by gaining access to key decision makers within specific agencies.
Focus on increasing agency sales long-term.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Established network of contacts and considerable sales experience within the media and agency space.
Extensive experience in integrated marketing communication sales or media sales
Strong ability to mentor account managers in an effort to drive their performance.
Strong presentation, analytical and problem solving skills.
A team player with strong leadership and communication skills.
Fluency in German.
title: Agency Sales Manager, Performance

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
The Fiber Enterprise Solutions team in Google Fiber will focus on providing secure, sustainable and reliable applications and analytics to help scale Fiber business operations, which is undergoing a rapid expansion and investment phase as it goes from the initial Kansas City to many more cities throughout the country. Initial efforts include integral management of disparate data sources and software tools and systems for the business to improve workflow and productivity, automation for planning and scheduling functions, and intelligent use of data for deriving insights and making better decisions in areas like scheduling, prediction and process improvement.

You will be part of a focused development team with a goal to build enterprise tools and applications to empower our internal and operational business users with tools and actionable analytics. You are expected to work with cross-functional teams, and are able to execute well in a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous environment. You will apply and invent technologies to enable scaling and faster pace of execution for the business, and be able to build a strong engineering and analytics team.Responsibilities
Build and lead/manage the development team. Cultivate innovation and strive for continuous improvement and gains.
Own development, delivery and support of apps and tools that are under scope.
Lead designs of major software components and systems. Work closely with technical leads in the larger Fiber Engineering organization to collaborate and develop technical and solution architectures.
Interface with cross-functional stakeholders to define and iterate on software requirements. Partner with Program Management and Process Management functions to build internal tools and operational systems that are in-line with evolving business dynamics.
Work with other parts of Google to take advantage of existing solutions, technologies, resources when applicable.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of relevant experience with software development as well as a record of individual technical achievement (C++, Java, SQL).
4 years of experience with managing/leading software teams.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent.
Experience with Integration Frameworks, Service Oriented Architectures, BPM, workflow, ticketing tools with large-volume transactions and messaging.
Firsthand experience building and delivering complex enterprise software solutions and line-of-business apps for one or more industries using modern technologies and methodologies.
Experience with building and customizing complex packaged applications (ERP, CRM, Supply Chain, etc.) to support and advanced business rules and logic.
Ability to describe complex technical algorithms, methods and analysis results.
Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills with the ability to interact with technical and non-technical groups.
title: Enterprise Applications Manager, Google Fiber

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. As an Account Manager, you'll manage relationships with clients, which means you are focused, proactive, and able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Additionally, you're an advisor and consultant, as well as a client advocate within Google.Responsibilities

Report on business figures internally with the leader of your vertical.
Serve as a liaison to clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities.
Provide campaign updates and ensure that our advertisers are satisfied.
Manage ongoing customer training in all AdWords-related tools.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience managing digital advertising campaigns for clients, with a focus on Search Engine Management (SEM) and AdWords.
Preferred qualifications
AdWords certified with experience in search Marketing.
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Ability to strategically think and analyze the needs of clients.
Advanced level of proficiency in all Google Apps products and excellent competency using spreadsheets and presentation tools.
Excellent business sense, problem solving, project management and analytical skills.
title: Account Manager, Automotive Vertical

text:
The application for the 2015 internship program is now closed. Please check back in October 2015 for the 2016 internship application.
As a Legal Intern and part of the Google legal regional team, you will play an important part in helping to respond to some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. You will get an insight into the legal issues at Google and YouTube and learn to expect the unexpected and be equipped with the full tool-kit of professional skills to handle whatever comes in. This role will test your organization skills, attention to detail, versatility and composure. You will get the chance to demonstrate that you have sound legal judgment, can learn quickly in a fast-paced environment, and can communicate confidently at all levels. An interest in technology and the internet, an understanding of Google’s online technologies and services as well as experience from working or studying abroad in an English speaking country, will be important assets for this job.Responsibilities
Conduct legal research on a variety of legal topics including: intellectual property, consumer regulations, media regulations, advertising law, data protection, etc.
Respond to various legal requests from users and third parties in relation to Google services.
Assist the legal team in the preparation and the management of court actions.
Participate in the creation and maintenance of internal knowledge databases for the legal team.
Review and drafting of contracts.
Minimum qualifications
Law degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Related experience in a leading law firm.
Well organized and able to manage numerous projects simultaneously under deadline pressure.
Excellent legal analysis and research skills.
Fluency in English and local language; additional European language(s).
title: Legal Intern 2015

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.As a Program Manager, you are responsible for protecting the integrity of some of Google's key products, including Google Search, Google Maps, AdWords, Adsense, Google Checkout and Google Product Search. You investigate financial fraud, account-related abuse, questionable business practices, violations of Google's policies, and general misuse of our products. You are introduced to dynamic analytical techniques and you leverage custom-built technology to have a direct impact on improving the experience of millions of Google users. You subscribe to a "user-first" philosophy and are interested in improving Google's user experience and product integrity. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and thrive in a fast-paced environment. You harness your analytical and technical skills to drive tool development and process improvements.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique challenges we face daily. As a Program Manager on the Risk Operations team, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects using your operations expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives or engineers.

The payments team provides the base platform for pricing strategies across all Google properties. We are working on building the payments infrastructure for multiple Google products like Play, Wallet, YouTube, Enterprise, Cloud, Google Fiber and other projects. Our payments business continues to expand quickly. You're a strong program manager who champions fighting fraud, improving our customer experience and delivering world-class analytics.Responsibilities

Facilitate and manage operations programs, working closely with Google engineers, product managers and vendor operations to develop and track project schedules and timelines
Gather requirements and define the scope of the project, facilitate discussions and drive resolution to issues, drive and stay on top of project/program execution and highlight risks.
Manage communication of progress/status within core team and external to the team (customers, partners, etc); escalate issues as necessary.
Work closely with Product, Engineering and cross-functional operations teams to identify analysis needs and track impact of recommendations.
Assist program management initiatives across the team. Participate in projects that help scale the group, implement best practices and improve methodology.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Information Systems or equivalent practical experience.
6 years work experience, including 2 years of experience in business intelligence, statistics, or scientific analysis.
Database query experience (e.g. SQL)
Preferred qualifications
Experience with statistical and quantitative modeling (e.g., regression, classification, clustering)
Experience managing multiple complex projects, working globally and cross-functionally.
Relevant experience in one of the following areas: eCommerce, payments, online fraud, product abuse, vendor operations, managing customer contacts
Proficiency with scripting or programming languages (e.g., Python or Java)
Demonstrated ability to synthesize information and see the big picture while effectively managing details.
Outstanding leadership, influencing, communication, interpersonal and teamwork skills.
title: Program Manager, Risk Operations

text:

gTech Ads is a team with the vision of providing best-in-class service for all of Google’s Advertising clients. As a Head of Strategy and Business Operations, you will join the gTech Ads Strategy and Business Operations team. You are a strong analytical problem-solver and leader, and as part of this team you will work on complex problems that are global in scope, and cross-functional between Services, Sales, Product, and Engineering.Responsibilities
Execute key strategic initiatives. Identify and structure strategic projects to solve for complex, ambiguous, and potentially charged business issues for gTech Ads.
Work with cross-functional stakeholders and leaders to gather relevant data and conduct business analysis using your effective project communication and management skills.
Solve potential problems with senior leaders to deliver strategic insights and recommendations based on business analyses to senior leadership.
Lead Business Operations initiatives. Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders in annual business planning, key organizational metrics, and other operationally strategic projects.
Facilitate conversations between gTech Ads leaders and external stakeholders on topics including developing business models, organizational design, and cross-functional initiatives.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of experience in Management Consulting, with 3 years of experience in Business Operations, managing a team, service, or product.
Experience with analysis packages such as R, SQL, SPSS, SAS, with expertise in data analysis.
Knowledge of Search, Exchange, and Brand Ads space and support ecosystem. Exceptional partner who can work closely with cross-functional stakeholders and influence successfully across organizational boundaries.
High proficiency with structuring strategic analysis and story-lines using spreadsheets and presentations. Example applications include: Google Sheets, Google Slides.
Enthusiastic problem solver who has a solid track record in structuring and executing complex analyses to support strategy, and works well in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment.
Proven leader with strong project management, analytical, written/verbal communication, and interpersonal skills with senior leaders.
title: Head of Strategy and Business Operations, gTech Ads

text:
Systems and Applications Administrators embrace Google's motto to ensure millions of users can access the world's information without a glitch. As a Systems Administrator at Google, you own and support the needs of one of Google's server infrastructure systems. You're highly technical and work directly with other server and service owners to ensure reliability and sustainability of the Google service infrastructure as well as compliance with internal policies. Success in this role means you are able to support servers in a mixed operating system environment and work efficiently with our internal technology providers as well as other operations groups. Googlers rely on your guidance when it comes to design decisions so you'll have a direct impact in keeping the business productive.Responsibilities
Work in a fast paced environment while ensuring the uptime and availability of Google's products to customers and Googlers.
Participate in on-call rotation.
Respond to tickets within team defined Service Level Objectives (SLO).
Support, maintain and deploy team-supported infrastructure and documentation.
Work closely with various network and software engineering teams.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience implementing, troubleshooting, and supporting the Unix/Linux operating system, Internet-based applications, and web servers.
Scripting experience in actively writing/modifying code to improve monitoring and automation (Perl, Python, Shell, etc).
Working experience with TCP/IP networking (DNS, DHCP, etc).
Preferred qualifications
Fluency in multiple programming languages.
Strong customer service, leadership, organizational, communication and interface skills.
title: Unix/Linux Systems and Applications Administrator

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Public Policy and Government Relations Manager - Tokyo.As a member of the Global Communications & Public Affairs team, you will work cross-functionally to help communicate with journalists and other thought leaders; devise specific communications materials and campaigns based on understanding of journalists' interests; engage in face-to-face meetings with commentators and other opinion formers; develop print and web-based material supporting these campaigns; and counter misinformation that might interfere with our business and ability to serve our users. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more.Responsibilities
Develop and lead public policy campaigns across the full range of policy areas that impact Google and the web. Key issues include technology innovation, free expression, privacy and intellectual property.
Engage directly with politicians and policy-makers.
Build a network of trade associations, industry partners, non-profit groups and others to support policies that will help create/maintain a user-focused online environment as well as an open Internet.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of relevant public policy and government relations experience.
Ability to speak and write Japanese and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Direct experience working within government, think tanks, public interest groups or the field of corporate public policy.
Experience working in high-stress environments and a proven ability to exercise judgment even in a crisis.
Broad policy experience with direct knowledge of the tech sector or the key issues impacting the Internet, like intellectual property, free expression, Internet access and online safety.
Team player who can work with people from a broad range of backgrounds and experience, including leading campaigns and mentor more junior members of the team.
Excellent communicator with great interpersonal and presentation skills, as well as the ability to write well and translate complex issues into simple language that people who are not experts can understand.
title: Public Policy and Government Relations Manager

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
YouTube has become the expressive platform of a generation empowered to shape what matters in culture and society today. Together we are building a truly global destination for creativity, learning and free expression. We are upending the established order by creating the first truly fan-led video community as the YouTube community creates and impacts culture and society daily. 

Gaming is a YouTube vertical that is growing rapidly. Here's your opportunity to help shape the next generation of gaming on YouTube. In this role you'll drive the gaming and product marketing strategy in EMEA - consumer insights, competitive analysis, product positioning, objectives and metrics, and overall go-to-market approach and execution. Through close cross functional collaboration coupled with strategic marketing, you will deepen consumer engagement with gaming and build YouTube into one of the most beloved gaming experiences on the planet.

Opening date for applications: 11th May 2015. Closing date for applications: 11th June 2015. Competitive salary applies.
Responsibilities
Drive actionable insights to inform product and marketing strategy (e.g. user and competitive research)
Provide the product/vertical marketing strategy as part of the global team, to achieve our YouTube gaming business goals. (e.g. set goals, define value prop, establish vertical narrative, etc)
Provide the Go-to-Market strategy and execution for product launches. (e.g. investment, EMEA country prioritization plans, establish pricing, acquisition and engagement strategies, etc)
Manage stakeholders forging strong working relationships across Partnerships, PR, Policy, Country Marketing and EMEA leadership
Support and input across other EMEA YouTube marketing projects as required
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Passion for gaming and/or previous gaming experience
Consumer-focus: a great passion for consumers and consumer experiences, with an ability to utilize consumer research and data to drive actionable insights to inform marketing strategy and improve the consumer experience.
Strong partnership and communication skills: a passionate leader and communicator, with demonstrated talent at building strong collaborative partnerships with product and other cross-functional teams
Ability to develop strategy and business plans.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast paced dynamic environment.
Ability to influence effectively cross-functionally across all levels of management.
title: Product Marketing Manager, YouTube EMEA
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
At gTech Ads, our mission is to “make it easy to run ads with Google at 10x the scale” through expertise and efficiency. To achieve this, we’re looking for Googlers who can partner with media and creative agencies, advertisers and Google’s internal teams to ensure flawless YouTube and Engagement ad campaign delivery.
Brand Specialists offer the highest quality campaign creation, delivery and support, both pre and post sales. You will execute quickly and efficiently on multiple campaigns providing sales, creative and technical consultation, across our most complex product areas - YouTube, Google Display Network (GDN) and reserve buys and engagement ads.
As a client facing expert, with a particular focus on coordinating agency support, cross functional relationship skills are key. You will operate as a key partner re-actively delivering brand campaigns based on agreed customer’s Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
You will have in-depth product knowledge and a strong technical aptitude which can be leveraged to persistently explore and uncover technical solutions to complex business scenarios.
Brand Specialists help provide the voice of the customer to the regional and global Customer Solutions and Innovations (CSI) and gTech Ads Product and Tools teams. Through your influencing and relationship-building skills, you will be essential to driving ongoing improvements to our products, processes and tools.Responsibilities
Manage the set up, support, delivery, optimization and reporting of reservation and engagement ad campaigns; liaise with sales and with the wider gTech support teams to ensure flawless delivery.
Provide specialized sales, creative and technical product expertise to account teams, advertisers, agencies and industry partners as the primary point of contact for reservation advertising. Support and advocate new product features, ensuring prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
Develop and own one or more areas of product expertise and act as the teams Subject Matter Expert. Liaise with the regional and global gTech Product and Tools teams to further improve reservation and engagement advertising products and to optimize existing reservation tools and systems.
Drive education initiatives designed to increase knowledge of Google reserve and engagement products and processes amongst agencies and sales teams.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues, and provide outstanding support across our platform technologies for advertisers and agencies using reserve and engagement products. Escalate out-of-scope troubleshooting issues to the gTech Global Support Team and monitor end-to-end timely overall resolution.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Demonstrable experience in Ad operations, trafficking, rich media, and/or inventory management
Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript or ActionScript skills and knowledge of third-party advertising tags (Mediaplex, Atlas, DoubleClick).
Ability to build and maintain effective relationships with a capacity to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders.
Detail oriented and strong project management skills, with an ability to prioritize and quickly complete a large volume of high-quality work.
Strong communication skills with an ability to absorb complex technical concepts, and communicate them to a non-technical audience and a proven ability to present to sales, technical and marketing audiences.
title: Brand Specialist, MENA Market

text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
As a Support Tools Program Manager for Consumer Operations, you will be responsible for improving the performance of our worldwide product support operations by advancing the capabilities of our agent tools; enabling productivity improvements; and launching innovative customer service technologies.
You will work closely with end-users and stakeholders within customer support operations to assess opportunities for our internal tools based on business growth, product launches, and customer satisfaction. You will lead the technology vision for our product and develop agent tool roadmaps that drive product success. You will be a tireless advocate for these initiatives, problem solving with platform, product, engineering, telecom, legal, and security teams to maximize customer success through customer service and contact center technology. Additionally, you will execute on priorities leveraging a deep understanding of your product area, effective project and change management, and a healthy obsession with metrics.
Responsibilities
Be accountable for improving key performance indicators by further developing the performance and usability of our internal tools and systems.
Identify, structure, lead, and launch support tools development projects (continuous improvement initiatives, prepping for new product launches, and evolving the Google support experience).
Build relationships with senior members of the Product Support Teams as well as cross-functional organizations (engineering, product managers, etc.).
Manage ongoing bug/incident, system configuration, and testing.
Ensure high degree of rigor and quality in all projects.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant experience.
Experience with information systems and technologies (e.g. CRM, data management, SQL, etc.).
Preferred qualifications
5 years of experience developing and scaling CRM or enterprise software.
Experience defining requirements for new tool platforms or software/web products in a fast-paced or start-up environment.
Change management experience, ensuring adoption and measurement of post-release impact.
Strong project management skills, with ability to plan, coordinate and execute against assigned task.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners.
title: Support Tools Program Manager, Consumer Operations
