text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Clinical Research Associate at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
You are responsible for assisting in the implementation and management of clinical trials. You will work closely with study managers, CRAs (Clinical Research Associates), research coordinators and clinical investigators to ensure compliance with protocols.
You will be part of a small team, so self-direction is critical. You will help identify projects/tasks and, in collaboration with the Study Manager, you will be maintaining consistent CRF (Case Report Form) data quality and management across sites.
Responsibilities
Assist the Study Manager in all aspects of clinical trials: develop protocol and informed consent form and other study-related documents using knowledge of GCP/ICH and other regulatory requirements; manage day-to-day responsibilities of clinical studies at investigational sites.
Assist with managing the investigator contract, budget, and payment process, and be responsible for initiating and tracking scheduling, payments and subject compensation.
Develop Case Report Forms (CRF), CRF guidelines and other study forms to be utilized by investigational sites. Co-monitor site visits including pre-study, initiation, interim and close-out visits, and ensure protocol compliance, accurate and thorough data collection, and appropriate study conduct.
Initiate and track device shipments and dispositions, and ensure that device supplies are adequate for investigational sites/assigned studies. Complete data entry and data resolution in clinical database, and perform review of CRF data for quality, completeness and accuracy. Conduct basic data analysis and interpretation, and coordinate and review regulatory documents from investigational sites as well as in-house to ensure compliance with protocol and applicable regulations.
Understand study timelines and manage investigational sites to meet enrollment goals and timelines. Collaborate and drive cross-functional activities in support of studies, and present at Investigator/Study Coordinator meetings, as needed.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a life science, health science, RN, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of industry experience including 1 year in clinical research in diagnostic or therapeutic medical devices.
4 years of direct clinical research experience.
Experience in clinical research at either a hospital or medical device/pharmaceutical company. Experience in GCP and FDA regulations.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in a life science, health science, RN, or related field.
Experience working with combination device.
Proficiency in productivity software and tools such as Google Apps.
Basic data analysis and interpretation skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills with strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
title: Clinical Research Associate (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
As a Systems Integration Engineer, you are responsible for providing technical solutions and managing relationships with Google's largest and most strategic online publishers. As a liaison between clients and our technical staff, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations and integrations of a variety of our product lines (such as Search, Mobile, Video and Commerce). From monitoring product performance to debugging and troubleshooting product code, you are the resident expert that addresses partner needs. Ensure OEM and hardware partners successfully bring up Project Tango on their devices.
Create hardware and system documentation and specifications.
Give feedback to internal engineers and product managers.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in the mobile/CE/embedded space.
Experience with Linux kernel, device driver APIs, chipset and Android.
Experience in C/C++, Java, MATLAB or Python.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree.
Project management experience resulting in a successful track record of customer product launches.
Experience with mobile device development and manufacturing.
Ability to speak Mandarin or Korean.

As a Product Data Management (PDM) Program Manager within the Google Fiber team, you will work across Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Deployment and Finance teams internally as well as suppliers, contractors, installers externally, towards developing and executing processes and workflows that define and manage product data throughout its lifecycle.
As an experienced professional in PDM, you will be the focal point of contact driving change management process and associated workflows from request to implementation. As a recognized expert in the field of Product Lifecycle Management you will work across IT and Supply Chain teams in identifying and driving PDM process improvements and system enhancements. You will be a key member in developing and institutionalizing operational metrics that drive Google and its business partners to meet cost, delivery and quality objectives.Responsibilities
Be responsible for and project manage the creation and processing of Bills of Materials (BOM), Engineering Change Orders (ECO), Manufacturer Change Orders, Deviations and Configuration Management activities by applying best practices of PDM principles during the support of New Product Introduction (NPI) as well as sustaining efforts.
Lead cross-functional PDM Change Control Boards (CCBs) that develop and approve engineering change requests. Project manage and document the implementation of change requests.
Identify and develop processes, workflows and system functionality that enables efficient exchange of product data with internal customers and external partners (suppliers, construction partners, installers, etc.).
Identify and drive PDM process improvements. Work with internal IT teams to implement system enhancements in support of operational efficiency and efficacy gains.
Define and maintain Key Performance Indicators (KPI) for PDM processes.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of industry experience in one or more of the following fields: Product Development, New Product Introduction (NPI) or Manufacturing Operations.
Direct experience as a Product Data Manager in support of product development using Agile, Windchill or equivalent.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Engineering/Operations.
5 years of experience in a PDM role.
Experience of implementation of a PDM solution from the ground up with Agile/Oracle.
Ability to think strategically, balancing a broad range of internal and external factors when identifying problems, proposing solutions, and making decisions.
Excellent attention to detail, quick learner with creative problem-solving and analytical skills.
An excellent communicator of project requirements and schedules.

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.With your technical expertise, you build business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution.
The Corporate Data (CorpData) Team is responsible for Data Integration, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, and Analytics technologies that empower our systems and business partners. As a member of this team, you will help develop solutions to meet the data management and reporting needs of Googlers.Responsibilities
Architect data warehouse solutions for highly complex business operations including data modeling and ETL architecture.
Manage end-users training and office hours support, collect and document open questions and potential improvements for the technology stack and data.
Conduct requirements gathering with senior business executives and users to plan a roadmap of project activity that leads to measurable improvement in business performance metrics/Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) over time.
Lead cross-functional integration effort to load, manipulate, audit, and report on data in internal business systems as well as make data updates to the systems using complex SQL statements.
Conduct advanced data analysis to identify trends using data mining algorithms and alert the management on risk and opportunity.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience of managing the full implementation lifecycle for delivery of systems solutions (analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).
5 years of experience in Business Intelligence and reporting/visualization tool administration (such as Tableau).
Database development experience including experience in ETL tools and SQL programming.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with the design and development of data visualization solutions for both traditional reporting as well as advanced analytics.
Development experience in designing and delivering end-to-end data warehousing/business intelligence solutions.
Ability and interest to work with a variety of data integration technologies (ETL and SQL) to solve problems, and a background that demonstrates this ability.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Business Systems Analyst, Data Management and Reporting

text:
This position is based in Minden, NVGoogle has one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. Your team is responsible for providing the manufacturing capability to deliver this state-of-the-art physical infrastructure. As a Manufacturing Line Supervisor, you evaluate the product designs and create the processes, tools and procedures behind Google's powerful search technology. When vendors build parts for our infrastructure, you're right there alongside ensuring manufacturing processes are repeatable and controlled. You collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design Engineers to determine Google's infrastructure needs and product specifications. Your work ensures the various pieces of Google's infrastructure fit together perfectly and keep our systems humming along smoothly for a seamless user experience.
Responsibilities
Assist the Operations Manager in managing and overseeing the operations and personnel of one or more production lines to maximize productivity and operating efficiencies.
Interview and hire employees; train on policies and procedures, scheduling, communication skills, and quality improvement tools; and provide performance reviews to reflect quality, quantity, attitude, attendance, knowledge, and adherence to process/policies.
Attain operational goals for production output, yield, efficiency, throughput time, and space utilization.
Maintain a safe and clean work environment by educating and directing personnel on the use of all control points, equipment, and resources; maintaining compliance with established policies and procedures.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in manufacturing, engineering, related field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience supervising production staff.
Experience working in a manufacturing production environment.
Experience in facilities and space management.
Preferred qualifications
Familiarity with manufacturing systems and processes.
Experience manage line efficiencies, key performance indicators and down time.
Experience in MES/MRP implementation and long term administration.
Experience in inventory control and purchasing.
Experience in shipping and receiving.
title: Manufacturing Line Supervisor, Special Projects

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
Grow the partnership base for Google Play Apps by helping app developers succeed and empowering them with insights, education, and running programs. You’ll drive the global strategy on how Google Play should engage with and leverage our third-party partnerships and coordinate regional execution of our key ecosystem programs, from venture capital (VC) business reviews to startup mixers to mobile agency summits.
You’ll work on figuring out how to educate VC firms and their portfolio companies. You’ll analyze opportunities for how to best work with companies that help develop apps for our partners, then build and implement programs to improve their work. You will take a global perspective to helping solve challenges in Google Play’s ecosystem, working closely with regional team members to execute local programs as well as scale global efforts.Responsibilities
Lead and coordinate global management of Google Play’s third-party ecosystem enablers, focusing primarily on VC firms, developer shops, agencies, and code academies.
Define strategy for, plan and execute innovative programs to drive Play partner success through our ecosystem enablers, working collaboratively with Google Play Business Development (BD) colleagues, product management, developer relations, marketing and other cross-functional teams.
Be the voice of our Ecosystem Enablers - synthesize and communicate feedback and learnings to the Google Play team and leadership.
Lead key internal initiatives to better align Google and Google Play efforts with our external ecosystem partners.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of work experience in a client-facing Business Development or Sales role, with experience working with executive-level clients.
Experience working in the investment/venture capital or agency ecosystem.
Preferred qualifications
Demonstrated ability to drive major initiatives across large organizations and lead growing teams.
Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment and to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management.
Excellent management, organizational, analytical, and influencing skills.
Outstanding presentation and communication skills, with creative flair to bring fresh ideas into product positioning and marketing campaigns.
title: Ecosystem Development Lead, Google Play Apps

text:
Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Business Analysts provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. As a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.
As a Business Intelligence Analyst in the Play Analytics team, you will be responsible for building out scaled reporting and data insights aimed at increasing Play store performance for the Apps and Games vertical. You will be working with multiple stakeholders to define key metrics integral to managing a rapidly evolving business with a massive global user base. You will partner closely with Play Analytics engineering to support ongoing improvements to Play’s data infrastructure. You will help define and prioritize new reporting capabilities, design tests, and develop reports that utilize the data. You will also use the resources you’ve developed to proactively identify and investigate emerging data trends, and work with business and product leaders to develop actionable insights.
You will be responsible for translating data into meaningful interpretations and recommendations and, where relevant, implement process improvements. The metrics you develop will serve as key input in the product development and operations decision-making. You will work collaboratively across Play teams (e.g. Engineering, Product Management, Business Development, Merchant, Operations) as well as with teams outside of Play such as Legal, Finance and Marketing teams.
Responsibilities
Lead scaled reporting for Play, focusing on product features and user experience. Serve as data expert for Play and develop trainings to educate other analysts on how to leverage resources.
Work with engineering partners to shape and drive the development of Google’s Business Intelligence (BI) infrastructure, including data warehousing, reporting and analytics platforms.
Partner with business analysts, Product Managers and other stakeholders to understand evolving requirements, and translate these into reporting capabilities.
Develop and refine key metrics and visualization for executive-level reporting, providing ongoing commentary on trends. Ensure quality of new metrics and help prioritize ongoing improvements to core data sets.
Identify and investigate emerging data trends on an as-needed basis, explaining root causes.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a quantitative concentration or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of professional experience as an analyst, data engineer with experience working with data visualization tools to deliver results, as well as experience with the Android and Play ecosystem.
Experience analyzing data and creating reports with spreadsheet, database query experience (e.g. SQL), statistical (e.g. R, SAS), quantitative modeling and forecasting experience.
Experience working with datasets/data warehouses. Experience managing projects while also handling ad hoc requests.
Preferred qualifications
MS in engineering, business or quantitative majors.
Experience working directly with engineers and product managers
Experience analyzing logs.
Proven experience in identifying opportunities for business improvement and defining/measuring the success of those initiatives.
Solid business knowledge and understanding of online App store dynamic.
Outstanding problem-solving and analytical skills combined with strong business acumen.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Google Play (Data Engineering)

text:
Help the globe "go Google." The Google for Work team helps companies seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. As a Technical Solutions Engineer, you're helping the globe "go Google" by working with leading companies, schools and government agencies to ease their transition to Google tools. You swiftly problem-solve technical issues for customers to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Google for Work business and bringing our product portfolio into companies both big and small around the world.
As a Technical Solutions Engineer Google Applications, you will work closely with engineering, product management, and deployment teams to improve the product's vision and to make Google customers successful. Applying your in-depth technical experience, you will develop a deep understanding of, and drive enhancements to, Google’s services architecture. As part of a 24x7 global team, you will be working in a third tier engineering-level support role and drive resolution for problems and inquiries that customers report. More specifically, you will provide solutions to customers and the first and second tier support teams, and resolve all escalated customer cases for the Google Apps Product Suite.Responsibilities
Diagnose and resolve customer problems for Google Apps products in a third tier engineering-level support function as part of a global 24x7 global team.
Obtain and maintain an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology, architecture and implementation, build and transfer knowledge to Google’s Tier 1 and 2 support groups.
Guide or perform design and implementation of new support, productivity or investigation tools to increase efficiency for the technical support process.
Act as a consultant and knowledge base for product managers, sales engineers, technical account managers, and deployment specialists, resolving technical deployment obstacles, improving the product's vision and and make Google customers successful.
Work closely with multiple Google Apps product management and software engineering teams on understanding ways to improve the product, and interact with QA teams to driveexceptional testing quality.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Industry experience in technical support, professional services, engineering, sustaining engineering, or systems engineering.
Preferred qualifications
Hands-on experience implementing, troubleshooting, and supporting Internet-based applications, web servers, mail servers (e.g. Exchange, Lotus, sendmail, or Postfix), and Linux/UNIX operating systems. Experience with Identity Management or Directory Services (LDAP, AD).
Experience with managing hosted services/SaaS. Familiarity with programming/scripting (i.e. one or more of the following: Java, C, C++, .NET, Python, Shell, Perl, JavaScript).
Experience with various DBMS, data mining and analysis.
Experience with managing long-term implementation projects.
Strong network administration and troubleshooting skills with understanding of Linux/Unix system administration. Strong understanding of web and mail-related standards, such as HTTP, HTML, XML, cookie-based SSO, and SMTP.
Outstanding troubleshooting, follow-through and problem solving skills, resourcefulness, attention to detail, and communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to keep pace with rapid changes in enterprise products.
title: Google for Work Technical Solutions Engineer, Google Applications

text:
The Google.org Access Development team's objective is to bring broadband to emerging markets in a financially sustainable and scalable way to impact hundreds of millions of people. The group focuses on developing business models, regulation and technology to support these goals. There is a strong emphasis on bringing new technologies or new ways to use technologies to solve the access challenges in these markets. As a member of the team, you will be responsible for defining and implementing access projects in emerging markets, as well as identifying and incubating promising technological solutions.
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives,working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy fiber-based and other technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring Internet access to people.
Responsibilities
Oversee the outside plant implementation of the fiber network and the implementation of network integration undertaken by equipment suppliers and contractors.
Coordinate and manage the communication between the cross-functional teams, equipment suppliers and fiber contractors, NOC personnel or any other deployment and operations support related matters.
Assist in the development of deployment dashboards, processes and procedures along with training programs and documentation
Innovate on solutions and technologies to drive towards achieving excellence in network deployment
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in a telecommunications field with experience in fiber deployment projects.
Preferred qualifications
Experience creating network drawings, route maps, and scopes of work.
Experience selecting, hiring and managing contractors, and working effectively with permitting, government agencies and large, cross-functional teams.
Experience in managing multi-million dollar projects involving budget planning management and reporting
Comfort using CAD and other drafting software and experience using Google Earth.
A deep understanding of core and access transmission network design and of inside and outside plant fiber optic network infrastructure.
title: Lead Project Manager, Fiber

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
At gTech Ads, our mission is to “make it easy to run ads with Google at 10x the scale” through expertise and efficiency. To achieve this, we’re looking for Googlers who can partner with media and creative agencies, advertisers and Google’s internal teams to ensure flawless YouTube and Engagement ad campaign delivery.
Brand Specialists offer the highest quality campaign creation, delivery and support, both pre and post sales. You will execute quickly and efficiently on multiple campaigns providing sales, creative and technical consultation, across our most complex product areas - YouTube, Google Display Network (GDN) and reserve buys and engagement ads.
As a client facing expert, with a particular focus on coordinating agency support, cross functional relationship skills are key. You will operate as a key partner re-actively delivering brand campaigns based on agreed customer’s Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
You will have in-depth product knowledge and a strong technical aptitude which can be leveraged to persistently explore and uncover technical solutions to complex business scenarios.
Brand Specialists help provide the voice of the customer to the regional and global Customer Solutions and Innovations (CSI) and gTech Ads Product and Tools teams. Through your influencing and relationship-building skills, you will be essential to driving ongoing improvements to our products, processes and tools.Responsibilities
Manage the set up, support, delivery, optimization and reporting of reservation and engagement ad campaigns; liaise with sales and with the wider gTech support teams to ensure flawless delivery.
Provide specialized sales, creative and technical product expertise to account teams, advertisers, agencies and industry partners as the primary point of contact for reservation advertising. Support and advocate new product features, ensuring prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
Develop and own one or more areas of product expertise and act as the teams Subject Matter Expert. Liaise with the regional and global gTech Product and Tools teams to further improve reservation and engagement advertising products and to optimize existing reservation tools and systems.
Drive education initiatives designed to increase knowledge of Google reserve and engagement products and processes amongst agencies and sales teams.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues and provide outstanding support across our platform technologies for advertisers and agencies using reserve and engagement products. Escalate out-of-scope troubleshooting issues to the gTech Global Support Team and monitor end-to-end timely overall resolution.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Demonstrable experience in Ad operations, trafficking, rich media, and/or inventory management.
Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript or ActionScript skills and knowledge of third-party advertising tags (Mediaplex, Atlas, DoubleClick).
Ability to build and maintain effective relationships with a capacity to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders.
Detail oriented and strong project management skills, with an ability to prioritize and quickly complete a large volume of high-quality work.
Strong communication skills with an ability to absorb complex technical concepts, and communicate them to a non-technical audience and a proven ability to present to sales, technical and marketing audiences.
title: Brand Specialist, UK Market

text:
Help the globe "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. On the Sales Operations team, you help fellow Sales Googlers by performing budgeting, planning, and analysis activities--and your passion for the magic of Google products like Apps and Chrome. Not only do you provide invaluable financial and budgeting input, but you also devise new ways for us to communicate with potential leads and bring them into the Google fold. Your razor-sharp insight means you excel at customer segmentation, acquisition and retention. You marry clean communication with strong analytical skills and a solid commitment to providing customers with a Googley customer experience. You also peer into the future for us; you examine and analyze statistical data to forecast marketing trends and to identify potential new markets for Google for Work. Help Google for Work grow and continue improving businesses the world over.
At Google, data drives our decision-making. The Google for Work Sales Operations team defines processes and makes data, analytics and tools available to inform business and product decisions across the company. In the role of Sales Operations Analyst, you will use your leadership skills, technology insight, business acumen and creativity to build data pipelines and tools to automate reporting and generate insight.
As a member of the Sales Operations team, you will have a global remit to use a data driven approach to sharpen decision making and drive deep understanding of our fast growing business. You will contribute directly to the scaling of Android and Chrome platforms at Google for Work and Google for Education as well as the Google Maps business.
In this role, you will analyze, report, and present sales and operations related data that is associated with customer pipeline, bookings forecasting, and sales productivity. You will provide insights to the business through analysis of bookings and sales activity to drive greater efficiency and effectiveness of our sales teams. You'll be building scalable solutions that will help make data relevant to the executive team on current and historical performance through dashboard visualization. Using your strong technical skills, you will build tools to automate reporting and dashboard updates so the leadership team can see quickly and accurately how their businesses are performing. You’ll be involved in defining user requirements, building and maintaining the data infrastructure, designing reports and ensuring timely delivery to the end users.Responsibilities
Perform advanced analysis activities, including defining, measuring and communicating core operational metrics.
Take a lead role in developing and publishing reports, dashboards, presentations, and tools to aid sales, support, operations, and marketing teams in consistently tracking activities to sales results.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to complete comprehensive performance and forecasting analysis of specific parts of the business, such as end-to-end work that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and final presentation slides.
Lead global projects in structuring and executing analyses required to develop business recommendations, manage multiple projects simultaneously, with limited oversight, and communicate findings/recommendations to senior management and the broader organization.
Own the “Single Source of Truth” working with other teams on sales team activity reports, product adoption, territory and segment analysis. Drive visibility into the business by designing and developing metrics dashboards that drive executive decision-making.
Minimum qualifications

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience at a management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity or similar corporate setting.
Experience in SQL.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or advanced degree.
Experience in Web-scale databases, Hadoop, or NoSQL technologies; knowledge of commercial and emerging reporting tools and technologies (e.g. Tableau, QlikView, D3); experience in related underlying technologies such as JavaScript, App Engine (or other cloud platforms).
Solid project management experience at a leading consulting firm or investment bank, or equivalent project management experience from a high-growth technology company.
Strong analytical and problem solving experience, combined with strong business judgment and an ability to present analysis in a clear and compelling manner.
Advanced spreadsheet skills (i.e. VLOOKUP, pivot tables, data modeling).
title: Sales Operations Analyst, Emerging Products, Google for Work

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Partner Plex Experience Manager - Tokyo.Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The Google Partner Plex is a customer experience center dedicated to championing the art and science of brand building through hands on, interactive workshops with marketers. Our mission is to inspire, educate and align with global customers so they have a stronger understanding of how to effectively leverage Google’s tools and platforms to confidently build their brands on the web. When customers come to Partner Plex, they are making a significant investment of time and have extremely high expectations about what we deliver in a Partner Plex experience. The core offering is an Advertising Activation Workshop, a full-day session that brings clients, their agencies, their Google account representatives and the Partner Plex team together to explore and develop solutions for a specific brand objective.
As the Experience Manager, you will play a critical role in managing the day-of-workshop guest experience for our top advertisers, giving them the white glove treatment, plus executing all the pre-workshop scheduling and post-workshop follow-up activities for every workshop.
In this capacity, approximately half of your time will be spent managing a complex matrix of global schedule and calendaring responsibilities, which requires strong attention to detail plus the ability to juggle multiple ongoing assignments at once. The other half of your time will be spent as the first person each guest interacts with for the Partner Plex, using a myriad of skills such as communication, organization, professionalism, judgment and tech-savviness to create a positive and memorable onsite experience. You will interface with C-level executives, clients and other high-profile guests, and will represent Google, YouTube and their brands. You will customize the experience for every Partner Plex guest, based on your understanding of their company’s brand values and the key messages that Google wants to deliver.Responsibilities

Interface with guests of all levels professionally and confidentially and provide a high degree of customer service, including but not limited to answering questions, locating rooms and helping with transportation.
Manage meeting logistics, which include setting up rooms, customizing individual Partner Plex moments as needed, ensuring that the facility is prepared for every client meeting, and coordinating with security, facilities, reception and catering teams for meeting needs.
Organize the operations needed for Tokyo Partner Plex, setting up a structure to project manage a busy calendar of events and designing a method to prioritize event requests from all teams to ensure that the event space is optimized correctly and efficiently.
Work globally and cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing and PR to promote events, manage logistics on the day-to-day operations of client visits, and manage both external vendors (event management, PR, etc.) and internal teams to make sure events run smoothly.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a marketing, event planning or executive assistant role.
Business level communication in Japanese and English.
Preferred qualifications
Proven mastery of Google applications including Gmail, Calendar, Docs and Sites.
Expectation of complete confidentiality on all business matters.
Proven project management skills.
Strong organizational skills, detail-orientation, and the ability to handle multiple priorities.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
title: Partner Plex Experience Manager

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.Responsibilities
Develop internal processes, best practices and frameworks for the Corporate Network Infrastructure Department.
Enhance cross-team collaboration and knowledge development along with technical partner teams (Engineering, Deployment, Operations, etc.).
Engage senior business stakeholders on feature specifications for tools and drive tools development.
Champion new processes, frameworks and technologies across technical teams.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Significant program management experience with complex global programs, including emerging regions. Program management office experience.
Benefit management, systems engineering, process development, and CMM experience.
Hands-on networking or infrastructure experience as a systems engineer, architect or software engineer.
Ability to structure and organize a team without pre-defined processes, including mentorship and leadership.
Ability to engage with different cultures and people at several levels in an organization.
title: Technical Program Manager, Corporate Network Systems Engineering
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
Google's corporate network engineering team is responsible for the design, rollout, 24x7 operations, performance, and security of the internal network that provides services to Google's tens of thousands of employees, contractors, and vendors throughout the world. We design and operate the network that connects offices ranging from large enterprise campuses with thousands of employees, to remote sales offices connected via satellite, and everything in-between. We design and maintain corporate data centers on multiple continents using best-of-breed equipment. We're a multi-vendor environment, using network, security, and Wi-Fi equipment from vendors large and small, as well as some equipment that you’re unlikely to see anywhere else. The network connectivity and service needs of Google are diverse, and our solutions are equally diverse, as we work to provide best-in-class enterprise connectivity and internal consulting services to an enormous variety of Google projects.
As a wireless network engineer for Google's enterprise network, you'll have primary ownership of the mid- and long-term roadmap and evolution of Google's worldwide enterprise Wi-Fi services. Serving as a senior member of the enterprise wireless team, you'll evaluate the wireless connectivity needs of the company, recommend designs and vendors to meet those needs, serve as the technical lead of project teams to deliver on your vision, and structure the consulting services that we offer to our internal customers.
You'll play a major role in our wireless consulting and engineering efforts for non-office locations, including vehicular Wi-Fi, emerging markets connectivity, IP via satellite, next-generation mobile devices such as Google Glass, and more. You'll have the opportunity to partner with, and provide technical expertise to a wide variety of other teams beyond corporate network engineering, including security operations, systems engineering, hardware operations, and Google production data center engineering. You also have experience as a senior Wi-Fi designer or consultant.Responsibilities
Design and guide the implementation of comprehensive, best-of-breed wireless communications needs that meet Google's evolving internal business communications needs.
Stay abreast of new technology offerings and best practices in the wireless space, and use this knowledge to introduce enhancements to Google's wireless networks to drive business productivity.
Define, document, and lead multi-year wireless road map for the Google enterprise network, in collaboration with other members of the wireless team.
Provide wireless consulting and design services to internal corporate customers, and to internal-external partnerships that include Google business partners and vendors.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in a technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with design and operations of an enterprise-class wireless network spanning multiple geographies and multiple buildings per location.
Experience with major Wi-Fi design and control topologies including autonomous APs and controller/controller-less based designs.
Experience with Wi-Fi protocols including all flavors of 802.11, and experience supporting protocols including DHCP, RADIUS/802.1x, and relevant PKI, EAP, DHCP and RADIUS attributes.
Preferred qualifications
6 years of experience with wireless design and support at a firm with global operations and 10,000 or more employees.
Real-world experience with the design and operational challenges of building a low-interference, reliable wireless network in a diversity of building environments including offices and data centers.
Experience with Femtocell deployment or 802.11 to cellular hand-off.
Experience designing multi-SSID systems for user segmentation and multiple service offerings, including lab and guest wireless access.
Basic familiarity with OSPF, BGP, and traditional enterprise IP routing and switching.
Knowledge of modern wireless survey, diagnostic, and troubleshooting software, with the ability to recommend the right tool for the job.
title: Enterprise Wireless Network Engineer

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Merchandising Manager Apps, Google Play - Tokyo.As a Merchandising Manager, you will help build and maintain Google Play's merchandising program on handsets, web and tablets. Based on your digital content retail experience, you will coordinate and launch effective online features and promotions. You bring to the table strong retail instincts, sharp analytical abilities, and impeccable oral and written communication skills. You are comfortable working cross-functionally with product, design, marketing, engineering, and other teams to develop an innovative user experience. It’s important that you be able to work both independently and collaboratively to develop new content features and scalable merchandising processes. You’ll also have a track record for successful prioritization, meeting critical deadlines, and enthusiastically tackling challenges with an eye toward problem solving.
The Global Merchandising Team owns content programming within the Play Store across all regions and verticals (Apps, Games, Music, Movies & TV, and Books & Magazines). As a Merchandising Manager for Google Play, you will impact millions of users everyday by owning merchandising efforts end-to-end for the Apps vertical within your market(s). You will be the expert on the content, user needs, and the local ecosystem. You will work with Merchandisers from other verticals on country strategy, Business Development on understanding needs of strategic partners, and Product & Engineering on supporting new platform capabilities. You will set the strategy for and execute against merchandising and retail promotions for the Apps vertical while continually analyzing performance metrics and optimizing the user experience. You bring extensive experience in an online or mobile business; a fanatical devotion to the user; superb organization and communication skills; and a track record of beating traffic, conversion and revenue goals.
Responsibilities
Set the country merchandising strategy for the Apps vertical and execute against the global plan
Analyze internal data, market research and industry trends to select content to promote
Drive strategy for content partner co-­promotion opportunities; work with Business Development team and content owners to secure exclusives for Apps vertical
Develop user insight for the Apps vertical, including understanding of customer lifecycles and segments
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience.
5 years of experience in a merchandising, marketing, or partnerships role for an online commerce or digital content business.
Ability to speak and write Japanese and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience working in function or company focused on mobile.
Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze research or performance data and apply that analysis to optimize merchandising strategy.
Ability to work with partners to develop co­-promotion or cross-­promotion strategies and campaigns.
Ability to advise on strategies and product requirements to enhance merchandising capabilities.
Strong communication skills and collaborative working approach.
title: Merchandising Manager Apps, Google Play

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
As an Optical Test Engineer, you will verify layer 1 through layer 3 network design, qualify optical modules of different vendors, certify platforms, and verify network management process of optical systems. You will be an integral part of the New Product Introduction (NPI) process to cover test responsibilities through proof of concept, vendor certification, solution testing, escalation and sustaining stages. You will work closely with the Optical Network Engineering and Network Sustaining team to ensure the quality of Google Fiber network.Responsibilities
Lead test projects from planning and organization to execution and delivery.
Generate test procedures, develop and execute test plans, test cases and deliver test results. Develop automation scripts on test cases.
Develop and maintain test stations for characterization and test of fiber optic modules. Troubleshoot technical issues associated with test stations and failing modules. Maintain calibration of test equipment to ensure compliance.
Work with Optical Network Engineer to qualify optical system, as well as monitoring and management systems.
Analyze test data for production modules to monitor quality. Work with sustaining team to support resolution of production issues.

Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Optics/Physics/Chemical/Materials Science Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in optical related testing role.
Experience with fiber optic components and transceivers. Experience with optical, high speed test and measurement equipment.
Experience in test automation.
Preferred qualifications
Advanced engineering degree.
Experience in large scale networking solutions testing.
IP Networking and IPoDWDM experience.
Network routing protocol troubleshooting skills in all of BGP, OSPF, ISIS, and MPLS/MPLS-TE and knowledge of TCP/IP, IPv6, Multicast, VRRP, HSRP, and SNMP protocols.
title: Optical Test Engineer, Google Fiber

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
Google Fiber architecture are at the forefront of innovation, tasked with creating the fastest broadband network in the world. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Network Architecture team employ the most innovative networking approaches and equipment to deliver Gigabit high-speed Internet and Google Fiber TV services. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful (through super-fast broadband). If you want to work on challenges such as building a highly scalable networking infrastructure, bringing great TV experiences into the home, creating innovative user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.
As the IP Edge Architect in Google Fiber, you will have overall responsibility for the IP Service Edge platform, technology and protocol choices, as well as vendor strategy. You play a critical role in the network, acting as the delivery point, authentication gateway and primary QoS enforcement point for a variety of services delivered across our network, including IPTV, Internet, business services and infrastructure services.
You’ll be surrounded by a team of network architects whom you will bounce ideas off, collaborate with, be challenged by, and together, dream up the next big networking thing for Google Fiber. Your skills will stem from an intimate understanding of protocols involved in carrier broadband networks, and your track record of designing and deploying large scale IP/MPLS networks. You will be responsible for the technology selection and roadmap as well as evangelizing your architecture to the Engineering team, others within Google and the wider Internet industry.
As an architect in the Google Fiber team you are the face of Google Fiber’s state of the art network: all of network engineering will look up to you for guidance.
Responsibilities
Create network architectures, blueprints and strategies, including architecture documents for consumption by the wider Google Fiber Network’s team.
Work with the industry to advocate and improve IP/MPLS standards, platforms and technologies, providing a feedback on real deployment experience and needs. Evaluate emerging technologies and platforms for their inclusion in the Google Fiber network and participate in strategic vendor discussions and partnerships.
Interface with senior management on business requirements and goals that will drive your network architecture. Act as technical advisor to senior management and other Google Fiber teams on topics and roadmaps relating to the IP Service Edge.
Design, select and deploy operational tools, platforms and processes to ensure the highest level of performance, monitoring and ease of operation for the IP Service Edge. Lead technical vendor engagement for platforms and products relating to the IP Service Edge.
Review the detailed network designs and network configurations of the Network Engineering group to ensure consistency with the architecture, as well as gain insight into how to optimize your architecture after real-world application.
Minimum qualifications
6 years of experience in IP/MPLS networks and technologies in multi-service environments.
Experience with IP, IPv6, Ethernet, MPLS BGP VPN, VPLS, VLL and IP Service Edge deployment and operation.
Experience with IP/Ethernet QoS strategies and architecture with experience in application to multi-service and multi-vendor environments.
Preferred qualifications
Network certifications such as CCIE/JNCIE/SRA.
Demonstrated industry participation (Broadband Forum, IETF, NANOG, etc.).
Operational experience with large scale carrier multi-service networks.
Strong written and oral communications skills in English with the ability to influence others with your stellar network engineering solutions.
title: IP Edge Architect, Google Fiber

text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Partner Product Solutions team work together with teams throughout YouTube to address our partners' most pressing technology challenges - ones that have no simple answers. We create solutions for and build enduring long-term relationships with organizations that represent outstanding opportunities and/or are strategically important for us to take new, world-shaping technologies to market.
Your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to solve the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time. You are a creative thinker who thrives in a fast-paced, market-driven environment. You are a self-motivated individual looking to solidify YouTube’s strategic partnerships.
Responsibilities
Implement YouTube services with partners. Key activities include pre-sales, integration, launch, support, optimization, and planning activities.
Advocate new product features, perform implementation reviews, and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
Run multiple technical projects and/or programs simultaneously.
Work closely with internal cross-functional teams including Business Development, Product Management, and Engineering.
Envision and drive technical solutions to joint partner-YouTube issues.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of client facing experience.
1 year of experience using HTML5, Flash, JavaScript, and/or Unix/Linux.
Preferred qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science.
Experience with network tools such as sniffers, proxies or Firebug.
Experience with consumer electronics hardware and/or chipsets.
Knowledge of Internet video technologies, such as DRM solutions, video/audio codecs, etc.
Track record of being proactive, identifying gaps, making constructive suggestions and follow through for resolution.
title: Solution Consultant, Devices, YouTube

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.
As a Recruiting Coordinator Lead, you work closely with your team to deliver results and step in when needed to remove roadblocks and ensure that projects and tasks are appropriately resourced and executed with the highest level of quality. You support your team members to exercise independent thinking and make rapid progress towards both business and developmental goals, as a coach and advocate. You also build strong relationships with the client groups you support and are their “go-to” person to resolve complex problems, explore additional service requests, and recognize the outstanding contribution of your team members. You are intimately familiar with the details of our Staffing Services processes and how they are applied to various functions and geographies. Moreover, you take initiative to improve our tools and techniques both in the context of your own team as well as sharing best practices across clusters and participating in Staffing Services-wide improvement initiatives.Responsibilities
Provide day-to-day oversight of a team of Recruiting Coordinators who support clients with interview logistics across Google's Technology, Portfolio and Global Business functions, ensuring consistent service excellence.
Participate in the selection and training of new team members as well as the performance evaluation and coaching of employees.
Create and sustain a positive team environment which serves to motivate and retain a large, flexible workforce that includes a mix of employees and contingent workers.
Manage team metrics, load balancing, productivity benchmarks, and service level agreements (SLAs) across the cluster.
Partner with the recruiters and Staffing leads to understand support needs and serve as the escalation point for issue resolution.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of HR-related experience or experience in an operations environment.
Experience with internal client management.
Preferred qualifications
1 year of people management experience or equivalent experience, with a track record of maximizing individual and team performance, while maintaining a fun working environment.
Previous experience managing an operational services team and/or responsibility for large scale service delivery.
Proven experience designing and implementing new processes; a passion for process and achieving efficiencies.
Results-driven, ability to analyze metrics and data to regularly inform the strategy for achieving team objectives and managing resources.
Ability to drive efforts and projects through influence, relationships, and broad knowledge base with recruiting domain knowledge specifically.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Recruiting Coordinator Lead

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Our customers are operating and competing in an increasingly globalizing world - this implies tremendous opportunities, but simultaneously comes with a number of unique challenges. Google’s global reach and in-depth market knowledge uniquely position us to support our advertisers along the various steps of their international growth journey. 

As an expert on international expansion processes/success factors and member of a global network that you can leverage, you are a trusted advisor and partner to our customers. From strategic planning support, identifying the right target markets, to setting customers up for success within their non-domestic footprint, you provide insights and hands-on support and help them reach and exceed their international ambitions.

Working closely with our advertisers, you develop a deep understanding of their business needs, objectives and decision processes. Your entrepreneurial spirit, communication skills and and analytical abilities allow you to identify the biggest levers for success, and present unique insights that shape your customers’ plans. Based on your knowledge of online media and in-depth understanding of our product suite, you create Google-caliber solutions that turn these plans into results.Responsibilities
Build thorough knowledge related to advertising on Google, Google Display Network, Google+, and YouTube.
Understand your customers’ objectives, and help them achieve these by developing forward-thinking, data-driven export recommendations and by educating them on wider export-related topics and opportunities.
Identify high-impact export opportunities based on existing frameworks and tools, and develop new ideas and approaches to drive export growth for your assigned portfolio.
Implement campaigns and monitor/improve impact against customer objectives.
Contribute to growing export acumen and resources within Google, and support other members in your network by sharing knowledge about your own market.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak English and an additional language fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or PhD.
First-hand experience working in multinational environments.
Proven track record in advertising sales and media account management. Understanding of the digital advertising market, technical product aptitude and strong analytical skills.
Consulting or advisory background.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
Fluency in English and French.
title: Export Specialist, Americas

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.Responsibilities
Evaluate skill level and manage offer process including reference checks.
Ensure hiring manager and team are prepared during the interview process and that interviews are conducted in an efficient and professional manner.
Manage candidate process and act as a candidate advocate.
Develop client management expertise.
