BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant staffing experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with recruiting information/applicant tracking systems
Experience in developing client management.
Experience from an executive search or a well known agency, especially experience in markets/industry mapping.
Demonstrated strong administrative skills; proficiency in spreadsheet software and documents.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on tact and diplomacy.
title: Recruiter, Global Business Organization

text:
At Google, we don't shy away from big, crazy ideas--and that's not just in our products. We aim to foster the healthiest workforce on the planet and our Benefits team is behind the wheel, driving these efforts. From retirement planning to financial literacy courses to healthy living campaigns, our Benefits team runs programs that are designed to keep our global Googlers healthy and happy. With more than 60 offices across the world, you're able to swiftly maneuver through the complexity of serving different legal and cultural practices, while also finding creative opportunities for giving our Googlers equitable support. You'll build an understanding of what "wellness' truly means to each Googler, and implement innovative programs as the population of Googlers grows in size and diversity. You are a mission-driven, enthusiastic team player with the creativity to develop and manage benefits programs.
As a Benefits Specialist, you will be charged with many tasks related to all things health and welfare. You think holistically and strategically about benefits and are able to multi-task. You establish solid working relationships with peers, cross-functional teams, carriers, and vendors. You are able to cultivate and influence relationships. Often times you will float across different areas within health and welfare to provide assistance and project management to drive important initiatives to completion.Responsibilities
Evaluate and determine the validity of the request for accommodation. Make a determination on the type of accommodation being requested and determine if it is reasonable within the parameters of the job description.
Work closely with leaders to educate and advise them on appropriate action to be taken when a request is made and a clear understanding of responsibilities throughout the entire process, start to finish. Act as a liaison and advocate for the employee to ensure compliance with identified accommodations.
Communicate with the requesting employees, their role and responsibilities in gaining approval for and implementation of their submitted request.
Evaluate and determine the type of accommodation that will be made, if appropriate, including, reassignment to a vacant position, acquiring or modifying equipment or devices, modified work schedules, etc. Follow through on required accommodations and ensure compliance by responsible personnel and determine if the accommodation places an undue hardship to implement.
Ensure all related documentation required from the employer is supplied to the appropriate parties, both internal and external, in order to make a comprehensive determination on the outcome of the request.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant experience in HR, Consulting or Business.
Project management experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in managing vendor related integrations.
Experience in leave management.
Proficient in ERISA, IRS, DOL, FMLA, ADA, and other federal, state and local laws.
Ability to assess the bigger picture strategically, think outside the box, and implement team goals/objectives across the organization while managing details. Ability to work in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.
Very strong analytical skills with ability to analyze metrics, research, and trends.
Skilled at establishing relationships and working collaboratively across multiple offices, geographies, and worldwide time zones often via email and video.
title: Benefits Specialist, Accommodation and Accessibility

text:
The gTech Ads team is a solution-generating force that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. In addition to troubleshooting on the customer side, we work with Sales, Product and Engineering teams within Google to develop better tools and services to improve our products based on the evolving needs of our users. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.
As a manager on the gTech Ads Platform Dedicated team, your pod is comprised of savvy Ads Solutions Consultants and Ads Solution Engineers. You will require adept people and client management as well as technical skills in this role. You will work closely with a list of top clients across the plan, pitch and implement portions of the process. In addition to serving as an escalation point for your team and tracking your team’s performance metrics, you will work hand-in-hand with your Sales counterparts to assist promoting product usage and identifying opportunities for your book of business. While developing strategies to increase efficiency and improve service performance for your team, you will in parallel partner with Global Support and Product Operations teams to improve the DoubleClick Digital Marketing platform team as a whole.Responsibilities
Manage and motivate your team of Ads Solutions Consultants and Ads Solutions Engineers to provide high-touch, solutions-oriented service for Google’s largest Agency and Advertiser clients.
Partner with and motivate your team to drive business growth and high customer satisfaction by maximizing our clients’ success with our products.
Analyze data, trends and team performance to drive ongoing service improvements and programs.
Manage client escalations (serving as final escalation point), engaging necessary resources and drive resolution.
Partner tightly with Sales to promote business growth with your book of business as well as work with Global Support and Product to provide client feedback for our products and workflows.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
MBA.
3 years of experience working Online Advertising, Media Planning or Marketing role with DoubleClick products or other ad server (such as Atlas, Vindico, or Mediamind).
3 years of client facing experience, demonstrated creative problem-solving approach, demonstrated technical aptitude and strong analytical skills with proven results.
Experience managing people or demonstrated strong aptitude for people management.
Ability to handle fast-paced environments with effective time-management, prioritization as well as excellent communication skills.
title: gTech Ads Platforms Dedicated Pod Manager

text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
Google for Work (formerly Enterprise) is one of the fastest growing Product Areas in Google. You will be in a group that works on delighting Google for Work users, partners, IT administrators, and independent software developers.

You will help Google build next-generation web applications like Gmail, Google Search, Google Maps, Google+, and other Google Apps for Work. Our engineers work with User Experience (UX) researchers to build the best User/Admin/Developer experience - fast, elegant and extensible - using various UI components, libraries, tools and the newly launched Material Design.Responsibilities
Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s products.
Build the libraries and frameworks that support large, complex web applications like Gmail, Google Search, and Google Maps.
Optimize web applications to maximize speed and scale. Support diverse clients from high powered desktop computers to small mobile devices.
Write client-side code for web-based applications, create fast, easy-to-use, high volume production applications, and develop prototypes quickly.
Work closely and efficiently with our UX researchers and designers. Identify and communicate best practices for front end.

Minimum qualifications
Experience with AJAX, HTML and CSS.
Experience in either Android or iOS native Mobile app development.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with web libraries and frameworks such as AngularJS, Polymer, and Closure.
Experience with one or more MVC framework.
Experience in desktop/mobile and browser development. An interest in user interface design.
title: Front End Software Engineer

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Account Manager, you'll manage relationships with Google's clients, which means you are proactive, able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, and sales-focused to help expand the client relationship. Additionally, you're an advisor and consultant, as well as a client advocate within Google. Above all, you are responsible for meeting your goals.Responsibilities
Manage client relationships.
Coach and develop junior members of the account management team.
Manage operations within the Sales team, aligning workflow among team members to execute complex initiatives and ensure accountability to team goals.
Develop forward thinking, data-driven analysis and recommendations that align with client goals and quantify high impact opportunities with clear recommendations to clients.
Serve as a liaison to clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities while ensuring that clients are satisfied with their business growth.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience managing digital advertising campaigns for clients, with a focus on Search Engine Management (SEM) and AdWords.
Preferred qualifications
AdWords certified with experience in Search Marketing.
Ability to strategically think and analyze the needs of clients.
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Advanced level of proficiency in spreadsheet and presentation tools.
Excellent business sense, problem solving, project management and analytical skills.
title: Account Manager, Telecom Vertical

text:
Business Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Business Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. A master juggler working of multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to tackle big picture challenges.As someone who knows the workings of the core Finance team inside and out, you'll lead individual projects to transform planning, tracking and control processes. You'll provide senior level management with insightful recommendations, planning and reporting support.
Advanced Technology and Projects (ATAP) is a fast-paced, project-focused innovation group. Projects are developed and executed at the intersection of an emerging trend in technology/science with a compelling, differentiating consumer capability, application or product. Googlers working at ATAP can expect to work on a team that delivers demonstrations and user experiences that appear magical, simple and wondrous - on seemingly impossible timelines.
You will help to ensure that ATAP makes sound business and financial decisions. As a Lead Business Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or helping to come up with a pricing strategy for a product, will be used by the team to determine the direction that a project will take including future investment decisions. You will be in a position to work on multiple projects at a time and will also have to balance being in the details with being strategic.
In this role, you will become an integral member of the wider ATAP Strategy and Partnerships team. This team is a close business partner to many of the projects that ATAP has running. The team is in a unique position to help shape the future of all these projects and businesses.
You are a well-rounded top performer who will be a key contributor in a fast-paced, high-growth environment and have a solid foundation in business analytics, pricing and strategy. You are excited to work within a start-up type environment and to be called upon to work on different projects and wear different hats as required. This is a small team and you’ll shine with your outstanding analytical skills and pricing expertise, ability to foster ruthless prioritization, and your clear and concise communication style. You have a chance to shape the future.Responsibilities
Develop a deep understanding of each project’s industry area to be able to do educated work.
Be a core team member for partnerships agreements at Google, including advising on business models and pricing.
Be the go-to person when it comes to business modeling and pricing discussions.
Create strategic recommendations based on a strong analytical approach.
Work across Google cross-functionally to help structure and execute analyses required to develop pricing and business recommendations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of work experience in a pricing, financial, or consulting related capacity.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Experience at a management consulting firm or in corporate strategy roles.
Experience with presenting to senior management.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills and impeccable business judgment, with professional distinction in thought leadership and innovation.
Ability to clarify and summarize complex issues. Detail-oriented skills.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Lead Business Analyst, ATAP

text:
Commodity Managers work with Engineering teams to make sure Google has the supplies and equipment to put into production the innovative products coming from our Engineering teams. As a Commodity Manager, you use your wide industry knowledge and strategic supplier relationships to optimize our total cost of ownership for our global -- and growing -- infrastructure. The scale at which Google operates means that savings on just one piece of hardware can have a huge impact on Google's bottom line.
You will be responsible for all aspects of supplier development and ongoing performance management to Google's cutting edge technology and business needs. You will develop and execute Google's sourcing strategy for our networking hardware, in support of our infrastructure deployment that powers all of Google's services. You will be expected to lead and participate on large projects, as well as understand and resolve complex issues that put company objectives at risk. You will be a key part of an end-to-end supply chain team that drives continuous improvement and ensures operational excellence in support of Google's rapid growth.Responsibilities
Develop commodity strategies and execute on them.
Lead cross-functional teams through robust supplier selection for new platforms.
Conduct high-level negotiations and secure comprehensive agreements with supplier executives.
Maintain high level of industry expertise and supplier/market conditions.
Manage supplier performance in cost, quality, delivery and technology alignment. Implement "best in class" supply chain improvements.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of relevant commodity management or supply chain management experience in related industry.
Preferred qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering or other relevant science, or MBA degree.
10 years of commodity management or supply chain management experience in a high-tech, Networking or telecom industry.
title: Networking Systems, Commodity Manager

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
This is a research-oriented and creative position that requires a sharp, analytical mind and an entrepreneurial spirit. Armed with deep knowledge of Google products, marketing trends and individual client needs, you'll brainstorm, develop and refine compelling, customized sector analysis and opportunity forecasts, then deliver them to the Sales team. Your primary goals as an Export Consultant are to capture a given target audience with innovative Google tools and refine how we position export opportunities in an integrated way to achieve our Sales team's objectives. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Responsibilities
Quantify high impact export opportunities across the industry to accelerate export across portfolios and drive changes end-to-end.
Develop forward thinking, data-driven recommendations that align with client objectives.
Train internal teams and external customers on export related export opportunities.
Develop smart, integrated, research-based proposals and presentations to enhance Google's reputation as a consultant and partner with clients.
Provide leadership, decision-making frameworks, analytic guidance and business judgment to drive projects.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Turkish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or advanced professional degree
Experience of thought leadership in applying data driven models that have had a tangible impact on sales and marketing operations across international markets.
Strong technical proficiency with SQL, experience working with large datasets and solving problems with data.
Understanding of the digital display marketplace
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, self-starter.
title: Export Consultant, Global Expansion Team (Turkish)

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.As a key member of the team, you manage projects in multiple areas with your expertise. You also monitor the performance of vendors working on projects and evaluate new technologies.
You will assess the image quality performance of our on-orbit satellites. You will perform sensitivity studies to determine how raw different image quality metrics and system calibration parameters impact our end product image quality. You will develop calibrations and Concept of Operations (CONOPS) recommendations in order to most efficiently improve end product image quality. You will help implement automated calibrations within the Google infrastructure.Responsibilities
Assess the image quality performance of our on-orbit satellites.
Determine which calibrations yield the most improvements on end product image quality and determine the recommended frequency of those calibrations.
Generate and validate calibration algorithms.
Automate Calibration algorithms on the Google infrastructure.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Optics, Physics, or related fields, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in Optics and programming.
Experience with Fourier analysis, statistical analysis, data fitting, image quality assessment, and calibration of imagery.
Experience automating processes and running computational jobs on a distributed system.
Preferred qualifications
C/C++ Experience.
Experience with 2-D CMOS or CCD sensors.
Optical imaging lab experience.
Excellent MATLAB and/or Python skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
title: Imaging Scientist, Skybox

text:
Google for Work helps companies the globe over be more productive, mobile and collaborative by "going Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. You lead the development and implementation of web-based applications to new Google customers. You lead all aspects of web development, requirements gathering, software development, testing, documentation, training, implementation, ongoing support and maintenance for both in-house and customer-facing web applications. You will work closely with a cross-functional team of Googlers, using UI and functional specs/prototypes as input. Be part of helping businesses the world over succeed by getting Googley.
As a Prototype Engineer, you will identify and prototype the next big products for Google for Work. Operating as a collection of small fast paced startups, this high visibility team is pushing the boundaries of what businesses can do with Google’s help. Our prospective product areas include a broad spectrum from Sales and Marketing Platforms to BigData analytics to Internet of Things to Google Glass for Work. Our team includes Engineers, Technology Managers, Business Analysts and is chartered with delivering solutions. We ideate, design, develop, and launch novel, business-generating products.
You play a critical role in development and implementation of new Google products for Work. You will work closely with Technology Managers, UX and Analysts to jointly develop solutions to some of the most challenging problems in the business world - while using the most innovative approaches and platforms available at Google. You will lead all aspects of system design, prototype development, testing, documentation, training, implementation, and initial support and maintenance. Best products will be “graduated” to its own autonomous mini business units. You will also work directly with our business customers and end users, and see the impact of your work first-hand.
You are an outstanding developer who is excited to work in a fast-paced, startup environment. You have a proven track record of delivering robust business applications using web technologies. You are capable of designing and developing significant new functionality under time pressure and sometimes ambiguous initial requirements. You are excited about the agility and speed of developing new tools and systems, building in flexibility to accommodate evolving business needs. You operate with a “user-first” mentality, anticipating their needs, and upholding adoption as your primary metric. You are not afraid of being close to your users and open to input and rapid iteration to get the best solution as quickly as possible.Responsibilities
Design and develop rapid prototypes of the web-based, mobile-friendly and/or back-end applications to enhance the cross functional business processes and Google customer experience.
Collaborate with other Google for Work Engineers on code reviews, internal infrastructure, and process enhancements.
Manage the graduation of the prototypes to production, ensuring scalable and reliable operation.
Evaluate third-party tools, data, and platforms for potential inclusion into Scaling systems. Manage the integration of such resources into your products.
Interact with end users actively to gather immediate feedback and convert into rapid iterations of the tools/systems you oversee.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience building web applications using JavaScript, Java, or Python.
Experience with HTML, XML/XSLT/JSON, HTTP and SSL.
Preferred qualifications
Experience building on cloud platforms such as Google App Engine (GAE), AdWords Select (AWS), etc.
Experience in database design and SQL, data analysis and modeling.
Experience with modern client-side/API technologies such as AngularJS, AJAX, cookies, REST, JSON/XML, CGI/Java/ASP servlets.
Familiarity with Google for Work business and products.
title: Prototype Engineer, Google for Work

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
In the fast-moving world of Payments, Google has been and will continue to lead and innovate. From the original Google Near Field Communication (NFC) Wallet in 2011, to the current suite of online payments products available for users and merchants, Google is committed to creating better user experience to streamline commerce on mobile devices.
Google's strong partnerships with key players in the ecosystem is a valuable asset to our success in revolutionizing payments. As Head of Business Development, you have the opportunity to foster enduring partnerships with our top partners. You will shape and negotiate partnerships that allow your cross-functional Product and Engineering teams to deliver innovative user experiences. You will cultivate partnerships to ensure they optimize and enable Google's ever-growing suite of payment offerings. You possess strong negotiation skills and relationship-building skills. To achieve your goals you will leverage project management skills and demonstrate an ability to work seamlessly across functional areas.
You will have the opportunity to build and manage a team, drive strategy and deliver innovative new business relationships between Google and major players in the Payments space. You will have accomplished partnering and relationship management skills, be an experienced people manager and a natural cross-functional leader, and bring relevant experience and an extensive network in the issuing and network community. You will also have deep product sensibility and the ability to communicate effectively with both business and technical leaders.Responsibilities
Identify and lead strategic discussions with potential partners and manage existing partners.
Explore new market segments and develop strategies to engage in those segments.
Represent Google publicly at conferences and in the press with regards to education and our applications.
Provide direction for the efforts of a cross-functional internal team (Product team, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Legal, and top executives).
Lead relationships and partnerships at other leading payments companies.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master's degree.
4 years of work experience in an Internet or consumer technology startup environment in business development, partner management, product management or product marketing.
Experience in identifying partners and structuring complex contracts, with a proven track record of negotiating and executing agreements.
In-depth experience operating within and leading cross-functional teams.
Significant background in mobile product, payments industry or online commerce.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to formulate and articulate contractual, technical, financial, and value points with partners and internal Google teams.
title: Head of Business Development, Payments

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Business Intelligence Analyst, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
Business Intelligence Analysts within the Google for Work Solutions group are responsible for building the data infrastructure that allows sales and support for Google for Work’s products to scale. You will look at the big picture within the Google for Work group, and ensure that the data in our systems and processes is well defined, accurate and available.
As Business Intelligence Analyst, you will work closely with our engineers to deliver a set of master data, backend infrastructure, Extract, Transform, Loads (ETLs) to build a world class data warehouse. You bridge technical and business worlds as you design technologies with creative and prolific engineers, and represent a cross-functional team from Google for Work Sales and Support. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed to deliver for our customers. You’ll be involved in projects from inception to delivery, ensuring that your reporting delivers high-quality and relevant data to intelligently grow our business.Responsibilities
Work closely with Finance, Sales and support management, and their teams to understand their information needs, ensuring that Business Intelligence (BI) solutions are an excellent fit to their evolving needs and helping develop their own related skills and capabilities.
Complete data analysis and root cause analysis to identify opportunities to improve our data infrastructure and workflow processes.
Own and deliver multiple BI work streams, both on an ongoing and ad-hoc basis.
Write requirement documents and work with Engineering to design data schemas for transactional and analytical systems.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience
Experience with databases including database design and SQL coding across standard commercial databases (e.g., Oracle, Teradata, MySQL, etc.).
Preferred qualifications
Product management or consulting experience (internal or external).
Experience in Web-scale databases, Hadoop, or NoSQL technologies and in related underlying technologies such as JavaScript, App Engine (or other cloud platforms).
Knowledge of standard finance and CRM systems (e.g., Oracle, Salesforce) together with knowledge of core sales and support processes.
Knowledge of commercial and emerging reporting tools and technologies (e.g., Tableau, QlikView, MicroStrategy, Business Objects, Cognos or D3).
Distinctive problem-solving and analytical skills, combined with strong business acumen; demonstrated ability to multi-task and apply initiative and creativity on challenging projects.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Google for Work Solutions

text:
Google's legal department is at the center of an information law revolution, and you're at its core. As a Legal Assistant, you are a driving force behind the success of your Legal team, ready to roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, conduct legal research and coordinate communications across the team. As you closely support your team, you may find yourself working with multiple groups within the Legal Department, internal clients across Google, and external parties. You're an independent thinker who isn't afraid to ask questions, and you're organized in a way that never overlooks the details.
As Compliance Analyst - Ethics and Compliance, you will support a diverse range of key compliance processes at Google: competition compliance, conflict of interest and other ethical standards under the Google Code of Conduct, and our ethics and compliance awareness program.

You will be a key contributor working to maintain program efficiency and effectiveness, including data collection and analysis of metrics, use and development of tools for workflow management and analysis, and reporting. You also demonstrate excellent ethical and business judgment.Responsibilities
Support the due diligence process for third party data protection, including assessing risk, negotiating agreements, working with internal stakeholders, and preparing documentation for presentation to internal and external auditors.
Provide general support to competition, Code of Conduct, and awareness functions.
Support the development of internal tools, policies, websites and processes.
Create and analyze metrics to evaluate risk, assess program efficiency and effectiveness, and develop recommendations to improve compliance programs.
Perform other project management functions for compliance programs, including delivering live trainings and distributing communications.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in project management and business processes/systems.
Ability to speak and write English fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Robust experience with case/project management and business processes/systems.
Experience with contract drafting and negotiation.
Attention to detail, and ability to multitask and manage time and priorities
Passion for technology and a technical background.
Exceptional interpersonal skills and a commitment to professionalism and collegiality.
title: Compliance Analyst, Ethics and Compliance

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
In your role as Global Infrastructure Manager you will successfully lead, manage and develop a team that designs, engineers, deploys and maintains the copper/fiber plant as well as the space, power and cooling needs for the Google corporate enterprise. You will be accountable to identify risk, dependency and resource (human and material) needs in the deployment of this project. Along with your team, you will work to craft successful cross-functional working relationships with key customers to document and agree on global standards. Your team will be dependent upon your success to minimize the issues that hamper their productivity and keep everything moving in an environment where change is the norm!
Responsibilities
Build a global team capable of successfully executing your mission. Define, implement and demonstrate progress on a maturity model for your team.
Ensure development and maintenance of road-map for global copper and fiber plant. Prioritize and successfully complete all assigned and self directed projects and work with vendors around new technologies.
Manage moves and remodels outsource project teams. Document, track and anticipate augmenting capacity for space, power, cooling and cable plant for Google infrastructure to include offices, data centers, labs, server rooms, campuses, etc.
Partner with customers to document and agree on global standards, and be involved with capacity monitoring and Interface with real estate globally.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Large company/corporate experience.
Experience with many of the following: long term planning, people management, infrastructure deployments, copper, cable plants, construction sites, fiber optics, networking (high level understanding, able to sit with engineers).
title: Global Corporate Infrastructure Manager

text:
Finance Project Managers drive critical priorities for Google by leading and assisting in projects of all sizes. Drawing from your strong financial background, you work with a diverse team to manage projects from concept to implementation and keep Google-wide stakeholders informed as you go. You get down into the details of complex analyses without losing sight of the overall objective. When working on multiple projects at once, you intuitively know which issues to highlight and can bring key decision makers together to come up with effective solutions. Once a project is completed, you're able to clearly communicate the results and draw the key learnings for senior management. You are efficient and organized, making the most of everyone's abilities and holding the team to a high standard.
Individual may not also be acting as the licensed individual for any other mortgage entity while working with Google.
Responsibilities
Identify external mortgage industry trends and communicate these internally, informing our strategy in this sector.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years as a licensed loan originator, or as an originator with a financial institution (bank, credit union, etc.).
Preferred qualificationsCompleted National NMLS exam, including credit for the Uniform State Test (UST) portion.
5 years of mortgage experience.
Proven knowledge and technical expertise within the mortgage industry.
Good understanding of compliance and industry regulation guidelines.
title: Mortgage Specialist (Part-time)

text:
The Creative Lab is a small team of designers, writers, programmers, filmmakers, producers and business thinkers whose mission is to remind the world what it is they love about Google. Our job is to make Google’s magic more magical, help advance and invent Google’s future, and to communicate Google’s innovations, intentions and ideals in ways that makes us all immensely proud.
As a Team Lead in the Creative Lab you are the driving force behind projects. Your role is similar to a startup founder/CEO. You’ll focus on creating new experiences and helping to solve real problems for users. This may involve the development of products and features, the creation of marketing campaigns, advertising, and UX or UI explorations. You are a strategic thinker with outstanding management skills who is fluent in the fundamentals of marketing, fully conversant in Google's products, and deeply excited by the potential of technology to change the world. You have the ability to create velocity in multiple workstreams while keeping them execute and remain strategically on course. You are able to articulate the business value of a project. You will be as excited by getting into the minds of users as you are identifying the magic in the products. You'll work closely with product managers, designers, producers, writers, external partners, production teams, legal/business affairs, and others to own, drive and execute a wide range of initiatives.Responsibilities
Develop strategy/write and oversee briefs that inspire creative and effective initiatives.
Manage the direction, pace, output and overall success of projects by understanding and owing the business context, simplifying, reducing and clarifying project goals, guiding and contributing to the creative process, owning the outcome and having a clear point of view and driving the process forward.
Build strong bridges with and across Google’s Product teams, Marketing, Research and UX.
Collaborate with and manage agency partners (creative, media, design, research, fabrication).
Partner very closely with Creative Lab (CL) creatives and producers in shipping output.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
10 years of experience managing marketing projects with major brands.
Experience working in an environment that’s focused on creative output (design agency, production company, media brand, advertising agency) or a startup.
Demonstrated capacity for developing and executing on marketing plans with an online component.
Aptitude for determining optimal way to position Google's products and brands in the market. Fascination with technology and its potential to create positive change.
Proven track record of successfully managing cross-functional teams and agencies.
title: Team Lead, Creative Lab

text:
Being a Talent Channels Lead/Manager at Google means finding people in hard-to-reach places. Like finding needles in a haystack, our team of sourcers are responsible for discovering the most talented people in the world. As a sourcer on one of our functional staffing teams, you play the role of detective -- tapping into all kinds of tools and resources to uncover the best untapped talent out there. Once spotted, you engage with these passive candidates, learn about their aspirations and interests and help them connect with roles, projects and opportunities at Google. You are both scrappy and resourceful, are able to listen to what candidates have to say and then and connect them with the Google magic. As a manager, you support team members to exercise independent thinking and make rapid progress towards goals. Working closely with your team to deliver results, you remove roadblocks and ensure that projects and tasks are appropriately resourced.
As a Talent Channels Lead/Manager, you will strategically partner with Staffing leadership to understand the nature and availability of Google’s Talent Pipelines. You will be responsible for directing the strategy and operations of a large and segmented sourcing team, and managing employees' day-to-day functions, anticipating personnel and resource issues, integrating with the business side of the company and ensuring project plans are adhered to.
You'll manage team/function metrics and performance and ensure the team's personal growth and career development. You'll also partner with recruiters and hiring managers to generate ideas, leverage resources and share information that facilitates a global sourcing strategy taking into account global trends inside and out of Google.
Responsibilities
Oversee the management and development of a team of sourcers.
Design and implement highly effective, results-driven sourcing strategies, practices, and infrastructure for current and future, global hiring needs. Develop consultative business partnerships with Directors to maintain a strong finger on the pulse of business and sourcing activities.
Develop and monitor metrics that improve sourcing efficacy and demonstrate ROI. Identify and own strategies to lift productivity.
Create and maintain a team environment of continuous improvement and self-learning with a strong focus on team efficiency and productivity.
Work with staffing analysts to track and analyze critical hiring statistics and create reports for Executives, Hiring Managers and Staffing audiences to help understand hiring trends and results for continuous improvement of sourcing strategies and processes.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience working in a Business Analytics or Staffing role.
3 years of experience leading and managing a team.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or an advanced degree in Management Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.
Consulting experience with global consulting firm.
Experience owning a sourcing/recruiting function; setting strategy, managing a team and working closely with business clients.
Strong track record of solving complex problems, designing creative strategies, and delivering significant impact as a manager; strong domain knowledge and expertise in technical sourcing/recruiting.
Demonstrated personal accountability and integrity, and an ability to build strong, productive relationships across the business.
Superb ability to consult, influence, and manage clients. Ability to drive efforts and projects through relationships and a broad knowledge base.
title: Talent Channels Lead/Manager

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Account Manager, DoubleClick Ad Exchange - Tokyo.Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Account Manager for the DoubleClick Ad Exchange in Japan, you are skilled and comfortable in data driven sales in this operational and technical role. Reporting to the Head of Sales, you are responsible for the optimization of ad spend on existing accounts, day-to-day communication with Ad Exchange buyers and the regular analysis and reporting of buyer data. You are an excellent communicator and salesperson, and you work with your Account Executive colleagues on client problem solving, delivering quarterly business reviews and building and maintaining strong client relationships. Furthermore, you work in collaboration with internal stakeholders across teams and countries to identify and create insights and best practices, as well as continually developing your presence in the Japanese market. You are proactive and organized, willing or used to acting autonomously in an appropriate manner and able to execute collaboratively across Google’s functional and regional teams.

Deep knowledge of the programmatic/RTB ads space is not required but a passionate interest in the space and willingness to learn is! You must demonstrate your ability to build client partnerships and influence their planning and decision making with your ability to develop and deliver proposals. A track record of account management (in any field) is a must.
Responsibilities
Take responsibility for smooth, optimized Ad Exchange (AdX) business across an assigned portfolio of accounts.
Act as an operational point of contact to track, escalate and resolve key customer issues for assigned portfolio.
Assist in consulting on new product launches, inventory opportunities, product commercialization and programmatic buying strategies.
Work collaboratively across business functions and regions to identify and create growth-accelerating initiatives.
Report on client and country business growth figures internally.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Business level communication in Japanese and English.

Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience in media, marketing or advertising, with a focus on display or video advertising.
Proven track record of client satisfaction and account management excellence.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
Excellent analytical skills that include the ability to see granular as well as big-picture issues.
Strong relationship building, interpersonal and organizational skills.
title: Account Manager, DoubleClick Ad Exchange

text:
The Google for Work team works to help organizations everywhere "go Google". The Google for Work Inside Sales team evangelizes Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome, to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You reach out proactively to show these customers how the Google for Work Solutions can help them become more productive, mobile and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
As a Google for Work Account Management Representative, your goal is to manage our customer installed base, driving product adoption and helping customers to solve business needs through the use of technology. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place and transform the way companies in Latin America (LatAm) work.
Responsibilities
Build campaigns for the Spanish speaking LatAm territory in order to achieve quarterly goals.
Perform inbound and outbound customer sales calls for small and medium-sized businesses. Keep thorough records of customer interactions and provide quarterly forecast projections on a weekly basis.
Leverage Google Sales, Engineering and Marketing resources and provide input on current collateral materials and ideas on how to improve them.
Engage with top partners, system integrators and influencers on the assigned territory/vertical markets in order to manage their customer base.
Engage with existing customers to ensure best use of Google solutions and increased value through strategic solution-based proposals, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in sales.
Ability to speak and write in English and Spanish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Strong track record in client SaaS/cloud software adoption.
Goal oriented and self-motivated with ability to work independently, in a distributed team environment.
Ability to balance competing priorities and manage several time-sensitive projects with minimal direction in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally at C-level within prospect companies.
title: Google for Work Account Management Representative, Spanish Speaking LatAm

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
As Head of Project Management, you will provide business operations rigor for the leadership team to plan and execute with a globally consistent approach to provide the same high quality customer experience to our advertisers. You will enable fast and sound business decision via robust analysis, insights, and planning. 

You will play a critical role in leading some of the most strategic initiatives to formulate innovative efforts to continue to push our scaled customer experience operations, and serve as the conduit to align efforts with cross functional partners. 

Examples include establishing a new functional team to reduce issue resolution time, evaluating options to best outsource specific issue types to vendors in different continents, and establishing new mechanics to capture user feedback and provide input to product teams.Responsibilities
Lead cross functional initiatives of strategic nature to the business.
Lead business goals setting, performance metrics operations, annual and quarterly planning exercises.
Drive operations related diagnostics and redesigns to drastically improve processes related to customer experience.
Act as thought partner to business partners and stakeholders.
Manage, develop, and mentor a high performing Program Manager (PgM) team.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience setting up programs from conception to implementation.
Experience in leading and building cross functional teams.
Consulting (or other analytical experience) and internet/high tech experience.

Preferred qualifications
MBA.
A passion for driving best customer experience. Social experience and Online Education experience.
Comfort with fast changing, ambiguous environment, e.g. experience working in a matrixed organization.
Engineering/technical background.
Exceptional influencing and leadership skills.
Strong, strategic problem solver.
title: Head of Project Management

text:
Google's Publisher & Distribution Solutions (PDS) team makes sure that our external partners are able to grow their businesses using Google's products. Technical Account Managers are advertising and technology experts who serve as liaisons between our biggest partners and Google's Engineering and Sales teams. They not only serve as Google gurus but also identify new opportunities where our products can better help our partners' businesses. Our suite of products is growing and PDS Technical Account Managers help us understand exactly what our partners need.
The Solutions Consultant Manager will lead individual client relationships along with managing a team of Account Managers (Solutions Consultants), serving as the primary day-to-day client contact. 

Adometry provides ad verification and cross-channel attribution intelligence, plus auditing and scoring metrics, to optimize results for the world’s leading online advertisers, publishers and ad networks. Through its SaaS-based advanced analytics, Adometry processes and analyzes tens-of-billions of impressions and advertising transactions per month to identify the true consumer purchase-decision journey. Adometry combines a scientifically proven methodology with a flexible and easy to implement solution to generate results in as little as two weeks.Responsibilities
Lead, grow, and manage a team of Account Managers ensuring correct process, client focus, and communication to create transformational performance for the client. Mange client health for a portfolio of accounts.
Lead and make decisions independently that properly balance the needs of the client and the business. Be responsible for managing client communications ranging from weekly performance meetings to quarterly business reviews through the Account Management leads/team.
Own internal communications to the cross-functional team on performance, strategies and needs. Ensure all deliverables and insights are being met and exceeded by the Account Management team, driving client success.
Develop people within the team and across capabilities by coaching, identifying areas of growth, celebrating successes, keeping an open dialogue with your team, and identifying training opportunities. Provide team members guidance, help on goal setting and performance feedback on a regular basis.
Minimum qualifications
8 years of sales and marketing functional experience, including 5 years of agency or client services leadership experience.
Experience working with Account Managers and managing escalations to resolution within the Portfolio. Experience working with Sales/Solutions teams to ensure client transition from agreement signing to engagement.
Experience running engagements with clients or equivalent experience. Experience in an Account Management role within the software and/or agency world.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working across teams to develop proof points of solution success to be shared in the sales/marketing process. Experience collaborating with Product and Sales teams to help develop key strategic services offerings.
Experience with SaaS model, online and digital advertising, offline and Media Mix Modeling.
Experience in leading cross-functional teams to achieve a shared vision/strategy.
Ability to speak to both technical and business stakeholders and users and interact at all levels of an organization.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation writing and delivery. Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to be personable yet persistent.
title: Solutions Consultant Manager

text:
At Google, our philosophy is build it, break it and then rebuild it better. That thinking is at the core of how we approach testing at Google. Unlike roles with similar names at the other companies, Test Engineers at Google aren't manual testers -- you write scripts to automate testing and create tools so developers can test their own code. As a Test Engineer, you navigate Google's massive codebase, identify weak spots and constantly design better and creative ways to break software and identify potential problems. You'll have a huge impact on the quality of Google's growing suite of products and services.
The Wireless Systems Test Engineer will design and execute test coverage to match system level wireless specification for Google and partner wireless platforms. Other responsibilities include planning test hardware and software infrastructure, automation, and analysis tools for test data related to performance of wireless systems. A broad set of wireless interfaces will be covered, including protocols for unlicensed and licensed frequency bands, as well as co-existence considerations between them.
Responsibilities
Participate in review of system specifications related to wireless interfaces, and planning of lab infrastructure and methods for measurement of the same.
Provide logistic support for purchasing lab equipment, as well as software automation investments to aid in test execution. While the main test focus will be on wireless interfaces, consideration of networking requirements to implement scalable test architectures will also be included.
Provide technical assistance to partner's development, test and manufacturing teams for wireless platforms.
Minimum qualifications
BSEE degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in specifying and executing system level wireless performance test coverage.
Experience working with radio link budgets and IP-layer throughput versus range measurement techniques. Experience with wireless protocols such as Wi-Fi, BT and LTE.
Experience with networking concepts and IP protocols. Product development experience and test experience of RF analog and mixed signal hardware platforms.

Preferred qualifications
10 years of experience in wireless testing.
Experience in Python, Perl or Tcl.
Experience with Chariot or Iperf.
Ability to work individually and in a team.
title: Wireless Systems Test Engineer, Access

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
You will lead strategic global projects that will positively impact the Customer Experience for Google’s Small- to Medium-sized Business (SMB) Advertisers. This team delivers a variety of strategic projects (e.g., annual business planning, integration of new product support models) and operational projects (e.g., launch of proactive chat or 24/7 service). You will lead the way for Global Customer Services by identifying new, impactful opportunities and executing on them. 

This is a strategic role requiring you to work with executives as well as with cross-functional and global teams. As a Customer Experience Strategy Lead, you provide project leadership, thought leadership, business judgment, and analytical insight to support customer centric initiatives globally. You have a hunger to drive strategic and operational innovation based on analytical rigor and the ability to get things done in a multi-stakeholder environment. You persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior-level executives and drive implementation, executing on your responsibilities while getting the best out of individuals throughout the company.Responsibilities
Deliver global projects to evolve and transform the customer experience for Google’s SMB customers across multiple products.
Develop compelling, insightful recommendations based on quality data analysis and lead execution against recommendations quickly, and with flawless accuracy.
Provide end-to-end leadership of projects from requirements definition to deployment, along with issue and risk management.
Engage with senior Google leaders; Partner with cross-functional teams to problem solve and provide insights that have a direct impact on the future direction of the business.
Deliver strategic projects managing communications across all organizations and levels globally.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Project management, people management or management consulting experience.
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree/MBA.
Experience in applying project management tools.
Impeccable business judgment, and professional distinction in thought leadership and innovation. Ability to manage ambiguity, work independently and be able to chart direction of projects.
Superior data modeling and presentation skills.
Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking and analytical skills.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to manage multiple and diverse stakeholders across businesses and leadership levels.
title: Customer Experience Strategy Lead, SMB Services

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.
You will join the Americas staffing leadership team where you will partner with other functional leaders and peers to develop and drive a world-class recruiting team supporting the Legal, Policy and Global Communications and Public Affairs (GCPA) organizations.

You are an excellent leader with hands-on recruiting experience and will be required to develop strong relationships across the organization, working collaboratively with clients, peers, and central teams. You work closely with the management team to develop recruiting strategies. text:

4 years of work experience.
Ability to build credibility and maintain excellent client relationships to ensure high client satisfaction.
Team player with extraordinary communication skills, and a high tolerance for ambiguity and a rapidly changing environment.

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
The Product Marketing Manager for Large Advertiser and Agency Marketing (LAAM) is at the forefront of a revolution in Marketing -- a shift from traditional Marketing tactics to new online, mobile and social strategies. Google's advertising platforms provide savvy advertisers with multichannel marketing opportunities, linking online marketing to brand impact and offline sales. The LAAM Manager shapes Google's point of view on the changing advertising landscape and supports Google's growth through effective and results-focused marketing campaigns.
You will drive marketing strategy, planning and campaign execution to support the Sales teams in driving advertising business from large advertisers and agencies. This will involve finding innovative ways to engage decision makers, educate the users of our products, promote Google's business brand and equip our Sales teams with the information and tools they need to work more effectively. You will arm the Google salesforce with marketing programs that establish fresh thinking in the industry and deepen engagement with clients. This is a cross-functional role, involving close work with PR and Sales, as well as collaborating with other Marketing teams across Google’s global offices.
Responsibilities
Ideate, develop, and execute marketing initiatives that drive Google's business.
Identify and build innovative marketing strategies and plans to drive large advertiser and agency education, engagement and product adoption.
Develop thought-leadership materials, client and executive presentations, case studies and other content designed to accelerate our business momentum and strengthen engagement with Google's partners.
Advocate Google's message, best practices and perspectives to our customers and our industry peers via events, and other client communication channels.
Lead development of large advertiser and agency value propositions, working closely with Sales and various key cross-functional teams.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Filipino (Tagalog) languages fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of consumer or business marketing experience (e.g. digital marketing) or related work experience from technology, media or consulting.
Demonstrated capacity for developing marketing strategies in a client-facing environment; expertise supporting and enabling a sales organization.
Ability to flawlessly execute large and complex events, and effectively operate in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a dynamic and constantly evolving context. Structured and proactive with an eye for constant innovation and improvement.
Demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills; a profound willingness to collaborate internally and externally.
Outstanding presentation and communication skills, with creative flair to bring fresh ideas into product positioning and marketing campaigns. Comfortable presenting to audiences of senior decision makers.
title: Product Marketing Manager, Large Advertiser and Agency Marketing (LAAM), Philippines

text:
The Brand Studio is a passionate team of creative thinkers tasked with shaping the future of Google brands by deepening the love of our users. As part of this team, you work with many kinds of creative thinkers all tasked with ensuring creative excellence across the Google Marketing landscape. Your goal is to deliver one integrated Google brand experience, and to better define the Google Marketing way. By embracing user insights, strategic thinking, and beautiful design paired with provocative execution, you strive to create delightfully intuitive (and delightfully inventive!) experiences that will define the future of our brand.
As a Media Technologies Manager within Google Marketing, you will guide advanced uses of ad technology for Google marketing campaigns, ensuring that we use the best of our own stack and others when necessarily. You will lead evaluations of our own stack offerings and provide feedback to sales and product. In doing so you will conduct tests and write POVs as pertains to ad tech uses and, as a result of our uses of media technology you will author case studies that can be used by Google Product and Sales teams.

You will also support campaign deployment when necessary, especially as pertains to implementation of tracking to unlock advanced measurements. This will occur in partnership with our ad technology and operations team both internal and at our agency. Your work will guide advanced work in the programmatic and mobile media spaces.Responsibilities
Act as primary team contact for Google Product Management, Marketing, Engineering, and other teams to inform, test, and implement product and operational improvements.
Coordinate authorship of all media case studies including as primary contact (and writer) of digital media cases studies regarding use of ad-tech, programmatic, dynamic advertising, mobile, etc.
Act as our resident mobile and video tracking expert understanding the ins-and-outs of Google ad stack and off-stack capabilities. Provide specialized technical support to internal ad campaigns pertaining to use of DoubleClick (DCM and DBM), AdMob, and AdWords.
Troubleshoot various tracking problems and utilize experience to develop solutions and document internal procedures, policies, and tutorials regarding ad tracking and targeting for DoubleClick, AdWords and Google Analytics.
Help to develop quality control, brand safety and privacy compliance monitoring systems.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
12 years of experience in digital ad operations roles e.g. as an ad trafficker in in-house or agency environment.
Experience in troubleshooting ad serving technical issues, e.g. delivery investigation and third-party rich media issues.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in working with Rich Media (Expandable, Video, Floating), Mobile, Video (VAST, VPAID) and Standard Display Ads
Knowledge of programmatic tools and tactics, such as Demand-Side platform (DSPs) and Data Management Platforms (DMPs.) Knowledge of mobile tracking platforms.
Hands-on knowledge of DoubleClick. Some working knowledge of AdWords.
Ability to understand and debug third party remarketing pixels and lists.
Ability to absorb complex technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience.

text:
The Design Producer shepherds projects through the design process by coordinating the work of UX Designers, Researchers, and Engineers. In this role, you’ll combine expert project management skills with a passion for user experience to help your team design how billions of users interact with our products. You’ll work cross-functionally and collaborate with managers, designers and engineering teams to plan projects, define milestones, assign resources, assess risks, and help projects meet deadlines. As a Design Producer, you will also manage all project-related communications to team members, leaders and other stakeholders. This job requires you to be an expert juggler, a master planner and a flexible project manager who can balance multiple projects that often span continents.
Want to make a difference in the way millions of people will use and create apps for wearables? The white-hot center of attention is wearables: the smart watches, headphones, and other devices that are really just getting underway. You can help organize the team that’s designing for this most intimate and important of spaces, and also the most challenging to work in. The age of wearable computing is upon us and Android Wear is the the forefront of creating a place for users, hardware manufacturers, and app developers to come together and make our lives simpler and better.
Android Wear's vision is helping people connect better with the people they are with while also helping them stay in touch with the rest of their world. Be part of the team that brings wearable computing to the masses and work with a great design team in the process.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require design producers to keep the big picture in focus. As the Design Producer for Android Wear, you a lead complex, multi-disciplinary project. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects span offices and time zones, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.Responsibilities
Understand strategic priorities and work with designers to make the most impact possible under tight schedules.
Collaborate with and support designers in delivering work in a way that builds trust with engineering and product management groups.
Identify team needs with regards to process, tools, documentation, etc, and implement or drive required changes to make sure designers are working at optimum efficiency.
Lead or collaborate with UX team leadership in key project decision-making, including: requirements gathering, scheduling, resource allocation, and coordination of teams and approval processes.
Provide clear communication to cross-functional team leads and senior management regarding project status, resource requirements, issues, and priorities. Proactively identify risks, prioritize them, and create plans to resolve in a timely manner.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience managing interactive, design, or creative projects (mobile experience).

Preferred qualifications
Working knowledge of project management software. Proficient with spreadsheet software (Google Sheets) or similar and Google Docs.
Strong familiarity with design tools, graphic formats and user interface technologies
Thorough knowledge of user centered design processes and iterative development processes
Proven ability to multitask, analyze opportunities, define successful approaches, and proactively solve problems
A strong sense of focus and an excellent attention to detail, while working in a very fast-paced environment.
title: Design Producer, Android Wear
