text:
Applications are due by May 1, 2015 at 11:59pm AEST. Our team will review applications on a rolling basis and it's in the candidates best interest to apply early. All hiring will be complete by July 2015. Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our search engine and tools serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.
Google is invested in increasing the number of future computer scientists and software developers, particularly those who are historically underrepresented in the field. Many aspiring computer scientists could benefit from a program that bridges the gap between academic study and a professional internship. Google wants to inspire these students to continue in the field with such a program.

With this in mind, Google announces that the 2015 STEP internships for Australia and New Zealand is now open to students who will be completing the first year of their university studies by Summer of 2015/16 and are studying computer science or related subjects. This program includes three main components: a software project, skills-based training, and professional development. 

This program is open to all qualified University students and is committed to addressing diversity in our company and in the technology industry. Students who are a member of a group that is historically underrepresented in the technology industry are encouraged to apply, including women, ethnic minorities and students with disabilities.

This summer trainee program includes:

Software Project: A 12-week development project that you will work on with a team of Googlers and other STEP Interns.

Skills-Based Training: Enhance your coding skills; get exposed to new tools and programming languages.

Professional Development: Attend ongoing technical talks by senior Googlers, additionally, learn how to enhance your resume, tackle technical interviews, and improve your presentation skills.

Mentorship: Be matched with a Google engineer, other than your manager, to guide you through your summer experience.

Fun: Social activities, community building and networking. Build a relationship with your peers.

Exposure: A unique glimpse into applying your computer science studies in a professional environment.
Responsibilities
Specific responsibilities vary by project area.

Minimum qualifications
Students must be completing their Bachelor's program between November 2017 and November 2018.
Students must be a first or second year student currently enrolled in a 4 year Bachelor's program, majoring or intending to major in Computer Science or Electrical and Computer Engineering.
Students must be attending a university in Australia or New Zealand.
Preferred qualifications
Students should have programming experience in either Java, Python, C, or C++.
Students in their second year should have two Computer Science courses.
Students in their first year should have taken one Computer Science course.
title: STEP (Summer Trainee Engineering Program) Intern, 2015

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
The Online Partnerships Group is a partner-focused organization that prides itself in providing great service, in creating innovative solutions, and most importantly, in having amazing people. The organization consists of a large and diverse global team of industry experts and our work touches clients around the world. As part of the team you will help both small and large companies set and achieve complex business strategies that allow them to succeed and thrive.
As an Account Manager you will be the face of Google for some of the company’s most important partners. You will also work on cross-functional initiatives aimed at driving global business results, product changes and increasing the efficiency and effectiveness of the team. Take part in product specialist and publisher engagement activities.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in a client facing or sales position.
2 years of experience in the online advertising industry.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working with ad servers/ad networks and yield optimizations.
Business analysis skills and experience with automated tools (including spreadsheet software, databases, etc.).
Understanding of Product Management and Marketing perspectives.
Excellent phone and in-person sales skills, with a strategic understanding of publisher and advertising industry business models.
Ability to navigate effectively within the Google organization.
Excellent verbal/written communication skills including presentation skills, with the ability to exude executive presence.

The Revenue & Intelligence Solutions team is a dedicated group of analysts focused on driving new insights and solutions around content, audience and business growth for Google’s largest and most strategic publisher partners. The mission of our team is three-fold. You'll Innovate by deploying new analyses and insights through cross-functional collaboration. You will connect by leveraging data-driven insights to build relationships with the Sales teams and their clients. And lastly, you will scale by coordinating enterprise-wide analytics initiatives across regions and markets, and productize in Ad Exchange and DoubleClick For Publishers.

Your role as a Revenue Intelligence & Solutions analyst is to generate and deliver data-driven insights to help our partners make the most of the web. You are responsible for unearthing new trends and insights for publishers, presenting the insights to publishers at the C-level, and for empowering the Sales team to speak to these trends. This uniquely-situated role as a Sales specialist allows you to show off your SQL building skills amongst a team of analysts and fellow data experts, beta-test the insights directly via a select group of client consultations and sales partners, and work with engineers and services to scale those insights more broadly.

You will report to the Head of Revenue Intelligence, Solutions & Innovations in APAC and partner closely with your local Sales team. 

You will have a deep industry understanding of the digital advertising industry, Google’s ad product suite and a passion for using data in storytelling.Responsibilities

text:

Additionally, you will be responsible for reporting on key metrics, tracking actual progress toward forecasts, driving new business opportunities, and ensuring prompt and proper resolution of business and technical issues with the partners.

Competitive Salary Offered.

Manage projects across EMEA.

Excellent organizational, analytical and influencing skills and ability to deliver results under pressure.

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
Be part of building Global Marketing at Google, an increasingly important driver of business strategy for the company across all products from Google Search and AdWords to Chrome, Android, YouTube and emerging businesses. Strategy and Operations is a core SWAT team of business thinkers who support the Chief Marketing Officer in setting global strategy, building the operation to scale with a rapidly growing function, and optimizing business growth. Think of us as a Chief of Staff function for marketing.
As the Global Strategy and Operations Manager, you will manage planning and operational processes across Global Marketing, including performance management, budget and headcount, competitive intelligence and strategic internal consulting projects. You will have a unique view of Google’s Marketing strategy across products and regions. In this role you will work cross-functionally with key partners in Finance and People Operations, as well as be an advisor to marketing leadership. This role will provide you with the opportunity to define and build operational processes for a high-growth team, scaling marketing to be a high performing organization within Google, and an industry marketing leader.Responsibilities
Conduct business analytics to support global marketing strategy. Develop and maintain an executive-level global marketing dashboard, including business growth metrics.
Drive and also support strategic projects and initiatives.
Manage annual and quarterly planning globally, including budget and headcount processes. Coordinate quarterly executive and sales management deliverables.
Identify and develop key marketing operations processes to improve overall organizational efficiency and effectiveness (e.g. global marketing calendar).
Minimum qualifications

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience at a consulting firm, or equivalent strategy and operations experience.
Project management experience.
Preferred qualifications
7 years of experience at a consulting firm or equivalent strategy and operations experience at a company.
Strong project management experience.
Experience in marketing or tech.
Strong presentation and presentation design skills.
Strong process orientation as well as business acumen and communication skills.
title: Strategy and Operations Manager, Global Marketing

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
Google Play’s business is one of the fastest growing at Google, a truly global business built on an ecosystem of app and game developers. The Play Apps Business Development team supports App and Game developers on Google Play to further accelerate their success. The team is fast-paced, execution-oriented and impact-seeking.
As a Strategy and Operations Lead at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and user projects through their lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks, and clearly communicating with project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, timezones, and hemispheres. It’s your job to keep all of the players coordinated on the project’s progress and deadlines.
You will be at the center of a quickly growing, cross-functional team of people across multiple sites (including APAC/EMEA). In addition to the Business Development team, you’ll work with Product Management, Engineering, User Experience, Merchandising, Marketing, Operations, and Support. Your projects will span everything from internal tools and driving team goals to external facing projects in enterprise, TV, wearables, auto, third-party app quality and support. You’ll also be passionate about helping developers to be successful on Google Play.
Responsibilities
Design and implement processes that improve velocity and coordination, and identify and prevent potential failures.
Diagnose and remedy organizational, project, and process gaps and failures independently.
Structure, lead and deliver on large-scale, cross-functional projects.
Run meetings, product reviews and roadmap planning.
Communicate with and manage many stakeholders.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of program management experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Experience in applying project management tools. Experience in managing operations across multiple regions.
Experience in managing highly complex, technically challenging projects.
Track record in developing and executing business strategy. Willing and able to knock down doors to make things happen.
Ability to multitask and get things done in a fast paced environment, and strong project management skills. Can drive decisions, lead meetings/strategy discussions, define priorities, decide course of action (and adjust when it needs adjusting).
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with proven ability to collaborate and lead. Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking and analytical skills.
title: Strategy and Operations Lead, Play Apps and Games Business Development

text:
As a Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales professional at Google, you are always reaching for ambitious performance goals. You work with a wide variety of SMB advertisers to deliver the optimal advertising solution for each client. Your interest in sales and the digital economy and your entrepreneurial drive enables SMB advertisers to expand their businesses with Google's latest advertising products and solutions. Your understanding of online media combined with your commercial acumen shape how new and existing businesses grow. Using your effective communication skills, you are the face of Google to a portfolio of clients whose needs you listen to, and help define the vision and strategy for how their products and services can reach thousands or millions of users.
As the Agency Development Manager, you will provide the management, analytical power required to drive advertiser, acquisition and overall business growth of your Agency portfolio.

You'll collaborate closely with agency representatives, identify business-development opportunities, evangelize new Google products and technologies throughout the agency, and develop and manage strong relationships with agency influencers and decision-makers driving scalable product adoption and business growth across the broader portfolio of agency-managed accounts. Moreover, you will develop the acquisition capabilities of the agencies in order to accelerating acquisition business growth. 

Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how your agencies’ new and existing businesses grow. Among your many attributes, you are persuasive, gregarious, a natural leader and skilled at solving problems and explaining complex issues. You possess excellent communication and presentation skills at the senior level as well as the ability to work closely and constructively with all areas of the business. You're particularly adept at developing close, one-on-one relationships.
Responsibilities
Deliver against assigned quarterly targets on new and existing business consistently, while prioritizing and delivering an outstanding sales experience to Google's top managed agency partners.
Own and strengthen primary agency relationships from executive C/B-level down to specific account teams including Media Planners and Buyers.
Build compelling, data-driven long term agency plans leveraging internal and third-party data. Synchronize agency plans with your Agency pod and internal cross-functional teams to further develop your agencies.
Be an ongoing thought partner for the Agency Lead on strategic initiatives and agency-level planning.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in sales or marketing at an agency, technology or media company.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in advertising sales, digital marketing, consulting, media specific industry or in a fast-paced media agency environment.
Established relationships and presence within the media marketplace.
Proven track record of developing agency partners and successfully driving new agency business opportunities.
Ability to speak and write in English and Danish or Swedish fluently and idiomatically.
title: Agency Development Manager, SMB Sales (Danish or Swedish)

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Responsibilities
Develop both industry-specific and general market analysis to deliver insights regarding market and competitive trends, auction dynamics, and other data-driven analysis.
Develop and refine compelling, customized stories and then deliver them to the Sales team in advance of client-facing meetings.
Gather and use data from different internal and external sources and turn it into insights that help clients realize their opportunities.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Portuguese fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Advanced level of proficiency in spreadsheet and presentation software.
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Strong organizational skills, detail oriented, and the ability to handle multiple priorities
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Great story teller sense.
title: Industry Analyst

text:
Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind every system is the Ad Serving Operations team to make sure that happens flawlessly. As a member of the team, you are a technical consultant with the dual role of being both client-facing and growing systems from the back-end. An expert in our tools and operations, you provide support, answer field inquiries and troubleshoot client issues. Beyond client-facing issues, your expertise also gives you the insight to recommend product and system improvements to our engineering teams. Your interactions on both sides ensure that when clients advertise with Google, their back-end systems never miss a beat.
You are a Senior Business Partnership Manager who will join the gTech Ads Global Operations team. You are an influential and effective problem-solver to join our team as we work on complex problems that are global in scope and cross-functional in nature - among regions, products and functions.Responsibilities
Act as the thought partner to senior business leaders in Google to recommend and influence key business recommendations to achieve operational excellence
Structure and execute against strategic projects to solve for complex, ambiguous, and potentially charged business issues for gTech Ads
Ensure global alignment across key initiatives via close partnership with regional and business stakeholders
Dig deep into and optimize associated processes and workflows to influence global consistency, increase productivity and and improve overall operations across gTech Ads
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in management consulting or strategy roles
Preferred qualifications
Experienced team player who has shown impeccable business judgment while navigating multiple dimensions of business, process and workflow issues
Knowledge of Search, Exchange, and Brand Ads space and support ecosystem.
Exceptional partner who can partner with senior cross-functional stakeholders and influence successfully across organizational boundaries
Enthusiastic problem solver who has a solid track record in executing large scale programs across multiple regions and teams, and works well in fast-paced, dynamic environment
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage across multiple, often time-sensitive initiative.
Proven leader with superb project management, written/verbal communication, and interpersonal skills.
title: Business Partnership Manager, gTech Ads

text:
The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR stuff easy and intuitive for Googlers. Our global team optimizes people processes, from problem definition to execution. We partner with teams across People Operations and in engineering to bring innovation and technology to the way we attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide. We focus on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers, and work in Google’s fast-paced environment to deliver 100+ operational services, manage the contingent workforce and implement HR programs across 70+ countries. Regardless of location or level of experience, members of the Operations team have the opportunity to create, develop and implement some of the most complex global operations around the world.
Google is looking for a dynamic leader who is not afraid to be “hands-on” whilst understanding the bigger picture. You will be strong on data and will be able to demonstrate an affinity with the service and product space that Google owns. You should be able to balance strategic vision, thought leadership, followership, execution excellence, continuous improvement and provide an exceptional experience to Googlers. As the "eyes and ears" for everything that happens, you will need to be able to spot trends and turn them into broader change programs. Most importantly, you should be able to inspire and grow a remarkable team.
Principal clients of Google People Services (GPS) Operations include the business leaders and their HR partners in all units and functions, and all other People Operations functions. A key priority will be to establish followership among this group. Other priorities will include meeting increasing demand by scaling the organization for growth whilst maintaining high performance and delivery standards. Human resources domain experience is not required.Responsibilities
Be responsible for overall Google People Services Operations (HR Operations) for North America and LatAm, which includes operations and programs for benefits, compensation, onboarding, Googler lifecycle, learning, and contingent workforce. Partner with peers in EMEA and APAC to ensure quality of services delivered globally and provide strategic direction to the global contingent workforce operations for Google.
Drive identification, assessment, and execution of ongoing process improvement and re-engineering opportunities in terms of user experience, quality, and productivity. Drive continuous improvement in the functionality and user experience of our HR systems, tools, and reporting capabilities in partnership with our IT infrastructure organization.
Develop, articulate, and socialize mid- and long-term strategy for GPS Operations and manage analysis of process health and Googler experience alongside business leadership. Partner with global peers to develop and maintain a strategic roadmap for GPS Operations including enhancement to existing services, addition of new services, etc.
Engage in larger cross-functional programs, e.g., around process improvement, efficiency improvements, systems integration, or data quality enhancements. Act as an influencer, integrator and coach for the global GPS teams, serve as a point-of-escalation for problems within our GPS Operations organization and work with relevant parties to reach resolution.
Manage strategic relationships with third-party vendors who deliver HR services to employees on behalf of Google. Foster and maintain the relationships with vendors who provide technology solutions for our global workforce, including influencing their product roadmaps.
Minimum qualifications
Experience leading a global services organization which includes 5 years of people management experience.
Experience with implementation of process automation.
Preferred qualifications
Bachelor's or Master's degree.
Experience with socializing and presenting analysis, proposals and strategies to organizational leaders.
Proven ability to develop and continuously refine strategy and roadmap for a service delivery organization, including technology support, integration and outsourcing.
Strong track record of managing complex cross-functional projects and getting things done effectively and efficiently.
Thorough understanding and affinity to technology. A demonstrated affinity for metrics.
Strong internal client-facing skills with a flexible communication style.
title: Director, Google People Services Operations

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. The Retail Logistics team is looking for a Logistics Associate to help drive forward the hardware business in North America. On a day-to-day basis you will drive process improvement and apply general problem solving skills across our transportation, distribution and reverse logistics functions supporting North America. You will also play a key role in delivering regional elements of global projects as well as managing regional specific initiatives.Responsibilities
Identify, measure and track key logistics metrics to help drive efficiency across North America network.
Follow up and drive day-to-day problem/issue resolution as it relates to forward and reverse logistics, working with other Googlers and third party logistics (3PLs) to resolve customer escalations.
Play a key role in supporting new product launches coordinating with Retail Operations to ensure proper setup, operations and success of launch.
Organize, moderate and lead cross-functional meetings with 3PLs and transportation providers.
Lead regional improvement projects and assist in delivery of regional elements of global projects.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in a logistics coordinator role or business operations role e.g. working in a customer and vendor facing capacity.
Understanding of B2C/B2B, transportation, fulfillment and distribution operations.
Familiar with import and export processes in relation to consumer electronics devices.
Excellent time management skills with demonstrated ability to operate in a fast-paced environment and juggle ever-changing priorities and deadlines.
Willingness to travel 25% of the time.
title: Logistics Associate, Retail Operations

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Industry Manager, you'll provide advertising solutions to the largest clients in the airline sector based in Singapore. You will work closely with the Sector Head to develop Google's proposition in this exciting, strategic category. You will develop relationships with clients and agencies to build the business and develop a reputation for thought leadership and industry change. This will require you to have excellent client-servicing and relationship skills along with commercial acumen to approach and persuade new and existing customers to partner strategically with Google.Responsibilities
Lead execution of overarching Airlines business strategy, including transformative cross-functional initiatives and platforms-based strategies.
Build sustainable and strategic relationships with leading Airlines clients (including VP/C-Level) and their Media and Creative agencies.
Structure joint business plans (JBPs) for key client accounts and step-change growth levels.
Work cross-functionally within Google and collaborate on projects to drive client success.
Analyze data trends and client performance, and develop strategic recommendations that challenge the status-quo.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Sales or Business Development experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Airlines/Travel market knowledge and experience.
Experience in advertising sales/marketing, working with advertising creative and media agencies at all levels (C-Level through to daily practitioners).
Demonstrable experience and success devising breakthrough plans, and being a change agent.
Knowledge of key Google-related advertising products (Search, Display, Video, Mobile).
Consulting background.
title: Industry Manager, Airlines

text:
People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be a champion of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching our clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.
As an HR Business Partner (HRBP) on the Employee Relations and Investigations team, you will provide expert advice in preventing and resolving workplace issues in EMEA. You will work with all of our EMEA locations consulting on employee relations issues and advising HRBPs and managers on how to conduct investigations, and apply Google policies and practices. We work closely with our legal, compliance, security and human resources departments interpreting policies and procedures and advising on fair and equitable employment practices. You will play a critical role in advising on and managing complex ER investigations.
As a HRBP you will work in conjunction with the Employee Relations and Investigations team, other HRBPs, Ethics and Compliance, Security and Internal Audit to primarily advise on and conduct complex investigations including grievances/disciplinaries, hotline complaints (including anonymous complaints) in addition to advising on employee relations issues, including reorganizations and performance management. Using your knowledge of applicable local employment laws and practices, you will devise, follow and advise on appropriate protocol for EMEA based investigations and develop appropriate investigation documentation and recommendations for management. You will also interpret policies and procedures and advise EMEA based HRBPs on fair and equitable employment practices in the areas of performance management, coaching/development, compensation, organizational development and restructuring. This is an individual contributor role.Responsibilities
Provide pragmatic advice and counsel to HRBPs on general employee relations issues in EMEA.
Partner with HRBPs and other global Investigations teams to ensure that the investigation/grievance process in EMEA is handled in a fair, timely manner consistent with local requirements; assess and document local best practices for investigations, and maintain storage and access of this information for internal users. Ensure that EMEA based investigations are thorough and include: understanding of the allegations; appropriate interviews, analysis and documentation; and recommendations for conclusion and course of action.
Provide project management coordination and guidance for HBBPs and managers on EMEA based reorganizations and reorganizations encompassing EMEA countries.
Prepare, track and maintain appropriate investigation and reorganization data and documentation for EMEA based investigations and reorganizations.
Develop and provide training and guidance to EMEA HRBPs and managers regarding employee relations issues, investigations, reorganizations and managing performance, localizing existing training materials where applicable.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Employees Relations experience gained in either an HRBP role or Employee Relations Advisory role including running and advising on grievances/disciplinaries/investigations, reorganizations, performance issues or a qualified solicitor in employment law.
Preferred qualifications
CIPD qualified.
Knowledge of and experience with EMEA employment law principles.
Ability to establish strong cross-functional relationships at all levels and geographies.
Proven project management skills with demonstrated ability to manage global projects.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with ability to organize and analyze data.
Ability to listen, but also to persuasively convey opinions and recommendations both in writing and orally.
title: HR Business Partner, Employee Relations and Investigations, EMEA
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

As a Google Account Executive, you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions. Google has become a leader in this space because we've developed effective products and services targeted to marketers and consumers. The primary responsibility of the Account Executive is to drive and grow new business with Google’s top advertisers. You'll manage business relationships to ensure that the clients' needs and requirements are met. This will require you to serve as their advocate within Google while collaborating with other Google teams to provide them with a comprehensive portfolio of solutions and options. This is a client-facing sales role requiring deep industry expertise, proven ability and a broad base of industry contacts.
Responsibilities
Develop high-level relationships to serve as a trusted consultant with major customers to optimize their advertising investment.
Manage multiple cross-product opportunities and projects.
Work collaboratively with a team to drive growth with new and existing customers.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in an advertising sales, business development and/or online media environment.
Preferred qualifications
10 years of relevant experience in online sales, advertising, marketing, and business-development.
Experience working with advertisers, agencies, and/or clients.
Knowledge of and established relationships within the advertising industry and the relevant industry vertical.
Knowledge of traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
A deep understanding of the industry's issues, a vision for its growth, and a commitment to advance Google's forward-looking strategies within the marketplace.
Willingness to travel.
title: Account Executive, Technology, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Manage client relationships.

text:
This position is available anywhere in the U.S. (there is no specific location).

Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
The Google Fiber Network Operations and Engineering team is responsible for designing an efficient and reliable network and operating it at scale. As a leader in the team, you will have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You will be managing a team of top-notch engineering managers where you will be asked to promote rapid and efficient decision making and active risk management, while ensuring innovation remains in focus to ensure lightning fast deployment of the Google Fiber network. You will also ensure that our network is designed on time and within allocated budgets. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network design efficient and reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.

Google is always striving to innovate and our Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) program is no exception. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next generation Internet content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than the opportunity to frame the future of broadband. As a Google Fiber Regional Engineering Program Manager, you will participate in the creation of a FTTH design solution that involves advanced network design programs, innovative production sources and extreme design value.Responsibilities
Oversee the design of the Outside Plant Fiber Network for your region (i.e. multiple metropolitan areas), from beginning with Prelim Design through to a fully constructible job package and as-builts.
Program manage the production of efficient designs for new development, network relocations and network upgrades. Take an active part in management decisions related to the program management of the network engineering activities, through leadership and innovation.
Select, hire and manage best in class Engineering personnel for each metropolitan area.
Establish high level relationship with major third parties and ensure efficient processes are in place.
Support finance metric development, reporting and dashboard reporting.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
15 years of industry experience, in various leadership positions.
Experience in Outside Plant and Network Facilities.
Relevant experience in Program Management of capital projects and the development of processes.
Preferred qualifications
Six Sigma certification, or equivalent work experience.
Experience in leading geographically dispersed teams.
Demonstrated ability to employ good troubleshooting skills and creative problem solving abilities under pressure.
Proven ability to promote corporate vision and culture
Willing to make an impact in the U.S. telecommunication industry.
title: Regional Engineering Program Manager, Network Engineering, Google Fiber, U.S.

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Data Center Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
As a highly motivated Data Center Program Manager, you will have demonstrated experience in the area of geographically dispersed data center design, development, construction, and technical fit-out projects. Your role is to participate and/or lead end-to-end initiatives for schedule/cost/quality improvements and innovations, end-to-end change management reviews, new product introductions and global program-level, cross-functional turn ups, acting as the data center construction and delivery team subject matter expert.
You will need to work with many internal and external stakeholders to ensure all input and deliverables are executed in an organized, coordinated and timely fashion. You will be required to have very strong project management, organizational and interpersonal skills with a good understanding of data center infrastructure, hardware, and networking. You will also need to be equipped with basic electrical and mechanical knowledge so that you can manage the specialist contractors effectively.Responsibilities
Lead large-scale, program-wide projects in the areas of electrical, mechanical, and controls engineering. Manage multiple simultaneous data center projects from inception through completion.
Support special experiments and pilots, renovations, and upgrades of existing facilities.
Gather and vet internal requirements to deliver solutions that satisfy customer's needs.
Maintain end-to-end responsibility from construction to deployment including commissioning and network/IT fit-out.
Demonstrate superior performance in resolving highly critical issues within matrix organization while maintaining rigorous adherence to project timelines and costs.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience managing multi-group, multi-disciplinary projects.
25% travel.
Preferred qualifications
MS in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Construction Management or related technical field.
Certifications in CCNA, or JCNIA, and RCDD (Registered Communications Distribution Designer) certification.
8 years of relevant work experience with data center equipment/environments, including switchgear, generators, chillers, cooling towers, air handling units, controls, security systems, fire safety systems, and a working understanding of start up/commissioning processes.
Experience managing vendor relationships and understanding of standard practices in the design and construction industry, including knowledge of fast-track design-build processes and associated documents and contracts.
Experience in managing complex/phased turnover between construction teams and owner turn-up/fit-out teams. Demonstrated skills in requirements gathering, resource organization, task prioritization, scheduling, and achieving objectives on schedule and within budget.
Knowledge of data center fit-out requirements and infrastructure (cable tray, fiber, power/cooling, grounding) including IP technology.
title: Data Center Program Manager, Technical Fit-Out

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
The mission of the Google for Work Technology and Solutions (GTS) team is to deliver simple, innovative business systems that enable our business and partners to thrive. GTS works with our business, partner and project teams to build systems for all aspects of the business: business intelligence, CRM, order management, billing, sales and support systems and marketing.
In this role, you will create and lead the GTS strategic planning process for the systems portfolio of projects. You will drive the creation, management and execution of the GTS portfolio roadmap. You will manage and lead either directly or indirectly a team of systems project managers to deliver systems to our business and partner teams. You will lead efforts to define priorities and provide transparent communication to the stakeholder teams for the GTS strategy and progress. You must have an entrepreneurial spirit, a passion for collaboration and a drive to advocate for Google’s customers, both internal and external. You believe in delivering results that exceed your stakeholder’s expectations.Responsibilities
Implement a clear and transparent systems strategic planning process and foster collaboration across Google for Work business, partners, product development and systems teams.
Consult and influence our strategy to ensure superior results for our customers, stakeholders, tools, products, and processes.
Manage delivery of the overall program including simultaneous programs: define scope and expected deliverables, align stakeholders and influence decision processes, organize and drive cross-functional teams, determine success metrics, and track against milestones.
Manage risks, anticipate bottlenecks, drive program prioritization, make trade-offs, and balance business needs versus constraints.
Communicate the impact of programs to senior management. Publish documentation and best practices procedures.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
5 years of program management experience in systems or product development environment.
Experience working with senior business stakeholders.
Preferred qualifications
MA/MS/MBA degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of program management experience in systems or product development environment.
5 years of leadership experience, with demonstrated ability to motivate and cultivate a results-oriented development team, and lead cross-functional, international projects using a structured approach.
Experience working with Sales and Ordering teams, Oracle, SAP, SalesForce, etc.
Ability to understand technical architecture and learn new products quickly. Ability to lead cross-functional, international projects using a structured approach.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment across all levels of an organization.
title: Program Manager, Order Management, Google for Work

text:
When people use Google products, the servers in our data centers do the work--around the clock and around the world. For over ten years, we've been building these centers; now they are some of the most efficient data centers in the world. As part of the data center team, you will ensure that our Data Center Portfolio run as cost efficient as possible. This includes preparing / analyzing bids from contractors, conducting financial analysis, preparing budgets, and reporting costs. From negotiating bids to executing change, you will collaborate with Project Managers, contractors, and upper management to make data driven decisions on both current and future data center costs.Responsibilities
Manage all critical documents for the construction and operation of Google’s data center's in the region by the organization of data, implementation of scalable processes and the use of professional tools. Ensure all documentation is accurate and available for operations.
Administer Engineering Change Notice (ECN) process and other automated document workflows.
Provide input and guidance for the setup and compliance of document control for construction projects.
Coordinate handover of documentation between construction projects and operations.
Be a site representative for Electronic Document Management (EDM) system including access control and library management.

Minimum qualifications

BA/BS degree in Facilities Management/Construction Management or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with Windchill and Google Drive.
Experience and knowledge in document control, process management, facilities management, and construction processes.

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Android Platform Partnerships needs a strategic business developer to lead the team to drive Android and its ecosystem across Africa. As a business developer you are connected to the broadest mix of African players in the mobile industry and you analyze, engage and influence them: silicon vendors, device manufacturers, distributors, network operators, retailers, developers - and ultimately users.

You will build the networks and intelligence to keep Android's meteoric growth going throughout the continent. You will work closely with the rest of the Android Platform Partnerships team, local Google teams in Africa, Android and Google Play Engineering, Product, Developer, Marketing and Legal teams on new initiatives and key strategic relationships. You educate Google teams by seeing multiple steps ahead across the region, identifying industry trends and key influencers and translating meaning back into Google’s engineering and product focus so we can help you execute.

The Head of Android Platform Partnerships role is empowered to chart its own path, to run the process from start to finish on global terms. You open doors with potential partners, lead exploratory talks with them and negotiate. The role offers the opportunity to work with industry leading Google partners to secure broad distribution of Android devices with Google services and then manage and nurture those relationships.

You will have strong commercial, negotiation and partnerships skills and long term specific pan-mobile industry experience. You will be able to work remotely and autonomously and must also collaborate with Product, Engineering, Legal and other internal teams to initiate, support and grow the partnerships as part of the regional strategy for Android and Google expansion.
Responsibilities
Lead the Android Platform Partnerships Africa Team geographically based in South Africa, Paris and London.
Drive and execute distribution of Google services on Android devices
Identify and prioritize partner targets; become an expert on each target’s organization, business model, and strategic priorities
Work closely with other account teams at Google to develop coordinated account strategy where appropriate
Serve as ongoing Android relationship manager for partnerships in the region, realizing and optimizing further value from each one
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience of mobile industry: dynamics, players, practices and technologies.
Experience doing business in Africa negotiating partnerships.

Preferred qualifications
Experience with ongoing partner relationship management; ability to serve as an advocate for accounts internally and work collaboratively to identify opportunities or resolve issues.
International experience.
Strong negotiator with a partnership approach; ability to represent Google in discussions and structure terms to achieve strong ongoing partner alignment.
Ability to interpret legal documents and work with attorneys on specific contract language.
title: Head of Android Platform Partnerships, Africa
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
This position will be based in Mountain View, CA, Austin, TX, Denver, CO, or Seattle, WA.Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
Google Fiber highly values innovation and rapid-paced engineering to develop and design solutions for our ever-expanding Broadband Services network.
As the Manager of Network Architecture, you must build and lead a team of highly capable network architects through the development, analysis and documentation of these solutions, acting as a liaison to other lead teams across the Google Fiber organization, including Product Management, Software Engineering and Business Development. You will also guide the group’s engagement in industry forums and standards bodies, and support engagement with vendors and suppliers on architectural direction and development. You will leverage your background in Carrier and ISP technologies and principles to drive innovation and optimization throughout all areas of the network.
Responsibilities
Guide and grow the Network Architecture team in order to support Google Fiber’s ongoing focus on innovation and rapid expansion of markets.
Be the liaison with other Google Fiber teams on topics of innovation, architecture and business development.
Mentor team members in their professional development, including guiding them in engagement with internal and external groups such as other Google teams, vendors and industry bodies.
Coordinate team activities and workload through task, milestone and objective tracking along with metric reporting.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of management experience.
Preferred qualifications
Strong understanding and practical experience in the telecommunications or ISP industry, including vendors, standards bodies and operators.
Experienced people manager, including management of teams across multiple geographies.
Comfort with operating in a high-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks, manage time efficiently and navigate ambiguity.
Proven ability to lead complex and innovative architectural projects, including work across corporate functions, locations, and/or teams.
Demonstrated good leadership and people management skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
title: Manager, Network Architecture, Google Fiber Network Operations

text:
The Baseline Study is a collaborative project between Stanford, Duke, and Google that will investigate the biology and chemistry of a healthy human. The goal is to help find new, and proactive ways to detect and prevent disease. We aim to combine traditional clinical observations of health, e.g. diet and behavior, with molecular and genomic signals. The project will involve the analysis of a wide variety of data sets, ranging from clinical data to comprehensive molecular profiles.
As a Quantitative Analyst for the Baseline Study, you will perform statistical analyses of large, disparate, and complex sets of data. You will consult with other Google Life Sciences teams on studying design, identifying biological targets for new technologies, and formulating new protocols for biological measurement. The team builds analytical tools on an evolving software platform and works closely with software engineers.Responsibilities
Apply advanced statistical methods.
Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine problems.
Develop quality control and pre-processing tools for a broad range of data types.
Communicate highly technical results and methods clearly.
Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams.
Minimum qualifications
PhD in a quantitative discipline (e.g. statistics, bioinformatics, computational biology, computer science, applied mathematics, or similar) or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with R, Python, Java, C++, or similar.
Experience with statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, predictive modeling, and stochastic models.
Preferred qualifications
Proficiency with an object oriented language and familiarity with basic software engineering practices.
Domain knowledge related to one or more data types under study (next generation sequencing, microarrays, mass spectrometry). Expertise in immunology, metabolomics, or the analysis of free text health records.
title: Quantitative Analyst (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
The ZOO is an agency-like team within the Global Google Sales organization. Here we help brands maximize the creative power of Google’s platforms and technologies. The ZOO is home to all types: From creative experts and strategists, to technologists, account directors and producers, we do it all. Working side by side with Sales and Marketing teams, we help our colleagues inspire, consult and educate their clients. And with our concentrated collection of artistic and technological kills, we help top brands around the world push the boundaries of Google technology. As part of a team of Creative Technologists, you will generate a forward thinking tech-based vision for the ZOO. You'll regularly be called on to deploy your creative and technical skills on huge projects for top advertisers. In some cases you’ll be refining existing ideas or prototypes for key pitches. In other instances, you’ll have the opportunity to dream and develop cutting-edge creative technology concepts that redefine interactive storytelling. Want to tell brand stories in a whole new way? Come check out the ZOO.
Responsibilities
Collaborate on the ideation and development of “never been done before” digital experiences in partnership with top brands and agencies.
Contribute to the development of cutting edge prototypes in the field of creative technology.
Work with internal Google teams (Product, Sales and Marketing) in order to solve top brands challenges through storytelling and technology.
Provide in-house technical advisement to the Production team, Creative team and Account Directors.
Advocate ZOO solutions across the Americas Large Customer Sales organization and influence adoption of ZOO-engineered offerings.

Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Design, Computer Science or Advertising, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience leading technology and innovation projects for global brands, or a development position at a creative agency with a portfolio of original work.
Preferred qualifications
Deep experience working with external production companies/vendors to produce ground-breaking work.
Expert knowledge of web languages and technologies (e.g. JavaScript, HTML 5, CSS3, ActionScript 3, Java/Android).
Working knowledge of creative languages and technologies (Processing, Open Framework, Arduino).
Demonstrated ability to contribute to creative ideation and prototyping of innovative storytelling.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and balance multiple projects simultaneously in a scrappy, start-up atmosphere.
title: Creative Technologist, The ZOO

text:
This role will be based in Charlotte, NC.
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Field Operations Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You have strong interpersonal, analytical and communication skills. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.Responsibilities
Lead and manage build teams to excel in the last mile deployment of Google Fiber’s Multi-family Dwelling Unit (MDU), Small and Medium Businesses (SMB), and Community Connection construction across the market/metro area.
Manage program goals, scope, schedules, budget, contracts and vendor resources to ensure timelines and production costs are aligned across multiple markets. Implement and manage QA/QC, risk register and action items. Report production and quality metrics with informative analysis on daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Establish scalable tools and processes across markets that monitor contractor performance including quality control, appropriate forecasting of building resources, billing against budget, and contract. Work with and communicate progress to internal stakeholders and ensure that projects are scoped properly and handed off seamlessly for network deployment.
Work closely with cross-functional teams including Google Fiber Outside Plant/Network Operations/Sales/Business/Customer Service in coordinating all project activities, resource requirements and business goals. Work with product suppliers and the Google Fiber supply chain to ensure material quantities are met and ensure everything meets Google Fiber design specifications.
Prioritize and multitask projects and see them through to completion, as individual and team contributor. Set team goals and foster innovative and creative work environment.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of contract and program management experience in the telecommunications or infrastructure industry.
5 years of experience building teams and managing direct reports.
Preferred qualifications
Bachelor's degree in electrical, mechanical, civil engineering or other field, MS or MBA degree.
PMP or PgMP certification.
Experience in scaling processes for new business/start-up.
Knowledge/experience with project management tools such Primavera P6.
Knowledge of FTTH technology and industry.
title: Field Operations Manager (Inside Plant), Google Fiber, Charlotte

text:
Google's Hardware Operations (Hardware Ops) team consists of diverse, upbeat, creative, team-oriented engineers and managers who operate and deploy some of the most sophisticated systems in the world. This team is responsible for defining and analyzing our key business metrics and trends, and reporting on them to the entire organization. text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include APAC Quality Assurance Lead - Tokyo.
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
Shoulder-to-shoulder with Operations experts, you’ll continuously be fine-tuning our quality framework to improve customer experience and satisfaction. You’ll work hands-on in our operations by performing and auditing quality reviews and performing in-depth analysis on the impact of quality, as well as helping us prepare for new launches and other initiatives to ensure our agents are world-class. Your enthusiasm will be vital for advocating for these initiatives with internal process owners and vendor partners in the call centers. You will coordinate closely with contact center vendor partners to achieve goals. You’ll boost our global push for consistently superior customer support experiences that resolve issues not just quickly and accurately, but in a Googley way. Your deep understanding of our product portfolio, your scaling approach, and your expertise with metrics will support your success. 

As an Asia-Pacific Region (APAC) Quality Assurance Lead, you will be the expert who ensures that call/contact center vendor partners and their service agents who support Google’s customers have the right knowledge and skills to provide world-class service. The scope of support is for the Google Play Store, Google Wallet and Google’s hardware devices across APAC.

At our contact centers, we insert a layer of quality assurance to make sure the customer experience is consistent with our high standards. You’ll work with our team's vendor managers and the leadership teams at our vendor partners to develop and maintain impactful QA programs. You will also function as a quality expert and consultant to the rest of the Consumer Operations organization, using data to interpret quality-related trends and influence projects across the organization.Responsibilities
Monitor QA program implementation with our Vendor Partners, including calibrating on QA audits to ensure quality standards are being evaluated fairly and consistently.
Report, analyze, and provide insights on our quality performance and programs (regularly and ad hoc) for cross-functional stakeholders and use this data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
Innovate on our existing QA programs and processes continually.
Act as a liaison and champion for quality while working with cross-functional groups of internal team members and vendor partners to improve quality and CSAT performance.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant work experience in a quality control or quality management role.
Ability to speak and write English and Japanese/Korean fluently and idiomatically.
Ability to travel 30% of the time to administer programs in person and meet with necessary stakeholders.
Preferred qualifications
Customer support and call/contact center knowledge and experience, including call center structure, tools, training, and quality processes.
Experience working on consumer products (software and/or hardware) in a documentation, communications, training, or quality assurance capacity.
Proven ability to teach complex information in an effective, engaging manner. Work with vendor management and service center agents in a positive, productive way that encourages collaboration.
Skilled in creating quality assurance processes that accurately audit performance and inform future training. Proven success in project management and execution, multi-tasking and delegating.
Forensic skills and attention to detail when crafting operations and processes. Ability to foresee and fix process gaps.
Excellent written, verbal, and public speaking skills. Ability to work effectively cross-functionally with proven track record of driving results.
title: APAC Quality Assurance Lead

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. text:
The mantra of the User Interface (UI) team is: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." As a UI Designer, you have a strong technical background and work closely with Engineers and Product Managers to design products that are simple but great for the user, focusing on interaction and visual design. Work with other UI designers to define the user model and interface for various Google products.

Work with other designers, engineers, product managers to build better products.

Experience designing for both native software and for the web.
Demonstrated experience in designing usable web-based interfaces.
Strong, clean visual design sense.
Excellent leadership, communication and teamwork skills.

text:

The Global Online Sales team is responsible for increasing the business growth coming from the online channel for Google Apps, through SEO/SEM, website optimization, and online partnerships. 

As an Apps Online UX Program Manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader shaping the future of Google Apps. You are responsible for reinventing the online experience across the website and on-boarding flows to better acquire and convert Google Apps customers. You will partner and collaborate closely with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Operations to bring new ideas and designs to life.Responsibilities

Lead usability tests from beginning to end to deeply understand our users and their needs.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Strong understanding of the technology market, and a passion for Google Apps.
UX background - user research, testing, and/or design.
Ability to work cross-functionally with a large number of stakeholders across the organization.

text:
At Google, we know building trust with users comes hand-in-hand with the dependable quality and reliability of our products. The Advertising Technology team helps ensure that our advertising products work effectively for our customers. When a Sales team colleague escalates an issue relating to a product such as AdWords or AdSense, we dig in, using our technical expertise to find the solution. You use your strong computer science background to answer technical questions from colleagues, partners and clients regarding ad specifications and technology. Your communication and sales skills come in handy when you break down complex product features and present them in an easy-to-understand manner. With an array of internal tools at your disposal, you troubleshoot ad functionality and display issues, working on higher-level projects to improve the team's operations. All of your efforts go toward ensuring that our ad products are working and our customers optimize them to deliver desired results.
The Global Support team within gTech Ads plays a critical role in Google's success. It provides high quality support to our Sales teams consisting of resolving issues in across Google Ads products (technical, billing, policy, implementation, etc.) and supporting real-time interaction channels (e.g. GVC) with customers. The Global Support team offers 24x5 service and it achieves this through globally consistent, scalable processes and through troubleshooting innovation (e.g. automated solutions and proactive/preemptive support).
As the Global Support Manager, you will oversee a team providing outstanding support to sales teams and advertisers in Singapore. You will also be expected to ‘move the needle’ on core operations. This will involve developing efficient workflows, identifying opportunities for seamless support between teams, and designing new services that will provide faster and better support to sales teams and advertisers. You have a passion for delivering excellent customer service and a drive for continuous improvement. You also have exceptional leadership, influencing and change management skills. You are ready to work side-by-side with your team, motivate and mentor managers and team members, and drive alignment across different functions and regions.Responsibilities
Lead a team of support specialists. Grow and develop talent while providing vision and setting direction for the team.
Provide strategic insights and lead continuous improvement efforts in customer service and operations.
Drive business results by tracking key operational metrics, identifying process improvement opportunities and delivering flawlessly on strategic projects.
Partner with Sales, Sales Operations, other gTech Ads teams and partners on initiatives to improve sales and advertiser support.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of experience building teams, hiring and developing people.
Strategy and/or operations consulting experience at a management consulting firm or a corporate strategy organization.
Proven ability to partner closely with senior cross-functional stakeholders and influence successfully across organizational boundaries with strong customer mindset.
Strong business judgment with ability to problem-solve complex business issues in a fast-paced, evolving team environment.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage across multiple, often time-sensitive initiatives, delivering flawless results.
Exceptional leadership, analytical, written/verbal communication, and interpersonal skills.
title: gTech Ads Global Support Manager

text:

Understanding of Greater China internet industry and product market.

text:
Technical support for a technology company is a big task. As a Corporate Operations Engineer you are the go-to person for Googlers' computer hardware and software needs, providing front line user support for all of Google's internal tools and technologies. You troubleshoot, respond to inquiries and find solutions to technical challenges. Beyond the day-to-day, you improve the Googler user experience by contributing to longer term projects and documentation efforts. You are highly technical and are comfortable problem solving with multiple operating systems (like OS X, Linux, Windows) and a range of devices (including desktops/laptops, phone systems, video conferencing and various wireless devices). You occasionally partner with various teams including security, networking and infrastructure. You're a fast learner and great communicator who can support the IT needs of global offices of all sizes and Googlers of varying technical backgrounds.
Competitive rates of pay apply
Opening date for applications: May 13, 2015
Closing date for applications: June 10, 2015Responsibilities

Travel occasionally to provide IT support in distributed offices.
Provide hands on and remote support/troubleshooting of integrated video and audio conferencing equipment in conference room and mobile system environments.
Support complex and highly technical equipment (servers, routers, switches, etc.) using established procedures.
Work with vendors and technical support organizations to coordinate troubleshooting process for all related troubles in a timely manner.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with scripting languages - JavaScript and/or Python.
Support experience with Linux and Mac OS.
Expertise in deploying and supporting desktops/laptops, phone systems, video conferencing and various wireless devices.
Ability to adjust quickly to changing priorities and make quick decisions with limited information.
Understanding of LAN/WAN and mobile computing environments.
Strong customer service, organizational, prioritization, multitasking, communication, and leadership skills.
