locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
As a member of Google's Public Policy team, you help shape various product and issue agendas with policy makers inside and outside government. In addition, you will help advise our internal teams on the public policy implications of their products, working with a closely coordinated and cross-functional global team. The role requires significant experience either working with or in government, politics or a regulatory agency as well as an ability to grasp complex technical and policy issues.
You will help develop campaigns to advance our public policy positions. You will need first-rate analytical and organizational skills, the ability to communicate effectively in person and writing, an aptitude for learning and the discipline to manage different projects to tight deadlines simultaneously. No two days at Google are the same, so flexibility and a willingness to try new things are essential. You will have worked with or in government, politics, a think tank, advocacy group or trade association and be familiar with Internet technologies and the policy environments that surround them.Responsibilities
Help research and develop public policy positions and campaigns as part of a broad cross functional team.
Work with policy makers, industry bodies and third parties to advance Google’s policy agenda.
Organize events and initiatives.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working within national politics, government, think tanks, public interest groups or the field of corporate public policy.
Experience of working directly, or indirectly, with the European Parliament.
Ability to speak and write in English and one or two other official languages of the European Union fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Broad policy experience with direct knowledge of the tech sector or the key issues impacting the Web, like intellectual property, free expression, Internet access and online safety and on policies relating to social mobility and digital skills.
Experience working in high-stress environments and a proven ability to exercise judgment even in a crisis.
Self starter with the ability to think, plan, and execute large projects.
Team player who can work with people from a broad range of backgrounds and experience, including leading campaigns and mentoring more junior members.
Excellent communicator with great interpersonal and presentation skills, as well as the ability to write well and translate complex issues into simple language that people who are not experts can understand.
title: Public Policy and Government Relations Analyst, European Parliament

text:
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, Street View to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge the technical and business worlds as you design services that our customers love. You'll work with Googlers from Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Finance, to name just a few. You have a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you will be part of shaping Google's next moonshot.
As a Product Manager on Captions & Accessibility for YouTube, you will help drive the future of captioning quality and coverage across all YouTube clients, as well as other Google products and services. You will also help coordinate and track accessibility improvements and status across all focus areas at YouTube. 

On a day-to day-basis, you will work closely with engineers to help drive technical project strategy, execution, and feature rollout. You will help resolve technical challenges, communicate progress to project stakeholders, and prioritize the end user’s experience to ensure high quality launches. You will also work on making improvements to YouTube-wide processes in order to drive accessibility improvements.

All in all, you are a master multi-tasker, excellent communicator, fun to work with, and you love turning engineering chaos into harmony to get stuff done and improve accessibility for all YouTube users.Responsibilities
Work with the YouTube Captions team (and many other technical teams at Google) to design, develop, implement, launch and support new services and enhancements to existing services, with a focus on accessibility.
Develop and execute plans under a set of implementation and delivery time constraints, optimizing for a complex blend of product cost, service opportunity cost, and ongoing support costs.
Collect and analyze relevant data and take actions accordingly.
Facilitate broad collaboration with clear communications and documentation.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of relevant work experience, including 1 year of industry experience with making web and/or mobile products accessible.
Experience managing large-scale, aggressive, and dynamic technical projects with competing resources and priorities.
Some experience with data modeling and analysis.
Solid knowledge of the accessibility standards and assistive technologies as well as tools and elements of project management.
Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels.
Passion for accessibility or assistive technology.
title: Product Manager, YouTube Captions and Accessibility

text:
The Finance Operations team manages Google's cash transactions on a global basis and ensures that Google's incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to manage our complex set of transactions. You thrive on making processes more efficient and scalable, you work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations and you proactively minimize operational risk. Externally, you collaborate with our outsourcing partners and internally, you collaborate across the five areas of the Financial Operations team: Global Revenue Operations, Procure to Pay, Electronic Payment Services, Business Process Outsourcing, and Payroll.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. Finance, Sales, Product Management, Engineering and vendors) to deliver best-in-class Credit processes for our customers.
Play a key role in improving Google's Credit processes by seeking scalable, cost-efficient solutions and minimizing the impact of operational issues.
Implement a better processes and systems for managing Customers Risk Globally and support other Revenue Operations processes.
Coordinate Credit operations efforts with a third part Vendor in order to gain efficiency, scalability and improve quality.
Coordinate with other Finance Operations teams (eg. Invoicing, Collections etc.) on finding system and process alternatives to increase Credit Operations efficiency and productivity.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Six Sigma qualification.
Experience with enterprise applications.
Experience on working with Project Managers to implement Finance systems and tools for driving better quality of services, controls and Finance results
Proven ability to work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment and to lead and drive complex operational initiatives
Strong spreadsheet software skills.
Superior analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate with seasoned management
title: Project and Process Manager (Credit), Finance Operations

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.
The Staffing Programs, Research Events team, part of Global People Services, is focused on marketing the cutting-edge work of Google’s researchers to the global technical community and promoting Google as an exceptional place to work. We champion the company’s employment brand and contributions to the technology and research fields, attracting the best talent along the way. Whether you are developing events that will increase community among researchers, building relationships with external and internal partners, or formulating new strategies to further the Research at Google brand, you will have an eye on Google’s short- and long-term growth needs and a pulse of the broader brand landscape.Responsibilities
Partner with internal entities to create comprehensive program and event strategies.
Manage relationships with key external organizations and groups to cultivate a strong partnership and enhance Google’s brand in the employment marketplace.
Develop and implement events including program mapping and planning, budgets, stakeholder buy-in, logistics, messaging (internal and external), developing content with researchers, and other core elements to successfully meet event objectives.
Build solid relationships with vendors, internal team members, and a wide range of stakeholders across Google, including senior-level stakeholders to manage expectations and ensure high-quality event management.
Contribute to our online presence and public messaging by creating interesting and informational web and collateral content.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of related experience in program and event management.
Preferred qualifications
Ability to lead and work with cross-functional teams, grow positive working relationships with colleagues at all organizational levels.
Focused on providing top-quality client support for the coordination and seamless delivery of events.
Flexible, proactive, responsible, detail-oriented and must demonstrate a high-level of scrappiness.
Demonstrated project management and budget management skills.
Ability to analyze and present information in a professional manner including writing and presentations.
title: Staffing Programs Specialist, Research Events

text:
Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind those systems are Googlers who advise and partner with our users and customers. As an Advertiser Solutions Consultant you will support clients using our DoubleClick products, including mobile and rich media. Your projects will include business pitches, product implementation and upgrades, and custom solutions. Customers will look to your expertise on product configuration and business processes, combining your deep understanding of DoubleClick products with industry best practices.
DoubleClick Ad Exchange (AdX) is the nerve center of Google’s display strategy. AdX, the world’s first cross-format, real-time marketplace to buy and promote display ads, is truly redefining today’s media-buying experience for advertisers and agencies. At the core of this platform is Real-Time Bidding (RTB), a technology that enables AdX Buyers to evaluate and bid on each available impression in real-time using their own data. As an AdX Solutions Consultant, you are an expert problem solver. You will manage CTO level relationships with strategic clients to ensure they meet their online ad serving objectives while simultaneously growing the AdX.

You will also operate cross-functionally with Sales, Technical Support, Product Management, Product Marketing and Policy teams to deliver key display opportunities to buyers. An expert in our tools and operations, you will provide support, answer and field inquiries and troubleshoot client issues. Beyond client-facing issues, your expertise also gives you the insight to recommend product and system improvements to the core team. Your interactions on both sides ensure that when clients advertise with Google, their back-end systems never miss a beat.
Responsibilities
Provide consulting services, share best practices and conduct technical troubleshooting for clients.
Work with core team to develop strategy, including best practices, change management and optimization analysis.
Conduct technical walk-throughs and implement new product features as they relate to client product usage.
Collaborate with the regional and global Sales and Services teams to lead monitoring exchange activity efforts and to track performance against goals.
Ensure project team, internal management and external customers receive appropriate, timely and accurate project information and status updates, identifying delays, budgets and technical quality concerns so that they can be proactively addressed.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BSc degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with SQL, HTML, JavaScript and or Unix/Linux.
Experience working in a client-facing capacity.
Ability to speak and write Chinese and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Familiarity with the ad serving industry, ad exchanges and networks. Knowledge of Google platforms (DoubleClick Bid Manager, DoubleClick for Advertisers, DoubleClick Search V3, DoubleClick For Publishers, and AdWords).
Proven ability to drive projects to a successful and timely conclusion.
Demonstrated ability to be flexible/adaptable in exercising judgment in a dynamic, matrixed environment and able to manage competing priorities.
Ability to absorb complex technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience effectively.
title: Ad Exchange Solutions Consultant

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.
Titan’s products, like other Google products, will eventually span the globe and require managers and engineers to keep the big picture in focus. As an Electronics Engineer, you will participate in requirements planning and documentation, conceptual designs, make/buy analyses, test methodology, design documentation, anomaly tracking and resolution, peer reviews (your designs and others), design reviews, and hardware/software debugging.Responsibilities
Participate in a variety of engineering tasks that might include microprocessor-based assignments, data bus assignments, interface with outside vendors , and provide technical support on designs.
Carry out detailed requirements, design, sizing and calculations and verify and check your designs.
Create electronic schematics, Bill of Materials, and appropriate work instructions.
Provide estimated durations for engineering tasks and status of tasks being worked.
Collaborate with QA to ensure all design engineering procedures are followed.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with measurement instrumentation and test systems, including oscilloscopes, logic and protocol analyzers, in-circuit emulators for microprocessor development.
Experience in designing one electronic product that incorporates a microprocessor and have experience in schematic capture program(s).
In order to access the technical and defense data necessary for this job, applicants must be a U.S. Citizen or currently hold a United States Permanent Resident Card (USCIS Form I-551).
Preferred qualifications
Master's/PhD degree in Electrical Engineering with specific courses in computer design or 15 years of experience in electronics engineering fields and related projects.
Experience using LabView or other instrumentation control software.
Experience in a company that designs and builds UASs. Experience in design and control of redundant systems.
Experience working on projects with a requirement for RTCA/DO-254 or equivalent process suggestions.
Proficiency in operational amplifier usage and proficiency in C or C++.
Strong documentation and writing skills using an office suite software.
title: Electrical Engineer, Titan Aerospace

text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
gTech Consumers creates a customer support experience that's so good, it's got to be Google. We're a passionate and engaged team, working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
As an Operations Manager, you will seamlessly run our core operations (quarterly planning meetings, monthly business reviews and Global Business Organization (GBO) reporting), lead strategic projects and drive our executive communication strategy. You'll have the opportunity to both imagine and create the future of our business operations.
You're known for your ability to develop deep relationships with senior leaders, even when your work spans offices, time zones and hemispheres. You're a natural planner who enjoys details, especially when they relate to business planning initiatives like strategic development, quarterly operations meetings, and budgeting. You also have a knack for identifying potential barriers and the risks that they pose, but you don't stop there -- you always have ideas for how to overcome them. You're an effective communicator, negotiating the interplay of audience, content and delivery method, all while coaching on it. You're admired for your authenticity, trustworthiness, and above all, your ability to get things done.Responsibilities

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Versatile across multiple functions.

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Google for Work Technical Solutions Engineer, Cloud Technology - Tokyo.Help the globe "go Google." The Google for Work team helps companies seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. As a Technical Solutions Engineer, you're helping the globe "go Google" by working with leading companies, schools and government agencies to ease their transition to Google tools. You swiftly problem-solve technical issues for customers to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Google for Work business and bringing our product portfolio into companies both big and small around the world.
As a Technical Solutions Engineer for the Google Cloud Platform, you will provide outstanding support for cutting edge products, solutions and APIs, including Google App Engine, Compute Engine and Storage and will work closely with lower support tiers, Engineering and Product Management. You will work in a second tier support role as part of a global team and provide in-depth technical assistance and advice to developers, system architects and lower support tiers. You will also work closely with software engineers, product managers and sales engineers to improve the product's vision and to make the Google Cloud Platform and its customers successful.
Responsibilities
Provide developer and technical support and resolve customer cases for Google for Work's Cloud products, solutions and APIs, including debugging App Engine and Google Storage applications, authoring documentation and code samples, and handling system configuration.
Obtain and maintain an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying hardware and software architectures, building and transferring knowledge to Google’s Tier 1 support group and peers.
Work closely with software engineers and product management to identify, prioritize and fix customer issues or code bugs; guide or perform design and development of new support, productivity or investigation tools to increase efficiency for the technical support process.
Act as a consultant for Sales Engineers, Technical Account Managers and Deployment Specialists, resolving technical deployment obstacles, improving the product's vision and making Google's customers successful.
Improve existing and author new Google Cloud Platform documentation, code samples, best practices and FAQs, helping the developer community thrive by monitoring discussion groups and attending live community events.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
Experience with programming and scripting languages (Java, C, C++, Python, Shell scripting, or JavaScript).
Preferred qualifications
Hands-on experience with Cloud technology solutions and with running and supporting large complex systems at scale.
Understanding of Unix/Linux or Windows systems from kernel to shell and beyond, taking in system libraries, file systems and client-server protocols.
Knowledge and understanding of network theory, such as different protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, etc), MAC addresses, IP packets, DNS, HTTP, OSI layers and load balancing.
Familiarity with application-level data storage and with retrieval and analysis tools and concepts such as SQL, NoSQL, Log analysis and MapReduce.
Systematic problem solving skills coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.
Ability to speak and write in English and Japanese fluently and idiomatically.
title: Google for Work Technical Solutions Engineer, Cloud Technology

text:
Google's custom-designed equipment makes up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Manufacturing Operations team is responsible for providing the manufacturing capability to deliver this state-of-the-art physical infrastructure. As a Manufacturing Engineer, you evaluate the product designs and create the processes, tools and procedures behind Google’s powerful search technology. When vendors build parts for our infrastructure, you’re right there alongside ensuring manufacturing processes are repeatable and controlled. You collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design Engineers to determine Google’s infrastructure needs and product specifications. Your work ensures the various pieces of Google’s infrastructure fit together perfectly and keep our systems humming along smoothly for a seamless user experience.Responsibilities
Provide on-site support for pre-production builds at CM/ODM, to include driving pre-production factory readiness, supporting product bring-up, providing training and gathering feedback on DfX and yield issues.
Drive Engineering DVT (Design Validation Testing) support, and coordinating with Test Engineering to establish test coverage requirements for manufacturing test process.
Engage with the Platform Development team to establish parameters for monitoring health of fleet, and drive program in support of early field failure analysis.
Own the front line for production and remanufacturing product issues, monitor health of fleet and initiate investigation of problem areas, and root cause product failures and drive corrective action.
Coordinate release of New Product Introduction (NPI) BOMs into Product Data Management (PDM) system, technical review of product changes through supply chain and in field, support second source and EOL replacement part qualification, and release of ECOs, MCOs, FCOs.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in Product Development or Product Engineering.
Experience with BOM structures and product data management systems such as WindChill or Agile.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Electrical Engineering.
6 years of relevant work experience at a server, memory or disk drive company.
Experience with scripting languages and SQL.
Successfully created and executed a design validation test plan on a complex electronic assembly.
title: Product Engineer, Manufacturing

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
Google for Work helps companies around the world to be more productive, mobile and collaborative by "going Google." Passionate about growing teams and markets? On the Google for Work Web Production team, you’ll have the opportunity to do both. As a leader within Google for Work, you’ll be responsible for improving project management processes and growing the teams working on those projects. As a leader within the Web Production team, you’ll act as a core member of Google’s internal digital agency, helping our marketing teams to spread the word about Google’s offerings for Work and Education. By embracing user insights, strategic thinking, beautiful design with provocative execution, you will lead creation of intuitive and inventive experiences that will define the future of our brand.
Responsibilities

Provide frequent project feedback and updates as projects develop (includes flagging issues and helping to identify possible solutions).

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

5 years of project management experience in the web industry.
Preferred qualifications
Account management experience and/or strategic planning experience. Technology/online industry experience.
Experience in working with agencies and external talents.
Knowledge of marketing techniques, and understanding of Google’s strategic and competitive position.
Ability to build and maintain constructive working and communications relationships with a diverse community of technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management.

text:
As a Technical Support Specialist, you will be responsible for supporting dynamic Google products by troubleshooting and prioritizing bugs on the fly. text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As a Strategic Account Manager, you’ll have the unique opportunity to create long-lasting relationships with our top partners in the News and Local Media space. You renew existing partnerships, optimize agreements, and create, as well as capitalize on potential opportunities. You cultivate existing partnerships to make sure they can take full advantage of Google's ever-growing suite of offerings. You will leverage your strong relationship-building skills and are apt to resolve contractual, technical, and financial issues with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs. You understand the details of individual campaigns and you will leverage your entrepreneurial drive and business planning skills to develop a comprehensive strategy for growing partner’s business, and the business Google does with that partner.
Responsibilities
Understand full scope of a publisher partner monetization business including inventory trends, direct and indirect channel priorities, competitors used. Understand how monetization fits into the larger business strategy.
Expand Google’s business growth by identifying new inventory and monetization products to support the partner’s business growth.
Analyze monetization performance and present findings to key clients, influencing partner strategy by highlighting key opportunities to increase yield through product usage. Identify opportunities to add new/emerging channels (e.g. Mobile and Video) to the product mix and bring data-driven insights to support recommendations. Drive Quarterly Business Reviews with senior executives.
Optimize usage of Google’s monetization suite, in consultation with partners, based on performance analysis (e.g. block list management, CPM thresholds, ad positioning). Develop frameworks to evaluate success of implemented optimizations and leverage analytical skills to evaluate vertical wide data trends in order to identify and promote concepts that drive growth.
Manage ad network relationships and optimizations within monetization products, inclusive of tactical troubleshooting, while building strong relationships with clients and networks. Navigate multi-layer relationships ranging from C-Level executives to day-to-day ad operation managers.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of work experience, including 3 years of related customer/account/partner management experience at an Internet company.
Preferred qualifications
Expertise in digital advertising monetization - Display, Mobile and Video.
Broad understanding of online advertising (i.e., ad serving networks) and of key platforms and trends (i.e. desktop, mobile, video).
Demonstrated analytic ability, including the ability to understand monetization metrics and apply these to potential optimizations.
Demonstrated partner relations, account management, and sales skills.
Comfortable with team-based business approach. Self-motivated and comfortable operating in a rapidly changing and largely undefined industry.
title: Strategic Account Manager, News and Local Media

text:
This position will be based in Raleigh-Durham, NC.
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google is always striving to innovate our Fiber-to-the-Home program. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next-generation Internet and TV content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than this opportunity to help create the future of broadband.
As a Customer Service Supervisor, you will ensure that Google is focused on our customers at our local brick-and-mortar location. You will be a product expert with detailed knowledge of our constantly evolving service. You will be responsible for supervising all functions of the Google Fiber Space, including customer experience, facilities management, performance planning, inventory, and product-related functions. You will help develop a vendor team focused on driving customer retention and satisfaction while ensuring excellence in customer service with every customer contact. Additionally, you will be an escalation point of contact for all in-market partners and ensure that the experience remains consistently excellent for the customer.
Responsibilities
Help create and maintain an environment for discovery in the Google Fiber Space that sparks new ideas for using Google Fiber services, such as high-definition programming and high-speed Internet.
Establish and maintain a professional and courteous support culture within the Google Fiber Space while promoting an interactive and engaging experience. Interact with other in-market teams (Construction, Sales, Marketing, etc.) to build a strong working relationship and be the local voice of Google Fiber’s customer and our support organization in cross-functional decisions.
Support employees in problem solving and address escalated internal and external customer issues in a responsive, timely, and accurate manner to achieve maximum customer satisfaction. Be a self-directed, passionate leader who is customer focused and acts with a sense of urgency to proactively address issues, obstacles, and shortfalls that may impact performance.
Oversee the inventory that is contained in our Google Fiber Space. Help build processes to improve the tracking and storage of Google Fiber equipment, as well as marketing/sales items.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in a customer service role (in person) and 1 year of people management experience.
Ability to work non-standard work hours as needed.
Ability to travel as required.
Preferred qualifications
Proven technical troubleshooting background (wireless networks, Windows, Mac OS, email).
Ability to communicate effectively with customers and employees of the organization.
Comfortable reporting technical issues to engineers in descriptive terms.
Local market expertise.
Creative and passionate approach to addressing opportunities and challenges; and an enthusiastic, self-motivated, positive can-do attitude that relishes delivering best-in-class customer service.

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
As part of the Google for Work Team, the Cloud Platform group is helping customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global data center and software assets. As a Cloud Platform Partner Business team member, you develop and drive the Google Cloud Platform business relationship with key service partners in South Asia, ANZ (Australia and New Zealand), and the broader APAC region by analyzing partner business alignment, establishing partner performance, identifying methods of increasing partner and Google business growth, promoting ideas to and identifying opportunities within partners, and coordinating across Google departments/groups to deliver cross-product business opportunities. Manage business performance of partners and map partner capabilities and priorities with Google goals and strategies to meet/exceed quarterly targets. Drive quarterly business reviews with key service partners and Google leadership.
Help partners grow their Google practice and product portfolio through joint development of solutions and services. Manage development and collaboration with partners on marketing campaigns.
Evangelize Google’s strategy in key industry events and shape industry agenda and standards, shape Google’s strategy, roadmap and business plan with stakeholders in Google Product Management, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing. Support regional engagement with strategic global and regional technology partners.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

10 years of experience in a high-performance partner or channel manager position. Experience building new partner programs and support infrastructure for service partners, with experience in business practice variance in ASEAN and across APAC.
Industry knowledge of System Integrators (SIs)/Service Providers (SPs) and Independent Software Vendors (ISVs). Extended knowledge of, and experience with, Cloud ecosystem.
Strong interpersonal skills and comfort working in a cross-functional organization. Excellent written and oral communication skills, including experience presenting to senior-level audiences.
Excellent partner/channel pipeline development and management skills, with proven success in delivering go-to-market strategies and results, and demonstrated success in a start-up culture/environment.
Solid technical understanding of foundational cloud technologies (network, compute, database, middleware, visualization, etc.).
Understanding of platform- and infrastructure-as-a-service markets, cloud-based technologies, and service provider ecosystem and business models.

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.Responsibilities
Design, implement and integrate systems to scale and automate network operations tasks.
Partner with neighboring teams in designing, testing, deploying and operating highly scalable software defined network systems.
Function as technical, engineering and operational subject matter expert for complex networking systems by participating in the rotating "on call" schedule.

Monitor network stability and performance - ensuring 24x7 operations and resolving service impacts as they occur

BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant work experience, including Unix systems administration with scripting experience in Shell, PHP, Perl or Python.
Experience working with network fundamentals (TCP/IP, ARP, IP Tables, routing).
Technical troubleshooting and performance tuning experience.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of relevant work experience in a high-volume or critical production service environment.
Coding experience in one or more of C, C++, Java, Python, Go
Working knowledge of TCP/IP fundamentals, network routing protocols (OSPF, IS-IS, BGP, MPLS).
Demonstrated ability to employ good troubleshooting skills and creative problem solving abilities under pressure.
Willingness to work weekend days and shifts outside of normal business hours (typically 4-day weeks, with no off-shift pager duty).

text:
Google is a universally recognized name. The Localization team helps Google's ideas and products look, feel and sound natural to users in their own countries. We collaborate with international Engineering, Product and Marketing teams to steer products through the localization process and ensure successful launches across the globe. Our team is an international collection of enthusiastic, creative and knowledgeable people who excel in a fast-paced, culturally diverse environment. You are an excellent communicator who plays a strategic role by building relationships with partner teams to establish needs, deadlines and budgets. You will flex your project management skills in order to ensure that our Localization process runs effectively and efficiently.
Google's mission is to make all of the world's information universally accessible and useful. We take that seriously for far more than just products in English language. Help us make sure that Google is useful and fun for our international users.

You have a passion for language and want to shape Google’s voice in your market or region. You are an experienced Turkish translator, copywriter, linguist, writer or editor with a creative, marketing or localization background.Responsibilities

Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

Alongside our support and troubleshooting work, we partner with sales, product management and engineering to focus on developing innovative, scalable support solutions that effectively serve our growing customer base. 
As a Support Specialist, you will work closely with advertisers and the global sales teams to drive troubleshooting, and implementation support. In this role you will become an expert, focused on handling troubleshooting and/or implementation tasks so that the sales teams can concentrate their efforts on client-specific activities. This is a specialist role focused on providing the highest quality of support to both our sales teams and the advertisers they work with.
Responsibilities
Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service via troubleshooting and resolving issues from sales teams and Google's advertisers.
Manage sales and customer inquiries by live chat, tickets, and other channels.
Work directly with large advertisers as well as internal sales teams.
Contribute to the development of internal products. Carry out one-off projects as required for large advertisers.
Provide emergency expert support during non-office hours when required.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in Korean and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
2 years of experience in an online advertising role.
Customer focused with client facing experience.
Familiarity with the ad serving industry and internet technologies (JavaScript, HTML, Flash).
Extremely proactive, organized, responsible, with the proven ability to work well with a team.
Strong communication skills.
title: Support Specialist

text:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. A master juggler working of multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to tackle big picture challenges.You are both a manager and a mentor, providing financial leadership and analytical support to partners of the core Finance team as well as giving your own team the support they need to become financial gurus. You'll keep senior management informed on key financial metrics and work to improve financial operation practices throughout your region.

As the Finance Manager and business partner you will manage all aspects of Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) including strategic planning for this high growth business. You will provide strong financial leadership spanning risk management, control and opportunity identification to steer the business and will have a strong track record of demonstrated success operating as a leader and influencing complex businesses.Responsibilities
Provide executive management with clear insights into drivers of business and financial performance and risk; assess business/market opportunities and inform/recommend prioritization decisions.
Lead strategic planning via formal Business Planning and regular Business Reviews.

Review and approve partnerships and other commercial agreements, and provide input and advice on potential acquisitions. Ensure that contracts are well-structured to perform for Google and mitigate risk/exposure.
Collaborate with and manage cross-functional teams (Tax, Accounting, Financial Operations, Internal Audit, M&A, etc.) to provide end-to-end financial support. Lead and develop the Google Fiber FP&A team.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in business or technical field, or related practical experience.
13 years of relevant experience in finance, management consulting, corporate strategy or similar environment, including FP&A and project management experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience managing large capital projects including identifying, assessing and controlling risks.
Strong problem solving ability combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate clearly and influence leadership teams.
Track record of leading and developing teams.
Demonstrated leadership, cross-functional communication and interpersonal skills.

text:
When leading companies decide to "go Google," it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. But the Google for Work Sales team can't do it alone. Once educational institutions, government agencies and other businesses sign on to use Google for Work products to make their work more productive, mobile and collaborative, you come in. As a Google for Work Sales Engineer, you assist fellow Sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the Product Marketing Management and Engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google for Work products.
You advocate for Google solutions like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make these large accounts more productive, collaborative and mobile. You bring Google's portfolio into big and small companies around the world and handle complex customer and stakeholder relationships. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.You have excellent technical, communication and organizational skills to enhance our Google Search for Work Sales team. You will work with the team to engage with sales prospects, prepare and present demonstrations of Google products, and address technical questions that arise throughout the sales process. Your previous experience with enterprise search products, content/document management repository systems and web-based applications will be on display as you engage with customers to understand their business and technical requirements. You are a confident presenter with the ability to persuasively present Google's product offerings. In addition, you are comfortable working closely with Product, Support, Engineering, and Sales teams.
Responsibilities
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Search for Work value proposition, using techniques to include whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, prototypes and RFI response documents.
Work with the team to identify and qualify sales opportunities and key customer technical objections, developing the strategy to resolve technical impediments to business transactions.
Make recommendations on integration strategies, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution, providing “best practice” advice to customers to optimize Google Search for Work effectiveness.
Work with the Sales Account team, Customer Support, Product Management, Engineering and Professional Services to identify and resolve product problems and deficiencies affecting pre- and post-sales customer satisfaction, utilizing outstanding pre-and post-sales account management, follow-through skills, resourcefulness and attention to detail.
Travel at least 25% of the time to visit customers throughout the US.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience serving in the capacity of a sales engineer or equivalent experience in a customer facing role that includes working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team.
Preferred qualifications
In-depth knowledge of web and related technologies (e.g. HTTP, Basic/NTLM, cookies/sessions, XML/XSLT/XHTML/HTML), including a working knowledge of web application development and integration (e.g. REST, SOAP, J2EE, CGI/Java/ASP servlets).
Understanding of essential enterprise networking concepts (e.g. DNS, TCP, proxies, DMZ) along with an understanding of network identity management systems, including SSO, SAML, LDAP, Kerberos and NTLM.
Conversant in Web 2.0 development platforms and solutions, including J2EE, Java servlets, JavaScript, HTML, ASP, CGI, Ajax, Flash, cookies and XML.
Demonstrated ability to create demo scripts in any of the following scripting/programming languages: Java, C#, JavaScript, Python, Perl or Shell Scripting.
title: Google for Work, Sales Engineer, Search

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

Additionally, you will be leading the design, roll-out and maintenance of processes and tools for performance tracking and best practice sharing.
You are a brand strategist with a passion for negotiating. You will shape the strategy and best practices around structuring annual negotiations and JBPs with Google’s biggest brand advertisers and top media agency partners. You thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment, and leverage your knowledge of industry upfront buying processes and the television/online video advertising ecosystem to ensure Google is positioned for success. You will also oversee and steward a program of value-added services to encourage and reward commitments with Google. Develop outstanding business frameworks and training materials to empower and enable GCAS Sales teams to successfully negotiate agreements in a timely manner
Drive large-scale media business opportunities from inception to full activation in partnership with LCS (Large Customer Sales) and local country teams.
Lead or support structuring and negotiations which may include alternative “value-added" services.
Oversee display and video incentive program support and approval, including adherence to global policies/exception handling processes.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience in sales/business development at a traditional or online media company or top media agency.
Preferred qualifications
Proven success negotiating upfronts as TV/online video buyer, seller, or key advisor.
Track record in structuring and delivering against contractual commitments and joint business plans
Superb analytical, presentation and communication skills with executive presence and the ability to comfortably interact with Google's executive management area.
title: Deal Lead, GCAS (Global Client and Agency Solutions) Sales Operations and Strategy

text:

You will work closely with Engineering, Operations and Product teams to drive superior user and operating performance. You will enable effectiveness and productivity by providing insights, plans, processes and tools to deliver cross-functional initiatives at scale.Responsibilities

Develop comprehensive performance analysis of Global operations, putting data models and analytics in place that provide a platform for strategic decision making.

Partner with operations and engineering to develop and define new and improved tool, workflow and operational initiatives. Plan, design and track pilot initiatives and impacts and provide operational finance supporting including tracking spend against budget, measuring and driving financial productivity.

10 years of consulting experience or relevant experience in a global company.
Preferred qualifications
Excellent project management experience, ability to define projects and execute within timelines and with multiple stakeholders. Proven ability to deliver projects on time and to budget.
Analytically-minded, logical thinker with strong problem solving skills and ability to make trade-offs.
Team player and self starter with strong interpersonal and solution oriented attitude and an ability to effectively operate with high energy and flexibility in a fast paced, constantly evolving team environment.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize information and see the big picture while effectively managing details.
Excellent spreadsheet modeling, presentation, and SQL skills; statistical, quantitative modeling and forecasting skills.
Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally and cross geography with all levels of management within Google and have exceptional verbal and written English communication skills.

text:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. text:

Internally, you work with product engineering teams improve our products by conveying feedback from developers, reviewing API designs and testing new features. Chrome, Android, App Engine, HTML5 as well as our core Google Apps and Ads APIs are just some of the platforms you promote and support.With your technical expertise, you drive strategy around fostering a community of developers who work with Google technologies. An ardent advocate for these developers, you represent their voice internally to our Product Managers and serve as their Google support in application development and technology implementation.Responsibilities
Assist third-party developers in troubleshooting their integrations with Google APIs and use of other Google developer products.
Manage and participate in developer discussion forums and support queues to debug and resolve technical/coding problems.
Help product engineering teams improve developer products by conveying feedback from developers and reviewing API.
Write sample code and client libraries, and contribute to open source projects.

BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in Engineering or Programming.
Program experience in Objective C, Java, Perl or Python.

Preferred qualifications
10 years of relevant work experience.
Experience as a committer in an open source project.
Experience with computer vision, imaging, or augmented reality platforms.
Strong mobile application development experience.

text:
Businesses that partner with Waze come in all shapes and sizes. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills contribute greatly to Waze's sales team. text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies.

Network Operations is responsible for planning, building and operating Google's network reliably and at scale. As a member of the Network Architecture team, you will develop software and deliver quantitative analyses to shape the future of Google's network. The scale and complexity of Google's network generates many unique and complex problems that require sophisticated quantitative analysis and algorithms. Your work will involve data gathering, problem formulation, algorithm development, software implementation and collaboration with users. The work requires strong software engineering skills, deep understanding of complex algorithms and mathematical concepts, and the ability to apply them to the large datasets and diverse set of networking technologies in use at Google to create useful tools. You will be responsible for creating innovative models and algorithms and implementing them in effective software. You will work closely with Optical and IP Architecture, Network Acquisition, Network Design, Deployment, and Operations teams to carefully consider and incorporate solutions to meet future needs. You will be expected to think critically and strategically about Google, absorb and process large amounts of technical information in a continuously evolving environment.Responsibilities
Collaborate with network engineers, understand trade-offs underlying decisions in network design, planning and operations.
Create mathematical formulations for networking problems such as topology optimization, availability simulation and anomaly detection.
Invent algorithms to solve networking problems using a variety of advanced mathematical techniques and implement these algorithms in code that is efficient, scalable, well-tested, easy to maintain and extend.
Collaborate with other teams, gather data to apply these tools to improve Google’s network.
Minimum qualifications
MS degree in Operations Research, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with statistics, Monte Carlo simulations, combinatorial optimization, stochastic optimization, game theory, auction theory, quantitative analysis, machine learning, advanced algorithms or related fields.
Preferred qualifications
PhD in operations research, computer science, mathematics or a related technical field.
Strong software engineering skills, including design, implementation and testing. Ability to quickly go from problem analysis to data gathering to algorithm to implementation to practical results: this position requires both theoretical and practical skills.
Interest in learning the necessary skills to contribute to the future of Google's network in an environment where networking technologies change rapidly.
Networking knowledge.
title: Software Engineer, Network Analysis and Optimization

text:
