You will be exposed to the full portfolio of Google's products (including Search, YouTube, Display, Mobile & Platforms), across all industry verticals and work closely with Google's local sales teams.Responsibilities
Set overall business strategy, business growth targets, and product adoption targets for agencies in Singapore
Own execution of key business growth initiatives, securing support from internal stakeholders at regional and local levels to ensure maximum adoption and impact
Provide guidance and expertise to sales teams on the dynamics, trends opportunities, and challenges working with agency partners
Identify and execute unique business partnership opportunities
Hire, train, mentor, and manage agency leads

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant experience in industry management or corporate strategy.
Preferred qualifications
MBA.
Substantial experience in sales, business development and/or client relationship management.
Strong project management, interpersonal and organizational skills.
Self-starter with demonstrated ability to deliver value through own initiative.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including experience presenting to senior-level audiences.
title: Head of Agency

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
Google Life Sciences is recruiting a research informatics database manager to support research activities in cell biology, chemistry, nanoparticle synthesis, genomics, biochemistry and biophysics, immunology, and bioinformatics to support the development of novel disease diagnostic technologies and biomarker discovery projects such as the Baseline study.
You should provide a full academic curriculum vitae or resume (showing all publications) and summary of research (ca. 1 page) as a single PDF file.Responsibilities
Configure and be principal user and administrator of a research informatics system (electronic lab notebook, data repository, chemistry electronic notebook, data analysis tools, sample management tracking system, etc.). Implement and support scientific computer applications using API, web services, script, and object-oriented programming languages to configure and develop cloud applications that will support basic, clinical, and genomic research.
Ensure the integrity and security of institutional data. Test, implement, and support new workflows, database components, and data sharing pipelines to on- and off-site databases. Maintain entity registration system, manage sample and assay logistics.
Be the super-user/manager of the electronic laboratory environment: data warehouse and virtualization technologies. Gather and implement user requirements/discern between must-have and nice-to-have and develop effective and efficient designs and detailed pathway flows.
Establish comprehensive and detailed function test plans. Work collaboratively with multiple teams and communicate in effective oral and written formats and keep all principal stakeholders updated in real time.
Provide training to others and document database changes and procedure.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Biology, Bioinformatics, related field or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience managing informatics environments in an industrial setting. Experience with workflow tools, scripting languages, and database technologies.
Experience integrating information flow between different systems (R, Python, Java, Jython, etc.)
Experience operating systems and support tools. Experience with web development, JavaScript, Linux, relationship databases, and programming.
Preferred qualifications
MS in Biology or Bioinformatics with 5 years of experience managing a LIMS/research informatics environment in a startup/large company environment.
Experience with multiple vendors of cloud technologies.
Familiarity with laboratory robotic automation in a life-sciences setting.
Maintain skills and programming languages as commensurate for experience level.
Working knowledge of statistics
Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as ability to communicate effectively with scientists and engineers from a wide range of technical backgrounds.
title: Research Informatics System and LIMS Manager (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
The Customer Support Apps team designs, develops, deploys and supports in-house and third-party contact center applications support users to improve productivity and customer satisfaction. You will play a major role in planning, designing and deployment of new contact center infrastructure across Google’s data centers. You will work with both internal Google teams and external vendors to research, evaluate and implement new solutions.
Responsibilities
Architect, design, deploy and roll out enterprise level contact center and voice systems that will be used to interact with advertisers, consumers and enterprises.
Coordinate new system deployments working with internal engineering operations teams such as Telecom, Network, Security, Hardware, and Data Center, and external suppliers such as software/hardware manufacturers, and telco/MPLS carriers.
Lead monitoring and troubleshooting of Google’s contact center voice systems and toll free numbers.
Develop and deliver presentations to provide internal training on contact center systems.
Oversee the creation of new processes and tools to support additional requirements on an ongoing basis.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience supporting global voice and data infrastructure deployments involving several IT teams and business units.

Preferred qualifications
Knowledge of Unix, Shell or Perl scripting to automate repetitive tasks.
Experience in vendor management, software and hardware evaluation, selection, deployment and system monitoring tools.
Hands-on debugging and troubleshooting skills in various platforms and protocols like TCP/IP and VoIP.
Knowledge of voice and data networking infrastructure elements including SIP, MPLS, Load balancers.
Participation in several network design and deployments across global data centers.
title: Contact Center and Voice Infrastructure Engineer

text:
Google's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. Strategic Partner Managers have the unique opportunity to create a long-lasting relationship with our top partners. You cultivate these existing partnerships to make sure they can take full advantage of Google's ever-growing suite of offerings. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to see win-win opportunities with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.
As a manager on the Product Partnerships Team, you will manage our strategic mobile and broadband technology partnerships and programs. In this high-visibility role, you'll develop, manage, and optimize our existing relationships with YouTube device, telecom operator, and retail partners in Latin America. You’ll work with these partners on new product integration, marketing campaigns, feature requests, and strategic planning to drive successful partner implementations and increase user adoption and awareness of YouTube products. You will also manage business creation and growth with our partners as part of our next generation implementations.Responsibilities
Manage partnerships that drive significant awareness and user growth with mobile operator, OEM, and broadband partners in Latin America and new YouTube territories, which are constantly expanding.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with partners including management and optimization of existing partners, support and track new partners through the launch process, contract negotiations, and liaise with YouTube product and technical support teams that may be in other regions.
Work with your YouTube Product Partnership colleagues in region, leveraging the existing partner footprint, and execute regional strategy to accelerate growth as new initiatives arise.
Execute scalable user acquisition through partnerships and marketing programs.
Define, analyze, and communicate partner metrics and develop account plans for presentation to YouTube management and partners.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience, including 5 years of related partnership experience in a consumer internet company.
Preferred qualifications
Experience pre-loading applications with operators and OEMs, developing programs with retailers to grow product awareness and usage, and creating scalable partner management processes with detailed account plans.
Demonstrated success at working with cross-functional teams and building strong relationships across departments including sales, marketing, business development, engineering and product management.
Strong understanding of mobile and broadband business models and priorities for partners.
Established network of contacts at mobile and fixed-line operators and device manufacturers.
Ability to interpret legal documents, negotiate contracts and work with attorneys to complete agreements.
Detail-oriented with great organizational skills and meticulous in follow-up. Highly analytical and data-driven.
title: Manager, YouTube Product Partnerships, Mobile and Broadband Partnerships, YouTube

text:
Design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. The job of an Interaction Designer is to envision how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In an Interaction Designer role, you’ll tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of people around the world—from the first-time user to the sophisticated expert. Achieving this goal requires collaboration with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.
Join the team developing hardware and software for projects in Google[x] Life Sciences such as the Smart Contact Lens, Cancer-detecting Nanoparticle Project and the Tremor Cancellation Device (Parkinson's Disease)
Responsibilities
Take ownership of one or more projects within the Life Sciences product group.
Collaborate closely with engineers, researchers and project managers to iterate rapidly.
Participate in the Ppoject lifecycle from wireframe to specs across multiple UX platforms.
Participate in user-experience research and usability studies.
Participate in regular design reviews and other team-wide design efforts.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience designing for health-related products (software and/or hardware).

Preferred qualifications
Experience with motion graphics and HTML/CSS prototyping.
Experience dealing with data design, and complex problem solving.
Experience in complex data visualization.
Strong portfolio of UX Design work across multiple platforms.
Work designing for wearable devices.
title: UX Designer (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
As an Android Partnerships team member, you're doing the negotiations that keep Android's meteoric growth going. You work closely with Android Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Legal teams on new initiatives and key strategic relationships. You don't just execute; you're a true thought leader who can see multiple steps ahead and identify industry trends and key influencers. Empowered to chart your own path, you run the process from start to finish. You open doors with potential partners, lead exploratory talks with them. 

You are responsible for leading and negotiating Android-related distribution for Google services with manufacturers, mobile networks, electronics retailers, and other entities participating in the creation and distribution of Android devices and services. Initially focused on smartphones and tablets, the role offers the opportunity to work with industry leading Google partners to secure broad distribution of Android devices with Google services and then manage and nurture those relationships on an ongoing basis. You will be able to work autonomously but also collaboratively with Product, Engineering, Legal, and other partner-facing teams to initiate, support and grow your partner accounts.Responsibilities
Open doors with potential partners, lead exploratory talks, build consensus with Senior executives internal and external to Google, negotiate complex strategic partnerships that are often first-of-its-kind
Drive and execute distribution negotiations for Google services on Android devices.
Identify and prioritize partner targets; become an expert on each target’s organization, business model, and strategic priorities.
Build and nurture strong relationships with third parties, working directly with some partners and through “one-to-many” models to reach large partner ecosystems.
Serve as the ongoing Android relationship manager helping to realize and optimize value from the partnership.
Minimum qualifications
10 years of experience in the mobile industry across mobile device, mobile operator, and/or related start-ups with international experience across Partner Management activities.
Experience with mobile carriers, mobile or consumer electronics manufacturers, and retailers.
Combined technical and product experience across the mobile space whilst delivering high value outcomes for partners.
Ability to speak and write in English and Bahasa Indonesia fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with ongoing partner relationship management; ability to serve as an advocate for your accounts internally and work collaboratively to identify opportunities or resolve issues.
Strong negotiator with a partnership approach; ability to represent Google in discussions and structure terms to achieve strong ongoing partner alignment.
Ability to interpret legal documents and work with attorneys on specific contract language.
title: Strategic Partnership Development Manager, Android Indonesia
locations: Jakarta, Special Capital Region of Jakarta, Republic of Indonesia

text:
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a Sales manager, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.Responsibilities
Lead and motivate a team of Managers/Team Leads who have responsibility for Key Account Managers
Analyze data, trends and client performance, and develop robust strategic plans and forecasts for customers, quarterly regional plans and long-term regional business plans
Lead and direct global projects and initiatives on behalf of all NBS teams
Liaise with Country Teams, Marketing Teams and SMB Sales Regional Heads on annual plans, market initiatives and major regional escalations. Prepare bottom up analysis for quarterly forecasting cycle, striving to grow the business and show gains in productivity through market initiatives
Act as 'One SMB' with cross functional partners. Take a lead role in building out the Sales team and develop and coach the team in best practices for consultative strategies
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience building relationships with C level executives.
Relevant work experience.
Experience with online media.
Proven ability to grow and lead a sales team with a strong track record of success in sales and in driving Sales and Operations teams.
title: Head of New Business Sales, Benelux and Nordics

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
An Account Analyst requires a sharp, analytical mind and an entrepreneurial spirit. You will be both creative and quantitative in this role. Armed with deep knowledge of Google products, marketing trends and individual client needs, you will develop customized marketing plans to support our Sales team. You identify integrated, data-driven business opportunities based on internal and external tools analysis and work with Account Management and Account Executives to identify business opportunities.Responsibilities
Develop both industry-specific and general market analysis to deliver insights regarding market and competitive trends, auction dynamics, and other data-driven analysis. Analyze client benchmarks, industry snapshots and present client mailshots.
Develop and refine compelling, customized stories and then deliver them to the Sales team in advance of client-facing meetings.
Gather and use data from different internal and external sources and turn it into insights that help clients realize their opportunities.
Develop smart, integrated, research-based proposals and presentations to enhance Google's reputation with client(s) as a consultant and partner. Quantify high-impact opportunities with clear traffic, performance and budget recommendations.
Develop, along with Account Executives and Account Managers, scalable and leading edge solutions for client(s) in order to optimize their advertising investment and maximize use of Google products (Search, Video, Display, Mobile, etc.).
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of extensive analytical work experience, working with data to identify trends and make recommendations in a consumer insights/research, investment banking or consulting function.
Advanced level of proficiency with complex spreadsheets/analysis and putting together presentations.
Proven ability to work cooperatively and proactively with staff inside and outside the department.
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Demonstrated excellence in written and verbal communication.
title: Account Analyst, Home and Personal Care Vertical, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
As a Publisher Monetization Specialist, you will identify and maximize business growth opportunities with existing partners and exceed their expectations through building and maintaining long-term win-win relationships. Your role also involves taking full responsibility of the market through business development initiatives and driving close collaboration with cross-functional internal teams to address the market challenges and opportunities. 

You are self-driven and passionate with excellent communication skills and a proven track record in sales with an analytical approach. You also have strong teamwork and excellent multi-tasking skills.Responsibilities
Accelerate partners' business by identifying optimal Google solutions while leveraging the value of the Google platform for app developers.
Build trusted relationships with partners and develop an extensive understanding of their business challenges in a pulse-type interaction model.
Empower app developers by utilizing Google’s latest technologies to scale and distribute their apps, drive user engagement and maximize their ROI.
Develop and/or participate in scalable and innovative cross-functional projects that help fuel application developers growth.
Promote new products or features that will have a positive impact on partners businesses.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Russian fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Publisher yield management/ad operations and/or sales/account management experience.
Knowledge of and a keen interest in online Display and mobile advertising.
Self-driven and detail-oriented with the ability to prioritize, plan and organize activity.
A passion for applications, digital technology, and the tech “start-ups” environment
title: Publisher Monetization Specialist (Russian)

text:
As a Marketing leader, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.
You will be responsible for defining and executing Google’s Marketing strategy in the cluster countries Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Netherlands and Belgium - supporting Google's growth and business growth generating efforts, as well as caring for Google’s brand and reputation. You will be a key member of the Northern European Cluster leadership team, representing Marketing with a single voice. Working alongside Sales, PR and Engineering teams, and the rest of the EMEA marketing team you will design and deliver effective, results-focused and inspirational marketing campaigns. You will drive projects such as defining and implementing country marketing plans and communications strategy, defining market research studies to gain knowledge about user attitudes and behavior, and developing creative that optimally positions the strengths of our products. You will report into the Regional Marketing Director.Responsibilities
Provide local market expertise and insights through deep understanding of consumer, industry and competitive behavior.
Develop, advocate and implement Google's marketing plans for consumer, advertiser and publisher products in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Netherlands, and Belgium. Understand and be comfortable with trade-offs and making tough business decisions.
Lead and project-manage execution of high-impact programs to drive public perception, product usage, and business growth across the Cluster, including new advertiser acquisition and large scale event management.
Build and mentor a team to handle all Google marketing efforts across the Cluster.
Manage the the Cluster marketing budget and champion the needs of the the Cluster markets in a fast-changing and dynamic international company. Drive new creative and execution best practices from the Cluster around the world.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Digital and traditional media/creative experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and one or more Cluster language fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Expert in marketing with experience in e.g. B2C and B2B marketing, and performance and brand marketing.
Strong project management experience (including agency management), campaign and event planning and execution. Track record of effectively delivering multiple and innovative projects in a very fast-moving environment.
Technology or online industry experience. Leadership experience and gravitas with creative judgment. Up-to-date on groundbreaking web/tech trends.
Ability to influence wide audiences at all levels and work effectively across functions and geographies.
Analytical skills and the ability to develop market insights, marketing strategy and analyze campaign effectiveness and ROI.
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Marketing Director, Northern Europe

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.As a Market Intelligence Analyst you defend the integrity of Google, its users and partners worldwide by defining and communicating product policies, fighting spam, fraud, and abuse across Google products (Google Search, Google Maps, AdWords, AdSense, Google Checkout, Google Product Search). You are proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, innovative--and able to work well in a fast-paced, global, cross-functional, and team-oriented environment while demonstrating technical know-how, effective communication and getting things done.Responsibilities
Investigate low quality and scam advertisers/landing pages/ad creative based on the large set of signals.
Identify and aggregate ads products abuse trends from low quality content to cybercrime.
Analyze and prioritize various data feeds to reveal top issues and take enforcement action, as well as liaise with the Product Quality Operations (PQO) teams and stakeholders (Engineering, Policy, Legal, etc.) to drive the resolution.
Define enforcement strategy and use appropriate processes and tools for implementation. Identify the need for automation or tools to automate and optimize process workflow.
Determine relevant new sources of information to gain market level insight to stay ahead of the game to keep users, advertisers and Google protected.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in data processing.
Ability to speak and write in Spanish and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working with SQL, Dremel, Python, Java, JS or HTML.
Project management and process optimization experience e.g. with a data analytics component.
Knowledge in Internet, web-research, online advertising, fraud detection, numerical analysis and e-commerce.
Ability to identify complex problems and implement creative, data-driven solutions.
Exceptional internet research skills and knowledge of web technologies.
title: Market Intelligence Analyst (Spanish)

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Google for Work Apps Strategic Account Sales Executive - Tokyo.The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Apps Strategic Account Sales Executive, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.
Responsibilities
Capture interest and create demand for business transformation using Google technology among targeted accounts.
Discover business/IT pain points as well as IT landscape at targeted accounts, and map Google solutions.
Craft an actionable account plan and engage internal key stakeholders.
Execute account plan including concrete business plan such as structuring agreements, convincing/influencing key customer contacts, driving their decisions on Google-based projects and managing agreements.
Represent Google at targeted accounts with executive presence across functions in overall account/relationship management.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
7 years of field sales experience in the technology industry targeting global accounts.
Experience in managing engagement model with customers and internal stakeholders as account director.
Command of proven sales methodology and consultative/value-based selling.
Proven ability to consistently exceed quotas.
Ability to balance competing priorities and manage time-sensitive projects with minimal direction in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills in English and Japanese.
title: Google for Work Apps Strategic Account Sales Executive

text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.
The Mobile Infrastructure Team designs and builds the infrastructure on top of which all YouTube mobile applications are developed. Our work enables YouTube Android and iOS development at scale through reusable components and practices, and a strong culture around robustness and performance. The work that you do on this team will impact multiple application teams and will be highly leveraged across YouTube’s mobile products.
Responsibilities
Enable the best mobile video experience in the world.
Design, build, and improve the client framework to support multiple application teams shipping fast, stable, and delightful experiences to hundreds of millions of users.
Design complex APIs adaptable to different applications across different platforms.
Improve performance and optimize user experience across several mobile applications.
Establish best engineering practices and influence them through solid design decisions, processes, and tools.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in computer science or equivalent practical experience.
Native mobile application development experience on one or more major mobile platforms (iOS, Android, Windows).
Experience in Objective-C, iOS, Java, Android, C#, WP7, UI design and implementation.

Preferred qualifications
Experience in and/or significant accomplishments in large- scale mobile projects.
Experience in API design, performance optimization, client architecture, or tools, in the mobile space.
title: Software Engineer, Mobile Infrastructure, YouTube

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.
Developer Marketing is focused on driving the success of Google's developer platforms, such as Android, by executing global, scalable programs, events and creative marketing campaigns to engage and delight developers. Google Play developer marketing is focused on building successful apps and games businesses on Play - helping developers build commercially viable consumer offerings with our products, APIs and tools. You will have a passion for apps and games business models and understanding how developers use our APIs and tools to achieve business success. We are looking for a marketing manager who can not only communicate with existing developers but also win the hearts and minds of first-time Android developers and encourage them to innovate and grow their businesses on Android through Google Play. This is a local/regional role, based in Seoul, Korea.Responsibilities
Conceptualize creative solutions and deliver integrated marketing campaigns and programs to drive user/developer acquisition and engagement of new and existing Google Play products, APIs and tools.
Integrate existing Google Play products, APIs and tools into a plan to reach new developers and get them excited about Android platform as a strategic business decision.
Collaborate with Google Play business development team to provide tailored marketing support to key existing developers, including value proposition and co-marketing plans.
Collaborate with Android Developer Relations team to provide marketing support to varied developer outreach initiatives. Establish online presence to engage potential developers, existing ecosystems and developer communities.
Contribute to key developer events such as Google Developer Summits and Think events which the wider Google Developer Marketing team leads.
Minimum qualificationsBA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.5 years of experience in B2B marketing program management or scaled partner relationship management.Preferred qualifications
Event content development or management experience/involvement.
Industry experience in apps or game. Experience in developer outreach.
Good understanding of Google's strategic and competitive position pertaining to Android and Google Play.
Track record in developing effective business and competitive positioning and messaging for technical products.
Demonstrated analytical success. Passion for analyzing products, customers and market dynamics.
Strong organizational, leadership, and analytical skills. Outstanding written and oral communication skills both in Korean and English.
title: Developer Product Marketing Manager, Google Play, Korea

text:
Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind those systems are Googlers who advise and partner with our users and customers. As an Advertiser Solutions Consultant you will support clients using our DoubleClick products, including mobile and rich media. Your projects will include business pitches, product implementation and upgrades, and custom solutions. Customers will look to your expertise on product configuration and business processes, combining your deep understanding of DoubleClick products with industry best practices.
You are a technical expert with an entrepreneurial drive for client-solutions and technology. You love solving client's online advertising problems. Additionally, you partner with sales to find business growth opportunities for Google. Your strong technical background and solid communication skills mean you confidently convey a product's value proposition to both non-technical and technical audiences. Your projects will include product-implementations and custom-solutions spanning multiple products including AdWords and YouTube.Responsibilities
Work with Sales to identify business opportunities leveraging both display and performance solutions supported by gTech.
Collect requirements, provide guidance and best practices to apply ad products and technologies to achieve advertisers' business goals.
Design and implement complex and customized solutions with a client in their portfolio.
Be responsible for end-to-end implementations and escalations handled by other Google teams for our named accounts.
Manage the technical relationship with selected advertisers portfolios.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.4 years of experience working with large customer engagements (e.g. Project Management, Technical Sales, ad Operations etc.).
Experience with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript and HTTP.
Preferred qualifications

MS or MBA degree.
Experience in the online advertising industry.
Experience with programming and scripting.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to translate complex product and technical concepts to non-technical and executive audiences.
title: Ad Solutions Consultant

text:
As a Merchandising Manager in EMEA, you will help build and maintain Google Play's merchandising program on handsets, web and tablets. Based on your digital content retail experience, you will coordinate and launch effective online features and promotions. You bring to the table strong retail instincts, sharp analytical abilities, and impeccable oral and written communication skills. You are comfortable working cross-functionally with product, design, marketing, engineering, and other teams to develop an innovative user experience. It’s important that you be able to work both independently and collaboratively to develop new content features and scalable merchandising processes. You’ll also have a track record for successful prioritization, meeting critical deadlines, and enthusiastically tackling challenges with an eye toward problem solving.
The Global Merchandising team owns content programming within the Play store across all regions and verticals (Apps, Games, Music, Movies & TV, and Books & Magazines). 

As a Merchandising Manager (Apps) for Google Play, you will impact millions of users everyday by owning merchandising efforts end-to-end for the Apps vertical within your markets. You will be the expert on the content, user needs and the local ecosystem. 

You will work with Merchandisers from other verticals on country strategy, Business Development on understanding needs of strategic partners and Product & Engineering on supporting new platform capabilities. You will set the strategy for and execute against merchandising and retail promotions for the Apps vertical while continually analyzing performance metrics and optimizing the user experience. 

You bring extensive experience in an online or mobile business and have a fanatical devotion to the user as well as superb organization and communication skills. Your track record of beating traffic, conversion and business goals is unparalleled.
Responsibilities
Set country merchandising strategy for the Apps vertical and execute against the global plan
Analyze internal data, market research and industry trends to select content to promote
Drive strategy for content partner co-­promotion opportunities, working with the Business Development team and content owners to secure exclusives for Apps vertical
Develop user insight for the Apps vertical, including understanding of customer life cycles and segments
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in a merchandising, marketing or partnerships role for an online commerce or digital content business.
Ability to speak and write in English and German fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working in function or company focused on mobile.
Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze research or performance data and apply that analysis to optimize merchandising strategy.
Ability to work with partners to develop co­-promotion or cross-­promotion strategies and campaigns.
Ability to advise on strategies and product requirements to enhance merchandising capabilities.
Strong communication skills and collaborative working approach.
title: Merchandising Manager Apps (German Market), Google Play
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
YouTube’s ecosystem is constantly growing and evolving, and it is critical to deploy resources efficiently to best serve YouTube’s advertisers, publishers and users globally. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, Associates on the team focus on assessing strategic initiatives, coordinating business planning, and driving actionable insights. You will be responsible for understanding the needs and identifying key drivers across a broad set of partners (media companies, vloggers, sports leagues, music publishers, etc.) and business models.
As an Associate, you will provide analytical “horsepower” and project management to support YouTube’s key strategic and operational priorities. You will frame and structure solutions, analyzing data and applying critical thinking to make recommendations and inform major business decisions. You will work cross-functionally with YouTube's Sales, Product, Engineering, Finance, and People Operations (HR) teams. You will be an expert on YouTube’s business model and operations and will apply your analytical experience to help advise strategy and optimize business operations. From scoping to analysis to implementation, you will be responsible for working with global teams on projects that impact the entire organization.
Responsibilities
Research and analyze key business drivers, competitive environment, opportunities, trends and operating metrics.
Execute sophisticated quantitative analyses and advanced modeling that translates data into actionable insights.
Analyze research data and synthesize raw information into insights, recommendations, dashboards and reports. Prepare presentations and clearly communicate findings from initiatives to senior management and to the broader organization.
Be responsible for part of larger initiatives both on an on-going basis and on an ad-hoc basis in order to provide proactive support in execution of global business development strategic priorities for the client group.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant experience in management consulting or corporate strategy.
Preferred qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
Experience or passion in consumer internet, media or online video industries.
Familiarity with SQL and basic coding experience (e.g. MATLAB, R, Python or Java).
Excellent spreadsheet software financial modeling and presentation software skills.
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
Ability to communicate and influence effectively by presenting data in a compelling way.
title: Associate, YouTube Strategy

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
Google Play is growing at a rapid pace, serving millions of Android users, both new and existing, with apps and games that are innovative, useful and entertaining. You will be part of the Google Play Partnership Development team, focused on helping developers build successful businesses using the Android platform and Google Play.
As a Business Development Manager for Google Play Apps and Games, you will acquire, drive and build a pipeline of amazing Android apps and games. You will also help partners manage business growth creation and growth on Google Play.Responsibilities
Become the primary point of contact for key Apps and Games partners in Korea.
Work with the cross-functional team (Product, Engineering, Marketing) to grow the ecosystem of Google Play in Korea.
Track and understand key partner metrics to understand the health of developer businesses.
Communicate best practices to partners to support the strategic priorities of Google Play.
Define partnership strategies and execute go-to-market plans.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant work experience in the areas of mobile apps and games, mobile business, distribution channels, and competitive landscape.
Experience sourcing, managing and negotiating with partners to create relationships.
Preferred qualifications
Proven experience working with partners, ideally in the gaming and/ or mobile industries.
In-depth experience operating within and leading cross-functional teams (product management, implementation, legal, finance, marketing, etc.).
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, fluid, and collaborative environment.
Passion for mobile apps and games, mobile business, mobile technology.
Excellent communication skills in both Korean and English.
title: Business Development Manager, Google Play Apps and Games

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Search Quality Analyst (Korean) - Tokyo.The Search Quality Evaluation (SQE) team's mission is to make the world's information more useful by defending the integrity of Google Search. On the SQE team you have an opportunity to make a significant and direct impact on the quality of Google's search results. You improve user search experience by reviewing search results for quality and content. You reach out to our webmaster community, provide user support, create market-specific policies and develop tools to aid our spam-fighting endeavors. You are part of a high performing team that is passionate about keeping Google Search at its best.
As a Search Quality Analyst you have the opportunity to make a significant and direct impact on the quality of Google's search results through search quality evaluation. You work on the cutting edge of search and the forefront of the web ensuring quality information is provided to millions of Internet users, and you are be expected to keep pace with constant change in a fast-paced work environment, bringing innovative ideas to improve access to relevant information on the web. You are a web-savvy individual who is a take-charge team player, as well as a quick learner and strongly interested in providing a better search experience for Google users.
You should feel comfortable with reviewing a great deal of Korean web search results and websites, and discussing nuances of Google product policies in Korean.Responsibilities
Improve the quality of Google’s search results through investigation, prevention and removal of search quality issues.
Understand Google’s search policies and enforce them by reviewing search results and websites in order to identify areas of concern.
Identify market trends, and recommend strategy adjustments based on market trends and patterns.
Partner with engineering teams to improve our search quality.
Develop and share practices for search quality investigation and analysis.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.Ability to speak Korean fluently and idiomatically.Business level communication in English and Japanese. 
Preferred qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Law, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or related discipline.
2 years of experience in one of the following areas: internet technology, online search, e-commerce, or online advertising/publishing, policy enforcement/user trust/risk/fraud investigation/product abuse.
Fundamental understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and familiarity with typical web practices.
Exceptional internet research skills and knowledge of web technologies, Good knowledge in internet infrastructure, website hosting, online advertising, fraud detection, numerical analysis and e-commerce.
Ability to analyze data and provide clear solutions with a strong attention to detail.
Passion for the web.
title: Search Quality Analyst (Korean) - Tokyo

text:
As a Brand Marketing Manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
As a Brand Marketing Manager, you’re a progressive, tech-savvy, rules-breaking and big-thinking steward of Google’s brands. You are experienced in the art and science of brand management, you're expected to develop a deep and wide understanding of Google’s brand ethos, architecture, and assets, and develop systems that codify and transmit all of them across Google and to key partners around the world. You’ll work to execute breakthrough ideas that will have as much impact in the development of brand strategy and management as Google's products have in technology.
You’re a strategic thinker, operations master, and change agent who thrives jumping in feet first to solve challenging problems by always focusing on the user. You are someone who's looking to the future, and who can help communicate technology in a way everyone can understand. In addition, you’ll be expected to be a doer as well as a thinker, who doesn’t settle for the expected and conventional, but works to push ideas, and Google’s approach to brand management, far beyond the norm.Responsibilities
Work with cross-functional teams throughout Google’s portfolio of companies, products and services to operationalize brand management in ways that match Google’s culture and aspirations.
Apply best-in-class experience to create elegant, intuitive management systems and brand identity tools that reinforce and extend the essential understanding and alignment of our brands inside and outside of Google.
Manage day-to-day relationships with key brand management partners.
Analyze scenarios and make brand management recommendations as new products and features are added to our portfolio.
Train global cross-functional teams on Google’s approach to brand management and take on special brand projects as needed.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.7 years of brand strategy experience.

Preferred qualifications
5 years of brand management experience.
Deep understanding of the art and science of brand management, with demonstrated experience in operationalizing brand management.
Proven track record of successfully working with cross-functional teams and agencies.
Ability to effectively operate in a fast-paced, constantly-evolving, team environment.
Ability to influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management.
title: Brand Strategist, Global Brand Studio

text:
Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. As a Project Manager, you will create and drive the programs that help us to find and develop the best talent in the world. You will oversee the projects that allow GPS to provide candidates and clients with a world-class experience as productively and efficiently as possible. Using your strong communication skills, you will set team strategy, influence business partners and facilitate change management across the department. You'll partner with other project managers, client-group managers and engineers to set strategy, build support processes and develop content that delights our users.
Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google. 

The Technical Student Outreach team is focused on promoting Google as an exceptional place to work for technical talent, building a sustainable and diverse pipeline of outstanding candidates, and collaborating to build and refine innovative partnerships and education strategies.Responsibilities
Manage the education strategy at HBCU’s and GIR selection process, training and evaluation of all GIRs.
Drive the curriculum consultation across HBCU’s and in partnership with other GIRs. Develop a strategy to teach the teachers at HBCU’s
Lead the building and execution of a long-term strategy for GIR growth including an approach for instructing beyond introductory CS coursework and securing team resources/budget requirements for growth
Partner with HBCU Outreach Lead to develop strong relationships with HBCU’s. Research and advise on potential expansion to other universities
Partner with the HBCU Outreach Lead and Curriculum Development Lead to research potential for GIR model to become a tech industry consortium or part of a larger Google-wide initiative on curriculum development. Join the Student Development working group on new development programs, with a focus on curriculum recommendations
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Computer Science educator experience (e.g. High School or University level educator, Teaching Assistant, CS curriculum design etc.)
Ability to travel when needed (less than 20%).
Preferred qualifications
Track record of successfully managing large complex projects.
Strong influencing and negotiation skills.
Ability to work with multiple internal groups, including remote teams, and build strong personal networks across a complex, fast-moving organization.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities and superior analytical skills.
High level of interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
title: Program Manager, Google in Residence

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
The SMB (Small and Medium-sized Businesses) Revenue team designs and implements scalable global sales programs for our SMB advertiser channel. The team supports and iterates on existing sales programs, develops and pilots new efforts, and champions strategic asks to cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Finance, Marketing, etc.) across Google.

In this role, you will work with a team focused on sales programs for SMB agencies and will be responsible for developing recommendations for and creating solutions to complex, ambiguous and high-visibility business challenges with the goal of driving significant business growth. You will work closely with sales and cross-functional leaders to ensure the smooth development, implementation and on-going management of our global SMB Agency Sales programs. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to represent SMB Sales in presentations to sales executives and cross-functional leaders.
Responsibilities
Ensure and manage the successful execution of global programs.
Identify large opportunities for product, program and process improvement, with a focus on driving significant business growth.
Develop and independently run global projects end-to-end. Ensure successful planning, execution, analysis and communication of your projects.
Advocate on behalf of SMB Sales to cross-functional partners to drive development of our asks and execution of solutions.
Communicate the team’s successes, challenges and plans to senior executives across Google.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in a sales, management consulting, corporate strategy, or sales operations role.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master's degree.
Experience in online advertising sales or similar industries.
Demonstrated experience with cross-functional collaboration and influence.
Strong project management, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
title: Agency Program Manager, Global SMB Revenue Team, SMB Sales and Operations

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As a Google Account Executive, you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions. Google has become a leader in this space because we've developed effective products and services targeted to marketers and consumers. You will support and grow new business with Google’s top advertisers. You'll manage business relationships to ensure that our clients' needs and requirements are met. This will require you to serve as their advocate within Google while collaborating with other Google teams to provide them with a comprehensive portfolio of solutions and options. This is a client-facing business role requiring deep industry expertise, proven business ability and a broad base of industry contacts.Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with a team to drive mobile growth for priority customers. Enable Sales teams to lead more UX discussions on Mobile Web and Mobile App opportunities.
Develop high-level relationships to serve as a trusted mobile consultant. Develop C-level relationships to serve as a trusted mobile consultant.
Develop thought leadership on vertical-wide mobile narratives, initiatives, and measurement opportunities.
Become a mobile product expert, and drive the momentum in trying new alphas, betas, and being the point of contact with various internal teams (Sales Leadership, Product, Operations, etc.).
Create a framework for executing attribution-related modeling with priority customers in partnership with global product experts and attribution stakeholders.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in an advertising business, business development and/or online media environment.
Preferred qualifications
10 years of relevant experience in online business, advertising, marketing, and business development.
Experience working with advertisers, agencies, and/or clients.
Knowledge of and established relationships within the advertising industry and the relevant industry vertical.
Knowledge of traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
A deep understanding of the industry's issues, a vision for its growth, and a commitment to advance Google's forward-looking strategies within the marketplace.
Willing to travel.
title: Mobile Account Executive, Consumer Electronics Vertical

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
This role will focus on the Google Glass Developer Kit (GDK).Responsibilities
Develop Android application for Google Glass based on The Glass Developer Kit and the Android Software Developer Kit.

BS in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of programming experience in Java.

Experience developing native applications for Android

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
As an Online Partnerships Group Account Manager, you will provide strategic account and relationship management to a portfolio of customers that includes many well-known brand sites. You will be responsible for driving our business forward by promoting the full Google suite of publisher and developer products. The primary online advertising solutions you will be promoting are AdSense and the Ad Exchange for desktop publishers, and AdMob for mobile publishers/apps developers. A key focus will be providing the right product mix for a partner across the full range of online properties. You will organize and execute on Online Partnerships Group Partner events, build new partnerships with key online companies in your market and develop innovative new ways to help partners grow their advertising earnings with Google. You’ll also contribute to the development of strategies for your market.Responsibilities
Build trusted, strategic relationships with partners and develop a thorough understanding of their business challenges
Add value to our partners' business by proposing the optimal solution
Provide creative ways for partners to improve their business
Cross-promote new products or features that will have a positive impact on partner investments

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Business, related field or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Experience in publisher yield management, ad operations and/or sales/account management.
Knowledge of and a keen interest in online display and mobile advertising.
Detail-oriented and analytical with the ability to prioritize, plan and organize sales activity.
title: Strategic Partner Manager (UKI), Online Partnerships Group

text:
People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be a champion of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching your clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.
The role of the HR Coordinator is to enable the Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) team to deliver solutions to clients seamlessly. The main priority of the role will be to provide support to the TechHR team to plan and keep track of delivery across the team and clients. This will involve slick communication, superb organization and collaboration on a global scale with a wide variety of stakeholders. You will also work closely with the HRBPs and liaise with other functions (such as communications) and senior stakeholders across Google. You will be the linchpin who keeps everything on track. There will be an extensive variety of tasks from providing administrative support to managing many short to medium-term projects.
Responsibilities
Provide People Operations support to the business, answering employee and manager questions about People Operations programs, policies, benefits and other People Operations-related items.
Assist with People Operations transactions including compensation changes, processing spot bonus awards and status change request forms, and handling employee transfers and exits.
Assist HRBP team with planning and roll-out of People Operations programs such as performance management, compensation planning, and other project-related work.
Conduct data analysis in partnership with the HRBP team related to many different activities (e.g. headcount, performance management, talent review, spot bonus budgets).
Build efficiency and effective responsiveness into existing operations. Anticipate and address needs before they are raised by our clients.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Significant experience with spreadsheet software and data analysis tools.
Client-service orientation with a strong focus on delivering exceptional customer service.
Proven ability to consistently and positively contribute in a high-paced environment.
Demonstrated ability to keep information confidential and commitment to produce high quality work.
Strong interpersonal, teamwork and organizational skills.
Superior verbal and written communication skills, with an emphasis on tact and diplomacy.
title: HR Coordinator, TechHR

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis.
