text:
Google for Work helps companies around the world to be more productive, mobile and collaborative by "going Google." As a Google for Work Technology Partner Consultant, you are responsible for providing technical solutions and managing relationships with Google's largest and most strategic partners. As a liaison between clients and our technical staff, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations and integrations of a variety of our product lines (such as Gmail, Google Drive, and Hangouts). You are a technical expert with an entrepreneurial drive and passion for client management.
You play a critical role in the development and implementation of new Google products for Work. You will work closely with developers - ISVs, partners and customers - to evangelize Apps APIs and the Google Apps platform. You will help developers on technical solutions and approaches needed to integrate with Google Apps. You will present roadmap of Apps APIs and AppScript to customers, partners, developers and analysts. Create and engage community of developers working with Google Apps APIs and AppScript.
You will lead all aspects of system design, prototype development, testing, documentation, training, implementation, and initial support and maintenance.
Responsibilities
Consult with clients on technical issues based on in-depth product and technical knowledge.
Develop technical tools and documentation to expedite partner implementation, and improve product serviceability.
Collaborate with Engineering to thoroughly test all use-cases and commercialize solutions.
Provide product solution improvements and market opportunities to Product Manager and Engineering.
Provide highly technical implementation support in client environment, including guidance on implementation feasibility of cross-product integrations.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant programming experience in Java, Python, C++, or JavaScript.
Technical experience in Web technologies such as HTTP, HTML, XML, DNS, and TCP/IP.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Computer Science or related major.
4 years of relevant programming experience in Java, Python, C++, or JavaScript. Applications development experience, working in Unix or related environments.
Experience programming mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms.
Technical sales or field sales experience with strong business knowledge; sales engineering or professional consulting experience.
Working knowledge of analysis of relational data in MySQL or equivalent.
Proven ability to adapt your message to the technical level of the audience, and comfort presenting technical materials to large groups. Excellent communication skills.
title: Google for Work Technology Partner Consultant, Apps

text:
The Google.org Access Development team's objective is to bring broadband to emerging markets in a financially sustainable and scalable way to impact hundreds of millions of people. The group focuses on developing business models, regulation and technology to support these goals. There is a strong emphasis on bringing new technologies or new ways to use technologies to solve the access challenges in these markets. As a member of the team, you will be responsible for defining and implementing access projects in emerging markets, as well as identifying and incubating promising technological solutions.
The Google Access team works to make Internet access more powerful, accessible and affordable for all. We also work to develop the next-generation technologies that will improve the lives and businesses of our millions of users around the planet. Want to change the world? Good. So do we. 

With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as lead some of Google's most complex multidisciplinary projects. As the Network Quality Assurance Lead, you will define and oversee network quality initiatives, identify risks and communicate goals and expectations to all stakeholders.Responsibilities
Operate across a myriad of internal Google groups and external organizations to ready and implement quality assurance processes.
Lead quality process improvements and quality assurance tools development that result in efficiency and efficacy gains.
Manage the quality control process to produce a value-engineered design, removing all obstacles in construction and operations.
Manage and enforce engineering quality and compliance with the design specifications. 
Work on all quality assurance processes required to achieve long term sustainability.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BSc degree in a technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
Experience of both wireline and wireless protocols technologies and solutions.
Experience in the development and implementation of quality assurance systems and processes.
Preferred qualifications
Excellent analytical skills and a tenacious problem solver with extensive knowledge of Telecommunications projects and quality assurance.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with ability to successfully work across multiple levels of the organization.
title: Network Quality Assurance Lead

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
The OPG grows Google's business by identifying new online publishers and app developers and helping them maximize their business growth with our products such as AdSense, Ad Exchange and AdMob. Our team is made up of high-achieving Business Acquisition Managers who work in a fast evolving marketplace identifying strategic partners and helping them develop their online and mobile strategy. You leverage your entrepreneurial drive to target, educate and persuade new partners to embrace Google's latest products and technologies. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis.Responsibilities
Prospect for new partners. Develop sales pitch strategies that optimize the market potential.
Establish trusted relationships with clients and develop a thorough understanding of their business challenges.
Uncover business needs of new online publishers and present our online solutions to them.
Be responsible for the Russian and Israeli new business development strategy.
Provide the ultimate client service by giving potential new strategic partners the attention they need and deserve.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write Russian and/or Hebrew fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Full sales cycle experience with a proven track record of achieving or over achieving targets.
Ability to pitch comprehensive monetization solutions over the telephone or face-to-face to high-end prospects.
Extremely proactive, organized, responsible, with proven ability to work well with a team.
Self-starter, self-motivated, and capable of seeking additional opportunities.
Strong communication skills.
title: Business Acquisition Manager (Russia and Israel), Online Partnerships Group

text:
Google's leadership team hand-picks thorny business challenges, and members of BizOps work in small teams to find solutions. As part of this team you fully immerse yourself in data collection, draw insight from analysis, and then zoom out to develop compelling, synthesized recommendations. Taking strategy one step further, you also persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior-level executives, roll-up your sleeves to help drive implementation and check back-in to see the impact of your recommendations.
The Google Play Partner Operations team is all about focusing on the user. You will be a professional, experienced and driven vendor manager in the Play Partner Operations team. Your job will require you to have strong relationships with internal stakeholders (vertical managers) and drive operational performance by managing a high performing vendor operations team, so that Google can get the best value and continue to invest in its great new products. You will have experience in analytics, quantitative metric analysis, people/performance management, call center management and/or other related areas. You will be a top performer who will quickly adapt and respond to changes as well as internal initiatives. You are someone who thrives in an ever-changing, fast-growing operational environment. You will have an operational savvy, proactive personality, the ability to make smart, independent decisions and the willingness to manage deliverables across teams and priorities.Responsibilities
Manage the overall performance of operations vendor workforce in terms of quality, resources and delivery of service. Ensure all aspects of vendor SLAs (Service Level Agreements) are consistently met (backlog, AHT, agent utilization, etc.).
Lead regular business reviews and any vendor relationship management activities.
Participate in workforce planning activities in coordination with internal teams.
Support vendor selection and overall vendor operations strategy.
Work closely with various internal groups to understand business requirements, implement new processes and contribute to ongoing process improvements.
Minimum qualifications
4 years of work experience managing operational projects.
2 years of experience managing vendor operations.
Preferred qualifications
Six Sigma certification.
Business process expertise.
Strong analytical and structured problem solving capabilities.
Exceptional leadership, management, communication and collaboration skills.
title: Onsite Vendor Manager, Google Play

text:
Our Googlers are innovative, take big risks and get things done, and our compensation plans are designed to reward them accordingly. On the leading edge of the compensation field, our team runs cyclical cash and equity programs and takes the notion of "Total Rewards" to new heights. We always aim to better recognize outstanding performance, so as a member of this team, you're an unconventional thinker and are willing to make bold bets. You take Googlers' feedback seriously, and collect it often to continually improve and enhance our programs through a two-way dialogue. Combining data and feedback from our Googlers with the latest industry research, you make large-scale, data-driven decisions that impact Googlers in a meaningful way.
As a Compensation and Performance Management Analyst, you’ll help drive the success of Google’s compensation and performance management programs on a global scale. In this role, you’ll build large-scale models, develop expertise in complex program details, and develop clear and concise messaging to educate and enable your many partners across People Operations. You’ll help make strategic improvements to the programs by synthesizing insights from both data analysis and communication with key stakeholders. You’ll also manage several projects at once and help People Operations leadership to make sound choices by analyzing data and working on critical issues.Responsibilities
Work closely with other analysts, managers and HR Business Partners to ensure the success of Google’s compensation planning and performance management programs (e.g., merit increases, annual bonuses, promotions, employee development, employee evaluation).
Manipulate large data sets in complex ways; tease meaning from the numbers and convey findings to leadership.
Play a governance role in the creation and review of compensation and performance management programs business rules.
Partner with Program Managers to prioritize and operationalize key tasks and processes.
Work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time efficiently.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Economics or other quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years or relevant work experience.
Experience with spreadsheet software.
Preferred qualifications
4 years of experience in investment banking, strategy consulting or compensation consulting.
Advanced spreadsheet software skills and familiarity with SQL.
Strong executive presence, comfortable with presenting directly to senior People Operations leadership.
Client-service orientation with extremely strong attention to detail. Ability to prioritize and work well in an environment with competing demands.
Deep interest in analyzing data and the ability to see beyond the numbers to drive sound decision-making.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills and an ability to find and execute creative solutions.
title: Compensation and Performance Management Analyst

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
As the Domains Policy and Compliance Program Manager, you will manage domain name related policy and compliance issues for Google. In this role, you will work with a variety of internal teams along with external stakeholders including the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN), government officials, industry, and public interest groups to drive solutions that meet Google’s long-term needs. The role requires a strategic perspective on the domain name industry, a solid understanding of ICANN and its contractual frameworks, the ability to identify, build and cultivate working partnerships with both regulators and energy industry stakeholders, and effective work across teams in order to ensure compliance with relevant rules and regulations.Responsibilities
Analyze and establish Google’s priorities and positions on regulatory and policy issues related to Google’s domain name products.
Develop and drive public policy and regulatory initiatives in all markets where we offer domain names.
Work with the Google Public Policy team to establish and implement strategies to communicate policy positions to key constituencies.
Work with trade associations, industry partners, non-profit groups, and other allies to establish and understand constraints and opportunities to Google strategy and priorities.
Support domain name related business initiatives, working closely with Engineering, Product Management and Business Development.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in technology, science, law, policy, economics or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant experience including working with ICANN and domain industry.
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree in Computer Engineering, MBA, JD or relevant advanced degree.
Direct experience working with the various institutions of government.
Experience managing internal compliance programs
Creative approach to problem solving and ability to deal with ambiguity.
Exemplary business judgment, problem solving and analytical skills, along with the ability to effectively communicate with highly technical management team
Exceptional oral and written communication ability and superb project management skills.
title: Domains Policy and Compliance Program Manager

text:
Google is a universally recognized name. The Localization team helps Google's ideas and products look, feel and sound natural to users in their own countries. We collaborate with international Engineering, Product and Marketing teams to steer products through the localization process and ensure successful launches across the globe. Our team is an international collection of enthusiastic, creative and knowledgeable people who excel in a fast-paced, culturally diverse environment. You are an excellent communicator who plays a strategic role by building relationships with partner teams to establish needs, deadlines and budgets. You will flex your project management skills in order to ensure that our Localization process runs effectively and efficiently.
You have a passion for language and you want to shape Google’s voice in your market or region. Google's mission is to make all of the world's information universally accessible and useful. We take that seriously for far more than just products in English language. Help us make sure that Google is useful and fun for our international users.
If you are an experienced Korean translator, copywriter, linguist, writer or editor with a creative, marketing or localization background then this role could be perfect for you.Responsibilities
Work closely with Google's translation and review vendors to ensure localization quality and monitor language quality data. Develop a good understanding of market expectations for localization quality and how Google's products fit in the market.
Form a critical part of the Google in-country “go-to-market” team with Marketing, Product and PR to drive localization of Google products. Work closely with local teams to develop specific terminology for new features and products, and shape the Google voice for the local market/region.
Work with localization project managers and other teams at Google to identify and address linguistic issues. Maintain language references such as terminology databases and the style guide.
Ensure quality of high-priority products and highly visible materials through quality assurance and bug fixing, taking a hands-on approach as necessary.
Understand challenges in the localization process and lead broad language quality improvement initiatives at the language and team level, as well as upstream.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as a Korean translator, linguist, copywriter, writer or editor.
Ability to speak and write in Korean and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master's degree
Experience within creative, localization or the online marketing/advertising industry.
Ability to relate to ambiguity, work independently and be able to chart direction of projects.
Detail-oriented, quality-focused and proactive, with strong ability to manage projects.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to manage multiple and diverse stakeholders across businesses and leadership levels.
title: Language Specialist, Korean

text:
Design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. The job of an Interaction Designer is to envision how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In an Interaction Designer role, you’ll tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of people around the world—from the first-time user to the sophisticated expert. Achieving this goal requires collaboration with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.
As a Motion Designer, you will design animations of the Glass user experience. You will work alongside other members of the UX Design, Engineering and Marketing teams to build interaction models, conduct user research and develop creative solutions to challenging UX problems in Google Glass. You are a self-driven and well rounded design professional with a keen understanding of consumer products, and a passion for defining the next generation of wearable computing. Additionally, you will aid in crating the narrative that guides users, improve usability, and makes the experience responsive and fun. You are a detail-oriented motion designer who can weave motion into interaction design and simplify complexity.Responsibilities
Define and implement the motion design language of one or more parts of the Glass user experience.
Provide patterns, best practices, and guidance on animation and transitions.
Create documentation (motion specs) that enables software developers to build software that fosters a delightful user experience.
Collaborate with and develop mutual respect and trust with product managers, engineers,researchers and designers.
Participate in user experience research and usability studies.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS, or a related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience using animation software.
Portfolio that includes motion and interaction design on mobile and/or web contexts.
Preferred qualifications
Familiarity with design techniques, such as storyboarding, user research and wireframes.
Solid understanding of the basic principles of animation.
Understanding of motion design details (physics, patterns, and visual design elements).
A strong acumen for user experience design and how motion design influences visual and interaction design (and vice versa).
Ability to use motion to express sentiment or emotional experience.
Strong conceptual skills.
title: Motion Designer (Glass)

text:
At Google, we expect our products to be lightning fast, and the same is true for our internal tools. Our Google People Services (GPS) team is made up of architects who envision better processes, build them, reliably operate them and then continually improve upon them. As a member of the team, you think holistically about technology, about the tools themselves and the systems and processes that support them. Your projects use technology to streamline and drive processes that are essential to keeping our organization operating. You have a bias for action and impeccable execution. You're a problem solver with drive and creativity who is constantly seeking to make our processes and systems better, faster and more efficient.
Maintaining a workforce that can deploy and redeploy agilely in this ever-changing environment is key to Google’s culture and success. Often we partner with other companies to help us scale in areas where we are exploring new opportunities or we need expertise in that is not part of our core business. Google created a program office to help build and manage relationships with these companies and their workers.

In this role, you will help the program office that manages these contingent labor relationships work better for Google - managing improvement projects, simplifying processes, etc.Responsibilities
Design and conduct program audits to evaluate compliance, operational efficiencies, and process improvement opportunities.
Identify and implement opportunities to simplify and automate operational processes by gathering, refining and analyzing large sets of data using scripts, spreadsheets and databases. Design and pilot experiments using scientific methodologies to discover and drive operational improvements.
Lead projects independently from conception through to implementation by establishing and adhering to project plans, proactively identifying and resolving risks, and regularly communicating progress against defined milestones. Support coordination and management of portfolio of projects and initiatives by maintaining tracking tools and participating and facilitating project meetings.
Design and develop reports, dashboards, executive communications and presentations using business intelligence tools and data-driven analyses. Maintain and enhance internal and external facing knowledge bases and sites.
Support systems implementations, changes and integrations by translating operational needs into systems requirements, designing use cases, conducting testing, and supporting change management.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a related field.
Experience in designing and conducting audits and quality assurance processes.
Experience with spreadsheet software and/or Google Apps for Work (e.g. presentation software). Experience with writing scripts and macros (e.g. AppScript).
Preferred qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field
Strong experience in analytics e.g. in consulting, finance, or IT.
Experience working on HR or procurement related efforts.
Ability to work cross functionally and collaboratively in a large, complex, perpetually evolving environment.
Ability to analyze large sets of data (e.g. regressions, factor analyses, t-tests, ANOVAs.) and synthesize findings into executive-ready communications.
Excellent project management, problem solving and analytical skills.
title: Lead Analyst, Process and Operations

text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.
As a Territory Manager you will be responsible for driving business and adoption of our Drive for Work and Chrome product areas in to leading organizations. You inspire clients to investigate our technologies so they, as a company, can be more productive in an ever increasing competitive marketplace. You will enable these clients to be more mobile and agile by using tools that are easy, trusted and business ready. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.
Responsibilities
Generate a territory plan to ensure a broad penetration into the accounts within your territory.
Understand complex customer requirements on both a business and technical level.
Develop and provide custom presentations on Google for Work Solutions to customers to solve their business problems.
Work with Partners to develop and articulate business value of our solutions
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Business or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of field sales experience in the technology industry.
Preferred qualifications
Ability to work independently but within a team environment.
Self-motivated, with proven ability to promote products and meet or exceed goals.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal.
title: Territory Manager, Google for Work

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.Responsibilities
Work closely with our Sales teams in different regions of the world to deliver as per business goals and build a strong understanding of digital advertising ecosystem including AdWords products.
Coach and groom team’s overall development and identify career development opportunities for them.
Develop and implement best practices for delivery, interaction with Sales teams and knowledge of the clients and industry vertical, leading the team in becoming our clients’ trusted advisors. Train and coach team to be an expert in building and managing campaigns and propose marketing solutions.
Understand account plans, ensure delivery in line with account plans and client objectives, and continually identify opportunities and suggest interventions such that the Sales team is able to deliver against client objectives and achieve set goals.
Oversee business development for new markets and expansion scope for existing markets.
Minimum qualifications
MBA degree or equivalent practical experience.
11 years of sales delivery or client management experience
4 years of people management experience.
Experience in building relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in full cycle problem solving starting from defining to structure to delivery.
Ability to identify business or tactical opportunities and help the team achieve success.
Ability to drive increased volume quarter over quarter and exceed goals.
Demonstrated diverse cultural understanding and be comfortable working with global teams.
Strong people management skills.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
title: Vertical Business Manager

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Account Manager primarily focused on a single global client, you'll manage relationships with clients, which means you need to be a focused, proactive self-starter and be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Additionally, you're an advisor and consultant, as well as a client advocate within Google. While you will be part of the Large Customer Sales (LCS) team, you will also work with Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS) and help pave the future for branding at Google.Responsibilities
Take responsibility for the management of clients.
Report on business figures internally and take ownership with the leader of your vertical.
Serve as a liaison with clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities.
Provide campaign updates and ensure that our advertisers are satisfied with their business growth.
Manage ongoing customer training in all AdWords-related tools.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience within account management, sales or marketing.
Ability to speak English and Bahasa Indonesian fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience in managing and optimizing paid search campaigns for large, complex clients, with experience in AdWords and Google Display Network.
Demonstrable media experience in business development, client relationships with the ability to deliver results under pressure.
Experience in communicating new product features/betas actively with clients and assisting in the implementation process.
Knowledge of online ads, especially for search and display ads and campaign performance management.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment.
title: Account Manager, Global Client and Agency Solutions
locations: Jakarta, Special Capital Region of Jakarta, Republic of Indonesia

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.Responsibilities
Develop a growth strategy for our largest technology advertisers jointly with local sales team in order to optimize their advertising investment and maximize use of Google products (Search, Video, Display, Mobile etc). Develop vertical expertise around the industry dynamics, client business factors and marketing priorities which Google can influence as part of a joint partnership.
Define, review and agree to a clear set of global priorities, joint global initiatives and roadmap with our largest global advertisers. Drive execution of Joint Business Plans across various Google products and services, channels, countries and regions working in close partnership with our local sales teams.
Conduct internal and external global business reviews. Analyze data trends and client performance utilizing Google internal tools and third-party resources. Ensure consistency in reporting, usage of tools and product adoption across markets. Develop strategic sales plans, prepare and conduct strategic pitches and sales presentations.
Build and foster deep relationships across the client organization with leading companies. Work with clients to enhance the relevance and understanding of digital marketing through training content, presentations, joint work-sessions. Engage in public forums to socialize the value of Google as a strategic partner and catalyze the digital marketing mandate for the industry.
Communicate and work closely with Google senior management and sales teams in different regions and markets to ensure consistent service levels across markets.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in Korean and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working in a global context in the consumer packaged goods industry.
Proven success in managing complex, international projects and business development.
A deep understanding of the industry's challenges, a vision for its growth, and a commitment to advance Google's forward-looking strategies within the marketplace.
Knowledge of media planning and digital media products and services.
Self-driven personality with strong analytical as well as communication skills.
Willingness to travel across APAC and globally: 30-50% of time.
title: Global Account Lead, Technology, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
The Creative is on the cutting edge of Google's Display business. The Creative Specialist team leads Google's engagement with large brand advertisers, technology partners, website publishers and creative agencies. To ensure high adoption and usage of our Rich Media product, the team builds client interest, communicates performance metrics, develops creative campaign strategies and supports complex technical issues.Responsibilities
Work with Sales and internal teams to identify business opportunities leveraging knowledge on creative best practices, and creative solutions supported by gTech.
Collect requirements, provide guidance and best practices on how to apply creative technologies to achieve business goals
Design and implement complex and customized creative and technical solutions with the client.
Post sales technical feasibility assessments and technical advisory on complex creative (e.g., advanced dynamic ad solutions, HTML5 creative, integrating outside technology into creatives, etc.).
Coordinate with advertisers' technical teams and co-own the implementation of such products; Work with Product Operations to roll out implementation of new creative products and features in region (post beta).
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Working experience with client side web technologies; HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and working experience with SQL, XML, HTTP protocols and one object-oriented language.
Customer facing experience, supporting product implementations, digital ad operations, or technical sales experience.
Ability to speak and write English and French fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MSc or MBA degree.
Experience in building and/or supporting complex rich media web technology executions.
Customer facing experience in sales, sales engineering, consultancy or related function.
Knowledge of Flash, Python, App Engine and Closure.
Ability to absorb complex technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience effectively.
Creative problem-solving, strong analytical and project management skills.
title: Creative Specialist

text:
Google's Publisher & Distribution Solutions (PDS) team makes sure that our external partners are able to grow their businesses using Google's products. Technical Account Managers are advertising and technology experts who serve as liaisons between our biggest partners and Google's Engineering and Sales teams. They not only serve as Google gurus but also identify new opportunities where our products can better help our partners' businesses. Our suite of products is growing and PDS Technical Account Managers help us understand exactly what our partners need.
Responsibilities
Perform implementation reviews, advocate new product features and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
Guarantee the technical aspects of a partner’s integration (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance.
Analyze and optimize the growth of existing partners and build systems and tools to help partner ecosystem grow if required.
Assist sales manager in business activities such as to present product demo and review technical terms in the contracts.
Improve product feature offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams including Product Development and Engineering.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.10 years of relevant work experience.5 years of experience in Internet products and technologies.
Ability to speak and write in English and Spanish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MA/MS degree.
Pre-sale and post-sale consultation experience.
Internet and networking knowledge, including HTML, JavaScript, XML/XSLT, HTTP, SSL and TCP/IP. Skills in C and/or C++ and scripting languages, particularly Python and Shell.
Ability to absorb complex technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience.
Proven ability to adapt your presentations to the technical level of the audience and comfort with presenting technical materials to large groups.
Excellent technical, vendor project management, and written and oral business communication skills. Creative problem-solving, analytical, debugging/troubleshooting skills. Attention to detail.
title: Technical Account Manager, Publisher and Distribution Solutions
locations: São Paulo - State of São Paulo, Brazil

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Responsibilities
Facilitate and manage technical project or programs, working closely with Google engineers, product and program managers and financial operations to develop and track release milestones and schedules for the many moving parts that need to come together.
Gather requirements and define the scope of the project, facilitate discussions and driving resolution to issues, drive and stay on top of project/program execution and highlight risks.
Manage communication of progress/status within core team and external to the team (customers, partners, etc.); escalate issues as necessary.
Work closely with Product, Engineering and cross-functional team to resolve issues that arise during design and implementation, and in post-production.
Assist program management initiatives across the team. Participate in projects that help scale the group, implement best practices and improve methodology.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with payments data (chargebacks, accounts receivable, accounting transactions, refunds).
Track record of quickly earning credibility based on your knowledge and excellent past record of success.
Knowledge of SQL, relational databases, and other data storage solutions.
Exposure to large-scale systems.
Excellent oral/written communication, interpersonal and analytical skills.
title: Technical Program Manager, Payments

text:
Technical support for a technology company is a big task. As the Operations Manager within the IT Support Technician team, your mission is to enable the people and technology that keep Google running. Your team provides the front line user support for all of our internal tools and technologies. Beyond the day-to-day, the team will contribute to longer-term technical projects, process improvement and the documentation efforts that help make the Google magic happen.
In Audio Visual Engineering (AV Eng), our goal is to make it easy for every Googler to communicate and collaborate effectively across rooms and different offices, all over the globe. For events, our goal is to extend the AV Engineering vision of a seamless technology experience to all attendees (including livestream viewers), press, and partners, as well as create a more efficient and reliable technical environment for event staff and vendors.

As the Events Technology Operations Manager, you will play a critical role in the ongoing support, planning and execution of Google’s highest priority external and internal events. You are a flexible team player and leader with the ability to adapt to a dynamic environment with changing requirements. You have a technical understanding of how live streaming and associated video conferencing operations function, and understand the fundamentals of running an operations group. You will be responsible for managing relationships with global stakeholders while growing the teams' capabilities in support, operations, and engineering. You will collaborate with various teams across Google as well as third-party agencies. You have experience in dealing with different levels of management and can represent the company in a public environment. You may also be required to travel up to 10-20%.Responsibilities
Oversee the the administration and operation of Google's corporate encoding and streaming infrastructure, and corporate events wireless infrastructure. Develop and execute plans under a set of implementation and delivery time constraints.
Drive improvements based on metrics, and identify opportunities for/implement automation. Develop and implement scalable problem management processes and associated metrics.
Work closely with Engineering groups to drive delivery of features in products and management tools used by the team, which result in operational efficiency gains.
Utilize reviews, challenge proposals, and build consensus via broad collaboration, clear communication and strong documentation.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience managing a team of engineering and/or operations professionals.
Experience in managing technical operations for AV/VC, networking, and associated computer systems and using metrics to drive service improvements over time.
Experience managing projects involving multiple stakeholders, resource planning and budgeting/forecasting.
Preferred qualifications
Experience leading teams with a strong focus on coaching and mentoring.
Demonstrated experience with ITIL, specifically problem management process implementation.
Experience with managing video conference bridge operations and live streaming infrastructure.
Ability to adjust to rapidly changing technology and make decisions with limited information.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment.
Understanding of content delivery networks (CDN), associated protocols and concepts such as STP, ICMP, VRRP, QoS, jitter, etc.
title: Events Technology Operations Manager

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
In Android Partner Training, you will lead all aspects of training and documentation for our partners’ support operations teams, including training development, delivery, and program management. You will work under compressed deadlines in a fast-paced dynamic environment that demands flexibility, high quality, and creativity. You will partner with a wide range of stakeholders including engineering, product management, operations, and external partners to develop the appropriate training and documentation solutions.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with cross functional teams and subject matter experts to develop learning solutions appropriate for a broad, non-Nexus audience.
Conduct needs analyses, design scalable learning solutions, and develop facilitator guides, job aids, web content, and evaluation strategies.
Identify learning and performance objectives, and measure results.
Document and update policies and procedures on a centralized intranet.
Develop and enhance knowledge-base content.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience designing, developing, and delivering technical and non-technical training in formats including instructor-led, web-based, and blended.
1 year of experience working with call center customer support operations.

text:
At Google, our philosophy is build it, break it and then rebuild it better. That thinking is at the core of how we approach testing at Google. As a Test Engineer, you navigate Google's massive codebase, identify weak spots and constantly design better and creative ways to break software and identify potential problems. As a TE on Glass, you will lead the testing efforts for some of the most vital features of Glass. This will involve developing test strategies, guiding test execution, automating test scenarios, and pushing testing upstream in the development process. Your testing involvement will likely span different layers of the Glass software stack, all the way from system-level software, to Glass platform APIs, to apps that run on the Glass platform.We're looking for a candidate who is excited about taking a holistic view of Glass while not being afraid to dive into the details when needed, and who is itching to drive a team culture of quality.Responsibilities
Lead the test effort from planning and organization to execution and delivery. Develop effective test strategies.
Write moderately complex code to test systems.
Use your knowledge of testing and testability to influence better software design, promote best engineering practices, bug prevention strategies, testability, and other quality attributes across products.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with test methodologies, writing test plans, creating test cases and debugging.
Experience with tests automation in Python.
Preferred qualifications
4 years of relevant work experience, including testing Android applications.
Knowledge of Android Wear and Google Glass.
Strong sense of product quality and end-user experience
Ability to work individually and in a team.
title: Test Engineer (Glass)

text:

The role requires a strategic perspective on the business, the ability to identify, build and cultivate working partnerships with local organizations, and a focus on execution while maintaining deep community relationships.
Not all cities where we're exploring hiring a team will necessarily become Google Fiber cities. Provide insight and analysis about the market to Google Fiber senior leadership.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
15 years of experience in Operations, Strategy or Product roles with core responsibilities of managing a team, building business, and managing relationships with public and private entities.
Operational experience in an Internet application or customer-facing Telecom company.
Experience in working with cross-functional teams and a variety of stakeholders.
Preferred qualifications
MBA, JD, or equivalent qualification with emphasis on business strategy.
Experience managing and leading a cross-functional team. Experience developing and executing strategies to deliver business results.
Strong in-market local relationships with city and community leaders.
Global mindset and ability to think across disciplines, industries, cultures, and scenarios.
Strong public speaking capabilities.
Excellent written and verbal communication, and organizational skills.

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Cloud Solutions Architect, Google for Work - Tokyo.Help the globe "go Google." The Google for Work team helps companies seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. As a Technical Solutions Engineer, you're helping the globe "go Google" by working with leading companies, schools and government agencies to ease their transition to Google tools. You swiftly problem-solve technical issues for customers to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Google for Work business and bringing our product portfolio into companies both big and small around the world.
The Google for Work team at Google is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Solutions Manager in the Google Cloud Platform Business, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.

Google Cloud Platform is changing the way the world uses cloud computing by exposing our infrastructure. We’re growing very fast and looking for a Solutions Manager for the Solutions team within the Cloud Platform Business Unit at Google. You will use your knowledge and leadership of product management, industries, software and cloud computing to design solutions and take them to market. You will help drive awareness of our solutions at leading industry conferences and Google events. Your enthusiasm, technical and business depth, and excellent presentation skills will help decision makers understand the benefits of Google Cloud Platform to drive growth and customer success.Responsibilities

Define the business case for solutions, design the solution to help with prototyping and development, and take solution through to launch and market.

Travel regularly 30% for meetings, technical reviews and onsite delivery activities.

Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in all aspects of cloud computing (infrastructure, storage, platforms and data), as well as cloud market, competitive dynamics and customer buying behavior.

5 years of experience as a Solution Manager or Developer, creating new solutions.
Experience in the business technology market and expertise in working closely with sales and marketing teams in cloud computing or related technical fields.
Deep understanding of the current state of the art for infrastructure automation, continuous integration/deployment, SQL/NoSQL/NewSQL, networking, and cloud-based delivery models.

text:
Google's Treasury team is on a mission to optimize the return on Google's financial assets. As a member of this team, you're always looking for innovative ways to help Google invest for the future while limiting volatility and material surprises. In addition to risk busting and asset management, you work collaboratively to administer business insurance programs and stock programs, and provide financial analysis support to our internal teams. You make creative yet calculated decisions that are backed by both experience and your extensive knowledge of the economy and financial industry.
Google’s Foreign Exchange team is a world-class finance organization focused on developing and implementing innovative solutions to manage Google’s global foreign currency risk. As a Foreign Exchange Associate, you will work with cross-functional teams to support Google’s expanding hedge programs and have a major impact on the company’s financial performance. As a key contributor in a dynamic group you will have significant responsibility and extensive opportunity to help shape an evolving Finance organization.Responsibilities

Execute hedging strategies by trading foreign currency derivatives with banking partners.
Develop analytics to monitor hedge performance against business and market conditions.

Bachelor’s degree with evidence of quantitative coursework such as finance, economics, mathematics or accounting or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of relevant work experience from an investment bank, corporate finance or consulting team.
Preferred qualifications
Superior analytical and problem solving skills with a passion for getting things done.
Strong financial modeling and due diligence skills.
Outstanding ability to combine focus and attention to detail with execution in a dynamic environment.
Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
title: Foreign Exchange Associate

text:
The Brand Studio is a passionate team of creative thinkers tasked with shaping the future of Google brands by deepening the love of our users. As part of this team, you work with many kinds of creative thinkers all tasked with ensuring creative excellence across the Google Marketing landscape. Your goal is to deliver one integrated Google brand experience, and to better define the Google Marketing way. By embracing user insights, strategic thinking, and beautiful design paired with provocative execution, you strive to create delightfully intuitive (and delightfully inventive!) experiences that will define the future of our brand.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. You have a voice in the strategic approach, and a strong and articulate point of view on the creative output. You understand both technology and creativity, and can be the the glue that brings them together. You manage project schedules, budgets and project management resources across all workstreams, identify risks and clearly communicate trade-offs, mitigation options, and recommendations to project stakeholders and the team. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.Responsibilities
Partner with Marketing requestors to ensure clear and compelling briefs are in place to guide strategic and creative output.
Project manage/lead projects and efforts across multiple stakeholders including senior stakeholders. Manage project priorities, workload distribution and project resources.
Define, evaluate and improve processes. Educate stakeholders and agencies on process and guidelines for projects.

Add technical value directly to projects (as skills are developed) and support the team to move projects forward.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Solid project management experience, ability to define projects, execute within timelines, with multiple stakeholders and proven ability to deliver projects on time and to budget.
Experience working with partners and stakeholders at various levels with the ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Ability to build and maintain constructive working and communications relationships with a diverse community of technical and nontechnical audiences.
Experience managing budgets, POs and drafting legal documents (SOWs, etc.). Experience working with agencies and vendors.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation and organizational skills.

text:

text:
Applications are due by June 22, 2015 at 11:59pm PST. Our team will review applications on a rolling basis and it's in the candidates best interest to apply early. All hiring will be completed by August 2015. Thank you for your patience while we consider your applicationThis position will be based in Waterloo, ON.Software Engineers at Google are researchers and developers who yearn to create and implement complex computer science solutions. Our engineers develop massively scalable, distributed software systems and also collaborate on multitudes of smaller projects that have universal appeal - which requires research, awareness, interactivity, and asking questions. You build strong competencies in data structures and algorithms, along with a technical fascination for how stuff fits together. You need to have a solid foundation in computer science in order to consistently come up with new ideas as well as strive for a deep understanding of our products and services in order to continually improve upon them. We focus on being a collaborative, global organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skills and a keen eye for quality.As a Software Engineer, you will work on our core products and services as well as those who support critical functions of our engineering operations. Depending on your background and experience, you will be working in one of the following areas:Product and Systems Development
Whether it's finding new and innovative ways to advance search quality, building computing platform and networking technologies, automating the indexing of videos, or continuing to refine and scale complex auction systems (just to name a few), you will be developing solutions to some of the most challenging technical problems out there. You will research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offerings and collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information. Examples of specialist domains: UI development with AJAX and similar technologies, security, embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers).Engineering Productivity 
As a software engineer in the Engineering Productivity organization, you'll use your software design, analysis and programming skills to create innovative automated testsystems. This isn't a job in which you'll simply debug and run test cases, in fact that only scratches the surface. The test team undertakes a broad range of challenges on a daily basis, designing and building intelligent systems that can explore various use cases and scenarios for distributed computing infrastructure. Just imagine trying to design and build an automated testing system for something that's never been done before. There are no text books that can help you learn this, which is why we have some of the best and brightest engineers working in this group.Site Reliability 
Software engineers working in Site Reliability are involved in every facet of Google's production and work on the cutting edge of cloud-based computing. As a member of this elite team you are in the thick of everything involved with keeping Google running, from code-level troubleshooting of traffic anomalies to maintenance of our most cutting edge services; from monitoring and alerts to building new automation infrastructure. Software engineers on this team love to create robust and scalable software that scale to tens of millions of users. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day, and work with just about every other engineering and operations team to provide services and applications that are quintessentially Google - fast, reliable and accessible to all.Responsibilities
Perform specific responsibilities which vary by project area
Minimum qualifications
Currently pursuing a BS or MS degree in Computer Science or related technical field.

Preferred qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship.
Experience in systems software or algorithms
Excellent implementation skills (C++, Java, Python)
Knowledge of Unix/Linux or other OS environments, and APIs.
Familiarity with TCP/IP and network programming.
title: Software Developer Intern, Fall 2015

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
As a highly motivated Program Manager you will have demonstrated experience in the area of complex, multi-disciplinary, and geographically dispersed data center design, development, construction and commissioning projects. You will provide project management of large-scale data centers, computer farms, networking, AC power distribution/conversion, and cooling methods at multiple scales. This role manages complex schedules, budgets, and broad inter-dependencies. You will have extensive experience managing large scale technical projects in a rapidly changing industry, be able to tolerate ambiguity, and demonstrate problem solving leadership with limited oversight.Responsibilities

Support special R&D experiments, renovations, and upgrades of existing facility.
Be responsible for gathering internal requirements and delivering solutions that satisfy customer's needs.
Maintain end-to-end responsibility from construction to deployment.
Resolve highly critical issues within matrix organization while maintaining rigorous adherence to project timelines and costs.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant work experience managing multi-group, multi-disciplinary projects.
Preferred qualifications
MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Construction Management or related technical field.
6 years of relevant work experience with data center equipment/environments, including switch gears, generators, chillers, cooling towers, air handling units, controls, security monitoring systems, fire safety systems, and a working understanding of start up/commissioning processes.
Experience managing vendor relationships and understanding of standard practices in the design and construction industry, including knowledge of fast track design build processes and associated documents and contracts.
Knowledge of large-scale facility electrical and mechanical systems.
Demonstrated skills in requirements gathering, resource organization, task prioritization, scheduling and achieving objectives on schedule within budget.

text:

As an Apps Domain Administrator you are the go-to person for Googlers' computer hardware and software needs, providing front line user support for all of Google's internal tools and technologies. You're a fast learner and great communicator who can support the IT needs of global offices of all sizes and Googlers of varying technical backgrounds.You improve the front-line user experience by providing on-demand user support for Google's corporate users, resources, tools and applications while also contributing to longer-term projects.

You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day and work with a wide variety of engineering teams at Google.Responsibilities
Support and administer Google’s complex Google Apps service environment.

Optimize existing environment based on business and administrative needs.
Ensure the overall reliability of Google Apps services for the google.com domain.

BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Experience with LAN/WAN and mobile computing environments.

2 years of relevant application administration experience
Knowledge of change management principles
Strong organizational, communication, and leadership skills

text:
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a Sales manager, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.
With the rapid growth of our SMB clients, it's important to have charismatic leaders who guide our markets to success. As a Country Manager for Small and Medium Businesses Sales, you are the lead in a market working with your management team to understand our advertisers’ needs and deliver measurable solutions. You work with the Sales Leadership team to set and implement strategic objectives and represent your market inside Google on market performance, market requirements and future plans, bringing together prioritized asks for global products, policy or business decisions essential for the market. You work with your management team to develop strategies for coaching high-performing account managers. You create a shared vision and a combined growth plan with all SMB teams driving a One SMB approach across Acquisition, Channel Sales, Global Customer Experience and Marketing. You partner with your Large Customer Sales (LCS) Country Manager and Teams to develop specific areas of collaboration that drive growth. When required you front local PR, media or events for SMB clients on behalf of the market.Responsibilities
Represent SMB Sales for your market on all strategic, operational and customer facing issues internally and externally to Google
Be responsible for business growth and productivity attainment by representing the SMB Sales Team in target setting for your market. Take ownership for delivery of targets for your market and program devising strategies to meet quarterly quotas
Working cross-functionally and with LCS stakeholders to develop an ambitious growth plan for your market and execute successfully against it
Develop and implement innovative best practices for business programs and markets. Ensure that your team is always up to date with the newest advertiser solutions
Manage a team of SMB Sales Representatives and team leads, working on the growth of Google's advertiser. Coach and manage your team to develop sales and account management skills and contribute to the management of the wider EMEA team
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

MBA.

text:
This position is based in Salt Lake City, UT.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
The Network Interface Unit (NIU) Vendor Program Manager team is all about focusing on the user. You will be a professional, experienced and driven vendor manager in the Google Fiber Deployment team. This role will require you to have strong relationships with internal stakeholders across multiple functions and drive operational performance by managing a high performing vendor operations team so that Google can get the best speed and efficiency in our last mile deployment of Google Fiber.
You have experience in analytics, partner management, program management, operations and/or other related areas. You will be a top performer and thought leader who will quickly adapt and respond to changes as well as internal initiatives, and you thrive in an ever-changing, fast-growing operational environment. You will have an operational savvy and ‘get it done’ personality, the ability to make smart, independent decisions, the ability to explore and execute innovative alternatives to the status quo, an openness to taking direction from internal partners, and the willingness to manage deliverables across teams and priorities. Effective management of relationship with external partners is integral in ensuring continued service delivery and customer satisfaction.Responsibilities
Manage the overall performance of operations vendor workforce in terms of quality, cost and delivery of service and ensure all aspects of vendor Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are consistently met (backlog cost, utilization, etc). Create programs to evaluate vendor performance, organize and run review sessions with senior management and service providers, communicate vendor performance through insightful metrics to internal teams and senior management, and lead regular business reviews and any vendor relationship management activities.
Determine, communicate and monitor NIU budgetary needs to the Google Fiber Finance team. Provide one-off analyses and input in support of internal teams across all functions within Google Fiber.
Participate in workforce planning activities in coordination with internal teams. Work closely with various internal groups to understand business requirements, implement new processes and contribute to ongoing process improvements.
Support vendor selection, negotiations and overall vendor operations strategy (e.g. creating request for proposals and evaluating vendor submissions and bids). Ensure problem resolutions are achieved without compromising the relationship with vendors and company customers.
Evaluate and monitor contracts to ensure vendors comply with contractual terms and conditions. Maintain and review internal/external documentation.
Minimum qualifications
4 years of program management or vendor management experience.
Preferred qualifications
BA/BS degree. PMP or PgMP certification.
2 years of relevant work experience managing large-scale and dynamic operational projects, with competing resources, priorities and changing workflows. Business process expertise.
Understanding of national NIU vendor landscape and relationships or experience with existing vendors. Excellent analytical qualities to monitor/review vendors’ financial and operational performances.
Basic technical understanding of fiber-to-the-home construction or willingness to learn.
Strong analytical and solution oriented background skills with great people skills. Strong analytical and structured problem solving capabilities.
Exceptional leadership, management, communication and collaboration skills. Excellent presentation skills to ensure vendors thoroughly understand their contractual requirements.
title: NIU Program Manager, Google Fiber

text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. Collaborate with Engineering, Product, Vendor workforce and other cross-functional teams on specific user-impacting issues and bugs.

BA/BS degree in engineering or computer science
or equivalent practical experience

Forensic skills and attention to detail with the ability to effectively multitask and work independently.
Excellent soft skills. Proven ability to turn frustrated customers into happy customers. Work with our partners (vendor operations and call center agents) in a positive, product way that encourages collaboration.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
As a Sensor Hardware Engineer, you will design, develop and deploy next generation hardware. You have a solid design background and knowledge of sensors for mobile products. You will select the sensor that fits the product requirements, oversee the implementation of the sensor design along with system engineers and product design engineers. Prototype hardware and boards.

BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with sensors.

text:
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a Sales manager, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You create a shared vision and a combined growth plan with all SMB teams driving a One SMB approach across Acquisition, Channel Sales, Global Customer Experience and Marketing. You partner with your Large Customer Sales (LCS) Country Manager and Teams to develop specific areas of collaboration that drive growth. Be responsible for business growth & productivity attainment by representing the SMB Sales Team in target setting for your market. Take ownership for delivery of targets for your market and program devising strategies to meet quarterly quotas
Working cross-functionally and with LCS stakeholders to develop an ambitious growth plan for your market and execute successfully against it
Develop and implement innovative best practices for business programs and markets. Ensure that your team is always up to date with the newest advertiser solutions

text:

As a data-loving member of the team, you will provide analytical support for the most strategic projects within the global organization and you will build the tools and frameworks that enable analysts to surface data easily and efficiently. The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business-critical insights using analytics, ensures cross-functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward.
