text:
Google has one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. Your team is responsible for providing the manufacturing capability to deliver this state-of-the-art physical infrastructure. As a Manufacturing Engineer, you evaluate the product designs and create the processes, tools and procedures behind Google's powerful search technology. When vendors build parts for our infrastructure, you're right there alongside ensuring manufacturing processes are repeatable and controlled. You collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design Engineers to determine Google's infrastructure needs and product specifications. Your work ensures the various pieces of Google's infrastructure fit together perfectly and keep our systems humming along smoothly for a seamless user experience.
As a Component Engineer, you will join the team responsible for setting and managing the quality and reliability standards for various components in servers, storage, networking equipment, and other products at Google. You are hands-on and have extensive involvement in the tools and techniques used to dynamically manage supplier outgoing quality and reliability, and drive root cause and corrective actions. You have solid partner management skills and love to scrape through data to drive process improvements throughout the supply chain. You collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design, Quality and Manufacturing Engineers to determine Google’s product needs and specifications. Your work ensures that our infrastructure and consumer products provide a delightful user experience.
Responsibilities
Engage with Design, Manufacturing Engineering and Commodity Management teams to influence the Approved Vendor List for Google's new products and work closely with the Quality, Commodity Management and Design Engineering teams during NPI (New Product Introduction) and Sustaining to drive root cause and corrective action of high priority/risk component issues.
Conduct Bill-of-Material (BOM) risk analysis, implement risk mitigation techniques, drive identification and qualification of new and alternate sourced components, and evaluate data sheet against the application.
Ensure identification and qualification of suppliers and components, aligning with Google's product requirements and supply chain roadmap while balancing design and business requirements.
Interface with supplier FAEs (Field Application Engineers) and contract manufacturers to monitor quality and reliability, and drive continuous improvements. Investigate and coordinate failure analysis, determine root causes, categorize failures, and drive corrective action in collaboration with the design and commodity teams.

Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with standard components space including discrete semiconductors, digital and analog off-the-shelf products and passive components.
Experience with manufacturer PCNs, Failure Analysis, EOL processing, and experience working with ISO 9001/9014, RoHS, and other industry standards.
Experience with both new and alternate component sourcing and FAI and CAR.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree.
10 years of Component Engineering or related electronics experience.
Understanding of semiconductor and passive component manufacturing/assembly processes.
Willing to travel.
title: Component Engineer, Semiconductor

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As a Mobile Solutions Specialist in the Publisher Business Solutions (PBS) team, you will be responsible for building and developing Google's mobile business across all platforms (e.g., DoubleClick for Publishers, Ad Exchange and AdMob). 

You will be available for supporting external facing teams in regular client meetings, delivering internal and external trainings and helping drive new business through the process; You will also drive feedback and input to product development as well as help shape product commercialization. You will help develop and execute go-to-market strategies with some of the largest publishers in EMEA, with a clear focus on driving product adoption for Google’s publisher and developer facing products. To do this, you will be expected to have in depth knowledge of the mobile industry and the advertising landscape. 

The role requires you to act autonomously, set and execute on ambitious goals and be able to come up with creative ways on how to win in mobile. You are a personal, proactive and organized individual, and you are able to execute collaboratively across Google’s functional and regional teams.Responsibilities
Provide support to the EMEA Sales teams across all verticals to ensure that their publishers are using a suitable and optimized mobile solution, including support for answering RFPs, so that the Sales team can spend more time with customers.
Drive overall commercialization of publisher products for mobile web and mobile applications for Google´s largest partners in EMEA by creating high level strategies as well as providing hands-on support.
Ensure that mobile product requirements from partners in EMEA are adequately prioritized.
Empower Partnerships teams by extracting and disseminating best practices, developing and delivering training on new and existing features, and partner engagements.
Become known as an expert on mobile across EMEA, both internally and also through external speaking engagements.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Extensive project management, consulting, account/partnership management or business development experience in Gaming, Mobile or Online publishing
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills - with experience interacting and building relationships with senior-level executives.
Strong analytical ability to make data-driven decisions
Extremely well organized, analytical and capable of handling multiple ad hoc requests simultaneously
Ability to work independently on project deliverables in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.
Ability to communicate in a second European language e.g., French, German or Italian.
title: Mobile Solutions Specialist

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.As a Market Intelligence Analyst you defend the integrity of Google, its users and partners worldwide by defining and communicating product policies, fighting spam, fraud, and abuse across Google products (Google Search, Google Maps, AdWords, AdSense, Google Checkout, Google Product Search). You are proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, innovative--and able to work well in a fast-paced, global, cross-functional, and team-oriented environment while demonstrating technical know-how, effective communication and getting things done.Responsibilities
Investigate low quality and scam advertisers/landing pages/ad creative based on the large set of signals.
Identify and aggregate ads products abuse trends from low quality content to cybercrime.
Analyze and prioritize various data feeds to reveal top issues and take enforcement action, as well as liaise with the Product Quality Operations (PQO) teams and stakeholders (Engineering, Policy, Legal, etc.) to drive the resolution.
Define enforcement strategy and use appropriate processes and tools for implementation. Identify the need for automation or tools to automate and optimize process workflow.
Determine relevant new sources of information to gain market level insight to stay ahead of the game to keep users, advertisers and Google protected.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in data processing.
Ability to speak and write in Spanish and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working with SQL, Dremel, Python, Java, JS or HTML.
Project management and process optimization experience e.g. with a data analytics component.
Knowledge in Internet, web-research, online advertising, fraud detection, numerical analysis and e-commerce.
Ability to identify complex problems and implement creative, data-driven solutions.
Exceptional internet research skills and knowledge of web technologies.

Quantify high impact opportunities with clear traffic, performance and budget recommendations and pitch to clients when applicable.
Partner with Sales and Sales Operations to develop and test tools, templates and frameworks to streamline and scale client analyses.
Collaborate with the Agency team to educate and train clients and agencies on how to architect and optimize AdWords campaigns.
Oversee the work of the Account Optimizer to help identify and implement recommendations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of analytical work, working with data to identify trends and make recommendations in investment banking or consulting.
Proficiency with spreadsheet and presentation software.
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Proven ability to work cooperatively and proactively with staff inside and outside the department.
Demonstrated excellence in written and verbal communication.
title: Analytical Lead, Banking Vertical

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.
The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR easy and intuitive for Googlers. Our global team optimizes people processes from problem definition to execution. We partner with teams across People Operations and in Engineering to bring innovation and technology to the way we attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide.

We focus on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers, and work in Google’s fast-paced environment to deliver operational services, manage the contingent workforce and implement HR programs across over 70 countries. Regardless of location or level of experience, members of the Operations team have the opportunity to create, develop and implement some of the most complex global operations around the world.Responsibilities
Manage one or more Google People Services (GPS) processes, and assume responsibility for operations, management, and continuous improvement of these processes.
Operate processes that may include highly-reliable data entry around employee information, customer-friendly handling and resolution of user inquiries, questions, and problems, auditing of process data, analysis and resolution of problems and special cases, and communication with HR Business Partners (HRBPs), recruiters, and other stakeholders.
Manage processes including definition, collection, and analysis of process metrics. Cooperate and communicate with relevant stakeholders (other People Operations teams, Finance, Legal, HRBPs, Staffing), along with relationship and contract management with vendors and outsourcers.
Improve processes including identification of problems and opportunities for enhancement of process parameters (quality, error rates, turn-around time and customer satisfaction, etc.), definition and assessment of improvement options, and execution/project management for the respective initiatives.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Human resources experience (in particular HRIS/HRMS administration operations).
Experience with enterprise type applications. Experience with process automation utilizing IT applications and tools.
High level of creativity, perseverance, and openness to change.
Affinity to technology, including intermediate to advanced spreadsheet and word processing skills, Web/Internet/HTML.
Exceptional attention to detail and solid time management and multi-tasking skills.
Excellent customer service skills and a welcoming and helpful attitude.
title: Operations Coordinator, Google People Services

text:
With the Access Strategy and Operations team, you will define and run Access projects. You’ll help us bring the transformative power of cloud computing, fiber-based and other technologies to markets and communities around the globe. As part of this team, you fully immerse yourself in data collection in order to draw insight from analysis. Then, armed with your findings, you zoom out to design and deliver strong, data-driven recommendations.
The City Deployment Team is at the forefront of expansion efforts for Google Fiber. The team is responsible for managing the strategic partnerships and key relationships required to bring Fiber to new communities.

As a Local Partner Manager, you will be responsible for local, on-the-ground partnerships to establish Fiber in a given city, working with city government, utilities, private landowners and more. You will understand the agreements and relationships needed to bring Fiber to your market, and you will drive these agreements to completion. You will navigate ambiguity, support diverse initiatives and work well in a cross-functional team environment.

You will be a pioneer for Fiber and learn everything you can about how to help the business succeed locally, manage business relationships, make key strategic decisions and teach what you’ve learned. With your strong relationship development skills, you will run with this opportunity to make a huge difference in new Fiber communities.Responsibilities
Negotiate local agreements with cities, transit agencies, and various private parties to enable fiber construction in the market. Handle early local community relationships (with NGOs, neighborhood/ community leaders, educational groups), on a reactive basis; Field and internally route all early sales requests.
Manage key day-to-day working relationships with the local government, state, utilities and key businesses and organizations, alongside Public Affairs, community managers, construction teams, and Legal. Initial responsibilities will include facilitating the relationship with city staff handling the permitting process.
Be the eyes and ears on the ground for the national Fiber team to inform Fiber’s overall strategy and develop a strong connection between your office and the national Fiber team. Be the spokesperson for your office internally, surfacing issues and setting the right tone; Help train, onboard, and welcome new hires to Google and your local office.
Communicate and collaborate with a broad range of internal constituents (Product team, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Legal).
Support the National City Deploy team by identifying and sometimes leading discussions with new potential partners. Help create and adapt new business agreements/models, including with governments, infrastructure owners, engineering companies, etc.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience operating within cross-functional teams (Product Management, Implementation, Legal, Finance, Marketing, etc.).
Experience balancing priorities and managing several time-sensitive projects at once.
Experience building strong in-market relationships with city and community leaders.
Preferred qualifications
Ability to understand engineering and technology nuances; Ability to grasp regulatory frameworks and find creative solutions within them.
Global mindset and ability to think across disciplines, industries, cultures, and scenarios
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Motivated by an entrepreneurial/start-up environment; Demonstrated “roll up your sleeves”, can-do attitude.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to formulate and articulate contractual, technical, financial and value points with partners and internal Google teams.
title: Local Partner Manager, Google Fiber

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
As a Business Analyst for the Google Fiber City Launch Team, you will empower the team to launch cities faster, efficiently, and with more impact using data. You’ll partner with cross-functional stakeholders to understand their analytic and business needs, and develop data driven decision-making and strategy. You will also define and measure the impact of initiatives to help stakeholders understand the outcome of past decisions.

You will lead efforts to understand where to launch the next fiber cities, and how to scale our data collection, analysis and decision making. You’ll be involved from project inception to design through to delivery, ensuring solutions are delivering high-quality and relevant data so our business can grow intelligently.
Responsibilities
Conduct data analysis and make recommendations to launch fiber cities (cost-benefit, invest-divest, forecasting, impact analysis).
Model data in order to create quantitative models including forecast, operational, financial, and statistical models of business dynamics.
Streamline the end-to-end city launch process and increase the ability to make data informed business decisions.
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of analytics experience.
Experience analyzing data through statistical and quantitative modeling. Technical experience in SQL and experience with statistical languages such as R.
Experience with regression analysis for prediction and forecasting.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with geospatial analysis and ESRI/QGIS tools.
Operational experience in measuring and improving productivity, utilization, scale initiatives, etc.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize information to see big picture while effectively managing detail.
Proven ability to successfully work and partner across multiple functions in an organization.
Distinctive problem solving and analytic skills with a high degree of analytical rigor.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Business Analyst, Google Fiber City Launch Team

text:
Google's legal department is at the center of an information law revolution, and you're at its core. As a Legal Assistant, you are a driving force behind the success of your Legal team, ready to roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, conduct legal research and coordinate communications across the team. As you closely support your team, you may find yourself working with multiple groups within the Legal Department, internal clients across Google, and external parties. You're an independent thinker who isn't afraid to ask questions, and you're organized in a way that never overlooks the details.
As a Legal Assistant on the Legal Investigations team, you will work directly with a fast-paced global team. The Legal Investigations team deals with complex and unique legal issues online from all over the world by quickly responding to legal requests for data. Among your many attributes, you are comfortable with a rapidly changing environment. You will field incoming issues that are processed through internal tools based on complex internal policies. Additionally, you will work with the Legal team to minimize Google's liability in potential suits.
Responsibilities
Facilitate communication of process and policy to internal and external customers.
Create documentation for existing and new policies and procedures.
Process English and Italian legal data requests efficiently and accurately.
Respond to internal and external customer inquiries regarding Google's process related to legal requests for data.
Run training sessions and give presentations to product and legal teams in Mountain View and our European offices, as required.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Italian fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Able to manage numerous projects simultaneously under deadline pressure.
Ability and willingness to take initiative to address problems and make continuous process improvements.
Ability to review or be exposed to sensitive content as part of our legal requests for data process.
Hard working, well-organized and detail-oriented.
Excellent analytical skills, with a strong ability to review and organize numerous documents in complex legal matters.
title: Legal Assistant (Italian), Online Product Support

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
As a Technical Program Manager (TPM) on Captions and Accessibility for YouTube, you will help drive the future of captioning quality and coverage across all YouTube clients, as well as other Google products and services. You will also help coordinate and track accessibility improvements and status across all focus areas at YouTube.
On a day-to day-basis, you will work closely with engineers to help drive technical project strategy, execution, and feature rollout. You will help resolve technical challenges, communicate progress to project stakeholders, and prioritize the end user’s experience to ensure high quality launches. You will also work on making improvements to YouTube-wide processes such as planning cycles and site releases with your fellow TPMs across other focus areas.
All in all, you are a master multi-tasker, excellent communicator, fun to work with, and you love turning engineering chaos into harmony to get stuff done, and improve accessibility for all YouTube users.
Responsibilities
Work with YouTube Captions team (and many other technical teams at Google) to design, develop, implement, launch and support new services and enhancement to existing services, with a focus on accessibility.
Develop and execute plans under a set of implementation and delivery time constraints, optimizing for a complex blend of product cost, service opportunity cost, and ongoing support costs.
Collect and analyze relevant data and take actions accordingly.
Facilitate broad collaboration with clear communications and documentation.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of relevant work experience, including 1 year of industry experience with making web and/or mobile products accessible.
Experience managing large-scale, aggressive, and dynamic technical projects.
Some experience with data modeling and analysis.
Knowledge of accessibility standards and assistive technologies, as well as tools and elements of project management.
Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels.
Passion for accessibility or assistive technology.
title: Technical Program Manager, YouTube Captions and Accessibility

text:
As a User Experience (UX) leader, you help define and drive the future of Google design. You identify and set product strategy, envision complex UX ecosystems and inspire teams to push the boundaries of what’s possible. You possess a clear vision of the future of user experience and have the courage to pursue forward-thinking design.In this role, you will apply your passion for brand, craft, and design fidelity to guide research and design processes, mentor talented members of your team, and collaborate with leaders of other UX and Engineering teams to create innovative experiences across all of Google’s products.
As the UX Director for Glass, you will lead and grow a strong, cross-disciplinary team of designers, researchers and prototypers. You will inspire your team to innovate and invent by taking smart risks, learning quickly, and optimizing accordingly. You will articulate a UX vision and drive consensus with engineering and product leadership. You will develop talent and coach individual contributors, design and research leads, and managers.

You will work with cross-functional groups including electrical, mechanical, software engineers, quality assurance, program management and business management and development. This role involves management across divergent businesses and timelines inside and outside of Glass.Responsibilities
Oversee all phases of UX work: research, conceptual design, prototyping, detailed design, usability testing, and implementation.
Attract, mentor, and retain great designers, researchers, and prototypers.
Drive all aspects of product development with an emphasis on strategic planning, conceptualization, resource management, scheduling, budgeting, and project management.
Partner with Product Management and Engineering to align UX vision and activities with Glass' business goals.
Continually improve research, design, and development processes to gain efficiency, remove obstacles, and simplify problems.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a UX-related field (human-computer interaction, human factors, behavioral research, or graphic design), or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience, including 5 years of experience managing a UX team.
Preferred qualifications
Master’s degree in a UX-related field (human-computer interaction, human factors, behavioral research, or graphic design).
Experience designing for multiple device types and contexts (desktop, tablet, smartphone).
Proven track record of shipping successful software experiences.
Proven leadership skills in communicating research, conceptual ideas, and design rationale, all within a user-centered design process.
Outstanding analytic, design, and management skills.
title: UX Director, Glass

text:
Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.
As a Hardware Validation Engineer your objective will be to collaborate closely with Hardware and Software design teams to develop test plans and infrastructures that evaluate and characterize the performance of our cutting edge Fiber to the Home and networking platforms. In addition, you will develop test suites, performance monitoring and automation routines that continually evolve and improve the qualification processes to yield more efficient failure detection and prevention.Responsibilities
Work closely with development teams to understand new project architectures and system components. Investigate test outcomes thoroughly and participate in root cause analysis of undefined behaviors.
Communicate findings and recommendations.
Strive for efficiency and efficacy in test execution, data gathering. data analysis, and reporting.
Cultivate good working relationships with customers, component suppliers and manufacturing to further quality goals.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in characterizing high speed buses such as xGMII, XAUI, XFI, SFI, PCIe, DDR.
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree in Electrical Engineering.
2 years of hardware/system networking design experience, or 4 years in HDL design and verification.
Familiar with ISI signal integrity analysis, and bit error rate testing thorough understanding of system power measurements, timing analysis, and environmental testing.
Familiarity with Linux or other Unix operating systems as well as strong scripting and/or programming skills.
Understanding of hardware evaluation methodologies, including development of test cases/suites, performance monitoring, test automation and data analysis.
Excellent oral and written communication skills together with demonstrated technical leadership and mentoring skills.
title: Hardware Validation Engineer, Google Fiber

text:
Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Business Analysts provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. As a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.
Using analytical rigor and statistical methods, you mine through data to identify opportunities for Consumer Hardware (Chrome, Chromecast, Android), from designing commercial feasibility of a concept, pricing analytics, cost optimization, market analytics - forecasting, segmentation, behavioral vs demographics. As a Business Analyst, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Commodity Managers, Product Managers, Program Managers and leadership to help drive insightful actions through your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.Responsibilities
Analyze and communicate key insights for existing projects.
Be a thought leader and Subject Matter Expert (SME) for specific analytics driven business problems.
Communicate business findings and strategic recommendations to senior management.
Drive the implementation of Analytics Platforms that connect data systems and Business Intelligence (BI) systems.
Construct an analysis around a specific business question, write up a clear, useable project plan, and execute with minimal guidance.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature (Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics) or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
MBA with 5 years of analytics experience or 7 years of relevant professional experience.
Strong project management experience and ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally across all levels at Google
Mastery level knowledge of SQL and one or more technical languages
Strong understanding of statistical modeling and quantitative analysis techniques
Firm sense of accountability, ownership for end-to-end project lifecycle
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills, with the ability to interact efficiently with technical and non-technical groups
title: Business Analyst, Consumer Analytics (Hardware)

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
You will be reporting to the Head of Sales Operations as the Sales Operations Manager based in Austin. You will be responsible for scoping and executing projects, defining deliverables, identifying resource needs and defining timelines. Typically, you will be managing more than one project simultaneously and you will partner closely with Inside Sales leadership to meet the needs of our growing Inside Sales team.Responsibilities
Partner with the lead qualification and Inside Sales leadership to build out operating models in Salesforce, establish incentive plans and create rich tracking environments that will scale to national markets.
Work as a strategic business partner to the Inside Sales manager and other members of the team: build relationships in Austin as well as with cross-functional partners in other markets to help align the various stakeholders, share information and develop solutions that take the various needs and use cases into account. Project-manage and/or support initiatives, including influencing and aligning stakeholders across the Sales management team and run specific one-off and recurring operational and business planning processes for the Inside Sales team (e.g. customer service channel management, quarterly planning).
Identify high-impact strategic opportunities, including building business cases, defining actionable plans and the roadmap to get there. Involve, align and manage relevant stakeholders across teams and markets, and drive a successful implementation and prepare playbooks, collateral and leads for Sales teams to action on plans.
Increase operational rigor and overall effectiveness of the organization across various topics (e.g. sales pipeline management, sales and reporting tools, sales and reporting processes, defining roles and responsibilities). Conduct external and internal analyses to understand the status quo, rationales and pain points, and develop and implement solutions.
Support Sales teams through one-off troubleshooting, problem-solving, and education/training on processes and tools Share best practices to the benefit of all regions and functions, and liaise with your counterparts from other markets to ensure you are leveraging their best relevant practices.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with spreadsheet software and SQL. Experience with other programming languages (e.g. Python, Shell scripting, Java, PHP, JavaScript, C, etc.)
Strategy consulting experience or project management experience in a high-growth technology firm.
Experience in sales and/or marketing within media, advertising, e-commerce, or search, structuring and implementing operational initiatives with sales teams.
Preferred qualifications
Experience analyzing data with strong statistical, quantitative modeling, and forecasting skills.
Operational experience in measuring and improving productivity, utilization, scale initiatives etc.
Demonstrated strong performance with increasing levels of responsibility and independence; Demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives.
Distinctive problem solving and analytic skills with a high degree of analytical rigor.
Good networker and influencer, with strong interpersonal skills, able to work across various business functions.
title: Sales Operations Manager, Inside Sales, Google Fiber

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
Strategic Partner Managers have the unique opportunity to create a long-lasting relationship with our top partners. You work closely with top partners to enhance existing partnerships, optimize agreements and grow potential opportunities. You cultivate these existing partnerships to make sure they can take full advantage of Google's ever-growing Digital Content platforms such as Play Books, Play Newsstand, Google News and Scholar. You possess very strong analytical and relationship-management skills and are apt to resolve business, technical and financial issues with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.
Responsibilities
Work with content partners to optimize their digital content sales through Play and make their offering as compelling and fresh to users.
Craft and deliver data-driven business reviews, foster insightful exchanges with Partners and optimize strategic relationships.
Engage with key partners on necessary contract and account changes to drive new Product features.
Lead research and conduct competitive analysis that helps determine our content strategies in region.
Play a central role in helping the team build content metrics and management business infrastructure tools, and design and implement processes and policies to improve Google’s ability to partner at scale.
Minimum qualifications
3 years of partner management experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Korean fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Strong online sales and business-development experience.
Experience in strategy planning or consulting.
Fluency in Chinese, or another southeast Asian language.
title: Strategic Partner Manager, Digital Content (Google Play, Books and Newsstand)

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
Performance Leads are self-starters with a proven ability to drive results through cross-functional teams. Armed with deep knowledge of Google’s Performance products, back-end infrastructure and sales processes, you will partner closely with our Global Product Leads, Product Management and Engineering teams to ensure our sales teams can efficiently implement advertising products. You will be responsible for determining whether or not our products are customer- and sales-ready from an implementation standpoint.Responsibilities
Leverage analytical skills and business judgment to create and implement operationally efficient scaled solutions
Inform product design and commercialization process as the definitive expert on workflow creation and process improvement
Synthesize and prioritize regional feedback; make recommendations on product, process or workflow changes
Manage high-profile projects with cross-functional stakeholders to improve implementation deficiencies
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in consulting, digital media, advertising, product management or related field.

Preferred qualifications
Proficient with spreadsheet and presentation software.
Demonstrated ability in learning systems and tools, and driving or designing improvements
Excellent problem solving, cross-functional project management and analytical skills
Passion for continuous optimization
Superior presentation, communication and collaboration skills
title: Global Operational Efficiency Lead, Performance

text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
As a Tools Program Manager focusing on customer/agent experience, you will work in a highly cross-functional fashion to develop and launch support automation, self-service, and Google-worthy internal tools. You’ll build the case and help design, test, and launch new platforms of tools that enable customer 360, workflow automation, and intelligent technical support, to name just a few examples. Entrepreneurial and detail-oriented, you are motivated by how a delightful service experience contributes to a differentiated user experience for Google Play, Android, Chromebooks, Google Wallet, Google Accounts, and any new consumer service we launch.
Responsibilities
Coordinate design reviews, pilots, UAT (User Acceptance Testing), and launch of new agent tools or customer self-serve experiences. Shadow and interact with agents regularly to deeply understand tools usage.
Manage feature prioritization and roadmapping processes, gathering feedback from cross-functional teams and defining business impact metrics.
Interact with Global Operations, Product Management, Engineering teams and other Google teams outside gTech (Google Technical Services) to represent agent tools and customer self-service needs.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with information systems and technologies (e.g., CRM, data management, SQL, workflow automation, etc.).
Experience with service operations, technical support, or customer support.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of hands-on experience in internet products and technologies. Experience defining requirements for new tool platforms in a fast-paced or start-up environment.
Track record of managing several large-scale, complex technical projects and coordinating project team members to deliver quality results within the project deadlines.
Well-regarded technical leadership and program management leadership to thrive in a highly matrixed organization.
Excellent analytical and business negotiation skills.
Excellent written and oral business communication and people skills, with the ability to influence senior-level stakeholders.
title: Tools Program Manager, Consumer Operations

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The role involves close collaboration between internal functional teams in the Online Partnerships Group (OPG) as well as counterparts across the entire Google organization and products including AdWords, YouTube, Google for Work, Country Managers, Industry Specialists and Local Direct Sales teams, as well as the Global Emerging Markets team.
OPG grows Google's business with online publishers by helping them utilize tools from Googles full product suite including AdSense, AdX, Mobile, Games and DoubleClick. Our team is made up of high-achieving specialists who work with partners in online advertising and e-commerce. We thrive in fast-paced, team-oriented and international environments. On this team you proactively identify, develop, support and maximize business growth opportunities from existing and new partners. In OPG, we strive to exceed partner expectations through building, supporting and maintaining long-term win-win relationships. You are self-driven, enthusiastic and analytical, with strong communication skills and a proven track record working in a sales environment.Responsibilities
Optimize the value proposition to existing strategic partners through direct 1:1 interactions in person and via the phone, offering them access to the full suite of Google product solutions.
Drive market growth through 1:1 and scalable interactions with medium-sized partners.
Offer support to non-strategic partners through online and scalable solutions.
Work cross-functionally within OPG and also through the wider Google and Global OPG organization.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Polish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Analytical capability e.g. with business analytics and modeling experience.
Exemplary project management, organization and prioritization skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking and analytical skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
title: Emerging Markets Strategic Partner Manager (Poland), Online Partnerships Group

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.You encourage safe and efficient network operations by leading project teams that maintain and improve network operations. You propose projects that increase network reliability and analyze network technologies that assess implications for Google.
Google's advanced corporate network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. As Network Security Technology Architect, working within the Corporate Network technology development group, you'll be a key player in the security roadmap and consulting efforts that address Google's diverse needs for network communications and connectivity.

Your job will touch on traditional enterprise challenges, including access policies, third-party customer connectivity, and the rise of BYOD, but the focus will be on the long view and the uncommon challenges, including integration of enterprise networking with cloud-based services, network segmentation, mobility in access networks, and a host of others. You'll have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of other teams beyond corporate network engineering, including security operations, systems engineering, hardware operations, backbone network engineering, and many others. Keeping the network secure ensures that our employees stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services, and that our engineers can focus on creating the next generation of public Google products and services.Responsibilities
Ensure that the Google enterprise network is secure.
Define and document 3-5 year security technology vision for the Google enterprise network.
Participate in leading and defining best of class security practices for enterprise networks consuming cloud services.
Lead initiatives to ensure that the technology vision is realized.
Minimum qualifications
MS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
CISSP or similar industry security certification.
7 years of experience with network and application security architecture, with a demonstrated bias to early action and cutting edge technology.
Experience with security design for multi-service enterprises (e.g. Wi-Fi networks with multiple classes of users).
Understanding of IETF security protocol landscape and development practices.
title: Enterprise Network Security Technology Architect

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
As a Mobile Product Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for supporting our Sales team and our Partners on our Mobile solutions. You should have an in-depth knowledge of Apps and Mobile Web. You will consult with the internal sales teams and external clients on Mobile monetization and feel comfortable delivering internal and external product trainings, as well as participating in pre-sales meetings. 

The role of Mobile Product Sales Specialist is a unique and exciting role within the Online Partnerships Group (OPG). This is your chance to be part of and directly learn about Google’s Mobile Monetization Business and have interactions with top websites/App Developers in the European market. This role will focus mostly on our Apps monetization solutions (AdMob/AdX) and Ad Serving (DoubleClick for Publishers).Responsibilities
Support product implementation and help partners in their day-to-day challenges by delivering innovative and scalable solutions to their problems and troubleshooting their issues.
Provide pre-sales support to address product and technical questions by supplying necessary documentation and technical guidance.
Act as one of our regional product experts on AdMob and mobile monetization, and be on top of new features and use cases. Develop educational materials for internal and external teams with the ultimate goal of increasing feature adoption.
Improve our product offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams including Product Management and Engineering.
Analyze and optimize the development of existing clients to ensure their success with the Google suite of products for partners.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Proven experience in pre-sales.
Knowledge of AdMob, Ad Exchange, DoubleClick for Publishers or any competition solution.
Knowledge of the app developers space and/or mobile publishing.
Strong troubleshooting skills in common web technologies, such as HTML and HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Java, PHP, Objective-C.
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to quickly absorb technical concepts and effectively communicate them to a non-technical audience.
Excellent problem solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills.
title: Mobile Product Sales Specialist, Online Partnership Group

text:
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. As a part of the Business Intelligence Team, you'll be using data to inform business and product decisions across the company. When a feature on one of our products -- from Google+ to Search to YouTube -- gets tweaked, you’ll work with finance and engineering teams to measure the impact of that change. Using your technical skills and business acumen, you’ll build tools to automate reporting and dashboard updates so clients can see quickly and accurately how projects are performing. You’ll be involved from project inception to report design through to data delivery, ensuring that your reports are delivering high-quality and relevant data so that our business can grow intelligently.
Business Analysts work with Engineering and other groups to conduct data-oriented analysis, develop metrics, synthesize information and present insights to support strategic decisions. As a Business Analyst within Geo Operations, you design and implement methodologies, dashboards and presentations, all while partnering with stakeholders across multiple functions and locations.Responsibilities
Build infrastructure and implement analytical approach to allow the development of a maintenance strategy for internal datasets.
Work with relevant stakeholders to deliver appropriate Business Intelligence (BI), data warehousing, reporting and analytical infrastructure required to support management teams and analysts.
Prioritize and communicate user needs, make recommendations and drive implementation for product or process changes.
Work with large data sets, automate data extraction, build monitoring/reporting dashboards and high-value, automated Business Intelligence solutions (data warehousing and visualization).
Design, develop and establish Key Performance Indicators to monitor the health of database assets and the performance of internal operations, providing analysis and strategic insights to drive growth and performance.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of business intelligence or analytics work experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in Web-scale databases, Hadoop, or NoSQL technologies; knowledge of commercial and emerging reporting tools and technologies (e.g. Tableau, QlikView, Microstrategy, Business Objects, Cognos, D3); experience in related underlying technologies such as JavaScript, App Engine (or other cloud platforms).
Proven experience of developing and managing project plans, and collaborating with teams across geographies and functions.
Knowledge and experience of relational databases and of database design best practices, with strong SQL-based skills and application development and ETL (database creation, optimization, data feed productionization etc).
Strong understanding of BI technologies and their application including database warehousing and dashboarding experience.
Proficiency in SQL across standard relational environments (e.g Oracle, Teradata, MySQL etc.).
Analytical expertise, comfortable managing large datasets. Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Geo Operations

text:
Help the globe "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Partner Business team member, you drive the Google for Work business relationship with key partners by analyzing partner business performance, identifying methods of increasing partner and Google returns, selling ideas to and identifying opportunities within partners, and coordinating across Google departments/groups to deliver on opportunities. You love your customer-facing role, jumping at the chance to engage with customers, provide them seamless support and keep them with Google.
As a Global Partner Sales Manager, you will be responsible for executing the business strategy with Global Strategic Partners. You will be responsible for achieving business and partner success objectives in a given region. You will represent the entire range of Google for Work products and services for our partners while at times focusing on a specific solution or product set for particular partner vertical markets.Responsibilities
Report to the Head of Global Partner Sales to successfully build strategy and execution plans to meet business growth objectives for a specific region.
Engage in joint sales efforts between the Google For Work field sales force and partner sales forces to ensure there is successful overlap between partner and Google field sales.
Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned alliance accounts.
Meet near- and long-term assigned regional targets for business volume and strategic objectives in assigned alliance accounts.
Lead regional joint sales planning processes with partners that develops mutual performance objectives, growth targets, and critical milestones associated with a productive alliance relationship.
Minimum qualifications

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
10 years of sales experience.
Proven track record of successfully selling Enterprise products.
Proven track record of selling with partners.
Proven track record of managing successful sales teams.
title: Global Partner Sales Manager, Google for Work

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As a Google Account Executive, you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions. Google has become a leader in this space because we've developed effective products and services targeted to marketers and consumers. The primary responsibility of the Account Executive is to drive and grow new business with Google’s top advertisers. You'll manage business relationships to ensure that the clients' needs and requirements are met. This will require you to serve as their advocate within Google while collaborating with other Google teams to provide them with a comprehensive portfolio of solutions and options. This is a client-facing sales role requiring deep industry expertise, proven ability and a broad base of industry contacts.Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with a team to drive growth with new and existing customers.
Develop high-level relationships to serve as a trusted consultant with major customers to optimize their advertising investment.
Generate business plans to define strategies and tactics.
Manage multiple cross-product opportunities and projects.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in an advertising sales, business development and/or online media environment.
Ability to speak and write in Korean and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working with advertisers, agencies, and/or clients.
Knowledge of and established relationships within the advertising industry and the relevant industry vertical.
Knowledge of traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
A deep understanding of the industry's issues, a vision for its growth, and a commitment to advance Google's forward-looking strategies within the marketplace.
title: Country Account Executive, Technology Account, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
Life on the web moves fast, and our millions of users around the world expect nothing less from us. Which is why Google is passionate about developing and releasing software rapidly. As a Software Engineer in Test (SET), your mission is to build the tools and infrastructure to increase our developers' efficiency. You play a crucial part in Google's success by partnering with the software developers to ensure that our code is thoroughly tested to the highest standards. In doing so, you help us secure our business future by creating the next generation of tools and frameworks that make our users and developers more productive.
Project Tango is a set of mobile technology that give devices a human scale understanding of space and motion. It uses computer vision technology to perform motion tracking and object detection. Project Tango has been working with universities, research labs, and industrial partners to harvest the last ten years of research in robotics and computer vision to concentrate that technology into a very unique development device. Now we are ready to take this technology to the masses.

You are a Software Engineer in Test who will be the Technical expert responsible for developing framework, defining methodologies, Performance Testing, and authoring testing tools. You will assist various test teams lead the testing of key Project Tango platform components as well as leading your team to deliver timely, high quality product releases within defined budget and schedule. You will own, define, and execute the test strategy to achieve quality goals. You will assist/mentor team members (internal and external) and promote automation to support an agile development process. You will bring strong mobile domain (hardware and software) credentials, including designing, authoring, and deploying automation framework, authoring tools, Performance, and scalability testing.Responsibilities

Design, develop, and document test frameworks using Java, C, or C++.
Provide technical leadership and direction to testing team members to adherence to coding, quality, functionality, performance, scalability and on-time delivery standards.
Lead, mentor and motivate team members to maximize their potential, foster innovation, boost productivity, and deliver high quality software.
Work with a cross-functional team of hardware and software engineers to develop innovative automated testing solutions.
Assist with measuring software quality and be able to present tradeoffs and provide risk assessment to all stakeholders.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in object oriented programming language Java, C++ or Python.
Experience with client side web technologies; HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Preferred qualifications
Experience applying agile software development practices.
Proven experience in testing/leading mobile SDK/APIs, or enterprise software platforms.
Excellent experience and knowledge in leading the testing lifecycle of large scale mobile platform or enterprise software products.
Experience with Selenium WebDriver, Robotium, Appium, Calabash or other automation frameworks.
Familiarity with the Eclipse IDE, GitHub, and Android SDK.
title: Software Engineer in Test, Project Tango

text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
As the Community Group Manager, you will lead a team of Community Managers to create world-class support communities and social channels for the millions of people who use Google products every day. You will be responsible for driving an innovative community strategy across a suite of consumer products and leading a team of community managers to achieve our business goals. You will collaborate cross-functionally to develop scalable community experiences that help build the Google brand and inspire users to get the most out of Google. You will scale proven best practices across teams in order to increase community and Social engagement, product adoption, issue resolution and ultimately, user retention.Responsibilities
Lead and coach a high-performing team to deliver effective customer support in Communities and Social media channels.
Develop, drive, and optimize the global Community and Social strategy across multiple Google products - including user experience and channel strategy, and operating model.
Identify and oversee data-driven analyses and initiatives to improve community performance.
Work closely with and influence cross-functional partners to improve products, policies and processes that deliver the best user experience. Partners include product management, marketing, high-touch support and others.
Drive innovation and experimentation in leading edge community engagement, support in social media and analytical assessment of our impact.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Relevant experience in technology, management consulting, community management, social media, customer support, operations.
Proven ability to build and maintain effective working relationships within a complex international organization.
Excellent project manager and self-starter, with the ability to work independently across multiple concurrent initiatives in a fast paced environment with evolving priorities.
Strong analytical mind with proven track record of driving results.
Proven leadership and direct management skills; ability to develop and inspire team members.
Outstanding communication and influencing skills with proven ability to create and gain support for a compelling vision.
title: Consumer Operations, Community Group Manager

text:
The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR stuff easy and intuitive for Googlers. Our global team optimizes people processes, from problem definition to execution. We partner with teams across People Operations and in engineering to bring innovation and technology to the way we attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide. We focus on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers, and work in Google’s fast-paced environment to deliver 100+ operational services, manage the contingent workforce and implement HR programs across 70+ countries. Regardless of location or level of experience, members of the Operations team have the opportunity to create, develop and implement some of the most complex global operations around the world.
The value Google places on our employees knows no bounds. We revolutionized search, and now we're redefining human resources in the way we work closely with our management teams to attract, hire, develop and reward talented people. Google's HR team – which we call People Operations – is focused on bringing this discipline to the next level. The people who work with us have a wide variety of talents and experience, including HR, program management, marketing, team management and analytical skills. Our common trait is that we share a commitment to preserving Google's uncommon culture as we continue to grow worldwide.

As a Global Mobility Specialist, you will assist with administering Google’s immigration, relocation and international assignment program. You'll manage service providers, prepare international cost estimates, and work closely with the Finance team. You will also serve as the main contact for employees for tax questions related to international assignments. As a member of the Global Mobility group, you will thrive working in a fast-paced and customer-focused environment.Responsibilities
Manage service providers on all points of execution on relocation and international assignment issues, and work with employees on relocation initiation and execution.
Prepare international assignment cost estimates and letters of understanding and take the lead in administering long-term international assignments.
Work on standard international assignment tax issues with outside tax provider and serve as primary contact for employee on basic tax questions and detailed assignment requests.
Serve as lead manager for service providers focused on relocation and assignment service provision and serve as the key point of contact for Staffing on relocation programs.
Liaise with finance colleagues with respect to domestic and international payroll transactions and support the annual tax equalization reconciliation process; communicate necessary payments and deductions to assigned employees.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in Global Mobility.
Preferred qualifications
Strong financial aptitude to understanding complex budgeting and tax information; experience working for a global tax provider on mobility related cases.
Interest in working on international administrative projects.
Comfort with ambiguity and ability to use sound judgment to drive complex issues to resolution and influence others to achieve results.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment, by prioritizing and recognizing tasks and situations which require a sense of urgency.
Strong oral and written communications skills.
title: Global Mobility Specialist, Tax

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
You are an experienced scientist with a background in protein expression and purification who will work on Google Life Sciences’ projects focused on nanotechnology and continuous health monitoring. You must be highly responsible and organized with strong problem solving skills, and the ability to manage and coordinate protein expression and characterization activities supporting multiple subgroups.
Responsibilities
Coordinate activities of a small protein expression/purification team. Provide expert input and oversight of protein expression construct design. Improve and optimize protein production workflows.
Manage CRO relationships in gene synthesis and protein expression. Express, purify, and characterize recombinant proteins at small to medium scale. Analyze, interpret, and present data at group meetings and in technical reports.
Remain current with relevant technologies and incorporate new methods, as appropriate, with special attention to high throughput expression, purification, and characterization technologies.
Adhere to document control policies where applicable. Contribute to publication efforts in peer-reviewed journals. Contribute to the generation and documentation of intellectual property.
Take on other duties as assigned.
Minimum qualifications
Master's degree in biochemistry, molecular biology, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of industry experience. Experience with bacterial and mammalian protein expression systems.
Experience in purification and characterization of antibodies, antibody fragments, antigens, and fusion proteins.
Experience with biophysical techniques essential to protein purification and characterization (e.g., HPLC/FPLC, DSC, DLS, SEC-MALS, ELISA, Octet/Biacore).
Preferred qualifications
PhD degree in biochemistry, molecular biology, or related field with 4 years or more of industry experience.
Experience with maintaining records and data in an LIMS environment.
Experience in protein formulation/optimization for stability and activity.
Experience in implementation of HTP technologies and use of liquid handlers.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
title: Protein Expression and Purification Scientist (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google works with thousands of strategic partners across the globe every day. The Google Fiber Operations team is responsible for ensuring that these partnerships run seamlessly. Part financial, part legal and administrative, and part infrastructure, you ensure compliance for Google's Multi-family Dwelling Unit and/or Small and Medium Businesses inside plant construction. You proactively review existing and new contracts, permits, terms and obligations. You coordinate with Facilities, Outside Plant (OSP), Network Operations (NetOps), and Finance to ensure successful project completion. In addition, you will be required to ensure quality control is maintained on all the builds. Your diligence ensures all users and partners have uninterrupted operations and 100% satisfaction.Responsibilities
Manage construction for the last mile deployment of Google Fiber’s MDU, Small and Medium Businesses (SMB), and Community Connection construction across the market/metro area.
Manage project budgets, installation schedules, production and contractor resource assignment and track contractor performance including billing against budget and contract. Support progress reporting, invoice approval, and material handling with the contractors, prioritize and multitask projects and see them through to completion, as individual and team contributor.
Handle daily updates and feedback required for troubleshooting and internal ticketing system. Report field production and other key metrics on daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Work with and communicate progress to internal stakeholders and ensure that projects are scoped properly and handed off seamlessly for network deployment. Work closely with cross-functional teams including Google Fiber OSP/NetOps/Sales/Business/Customer Service in coordinating all project activities, resource requirements and business goals.
Establish and coordinate quality control requirements for Fiber to the Home (FTTH) build. Evaluate vendor performance and manage escalation processes for construction and maintenance incidents.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in Project/Program Management role specific to FTTH construction (OSP/ISP).
Preferred qualifications
Experience interpreting fiber test results and auditing projects for compliance with scopes of work. A deep understanding of inside and outside plant fiber optic network infrastructure, engineering design and construction.
Experience in managing contractors and field technicians.
Knowledge/experience with project management tools.
Knowledge/experience with Web Applications.
Knowledge of telecommunications and related standards and regulations - an industry insider.
Strong interpersonal, analytical and communication skills. Flexible and able to think quickly.
title: Construction Manager (Inside Plant), Google Fiber

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow.
