text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
Google's corporate enterprise network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies.

As an Enterprise Network Engineer for Google's Enterprise network, you'll serve as one of the senior technical members of an engineering team responsible for connectivity to over 50,000 employees in over 200 locations worldwide, with a growing consulting engagement to third-party and acquisition partners. You'll design solutions in the context of a multi-vendor, best-of-breed environment with a diverse and often high-demand internal customer base, where "we're going to scan every book in the world" isn't just an idea - it's already happening. You'll create robust, scalable, fault-tolerant designs to meet the needs of large engineering campuses, small remote sales offices, and all sizes in-between. 

You'll have the opportunity to partner with, and provide technical expertise to a wide variety of other teams beyond corporate network engineering, including security operations, systems engineering, hardware operations, and Google production network engineering. You'll work in a fully dual-stacked v4/v6 environment, where all enterprise designs and connectivity must support both IPv4 and IPv6.Responsibilities
Work with other team members and groups to develop scalable network designs, solutions and policy recommendations to support the continued growth of Google enterprise IP networks.
Lead the requirement analysis, architecture design, and solution development of the enterprise cloud networking project to ensure seamless integration with Google public cloud services.
Analyze and drive key platform decisions and selections, providing guidance to other network engineering and partner teams.
Lead development of Google's growing enterprise network infrastructure through published architecture and engineering design documents.
Work with Google cloud network groups and collectively influence enterprise networking industry to create compatible architecture models and standards to Google public cloud services.
Minimum qualifications
BS/BA degree in engineering, technology or science or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of IP networking experience in a production environment, and 4 years of enterprise network design and architecture experience.
Experience assessing company campus, branch office, WAN, and data center business needs and pain points, designing and documenting solutions to meet these needs, and driving external vendors to deliver against product and software roadmaps.

Preferred qualifications
Master's or PhD in a technology domain.
10 years of production IP networking experience, 6 years of large enterprise network design and architecture experience.
Expert-level competence in IP routing/switching and security technologies and protocols including TCP/IP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, AAA/Radius, IPsec, GRE, OpenFlow, and their best-practices, fault-tolerant use at global scale.
In-depth understanding of network segmentation and virtualization technologies such as VLAN, VPN, VRF, NVO (NVGRE, VxLAN) and OTV. Substantial experience with routing platforms from Cisco and/or Juniper.
Excellent written and verbal English-language communication skills, with the ability to influence others with network engineering solutions.
title: Enterprise Network Engineer

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Support Specialist, Auction - Tokyo.
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grows. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. The Global Support team in gTech Ads plays a critical role in Google's success, supporting Sales teams, advertisers and products that enhance business potential by consistently providing scalable product solutions, reliable information based on efficient, consultative analysis, accurate implementations and timely communications. Alongside our support and troubleshooting work, we partner with Sales, Product Management and Engineering to focus on developing innovative, scalable support solutions that effectively serve our growing customer base. 

As a Support Specialist, you will work closely with advertisers and the global Sales teams to drive troubleshooting and implementation support. In this role you will become an expert, focused on handling troubleshooting and/or implementation tasks so that the Sales teams can concentrate their efforts on client-specific activities. text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.
The Cloud Platform Territory Sales Manager role is an exciting opportunity to help build Google’s next big business, and define the future of truly ground-breaking technology.
In this role, you work to drive awareness, adoption and business of Google’s Public Cloud for territory-based accounts, exceeding quarterly goals. Given that Cloud Platform is a start-up business within Google, this role commands a large amount of responsibility, and you are expected to participate actively in all aspects of building the business, including strategic planning, demand generation, installed base engagement/promotion, and net new account acquisition.
Responsibilities
Build and maintain executive relationships with customers, influence long-term strategic direction, and act as a trusted advisor.
Help develop and execute a territory business plan, and build targeted account plans across key verticals (media, genomics, gaming, and finance), resulting in a robust pipeline.

Manage multiple opportunities through the entire cycle simultaneously, working with cross-functional teams as necessary, and serve as the primary customer contact for all adoption-related activities.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of enterprise technology or data center sales experience.
2 years of experience in public/private Cloud sales (IaaS or PaaS).

text:
First impressions matter. Every day, hundreds of millions of online users visit the Google homepage. Yes, to search, but also to be delighted, informed, and surprised (and maybe even to laugh a little). The Google Doodle makes this possible - it's the change that is constant on Google.com.
As a Product Graphic Designer/Illustrator, more commonly known as a "Doodler," you have the world's best platform to showcase your stylistic skills, as well as your sense of humor, love of all things historical and imaginative artistry. From Jules Verne to Pac-Man, you have the reins to our brand and iconic logo and can run free with your innovative ideas. Go forth and doodle!

Pitch, create, collaborate and iterate on engaging, fun and beautiful artistic experiences on the Google homepage and beyond.
Balance multiple large and small projects simultaneously.
Manage communication with team, as well as international and external stakeholders.

Build and share skills with team.

BA/BFA degree or equivalent practical experience.

text:
Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Mechanical Engineer you design and evaluate our data center systems, identifying product requirements and contributing to research and project planning. From the chip to chiller, you are responsible for designing and optimizing an architecture that will scale with Google's continued growth.
With your technical expertise, you lead and manage projects, develop product and process improvements, provide consultation to others and help facilitate training and development.
Responsibilities
Contribute to overall system architecture from “chip to chiller” with the ability to make interdisciplinary trade-offs to optimize total cost of ownership of overall computer infrastructure.
Develop holistic mechanical designs from package to data center level optimizing for cost and efficiency.
Design specification of thermal management hardware including material selection, heat sinks, heat exchangers, air movers, pumps and all supporting equipment.
Develop appropriate specifications and test procedures as necessary to ensure desired reliability and performance of electronic equipment.
Mentor junior engineers in all aspects of concept development, analysis, design, and specification.

Minimum qualifications
MS degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in electronics packaging or related industry.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with dynamic system analysis, feedback control systems (PID Control).
Experimental experience specifically related to capturing acceleration, displacement, sound, temperature, pressure, velocity, power and flow rates.
Experience with op/non-op shock/vibe issues related to electronics packaging.
Successful application of one or more advanced cooling techniques such as liquid cooling, thermo-electric devices, two-phase heat transfer and heat exchangers.
Expert knowledge of cooling strategies used at the package, board, system and data center.
Extensive knowledge of CFD, thermal analysis techniques, pipe flow (pressure drop) calculations and structural modeling techniques.
title: Mechanical/Systems Engineer

text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.
The Global Scaled Services (GSS) team keeps YouTube (a Google company) growing and successful. We are dedicated to supporting the company's growing base of users, partners, and advertisers in more than 60 languages on a global basis, and providing them with the highest levels of service. We are responsible for rapidly responding to user needs and requests on a global scale. This means that GSS team members need to be proactive, motivated, organized, responsible and able to work well in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
As a YouTube Legal Tools and Data Specialist you will support the key strategic and operational priorities of the YouTube Legal Operations team. In this position, you will manage detailed analytical projects end-to-end, establish and improve metrics tracking, build world-class dashboards, and use data to inform and improve the quality of our tools and processes. You will have the ability to respond to the changing legal and regulatory environment in order to assess current and future needs of the business and to balance the needs of partners, users and legal requirements. You’re an independent thinker with a passion for promoting free speech and transparency. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and possess the ability to take decisive action in high-pressured situations.
Responsibilities
Analyze data effectively to support the development of strategy and recommendations to support YouTube's legal operations objectives.
Build automated reports and enhance the Legal Operations team dashboard to empower the team to monitor performance and proactively make informed business decisions.
Process removal requests efficiently and accurately, including copyright issues or government requests as well as one-off data requests to support Legal, PR, Engineering and other internal teams.
Respond to internal and external customer inquiries regarding YouTube's legal removal processes.
Build forecasting models for business needs and strategy planning. Prepare presentations and clearly communicate findings from initiatives to Legal team stakeholders, senior management and the broader organization.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of practical experience in quantitative analysis, including statistical modeling experience (e.g. forecasting).
Experience using SQL and working with data sets.
Experience using spreadsheet software for analysis and data visualization.
Preferred qualifications
Demonstrated interest in intellectual property law/legal experience.
Fluency in R, SPSS or other tools.
Familiarity with Python, CS, or machine learning.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with other team members to frame problems, structure analyses, and drive the implementation of solutions.
Fluency in Russian, Turkish, German, Chinese, Vietnamese or Korean.
title: Legal Tools and Data Specialist, YouTube

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
As a RF Systems Engineer, you will join our embedded system design team building mobile products. You will have a solid antenna design, RF systems, hardware board design background and experience building/shipping mobile products. You will also have knowledge of system architecture. As an engineer on our team you will be directly involved in defining overall product architecture, design board, to achieve lowest possible cost and achieve best RF performance.Responsibilities

Design best in class RF (Wi-Fi, BT, GNSS, PAN) system solutions supporting Wi-Fi, BT, GNSS, PAN.
Be responsible for antenna and board design for optimal RF performance.
Design for volume manufacturing at lowest cost.
Minimum qualifications
7 years of antenna design experience for Wi-Fi, BT and GNSS solutions.
7 years of experience designing RF system (Wi-Fi, BT, GNSS, PAN) solutions.

Preferred qualifications
7 years of hardware architecture, high speed board design, board bring-up experience, devices and interconnects.
Experience of building and shipping small form factor mobile products.
Experience with factory process and manufacturing
Knowledge of RF (Wi-Fi, BT, GNSS) software stack.
Knowledge of Android device environments.
title: RF Systems Engineer (Glass)

text:

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Experience or interest in sales, customer support, account management, marketing or consulting.
Demonstrated experience in managing and customizing experience to a customer base.
Proven ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail.
Proactive, independent worker with the demonstrated capacity to lead, motivate and work well with others.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and in the language you would support.
title: Associate Account Strategist (Czech/Slovak), SMB Sales

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
The Customer Support Apps team designs, develops, deploys and supports in-house and third-party contact center applications support users to improve productivity and customer satisfaction. You will play a major role in planning, designing and deployment of new contact center infrastructure across Google’s data centers. You will work with both internal Google teams and external vendors to research, evaluate and implement new solutions.
Responsibilities
Architect, design, deploy and roll out enterprise level contact center and voice systems that will be used to interact with advertisers, consumers and enterprises.
Coordinate new system deployments working with internal engineering operations teams such as Telecom, Network, Security, Hardware, and Data Center, and external suppliers such as software/hardware manufacturers, and telco/MPLS carriers.
Lead monitoring and troubleshooting of Google’s contact center voice systems and toll free numbers.
Develop and deliver presentations to provide internal training on contact center systems.
Oversee the creation of new processes and tools to support additional requirements on an ongoing basis.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience supporting global voice and data infrastructure deployments involving several IT teams and business units.

Preferred qualifications
Knowledge of Unix, Shell or Perl scripting to automate repetitive tasks.
Experience in vendor management, software and hardware evaluation, selection, deployment and system monitoring tools.
Hands-on debugging and troubleshooting skills in various platforms and protocols like TCP/IP and VoIP.
Knowledge of voice and data networking infrastructure elements including SIP, MPLS, Load balancers.
Participation in several network design and deployments across global data centers.
title: Contact Center and Voice Infrastructure Engineer

text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.
As a Platforms Networking Software Engineer, you will be building software for distributed services, abstractions, and the components of the system that operates and powers the world's largest network infrastructure, from data center fabrics, to wide area networks, to the peering edge of our infrastructure. Software engineers in platforms networking team solve the hardest problems in scale and availability because Google's network must continue to grow at an exponential rate while failing last and failing least.
Responsibilities
Design, develop and deploy software network control system.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with C/C++, scripting.

Preferred qualifications
MS/PhD in Computer Science
Proficient in data structure, algorithms and complexity analysis.
Strong systems builder.
Understanding of distributed systems.
Background in SDN systems.
title: Software Defined Networking Engineer

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
As a Channel Partner Manager, you will join our newly-formed Channel Partnerships Team in the early stages of strategy development and team growth. You will have a strong sales focus and work closely with our most technologically advanced publishers and platforms with a goal of growing our publisher base.Responsibilities
Manage primary relationships with regional Channel Partners at all levels. Develop annual and quarterly plans with these partners and drive their implementation.
Be accountable to product and acquisition goals and other metrics.
Translate data into actionable advertising strategies for our partners. Evaluate and prioritize new partnership opportunities from a strategic, financial and operational point of view.
Manage relationships with internal stakeholders including senior leadership team and a broad spectrum of other functions such as engineering, finance and marketing.
Work on channel related projects to consistently improve processes, procedures, relationships and measurement.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and one other European language fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Channel management or business development experience in Internet or hi-tech company.
Ability to absorb complex technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience.
Demonstrated partner relations and account management skills, and comfortable with a team-based selling approach.
Business sense, problem solving, project management and analytical skills.
Excellent communication skills.
title: Channel Partner Manager, Online Partnerships Group

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
As a Quantitative Analyst, you are responsible for protecting the integrity of some of Google's key products, including Google Search, Google Maps, AdWords, Adsense, Google Checkout and Google Product Search. You investigate financial fraud, account-related abuse, questionable business practices, violations of Google's policies, and general misuse of our products. You are introduced to dynamic analytical techniques and you leverage custom-built technology to have a direct impact on improving the experience of millions of Google users. You subscribe to a "user-first" philosophy and are interested in improving Google's user experience and product integrity. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and thrive in a fast-paced environment. You harness your analytical and technical skills to drive tool development and process improvements.Responsibilities
Perform statistical analyses on huge data sets to determine trends and develop business insights in order to protect Google’s users.
Utilize machine learning to scale, optimize and automate our abuse fighting efforts.
Assist with designing and building infrastructure to facilitate analysis and experimentation.
Develop metrics for measuring and understanding Google’s effectiveness at combating fraud. Conduct investigations into sophisticated forms of abuse, take action on fraudsters and close attack vectors.
Translate business needs into data modeling initiatives and work with other Analysts and Software Engineers to put predictive models into production.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Social Sciences, related field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in a related field.
Programming experience in one of the following languages: Python, C++ or Java.
Preferred qualifications
MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Social Sciences or related field.
Experience with machine learning, data mining, or building statistical methods.
Ability to thrive in a fun, fast-paced environment with a stellar team of fellow data geeks.
title: Quantitative Analyst, Product Quality Operations

text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.
Inspire businesses around the world to “work the way they live” with Google’s business technologies. The Google for Work team helps businesses work better together, move fast and innovate. Sales Development Representatives on the EMEA Outbound Sales Development team bridge the gap between Marketing and Sales and have the exciting privilege of being true Google Apps for Work advocates. As a member of the global Sales Development team, you will be the first point of contact at Google - creating a simple, beautiful and intuitive experience for prospective customers to learn about, engage with and implement Google Apps for Work. You will coordinate with your aligned sales colleague(s) to approach the assigned territory and accounts strategically. You will apply best in class demand generation and skills through outbound outreach to identify new prospects. You will work cross-functionally with experienced sales representatives and marketing managers.Responsibilities
Manage a large volume of daily outbound interactions with prospective Google customers via phone and email - qualifying, educating and connecting them with our sales teams in order to deliver personal business targets.
Engage with representatives and senior managers on our Sales, Marketing and Operations teams to design and execute campaigns, and help continually improve our product, marketing and sales processes.
Analyze and report on our demand generation business sales and marketing stakeholders.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in sales or business development at a high-tech company.
Experience as a representative with prospect/customer outreach in mid-market accounts.
Ability to speak and write English and either Swedish, Norwegian or Finnish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Selling experience in software sales.
Able to work independently but within a team environment.
Ability to work in a fast-changing environment and deal with ambiguity with limited guidance.
Goal oriented, self-motivated individual who is confident, thorough, and tenacious. Fast learner with strong interest in technology.
Analytical, detail-oriented and able to “zoom” in/out from the big picture to the minutiae. Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal

The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. text:
Google’s Geo products play a prominent role in Google and include highly popular products such as Google Maps, Google Earth, Local, Street-View, Transit, Traffic etc. The Geo Operations team manages a large scale globally distributed operation to enable Google Geo Product teams create and manage Geo Content for some of the above products and is critical to meeting Google’s content goals.

text:
As a Technical Account Manager, you are responsible for providing technical solutions and managing relationships with Google's largest and most strategic online publishers. As a liaison between clients and our technical staff, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations and integrations of a variety of our product lines (such as Search, Mobile, Video and Commerce). From monitoring product performance to debugging and troubleshooting product code, you are the resident expert that addresses partner needs. You are a technical expert with an entrepreneurial drive and passion for client management.
As a Technical Account Manager (TAM) focusing on Android Wear, you are responsible for launching new Android Wear devices by managing the entire technical engagement of a wearable device. TAM's have a dynamic and versatile role: from driving cross-functional initiatives, both internally and externally, to diving into technical details and troubleshooting issues - you are the resident Android Wear expert that ultimately delivers the wearable to users.Responsibilities

text:
At Google, we know building trust with users comes hand-in-hand with the dependable quality and reliability of our products. The Advertising Technology team helps ensure that our advertising products work effectively for our customers. When a Sales team colleague escalates an issue relating to a product such as AdWords or AdSense, we dig in, using our technical expertise to find the solution. You use your strong computer science background to answer technical questions from colleagues, partners and clients regarding ad specifications and technology. Your communication and sales skills come in handy when you break down complex product features and present them in an easy-to-understand manner. With an array of internal tools at your disposal, you troubleshoot ad functionality and display issues, working on higher-level projects to improve the team's operations. All of your efforts go toward ensuring that our ad products are working and our customers optimize them to deliver desired results.
The Global Support team within gTech Ads plays a critical role in Google's success. It provides high quality support to our Sales teams consisting of resolving issues in across Google Ads products (technical, billing, policy, implementation, etc.) and supporting real-time interaction channels (e.g. GVC) with customers. The Global Support team offers 24x5 service and it achieves this through globally consistent, scalable processes and through troubleshooting innovation (e.g. automated solutions and proactive/preemptive support).
As the Global Support Manager, you will oversee a team providing outstanding support to sales teams and advertisers in Singapore. You will also be expected to ‘move the needle’ on core operations. This will involve developing efficient workflows, identifying opportunities for seamless support between teams, and designing new services that will provide faster and better support to sales teams and advertisers. You have a passion for delivering excellent customer service and a drive for continuous improvement. You also have exceptional leadership, influencing and change management skills. You are ready to work side-by-side with your team, motivate and mentor managers and team members, and drive alignment across different functions and regions.Responsibilities
Lead a team of support specialists. Grow and develop talent while providing vision and setting direction for the team.
Provide strategic insights and lead continuous improvement efforts in customer service and operations.
Drive business results by tracking key operational metrics, identifying process improvement opportunities and delivering flawlessly on strategic projects.
Partner with Sales, Sales Operations, other gTech Ads teams and partners on initiatives to improve sales and advertiser support.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of experience building teams, hiring and developing people.
Strategy and/or operations consulting experience at a management consulting firm or a corporate strategy organization.
Proven ability to partner closely with senior cross-functional stakeholders and influence successfully across organizational boundaries with strong customer mindset.
Strong business judgment with ability to problem-solve complex business issues in a fast-paced, evolving team environment.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage across multiple, often time-sensitive initiatives, delivering flawless results.
Exceptional leadership, analytical, written/verbal communication, and interpersonal skills.
title: gTech Ads Global Support Manager

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.As a YouTube Online Partner Manager you will be responsible for managing a new generation of online content creators. You will promote the YouTube Partnerships program to prospects of medium-to-large size media businesses and execute campaigns to help grow and support our top leads. You are a proactive self-starter, able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, and client-focused. Additionally, you will be responsible for reporting on key metrics, tracking actual progress toward forecasts, driving new business opportunities, and ensuring prompt and proper resolution of business and technical issues with the partners.Responsibilities

Analyze and report on key partner and business growth figures internally and take ownership with the leaders of your market
Serve as a liaison with partners regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities
Drive educational and acquisition programs and events for your market
Manage projects across EMEA

BA/BSc degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in new business development and media industry experience.
Ability to speak and write in English, German and French fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications

Collaborative working style and ability to work with cross-functionally with internal teams and external partners.
Interest in the media and entertainment industry (Film, TV, Music, Video games.)
Excellent organizational, analytical and influencing skills and ability to deliver results under pressure.

text:

text:
The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical and HVAC systems in the world. Facilities Technicians on this team operate, monitor and support all facilities activity at Google's data centers. You take ownership of the operation and maintenance of water pumps and treatment systems, HVAC, UPS, generators, electrical distribution and control and monitoring Systems. You're at the forefront of best-in-class environmental practices. You bring the ideas of our Data Center Engineers to life and develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving efficiencies. You ensure that problems are identified and repaired quickly, that contractors deliver quality services and preventive maintenance, and that safety measures are being performed. In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you respond to data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.
You help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems (e.g. piping, cooling, and non-critical electrical system components). You provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order.
Responsibilities
Plan and execute work assignments under varying degrees of supervision.
Obtain facilities related vendor price quotes and prepare purchase orders.
Assist in the preparation, updating and tracking of facilities operating finance and budget, and with maintaining and control of the site critical system documents.
Assists with the tracking and scheduling of required employee training.
Liaise with site vendors to arrange work schedules and record work done, and assist with the Facilities Service Agreements (FSAs) and Scope of Work (SOW) with various vendors.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with CMMS or Maximo systems and reporting.
Online document management experience.
Experience assisting with safety training and reporting/recording.
Computers skills with office applications, project management software, CMMS, Maximo experience.
title: Data Center Facilities Specialist

text:
Security is at the core of Google's design and development process: it is built into the DNA of our products. The same is true of our offices. You're an expert who shares our seriousness about security and our commitment to confidentiality. You'll manage the security staff who keep our Googlers safe and our world-class technologies and facilities secure. You'll collaborate with our Facilities Management team to create innovative security strategies, investigate breaches and create risk assessment plans for the future. You believe that providing effective security doesn't come at the expense of customer service - you will be our bodyguard (and our long lost pal).
Responsibilities
Serve as a security officer who can provide guidance and assistance to new officers. Communicate effectively with English speaking staff.
Detect and serve as a general security presence/visible deterrent to suspicious activities, criminal acts or rules infractions at or near an assigned post which may be a threat to the property, assets or personnel at the site.
Conduct unarmed foot, bicycle and/or vehicle patrol (interior and/or exterior), control access and egress, monitor CCTV/alarm systems, metal detection operation, staff screening, provide escorts to service personnel and conduct other duties as specified in post orders or assigned.
Report all incidents, accidents and medical emergencies. Complete Security officer reports for each shift outlining shift activities. Assist with generation of access reports, video, etc., for assistance in investigations.
Conduct detailed equipment inspection and coordination of repairs, safety equipment audits (AED, fire extinguishers, eye wash stations and other areas as requested), respond to reboot requests in a timely and accurate manner and perform other job duties as assigned.

Minimum qualifications
2 years of work experience in a security and/or safety related role including Security Officer, Retail/Store Detective, law enforcement, or service in government military forces.
18 years of age or older, as required by applicable law, and be able to pass any training or other qualifications required for both licensing and the role.
Ability to lift and move 22kg (50 lbs) of equipment; stand up to 6 hours; walk up to 10km (6 miles) during a shift; and have adequate vision and hearing to observe/detect activity.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Familiarity with security technologies including CCTV, Access Control, and Incident Management Systems.
Able to work flexible schedules including weekends, holidays, periodic overtime and unscheduled shifts.
Detail oriented and the ability to multitask in a fast paced environment.
title: Data Center Security Officer

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. You have an entrepreneurial drive and can easily handle engaging large media companies and small organizations to promote YouTube’s partner program, acquire new content partners to the program, and develop these partners on the platform in one of Asia’s key markets. Each of the three content verticals of Entertainment,News and Sports offers new ways of addressing content production and delivery. 

YouTube's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. Strategic Partner Managers have the unique opportunity to create a long-lasting relationship with our top partners. You cultivate these existing partnerships to make sure they can take full advantage of YouTube's ever-growing suite of offerings. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to resolve contractual, technical and financial issues with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.

As a Manager, Content Partnerships for YouTube, you should be comfortable working cross-functionally with colleagues across multiple disciplines to ensure our partners are positioned for success and our users enjoy the best experience possible. text:
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical chops to roll up their sleeves and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our world-class software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.With extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage engineers across multiple teams and locations, a large product budget and oversee the deployment of large-scale projects across multiple sites internationally.Responsibilities
Manage a team of software engineers, including task planning and code reviews.
Drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
Be responsible for the overall planning, execution and success of complex technical projects.
Work closely with the product management team to ensure we are building the best products.
Contribute technically to projects.

BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Programming experience in two of the following: Java, C++ and Python.
Technical management experience (managing teams of 5 or more) with leadership and team building experience.
Preferred qualifications

Extensive experience designing and implementing large-scale distributed systems.
Software background and deep mobile experience. Internet, video, and streaming experience.

Extensive knowledge of Unix/Linux or Windows environments.
People management skills, proven track record of mentoring and coaching team members.

text:
Google's Publisher & Distribution Solutions (PDS) team makes sure that our external partners are able to grow their businesses using Google's products. Technical Account Managers are advertising and technology experts who serve as liaisons between our biggest partners and Google's Engineering and Sales teams. They not only serve as Google gurus but also identify new opportunities where our products can better help our partners' businesses. Our suite of products is growing and PDS Technical Account Managers help us understand exactly what our partners need.
The Solutions Consultant Manager will lead individual client relationships along with managing a team of Account Managers (Solutions Consultants), serving as the primary day-to-day client contact. 

Adometry provides ad verification and cross-channel attribution intelligence, plus auditing and scoring metrics, to optimize results for the world’s leading online advertisers, publishers and ad networks. Through its SaaS-based advanced analytics, Adometry processes and analyzes tens-of-billions of impressions and advertising transactions per month to identify the true consumer purchase-decision journey. Adometry combines a scientifically proven methodology with a flexible and easy to implement solution to generate results in as little as two weeks.Responsibilities
Lead, grow, and manage a team of Account Managers ensuring correct process, client focus, and communication to create transformational performance for the client. Mange client health for a portfolio of accounts.
Lead and make decisions independently that properly balance the needs of the client and the business. Be responsible for managing client communications ranging from weekly performance meetings to quarterly business reviews through the Account Management leads/team.
Own internal communications to the cross-functional team on performance, strategies and needs. Ensure all deliverables and insights are being met and exceeded by the Account Management team, driving client success.
Develop people within the team and across capabilities by coaching, identifying areas of growth, celebrating successes, keeping an open dialogue with your team, and identifying training opportunities. Provide team members guidance, help on goal setting and performance feedback on a regular basis.
Minimum qualifications
8 years of sales and marketing functional experience, including 5 years of agency or client services leadership experience.
Experience working with Account Managers and managing escalations to resolution within the Portfolio. Experience working with Sales/Solutions teams to ensure client transition from agreement signing to engagement.
Experience running engagements with clients or equivalent experience. Experience in an Account Management role within the software and/or agency world.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working across teams to develop proof points of solution success to be shared in the sales/marketing process. Experience collaborating with Product and Sales teams to help develop key strategic services offerings.
Experience with SaaS model, online and digital advertising, offline and Media Mix Modeling.
Experience in leading cross-functional teams to achieve a shared vision/strategy.
Ability to speak to both technical and business stakeholders and users and interact at all levels of an organization.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation writing and delivery. Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to be personable yet persistent.
title: Solutions Consultant Manager

text:
Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. As a Talent Discovery Specialist, you play a key role in bringing the most talented people in the world to Google. You provide critical support to the business by finding great candidates for open roles and addressing staffing needs quickly yet purposefully. You are detail-oriented and conscientious, and have an eye to improving our internal system data while developing viable candidates for our stakeholders.

As part of a global team, you gain exposure to the inner workings of Google and partner closely with teams across staffing to help meet our clients’ ever changing business needs.Responsibilities
Generate high value passive talent for Google’s immediate business needs leveraging existing talent pools and discovering new talent pools through competitive intelligence and other sourcing methods.
Improve data integrity within our internal systems.
Own and manage projects with multiple stakeholders, both ongoing and on an ad hoc basis.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Consulting and/or project management experience.
Preferred qualifications
Relevant work experience sourcing/recruiting/lead generation- at agency, in-house, or executive search.
Experience with market research and talent mapping.
Proven ability to consistently and positively contribute in a fast-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks and manage time efficiently.
Flexible (ability to work across different time zones) and able to think quickly.
Demonstrated curiosity to learn about different/new sourcing techniques.
Deadline and detail-oriented. Excellent problem-solving, communication and facilitation skills.
title: Channels Specialist, Talent Discovery

text:
As a member of a fast-paced multi-disciplinary team, you use your creativity and diverse range of engineering experience to explore solutions to a variety of engineering problems. As a mechanical engineer, you participate in the design, analysis, and prototyping of new concepts. You work in a manufacturing and product oriented development environment and collaborate with vendors and outside sources in order to see parts through to manufacture.
Our project is seeking to fill a ­mechanical engineering position, focused on the development of agile, compact and lightweight electronically steerable mechanical gimbal mechanisms that can operate at low temperatures. The scope of responsibilities include collaborating closely with controls systems engineers on the team to rapidly prototype beam steering mechanisms that operate in harsh environmental conditions, as well as evaluate the performance of existing prototypes and interface with third-party equipment providers and design firms. You are highly-motivated and enjoy working in a small dynamic team environment.
Responsibilities
Design steerable pointing assemblies.
Evaluate performance and troubleshooting of existing prototypes.
Design assemblies that maintain compliance with operational requirements over a wide thermal range.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Hands on practical experience with designing agile, light-weight, compact, and pointing mechanisms.
Experience in finite-element analysis to evaluate thermally-induced stresses, and structural modes.
Experience in one of the mainstream 3D mechanical engineering CAD software programs.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Mechanical Engineering.
5 years of relevant work experience.
Experience with mechanical design for very low temperatures. Experience with control systems.
Hands-on experience with environmental testing infrastructure (e.g. thermal chambers, shake tables etc.).
Experience with finite-­element and modal analysis. Experience with environmental (thermal, structural, EMI etc.) test preparation, setup, and data analysis.
Familiarity with tooling and processes for volume production of hardware.
title: Mechanical Engineer (Loon), Special Projects

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Carrier Sales Manager, Japan - Tokyo.Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As the Carrier Sales Manager, you will be charged with managing strategic carrier accounts and OEM partners in Japan, building the Android presence across smartphones, wearables and other Google ecosystems. You will lead all business negotiations with carriers to increase Android presence. You will partner cross-functionally with the marketing teams, the partnership group and the product organization at Google to drive Android business.
Responsibilities
Lead the relationship with the key decision makers at the carriers and dealers of our Nexus products and related accessories.
Serve as the primary interface from a sales perspective to ensure a great consumer experience for Android and Nexus in stores.
Lead all aspects of our relationships with our key strategic partners, driving new opportunities for hardware business growth and product distribution.
Work closely with our Nexus OEM partners in the market.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
12 years of work experience in sales/account management/channel management with consumer electronics or high-tech products.
12 years of industry experience in the mobile devices space specialized in the carrier channel.
Business level communication in Japanese and English.

Preferred qualifications
MBA.
Sales and/or product planning experience in a fast-paced industry, in mobile phones and/or tablets.
Hands-on relationship management experience with a proven track record in reaching and exceeding quotas.
Proven ability to plan and manage at both the strategic and operational level within a carrier sales environment as demonstrated by repeated financial and expansion successes.
Demonstrated strategic and analytical sales approach with focus on building relationships with clients.
Established regional relationships and presence within the telecom sector.
title: Carrier Sales Manager, Japan

text:
As Product Counsel at YouTube, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.
The YouTube legal team is looking for a product counsel. Working out of YouTube’s office in San Bruno, you'll develop and implement legal approaches and policies for YouTube, helping product teams make decisions based upon your sound legal judgment. Your primary responsibility will be legal oversight of YouTube's important copyright programs, including YouTube's DMCA process and Content ID system. This includes collaborating with Google lawyers outside the U.S. on critical copyright matters, including litigation and regulatory work. You'll also be responsible for providing legal advice across other areas of law, including privacy, content regulation and consumer protection, and will also support your colleagues in legal, government relations and public relations on a range of product matters. You'll be working in a place that operates very much like a rapidly growing startup business, with a dynamic and intense environment and a minimal amount of hierarchy.Responsibilities
Ensure compliance with U.S. and international laws and regulations dealing with copyright, privacy, content regulation and consumer protection.
Provide legal advice to teams from Engineering, Product Management, Advertising Sales, Marketing and Communications from the initial stages of product development to launch.
Respond promptly to a wide range of legal requests from Engineering, Product Management, Advertising Sales, Marketing, Communications and other business groups.
Legal oversight of YouTube's copyright programs, including YouTube's DMCA process and Content ID system.
Minimum qualifications
JD degree.
3 years of related experience.
2 years of legal experience with copyright matters.

Preferred qualifications
5 years of relevant work experience in a law firm or in-house legal department.
Copyright litigation experience.
Background in media, communications, intellectual property and contract law, as well as demonstrated litigation experience.
title: Product Counsel, YouTube

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
The Head of Channel Sales will be responsible for managing and growing our Channel Sales business in Australia and New Zealand. You will be responsible for building the team, building relationships with channel partners and being the face of Google to the broader SMB partner ecosystem. 

You will have demonstrated strong performance in a commercial partnership/business development role, and will have team management experience. You are a self-starter who who can work in a rapidly changing industry, tolerate ambiguity, and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight. You are an experienced channel sales professional, with significant negotiation, partner management and team management experience.Responsibilities
Build and manage cross-functional team of business development managers, strategic partner managers and account managers.
Evaluate and prioritize opportunities from a strategic, financial and operational perspective.
Structure proposals including partners benefits, targets, requirements, incentive structure, legal and operational implications.
Ensure partners are fulfilling their contractual obligations and targets, and that Google is providing the required support for them to do so.
Manage relationships with internal stakeholders, including country leadership team and a broad spectrum of other functions, such as Engineering, Sales Finance, Marketing and Compliance.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience, including 3 years in a partner development/management role.
Preferred qualifications
Significant experience negotiating multi-million dollar agreements with strategic partners.
Demonstrable experience managing and growing a large business.
Industry experience working directly with traditional media companies or SMBs.
Functional experience working in channel sales.
Track record of building high-growth cross-functional teams.
title: Head of Channel Sales, Australia and New Zealand

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
On the Google for Work team, we believe that work is more than calculating profits, balancing supply and demand or pushing paper. It’s people coming together to dream, hack, create, hustle and build. It’s where we spend so much of our time so technology should get out of the way so ideas have space to grow and inspiration is free to strike at any moment.

Google offers the world’s most popular web-based communication, productivity and collaboration tools for work, but our customers have needs that extend beyond these tools. That’s where the Google Apps platform comes in, allowing anyone to build solutions that integrate with Google’s apps, from a major software company to an in-house IT developer to the hobbyist down the hall hacking up a more efficient way to collect budget requests from a global team.

We’re looking for a marketer to lead our Google Apps developer platform outreach efforts at a global level. The Google Apps platform has great momentum already, with over 200 million installs of partner apps to date, and exciting opportunities ahead as more and more companies join the over 5 million that have already gone Google. You’ll be part of the core cross functional team that gathers market insights, develops the core strategy and executes on programs to attract developers to the Google Apps platform and to ultimately support their success as Google partners.Responsibilities
Collaborate with the product development team to translate product goals for the Google Apps platform into go-to-market strategies and promotion tactics.
Attract high-quality developers to the Google Apps platform to build solutions that complement and integrate with Google’s apps including Gmail, Drive, Docs and Hangouts.
Drive ongoing engagement with the developer community either in person at events, through targeted outreach or through broad communication channels like social and online.
Work with the Google Apps marketing team to increase the awareness and consideration of partner-built solutions among current and future customers through the sales cycle and Google’s app marketplaces.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant work experience in enterprise or developer product or marketing management.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with or understanding of a developer audience.
Comfort collaborating with technical partners and stakeholders (e.g. product development).
Interest in cloud technologies and collaboration/social software, understanding of Google’s strategic and competitive position and track record.
Understanding of the enterprise software development, implementation, sales and deployment cycles.
Strong communication skills, including storytelling and narrative construction.
title: Product Marketing Manager, Platform, Google Apps

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
You have an entrepreneurial drive and can easily handle engaging large media companies and small organizations to promote YouTube’s partner program, acquire new content partners to the program, and develop these partners on the platform in one of Asia’s key markets. This is a hands-on role that requires strategic planning and consulting skills. Essentially, you have the ability to balance short-term and long-term thinking. Each of the three content verticals of Entertainment,News and Sports offers new ways of addressing content production and delivery. 

YouTube's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. Strategic Partner Managers have the unique opportunity to create a long-lasting relationship with our top partners. You renew existing partnerships, optimize upscale potential opportunities. You cultivate these existing partnerships to make sure they can take full advantage of YouTube's ever-growing suite of offerings. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to resolve contractual, technical and financial issues with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.

As a Manager, Content Partnerships for YouTube, you should be comfortable working cross-functionally with colleagues across multiple disciplines to ensure our partners are positioned for success and our users enjoy the best experience possible. You should also expect to initiate and manage day-to-day operations and partner relationships, fielding and prioritizing incoming requests, troubleshooting partner systems around reporting, content management and Content ID and creating periodic reports (external and internal) on partner performance. Ensuring growth with our teams will also be a key determinant of your success.Responsibilities
Manage and strengthen strategic partnerships as well as develop new partnership opportunities.
Analyze and track key metrics to identify trends and highlight issues.
Resolve business issues with partners in a timely and effective manner.
Work cross-functionally to identify new business opportunities.
Implement and share best practices with peers.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of related business development, customer/account/partner management experience in an Internet company.
Ability to speak and write English and Bahasa fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Project management experience and ability to handle multiple time-sensitive projects.
TV, film, online service or multimedia experience.
Good technical know-how, attention to details, and ability to develop creative solutions to problems.
Strong understanding of the Internet media space, search engines, and digital content business models.
Excellent negotiation and analytical skills regarding contractual, technical, and financial issues.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
title: Manager, Content Partnerships, YouTube
locations: Special Capital Region of Jakarta, Indonesia

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
As a Technical Program Manager, Cloud Platform, you have a technical background, as well as a history as an active participant or lead product development and exceptional project/program management and leadership skills. You have an understanding of ecosystem interactions between and among various developer communities, and you're interested in helping to build Google's next business through driving product adoption, excellence, and usability for developers.Responsibilities
Manage product launch roadmaps and align group project and resource plans.
Plan and manage sample code and client library development projects, and contribute to open source projects.
Manage programs to help developers in troubleshooting their integrations with Google APIs and use of other Google developer products.
Create momentum and drive the success of Google’s developer products and the open web through your interactions with third party developers building applications and businesses on them.
Participate in technical and design discussions with technical executives at strategic partners to speed adoption and ensure best practices during implementation.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related degree, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience.
Project management or technical management experience including managing technical projects.
Preferred qualifications
Strong fundamentals in Computer Science or technical operations.
Familiarity with developer interests and experience working with diverse developer communities.
Familiarity with cloud platforms in and outside of Google.
Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels.
title: Technical Program Manager, Cloud Platform

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
As Manufacturing Engineer for Makani’s Airframe Team, you will be responsible for bringing our structural composite designs and processes from prototype to production. You will work closely with Engineering, Systems, Integration, and Materials & Processes (M&P) team members, as well as external vendors to track design changes, develop and evolve requirements and specifications, and drive Design for Manufacturing and cost reduction efforts.

Makani is a Google special project to generate clean and efficient energy using autonomous tethered wind turbines (www.google.com/makani). We are looking for a passionate and capable product/manufacturing composites engineer to join our team and to help design our next generation prototype. This is an opportunity to solve interesting and challenging problems on a very unique project. Our primary facilities are in Alameda, CA so you must be willing to spend a majority of your time in the East Bay.Responsibilities
Establish, deliver, and maintain manufacturing processes for composite parts/assemblies throughout the product life cycle. Work with Contract Manufacturers (CMs) and vendors to prioritize and solve problems. Drive continuous improvement through the supply chain, resulting in reduced cycle time, increased yields and reduced cost.
Provide technical discipline and leadership throughout the product life cycle, driving DFx, driving FMEA, developing specifications, process development, and readying Google’s supply chain.
Interface cross-functionally with design, manufacturing, and commodity teams in down-selection, sourcing, qualification, and integration of components and vendors used in Google’s products.
Work with Engineering and M&P to develop and enforce quality specifications for outsourced and in-house composite parts.
Track and prioritize non-R&D engineering tasks, keep part/assembly drawings and specifications up to date, act as primary interface to PLM tools for airframe team.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Mechanical/Aerospace/Automation Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a manufacturing engineering role.
Experienced with composite (CFRP/GFRP) part/assembly design and fabrication.
Experience outsourcing composite parts/assemblies to contract manufacturers.
Preferred qualifications
Master's or PhD Engineering degree.5 years of on-the-job experience.
Six-sigma training.
Hands on experience with CAD and PLM software (NX and Teamcenter).
Management experience.
Familiarity with high throughput/automated composite fabrication methods (RTM variants, ATL, AFP, etc).
title: Product/Manufacturing Engineer (Makani), Special Projects

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
The OPG team is composed of high-achieving specialists who work with websites and app developers in online advertising. We thrive in fast-paced, team-oriented and international environments. We are in charge of multiple tasks such as helping partners and colleagues solve problems. We develop, support and maximize business growth opportunities for new and existing partners.Responsibilities
Enhance the experience of our partners through exceptional 1:1 customer support.
Identify and implement optimizations that grow partner businesses.
Troubleshoot and debug technical issues with websites or apps.
Collaborate with other local and global teams on sales, marketing, new product integration, and scalable support teams to maximize business growth for our products.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
BA/BS degree with a focus in Engineering.Experience with HTML, JavaScript, Python, MySQL, Objective C, Java or other programming languages.
Experience with client service and a passion for building and maintaining successful customer relationships.
Strong logic-based, problem-solving and analytical skills.
Outstanding spoken and written communication skills with strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
title: Ad Sales Tech Specialist, Online Partnerships Group

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As a Google Analytical Lead, you will work with the largest advertising agencies and clients. You'll work as a team member on Google's industry-focused Sales teams, exchanging knowledge regarding client and agency needs within specific industry sectors. You will work with Account Planning and Marketing to pitch integrated, data-driven business opportunities based on internal and external tools analysis. You will also work with Account Management and Account Executives to identify business opportunities, such as keyword expansion, improved account structures and ad text.
Responsibilities
Develop forward thinking, data-driven recommendations that align with client marketing objectives.
Quantify high-impact opportunities with clear traffic, performance and budget recommendations and pitch to clients when applicable.
Partner with Sales and Sales Operations to develop and test tools, templates and frameworks to streamline and scale client analyses.
Collaborate with the agency team to educate and train clients and agencies on how to architect and optimize AdWords campaigns.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting or media.
Preferred qualifications
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Proven ability to work cooperatively and proactively with staff inside and outside the department.
Advanced level of proficiency with complex spreadsheets/analysis and putting together presentations.
Demonstrated excellence in written and verbal communication.
title: Analytical Lead, Finance Vertical

text:
The Brand Studio is a passionate team of creative thinkers tasked with shaping the future of Google brands by deepening the love of our users. As part of this team, you work with many kinds of creative thinkers all tasked with ensuring creative excellence across the Google Marketing landscape. Your goal is to deliver one integrated Google brand experience, and to better define the Google Marketing way.
