By embracing user insights, strategic thinking, and beautiful design paired with provocative execution, you strive to create delightfully intuitive (and delightfully inventive!) experiences that will define the future of our brand.
Brand Studio will define the foundational voice of Google and create amazing experiences through interactive storytelling, emotional film making and awesome brand identities and product experiences. We strive to blur the lines between product, code, ​strategy and art.​
Google creates products and experiences that make a real difference in people's lives. One of the largest challenges we face is how we support users across the entire Google ecosystem. Brand love is built across key moments for the user, from how we support them across products, a help center exchange, right down to recovering lost email.
The challenge as a creative leader is to create communications and experiences that give the user the confidence that Google is with them at every moment along the way. You will lead a team of writers, designers and developers to create sites, products and UI and UX patterns that will reach across the brand, and impact billions of users with the goal of increasing brand love in the process.
You will work with key marketing partners to deliver our product stories and services to the world through amazing digital experiences. You will also work across a variety of mediums, including but not limited to Google's websites, our mobile experiences, apps and immersive environments.Responsibilities
Deliver strategically sound, conceptually based, iconic experiences across both marketing and product.
Be a strategic partner to our Product, Marketing, Development and Creative Lab functions.
Lead and mentor a team of web designers, information architects and UX designers; lead external experience, design and production agencies.
Manage a large body of work and various stakeholders in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.
Be an advocate for the Google Brand.
Minimum qualifications
7 years of experience at a creative agency or an in-house team.
A portfolio of brand-defining interactive experiences.

Preferred qualifications
10 years of experience at a creative agency or an in-house team.
Experience managing a multi-disciplinary team.
Knowledge of design trends, as well as an understanding of consumer insights.
title: Creative Lead, Interactive Design, Brand Studio

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
You are a proactive team player that thrives in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment. You have a passion for helping manage complex agreement frameworks and supporting overarching team initiatives. Your role will be a combination of individual projects, internal team support and exposure with top advertisers and agencies.Responsibilities
Scale individual team efforts into a uniform team approach (i.e., cross-team best practice sharing, standardizing agreement-related sales materials, etc.).
Support a team of Upfronts agreement leads throughout the upfront season (pitch preparation, meeting support with top advertisers and agencies, agreement tracking).
Manage team’s display and video incentive agreements (i.e., adherence to global policies/exception handling processes, value add approvals, agreement tracking).
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in sales/business development at a traditional or online media company or media agency.
Preferred qualifications
Proven success supporting/negotiating upfronts as a TV/online video buyer, seller, or key advisor.
Existing relationships with agency/TV advertising stakeholders.
Detail-oriented and ability to effectively multi-task.
title: Upfronts Specialist, Agency Team

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
As a Product Marketing Manager responsible for AdWords product launches, you will lead the positioning, marketing communication and launch strategy for key AdWords packages. Working cross-functionally with product, engineering, sales and PR, you will design high-impact AdWords packages that bring together a collection of AdWords features into one holistic story that helps our customers succeed, and provides thoughtful concepts for the overall market/press to engage with.Responsibilities
Serve as the marketing lead for key AdWords product launch packages.
Develop white papers, blog posts, videos, website content, press FAQs, UI content in the AdWords interface and presentations focused on telling the story of the launch package, its benefits to marketers and how to be successful in using it.
Help to shape the development of new AdWords products based on market insights.
Define and implement mechanisms for measuring the impact of product launches.
Work in collaboration with extended marketing team to build out key strategies per quarter based on product launches or strategic initiatives.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of work experience in AdWords.
Exceptional written work, including the ability to articulate complex products and features in language that is engaging and easy to understand.
The ability to organize content and set direction in the face of ambiguity.
Ability to work in a highly cross-functional environment to drive stakeholder alignment and scaled communications.
A passion for marketing and working with the AdWords ecosystem (advertisers, agencies, press and analysts).
title: Product Marketing Manager, AdWords

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
You will guide the product teams using data-driven insights to shape the product and services that resolve the top issues that Google Apps customers face. You'll advocate for features important to Google Apps use cases, ensure product instrumentation in new launches, and improve current product supportability at scale.
As a Program Manager on the Google for Work team, you'll gather requirements, define scope, create business cases, and develop plans and schedules while driving and managing implementation/deployment of product enhancements and global compliance requirements. You'll gain and maintain strong technical knowledge of Google Apps for Work products and Google's internal solutions.Responsibilities
Apply analytics to data, evaluate and develop recommendations specific to security and privacy regulations and user expectations. Define, articulate and advise on product requirements in kind.
Translate your solid understanding of Google Apps for Work business, products and technologies into evolving and high-profile implementation and operations programs specific to government and industry standard compliance programs (e.g. FISMA/FedRAMP, ISO, PCI, SOC, HIPAA).
Work with engineers and product managers to pursue agreed upon objectives while tracking, prioritizing and communicating top issues.
Make quantitative assessments of compliance, product support inefficiencies and/or stability problems. Lead security, privacy and compliance commitments for some the highest profile and most sensitive opportunities to ensure the success of everyone involved.
Analyze product usage and design for adoption and stability problems affecting the success of the products.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
7 years of experience in program, product and/or compliance management for professional services (auditing focus), enterprise software, and cloud computing operations.
Work experience with advanced system architecture and design, technical troubleshooting, system administration, security and privacy standards, and other Internet industry standards.
Ability to drive, shape, and deliver compliance requirements for Google Apps for Work products.
Demonstrated ability to influence Engineering and Product Management teams to improve business growth, user adoption, and/or the maintenance of a product offering by identifying problems and suggesting and/or driving implementation of fixes or features.
Ability to manage complex and/or cross-functional projects and apply your skills in data-driven usage, issue analysis and problem scoping. Ability to communicate cross-functionally with product teams.
title: Technical Program Manager/Program Manager, Google for Work

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
As an Android Partnerships team member, you're doing the negotiations that keep Android's meteoric growth going. You work closely with Android Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Legal teams on new initiatives and key strategic relationships. You don't just execute; you're a true thought leader who can see multiple steps ahead and identify industry trends and key influencers. Empowered to chart your own path, you run the process from start to finish. You open doors with potential partners, lead exploratory talks with them.

You are responsible for leading and negotiating Android-related distribution for Google services with manufacturers, mobile networks, electronics retailers, and other entities participating in the creation and distribution of Android devices and services. Initially focused on smartphones and tablets, the role offers the opportunity to work with industry leading Google partners to secure broad distribution of Android devices with Google services and then manage and nurture those relationships on an ongoing basis. You will be able to work autonomously but also collaboratively with Product, Engineering, Legal, and other partner-facing teams to initiate, support and grow your partner accounts.
Responsibilities
Open doors with potential partners, lead exploratory talks, build consensus with Senior executives internal and external to Google, negotiate complex strategic partnerships that are often first-of-its-kind
Drive and execute distribution negotiations for Google services on Android devices.
Identify and prioritize partner targets; become an expert on each target’s organization, business model, and strategic priorities.
Build and nurture strong relationships with third parties, working directly with some partners and through “one-to-many” models to reach large partner ecosystems.
Serve as the ongoing Android relationship manager helping to realize and optimize value from the partnership.
Minimum qualifications
15 years of experience in the mobile industry across mobile device, mobile operator, and/or related start-ups with international experience across Partner Management activities.
Experience with mobile carriers, mobile or consumer electronics manufacturers, and retailers.
Combined technical and product experience across the mobile space whilst delivering high value outcomes for partners.
Ability to speak and write in English and Chinese fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with ongoing partner relationship management; ability to serve as an advocate for your accounts internally and work collaboratively to identify opportunities or resolve issues.
Strong negotiator with a partnership approach; ability to represent Google in discussions and structure terms to achieve strong ongoing partner alignment.
Ability to interpret legal documents and work with attorneys on specific contract language.
title: Strategic Partner Development Manager, Android Partnerships Greater China

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.Responsibilities
Manage the design and deployment of Google's Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) build in a metropolitan area.
Lead a project team within a metropolitan area including vendors and contractors.
Coordinate with city officials, jurisdictional authorities, and utility representatives.
Manage proposals, bids, scope definition, engineering design cycles and design review and approvals for a FTTH network, specifically, the selection of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) vendors.
Manage vendor scope of work (SOW), project change orders and materials procurement sufficient to meet contractual requirements.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience managing telecommunication, utility or distributed infrastructure construction or implementation projects and project teams, with profit and loss responsibility.
Experience in developing requests for proposal (RFPs), scheduling projects, cost engineering, budgeting and forecasting costs, reporting project status and costs, procurement and experience in negotiating with contractors and vendors.
Management experience in driving contractor performance.
Preferred qualifications
BS degree in Construction Management or an engineering field.
10 years of experience with fiber network deployments, including experience with constructing new outside and inside plant fiber infrastructure, and 5 years of experience with FTTH infrastructure.
Experience with Primavera project management system.
Familiar with GIS and database management including AutoCAD, ESRI, and shape file functionality.
Working knowledge of inside and outside plant fiber optic network infrastructure, engineering design and construction.
Knowledge of network drawings, route maps and scopes of work and interpreting fiber test results and auditing projects for compliance with scopes of work.
title: Outside Plant (OSP) Project Manager, Google Fiber

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The North America Channel Sales team focuses on building and managing long-term relationships with our Canadian-based Premier Small and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Partners. You are focused on empowering the millions of small- and medium-sized businesses with Google’s AdWords advertising solutions (and other Google technologies) - all toward the goal of driving business growth for our customers, our partners, and Google. You will gain broad exposure to many Google products and people as we're identifying and implementing solutions that best suit the unique needs of our channel partners and SMB customers.
Responsibilities
Source, structure and negotiate significant and complex relationships and partnerships to increase Google advertising services among local businesses.
Plan and develop strategically for assigned verticals. Build key relationships with C-level individuals.
Oversee profitability analysis, define partnership scope, and lead cross functional Deal teams to bring the partnership to fruition.
Manage internal approvals processes and interact with senior internal executives from relevant functions (e.g. Product, Engineering, Legal, Operations, Finance).
Represent Google at partner and industry events (attending, speaking engagements, panels).

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.10 years of Sales/Business Development experience in sales or marketing at a technology or media company.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Relevant experience in developing channel programs or working with small business merchants.
Local marketing expertise in media industry.
Proven track record of initiating and successfully driving new business opportunities.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about complex issues and develop recommendations and action plans. Strong analytical and financial modeling skills.
title: Strategic Partner Development Manager, Channel Sales

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
In this role, you will execute established project management process independently. You will manage well defined projects of limited to moderate complexity and scope. You will manage well defined projects of limited to moderate complexity and scope.Responsibilities
Develop project plans, resource plans and execute plans to support technology projects for internal processes at Google.
Develop implementation plans for 3rd party and custom-built software solutions for Googler-facing technology in areas like Benefits, Payroll and Talent.
Support and coordinate vendor analysis (Request for Information/Request for Proposal) to select and engage with vendor partners for technology solutions.
Engage and manage multiple stakeholders to encourage collaborative design and buying.
Minimum qualifications
Project management experience including working with 3rd Party Software partners.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with HR systems and process.
title: Program Manager, Benefits

text:
As an Administrative Business Partner, you're at the heart of your team's business operations and activities and the soul that keeps your team moving forward. You anticipate the needs of your managers and team members and help them stay focused on their projects by resolving operational and administrative issues before they arise. You move quickly with the changing environment and are up to date with the latest Google products and services. You also use that knowledge to strategically support your team's projects. In addition to being organized and analytical, you possess the strong business judgment and communication skills needed to interact with a variety of people and job functions.Responsibilities
Perform an extensive array of administrative tasks (manage calendars, book travel, and schedule facilities and equipment).
Coordinate duties for multiple offices.
Build efficiency and effective responsiveness into existing operations, and help define new operational strategies.
Mentor new team members.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Experience serving as a project lead from conception to completion.
Ability to quickly learn new tools and technologies. Interest and experience in using technology and the Internet to improve work efficiency.
Comprehensive knowledge of process, project and program management theory and practices - and the ability to apply them when solving operational issues.
Expectation of complete confidentiality on all business matters.
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with a diverse range of people and job functions.
title: Administrative Business Partner, Display Ads

text:
Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Business Analysts provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. As a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.
The Google Play Gift Cards business is growing at an astounding pace and our immediate focus is to enable it to scale. If you’re looking for a start-up like team to work in within Google, you’re on the right page. Being scrappy, wearing multiple-hats and a dizzying learning curve are some attributes of this team.

As a Business Analyst, you will provide the team with better insights that helps us capitalize on the right opportunities. You will be the ultimate data expert for Gift Cards. You thrive on solving highly analytical problems, and you will be charged with finding the most practical and scalable solutions to what can be ambiguous strategic challenges.

Your role will require incisive thinking, nuanced stakeholder engagement and world-class team work. Your ability to think strategically yet analytically, inspire others and drive personal impact are critical to succeed in this position.
Responsibilities
Develop a deep understanding of the Gift Cards Industry trends and dynamics to drive processes like reporting, business forecasting and marketing analytics.
Gather requirements and enable data savvy team members to self serve standard report requests by developing standard queries and documentation.
Analyze sales data across merchants, products, promotions and other variables to deliver insights that ensure optimal MDF utilization.
Manage ad hoc requests to help retail Sales Managers better understand changes in sales trends and performance.
Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of professional experience in a related role.
Experience analyzing data sets using SQL, R, spreadsheet software and other quantitative and statistical modeling technologies and tools.
Preferred qualifications
Project management experience.
Ability to handle multiple time-sensitive projects.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills and impeccable business judgment.
title: Business Analyst, Gift Cards Strategy and Operations

text:
As a member of Google's Public Policy team, you help shape various product and issue agendas with policy makers inside and outside government. In addition, you will help advise our internal teams on the public policy implications of their products, working with a closely coordinated and cross-functional global team. The role requires significant experience either working with or in government, politics or a regulatory agency as well as an ability to grasp complex technical and policy issues.
As our Manager for Public Policy and Government Relations in the Nordics, you will represent Google externally with government, regulators and third parties, as well as help manage our local public policy strategy and campaigns. You will work with a cross-functional team of Google employees in Europe, as well as with a closely-coordinated global Public Policy team to advance policy positions that benefit our users and an open Internet more generally.Responsibilities
Develop and lead public policy campaigns across the full range of policy areas that impact Google and the web (Key issues include technology innovation, free expression, privacy and intellectual property.)
Engage directly with politicians and policy-makers
Build a network of trade associations, industry partners, non-profit groups and others to support policies that will help create/maintain a user-focused online environment as well as an open Internet
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Direct experience in politics including time spent working on campaigns or in government.

Preferred qualifications
Broad policy experience with direct knowledge of the tech sector or the key issues impacting the Web, like intellectual property, innovation and entrepreneurship policy, media policy and free expression.
A sense of humor and the ability to thrive and exercise judgment in a fast moving and sometimes. Self starter with the ability to think, plan, and execute large projects.
Team player who can work with people from a broad range of backgrounds and experience,
including to lead campaigns and mentor more junior members of the team.
Strong networker, able to work in a cross-cultural environment and manage relationships in multiple countries.
Excellent communicator with great interpersonal and presentation skills, as well as the ability to write well and translate complex issues into simple language that people who are not experts can understand
title: Public Policy and Government Relations Manager, Nordics

text:
As a member of the Global Communications & Public Affairs team, you will work cross-functionally to help communicate with journalists and other thought leaders; devise specific communications materials and campaigns based on understanding of journalists' interests; engage in face-to-face meetings with commentators and other opinion formers; develop print and web-based material supporting these campaigns; and counter misinformation that might interfere with our business and ability to serve our users. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more.
You will be working on supporting New York and East Coast PR activities.Responsibilities
Support the New York Communications team in the execution of Google's strategic external communications plan.
Work with the New York Communications and Public Affairs team to create and implement imaginative, focused PR campaigns to launch and promote Google products.
Manage the Google Press mailbox and coordinate coverage across the world.
Train and provide advice to company officials for press conferences, media interviews and trade presentations.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of relevant full-time work experience in communications, media, or technology.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working directly with media or press.
Avid consumer of news on all platforms.
Ability to think, plan and execute on multiple projects simultaneously in an organized fashion.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and creatively solve problems.
Ability to work with colleagues in different countries and appreciate cultural differences.
Excellent communication skills - verbal and written.
title: Communications Associate, Corporate

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
Driving the efforts for the Traditional Media partnerships within Google’s Channel Sales Partners in the United States, you will have a unique opportunity to be a key, high-visibility player in Google’s Channel Sales partnerships strategy. Your main role will be to develop and execute on launched partnerships between traditional media companies, including broadcast, print and radio, and Google’s Channel Sales partners ecosystem. 

You will influence, educate and build trust with traditional media companies and help to develop their digital marketing businesses as a Google Channel Sales partner.

You have a proven track record in building digital marketing businesses from the ground up, inclusive of business operations and associated financials in restructuring businesses for success across product, finance, operations and sales excellence. 

You have a sharp, analytical mind that can solve complex problems. You will develop close relationships with key industry leaders and executives in the digital and mobile space, and serve as part of a high-energy team that is working with the world's largest publishers and agencies to push the boundaries of the online ad serving and monetization industry.

You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to resolve contractual, technical and financial issues with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.Responsibilities
Drive business growth through analysis and optimization on partners’ portfolio.
Develop the Traditional Media strategy, strategic account plans, and key executive relationships - including growth opportunities, action planning, and business growth forecasting.
Maintain a thorough understanding of the Partner Business Solutions suite and its competitive advantages, actively monitor the competitive landscape and provide feedback to Google’s Product development team.
Be the first point of contact for partners around all key areas (operations, financial, sales, training, product enhancement, monetization, etc.).
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience in sales or marketing at a technology or media company.
Sales training experience.
Preferred qualifications
Extensive strategy development/partnership management or business development experience.
Experience in traditional media companies.
Strong analytical and reasoning skills with respect to technical, contractual and financial negotiations.
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills - with experience interacting and building relationship with senior-level executives.
title: Strategic Partner Manager, Traditional Media

text:
At Google, our philosophy is build it, break it and then rebuild it better. That thinking is at the core of how we approach testing at Google. Unlike roles with similar names at the other companies, Test Engineers at Google aren't manual testers -- you write scripts to automate testing and create tools so developers can test their own code. As a Test Engineer, you navigate Google's massive codebase, identify weak spots and constantly design better and creative ways to break software and identify potential problems. You'll have a huge impact on the quality of Google's growing suite of products and services.
You use your knowledge of testing and testability to influence better software design, promote proper engineering practice, bug prevention strategies, testability, accessibility, privacy, and other advanced quality concepts across products.
Responsibilities
Develop test strategies.
Automate tests using test frameworks.
Write moderately complex code/scripts to test systems.
Take responsibility for monitoring product development and usage at all levels with an eye toward improving product quality.
Create test harnesses and infrastructure as needed.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Computer Science.
3 years of test automation experience.
Experience in Flash and/or MySQL.
Experience in building automation infrastructure/test scripts on iOS/Android and other mobile platforms.
Experience in defining and executing test strategies for consumer electronic devices.
Good coding skills in Python.
title: Test Engineer, YouTube

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
You will manage the integration of engineering vendors for Google acquisitions. This role is key to ensure that acquisitions’ critical engineering services are protected during their integration with Google. You will establish integration strategy for vendors that support the engineering environment of incoming acquisitions. You will work directly with vendor managers from acquired companies as well as internal Google teams to integrate and/or replace critical engineering services provided to acquired companies. Additionally, you will be responsible for communicating the status of vendor integration and driving results, escalating issues as necessary. You may also contribute to building solutions that increase the efficiency of the vendor integration process.
Responsibilities
Be the cross-functional lead for vendor and contract integration for the M&A Tech Integration team.
Lead acquisition vendor integration for Corporate Engineering and Production vendors, from establishing a high-level strategy to detailed tracking of the integration completion for each engineering service.
Build and manage key cross-functional partnerships with the Finance Integration Management Office (FIMO), Global Infrastructure Commercial Operations (GICO), and the Legal Entity Optimization (LEO) teams.
Leverage automation to track and report on vendor integration status. Build and maintain both team and acquisition-facing sites pages to document and market the vendor and contract integration service.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working and partnering across multiple functions in an organization.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working with external suppliers.
Experience with financial forecasting and/or modeling.
Familiarity with Google P2P and expense processes.
Track record of demonstrating solid judgment and making balanced grey-area decisions.
Strong customer service, and verbal and written communication skills.
title: Program Manager, Vendor Integration

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include APAC Head of Sales Operations - Singapore or Tokyo.The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
As the Head of Sales Operations, you will take a can do approach to keep the organization running efficiently and effectively from an operations perspective. You will provide project coordination skills to support daily operations, as well as tactical and strategic initiatives. In this role you will interact daily with the leadership team for SMBs (Small and Medium-sized Businesses) in your region.
You are responsible for maintaining smooth regional operations across the different offices and function of the regional SMB business, as well as planning for future growth, and communicating results and plans to executive staff globally. You will be the primary contact for regional projects and conduit for branding the team cross-functionally in-region and within SMB globally. You will possess a unique ability to work across diverse cultures and act as a bridge to the global teams. You will work with regional and global leadership teams to identify opportunities for future growth and create and implement plans to achieve it. You will be critical to the ongoing success and future growth of the SMB business in your region.
You will plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to stakeholders. Your work will often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated.
Responsibilities
Drive smooth execution of programs and operations including headcount planning, regional strategic priorities and Objectives and Key Results (ORKs), target setting, quarterly launch, training, feedback, business reviews, communications, and change management.
Partner with regional sales leadership to identify strategic execution opportunities, generate business plans, ensure smooth execution and drive advocacy for regional needs with central teams. Develop and execute global pan-regional projects aimed at improving sales effectiveness and productivity in conjunction with central teams.
Act as primary liaison to regional SMB Revenue teams, Large Customer Sales (LCS) Sales Operations and Marketing teams to drive regional alignment, collaboration, business planning and quarterly reviews.
Develop and maintain process for recognition of regional sales and services high performers via quarterly and monthly awards.
Minimum qualifications
10 years of work experience with problem-solving and analyses of data sets.
Experience in project management/operational management.

Preferred qualifications
Master's degree or MBA.
10 years of relevant work experience.
Team management experience. Ability to work across global cultures, and influence senior managers.
Long-term strategic thinking balanced with near-term execution skills. Distinctive problem solving and analysis skills, and impeccable business judgment.
A tolerance for ambiguity and ability to work in a fast-changing environment, with an entrepreneurial approach.
Executive-level written/verbal communication skills.
title: APAC Head of Sales Operations

text:
The Google Policy team's mission is to promote a positive experience for users, advertisers, partners and Googlers. You help work toward this goal by developing and implementing fair and consistent policies and by protecting the online safety of our users. We balance freedom of expression, access to information, brand impact and user experience to transform Google's principles into fair and consistent guidelines for our users' content and behavior on our products. The policy team is responsible for developing and launching new policies, serving as the policy expert on cross-functional teams on policy implementation and consultation. You collaborate with a wide-range of stakeholders, from engineers to sales managers to attorneys, working with them to reach consensus on policy issues. You develop content policies, support training and escalations for the policies after product launch and build expertise in areas like Internet hate speech and online cyber bullying. You have strong leadership, communication, project management and interpersonal skills.
As a Policy Lead, you lead and drive high-level, global, cross-functional initiatives, including developing and launching new policies and serving as the policy expert on cross-functional teams with Product, Engineering and Legal. The ideal candidate has strong leadership, communication, project management and organizational skills.
Sound and clear content policies are the foundation to a positive experience for all stakeholders – our developers, users and advertisers. You are a leader who will not only help the Play team with ongoing policy issues but will also set the pace for new things that we should execute proactively.
The Google Play store provides sales and distribution of apps and entertainment (music, books, movies, TV, magazines, etc.) for the majority of mobile computing devices in the world. We're growing fast and pushing the boundary of the mobile ecosystem in content types/diversity. We run lean and fast for a business of this size. This is a fast-paced, execution-oriented, impact-seeking team and you are an experienced policy expert who will help support and scale our existing policy team without losing velocity.
Responsibilities
Help iron out known policy issues that are at the intersection of business, product and policy.
Conceive, launch, and deliver new policy programs to drive efficiency into enforcement operations, reduce costs and improve accuracy.
Manage policy changes and operations communications including training materials, metrics, websites, and documentation management for our internal and external audiences.
Set industry standards and perform competitive analysis for policy areas related to various mobile stores.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of public/internet policy or legal experience.
Policy experience, with experience with the tech sector or the issues impacting the Web, e.g., intellectual property, free expression, Internet access and online safety.
Preferred qualifications
MBA, MS or other advanced degree.
3 years of relevant work experience with law or policy in the Internet industry.
Experience with complex Internet policy topics.
Experience with mobile ecosystems.
Analytical and problem-solving skills, combined with strong business judgment.
Presentation skills and ability to communicate in a clear and compelling manner to multiple stakeholder groups.
title: Policy Lead, Google Play Store

text:
As a Marketing lead, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
The Google Cloud Platform Marketing team is responsible for managing the end-to-end inbound customer journey driving from awareness straight into helping users find us and get access to the right information at the right time to the very end where we partner with sales to help grow our customer and make them more successful. From SEM, SEO, Web production, content, creative, acquisition programs, infrastructure and programs, web analytics, conversion optimization, and more - this team lives the life of our customers and makes finding, understanding, loving, trying, buying, and growing with Google Cloud Platform as easy as possible.
As the lead of our digital marketing team you will work as part of the global marketing management team to develop the web roadmap, allocate spend, optimize ROI, and ensure that we are getting the right messaging in front of our target users with scale and efficiency.  You will help direct our efforts across the customer journey and the funnel to acquire customers, educate them, drive trials and conversions, and ultimately grow business. You will be expected to drive breakthrough digital marketing at scale, roll up your sleeves and help, all while managing a high performing team.Responsibilities
Own the end-to-end web vision, strategy and execution for cloud.google.com.
Scale top traction channels (acquisition programs, SEO, paid media and retargeting) and increase impact internationally.
Analyze performance by customer cohort and optimize strategy, targeting and messaging accordingly.
Develop and execute go-to-market strategies for new products and feature releases.
Build and run a high performing digital marketing team.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience of paid search, digital media and online marketing.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Experience in running integrated, data-driven online marketing campaigns. Experience building and developing global scale campaigns.
Strong project management experience including managing external agencies.
Experience planning and executing multiple, complex marketing programs including budget management.
Project management skills.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills, with aggressive attention to detail.
title: Global Lead, Digital Marketing, Google Cloud Platform

text:
The Google for Work team works to help organizations everywhere "go Google". The Google for Work Inside Sales team evangelizes Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome, to leading companies, schools and government agencies. As an Enterprise Inside Sales Representative, you reach out proactively to show these customers how the Google for Work Solutions can help them become more productive, mobile and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.Responsibilities
Use phone, email and chat to perform inbound (some outbound, and with partners) customer demand generation, responding to incoming customer inquiries regarding their business-needs for Google for Work products.
Work with Marketing to design product and region specific marketing campaigns and messages to drive interest.
Forecast accurately and over achieve targets by leading customers through a cycle.
Monitor customer feedback and translate customer needs into a better overall product experience.
Work with cross-functional partners to improve the product's vision and drive growth initiatives. Drive programs within your market to encourage new partner adoption and productivity.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Sales experience with solid understanding of Google messaging and collaboration products.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Insightful, can suggest and implement changes to improve individual and team processes, sales methodology and user experience.
Master and maintain strong knowledge of market needs, competition and latest industry news and trends.
Ability to speak and write in English and a MENA language fluently and idiomatically.
title: Google for Work Inside Sales Representative (MENA)

text:
Deal Desk is responsible for providing business process and operations support to the Sales team in the closure of commercial agreements for Google for Work products and services. As a Deal Desk Specialist, you will provide guidance on complex deal structures and support the execution of all contractual documents while ensuring business and operational compliance. You will drive enhancements to the quote-to-cash processes and policies to increase sales velocity and improve operational efficiencies. You will influence strong working relationships with Google For Work sales teams and other Google For Work functions. 

You must have exceptional communication, organizational and time management skills and be comfortable juggling multiple tasks while meeting strict deadlines. At the same time, you should have a bias for execution and a high level of drive and creativity to constantly improve your area of responsibility.Responsibilities
Serve as a trusted advisor to field sales on pricing, product configuration, and business terms to drive agreement closure.
Manage the end-to-end deal review process and support the execution of contractual documents while ensuring compliance with business policies.
Ensure compliance with published sales and business approval policies and serve as an escalation point to business partners for quote-to-cash operations.
Act as the primary liaison with all cross-functional business partners involved in the order process to facilitate agreement closure.
Build productive relationships and feedback loops with Legal, Finance, Sales and Product teams to drive agreement efficiencies.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of industry experience in contract management or sales operations roles at a technology firm.

Preferred qualifications
Exposure to complex agreements and negotiations.
Strong analytical and problem solving experience, combined with strong business judgment and an ability to present analysis in a clear and compelling manner.
Solid working knowledge of commercial Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems.
Demonstrated ability to lead complex strategic and operational initiatives.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
title: Google for Work, Deal Desk Specialist

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.Responsibilities

Design and develop data warehouse solutions for highly complex business operations.
Develop, test and deploy new data pipelines to support customer requirements. Fix defects and implement enhancements in existing pipelines; Monitor and support existing pipelines.
Partner with users, platform, application and support teams on support issues, process issues, bug fixes and delivery of enhancements.
Address operational issues including planned outages, disaster recovery testing, etc.
Monitor and report Service Level Agreement (SLA) compliance. Identify platform dependencies and work with platform teams to develop and test new features.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in designing and developing data integration/data warehousing/business intelligence solutions.
Programming skills in Java
Preferred qualifications
Experience working with BI tools like Tableau
Experience and proficiency in ETL tools like Pentaho Kettle, Informatica and/or DataStage.
Outstanding SQL scripting skills.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills

text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. As the Head of our Education business in India, you will be responsible for managing sales for Chromebooks, Android tablets, device management software and Google Apps into the Education segment. You are comfortable managing a pipeline of accounts, building relationships, promoting the value of technology in education and building solutions. You will also be responsible for leading our efforts to ensure that education institutions that use our products are trained and use them well to improve teaching and learning in the classroom, ideally in a 1-to-1 environment.Responsibilities

text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.
As a YouTube Online Partner Strategist, you will use your interest for video, the media, and the internet, to acquire a deep understanding of our APAC content provider's business and distribution goals. You will be responsible for managing partner activities and representing YouTube's user, product, and program interests to the partner. Responsibilities include giving launch support to new partners, planning forecasting and reporting partner metrics, driving new business opportunities, and ensuring prompt and proper resolution of business and technical issues with the partner. You will work as a key member of a dynamic team, representing the needs of Australia and New Zealand, India, and Southeast Asia partners in partner program planning and development. You are as comfortable in a partner-facing capacity interacting with content providers, as you are in working cross-functionally on programs to encourage/enable providers to make their content discoverable through YouTube.Responsibilities
Provide proactive partner management for top-tier partners - account planning, proactive support and optimization, new business development.
Work on India partner program communication and reactive support, including maintaining and developing new 1-to-many communications for partner support and optimization.
Develop key categories of partners.
Identify opportunities that can help a partner grow, including programming ideas, collaborations, partnerships, tentpole activities.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience in IT/digital content field.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
4 years of work experience, including 2 years of related account or partner management experience.
Knowledge of online video and experience in online entertainment or new media, with an understanding of the online entertainment space as well as YouTube.
Demonstrated success in process management and client/partner support, with flexibility and ability to work with diverse regions. Ability to work as needed on timely delivery of content to the region.
Strong organizational, analytical, and time management skills. Comfortable working with internal and external clients.
Fluency in additional languages.

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multidisciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
As a Supply Chain Program Manager in Google Fiber Supply Chain Operations, you will lead various programs and projects that deliver strategic operational improvements to the organization. These processes and systems span operational areas including but not limited to cost, quality, inventory, planning, procurement, data management, and compliance. You will leverage your experience in both operational and project roles focused on end-to-end process improvements.Responsibilities

Interface with internal customers, partner teams, suppliers and other stakeholders to define and fulfill process and system requirements.
Engage with internal customers developing new supply chains and solutions.
Identify opportunities for supply chain operational improvements.
Promote project management best practices.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or MS in technical field.
8 years of experience in supply chain management, in both functional and project management roles.
Experience implementing new tools and systems.
Experience leading cross-functional project teams.
Excellent leadership and facilitation skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

text:
At Google, we don't shy away from big, crazy ideas--and that's not just in our products. We aim to foster the healthiest workforce on the planet and our Benefits team is behind the wheel, driving these efforts. From retirement planning to financial literacy courses to healthy living campaigns, our Benefits team runs programs that are designed to keep our global Googlers healthy and happy. With more than 60 offices across the world, you're able to swiftly maneuver through the complexity of serving different legal and cultural practices, while also finding creative opportunities for giving our Googlers equitable support. You'll build an understanding of what "wellness' truly means to each Googler, and implement innovative programs as the population of Googlers grows in size and diversity. You are a mission-driven, enthusiastic team player with the creativity to develop and manage benefits programs.
As an Accommodation Specialist, you’ll manage all local disability accommodations for Googlers and candidates with disabilities, including managing vendor relationships. You’ll partner closely with different teams to deliver training, resources and processes. You think holistically and strategically about accommodations and are able to multi-task. You establish solid working relationships with peers, cross functional teams, carriers, and vendors. You are a team player who is able to cultivate and influence relationships. You will provide oversight and administration of disability provisions, evaluations, and accommodations.
Responsibilities
Be responsible for activities related with leave of absences, accessibility, worker related injuries, accommodations requests including communications, onboarding Nooglers with disabilities, evaluation, training, tracking, return to work plans, guidelines for extended leaves, and manage, as well as message sensitive and confidential information appropriately.
Provide custom benchmarking across accommodations, assess industry trends, maintain up to date working knowledge of accommodation laws within APAC. Keep abreast of the current changes in the laws by attending seminars and utilizing the internet and periodicals
Provide appropriate training to cross functional teams such as staffing, Noogler team, Tech stop, HRBPs
Partner with and support Diversity, Staffing, Health and Safety, Employment Legal and HR Business Partners on all things accommodations/accessibility related.
Handle escalations around all benefit situations and work directly with Googlers, managers, HRBPs, and legal to resolve complex situations
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant experience in Occupational Rehabilitation, HR, Consulting or Business.
Project management experience.

Preferred qualifications
Experience in accommodations, return to work processes 
Knowledge in different accommodation laws.
Experience working in a team environment, while also being able to work independently.
Experience in managing vendor relations.
Skilled at establishing relationships and working collaboratively across multiple offices, geographies, and worldwide time zones often via email and video.
Ability to work in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment. Able to think strategically while managing details.
Very strong analytical skills with ability to analyze metrics, research, and trends. Strong oral and written communication skills.
title: Disability Accommodation Specialist

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.
As a Product Specialist on the Customer Support Applications team, you will shape and improve the user experience for hundreds of millions of Google users, and thousands of Googlers who support our users. You will work cross-functionally across Google’s product areas, the Customer Support Applications team, and Product Management to help guide the future of a new platform that will leverage Hangouts as a means to provide innovative, multi-channel (voice, chat and video) support to consumers, advertisers and enterprises. You will also have responsibility for existing 3rd-party applications and integrations that are in use by Google’s customer support teams across the organization.
Responsibilities
Work with customer support teams to gain knowledge of and improve their operations.
Map out a support team’s existing business process to understand gaps and pain points, and create business requirements and functional specifications to address those.
Evaluate and introduce technology (both 3rd-party and homegrown) to improve the customer support experience.
Partner with internal business and engineering teams to introduce new solutions and enhance existing ones.
Manage the lifecycle of 3rd-party solutions when they're used as the main point of contact for vendor relationships, product deployment and upgrades, and user training.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant Business Analyst experience.
Experience working with 3rd-party software vendors, across activities including creating RFIs, RFPs, vendor evaluations, proofs-of-concepts or pilots, system deployment, support plans, user training.
Preferred qualifications
BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field or an MBA/MA degree.
Experience with contact center, customer support or real-time communications (voice, chat or video) applications.
Experience building and shipping enterprise applications and solutions.
Experience working with UX teams on user research and user interface design.
Strong project management, interpersonal and organizational skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills, comfortable engaging with technical and business stakeholders at all levels.

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
Working on Strategy and Planning, you will demonstrate excellence in project management, business judgment and analytical problem solving. You will become a cross product expert while communicating key insights to senior leaders. You will understand Product Quality Operations (PQO) product suite by communicating key “state of the business” metrics and driving the planning process with team executives. You are a self-starter who can work in a rapidly changing industry, and you tolerate ambiguity and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight.Responsibilities
Understand Google's product policy, enforcement, and risk strategy in order to identify key policy and enforcement operational successes, risks and inconsistencies, and opportunities for improvement. Partner with cross-functional teams in PQO, Legal, Product, Engineering, and Sales to mitigate such risks based on impact.
Lead complex and time-critical projects for senior leaders by quickly understanding context and developing a prioritized approach for resolution.
Become an expert in the data available in disparate sources, and use this data and your knowledge of statistical methods to execute sophisticated quantitative analyses and advanced models to produce actionable insights.
Communicate initiative findings to senior leadership by preparing polished presentations and identifying key takeaways.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience identifying risks and opportunities for business improvement by sourcing problems, analyzing data and driving business strategy, as well as measuring the success of those initiatives.
Experience in managing complex, global and cross-functional projects.
Data-driven and highly analytical, and able to translate data and trends into powerful strategies and compelling messaging.
Strong project management skills.

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users. With your technical expertise, you lead projects in multiple areas of expertise (i.e., engineering domains or systems) within a data center facility, including construction and equipment installation/troubleshooting/debugging with vendors.
Responsibilities
Research new designs, materials, technologies and construction methods of data center equipment and facilities. Carry new design concepts through exploration, development and into mass production.
Define data center system-level architectures, specify performance requirements and create accurate conceptual design and programming requirements documentation.
Produce analyses that ensure designs satisfy requirements, including predicted performance and power quality concerns.
Work closely with Platforms hardware designers to optimize the interfaces between the IT equipment and the facility. Define/create the interface infrastructure between the facility and the IT equipment with a view for optimizing utilization and minimizing the total cost of ownership.
Travel to data center sites for engineering evaluations, electrical systems audits, startup testing and full commissioning as required.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of work experience in Electrical Engineering.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree or PhD in Electrical Engineering.
10 years of experience in Electrical Engineering and 5 years of experience with mission critical facilities.
Experience in power system reliability, risk assessment studies and in multiple or all of the areas of high voltage utility connections, customer substations, back-up generators, distribution transformers, switchgear, low voltage reticulation systems, UPS, protection systems, power quality, electrical monitoring and control systems.
Involvement in special projects including input into upcoming system architectures as well as the ability to troubleshoot and perform complex business case analyses.
Be a resource for everything electrical in the area of data center engineering.
title: Electrical Engineer, Data Center R&D - Mountain View

text:
As a Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales professional at Google, you are always reaching for ambitious performance goals. Your interest in sales and the digital economy and your entrepreneurial drive enables SMB advertisers to expand their businesses with Google's latest advertising products and solutions. Your understanding of online media combined with your commercial acumen shape how new and existing businesses grow. Using your effective communication skills, you are the face of Google to a portfolio of clients whose needs you listen to, and help define the vision and strategy for how their products and services can reach thousands or millions of users.
To our customers, you are the face of Google. You listen to our customers’ needs, understand the details of individual campaigns, resolve their questions and explore and uncover business opportunities. You set the vision and the strategy for how our customers’ products and services reach thousands or millions of users. You partner with a highly engaged team and bring creativity to grow and transform the business. Work is done in a structured environment, which emphasizes productivity, quality and CSAT targets.

Supplementing your core role, you’ll participate in a two year developmental program which offers excellent training, equipping you with the business, analytical and leadership skills needed to be successful at Google. At the end of the program, you’ll have a deep understanding of our products and customers - the real foundation of Google.Responsibilities

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications

Proven ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and fluency in Italian.

text:
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a liaison between our clients and our technical staff, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations, integrations and troubleshooting for a variety of our product lines. Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned alliance accounts.

Lead regional joint sales planning processes with partners that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones associated with a productive alliance relationship.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

MBA degree.
Sales experience.
Proven track record of managing successful sales teams.

locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Using your technical and leadership expertise, you run Engineering-focused projects that are well-defined under supervision.
Responsibilities
Coordinate and/or drive the design, writing and delivery of software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Google's services.
Identify and/or analyze problems relating to mission critical services and manage the building of automation to prevent problem recurrence; with the goal of automating response to all non-exceptional service conditions.
Influence and manage the creation of new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale distributed systems.
Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning.
Conduct periodic on call duties using a follow-the-sun model to build understanding of services owned by the team (on an optional basis).

Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Engineering or IT-related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant work experience, including 1 year of industry experience or equivalent.

Preferred qualifications
4 years of software development, data center, operations, or computing infrastructure-related experience, including experience in multi-tiered distributed application environments.
Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
Strong customer service focus, with the ability to communicate with highly technical management teams.
Focused and agile under pressure.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation and organizational skills.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and communication skills.

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
This is a data-oriented yet creative position that requires a sharp, analytical mind and an entrepreneurial spirit. Armed with deep knowledge of Google products, marketing trends and individual client needs, you will brainstorm effective marketing strategies and craft compelling narratives to deliver to clients.

You will develop a deep knowledge of Google products, online marketing trends and individual customer needs and present opportunities to clients helping them leverage Google’s insight to drive their business performance. You’ll become a trustful partner working with your team and key clients to help them understand how Google’s insights can supplement and complement their internal business intelligence.

You will help the largest Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) global brands with business insights and analytics support. As the Analyst on the team, you will work closely with clients and their agencies to set the vision and strategy for how their advertising can reach millions of users.Responsibilities
Craft compelling narratives that clearly position and align our proposed solutions to the client’s business challenges and objectives.
Partner with leaders on the team to build effective strategies for CPG clients and their top brands.
Conduct robust research and create simple, compelling insights from disparate data sources. Utilize measurement tools to add relevant, trustworthy data to presentations and proposals.
Acquire and share deep knowledge of the industry / vertical, its competitive landscape, client products and key business issues that affect the client and the industry.
Uncover new business opportunities and insights through data analysis and 3rd party research tools.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Proven experience working with complex spreadsheets/analysis and putting together presentations in a compelling and visual way for C-level audiences.
Proven ability to work collaboratively and proactively within a team environment.
Ability to understand the implications of data analysis and build a strategic story from this data.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills that include the ability to see granular as well as big-picture issues.
Self-driven personality with strong analytical as well as communication skills
Demonstrated excellence in writing and verbal communication.
