text:
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, StreetView to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge the technical and business worlds as you design services that our customers love. You'll work with Googlers from Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Finance, to name just a few. You have a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you will be part of shaping Google's next moonshot.
As a Chromecast Support Operations Manager, you will be responsible for development, scaling and management of vendor teams, in close partnership with one or more outsourced vendors and various internal operations teams. In this role, you will have accountability for the performance of a vendor team globally. You will be responsible for new process implementation, training, critical issue resolution, ongoing workforce planning, budgeting, approvals, space planning, systems support (as needed), business reviews and day-to-day vendor relationship management. You will also be expected to contribute to the long-term operational strategy and support model, outsourcing decisions, contract negotiations, vendor selection and continuous improvements of business processes.Responsibilities
Manage a team of vendors in various locations across EMEA, APAC, and North America, and build and manage a vendor team that ensures operational objectives are met across multiple vendor sites.
Manage the overall performance of a vendor workforce in terms of cost, quality and delivery of service. Key objectives include service levels, abandon rates, first call resolution, schedule adherence, forecast accuracy, occupancy, and cost per contact.
Build and maintain a scheduling, workforce management, and forecasting process for the Chromecast Support team, collect and analyze data in order to recognize process inefficiencies, identify process improvement opportunities, and drive improvement of vendor performance and Service Level Agreement (SLA) compliance.
Identify and implement operational improvements in all relevant metrics (e.g. costs, turnaround time, quality, productivity and work) with vendor training, tools, and Quality teams to ensure a continually improving great customer experience.
Drive global operational strategies by conducting needs assessments both internally and externally.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in vendor management.
Experience in call center operations and/or managing an outsourced vendor with ownership to drive CSAT (Customer Satisfaction).

Preferred qualifications
Experience successfully managing customer support vendors to meet objectives.
Experience providing forecasting volumes on a monthly, weekly and daily interval to call center on multiple products and tiers.
Process improvement (Six Sigma) experience.
Strong record of success with customer-focused service teams.
History of process development and improvement in technical support.
title: Chromecast Support Operations Manager

text:
The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical and HVAC systems in the world. Facilities Technicians on this team operate, monitor and support all facilities activity at Google's data centers. You take ownership of the operation and maintenance of water pumps and treatment systems, HVAC, UPS, generators, electrical distribution and control and monitoring Systems. You're at the forefront of best-in-class environmental practices. You bring the ideas of our Data Center Engineers to life and develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving efficiencies. You ensure that problems are identified and repaired quickly, that contractors deliver quality services and preventive maintenance, and that safety measures are being performed. In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you respond to data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.Responsibilities
Provide technical input in the planning, design and development of all electrical and mechanical facilities equipment.
Ensure that facilities problems are identified and repaired quickly.
Mentor and develop the skills of an internal team to scale in support of facilities equipment.
Work towards continual improvement in operation and maintenance efficiencies, and travel to other regions to facilitate projects.
Lead a team of skilled electrical and mechanical technicians.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Mechanical/Marine/Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience in management of vendors/contractors performing installation, maintenance or upgrade work in data center or critical facilities.
Preferred qualifications
6 years of relevant experience, including experience in planning, creating and implementing complex control system designs for large data center installations, including negotiations or technical interactions with equipment providers.
Significant experience as a Marine Chief Engineer or Facilities Manager of Critical Facilities/Data Center.
Technical competence and hands on experience in electrical and mechanical systems, cooling principles and specialized in generators, power electronics, chillers and pumps.
Experience in motivating, leading and creating an effective team environment.
Has large data center facilities management experience.

text:
At Google, we don't shy away from big, crazy ideas--and that's not just in our products. We aim to foster the healthiest workforce on the planet and our Benefits team is behind the wheel, driving these efforts. From retirement planning to financial literacy courses to healthy living campaigns, our Benefits team runs programs that are designed to keep our global Googlers healthy and happy. With more than 60 offices across the world, you're able to swiftly maneuver through the complexity of serving different legal and cultural practices, while also finding creative opportunities for giving our Googlers equitable support. You'll build an understanding of what "wellness' truly means to each Googler, and implement innovative programs as the population of Googlers grows in size and diversity. You are a mission-driven, enthusiastic team player with the creativity to develop and manage benefits programs.
As a Financial Wellness Analyst, you will be charged with many tasks related to all things financially related to the employee experience at Google. You think holistically and strategically about benefits and are able to multi-task. You establish solid working relationships with peers, cross-functional teams, carriers, and vendors. You are a team player who is able to cultivate and influence relationships. Often times you will float across different areas within health and welfare to provide assistance and project management to drive important initiatives to completion.Responsibilities
Manage activities related to Googlers’ personal financial education and baseline assessment in the areas of retirement, savings and investments, debt management, and estate planning.
Design, implement and maintain processes and programs, including the request for information and request for proposal processes, for traditional and innovative financial benefits.
Analyze data for comprehensive spectrum of benefits programs and present to upper management.
Drive ongoing employee engagement through crafting communications strategy and executing marketing campaigns.
Become proficient in retirement plans or financial related programs.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of relevant experience in HR, Consulting or Business.

Preferred qualifications
Experience considering the financial impact event throughout the financial lifecycle of a Googler.
Experience working in a team environment. Experience in managing vendor related integrations.
Strong benefits program management skills, with ability to engage with our clients (employees and other internal stakeholders) to understand their needs and handle escalated issues.
Ability to work in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment. Ability to think strategically while managing details.
Ability to assess the bigger picture, think outside the box, and implement team goals/objectives across the organization.
Strong analytical skills with ability to analyze metrics, research, and trends.
title: Financial Wellness Analyst

text:
gTech Ads is our group focused on advertising, which lives by the mission: "make it easy to run ads with Google." On the platforms specialists gTech Ads team, we offer high touch technical services to large advertisers across Google’s Platform products including DoubleClick Bid Manager, DoubleClick Campaign Manager, DoubleClick Search, DoubleClick Ad Exchange, and Google Analytics Premium. These high touch services include technical pre-sales, design of customized solutions, and implementation of complex ads products.
As a manager on the gTech Ads Platform Specialists team, your pod is comprised of savvy Ads Platforms Specialists. You have people and client management skills, as well as technical skills in this role. You and your team will work closely with a list of clients across the plan, and pitch and implement portions of the sales process. In addition to serving as an escalation point for your team and tracking your team’s performance metrics, you will work hand-in-hand with your sales counterparts to assist promoting product usage and identifying growth opportunities for your book of business. While developing strategies to increase efficiency and improve service performance for your team, you will, in parallel, partner with Global Support and Product Operations teams to improve the DoubleClick Digital Marketing (DDM) platform team as a whole.
Responsibilities
Manage and motivate your team of specialists to provide high touch, solutions-oriented service for Google’s largest agency and advertiser clients.
Partner with and motivate your team to drive business growth and high customer satisfaction by maximizing our clients’ success with our products.
Analyze data, trends and team performance to drive ongoing service improvements and programs.
Manage client escalations (serving as final escalation point), engaging necessary resources and drive resolution.
Partner with Sales to promote business growth, as well as work with Global Support and Product to provide client feedback for our products and workflows.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of client facing experience.
Experience managing people.

Preferred qualifications
MBA.
3 years of experience in an online advertising, media planning or marketing role (e.g., with DoubleClick products or other ad server such as Atlas, Vindico, or Mediamind).
Demonstrated strong aptitude for people management.
Demonstrated creative problem-solving approach; demonstrated technical aptitude.
Strong analytical skills with proven results.

text:

Important: The subject field of your email must include gTech Consumers, Korean Online Help and Community Specialist (Multiple Products) - Tokyo.Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. Represent Google by actively driving, growing and managing a Korea Google product community, building healthy relationships with community power users and influencers, and engaging directly with users online and offline. Guide power users and influencers to represent Google well through relationships, coaching, training and problem-solving. Ensure user questions receive quality, timely answers by working with power users to respond directly when appropriate.
Lead new innovations in community programs including process improvements, best practice sharing and measuring and driving community health metrics. Lead new innovations in community programs including process improvements, best practice sharing and measuring and driving community health metrics.

Experience in developing online content strategy, working with content management systems, SEO methodologies, and marketing communications for consumer facing products.
Experience developing an online community or social strategy and an understanding of social media.
Ability to work effectively cross-functionally with proven track record of driving results.
Excellent problem-solving skills, sound business judgment, strategic and analytical capabilities.

text:
The Google for Work team works to help organizations everywhere "go Google". The Google for Work Inside Sales team evangelizes Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome, to leading companies, schools and government agencies. As an Enterprise Inside Sales Representative, you reach out proactively to show these customers how the Google for Work Solutions can help them become more productive, mobile and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
Inspire businesses around the world to “work the way they live” with Google’s business technologies. The Google For Work team helps business work better together, move fast and innovate. You will bridge the gap between Marketing and Sales and have the exciting privilege of being a true Google Apps for Work advocate. 

As a member of the global Sales Development team, you will be the first point of contact at Google - creating a simple, beautiful and intuitive experience for prospective customers to learn about, engage with and implement Google Apps for Work. You will co-ordinate with your aligned sales colleague(s) to approach your territory and accounts strategically, applying best in class demand generation and skills through outbound outreach to identify net new prospects. Act as site co-ordinator of Apps focussed temp and/or vendor demand generation workers
Engage with reps and senior managers on our sales, marketing and operations teams to design and execute campaigns, and help continually improve our product, marketing and sales processes
Analyze and report on our demand generation business sales and marketing stakeholders

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in sales, or business development at a high-tech company.
Experience with prospect/customer outreach in mid-market accounts.

Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal.

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.
Our users come first, and the Corporate Engineering Apps team is at the heart of that promise. The Corporate Engineering Apps team designs, develops, deploys and supports in-house performance review application for Google's biggest assets, its employees.
In this role, you will work with internal Google teams to research, evaluate and implement new and innovative solutions. You will translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, define and design the scope of technical projects, and oversee execution. You will be faced with the challenge of delivering solutions that balance rapid innovation with uncompromised reliability. Your job will be to design and implement a superior Googler experience. You should be an experienced generalist, IT and business analyst. You must have the ability and interest to work on a range of different types of projects and business processes, and must have a background that demonstrates this ability.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with and advise Business, Corporate Engineering, User Experience and other cross-functional teams to design and implement a superior Googler experience for the performance review application.
Partner with internal business teams in developing delivery roadmaps, defining business processes and associated system requirements.
Be a key contributor to system implementation projects (requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution).
Work with People Operations teams to gain first-hand knowledge of their programs and synthesize knowledge into systems improvements.
Plan, prioritize, and deliver systems enhancements. Support and upgrade implemented systems.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience in implementing and designing HRIS applications.
Experience with complete software development/deployment lifecycle - analyze, design, build, test, implement, and support.
Subject matter experience and systems experience in one or more Human Resource domains (e.g. self-service systems, Learning and Development, Total Rewards).
Preferred qualifications
MA/MS degree.
Experience working with systems that handle sensitive data.
Successful track record working on cross-functional, cross-team projects.
Ability to deal with ambiguity and thrive in a rapidly changing business environment.
Ability to learn a new business domain and build subject matter expertise in a short period.
Strong analytical skills.

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.You encourage safe and efficient network operations by leading project teams that maintain and improve network operations. You propose projects that increase network reliability and analyze network technologies that assess implications for Google.
Responsibilities
Work with other team members and groups to identify and develop scalable network designs (OpenFlow/SDN, MPLS, BGP), solutions and policy recommendations.
Ensure continued smooth operation of the global network infrastructure.
Support Google's internal application groups by identifying and presenting their network-impacting requirements to the rest of the network engineering team.
Support and lead implementation of Google's growing network infrastructure.
Participate in the rotating "on call" schedule with other members of the team providing third-tier support, solving the more complex networking trouble.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Civil Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with Cisco and/or Juniper.
Experience in network routing protocol troubleshooting in BGP, OSPF, IS-IS and MPLS.
Preferred qualifications
Network certifications (CCNA, JNCIA-CCIE or JNCIE) or equivalent work experience.
5 years of experience with a service provider or enterprise-level network in engineering or design roles.
Substantial operational experience with enterprise/carrier-class routers and switches.
Excellent knowledge of TCP/IP, GRE, IPSec, POS, PPP, VRRP, HSRP and SNMP protocols.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to influence others on network engineering solutions.
title: Network Engineer

As a member of a fast-paced multi-disciplinary team, you use your creativity and diverse range of engineering experience to explore solutions to a variety of engineering problems. text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
As a Network/Capacity Planner, you will enable the team to make the most informed decisions for network expansion and growth. With Google's ever-evolving technologies at your fingertips, you'll be challenged to innovate. At the same time, you will work to ensure that the future network will accommodate bandwidth and quality needs for Google Access.
By directing how and where to cost-effectively expand network infrastructure, you’ll ensure that our customers stay connected with our growing suite of applications, products and services. You play a pivotal role - ensuring that future network capacity, platforms and tools will continue to scale to the high-performance needs from our users and meet the safe and efficient monitoring performance for our Network Operations team.Responsibilities
Adapt and enhance existing models which characterize architectural guidelines and design principles to affect network capacity decisions.
Create clear input requirements, and manage the modeling output for data-driven decision making.
Simulate failure scenarios on Google's existing network infrastructure as well as future designs.
Conduct “what-if“ simulations and bottleneck analysis, investigate the impact of network changes and recommend design optimizations.
Analyze the modeling input and output data to identify key influential factors and improve quality of the modeling process; communicate simulation, analysis and design results crisply to partner teams.
Minimum qualifications
MS degree in networking, operations research, computer science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in network modeling.
Experience working in access networks, outside plant and IP.
Preferred qualifications
PhD degree in a technical field.
Experience working on network planning problems of complex scope on large-scale service provider networks.
Experience with network modeling software (Cariden, WANDL, OPNET, etc.) or in-house custom software.
Experience in demand forecasting, Monte Carlo simulations, network analysis, performance metrics and operations research for demand-based networks.
Proven analytical ability.
title: Network Planner, Network Capacity, Google Fiber

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
As a Technical Program Manager in Google’s Security Team, you will be central to managing projects within the Enterprise Security engineering team. Working with some of the best security engineers in the world, you’ll have a direct positive impact on security of Google’s data and infrastructure.
Success in this role will require sound judgment under pressure, a strong technical background, meticulous attention to detail and outstanding communication skills. You will coordinate between many stakeholders, set expectations for deliverables fro m many different teams, keep track of success of parallel efforts, identify key roadblocks and work with the team members involved to keep things moving. You will be the owner of a large security program and ultimately responsible for its success.Responsibilities
Identify, plan, coordinate, and deliver projects that address the risk introduced to Google when we acquire new companies.
Coordinate between different security teams, set clear expectations about responsibilities, communicate with stakeholders and measure success.
Optimize and enhance existing processes with an eye to reducing a high operational load.
Identify areas of risk before they become roadblocks and bring dependent parties together to agree upon a solution.
Communicate with senior leadership on an ongoing basis about the current highest risks and what steps need to be taken to address them.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline (e.g. Electrical Engineering) or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in computer security
Preferred qualifications
Hands on experience in an engineering or technical role delivering security solutions. Experience running large security programs.
Ability to evaluate technical risk and business impact and explain the impact of security issues to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization abilities with excellent attention to detail.
Excellent written communication skills, with a focus on translating technically complex issues into simple, easy to understand language.
title: Technical Program Manager, Security Operations

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
Program Managers have excellent system design, project management, analytical, technical and leadership skills. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you are responsible for developing and supporting a wide array of internal systems and platforms for the Google for Work Sales, Marketing and Partner teams across all product lines (Apps, Chrome, Search, Geo, Cloud, etc.). You will work closely with business counterparts to evaluate and prioritize enhancements to our platforms, define technical requirements and work with our developers and admins to deliver solutions.

You will be in charge of maintaining current solutions that our Enterprise Business Solutions (EBS) team owns, troubleshoot complex issues and work with our Engineering teams to prioritize high priority bugs. Familiarity with the key business drivers across the Google for Work customer lifecycle (marketing, sales, support, etc.) will be key to your success in this position, as well as experience troubleshooting technical issues and identifying root-causes. You will also gain administrative knowledge of the CRM used in Google for Work, but will not be required to develop/code (only configuration/admin changes).

Opening Date: Wednesday 6th May 2015

Closing Date: Wednesday 3rd June 2015

Competitive Rates of Pay Apply.
Responsibilities

Define clear technical systems requirements for Engineering and Development teams to execute and track ongoing technical work and to ensure timely execution of all systems requirements.
Work collaboratively across Technology and Solutions teams and other Google teams to improve and invest in systems and platforms to meet the great growth in Google for Work.
Provide staffing estimates for delivering systems requirements and build a robust forecasting model for the successful management of product launches.
Provide ongoing delivery and maintenance of our CRM and tools used by the sales and partners organizations, troubleshoot and provide support for tools and systems, and be on-call for business critical systems.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in CRM Workflow and Business Application design.

Master's degree.
Technical degree in CS, EE, etc.

Strong business and technical communication skills with an ability to gather and predict business requirements, and translate them into clear specifications and system architecture.

text:
Applications are due by June 22, 2015 at 11:59pm PST. Our team will review applications on a rolling basis and it's in the candidates best interest to apply early. All hiring will be completed by August 2015. Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.This position will be based in Waterloo, ON.Software Engineers at Google are researchers and developers who yearn to create and implement complex computer science solutions. Our engineers develop massively scalable, distributed software systems and also collaborate on multitudes of smaller projects that have universal appeal - which requires research, awareness, interactivity, and asking questions. You build strong competencies in data structures and algorithms, along with a technical fascination for how stuff fits together. You need to have a solid foundation in computer science in order to consistently come up with new ideas as well as strive for a deep understanding of our products and services in order to continually improve upon them. We focus on being a collaborative, global organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skills and a keen eye for quality.As a Software Engineer, you will work on our core products and services as well as those who support critical functions of our engineering operations. Depending on your background and experience, you will be working in one of the following areas:Product and Systems Development
Whether it's finding new and innovative ways to advance search quality, building computing platform and networking technologies, automating the indexing of videos, or continuing to refine and scale complex auction systems (just to name a few), you will be developing solutions to some of the most challenging technical problems out there. You will research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offerings and collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information. Examples of specialist domains: UI development with AJAX and similar technologies, security, embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers).Engineering Productivity 
As a software engineer in the Engineering Productivity organization, you'll use your software design, analysis and programming skills to create innovative automated testsystems. This isn't a job in which you'll simply debug and run test cases, in fact that only scratches the surface. The test team undertakes a broad range of challenges on a daily basis, designing and building intelligent systems that can explore various use cases and scenarios for distributed computing infrastructure. Just imagine trying to design and build an automated testing system for something that's never been done before. There are no text books that can help you learn this, which is why we have some of the best and brightest engineers working in this group.Site Reliability 
Software engineers working in Site Reliability are involved in every facet of Google's production and work on the cutting edge of cloud-based computing. As a member of this elite team you are in the thick of everything involved with keeping Google running, from code-level troubleshooting of traffic anomalies to maintenance of our most cutting edge services; from monitoring and alerts to building new automation infrastructure. Software engineers on this team love to create robust and scalable software that scale to tens of millions of users. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day, and work with just about every other engineering and operations team to provide services and applications that are quintessentially Google - fast, reliable and accessible to all.

Responsibilities
Perform specific responsibilities which vary by project area
Minimum qualifications
Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science or related technical discipline.
Preferred qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship
Experience in systems software or algorithms
Knowledge of Unix/Linux or other OS environments and APIs.
Excellent implementation skills (C++, Python, Java).
Familiarity with TCP / IP and network programming.
title: Software Developer Intern, PhD, Fall 2015

text:

text:
Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind those systems are Googlers who advise and partner with our users and customers. As an Ads Platform Specialist, you will deliver Google Ads services efficiently, quickly, and while maintaining quality lead and execute projects for all clients who use DoubleClick products, with a major focus on DoubleClick Search. These projects will include technical assistance on business pitches, product implementations, product upgrades, and custom solutions. You will work on multiple projects concurrently, either independently or on small teams. We have a passion for managing relationships, specifically cross-functionally and with our clients to provide Google-caliber client service. We work on multiple projects concurrently, either independently or on small teams. We are excited to develop and grow our clients business, and ensure success through our best-in-class solutions. 

As the technical, functional and industry expert, you will meet and exceed our clients expectations by proactively providing them with solutions that will have a big impact on their business on an on-going basis. Your activities will include accelerate feature adoption, accelerating cross product usage, cross agency workflow consulting, case study development, creating training plans and cross product network audits.Responsibilities

Working background of an SEM Agency or Marketer position.
Strong Project Management skills.
Strong data analysis, ability to deal with ambiguity, solve complex problems and scale effectively across a large organization and highly distributed team.

text:
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our world-class software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.
You are excited about protecting end users and have a strong passion for building advertising products that balance the needs of advertisers with those of end users. You are excited about building compelling experiences for advertisers, end users, and internal users. You are adept in creating effective relationships through influence and expertise to shape Ads products. You demonstrate analytical thinking through data-driven decision-making and technical know-how. You lead your teams by example, mentorship and charisma to do what it takes to get things done in order to make a difference. You have a passion for Software Development and a proven track record of creating extensible architectures and solid designs that withstand the test of time.
Responsibilities
Set strategy and product vision for the functional area.
Drive definition of platforms used by multiple internal stakeholders.
Build engineering team and grow leaders.

Partner cross-functionally with organizations within Google, and/or with external industry leaders.

BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.
As a Lead Creative Recruiter, you will partner with the Creative leadership team spanning several organizations to include (but not limited to) Creative Lab and Brand Studio. You will manage the resource planning and allocation of a dynamic team of makers including Designers, Information Architects, Copywriters, and Creative Technologists. You will ensure that projects and teams are properly staffed and run efficiently with the resources needed to meet deliverables.
With an excellent understanding of each team member’s professional aptitudes, and a keen knowledge of timing involved to accomplish assigned tasks, you will plan for incoming projects and implement resource changes in real time against evolving priorities. You will help in sourcing exceptional talent from a thoughtfully curated bench in order to supplement in-house teams. You'll work closely with Project Managers, and the Delivery, Creative, and Technology leads to ensure that creative resources are properly allocated and utilized.Responsibilities
Ensure resources are properly allocated and utilized against prioritized projects. Identify red flags to proactively head-off and resolve resource conflicts; remove roadblocks as needed.
Set clear expectations in regards to project staffing and timing with creatives, project managers, and discipline leads, involving recruitment when needed.
Develop and maintain an ongoing resourcing grid to maximize transparency and responsiveness across the group.
Develop and implement best practices for resourcing including acting as curator over contractors and talent against key skill sets.
Represent Creative Resources in any high level conversations with the Creative leadership team. Run effective meetings and office hours for creatives, production, and operations to inform, share, and implement.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience in creative resource management as well as experience working in a digital agency.
Project Management and/or Operations experience at a creative agency or department (ad agency, design agency, digital agency).
Proven track record successfully managing creative resources across multiple cross-functional teams.
Industry relationships with Creative and Technology talent.
Aptitude for determining optimal way to position creative individuals on incoming projects.
Impeccable communication and partnership skills as well as responsive, action oriented, and flexible to rapidly changing priorities.

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
Global Business Strategy (GBS) provides insightful review, perspective, and direction on the strategy and operating performance of Google’s businesses. We are a central team that typically engages on projects and work streams that impact multiple areas of Google’s business. We are integral partners to both our counterparts embedded within business lines, and to senior executives across Google’s business organization. We are focused on delivering insights and impact throughout our work.
GBS is part of Global Sales Operations and Strategy, which makes sure Google's complex business is pursuing the best strategy and executing flawlessly. Team members are experts in business strategy and operations, analytical and strategic, yet highly pragmatic and results-oriented.
As a Principal in GBS, you will lead projects and teams that impact the business performance of Google. You are highly experienced at structuring ambiguous problems, leading analytical work streams, applying sound business judgment and communicating complex issues effectively. In doing so, you will manage teams within GBS, collaborate with your counterparts in the various business lines and present to senior executives within Google more broadly.

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
Google and Google Fiber highly value innovation and rapid paced engineering to develop and design solutions for our ever expanding broadband services network. The Physical & Facilities Engineering team is responsible for Outside (OSP) and Inside Plant (ISP) design, product/vendor selection, evolution and implementation, and collaboration with other Google Fiber teams on innovation and deployment. Your responsibilities as OSP/ISP engineer within this team will include selecting physical appurtenances that support the passive network and active devices. You will also work with the Access engineering and Architecture teams to specify and aid in the selection of materials that integrate seamlessly with the broader network. You will learn quickly and adapt to changes.Responsibilities
Develop processes, procedures, and documentation for the engineering of OSP and ISP solutions.
Interact with vendors on the specifications and product selection of OSP and ISP products.
Work closely with other engineering teams on the delivery of an innovative and progressive network architecture.
Apply design best practices to Google Fiber’s network rollout with an appreciation of GIS data handling.
Provide engineering support to field staff with responsibility for customer installation, quality assurance, and troubleshooting.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in aerial and underground communications design.
Experience with communications engineering and related systems (Outside and Inside Plant). OSP and ISP materials experience.
Experience with GIS/CAD systems.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working in a telecommunications or Internet service provider environment.
Strong understanding of OSP and ISP technologies, vendors and the industry. 
Detailed understanding of communications construction processes (OSP Placing, OSP Splicing, ISP).
Comfort with operating in a fasted-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks, manage time efficiently and navigate ambiguity.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
As a Manager in Product Quality Operations, you will lead a world-class team responsible for protecting Google’s users from abuse and fraud while ensuring trust and improving Google’s reputation. You are a strategic leader who possesses the ability to work globally and cross-functionally with several internal stakeholders through effective relationship building, influence, and communication skills. Transform current workflows to be more scalable while driving efficiency and automation.

Partner with cross-functional stakeholders (Sales, Finance, Engineering, Product and Legal) to achieve your team’s overall vision.
Work as part of a broader product quality operations management team with regards to strategy, process improvement, people development and technology implementation.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Engineering or Technology or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Master's of Technology or MBA degree.
8 years of industry experience in one of the following areas: internet technology, online search, eCommerce, online payments or online advertising/publishing, policy enforcement/user trust/risk/fraud investigation/product abuse.
4 years of experience in people management. Experience in leading, mentoring, and motivating large operations teams. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Experience working with and managing semi-technical operational teams with the expertise to leverage technology to achieve business goals.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with capability to process high amount of data to drive business strategies and decisions.

text:
As a User Experience (UX) leader, you help define and drive the future of Google design. text:
Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.With your technical expertise, you create test plans for highly complex platforms (e.g., validating the interaction of multiple pieces of equipment at the networking and subsystem levels), and using your deep knowledge of component design characteristics, you diagnose highly complex hardware or software issues.
You are a Hardware Testing Engineer ready to join Google's world-class design and test team. You will provide support to the Platforms team, assisting design engineers on new product bring-up and development which includes the setup, test, and troubleshooting of prototype systems down to component level. Testing environments will primarily involve some electrical testing, but may involve other engineering disciplines. You have some knowledge of utilizing electronic test equipment such as digital scopes, and data acquisition systems. You will coordinate the implementation of test methods and procedures by writing test plans, analyzing results and recommending changes regarding complex problems to product development engineers.Responsibilities
Assist engineers in design, development and evaluation of new products, perform bench level repair and bring-up on engineering prototypes, prepare and execute diagnostic test plans while documenting results.
Execute DVT test plans such as signal integrity measurements and environmental tests. Generate and apply engineering change orders or other experimental reworks.
Assemble test fixtures, load banks, and other components common to product development.
Set up and maintain lab space, tools, and materials of a hardware R&D lab. Be responsible for inventory management of prototype devices.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer/Electronic Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience working in a hardware R&D lab environment. Experience with modern analog and digital electronics and electronic circuit.
Experience using use test equipment such as oscilloscopes, amp-probes, logic analyzers, communication analyzers. Testing and troubleshooting experience in a research and development environment.
Experience using hand tools such as drivers, hammers, drills, and crimpers. Experience working from schematics, CAD drawings, rough engineering drawings and/or verbal instructions.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with Linux or other Unix operating systems, as well as scripting and/or programming skills.
Familiarity with test equipment such as loads, multi-meters, oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, thermal chambers, and automation of tests.
Demonstrated understanding of product delivery life cycles. Understanding of hardware evaluation methodologies, including development of test cases/suites, performance monitoring, test automation, and data analysis.
Ability to independently test and follow test plans with little to no direction. Ability to work in a lab environment, with understanding of how to maintain a lab. Knowledgeable about workplace hazards.
Possess a wide range of engineering testing skills to include acoustical testing, EMC, etc. Possess a high degree of initiative.
Possess soldering skills, with ability to solder small packages such as 0402 resistors and other SMT devices.
title: Hardware Testing Engineer

You are self-driven, enthusiastic and passionate, with excellent communication skills and a proven track record in growing business. Maximize client business growth by account management and promoting improvement ideas both as a dedicated consultant and through scalable ways.
Increase Google AdSense, AdMob and other Google products for partners.
Establish partnerships with new high potential publishers/developers.
Analyze data, trends and account performance, and develop account plans for publishers, and country business plans for the market.
Work cross-functionally within the Online Partnerships Group and through the wider Google and Global OPG organization. Collaborate with global product development teams to meet local customer expectations and develop scalable initiatives for the larger pool of publishers to drive business growth and customer satisfaction.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in developing and pitching advertising solutions over the telephone, email, and face-to-face meetings to prospects.
Ability to speak and write English and Mandarin fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in internet, advertising, e-commerce, publishing, online services, ad sales.
Demonstrated ability to acquire and negotiate with individual publishers and complex organizations.
Demonstrated ability to work with little or no guidance. Ability to independently identify and pursue the most strategic opportunities.
Self-directed, motivated, and driven performer with exceptional multi-tasking abilities toward goals.
Comfortable operating in a rapidly changing, fast paced industry with the ability to manage an evolving product set and client needs.
Strategic thinking and strong data analysis skills.

text:
The New Business Sales Organization looks for those next big opportunities that drive growth for Google. You're the human face of how we do business, often working independently, beyond our offices, traveling to trade shows and meeting with prospective customers. You’re a master of Google services, working closely with clients to pinpoint the right mix of products and advertising strategies that suit their needs. You know the industry inside and out, and are always enthusiastic about finding new opportunities to impact the future of our business.
Drive growth for Google's Online Sales Group as part of the New Business Sales (NBS) Organization. You collaborate with our Account Management teams to devise strategies to acquire specific segments of our market. You prescribe the right marketing mix based on Google's core advertising products through acquisition of predefined mid-and up-market clients. You are product- and industry-savvy, and your drive propels you toward new acquisitions and building and managing our book of business.Responsibilities
Manage an expanding team of business acquisition managers working on the acquisition of new strategic Google advertisers.
Take a lead role in building out our online sales team and developing and coaching your team in best practices in sales.
Work as an internal advocate of the sales department with other stakeholders in the sourcing of leads and the customer onboarding processes.
Increase team's productivity by developing them individually and by recognizing opportunities for creating new systems, structures and processes.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and a Nordic language fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in sales management.
In-depth knowledge of Nordics media landscape.

.Demonstrated analytical ability, including the ability to understand monetization metrics and apply these to potential optimizations.

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. text:
As an Administrative Business Partner, you're at the heart of your team's business operations and activities and the soul that keeps your team moving forward. You anticipate the needs of your managers and team members and help them stay focused on their projects by resolving operational and administrative issues before they arise. In addition to being organized and analytical, you possess the strong business judgment and communication skills needed to interact with a variety of people and job functions.
You will be performing administrative tasks including schedule management, making travel arrangements, preparing itineraries, submitting and tracking internal requests, coordinating hiring activities and schedules, coordinating meetings and group events, preparing and tracking expense reports, proofreading documents, participating in key projects, and interfacing with high level executives, both internally and externally, in a professional, effective manner. You must be able to assist in preparation of presentations and assist with correspondence, memos, charts, tables, graphs, plans, etc. You'll also be responsible for attending weekly department staff meetings and track action items. You will act as a liaison to other departments and outside agencies including senior-level management, and handle highly sensitive, confidential, and non-routine information.
Responsibilities
Perform an extensive array of administrative tasks (manage calendars, book travel, and schedule facilities and equipment).
Coordinate duties for multiple offices.
Build efficiency and effective responsiveness into existing operations, and help define new operational strategies.
Mentor new team members.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of administrative experience in a high-tech environment supporting C-level.
Ability to speak and write in English and Spanish fluently and idiomatically.

Interest and experience in interacting with all levels and departments within a company - domestic and international.

Strong organizational skills with an attention to detail and a proven ability to handle multiple priorities.
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with a diverse range of people and job functions.

text:
Google's products are known for their clean design, ensuring users can quickly and easily find what they're looking for. As an Industrial Designer, you leverage your strong technical background and understanding of "good" design to look for ways to streamline the user experience. You work closely with the product managers and development engineers throughout the entire production cycle. You design everything from high-level product flow to detailed UI mockups and then use your expert scripting skills to make your designs a reality.
As an Industrial Designer, you will shape the future by designing products that harness the power of Google to delight and inspire millions of people worldwide. You are a designer who is passionate about improving people's lives through design and technology. You are proactive, creative, engaged, optimistic, progressive, open-minded and resourceful. You seek inspiration, empowerment, and challenge. You approach challenges from many angles and create refreshing new approaches. You are passionate about the design process, from developing strong conceptual foundations to refining the smallest of details with quality and dignity. You believe that great isn't good enough and are ready to inspire.Responsibilities
Contribute concepts and stories for the look and feel of the product and express them in a compelling way, both visually and verbally. Create stories, sketches, mockups, models, illustrations, 2D and 3D renderings and photography.
Be responsible for the design of straightforward projects. Design assigned pieces of complex projects with guidance and help of a larger Industrial Design team.
Interface well in multidisciplinary teams including research, strategy, user-interface, software and hardware engineers, marketing and business teams.
Focus on the user. Interpret and translate complex technologies into simple and beautiful products and user experiences.
Create and contribute to a great design team culture. Stay inspired and inspire the people around you.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Design or Industrial Design Engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in Industrial Design/Product Development.
Portfolio of creative work.
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree in Industrial Design or Industrial Design Engineering.
Advanced 3D Visualization skills via Autodesk Alias, Solidworks, Rhino, KeyShot, Creo, etc.
Inspiring 2D skills via sketching, Illustrator, Photoshop, etc.
Ability to work with and support creative leads, senior designers, product development teams and process at all levels.
Understanding of global trends, technology and fashion. A self-managing, motivated and entrepreneurial nature.
Strong, unique, communication and visualization skills.
title: Industrial Designer, Consumer Hardware

Excellent business partnering, strategic thinking, influencing and communication skills.

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. Enhance cross-team collaboration and knowledge development along with technical partner teams (engineering, deployment, operations, etc.).

Champion new processes, frameworks and technologies across technical teams.

Preferred qualifications
Significant program management experience with complex global programs, including emerging regions.
Program management office experience.
Benefit management, systems engineering, process development, and CMM experience
Hands-on networking or infrastructure experience as a systems engineer, architect or software engineer
Ability to structure and organize a team without pre-defined processes, including mentorship and leadership.

text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.
Inspire businesses around the world to “work the way they live” with Google’s business technologies. The Google for Work team helps businesses work better together, move fast and innovate. Sales Development Representatives on the EMEA Outbound Sales Development team bridge the gap between Marketing and Sales and have the exciting privilege of being true Google Apps for Work advocates. As a member of the global Sales Development team, you will be the first point of contact at Google - creating a simple, beautiful and intuitive experience for prospective customers to learn about, engage with and implement Google Apps for Work. You will coordinate with your aligned sales colleague(s) to approach the assigned territory and accounts strategically. You will apply best in class demand generation and skills through outbound outreach to identify new prospects. You will work cross-functionally with experienced sales representatives and marketing managers.Responsibilities
Manage a large volume of daily outbound interactions with prospective Google customers via phone and email - qualifying, educating and connecting them with our sales teams in order to deliver personal business targets.
Engage with representatives and senior managers on our Sales, Marketing and Operations teams to design and execute campaigns, and help continually improve our product, marketing and sales processes.
Analyze and report on our demand generation business sales and marketing stakeholders.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Experience as a representative with prospect/customer outreach in mid-market accounts.
Ability to speak and write in English and Italian fluently and idiomatically.

Selling experience in software sales.
Able to work independently but within a team environment.

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
Developer Marketing is focused on driving the success of Google's developer platforms, such as Android, by executing global, scalable programs, events and creative marketing campaigns to engage and delight developers. Google Play developer marketing is focused on building successful apps and games businesses on Play - helping developers build commercially viable consumer offerings with our products, APIs and tools. You have a passion for apps and games business models and an understanding of how developers use our APIs and tools to achieve business success. You are a marketing manager who can not only communicate with existing developers, but also win the hearts and minds of first-time Android developers and encourage them to innovate and grow their businesses on Android through Google Play. This is a local/regional role, based in Beijing, China, focusing to support the success of Chinese developers in the global market.Responsibilities
Conceptualize creative solutions and deliver integrated marketing campaigns and programs to drive user/developer acquisition and engagement of new and existing Google Play products, APIs and tools.
Integrate existing Google Play products, APIs and tools into a plan to reach new developers and get them excited about the Android platform as a strategic business decision.
Collaborate with the Google Play business development team to provide tailored marketing support to key existing developers, including value proposition and co-marketing plans. Collaborate with the Android Developer Relations team to provide marketing support to varied developer outreach initiatives.
Establish online presence to engage potential developers, existing ecosystems and developer communities.
Contribute to key developer events such as Google Developer Summits and Think events, which the Google Developer Marketing team leads. Work with PR on messaging and positioning; manage PR deliverables.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in B2B marketing program management or scaled partner relationship management.
Ability to speak and write Chinese and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Industry experience in apps or games. Developer outreach experience.
Event content development or management experience/involvement
Track record in developing effective business and competitive positioning and messaging for technical products.
Good understanding of Google's strategic and competitive position pertaining to Android and Google Play.
Strong organizational, leadership, and analytical skills. Passion for analyzing products, customers and market dynamics.
title: Developer Product Marketing Manager, Google Play

text:
The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR stuff easy and intuitive for Googlers. Our global team optimizes people processes, from problem definition to execution. We partner with teams across People Operations and in engineering to bring innovation and technology to the way we attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide. We focus on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers, and work in Google’s fast-paced environment to deliver 100+ operational services, manage the contingent workforce and implement HR programs across 70+ countries. Regardless of location or level of experience, members of the Operations team have the opportunity to create, develop and implement some of the most complex global operations around the world.
Responsibilities
Manage one or more Google People Services (GPS) processes, and assume responsibility for operations, management, and continuous improvement of these processes.
Operate processes that may include highly-reliable data entry around employee information, customer-friendly handling and resolution of user inquiries, questions, and problems, auditing of process data, analysis and resolution of problems and special cases, and communicating with HR Business Partners (HRBPs), recruiters, and other stakeholders.
Manage processes including definition, collection, and analysis of process metrics. Cooperate and communicate with relevant stakeholders (other People Operations teams, Finance, Legal, HRBPs, Staffing), along with relationship and contract management with vendors and outsourcers.
Improve processes including identification of problems and opportunities for enhancement of process parameters (quality, error rates, turn-around time and customer satisfaction, etc.), definition and assessment of improvement options, and execution/project management for the respective initiatives.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Human resources experience (in particular HRIS/HRMS administration operations).
Experience with enterprise type applications. Experience with process automation utilizing IT applications and tools.
Affinity to technology, including intermediate to advanced spreadsheet skills, Web/Internet/HTML.
High level of creativity, perseverance, and openness to change.
Exceptional attention to detail and solid time management and multi-tasking skills.
Excellent customer service skills and a welcoming and helpful attitude.

text:
As a member of the Global Communications & Public Affairs team, you will work cross-functionally to help communicate with journalists and other thought leaders; devise specific communications materials and campaigns based on understanding of journalists' interests; engage in face-to-face meetings with commentators and other opinion formers; develop print and web-based material supporting these campaigns; and counter misinformation that might interfere with our business and ability to serve our users. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more.Responsibilities
Develop strong relationships with journalists and communicate complex technology in simple terms.
Act as media spokesperson for Google Maps/Geo products, communicating the product’s user benefits to the press.
Collaborate with Google engineering and product teams to highlight the functionality and key benefits of Google Maps and Geo products.
Help with strategic planning, drive narrative development and overall messaging.
Train and provide advice to company officials for media interviews, press conferences, and industry presentations.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience in communications, media, or technology.
Preferred qualifications
Demonstrated ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high-stress environments.
Have relevant media relationships and proven track record of positive press placements.
Proven communicator - excellent written and verbal communications skills

text:
Our clients' needs are constantly changing, and so our products need to change with them. Strategic Partner Developers serve as our expert consultants to our customers, using research and analytics to build long-lasting relationship with our top partners. Your expertise of Google's products and our partners' businesses allow you to identify new opportunities for their growth, launch new products, and expand the impact of our clients' work. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to work effectively with Google's partners, in order to best represent our users, products and programs and drive growth.
As a Strategic Partner Development Manager, Partner Business Solutions (PBS), you will manage Google's publisher advertising solutions across India. You will help publishers implement monetization programs that maximize business growth yield from their inventory using solutions such as the DoubleClick for Publishers suite, AdSense for Content, AdSense for Search, AdMob and AdExchange. You will build, grow, and maintain relationships with major web publishers, mobile developers, and advertising networks across the region who use these solutions.
You will be responsible for developing strategies that best match our monetization solutions for publishers in India based on market conditions, competitive dynamics, publisher needs, and product capabilities. Superior business sense, problem solving, senior relationship management, corporate strategy and negotiations skills.

text:
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. As a part of the Business Intelligence Team, you'll be using data to inform business and product decisions across the company. When a feature on one of our products -- from Google+ to Search to YouTube -- gets tweaked, you’ll work with finance and engineering teams to measure the impact of that change. Using your technical skills and business acumen, you’ll build tools to automate reporting and dashboard updates so clients can see quickly and accurately how projects are performing. You’ll be involved from project inception to report design through to data delivery, ensuring that your reports are delivering high-quality and relevant data so that our business can grow intelligently.Responsibilities
Build infrastructure and implement maintenance strategy for internal datasets.
Work with relevant stakeholders to deliver appropriate Business Intelligence (BI), data warehousing, reporting and analytical infrastructure required to support management teams and analysts.
Prioritize and communicate user needs, make recommendations and drive implementation for product or process changes.
Work with large data sets, automate data extraction, build monitoring/reporting dashboards and high­ value, automated BI solutions (data warehousing and visualization).
Design, develop and establish Key Performance Indicators to monitor the health of database assets and the performance of internal operations, providing analysis and strategic insights to drive growth and performance.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Programming experience with Python, C/C++, Java, distributed systems.
Data extraction experience using SQL. ETL and Linux experience.
Experience working with systems processing event based logs, user logs, etc.
Preferred qualifications
Master’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
Experience with MapReduce, Hadoop or NoSQL technologies.
Strong understanding of BI technologies and their application including database warehousing and dashboarding experience.
Extensive use of visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, QlikView, MicroStrategy).
A proven record of managing project plans and collaborating across geographies and functions.
Passion for Google Maps, geospatial analysis and mapping.
title: Data Engineer, Google Maps

text:

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations (PQO) team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
As an Anti Abuse Engineering Manager, you lead a world class team responsible for protecting Google and its users by fighting abuse and fraud for at least one Google product (i.e. Search, Maps, AdWords, AdSense). You ensure trust and reputation not only for this product, but also for Google as a broader brand and company. You are a strategic leader who possesses the ability to work globally and cross-functionally with several internal stakeholders through effective relationship building, influence and communication. You demonstrate analytical thinking through data-driven decisions. You have the technical know-how, charisma and ability to work with your team to make a big impact.Responsibilities
Manage and develop a high-performing engineering team.
Lead design and development efforts for abuse-fighting systems used within PQO.
Work with Product and Engineering teams across Google to integrate with other abuse-fighting systems.
Develop metrics to measure growth and performance of the team.
Execute special projects involving cross-product abuse prevention, quantitative analysis, and strategy development.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or other technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
7 years of experience in technology industry; software engineering experience.
Ability to work with Engineering, Product Manager, and Sales teams to improve signals and products and to align incentives.
Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management within Google.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
title: Anti Abuse Engineering Manager

text:
As a Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales professional at Google, you are always reaching for ambitious performance goals. Your interest in sales and the digital economy and your entrepreneurial drive enables SMB advertisers to expand their businesses with Google's latest advertising products and solutions.
