Using your effective communication skills, you are the face of Google to a portfolio of clients whose needs you listen to, and help define the vision and strategy for how their products and services can reach thousands or millions of users.
As the Agency Development Manager, Small- to Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales, you will provide the management and analytical power required to drive advertiser, acquisition and overall business growth of our Agency portfolio. 

You'll collaborate closely with agency representatives, identify business-development opportunities, champion new Google products and technologies throughout the agency, and develop and manage strong relationships with agency influencers and decision-makers driving scalable product adoption and business growth across the broader portfolio of agency-managed accounts. Moreover, you will develop the acquisition capabilities of our agencies in order to accelerate acquisition business growth. 

Among your many attributes, you are persuasive, gregarious, a natural leader and skilled at solving problems and explaining complex issues. You possess excellent communication and presentation skills at the senior level as well as the ability to work closely and constructively with all areas of the business. You're particularly adept at developing close, one-on-one relationships.Responsibilities

Build compelling, data-driven long term agency plans leveraging internal and third-party data. Synchronize agency plans with our Agency pod and internal cross-functional teams to further develop our agencies.
Be an ongoing thought partner for the Agency Lead on strategic initiatives and agency-level planning.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in sales or marketing at an agency, technology or media company.
Ability to speak and write English and German fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in advertising sales, digital marketing, consulting, media specific industry or in a fast-paced media agency environment.
Established relationships and presence within the media marketplace.
Proven track record of developing agency partners and successfully driving new agency business opportunities.
Demonstrated ability to lead and manage multiple projects with a broad range of internal and external constituents simultaneously.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about complex issues and develop recommendations and action plans.

text:
The SMB Revenue team is responsible for driving global initiatives to increase business growth among Google's Small- to Medium-sized Business (SMB) advertisers. The team leads the strategy, design, planning, and operation of revenue programs that drive a scalable and analytical approach to generating incremental business growth, in collaboration with cross-functional teams across Sales, Marketing, Product and Engineering. 

In this role, you will develop a deep understanding of current and future market opportunities in the SMB segment. You will be responsible for developing and executing key strategic planning and resource investment decisions for revenue programs executed by a large global sales force. You will determine the overall strategy for sales resource investment, map headcount and vendor resource needs, set business targets and account assignments, and drive the annual/quarterly business planning/launch cycles to enable execution at scale. You will also work closely with senior executives and cross-functional leaders on deep dives around business growth opportunities and business growth execution insights.Responsibilities

Develop analytical frameworks, tools, and techniques to plan and communicate short and longer term resource needs, as well as to identify advertisers that will be best served by each of our business programs.
Work with our cross-functional partners (Sales teams, Revenue Program Managers, Finance, People Operations, Product/Engineering) to ensure the successful execution during quarterly cycles. Identify opportunities for ongoing program improvements and enhancements.
Work with senior executives on deep dives regarding strategic topics by developing insights on business growth opportunities and performance.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
MS or advanced professional degree in mathematical or technical degree.
Experience analyzing large data sets using SQL, spreadsheet software, R, and other quantitative and statistical modeling technologies and tools.
Proven experience in identifying opportunities for business improvement, and defining and measuring the success of those initiatives.
Track record of thought leadership in applying data driven models that have had a tangible impact on sales and marketing operations across international markets.
Superior communication skills, including the ability to take complex, ambitious topics and create compelling narratives for different audiences.

text:
The User Experience (UX) team follows a simple premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." UX Researchers strive to learn what they need and want from our products and services. As a UX Researcher, You conduct independent research, analyze real user behavior and work with User Interface Designers, Products Manager and Engineers to improve our product features and develop new ones. Your work spans across all of Google's products, and you are encouraged to identify new opportunities for user experience improvements. We strive to the connect users to the magic of our products, and your job is to make that connection intuitive and accessible.With considerable experience, you evaluate all the features contributing to user experience, providing expertise, collaborating internally and occasionally leading projects. You contribute new processes and identify product and use requirements.
Responsibilities
Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of how users experience online search.
Collect and analyze user behavior through server logs, online experiments (A/B testing), benchmark studies, lab studies, and surveys.
Work with designers, product managers, engineers, and research managers to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and oral presentations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental Psychology, Anthropology, Information Science or related field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of work experience in an applied research setting.
Preferred qualifications
4 years of relevant work experience, including experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices.
Experience with SQL, Python, SPSS and remote usability testing tools, such as Keynote or UserZoom.
Internet, search and advertising experience.
Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase.
Excellent working knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.
title: User Experience Researcher

text:

This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
As a Product Marketing Manager for Strategy and Operations at Google Fiber you will be responsible for developing the Google Fiber Marketing strategy. This includes actively identifying high-value analyses, analyzing large operational and financial data sets to draw insights, synthesizing insights into recommendations in plain language, and presenting to Google Fiber leadership. You are a strategic and analytical thinker who can break down problems and drive solutions. This role is highly cross-functional across the Google Fiber team.Responsibilities
Develop our strategic goals including annual and quarterly plans for Google Fiber Marketing through cross-functional coordination in Google Fiber.
Define and execute quantitative analyses on operational data sets to provide strategic recommendations to Google Fiber leadership.
Work closely with the rest of the marketing and cross-functional teams to constantly optimize the day-to-day operations of our complex hyper-local marketing programs.
Develop executive communications and presentations to weave a narrative about Google Fiber.

BA/BS degree in a technical or quantitative/business-oriented field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications
Demonstrable analytic experience from a high growth firm, a leading consultancy or financial services company.
Experience working on a highly cross-functional team with ability to manage complex projects with multiple stakeholders and multiple priorities.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with experience in developing and delivering executive presentations.
Knowledge of relational databases, fluency in SQL, ABI, PLX.
Expertise in spreadsheet and presentation software.
Ability to consistently deliver quality outputs with tight deadlines in a dynamic environment.

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We are a central team that typically engages on projects and work streams that impact multiple areas of Google’s business. We are integral partners to both our counterparts embedded within business lines and to senior executives across Google’s business organization. We are focused on delivering insights and impact throughout our work.
GBS is part of the Global Sales Operations & Strategy that makes sure Google's complex business is pursuing the best strategy and executing flawlessly. Team members are experts in business strategy and operations, analytical and strategic, yet highly pragmatic and results-oriented.
As an Associate in GBS, you will work on projects that impact the business performance of Google. You are highly experienced at structuring ambiguous problems, leading analytical work streams, applying sound business judgement and communicating complex issues effectively. In doing so, you will manage small teams within GBS, collaborate with your counterparts in the various business lines, and present to senior executives within Google more broadly. 
You have demonstrated top quartile performance in a consulting environment (or similar). You are a self-starter who can work in a rapidly changing industry. You tolerate ambiguity and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight.
Responsibilities
Analyze and determine key insights from key business drivers, competitive environment, trends and operating metrics.
Contribute to complex and time-critical projects for senior leaders by quickly understanding context and developing a prioritized approach for resolution.
Execute sophisticated quantitative analyses and advanced modeling that translates data into actionable insights.

Contribute to larger corporate initiatives both on an on-going basis and on an ad-hoc basis.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in management consulting, investment banking, corporate strategy, or equivalent project management experience in a technology/media company.

Distinctive problem-solving and analytical skills.
Outstanding spreadsheet software modeling and presentation software production skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

text:
When it comes to evaluating a Mergers and Acquisitions opportunity, the M&A Finance team plays a critical role in providing the tool kit for making sound business decisions. Working in close partnership with Legal, Corporate Development and People Operations, this team provides the financial analysis, forecasting and modeling to help decision-makers assess the strengths and risks involved in a given acquisition opportunity. As part of this team, you not only have strong finance and accounting background, but you can harness this knowledge to navigate complex financial issues to find creative solutions. You're willing to dive deep into the details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture.
As the leader of this world-class team, you have deep expertise in all types of Mergers and Acquisitions agreements, as well as a strong finance, accounting, and operations background. You can harness this knowledge to navigate complex financial issues to find creative solutions and provide insight to your business partners on the financial aspects of Mergers and Acquisitions activities. You’re a strong leader, with experience managing high performers to reach their full potential. You have the ability to influence people without authority and have successfully worked in multi-functional teams in your previous roles.Responsibilities
Lead a team of professionals owning Mergers and Acquisitions transactions from initial term sheet draft through financial due diligence, contract structuring, integration planning and execution, valuation of intangible assets, and IPR&D and purchase price allocation.
Manage internal and external financial diligence teams through the delivery of a summary of findings, teaming closely with Corporate Development, Legal, and business leaders to evaluate and provide independent advice and perspective on agreement-making opportunities.
Assess all accounting and reporting implications of Mergers and Acquisitions activities. Determine consolidation structure and mechanics. Review and finalize technical accounting documents to describe all aspects of executed transactions. Collaborate with External Reporting, Investor Relations, and Public Relations on all external communications of Mergers and Acquisitions activities. Identify and define issues that require escalation and determine escalation path depending on the issues and project prioritization.
Determine guidance for internal teams on contract structure and ramifications of agreement terms and provide advice to business leaders regarding optimal structures and alternatives to meet business goals. Work closely across Finance teams to monitor post-agreement close activities against goals, projections and budgets established during the agreement diligence process.
Monitor finance readiness plans through implementation to identify the most optimal path to integration and identify opportunities to increase efficiencies. Leverage expertise to create finance readiness plans to support product launches, new business models, business in new countries, and other projects.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
15 years of relevant Mergers and Acquisitions experience in public accounting and/or private industry.

Preferred qualifications
CPA.
Ability to lead, plan, execute and deliver on unconventional projects in a fast-paced environment. Ability to deal with ambiguity and be comfortable in an unstructured environment.
Proven leader and collaborator. Ability to communicate with multiple levels including peers, managers and executive team
Demonstrated creative thinker.
Excellent project management skills and ability to keep multiple priorities moving at the same time.
Excellent planning, analytical and interpersonal skills. Strong communication skills.
title: Finance Director, Mergers and Acquisitions

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Data Center Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
As a highly motivated Data Center Program Manager, you will have demonstrated experience in the area of geographically dispersed data center design, development, construction, and technical fit-out projects. Your role is to participate and/or lead end-to-end initiatives for schedule/cost/quality improvements and innovations, end-to-end change management reviews, new product introductions and global program-level, cross-functional turn ups, acting as the data center construction and delivery team subject matter expert.
You will need to work with many internal and external stakeholders to ensure all input and deliverables are executed in an organized, coordinated and timely fashion. You will be required to have very strong project management, organizational and interpersonal skills with a good understanding of data center infrastructure, hardware, and networking. You will also need to be equipped with basic electrical and mechanical knowledge so that you can manage the specialist contractors effectively.Responsibilities
Lead large-scale, program-wide projects in the areas of electrical, mechanical, and controls engineering. Manage multiple simultaneous data center projects from inception through completion.
Support special experiments and pilots, renovations, and upgrades of existing facilities.
Gather and vet internal requirements to deliver solutions that satisfy customer's needs.
Maintain end-to-end responsibility from construction to deployment including commissioning and network/IT fit-out.
Demonstrate superior performance in resolving highly critical issues within matrix organization while maintaining rigorous adherence to project timelines and costs.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience managing multi-group, multi-disciplinary projects.
25% travel.
Preferred qualifications
MS in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Construction Management or related technical field.
Certifications in CCNA, or JCNIA, and RCDD (Registered Communications Distribution Designer) certification.
8 years of relevant work experience with data center equipment/environments, including switchgear, generators, chillers, cooling towers, air handling units, controls, security systems, fire safety systems, and a working understanding of start up/commissioning processes.
Experience managing vendor relationships and understanding of standard practices in the design and construction industry, including knowledge of fast-track design-build processes and associated documents and contracts.
Experience in managing complex/phased turnover between construction teams and owner turn-up/fit-out teams. Demonstrated skills in requirements gathering, resource organization, task prioritization, scheduling, and achieving objectives on schedule and within budget.
Knowledge of data center fit-out requirements and infrastructure (cable tray, fiber, power/cooling, grounding) including IP technology.
title: Data Center Program Manager, Technical Fit-Out

text:
People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be a champion of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching your clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.
As Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) for Employee Relations and Investigations in APAC, you will work in conjunction with the Employee Relations and Investigations team, other Human Resource Business Partners, Employment Legal, Integrity and Governance, Ethics & Compliance, Security and Internal Audit to advise on employee relations issues, including reorganizations, performance management, disciplinary issues, and where appropriate, to conduct quality investigations on people issues/grievances for our offices located in APAC countries. 

Using your knowledge of applicable local employment laws and practices, you will devise, follow and advise on appropriate protocol for APAC-based employee relations issues and investigations, and develop appropriate investigation documentation and recommendations for management. Working closely with our Legal, Compliance and People Operations (Human Resources) departments, you will interpret policies and procedures and advise on fair and equitable employment practices in terms of both company culture and local laws and practices. You will also be a generalist who will provide human resources advice, expertise and counseling in the areas of performance management, coaching/development, compensation, organizational development and restructuring. This is an individual contributor role.
Responsibilities
Partner with HR Business Partners and other Global Investigations teams to ensure that the investigation process in APAC is handled in a fair, timely manner and consistent with company culture and local requirements
Provide pragmatic advice and counsel to HR Business Partners on general employee relations issues in APAC. Assess and document local best practices for investigations, reorganizations and performance management in APAC countries, and maintain storage and access of this information for internal users
Provide project management coordination and guidance for HR Business Partners and managers on APAC-based reorganizations and reorganizations encompassing APAC countries. Ensure that APAC based investigations are thorough and include: understanding of the allegations, appropriate interviews, analysis and documentation, and recommendations for conclusion and course of action
Prepare, track and maintain appropriate investigation and reorganization data and documentation for APAC based investigations and reorganizations
Develop and provide training and guidance to APAC HR Business Partners and managers regarding employee relations issues, investigations, reorgs and managing performance, localizing existing training materials where applicable
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of (or equivalent) Employee Relations experience gained in either an HRBP role or Employee Relations Advisory role including running and advising on disciplinaries/investigations, reorganizations, performance issues or a qualified solicitor in employment law.
Experience working with employment law principles.
Preferred qualifications
CIPD qualified (or equivalent).
Knowledge of and experience with APAC employment law principles.
Attention to detail and ability to multi-task. Strong analytical and problem solving skills with ability to organize and analyze data.
Ability to establish strong cross functional relationships at all levels and geographies. Ability to listen, but also persuasively convey opinions and recommendations.
Proven project management skills with demonstrated ability to manage global projects
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
title: HR Business Partner, Employee Relations and Investigations, APAC

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
You are a research scientist with experience in chemical and biological sensors who will work with Google Life Sciences to support the development of novel disease diagnostic technologies and biomarker discovery projects such as the Baseline study. You will also support our internal research programs that seek to fundamentally advance the state of the art in instrumentation, methods, and computational biology in related areas.
Responsibilities
Design, fabricate, and characterize biocompatible/biodegradable materials for biosensor formulations.
Develop biosensors to detect bioanalytes in real-time, in a complex biochemical environment.
Evaluate and recommend existing and novel biosensor technologies.
Develop validation and quality control methods to assess new designs.
Contribute to the generation and documentation of standard protocols and intellectual property.

Minimum qualifications
PhD degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, biochemistry, bioengineering or related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with strategies for fabricating biocompatible/biodegradable materials.
Experience with strategies for real-time biosensing.
Expertise with analytical techniques to characterize biosensor sensitivity, selectivity, stability.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of post-graduate industry or academic experience.
Background in diagnostic technologies.
Experience in a biotechnology start-up environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as ability to communicate effectively with scientists and engineers from a wide range of technical backgrounds.

title: Strategic Partner Development Manager, Google Shopping

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
Opening date: 14 May 2015 Closing: 14 June 2015

Competitive salary applies
Responsibilities
Work with internal stakeholders (Sales, Outreach, Deployment, Integration, Marketing, In-Country) to align on plans and targets. Develop Country Plan
Identify, onboard and manage professional development partners and co-create business plans. Manage Google for EDU Certified Trainers and track activity
Engage District leadership to achieve scale product usage by formulating shared goals and action plans. Liase between school leadership and professional development partners
Facilitate Google Educator Groups in region and work with Google Certified Teachers and run Google Teacher Academies. Facilitate accreditation of Google training programs and communicate progress and outcomes
Track Google Apps and device usage patterns, contextualize results and prioritize appropriate programs to achieve goals. Analyze existing professional development and training programs in region
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Teaching experience or background in training/professional development.
Deep understanding of Google’s messaging and collaboration products and experience with Google’s hardware products including Chromebooks and Android tablets.
A background in project or program management, coordinating large groups of stakeholders.
Knowledge of education market needs, competition and latest industry news and trends
Demonstrated passion for education.
Very strong analytical, problem solving, organization and communication skills.
title: Education Program Manager
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.Responsibilities
Coordinate large, complex projects, including developing and coordinating realistic project estimates, plans and/or metrics. Facilitate project management across multiple time zones, cultures, products and organizations.
Monitor, measure and communicate project progress, potential risks and delays and team performance to the project team, executives and stakeholders. Exercise judgment regarding project risk and priority, and escalate appropriately.
Drive cross-product area and cross-functional collaboration and solutions.
Understand and stay informed about Google products, internal tools, capabilities, systems, resources and processes to identify opportunities where they can be leveraged to increase work efficiency and effectiveness of the project team.
Design and implement scalable and automated systems, processes and organizational structures to increase work efficiency, effectiveness and risk mitigation.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Economics or other quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of program management experience in the technology or other highly-technical industries (e.g. aerospace industry) either in corporate IT, professional services or product development.
Preferred qualifications
Experience managing large-scale and dynamic technical projects, with competing resources and priorities.
Excellent knowledge of product life cycle, tools, processes and operations planning.
Strong analytical skills and a demonstrable bias toward action. Ability to self-start and self-direct projects when necessary.
Excellent written and oral communication skills; meticulous attention to detail.
Fluent in French.
title: Program Manager, Google Access

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.
With your technical expertise, you build business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution.
You understand the technology solutions provided by internal and external partners, and use your technical skills to identify the best ways of integrating these solutions into the Google environment. You make solutions integrate seamlessly with pre-existing or associated systems. You understand configuration and management of these systems, web-services, message based solutions and associated workflows.
This specific Business Systems Integration (BSI) role involves working on cross-functional initiatives to support Google’s diversified portfolio of autonomous units, including subsidiaries, acquisitions, funded entities, etc.Responsibilities
Empower acquisitions and new businesses by identifying fit-for-purpose solutions to key infrastructure and business process needs.
Partner with internal and external technology and business teams to define business processes and associated system requirements.
Participate in systems implementation projects (requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution).
Plan, prioritize and deliver systems enhancements.
Work on a variety of enterprise applications and problems.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of work experience including experience managing the full implementation lifecycle for delivery of systems solutions (analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).
Systems experience in one or more market domains, e.g. hardware manufacturing, biotech, robotics, technology.
Systems experience in one or more business domains, e.g. Corporate Real Estate, Workplace Services, Human Resources, Finance.
Preferred qualifications
MA/MS degree.
Demonstrable experience working with third-party system APIs and web services.
Experience in systems integration using message-based middleware (e.g. JMS).
Development experience in Java/JavaScript and/or C#.
Strong skills using SQL and relational database management systems (Oracle, MySQL, Sybase, SQL Server).
title: Business Systems Analyst, Emerging Business Areas

text:
The gTech Ads team is a solution-generating force that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. In addition to troubleshooting on the customer side, we work with Sales, Product and Engineering teams within Google to develop better tools and services to improve our products based on the evolving needs of our users. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.
We offer both high-touch technical services to large advertisers and scaled services to advertisers of all sizes. Our high-touch services include technical pre-sales, design of customized solutions, implementation of complex ads products, trafficking of media products and troubleshooting.
gTech Ads is a team with the vision of providing best-in-class service for all of Google’s advertising clients.
Responsibilities
Manage the relationship between gTech Ads and the Platforms sales leadership team in the U.S., co-owning the book of business and identifying opportunities to drive business via high-touch technical services and solutions.
Manage a team of Solutions Consultants and Solutions Engineers who will work alongside Sales, advertisers and agencies to drive technical engagements.
Act as the point of contact for the Sales team and clients by partnering internally within gTech Ads to provide a comprehensive technical support experience.
Develop and closely monitor operational reports with stakeholders in order to show the team’s performance indicators, which include areas for improvement.
Design and develop technical offerings that meet local market needs using quantitative analysis, industry research and advertiser feedback.
Minimum qualifications
10 years of experience as a manager or individual contributor, running technical engagements with clients (e.g. consulting, project management, sales, implementation, technical sales, etc.).
5 years of experience as a people manager.
Experience in translating technical concepts to non-technical and executive audiences.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or MS degree
Experience working in a cross-functional environment across multiple countries.
Experience working in the programmatic/Real Time Bidding industry.
Familiarity with the ad serving industry and Internet technologies.
Ability to lead teams with diverse backgrounds (e.g. technology, operations, customer facing) to execute on a shared vision.
title: Head of gTech Ads, Platforms Dedicated (North America)

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Data Center Operations Engineer, Japan - Tokyo.Google isn't just a software company. The Hardware Operations team is responsible for monitoring the state-of-the-art physical infrastructure behind Google's powerful search technology. As an Operations Technician, you'll install, configure, test, troubleshoot and maintain hardware (like servers and its components) and server software (like Google's Linux cluster). You'll also tackle the configuration of more complex components such as networks, routers, hubs, bridges, switches and networking protocols. You'll participate in or lead small project teams on larger installations and develop project contingency plans. A typical day involves manual movement and installation of racks, and while it can sometimes be physically demanding, you are excited to work with infrastructure that is at the cutting-edge of computer technology.Responsibilities
Install new servers as our Linux cluster grows.
Help test and troubleshoot new server hardware components.
Install switches, routers, and other networking gear.
Configure and troubleshoot Linux OS-related issues.
Resolve issues with broken equipment with little to no escalation and cover on-call responsibilities.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience working with and troubleshooting hardware/network-related issues using Linux based tools.
Business level communication in Japanese and English.
Preferred qualifications
Substantial experience in end-to-end ownership of issues and execution of small/medium size projects.
Linux knowledge: familiar with Linux environment and experience as administrator.
Networking knowledge: comfortable in troubleshooting network issues, familiar with main protocols and common types of devices and data transmission media.
Hardware knowledge: very good understanding of PC hardware, comfortable in troubleshooting and repairing servers
Able to lift/move 50 lbs equipment on a daily basis. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Ability to work flexible hours including weekend and/or shift work. Ability to travel extensively.
title: Data Center Operations Engineer, Japan

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google, aimed at enabling next generation Internet connectivity. The Google Fiber team is deploying a Fiber-to-the-Home network capable of delivering gigabit connectivity and enhanced TV products to consumers. The Network Operations team is responsible for the design, deployment and operation of the network equipment, facilities and systems needed by this leading edge broadband project.
IP numbering strategy, policy and administration is a key function of Google Fiber’s Network Operations. We run design and build a rapidly growing Broadband Services network requiring a scalable numbering acquisition and usage policy. As the Numbers Administrator, you will work with Engineering and Operations teams across Google Fiber on the evolution, implementation and administration of our IP numbering strategy, plus you will represent Google Fiber at Google and industry-wide forums involving numbering such as ARIN and NANOG. You will also play a key role in the design and development of management and deployment tools for IP numbering.Responsibilities
Develop and maintain processes, procedures, and documentation regarding the IP numbering strategy for Google Fiber.
Ensure the planning of effective IP address resource utilization well into the future.
Act as the subject matter expert within Google Fiber on IP numbering, leading engagement with other engineering and non-engineering teams on the topic.
Represent Google Fiber at Google-wide and industry-wide numbering forums.
Contribute to the design and development of automated management and deployment tools for IP numbering.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Project management experience and experience with Project Management tools (i.e., spreadsheets, scheduling tools, dashboards).
Preferred qualifications
Experience working in a telecommunications or Internet service provider environment.
Strong understanding of IP numbering industry practices, forums and institutions.
Ability to engage with network engineers at a technical level when resolving project related technical issues.
Comfort with operating in a fast-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks, manage time efficiently and navigate ambiguity.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
title: Numbers Administrator, Google Fiber Network Operations

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Account Manager primarily focused on a single global client, you'll manage relationships with clients, which means you need to be a focused, proactive self-starter and be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Additionally, you're an advisor and consultant, as well as a client advocate within Google. While you will be part of the Large Customer Sales (LCS) team, you will also work with Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS) and help pave the future for branding at Google.Responsibilities
Take responsibility for the management of clients.
Report on figures internally and take ownership with the leader of your vertical.
Serve as a liaison with clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities.
Provide campaign updates and ensure that our advertisers are satisfied with their business growth.
Manage ongoing customer training in all AdWords-related tools.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience within account management, sales or marketing.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience in managing and optimizing paid search campaigns for large, complex clients, with experience in AdWords and Google Display Network.
Demonstrable media experience in business development, client relationships with the ability to deliver results under pressure.
Experience in communicating new product features/betas actively with clients and assisting in the implementation process.
Knowledge of online ads, especially for search and display ads and campaign performance management.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment.
title: Account Manager, Automotive, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
As a member of the Demand Management team, you will engage with reps and senior executives on our Sales, Marketing and Operations teams to design and execute experiments, initiatives and insights programs that will drive changes to Product, Marketing and Sales processes. You will use your project management skills and innovative thought processes to find solutions that will help improve evolving inbound workflows. You will also be expected to contribute to the long-term operational strategy model, and continuous improvements of business processes. A key part of your role will be managing the relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
You will work closely with our vendor manager and partners to build the scale and flexibility our business needs to take it to the next stage of growth. Highly creative and detail focused, you are the kind of person who never stands still, rolls their sleeves up, loves the challenge of running multiple concurrent workstreams, and is driven by a passion for setting and exceeding challenging targets.Responsibilities
Collaborate with Google for Work Sales and Marketing team to plan and execute Inbound demand generation campaigns and initiatives for the EMEA market either through own efforts or via a vendor partner.
Manage and lead projects across multiple stakeholders, and educate stakeholders on style and guidelines for projects.
Develop senior-level relationships (Director, VP level), to serve as a trusted consultant with major stakeholders, to define strategies to manage and increase the supply.
Present management with clear insights and recommendations into drivers of business growth, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), market trends, risks, and opportunities leading to identification of new business opportunities and business growth-enhancing sales actions.
Collaborate with vendor manager to deliver against core metrics (lead conversion, pipeline); define, evaluate, and continually improve Inbound management processes.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in marketing, project management or in a consulting firm.

Preferred qualifications
Experience in market researching modeling; ability to plan, execute and manage marketing campaigns.
Highly analytical, with a track record of being a strong problem solver, capable of translating analysis and insights into actionable business plans.
Passion to drive collaboration and deliver high-quality highly-complex projects across teams.
Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities and able to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with strong influencing, presentation and interpersonal skills.
title: Demand Program Manager, Google for Work

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
Our team is made up of high-achieving specialists who work with partners in online advertising. We thrive in fast-paced, team-oriented and international environments. On this team you proactively identify, develop, support and maximize business growth opportunities from existing and new partners.

As an Account Manager, you use your influencing and relationship-building skills, and you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis.
Responsibilities
Maximize client business growth by managing accounts and promoting improvement ideas both as a dedicated consultant and through scalable ways.
Promote Google AdSense, AdMob and other Google products to partners.
Enhance the quality of high-touch accounts and grow them into higher value accounts.
Collaborate with global Product Development team to meet local customer expectations.
Cooperate with data analysts closely in identifying growth opportunities and solving business issues.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in advertising, mobile, e-commerce, publishing or online services.
Ability to speak in English and Mandarin fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Knowledge of HTML and JavaScript.
Strategic thinking and data analytical skills.
Self-directed, motivated and driven performer with exceptional multi-tasking abilities toward goal.
title: Account Manager, Online Partnerships Group (OPG)

text:
As an Administrative Business Partner, you're at the heart of your team's business operations and activities and the soul that keeps your team moving forward. You anticipate the needs of your managers and team members and help them stay focused on their projects by resolving operational and administrative issues before they arise. You move quickly with the changing environment and are up to date with the latest Google products and services. You also use that knowledge to strategically support your team's projects. In addition to being organized and analytical, you possess the strong business judgment and communication skills needed to interact with a variety of people and job functions.
Responsibilities
Perform an extensive array of administrative tasks (manage calendars, book travel, and schedule facilities and equipment).
Build efficiency and effective responsiveness into existing operations, and help define new operational strategies.
Mentor new team members.
Serve as a lead and manager of small projects.
Coordinate duties for multiple offices.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of general administrative experience.
Experience serving as a project lead.
Preferred qualifications
Interest and experience in using technology and the Internet to improve work efficiency.
Comprehensive knowledge of process, project and program management theory and practices and the ability to apply them when solving operational issues.
Ability to quickly learn new tools and technologies.
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with a diverse range of people and job functions.
Expectation of complete confidentiality on all business matters.
title: Administrative Business Partner, Product Quality Operations

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
Google Life Sciences is recruiting a life-sciences Laboratory Automation Engineer to lead, execute and support applications development and design/implementation of systems for cell culture, biochemical/cellular assays, genomics support, high content imaging, flow cytometry, automated mass-spectrometry and acoustic transfer devices. You will work in cross-functional teams to define process requirements, assay development, and assay transfer to automation.

You should provide a full academic curriculum vitae or resume (showing all publications) and summary of professional activities (ca. 1 page) as a single PDF file.Responsibilities
Provide technical development and review for automation platforms, process optimization and facility design.
Provide technical management and expertise for the design, procurement, fabrication and commissioning phases for custom equipment and integrations.
Troubleshoot complex equipment and process issues and develop and implement sound solutions.
Support and troubleshoot equipment across a range of applications including biochemical, biophysical, and cellular assays. Provide process and automation support to next-gen sequencing laboratories.
Execute assays according to the developed protocol, analyze and load data to the database.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in life sciences or engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of relevant experience.
Experience in developing automated applications in screening/cell imagining.
Experience interfacing with LIMS systems and writing device drivers.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in biology, engineering, or related area.
Experience troubleshooting and improving assay performance including familiarity with standard screening statistical metrics, and communicating results of routine assays of any kind.
Knowledge of biochemical and cell-based assay technologies with experience in assay development and assay conversion to automated high throughput formats.
Track record of success in leading the development execution of complex assays on automated liquid handlers and integrated robotic systems.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as ability to communicate effectively with scientists and engineers from a wide range of technical backgrounds.
title: Laboratory Automation Engineer (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
Using your deployment and project management experience, you will manage and lead technical projects that create and support Googlers’ AV and VC (Audio Video and Video Conferencing) experience. You must demonstrate the ability to provide matrix leadership across functional teams, lead complex projects to successful completion, and understand complex, technical topics. Success requires a combination of strong technical competency and the ability to lead and influence across functional groups.Responsibilities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: AV/VC Engineers, Networking, Technical Support, Facilities, external vendors, architects, general contractors, and users to drive all aspects of project delivery.
Use stellar technical judgment and previous operations experience to execute entire project life-cycle: proposal, requirements, project and resource planning, expectation setting, communication, budgets, pilot, build, and closeout.
Develop and execute plans under a set of implementation and delivery time constraints.
Resolve troubleshooting technical challenges, problems that may arise, and physical site related issues.
Utilize reviews, challenge proposals, and build consensus via broad collaboration, clear communication and strong documentation.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of project management and deployments experience leading global, technical projects involving multiple teams.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of project management/hardware deployment work experience.
Ability to understand technical subjects and emerging technologies and their relevance to the marketplace.
Ability to establish priorities, work independently, successfully execute multiple projects, and proceed with objectives with minimal supervision.
Creative problem-solving and analytical skills. Agile under pressure with impeccable business judgment.
Excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills across several diverse technical and non-technical groups.
Ability to travel internationally.
title: Program Manager, AV Deployments

text:
The Creative Partnerships team is a group of engineers, producers, creatives and marketing leads working within Google Marketing. We operate at the intersection of marketing, Google’s products, and our creative and brand partners. Our goal is to shape the ways technology is used by the world’s best known brands and to accelerate change across the industry.Our ambition is to have as much impact on the future of digital marketing as Google's products have in technology. Check out artcopycode.com for the current projects and projectrebrief.com for previous work.
You are an innovative creative leader, motivated to push technical and creative boundaries to solve the biggest problems in digital marketing and inventing the future while at it. You are adept at leading teams, and ready to partner with the most talented agency teams and most loved brands in the world.
You will have a long track record of creating pioneering digital products and platforms with brands and going beyond marketing and advertising campaigns. You will have a deep understanding of and fascination with the technical underpinnings of creative ideas made for modern web and always aspire to break new ground in creating useful, entertaining and magical experiences for users.
You are deeply familiar with Google’s products, and you're excited at the prospect of finding new ways to use them in flagship projects in partnership with some of the world’s most loved brands. You are also deeply familiar with how today’s leading edge agencies work when at their absolute best. You are excited to bring technology and creativity together in new and exciting ways.Responsibilities
Develop creative concepts that use Google’s products and web technologies in pioneering and develop scalable ways to solve marketing problems.
Partner with and provide creative oversight for the creative and technology teams who lead innovative concept and prototyping and develop technology-forward marketing with partner brands.
Participate in new partnership development efforts to create new opportunities for first-in-industry applications of Google’s products.
Build relationships with creative agencies, key brands, holding companies and industry organizations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Design, Product Design or related discipline or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience as a Creative Director working in creative agencies, technology companies or start-ups on the brand side.
Preferred qualifications
A portfolio of breakthrough work in technology-driven marketing campaigns.
Proven leader, able to drive forward at pace while demonstrating diplomacy and cross-functional collaborative skills.
Deep familiarity with Google’s products and platforms, open web platforms and emerging technologies.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment on multiple projects in a start-up atmosphere
Interest and curiosity in gadgets, inventions and world-changing leaps in technology.
Great at inspiring and rallying technologists, creatives and production vendors to do their best work.
title: Creative Lead, Creative Partnerships

text:
The Global Merchandising team owns content programming within the Play store across all regions and verticals (Apps, Games, Music, Movies & TV, and Books & Magazines). 
As Head of Merchandising for Google Play in Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA), you will impact users by directing regional merchandising efforts for the Apps vertical. You will manage a regional team of Merchandising Managers, develop the overall merchandising strategy (inventory management, user acquisition and retention, ecosystem health, promotions, etc.) and deliver against performance metrics. You will work across multiple countries and functions (Business Development, Marketing, PR, Merchandising, etc.) and be a leader within the broader Apps vertical team. 

You bring extensive strategic experience in an online commerce or mobile business, superb communication and team management skills, a fanatical devotion to user experience, and a track record of beating traffic, conversion and business goals.
Responsibilities
Set regional and country level merchandising strategy for the Apps vertical.
Partner with Apps leads from other regions to understand trends and best practices and to jointly develop the global Apps merchandising strategy.
Drive team to execute against the plan, analyze internal data and optimize user experience.
Develop deep insights for the Apps vertical, understanding the user segments and lifecycle, ecosystem challenges, competitive landscape and partner needs.
Champion merchandising vision and goals to both internal and external partners.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in a merchandising, marketing, or partnerships role for an online commerce or digital content business.

Preferred qualifications
Deep knowledge of Apps industry having worked for mobile company or function.
Proven ability working with partners to develop co-promotion and cross-promotion campaigns.
Proven ability to deliver scaled solutions across multiple countries and languages.
Strong analytical skills, with an ability to analyze research or performance data and apply that analysis to optimize merchandising strategy.
Strong leadership and people management skills, with the ability to both nurture creative and drive operational process and discipline.
title: Head of Merchandising Apps, Google Play
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. The job of a UX Designer is to envision how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In a UX Designer role, you’ll tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of people around the world—from the first-time user to the sophisticated expert. Achieving this goal requires collaboration with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.
As a UX Designer, you will design components of the Glass user experience. You will work alongside UX, Engineering and Marketing teams to build interaction models, conduct user research and develop creative solutions to challenging UX problems in Google Glass. You are a self-driven and well rounded design professional with a keen understanding of consumer products, and a passion for defining the next generation of wearable computing.Responsibilities
Take ownership of one or more parts of the Glass user experience, designing the interactions and interfaces.
Create documentation (including design rules, pixel perfect mocks, animations) that enables software developers to build software that fosters a delightful user experience.
Collaborate with and develop mutual respect and trust with product managers, engineers, researchers and designers.
Participate in user experience research and usability studies.
Participate in regular design reviews and other team-wide design efforts.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS, or a related field or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Advanced degree in Computer Science, Graphic Design, Industrial Design, HCI, Product Design, Interaction Design, Information Design, or related field.
Familiarity with design techniques, such as, storyboarding, user research and wireframes.
Ability to establish credibility with engineers, PMs, and designers quickly.
A strong acumen for user experience design and how motion design influences UI and interaction design (and vice versa).
Strong design portfolio, either of client projects or personal ones.
title: UX Designer (Glass)

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As the Agency Relationship Head, you will be consulting with agencies within the Media Agency sector to provide digital solutions via a variety of Google's products (Search, Mobile, Display, YouTube). Your main focus will be on brand marketing and the opportunities on YouTube. Your role involves a mix of finding and managing new and existing business relationships and working closely with the Agency Head to develop Google's marketplace inside the agencies and on the media plans.
You'll combine digital media and deep commercial knowledge with strong presentation skills. You'll manage the relationships with agencies, and targeting, educating and developing new agencies. This means you have excellent client-servicing and relationship building skills along with the entrepreneurial drive to approach new and existing agencies and their clients with large, multi-faceted media propositions.
Responsibilities
Identify new customers and develop strong relationships with clients and marketing services agencies.
Analyze data, trends and client performance, develop solid business plans and prepare and conduct presentations.
Collaborate and consult with major customers with the goal of extending relationships, increasing Google's client and agency base, and optimizing their advertising investment.
Develop case studies of successful campaigns in order to share insights with customers and to serve as an evangelist at events and conferences.
Champion new product releases internally and externally.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as a client marketer or in a leadership position within the media industry.
Preferred qualifications
Established network of contacts and considerable sales experience within the media and agency space.
Solid knowledge of Google products.
Proven success in business development, client relationship, servicing skills, and solution-based selling.
title: Agency Relationship Head

text:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. A master juggler working of multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to tackle big picture challenges.You are both a manager and a mentor, providing financial leadership and analytical support to partners of the core Finance team as well as giving your own team the support they need to become financial gurus. You'll keep senior management informed on key financial metrics and work to improve financial operation practices throughout your region.Responsibilities
Provide executive management with clear insights into drivers of business and financial performance and risk; assess business/market opportunities and inform/recommend prioritization decisions.
Oversee all aspects of the budgeting, forecasting, and monthly reporting processes - ensure accuracy and predictability of results and key metrics. Develop and maintain P&L.
Collaborate with and manage cross-functional teams (Tax, Accounting, Financial Operations, Internal Audit, M&A, etc.) to provide end-to-end financial support.
Drive professional development of your team members by providing significant opportunities and coaching on how to effectively support senior business partners and enable them to excel in the global Finance organization.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
9 years of relevant experience in finance, management consulting, corporate strategy or similar environment, including FP&A and project management experience.

Preferred qualifications
Extensive knowledge of spreadsheet software, Hyperion Essbase, and Oracle. SQL, Python, R, or other coding experience.
Strong problem solving ability combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate clearly and influence leadership teams.
Strong analytical and modeling skills and some project management experience.
Organized, strategically focused, detail oriented, and able to deal with ambiguity in a constantly evolving environment.
Demonstrated leadership, cross-functional communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Finance Manager

text:
Are you interested in helping to lead our automotive initiatives in front of customers and partners? Do you enjoy digging into the use cases of drivers, the hardware specification of automakers, and their impact on technical decisions such as Bluetooth protocol and HMI implementation? Would you like to create technical integration guidance to show our partners the path to successful integration in that Android ecosystem?

If you answer yes to these questions then working with automotive partners on Android Auto is the right place for you! 

In this role, you’ll have four areas of operation. You'll execute and ensure overall automaker success with Android Auto and related products. This includes interfacing and negotiating directly with partners to deeply understand and satisfy all aspects of partner business and technical needs. You will advocate and grow technical and business relationships with automaker partners of Google, focused on Android Auto and related product integration. You will scale, develop and recommend programs around existing and potential partners in order to help grow the products and business.
Lastly you'll innovate and manage key relationships and projects for ongoing special product development programs, including feature specifications, delivery timelines, etc.
Responsibilities
Be the primary lead and owner for all aspects of a partner’s vehicle or aftermarket head unit integration with Android Auto by providing the necessary guidance and leadership.
Liaise with internal and external cross functional teams to have a successful launch, including Product Management, Engineering, UX, QA, Business Development, Marketing, Go-to-Market, and post-launch support.
Provide strategic insights to define and improve product features, business analytics and monitoring tools by working closely with product management and engineering teams.
Improve partner engagements: identify systemic problems and recommend solutions; manage highly complex, sometimes mission critical cross functional programs, establish new processes where beneficial.
Provide visible leadership and partnership with Technical Leads in order to deliver a family of related projects.
Provide input to key decision makers that have a direct impact on the future direction or one of more project areas.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of hands on experience in a similar role (e.g. Product Manager, Software Engineer, Technical Program Manager, Technical Account Manager, etc.).
Preferred qualifications
4 years of experience with a proven record running multiple strategic complex projects.
Experience working with embedded systems, Linux kernel, device driver APIs, chipset, and Android.
title: Technical Solutions Consultant, Android Auto

text:
As Google's products and services grow to serve our billions of users, the Strategic Negotiation team works behind the scenes to secure infrastructure for Google's future. It's a big job that involves everything from operating underwater cables to finding data center space. In this role you combine your deep market knowledge with tech industry savvy to find solutions that support Google's growth. You'll work with specific teams to oversee vendor and partner relationships. Your successful management skills have the potential to impact every part of the business and save Google millions of dollars in operating costs. You'll ensure that we receive contract compliance on our third-party agreements, while identifying the most cost-effective solutions for our needs. You'll take lead on special projects, manage vendors and present your recommendations to Google leadership.
As a Strategic Negotiator in the Network Content Distribution group, you will play a pivotal role in driving Internet peering and Google caching programs in close coordination with technical and product teams. You will analyze network traffic data reports to identify where Internet traffic is destined or sourced, negotiate with ISPs, carriers, network operators and mobile providers for interconnect capacity and other programs like content caching, and will work closely with internal and external provisioning teams to ensure that peering connections are upgraded in a timely and effective manner. You have substantial knowledge of both the technical and commercial aspects of global and regional networks, excellent numerical analysis skills, understand how to manage complex technical projects, and have a flair for goal-focused commercial and contractual negotiation, all while maintaining both a smile and a sense of humor throughout. You are able to work successfully across diverse geographies, circumstances, expectations, environments, cultures, paradigms, and technologies. You are highly technical, business-savvy and are interested in helping to build one of the world's largest networks.Responsibilities
Build strategic long-term relationships with Asian ISPs, carriers and operators for effective, efficient and scalable delivery of Google content to users.
Identify, negotiate agreements covering Internet interconnect, peering, colocation, fiber and content distribution services.
Develop numerical analysis techniques to understand large amounts of network performance and traffic data.
Communicate progress internally, and collaborate with a wide variety of internal teams including product and business development, legal, network architecture and deployment.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of telecommunications experience.
Experience with carrier markets within Asia.
Experience with technical, commercial and legal areas of telecommunications and carrier markets.
Preferred qualifications
MBA.
4 years of relevant work experience, including technical and commercial knowledge of operator network topology and architecture, IP routing, and CDN platforms.
Experience working in a senior IP network planning or implementation role at an ISP, telecoms operator, carrier or CDN.
International experience. Strong data-driven analytical and problem solving skills.
Fluency in English and additional languages.
Willing to travel.
title: Strategic Negotiator, Network Content Distribution, APAC Focus

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include IT Field Technician, Corporate Operations Engineer - Tokyo.Technical support for a technology company is a big task. As a Corporate Operations Engineer you are the go-to person for Googlers' computer hardware and software needs, providing front line user support for all of Google's internal tools and technologies. You troubleshoot, respond to inquiries and find solutions to technical challenges. Beyond the day-to-day, you improve the Googler user experience by contributing to longer term projects and documentation efforts. You are highly technical and are comfortable problem solving with multiple operating systems (like OS X, Linux, Windows) and a range of devices (including desktops/laptops, phone systems, video conferencing and various wireless devices). You occasionally partner with various teams including security, networking and infrastructure. You're a fast learner and great communicator who can support the IT needs of global offices of all sizes and Googlers of varying technical backgrounds.You improve the front-line user experience by providing on-demand user support for Google's corporate users, resources, tools and applications while also contributing to longer-term projects.Responsibilities
Troubleshoot and problem solve issues for Google's corporate resources, tools, operating systems and applications both locally and remotely.
Work with service owners and customer teams to plan and implement service and application upgrades and changes.
Develop solutions to operational and user productivity issues via automation or process improvements.
Support IT infrastructure related projects, such as server or network upgrades, and office relocations and expansions.
Travel occasionally to provide IT support in distributed offices.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with scripting or programming languages.
Support experience with various operating systems (Chrome OS, Linux, Mac, Windows, Android).
Expertise in deploying and supporting desktops, laptops, video conferencing, networking and mobile devices.
Ability to adjust quickly to changing priorities and make quick decisions with limited information.
Strong customer service, organizational, prioritization, multitasking, communication and leadership skills.
Fluency in Japanese.
title: IT Field Technician, Corporate Operations Engineer

text:
The Data Center team designs and operates some of the most sophisticated electrical and HVAC systems in the world.
