Facilities Technicians on this team operate, monitor and support all facilities activity at Google's data centers. You take ownership of the operation and maintenance of water pumps and treatment systems, HVAC, UPS, generators, electrical distribution and control and monitoring Systems. You're at the forefront of best-in-class environmental practices. You bring the ideas of our Data Center Engineers to life and develop creative approaches to reducing operational costs while improving efficiencies. You ensure that problems are identified and repaired quickly, that contractors deliver quality services and preventive maintenance, and that safety measures are being performed. In emergency situations or abnormal conditions, you respond to data center performance issues and outages to minimize the recovery time from failures.You help inspect, maintain and repair various data center systems (e.g., piping, cooling, and non-critical electrical system components). You provide daily assistance to senior technicians as you read blueprints/schematics, conduct tours of systems and assess their working order.Responsibilities
Operate, monitor, maintain, and respond to abnormal conditions in facilities systems. Areas include: Electrical, Mechanical, Building Monitoring and Control.
Track and trend operational characteristics.
Minimum qualifications
Associate's degree, trade school certification or other verifiable training in a relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience at journeyman or technician level in a critical environment, or 2 years of experience in mechanical/HVAC, electrical, or a combination of both.
Ability to lift and move 50 lbs of equipment; work on platforms, ladders and under raised floors.
These positions require shift work that includes weekends and holidays.
Preferred qualifications
Data center, hospital or power plant experience.
Mechanical applicants must have or obtain a Universal Refrigerant Handler's certification; electrical applicants must have or obtain licensing if required by the local jurisdiction.
Knowledge of the electrical and mechanical systems used in a data center environment, including: Feeders, Transformers, Generators, Switchgear, UPS systems, ATS/STS units, PDU/PMM units, Chillers, Air handling units and CRAC units.
Ability to communicate intelligently and effectively with contractors who perform maintenance or upgrade work on these systems.
Ability to learn quickly and address issues as they arise during normal working hours or when on-call.
title: Data Center Facilities Technician

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
As an Account Executive, you will grow the OPG business by acquiring publishers on the various Google products including AdSense, Ad Exchange, AdMeld, AdMob, and DoubleClick for Publishers (DFP). You will work in a fast-paced environment and rapidly changing industry landscape across web desktop, tablet, video, and mobile that will call for creativity and thought leadership. You will always be thinking about new ways to grow our network, establish long term relationships and share the magic of our products with our publishers. You will have the unique opportunity to be innovative in your approach, adapting to the market and determining the best way to partner with our publishers (e.g., call, in-person, events, etc.) to help them attain their business goals through our product offerings.Responsibilities
Be a market expert and define the best way to grow our business in the space.
Evangelize the value of our products to online publishers and mobile developers.
Establish and develop valuable new business partnerships for the long term.
Transition customers seamlessly to the appropriate support channel.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
2 years of experience in an advertising sales, business development, and/or online media environment, including 1 year of successful direct selling responsibility.
Track record of exceeding goals and thinking outside the box.
An understanding of the online advertising industry.
Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
title: Account Executive, Online Partnerships Group

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
As a Developer Communication Program Manager, you will lead outreach efforts with other Googlers to communicate Policies and promote user protection. You will craft external communications and represent Google at external events to directly interact with Developers and other 3rd party organizations, and drive large projects across the company.
Responsibilities
Work in global partnership with other Google teams to develop and execute scalable strategies for building awareness about Google’s Developer Policies over multiple channels (documentation, public speaking, online user support tools etc).
Craft written communications, help centers, blog posts and other external collateral advocating and educating on user protection and safety.
Identify or develop effective channels to receive user feedback to analyze in order to make data-driven decisions on direction of your team’s communication efforts.
Maintain functional ownership of key channels for internal and external stakeholder communications, and educate product area and cross-functional partners in appropriate communication channels.
Establish close relationships and initiate joint projects with internal teams regionally (e.g. Policy, Legal, Product) to leverage their platforms in the interests of Developer Education and Communication.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant work experience.
Experience in developer relations, public advocacy, public communications or public relations in relation to technical, scientific or communications policy issues.
Experience in working with qualitative and quantitative research studies and experiments, using data to drive decision making and develop project designs.
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree or PhD.
Relevant industry experience or knowledge of Google's products and services.
Familiarity in one or more of the following areas: coding, databases and querying, network security, front end development and/or statistical analysis.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
title: Developer Communication Program Manager

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Account Manager primarily focused on a single global client, you'll manage relationships with clients, which means you need to be a focused, proactive self-starter and be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Additionally, you're an advisor and consultant, as well as a client advocate within Google. You will be part of the Large Customer Sales (LCS) team.Responsibilities
Take responsibility for the management of clients.
Report on business figures internally and take ownership with the leader of your vertical.
Serve as a liaison with clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities.
Provide campaign updates and ensure that our advertisers are satisfied with their business growth.
Manage ongoing customer training in all AdWords-related tools.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience within account management, sales or marketing.

Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience in managing and optimizing paid search campaigns for large, complex clients, with experience in AdWords and Google Display Network.
Demonstrable media experience in business development, client relationships with the ability to deliver results under pressure.
Experience in communicating new product features/betas actively with clients and assisting in the implementation process.
Knowledge of online ads, especially for search and display ads and campaign performance management.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment.
title: Account Manager, Consumer Packaged Goods Verticals, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
Our Patent team is an invigorating, inspiring team of innovators and attorneys who are passionate about future technologies and excited about resolving their ensuing legal challenges. As a member of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to develop and implement Google's strategy to protect, defend and capture the value of its patents. You dive into varied and interesting tasks that include patent-related protection, licensing, dispute resolution (pre-litigation and litigation), acquisition, deals and policy work. You will work with engineers, product developers, executives and other legal team members, and will be responsible for managing outside counsel.
The Competitive Analysis Team (CAT) is part of Google’s Global Patents Team (GPT) dedicated to providing competitive analysis to facilitate the GPT’s strategic objectives. CAT works closely with each of the Patent Product Areas, and the Transactions and Patent Litigation teams to provide in-depth patent, financial and product analysis for a variety of use cases. CAT is also involved in building processes and tools to enhance GPT’s understanding of our own patent portfolio and the competitive landscape.
As a Competitive Intelligence Analyst, you will develop and implement patent and financial analytics capabilities to anticipate and mitigate patent risk for Google and to facilitate GPT’s strategy to protect, defend and capture the value of its patent portfolio. You will generate patent and business analytics, develop process and tools for competitive analysis, review and analyze internal and external patent assets and assess technical details of products and product developments. You will work with a variety of legal team members throughout GPT, including members of the Patent Product Areas, and the Transactions and Patent Litigation teams as well as with outside counsel and analytics service providers. You'll work with an invigorating, inspiring team of innovators and attorneys who are passionate about future technologies and excited about leveraging world class analytics to accomplish strategic objectives.Responsibilities
Generate and leverage patent and business analytics for different use cases.
Evaluate internal and external patent assets and portfolios.
Develop process and tools for competitive analysis.
Formulate playbooks for patent, financial, and product analysis.
Support Patent Litigation, Transactions and Patent Product Areas with competitive analysis.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of relevant technical and engineering experience in product design and development.
Preferred qualifications
Advanced degree (MS/PhD) in electrical engineering or computer science
Deep familiarity with patent and business analytics, including patent landscapes and financial modeling.
Programming skills in Java or C/C++ and knowledge of UNIX/Linux and scripting skills (Perl, Shell, Python, XML).
Strong interpersonal, leadership and team skills.
Excellent communication skills and ability to explain complex technical concepts and systems in simple terms.
title: Competitive Intelligence Analyst

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
Partnership Operations is the global team that makes sure Google's complex Partnerships organization runs smoothly. Experts in driving operations, operational improvement programs and strategic initiatives, team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of getting things done. They develop business operational programs, launch initiatives and set high-level goals that accelerate growth and improve productivity.
As Head of the Product Partnerships Strategy and Operations team, you ensure that the Partnerships organization focuses on the most impactful activities and operates in the most efficient way. You partner at an executive level to shape and define operational priorities and execution plans for a global Product Partnerships organization. Our organization leads multiple areas of business development, including data and content licensing and product integration agreements enabling a wide range of Google products including Search, Maps, Ads, Play Books, and many others.
You are a leader who brings vision to business operations with a high bias for action. You are grounded in data and draw insight from analysis to develop compelling, synthesized recommendations which you can persuasively communicate at an executive level to lead decision-making. You are a proven leader with sound business judgment, management, problem-solving, communication and analytical skills; and you roll up your sleeves to drive implementation through a team which you manage.Responsibilities
Partner directly with Product Partnerships executives and directors to lead strategic and operational management initiatives across the global Product Partnerships organization.
Identify and lead operational initiatives to optimize the impact and utilization of the business development team (Strategic Partner Development Manager/Strategic Partner Manager). Track impact of team's work as needed and make recommendations.
Build and lead relationships with senior cross-functional team members, including People Operations, Finance, Communications, and Compliance to shape a well-coordinated support strategy and execution plan.
Ensure a high degree of rigor and quality in all projects, and ensure that best-of-breed processes are adopted by Product Partnerships teams globally.
Share and evangelize best practices with other partnerships teams.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience, including 5 years of experience at a leading consulting firm, investment bank or experience as an analyst.

Preferred qualifications
MBA or graduate degree in a management, technical or engineering field.
10 years of relevant work experience in consulting, e.g. software, Internet and/or media industries, and/or early stage companies.
Experience leading complex operational and strategic initiatives across various geographies.
Distinctive problem-solving and analysis skills, combined with impeccable business judgment.
Superior ability to present to executives.
Excellent written/oral communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Head of Strategy and Operations, Product Partnerships and Emerging Business Development

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.With your technical expertise, you build business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution.Responsibilities
Partner with internal Marketing teams to define business requirements and associated system requirements.
Work with engineering teams to develop our Marketing Content Management System web application, integrate with multiple source systems and build/deploy technical solutions.
Manage support for home grown Marketing tools in supporting a wide variety of products and marketing campaigns.
Manage relationship and expectation of internal customers.
Lead systems implementation projects to deliver requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution and drive the testing and quality assurance process.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of work experience including experience managing the full implementation lifecycle for delivery of systems solutions (analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).
Systems background experience in one or more business domains such as Marketing, Legal, Finance or Human Resources.

Preferred qualifications
MBA or engineering graduate degree.
Experience with relational databases, NoSQL databases, JSON, and enterprise coding.
Domain expertise in Marketing or experience with a Marketing Agency or Marketing IT.
Demonstrated ability and strong track record in developing and delivering business systems, technical requirements and process design/optimization.
Demonstrated top quartile performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
Familiarity with content management systems and/or web site production tools and related processes.
title: Business Systems Analyst, Marketing

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Brand Coordinator - Tokyo.Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.Responsibilities
Contribute to internal education initiatives designed to increase knowledge and adoption of Google Brand products, processes and implementation services.
Project manage and implement media campaigns and programs, coordinating between client, Sales, Sales Support and Vendor teams to deliver a campaign and providing excellent customer service to Google's advertisers by proactively identifying and solving client problems.
Provide specialized support to account managers and internal stakeholder teams, acting as the on-shore Large Customer Sales (LCS) point of contact for Brand reservation and auction campaign implementation.
Establish relationships cross-functionally and with peers, Sales Operations and Vendor Managers to identify and pursue growth opportunities and areas for process improvements.
Establish limits that allow for processes to scale appropriately while proactively working to improve efficiency and drive service adoption.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
2 years of experience in digital ad operations, account management, marketing or similar experience in online advertising sales.

Preferred qualifications
Experience with some programming language (e.g. Java, Python, etc) and/or a working knowledge of SQL databases
Proactive and responsible, with the proven ability to work independently and manage competing priorities while paying strict attention to detail.
Strong relationship management skills and experience working in a cross-functional/matrixed environment
Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment
Excellent communication and organizational skills
title: Brand Coordinator

text:
Google for Work helps companies around the world to be more productive, mobile and collaborative by "going Google." Fancy yourself a self-help guru? On the Technical Online Help team, you're just that, helping new Google for Work customers get up to speed with Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome through our online self-help platform. Thanks to you, leading companies, schools and government agencies get Google-caliber customer service on demand. You design, improve and scale the self-help platform, marked by its stellar user experience and clean navigation. Schooled in search optimization techniques, you collaborate with fellow marketing and technical support Googlers to make sure the experience of going Google is powerful and seamless.
Google for Work (the business unit responsible for taking Google’s business and enterprise focused Apps, Geo, Cloud, Devices and Search products to market) is working to transform our own business systems to a 100% cloud model. While we use a variety of cloud applications today, both internal and 3rd party, we are taking our systems to the next level to be fully integrated and play together nice in a seamless, collective system built on Google’s cloud infrastructure.

As a Technology Manager for Applications within the Google for Work Technology and Solutions (GTS) group, you will be responsible for driving the development of applications for our marketing, sales, support, operations and channel partner teams, whether sourced externally or built from conception to launch in close partnership with our creative and prolific engineering team. You will be comfortable both in a rapid prototyping mode, or building for scale and always with a mind toward integrating data, processes and identity across applications. 

You are a leader who listens intently to our customer’s pain points, yet discovers and acts on the true enablement opportunities hidden in those discussions. You understand how to assess an operational process or workflow and target application feature development to support the goals of that workflow, not just mimic an existing process. You can break down complex problems and solutions into tangible incremental steps that drive product development at Google-speed to deliver for our customers: Googlers and Google for Work employees and partners.Responsibilities
Identify the applications and features that will give our internal teams and ecosystem partners an advantage and make them productive in their daily work. Application areas may include partner/channel programs, customer relationship management, order management, marketing and demand management, support organization ticketing and management, business intelligence and analysis.
Craft a product strategy and roadmap. Make the business case for applications or features that support our go-to-market processes and further our technology goal of achieving a scalable, integrated, flexible, 100% cloud infrastructure.
Execute against our product roadmap, and define comprehensive product requirements. Initiate and prioritize projects within our Google for Work Engineering team. Work in partnership with Engineering to make sound technical vs requirements scope tradeoffs, assist in determining the best technical implementation methods and then project manage execution.
Establish the key operational metrics and goals for our applications. Coordinate with relevant teams across Google for Work to ensure that operational requirements are defined and met in addition to the product requirements.
Build and manage relationships with counterparts in Engineering, Sales, Support and Operations; create cross-functional product and project teams optimized for successful product and business execution.

Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a product management, software engineering or similar technical role.
Experience with web technologies and experience with API and systems design.
Experience designing and coding web or mobile cloud applications involving JavaScript, HTML, JSON, AJAX etc. Experience managing the full lifecycle from conception and requirements gathering to development to deployment.

Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Software Engineering, or MBA degree.
Experience in product management, product design, or a role with equivalent responsibilities.
Knowledge of typical internal business client applications: partner/channel programs, customer relationship management, order management, marketing and demand management, support organization ticketing and management, business intelligence and analysis.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Ability to evolve business and product strategy based on research, data and industry .
Significant people and organizational management skills. A natural leader and mentor.
Strong cross-functional project management, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
title: Google for Work Technology Manager, Applications

text:
As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.The Real Estate team handles a variety of issues necessary to support Google’s rapid growth both in the U.S. and internationally. The team works closely with the facilities team to acquire and lease office facilities in strategic locations around the world and to design and develop cutting edge offices which are consistent with Google’s unique culture. You'll work very closely with the Global Infrastructure team to acquire strategic sites around the globe and develop innovative data centers to expand on Google’s robust network infrastructure necessary to support Google’s wide array of products. You will collaborate on a wide variety of cutting edge real estate projects with the Renewable Energy Investment Team, Fiber and Access Team, and groundbreaking projects lead by the Google[x] Team. You will regularly partner with other teams within Legal, Tax and Finance and strive to coordinate forms and best practices with our counterparts around the world. Responsibilities
Acquire, develop and construct office facilities, data centers and fiber networks throughout the world
Negotiate and draft office and co-location leases
Coordinate government entitlements, land use and zoning matters
Negotiate and draft the design, construct and service agreements and related permitting issues
Negotiate and draft development agreements, easements, service agreements, license agreements, management agreements and other documents for the development and operation of office facilities and data centers
Minimum qualifications
BA/BSc/LLB degree or equivalent practical experience.
Qualified solicitor in the United Kingdom and/or Ireland.
Preferred qualifications
Hands-on Real Estate experience analyzing issues, performing due diligence, drafting principle agreements for acquisitions, development projects and leases, and coordinating cross-functional deal teams.Relevant work experience in a top law firm and additional in-house experience.
Hard working, problem-solving, and able to manage numerous projects and teams simultaneously under deadline pressure. Excellent interpersonal skills, sense of humor and team-oriented.
Sound business judgment, clear communication skills and strategic thinking. Flexibility, initiative and willingness to work on a broad variety of legal matters.
title: Corporate Counsel, Real Estate
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
The Inside Sales Organization looks for those next big opportunities that drive growth for Google. You're the human face of how we do business, often working independently, beyond our offices, traveling to trade shows and meeting with prospective customers. You’re a master of Google services, working closely with clients to pinpoint the right mix of products and advertising strategies that suit their needs. You know the industry inside and out, and are always enthusiastic about finding new opportunities to impact the future of our business.
The Acquisitions team drives the acquisition of new advertising clients for Google. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes Google’s new business growth. As a Business Acquisition Manager you provide the highest level of consultation to our advertisers within a specific industry such as Retail, Technology, Finance, Travel, Local, Entertainment and Media. Working with these clients, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. 

With marketing Google’s AdWords, the leading text-based advertising platform in Europe as well as Google Display solutions to medium-to-large size companies you are contributing significantly to increase Google’s book of business of prospective large advertising clients. You will work closely with a dedicated account management team who execute a well thought-out campaign. You will identify potential large advertisers to promote our ad products. You are product- and industry-savvy, and your drive propels you toward new acquisitions. You will gain invaluable experience in this high impact role working in a dynamic international environment.Responsibilities
Prospect new potential advertisers via various strategic initiatives such as cross departmental collaboration with marketing, networking, trade-shows and online research.
Secure new SMB (small-to-medium sized business) AdWords clients by presenting search marketing solutions, and create relevant ad campaigns.
Work within a team that supports a particular sector and educate customers on the opportunities within them.
Develop pitch strategies that optimize the market potential.
Provide the ultimate in client service by giving potential new customers the attention they need and deserve.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and German fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Proven technical ability with customer-relationship management programs (CRM).
Strong communication and persuading skills and the ability to pitch comprehensive advertising solutions over the telephone and face-to-face to prospects.
title: Business Acquisition Manager

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.
You will join the G&A leadership team where you will partner with other functional leaders and peers to develop and drive a world-class recruiting team supporting the People Operations (POps) organization. You will set the talent acquisition strategy for POps globally, engaging key partners within the business and across Google People Services (GPS). 

You need to be an excellent leader with hands-on recruiting experience and will be required to develop strong relationships across the organization, working collaboratively with clients, peers, and central teams. You work closely with the management team to develop recruiting strategies. You prioritize team resources and manage performance metrics to achieve hiring targets and optimize client and candidate experience. You will manage a team Recruiters.Responsibilities
Oversee the management and development of a team of world-class recruiters.
Design and implement highly effective, results-driven recruiting strategies, practices, and infrastructure for current and future, global hiring needs. Develop consultative business partnerships with Executives to maintain a pulse of business and recruiting activities.
Develop and monitor recruiting metrics that improve hiring efficacy and demonstrate ROI including time to fill, time in pipeline. Identify and own strategies to lift productivity.
Identify process improvement areas and solutions, share and encourage best practices, across the wider staffing community.
Work with staffing analysts to track and analyze critical hiring statistics and create reports for Executive, Hiring Manager and Staffing audiences to help understand hiring trends and results for continuous improvement of recruiting strategies and processes.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 year full life-cycle recruiting/sourcing experience, executing talent searches.

Preferred qualifications
Proven ability to develop employees and maximize individual and team performance while maintaining a fun working environment.
Ability to analyze hiring statistics, synthesize results, draw conclusions and convert them into business opportunities.
Ability to drive efforts and projects through influence, relationships, and broad knowledge base.
Strong track record of solving complex problems and delivering significant impact as a leader.
Personal accountability, integrity, credibility and is a role model for others.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; proven ability to take initiative and build strong, productive relationships.
title: Staffing Lead/Manager, General and Administrative People Operations

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
You are a strategic and analytical thinker who can break down problems and drive solutions. In this role, you will work with the Acquisition Marketing team to make sure that all eligible households and businesses can benefit from using the right type of Google Fiber service. You will also have the opportunity to create product offering strategies for Google Fiber, working closely with Product and Sales teams.Responsibilities
Devise a strategy to recommend the right Google Fiber services to eligible households and businesses.
Contribute to building an engine that determines service recommendations.
Draw insights from analyzing market trends and apply the learnings to optimize acquisition performance.
Package analysis for reports and presentations to shape strategic and operational decisions.
Design, test, analyze and optimize innovative marketing campaigns to increase Google Fiber adoption.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Math, Stats, CS, other technical fields or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA/MS or PhD degree.
SQL or programming experience.
Distinctive problem solving and analytical skills, and impeccable business judgment.
Proven track-record of cross-functional collaboration.
Hunger for learning and development, team player.
Excellent written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills.
title: Product Marketing Manager, Acquisitions, Google Fiber

text:
As a Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales professional at Google, you are always reaching for ambitious performance goals. You work with a wide variety of SMB advertisers to deliver the optimal advertising solution for each client. Your interest in sales and the digital economy and your entrepreneurial drive enables SMB advertisers to expand their businesses with Google's latest advertising products and solutions. Your understanding of online media combined with your commercial acumen shape how new and existing businesses grow. Using your effective communication skills, you are the face of Google to a portfolio of clients whose needs you listen to, and help define the vision and strategy for how their products and services can reach thousands or millions of users.
The External Telesales Operations (ETO) team is currently looking for a Vendor Sales Manager to manage part of our outsourced SMB acquisitions business in EMEA. You will be responsible for managing the overall performance of vendors, and continuing our effective relationships with the country management and Marketing teams. You will focus on the acquisitions strategy in the SMB space, supporting local ETO management, vendor management and Marketing in running a successful AdWords Sales team. You will work closely with the central management teams in Dublin and Mountain View.Responsibilities
Drive ETO customer acquisitions to meet and exceed targets.
Implement and maintain a strong business rhythm to support remote management.
Institute a culture of formal communication, transparency, accountability and constructive criticism.
Conduct quarterly analyses, deduce actionable business intelligence and formulate improvement plans.
Coach and develop the vendor management team towards being a self-managed organization.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in team management.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in contract discussions, RFP/RFI, and business reviews.
Ability to conduct market level analyses to identify opportunities, and develop and execute acquisition strategy.
Demonstrated stakeholder management, coaching, mentoring and leadership abilities.
Highly analytical, with a track record of being a strong problem solver, capable of translating analyses and insights into actionable business plans.
Knowledge of sales, sales management, and the online advertising industry.
Fluency in English and Italian
title: Vendor Sales Manager, External Telesales Operations

text:
Google's in-house tax team knows all things corporate tax. Made up of smart, perceptive Googlers with a flair for domestic, international and sales & use tax, the knowledge and expertise of this team runs deep. You have years of experience in this field and an extensive knowledge of those tax issues most relevant to internet companies. While we don't give our Googlers individual tax advice, you make it easy for Googlers to get what they need to make good tax decisions. You find ways to work smarter by streamlining and automating our tax processes and systems, and find ways to be both innovative and compliant.ResponsibilitiesResponsible for the quarterly and annual foreign provisioning process and for provision analysis of Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A), and intellectual property restructuring transactions.Review and consolidate quarterly and annual tax provision packages from foreign subsidiaries, and review and enhance monthly foreign income tax accounts reconciliations and process.Educate regional tax teams and local entity leads on the basic frameworks of ASC 740.Research and analyze provision implications from foreign M&A deals and IP restructuring transactions.Enhance foreign provision process controls and assist with SOX documentation.Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
9 years of relevant experience in a CPA firm or corporate tax department.
6 years of experience in a leadership role responsible for international tax provision.
Experience with ASC 740, accounting for income taxes and experience using OneSource Income Tax software.
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree in Taxation or JD.
CPA.
Experience managing tax staff and external tax consultants.
Demonstrated ability to develop new processes.
Ability to explain complex tax matters.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
title: International Tax Provision Manager

text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.
Google's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. You will have the unique opportunity to create a long-lasting relationship with our top partners. You cultivate these existing partnerships to make sure they can take full advantage of Google's ever-growing suite of offerings. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to see win-win opportunities with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.
You will be responsible for driving awareness about YouTube Next Lab to the creator community in India, ramping up utilization through execution of our learn, connect and create programs. This includes, but is not limited to, working with the team in Tokyo to facilitate education workshops, project managing community events to drive collaboration between creators, and managing video production assets and activities. You will also be responsible for ensuring that all YouTube Next Lab operations adhere to Google business operations standards through liaising with other cross-functional teams such as Facilities and Legal.

You are a self starter with an entrepreneurial spirit, and have a proven track record of managing creative and operations, preferably in the media industry. You will regularly sync up with the central team to ensure alignment on key procedures and goals. An open and collaborative attitude is important with an ability to work effectively with cross-functional YouTube teams including Marketing and Business Development. Familiarity with YouTube and contacts in the Indian online video community will be a great advantage in this role.Responsibilities
Manage and coordinate productions and production programs, education programs and community events in collaboration with the team in Tokyo, and elsewhere globally.
Manage coordination and content production with partners.
Drive awareness and act as a point of contact both internally and externally for the YouTube Next Lab - including primary partner relationship management for our local partner.
Run day-to-day operations in Mumbai including execution of creator-facing contracts, and coordinate the on-site team in charge of bookings and production, along with reporting back on asset utilization and success.
Budget management and tracking.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in video production and media - TV, film, and/or online.
Experience in digital and online video.
Ability to speak and write Hindi and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience producing video and working with small production crews – hands-on experience communicating with or managing talent.
Experience in partner or customer relationship management. Strong project and people management skills.
Studio management experience or exposure.
Creative background such as direction, script writing, and others.
Understanding of the digital and online video industry.
Working knowledge of post production platforms, professional cameras, lighting and sound equipment.
title: Production and Operations Lead, YouTube Next Lab

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
You will be at the core of managing Google's continued growth with the opportunity to make a significant impact. You will be responsible for identifying opportunities and driving the progress of various initiatives that will impact how people access Internet across the globe. You possess a mix of computer and network engineering background along with experience in the telecommunication and mobile industries. You are also equally conformable working with hardware components and design, as well as software development lifecycle.Responsibilities
Work directly with multiple engineering teams (including hardware, software and test), supply chain, and cross-functional stakeholders to manage schedules/deliverables and ensure productivity and progress on multiple concurrent projects.
Engage directly with executives from different projects and partners, communicate well both within Google and outside, and manage project timelines and budgets.
Utilize your expertise in microwave systems to drive system engineering trades and top level design of wireless systems.
Develop and deliver presentations explaining Google's interest and the role of technology in transforming wireless access worldwide, as well as specific solutions that help get there.
Work with product management to ensure design and features roadmap align with overall goals and meet leadership requirements.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Engineering or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
10 years technical project experience with 4 years of experience managing multi-group, multi-disciplinary operational projects from evaluation and design to execution.
Experience with microwave industry standards and related technologies. Experience with point-to-point microwave/millimeter wave systems.
Experience with full hardware product development lifecycle from requirements definition through design through manufacturing through field support.
Preferred qualifications
Deep understanding of wireless technologies and telecommunication industry.
Understanding of how RF components and subsystems are integrated to provide radio systems.
Knowledge of Cellular and LTE industry standards and related technologies.
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies and solutions in the wireless space, and passion for making Internet access a better experience.
Proven ability to work on assignments that require data evaluation, recommendation development, and decision making.
title: Technical Program Manager, Access

Analytical work related experience.
Excellent analytical and communication skill.

text:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to tackle big picture challenges.
The Partner Business Solutions (PBS) team works directly with large, sophisticated partners to develop and harness the value of their online content. Our partners represent publishing, entertainment and commerce companies as well as other emerging verticals. As PBS Finance, we are in a unique and exciting position to shape the digital alignment of marketing and business strategies as our products evolve. 

In this role, you will become an integral member of the wider Partner Business Solutions finance team (Google’s ad monetization business development team) and will act as a business partner to an Americas PBS director and its management team by setting strategy, playing a key role in agreements, and tracking and delivering robust results. 

You are a well-rounded top performer who will be a key contributor in a fast-paced, high-growth environment and have a solid foundation in business analytics and strategy. Ultimately, you’re able to shape the business direction and influence execution by working with senior leaders in Sales and Product. Your outstanding analytical skills, ability to foster relationships, ruthless prioritization, and your clear and concise communication style will earn you a seat at the table. This is a highly influential role which will impact the decision and performance of a team managing a substantial portion of Google’s business growth.Responsibilities
Develop a deep understanding of Google (buy and sell side) and wider industry trends in order to be a thought partner in designing and executing on PBS go-to-market strategy.
Be a core team member for Partnerships agreements at Google, including advising on pricing, structuring and approving contractual terms.
Structure and communicate complex, ambiguous and potentially charged business issues for the PBS management team.
Oversee Google's overall and long-term interests, including making resourcing recommendations to drive productivity gains, designing appropriate incentive structures for sales teams, and tracking spend against budget.
Design and execute on a long-term PBS Finance plan that will align with PBS’s strategy.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Experience at a management consulting firm or in corporate strategy roles.
Experience and comfort with large datasets.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills; comfort and experience with regularly presenting to senior management.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills and impeccable business judgment, with professional distinction in thought leadership and innovation.
title: Senior Financial Analyst, Partner Business Solutions

text:
The Google for Work team works to help organizations everywhere "go Google". The Google for Work Inside Sales team evangelizes Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome, to leading companies, schools and government agencies. As an Enterprise Inside Sales Representative, you reach out proactively to show these customers how the Google for Work Solutions can help them become more productive, mobile and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
We are looking for a dynamic and experienced sales individual excited to work with our prospects and partners to accelerate the growth of Google Apps for Business in Asia, focusing on Indonesia. As an Inside Sales Representative, you handle inbound demand as well as prospect to build pipeline, then manage agreements both directly and in conjunction with our partners. You work closely with our partners to develop their capabilities and identify new high-potential partners. You excel at product pitching, cultivating a strong base of new clients, working cross-functionally both inside and outside the company, and managing agreements in a high velocity, high volume environment.
Responsibilities
Build and manage an effective sales coverage model to introduce Google Apps for Business and other Google offerings throughout SMB (small and medium-sized businesses).
Drive business growth by leading customers through a business cycle with a strong emphasis on new business.
Engage with prospect organizations to position Google solutions through strategic value-based business case definition, analysis, references and analyst data.
Monitor customer feedback and translate customer needs into a better overall product experience.
Increase effectiveness of tools and communication channels by recognizing opportunities for innovation and proactively implementing new systems and processes.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in business (e.g., marketing), information systems or IT disciplines, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of sales experience in an online or cloud business.
Ability to speak and write in English and Bahasa Indonesia fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Proven track record in inside sales with consistent performance above quotas and goals.
Knowledge of the Software-as-a-Service market.
Strong ability to build relationships and deliver in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.
Ability to work independently, prioritize effectively, and balance multiple, disparate work streams.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, possessing ability to maintain control of communication length and direction, and articulate under pressure.
title: Google for Work Inside Sales Representative, Indonesia

text:
Click the “Apply Now” button to submit your resume in English in a PDF format (in your resume, be sure to include your expected graduation month and year, location you are applying for and availability for internship). A cover letter is not required.Applications are due by Monday, July 31, 2015 at 11:59pm PST. Our team will review applications on a rolling basis and reach out to applicants in early 2015 if selected for next steps. We appreciate your patience while we consider your application. In addition, you will participate in a structured program of educational and social activities toensure you have a productive experience at Google that helps you grow both your personal and professional skills.The Business Internship is open to students from all academic disciplines with strong analytical skills to help Google clients and users get the most out of their advertising efforts and our products. With exceptional interpersonal skills, you are strongly interested in client service, project management and communication. You are also a self-starter who brings a determined, solution-oriented attitude. Many intern roles within this programme do not require technical skills and they could include managing advertiser or publisher accounts, developing compelling advertising solutions for brand advertisers, improving access to relevant information for millions of internet users, analyzing large sets of data, or developing scalable support solutions for rapid- growth consumer products.Responsibilities
Job responsibilities and detailed projects will be determined based on your educational background, interest, and skills
Minimum qualifications
Enrolled in a full time Bachelor's/Master's program graduating in 2016 (priority given to students in their penultimate year of study).
Returning to education on a full-time basis upon completing the internship.

Strong analytical skills and ability to tackle highly strategic and challenging business problems
Demonstrate ability to be a self-started and independent thinker
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a challenging environment
Strong interest in the Internet and Google’s technology and business
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Fluency in Asian languages (Mandarin, Taiwanese, Korean, Vietnamese, Thai and/or Bahasa Indonesia).
title: Business Intern 2015

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
As a National Field Operations Manager, you will lead multi-market projects for Google Fiber. You will actively participate in project planning, deployment and operational support to deliver the best customer experience for Google customers. This includes managing project schedules, staff allocation, risk assessment and clear communication with project stakeholders. Projects will span multiple office, time zones and geographic locations.
You will be a professional and driven Field Operations manager on the Google Fiber team. You will have experience in all aspects of project management, budget control, contract administration, vendor and contract management, Request for Proposals (RFP) and contractor selection and related areas. You will quickly adapt and respond to industry changes as well as internal initiatives, and will thrive in an ever-changing, fast-growing technical operations environment. You will be operational savvy and have a ‘get it done’ attitude. You have the ability to make smart, independent decisions and the willingness to manage deliverables across teams/priorities.
Responsibilities
Manage National Field Operations for the Google Fiber infrastructure. Coordinate market and activities and workload through milestone, and objective tracking along with metric reporting and be responsible for helping create, and managing within budget.
Coordinate equipment install and upgrades. Perform new Plant testing, equipment integration, network acceptance and QA to ensure exceptional quality of Google Fiber.
Support new build installation efforts and maximize network uptime and promptly repair network failures due to outages and incidents.
Interface with cross functional teams Sales teams on customer issues and act as primary contact for network service issues by responding quickly to escalated customer complaints/issues.
Promote safety. Be responsible for safety inspections, run safety meetings and safety trainings when necessary with staff.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in aerial and underground network design.
Experience with network engineering and related systems (Outside and Inside Plant). OSP and ISP materials experience.
Ability to work non-standard work hours as needed.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working in a telecommunications or Internet service provider environment.
Strong understanding of OSP and ISP technologies, vendors and the industry. Detailed understanding of communications construction processes (OSP Placing, OSP Splicing, ISP).
Comfort with operating in a fasted-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks, manage time efficiently and navigate ambiguity.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
title: National Field Operations Manager, Google Fiber

text:

The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. Leverage data and relationships from across the organization to develop compelling, insightful recommendations to boost the Staffing Services strategy.

10 years of relevant work experience

text:
The Brand Studio is a passionate team of creative thinkers tasked with shaping the future of Google brands by deepening the love of our users. As part of this team, you work with many kinds of creative thinkers all tasked with ensuring creative excellence across the Google Marketing landscape. Your goal is to deliver one integrated Google brand experience, and to better define the Google Marketing way. By embracing user insights, strategic thinking, and beautiful design paired with provocative execution, you strive to create delightfully intuitive (and delightfully inventive!) experiences that will define the future of our brand.
In particular, we’re seeking a Senior Content Strategist with an understanding of the retail world and technology. In partnership with the Content Strategy Lead, this Senior Content Strategist has strong language and conceptual skills to communicate complex technology and business ideas in ways ordinary people can easily understand. 

The Senior Content Strategist for the Brand Studio will develop product experiences by creating useful, meaningful text that helps users navigate and enjoy Google products and destinations. You’ll work with UX Designers, Copywriters, Product Managers, Engineers, Marketing, and Sales to maintain a consistent, authentic voice across products, driving intentional communication with every word. You’ll use empathy, logical reasoning, and data to strengthen content choices, and you’ll pursue a deep understanding of your products in order to find the right words. You’ll define guidelines and develop tools to help your cross-functional team members make good content choices too. 

You are a content strategist who can thrive in a fast-paced and often unpredictable environment. In this role you'll be working closely with the aforementioned partner teams to guide the effective deployment of the content and tools we have at our disposal to remind the world what they love about Google .Responsibilities
Partner with the Head of Editorial & Content Strategy to deliver thought leadership and work that demonstrates the benefits of the content strategy discipline at Google and within Brand Studio
Define content requirements for projects in partnership with Head of Editorial & Content Strategy, Design, IA, PMO, Retail Marketing, and Product Management/Engineering
Create guidelines and inspire teams to produce best-in-class content
Support broader Brand Studio content strategy projects
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in English, Journalism, Human Computer Interaction or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of online editing, content creation, and/or content strategy experience in an agency or consulting environment.
Experience with editorial processes, such as style guidelines.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working in Agile product development environments; able to adapt quickly and create solutions independently or collaboratively.
Product content writing for e-commerce or technology brand.
Knowledge of defining project schedules, scoping work, and managing stakeholders.
Strong command of the English language; an eye for details, meticulous grammar, and proofreading skills.

text:
Please include URLs for an online portfolio in addition to resume. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered.Design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. The job of an Interaction Designer is to envision how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In an Interaction Designer role, you’ll tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of people around the world—from the first-time user to the sophisticated expert. Achieving this goal requires collaboration with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
Titan’s products, like other Google products, will eventually span the globe and require managers and engineers to keep the big picture in focus. As an Autopilot Developer, you will select and integrate a hard, real time operating system with our custom Flight Control Computer, specify, design, implement and analyze peripheral drivers including EDAC memory, CAN bus, SPI, ADC, and servo PWM signals. You are fluent and have demonstrated experience with SW revision control and defect tracking systems in a very high quality development environment. You will provide data analysis, test to development and software documentation. You have high performance, multi-threaded application development with data integrity and latency considerations. You possess fault detection and remediation experience, and overall code robustness. Our work will be certified to high government standards for availability and reliability.
Responsibilities
Design, code and test embedded software.
Understand and curate a comprehensive configuration control system.
Develop and shrinkwrap a flight telemetry data logging, archival and processing capability.
Provide algorithmic assistance from the Flight Dynamics Team and implement autonomous airborne flight control software.
Minimum qualifications
RTOS and C++ experience.
Real time development experience with small time critical systems.
Device driver and low level peripheral interface programming experience.
In order to access the technical and defense data necessary for this job, applicants must be a U.S. Citizen or currently hold a United States Permanent Resident Card (USCIS Form I-551).
Preferred qualifications
Experience with high performance servomotor control.
Lightweight RTOS experience or authorship.
Attitude Determination or Inertial Navigation System development experience.
History as a contributing member on a flight controls team involving control loops for aerospace vehicles.
title: Autopilot Developer, Titan Aerospace

text:
Design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. In an Interaction Designer role, you’ll tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of people around the world—from the first-time user to the sophisticated expert. text:
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is what you get when you treat operations as if it’s a software problem. Our mission is to progress, protect, and provide for the software and systems behind all of Google’s public services - Search, Ads, Gmail, Android, YouTube, and AppEngine, to name just a few - with an ever-watchful eye on their availability, latency, performance, and capacity. This is an unusual job, unlike others in the industry. Like traditional operations groups, we keep important, revenue-critical systems up and running despite hurricanes, bandwidth outages, and configuration problems. Unlike traditional operations groups, we also have full access to and authority to fix, extend, and scale the code to keep it working and harden it against all the vagaries of the Internet. We hire people from both systems and software backgrounds. Strong candidates will have experience with both. Just as what we do is unique, where we do it is unique too. At Google, we have the good fortune to have developed many interesting systems ranging from planet-spanning databases to near real-time scalable data warehousing to fault-tolerant datastream joining. In SRE, we flip between the fine-grained detail of disk driver I/O scheduling to the big picture of continental-level service capacity, across a range of systems and a user population measured in billions. We own those products in production. We drive reliability and performance across massive scale by mastering the full depth of the stack. We literally do learn something new every day - usually surprising things - that have the potential to transform the lives of billions of our users around the world.
As a Software Engineer on the SRE team, you will have the opportunity to tackle the complex problems of scale which are unique to Google while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large-scale system design.
Opening date: April 2nd 2015
Closing date: May 4th 2015
Competitive Salary AppliesResponsibilities
Design, write and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Google's services.
Solve problems relating to mission critical services and build automation to prevent problem recurrence; with the goal of automating response to all non-exceptional service conditions.
Influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale distributed systems.
Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning.
Conduct periodic on call duties using a follow-the-sun model.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more of: C, C++, Java, Python, Go.
Experience with algorithms, data structures, analysis and software design.
Preferred qualifications
Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
Familiarity with running web services at scale; understanding of Unix systems internals and networking.
Understanding of Unix/Linux systems from kernel to shell and beyond, taking in system libraries, file systems, and client-server protocols along the way.
Networking: knowledge and understanding of network theory, such as different protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, etc), MAC addresses, IP packets, DNS, OSI layers, and load balancing).
Systematic problem solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.
title: Software Engineer, Site Reliability Engineering
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
This position will be based in Salt Lake City, UT.

You proactively review existing and new contracts, permits, terms and obligations. You coordinate with Facilities, Outside Plant (OSP), Network Operations (NetOps), and Finance to ensure successful project completion. In addition, you will be required to ensure quality control is maintained on all the builds. Your diligence ensures all users and partners have uninterrupted operations and 100% satisfaction.
Responsibilities
Manage construction for the last mile deployment of Google Fiber’s MDU, Small and Medium Businesses (SMB), and Community Connection construction across the market/metro area.
Manage project budgets, installation schedules, production and contractor resource assignment and track contractor performance including billing against budget and contract. Support progress reporting, invoice approval, and material handling with the contractors, prioritize and multitask projects and see them through to completion, as individual and team contributor.
Handle daily updates and feedback required for troubleshooting and internal ticketing system. Report field production and other key metrics on daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Work with and communicate progress to internal stakeholders and ensure that projects are scoped properly and handed off seamlessly for network deployment. Work closely with cross-functional teams including Google Fiber OSP/NetOps/Sales/Business/Customer Service in coordinating all project activities, resource requirements and business goals.
Establish and coordinate quality control requirements for Fiber to the Home (FTTH) build. Evaluate vendor performance and manage escalation processes for construction and maintenance incidents.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in Project/Program Management role specific to FTTH construction (OSP/ISP).
Preferred qualifications
Experience interpreting fiber test results and auditing projects for compliance with scopes of work. A deep understanding of inside and outside plant fiber optic network infrastructure, engineering design and construction.
Experience in managing contractors and field technicians.
Knowledge/experience with project management tools.
Knowledge/experience with Web Applications.
Knowledge of telecommunications and related standards and regulations - an industry insider.
Strong interpersonal, analytical and communication skills. Flexible and able to think quickly.

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.
Google Life Sciences is recruiting engineers to support the development of novel disease diagnostic technologies and biomarker discovery projects such as the Baseline study.Responsibilities
Conceptualize, design, build and test new hardware and products in a fast-paced product development team taking projects and entire products through every phase from initial concept to production.
Have a passion for design and work closely with Industrial Design during all phases of product development to make the vision a reality.
Communicate ideas and design specifications through breadboards, prototypes, sketches, slides, 2D drawings and written documentation.
Work cross-functionally to help define system architecture for new projects and products. Participate in cross-functional system integration support to ensure team success, timely and cost-effective delivery.
Work closely with external resources and suppliers to drive on-time delivery of components and devices.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Mechatronics, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant industry experience.
Coding experience (e.g. C/ C++, Python, MATLAB).
Experience designing control systems, the use of microcontrollers to achieve closed-loop control, and hardware prototyping.

Preferred qualifications
MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering or related field.
Experience in Digital Signal Processing.
Experience with medical devices.
Experience with actuators (various technologies).
Demonstrated project leadership and mentoring skills.

text:

text:

As a Creative Engineer, you will be responsible for the creation of high quality, world class web content for desktop and mobile devices. You will engineer front end components that will present information in new, innovative, and creative ways. Your work will require a focus on compatibility, accessibility, and internationalization.
Your components should be modular, reusable, and well documented to the benefit of the greater team. You will experiment with emerging technologies and discuss their merits with fellow team members.
Responsibilities

Strong consistency and attention to detail.

Excellent leadership, communication, project management, and organizational skills.

text:
