text:
We are accepting applications for our July and September programs. The deadline to apply is July 6, 2015 at 11:59pm (Pacific Time). Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our search engine and tools serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services. Google is invested in increasing the pipeline of computer scientists and software developers, particularly those who are historically underrepresented in the field. Many aspiring computer scientists could benefit from a program that bridges the gap between academia and industry.

The Google Engineering Residency Program is a 1-year program open to all qualified graduates who received a degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering within the last year (or who will receive a degree by the summer of 2015). It combines CS education with hands-on software engineering experience in a supported, closely mentored cohort. In addition to an intensive industry-focused curriculum, the Engineering Residency Program provides residents with a strong foundation in CS (as it applies to real engineering problems) and experience working on complex programming projects with Google engineers.

The Engineering Residency Program is open to all qualified college graduates and is committed to addressing diversity in our company and in the technology industry. Those who are members of historically underrepresented groups in the technology industry are specifically encouraged to apply.Responsibilities
Participate in a one year residency program combining industry-focused Computer Science education and practical software engineering experience.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Eligible to work in the United States.
Preferred qualifications
Expertise in data structures, algorithms and complexity analysis.
Experience programming in C, C++, Java and/or Python.
Strong work ethic and a willingness to learn.
title: Engineering Resident, University Graduate

Strategic thinking skills, innovative and proven ability to execute.

Excellent stakeholder management, organization and interpersonal skills.

text:

text:
As a Store Operations Vendor Manager, you will be responsible for process development, as well as scaling and performance management of gTech support teams in close partnership with one or more outsourced vendors and various internal operations teams. In this role, you will have accountability for the performance of one or more outsourced vendor operations. You will be responsible for new process implementation, auditing vendor implementation of training, performance management of the vendor and day-to-day vendor workflow oversight. You will also be expected to contribute to the long-term operational strategy and support model, outsourcing decisions, contract negotiations, vendor selection and continuous improvements of business processes.
Responsibilities
Manage vendor operations in North America, ensuring we set the bar for high scale, quality, efficiency and policy enforcement of our vendor functions globally; ensure we are are meeting a high standard for delivery of service, manage overall relationship with the vendor workforce, monitor cost, quality, and delivery of service. Lead regular business reviews, vendor relationship management activities, workforce planning, and budgeting activities in coordination with internal teams.
Develop scalable solutions and ensure operational execution by partnering with operations leaders as well as vendors directly, and collaborate with various internal groups to understand business requirements, implement new processes, and contribute to ongoing process improvements. Work as part of a broader operations management team to develop the team’s strategy, process improvement, people development and technology implementation.
Manage the overall performance of a vendor workforce in terms of cost, quality and delivery of service, ensure seamless process execution and that all aspects of vendor Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are consistently met. Drive improvements in all relevant metrics, e.g., costs, turnaround time, quality, productivity. Manage, coach and mentor Googlers across the broader operations team.
Monitor daily performance, collect and analyze data in order to recognize process inefficiencies and potential problem areas. Review vendor data, identify process improvement opportunities and drive improvement of vendor performance (SLA compliance, Monthly Business Reviews (MBRs), Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)). Help create a vendor ‘Incubation’ playbook (containing process documentation, QA frameworks, sample reports, governance structure, Best Current Practices (BCP), process improvement methodologies, etc.).

Understanding and passion for retail products/services.
Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced team environment with excellent analytical, communication and interpersonal skills.

text:

Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.
As the Channels Manager/Site Lead, you will lead the Channels Hub in India and work closely with functional staffing teams around the world to implement proactive talent research, passive candidate identification, and candidate data management efforts. In this role, you are simultaneously a site leader, project manager and systems thinker. You are responsible for leading a team to establish processes to prioritize team resources, managing performance metrics to deliverable measurable output.Responsibilities
Devise and execute strategies to generate and maintain a database of high volume, high quality leads and candidate data.
Provide day-to-day team member oversight, inclusive of anticipating resource demands and balancing workload accordingly, as well as ensuring that quality standards are achieved.
Establish and ensure that project plans are in place, followed and progressing in line with delivery dates.
Manage and influence complex partner relationships around the world (regional Channels teams, cross-functional teams, etc.).
Communicate all critical elements of the Channels Hub to stakeholders, including status/progress/gaps to Channels leadership, while effectively solving problems with them.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant experience in managing offshore operations for global companies.

Strong track record of solving complex problems, strategic thinking and delivering significant impact as a leader.
Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate a large workforce, comprised of a mix of employee and contingent workers.
Proven ability to take initiative and build strong, productive relationships. Ability to drive efforts and projects through influence, relationships, and broad knowledge base.
Personal accountability, integrity and credibility, and a role model for others.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Channels Manager/Site Lead

text:
As a Google for Work Technical Account Manager, you are responsible for providing technical solutions and managing relationships with customers who have chosen to "go Google". As masters of cloud computing, the Google for Work team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter through Google Apps. You will liaise between clients and our technical staff, flawlessly lead deployments, implementations and integrations of custom security and features across the Google Apps suite. From monitoring product performance to debugging and troubleshooting product code, you are the resident expert that addresses partner needs. You are a technical expert with an entrepreneurial drive and passion for client management.
You are the critical link between Sales, Product, partners and customers. You are a well-rounded individual who can work on the big picture as well as roll-up your sleeves to implement solutions and resolve technical challenges. 

You will be responsible for overseeing the technical integration, platform adoption and optimization of critical projects from start to finish. You will work closely with a cross-functional team to ensure rapid and accurate resolution of technical challenges. You will drive new business opportunities for the Google Cloud Platform, including Google App Engine, Google Compute Engine, Big Query, Google Cloud Storage and more.

You will use your project and product management skills and apply your software engineering expertise to lead the timely execution of adopting the Google Cloud Platform solutions to the customer’s requirements. You are an active expert and leader in the Cloud, and you strongly believe that you can help any industry build its next generation business software in the Cloud.
Responsibilities
Establish roadmap and key project milestones for concurrent engagements, advocate internally for product features and sales direction and proactively identify technical dependencies and roadblocks to mitigate risks and to ensure successful execution of projects.
Recommend cloud solutions by using your technical breadth across multiple areas, and manage strategic alliances among Google and partners/customers to promote adoption and interoperability of their existing applications and infrastructure solutions to Google Cloud Platform.
Deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles and technical project presentations, adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders while also driving partner advisory board initiatives.
Identify new product features and feature gaps, provide guidance on existing product issues and collaborate with Solutions Architects in solution creation to influence the growth of Google Cloud Platform.
Drive towards the creation, delivery and operation of innovative business solutions in the Cloud by leveraging technical expertise and business acumen.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or Math or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience managing technical projects.

Preferred qualifications
Experience in responding to Request For Proposals and authoring papers for publication with hands-on experience in building multi-tier high availability applications with modern web technologies.
Highly skilled in interacting with sales/partner led business and technical stakeholders and independently translating complex customer requirements into appropriate solution architectures.
Knowledge of Cloud infrastructure technology and of requirements, developments and best practices across various industries with superb hands-on technical analysis and troubleshooting skills, ranging from application debugging to system performance optimization to cloud infrastructure design.
A team player and flexible self-starter with a strong can-do attitude and the ability to anticipate the unexpected in order to succeed in unpredictable situations and resolve complex issues.
Strong presentation, public speaking, business analytics and negotiation skills in influencing internal and external stakeholders at all levels as well as excellent written and oral business communication skills.
Exemplary communicator in English and Hebrew.
title: Cloud Platform Technical Account Manager
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.Responsibilities

Manage agreements that comply with company policies and risk tolerance.
Respond promptly to legal requests from Licensing, Business Development, Advertising Sales, Marketing and other clients, summarizing and communicating legal concepts that business people can use.
Advise business clients, as well as Finance and other company colleagues, on the legal issues and risks, approval processes, company policies and procedures, IP and business strategy.
Support the continuous improvement of standard form agreements and legal processes.

JD degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in business development, intellectual property matters and contract law.
Active and in good standing in one State Bar in the United States.

Direct knowledge and experience in multiple aspects of hardware operations.
Extensive background in drafting services agreements, sales contracts, licenses and intellectual property agreements.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage several simultaneous projects under deadline pressure.
Superior English communication skills, both verbally and in writing.

text:

text:
The gTech Ads team is a solution-generating force that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. In addition to troubleshooting on the customer side, we work with Sales, Product and Engineering teams within Google to develop better tools and services to improve our products based on the evolving needs of our users. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.
The Global Support team within gTech Ads plays a critical role in Google's success. It provides high quality support to our Sales teams and advertisers, resolving issues across Google Ads products (technical, billing, policy, implementation, etc) quickly and efficiently.

As a Manager in Global Support, you will lead a team providing outstanding support to Sales teams and advertisers. You will play a critical role in making customer care a competitive advantage for Google. This will involve developing efficient workflows, identifying opportunities for seamless support between teams and designing new services that will provide faster and better support to Sales teams and advertisers. You have a passion for delivering excellent customer service and a drive for continuous improvement. You have exceptional leadership, influencing and change management skills. You are ready to work side-by-side with your team, to motivate and mentor team members, and to drive alignment across different functions and regions.
Responsibilities
Inspire, grow and develop talent while providing vision and setting direction for the team. Lead effectively through ambiguity.
Partner with Sales, Sales Operations and other gTech Ads teams to drive continuous innovation and launch new services in a very dynamic environment.
Provide strategic insights and lead continuous improvement efforts in customer service and operations.
Drive business results by tracking key operational metrics, identifying process improvement opportunities and delivering flawlessly on strategic initiatives.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of experience building teams, hiring and developing people. Experience leading people through change.
Strategy and/or operations consulting experience at a leading management consulting firm or corporate strategy organization.
Impeccable business judgment with the ability to problem-solve multiple dimensions of complex, business issues while maintaining ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage across multiple, often time-sensitive initiatives, delivering flawlessly.
Ad technology or operations expertise, specifically with ad serving, online advertising, video and mobile ad technologies.
Impeccable analytical, written/verbal communication, and interpersonal skills.

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Field Operations Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You have strong interpersonal, analytical and communication skills. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
Responsibilities
Lead and manage build teams to excel in the last mile deployment of Google Fiber’s Multi-family Dwelling Unit (MDU), Small and Medium Businesses (SMB), and Community Connection construction across the market/metro area.
Manage program goals, scope, schedules, budget, contracts and vendor resources to ensure timelines and production costs are aligned across multiple markets. Implement and manage QA/QC, risk register and action items. Report production and quality metrics with informative analysis on daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Establish scalable tools and processes across markets that monitor contractor performance including quality control, appropriate forecasting of building resources, billing against budget, and contract. Work with and communicate progress to internal stakeholders and ensure that projects are scoped properly and handed off seamlessly for network deployment.
Work closely with cross-functional teams including Google Fiber Outside Plant/Network Operations/Sales/Business/Customer Service in coordinating all project activities, resource requirements and business goals. Work with product suppliers and the Google Fiber supply chain to ensure material quantities are met and ensure everything meets Google Fiber design specifications.
Prioritize and multitask projects and see them through to completion, as individual and team contributor. Set team goals and foster innovative and creative work environment.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of contract and program management experience in the telecommunications or infrastructure industry.
5 years of experience building teams and managing direct reports.

Preferred qualifications

PMP or PgMP certification.
Experience in scaling processes for new business/start-up.
Knowledge/experience with project management tools such Primavera P6.
Knowledge of FTTH technology and industry.

text:
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a Sales manager, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.Responsibilities
Be accountable for the Acceleration "portfolio growth" (investment, product adoption, campaign sophistication).
Serve as a liaison with clients and agencies regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities.
Provide campaign updates and ensure that our advertisers are satisfied.
Develop forward thinking, data-driven sales analysis and recommendations that align with client goals and quantify high-impact opportunities with clear recommendations to pitch to clients.
Report on sales figures internally and take ownership with the leader of your verticals.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in media account management and/or the advertising industry.
Ability to speak and write in English and Spanish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Strong project management experience and skills.
Proven track record in advertising sales and media account management,
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Excellent business sense, problem solving, and analytical skills.
Excellent organizational and influencing skills.

text:

As a Technical Solutions Engineer, you're helping the globe "go Google" by working with leading companies, schools and government agencies to ease their transition to Google tools. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Google for Work business and bringing our product portfolio into companies both big and small around the world.Responsibilities
Diagnose and resolve complex customer problems for the Google Apps product suite in a third tier engineering-level support function as part of a global team.
Obtain and maintain an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology, architecture and implementation, building and transfering knowledge to Google’s Tier 1 and 2 support groups.
Guide and perform design and implementation of new support, productivity and investigation tools to increase efficiency for the technical support process.
Act as a consultant and knowledge base for Product Managers, Sales Engineers, Technical Account Managers and Deployment Specialists, resolving technical deployment obstacles, improving the product's vision, and making Google customers successful.
Work closely with multiple Google Apps Product Management and Software Engineering teams on understanding ways to improve the product, and interact with QA teams to drive exceptional testing quality.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of industry experience in technical support, professional services, engineering, sustaining engineering, or systems engineering.
Preferred qualifications
Hands-on experience implementing, troubleshooting, and supporting Internet-based applications, web servers, mail servers (e.g. Lotus, Sendmail or Postfix) and Linux/Unix operating systems.
Experience with identity management or directory services with strong network administration and troubleshooting skills, an understanding of Linux/Unix system administration and a strong understanding of Web and Mail-related standards, such as HTTP, HTML, XML, cookie-based SSO and SMTP.
Experience with managing hosted services and SaaS with a familiarity of programming/scripting (i.e. Java, C, C++, .NET, Python, shell, Perl, JavaScript, etc.).

text:
The Finance Operations team manages Google's cash transactions on a global basis and ensures that Google's incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to manage our complex set of transactions. You thrive on making processes more efficient and scalable, you work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations and you proactively minimize operational risk. Externally, you collaborate with our outsourcing partners and internally, you collaborate across the five areas of the Financial Operations team: Global Revenue Operations, Procure to Pay, Electronic Payment Services, Business Process Outsourcing, and Payroll.
Our mission is to design and implement global, scalable and compliant procurement and payments operations at scale. You are a creative problem solver who is focused on creating great Googler experiences while proactively mitigating risk by finding innovative, automated solutions to improve the scalability around these complex set of processes and systems. You will work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations globally by setting the vision and partnering with key stakeholders in Engineering, Facilities, Finance, and Legal as well as collaborating externally with our outsourcing partners and banking institutions.Project and Process Managers in our group are versatile, nontraditional thinkers who are able to adapt to quickly changing priorities. If you thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with exciting challenges every day, this is the place for you.
Responsibilities
Drive end-to-end process design and new system implementation, collaborating with Product, Engineering, Finance and Operations teams.
Design reporting and perform analyses to drive effective process improvement, eliminate mistakes and provide quick fixes.
Oversee and drive global processes and projects.
Manage outsourced vendors and processes, ensuring that operations targets are met and identifying opportunities for growth and improvement.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA, Master's or other advanced degree.
Experience managing, running, and optimizing BPO operations.
Passion for analyzing large data sets (strong spreadsheet skills), formulating recommendations and communicating them clearly.
Ability to autonomously drive and prioritize multiple initiatives.
Success working in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment and leading complex operations initiatives.

text:
The ZOO is an agency-like team within the Global Google Sales organization. Here we help brands maximize the creative power of Google’s platforms and technologies. The ZOO is home to all types: From creative experts and strategists, to technologists, account directors and producers, we do it all. Working side by side with Sales and Marketing teams, we help our colleagues inspire, consult and educate their clients. And with our concentrated collection of artistic and technological kills, we help top brands around the world push the boundaries of Google technology. As part of a team of Creative Technologists, you will generate a forward thinking tech-based vision for the ZOO. You'll regularly be called on to deploy your creative and technical skills on huge projects for top advertisers. In some cases you’ll be refining existing ideas or prototypes for key pitches. In other instances, you’ll have the opportunity to dream and develop cutting-edge creative technology concepts that redefine interactive storytelling. Want to tell brand stories in a whole new way? Come check out the ZOO.
The ZOO team helps Europe’s largest advertisers exploit the full creative potential of Google and YouTube. In-depth platform knowledge enables us to consult with advertisers and their agencies on every aspect of the creative process from brand planning through proposition creation and technical prototyping to campaign implementation. The ZOO works highly collaboratively with Google Sales teams across EMEA, transforms advertising business opportunities. We're passionate about the ways in which the science of Google combines with the art of advertising to help the region’s largest advertisers make the most of the opportunities provided by the web.

You possess a thorough understanding of digital and brand communication as well as industry best practices. Your portfolio must show a highly creative and well-executed, ideally show award winning - FWA, DA&D, Cannes Young Lions, Eurobest and One Show. 

You have a recognized standing in your professional field through a portfolio of original and effective campaigns. You will also be able to show mastery of existing and emerging technologies, processes, and practices.

You will have and gain continuous knowledge of all new product innovations at Google in order to drive leading edge creative innovation in their application. You will have outstanding pitching and communication skills, with the ability to describe potentially complex creative solutions with clear, straightforward and inspirational language.
Responsibilities
Work alongside ZOO Brand Planning and Creative Account Management teams to conceive and present brand-specific creative ideas that inspire senior clients.
Accelerate understanding among senior brand managers of what digital technology can do for their brands in the new media landscape and to give them the confidence to make step changes to the way they currently plan and execute their campaigns.
Produce innovative advertising concepts and implement these effectively in real market conditions.
Work within The ZOO to help make sure all internal communications and processes support the overall quality of the creative output, collaborating with the other ZOO teams in Europe and elsewhere.
Help maintain and develop a culture which encourages imaginative new ideas and best practice delivery of ideas that exploit Google platforms.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as a Senior Creative/Creative Director in an creative agency environment.
Ability to speak and write in English and French fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working in a small, diverse high-performing creative and creative technology team, as well as with senior clients (CMO level) of the world's leading branding companies.
Strong experience with luxury brands and demanding clients.
Demonstrate advanced knowledge of brand strategy and digital brand communications through the completion of major and complex projects. Demonstrate knowledge of UX.
title: Creative, The ZOO SEEMEA

text:
The gTech Ads team is a solution-generating force that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. In addition to troubleshooting on the customer side, we work with Sales, Product and Engineering teams within Google to develop better tools and services to improve our products based on the evolving needs of our users. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.
The Global Support team in gTech Ads plays a critical role in Google's success, supporting sales teams, advertisers and products that enhance business potential by consistently providing scalable product solutions, reliable information based on efficient, consultative analysis, accurate implementations and timely communications.
