text:
As a User Experience (UX) leader, you help define and drive the future of Google design. You identify and set product strategy, envision complex UX ecosystems and inspire teams to push the boundaries of what’s possible. You possess a clear vision of the future of user experience and have the courage to pursue forward-thinking design.In this role, you will apply your passion for brand, craft, and design fidelity to guide research and design processes, mentor talented members of your team, and collaborate with leaders of other UX and Engineering teams to create innovative experiences across all of Google’s products.
The User Experience Manager for Google’s Display Ads products will bring vision and unrelenting determination to reshape Google’s approach to display advertising. In this role, you will lead and grow a strong, cross-disciplinary team of designers, researchers, and prototypers across multiple product lines and geographies. You will evangelize and champion an exceptional experience for advertisers, and inspire your team to innovate and invent by taking smart risks, learning quickly, and optimizing accordingly. You will articulate a UX vision and drive consensus with engineering and product leadership – establishing and advocating for user research, design, and product development processes that result in game-changing experiences. You will develop talent and mentor individual contributors, design and research leads, and managers. You will guide research and design processes and methodologies. You will collaborate with other UX leaders and managers to drive best practices and UX consistency across Google’s Advertising and Commerce products.Responsibilities
Oversee all phases of UX work: research, conceptual design, prototyping, detailed design, usability testing, and implementation.
Attract, mentor, and retain great designers, researchers, and prototypers.
Partner with Product Management and Engineering to align UX vision and activities with Google’s business goals.
Improve research, design, and development processes continually to gain efficiency, remove obstacles and simplify problems.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a UX-related field (human-computer interaction, human factors, behavioral research, or graphic design) or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience as a designer or user researcher working on web or desktop applications.
4 years of experience managing a UX team.
Experience with design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Flash, Fireworks, Illustrator, Photoshop, Acrobat, Visio, Axure, Balsamiq and FileMaker.

Preferred qualifications
Experience designing for multiple device types and contexts (desktop, tablet, smartphone).
UX-related experience in advertising.
Proven leadership in communicating research, conceptual ideas, and design rationale – all within a user-centered design process.
title: UX Manager, Display Ads Products

text:
Google accountants are a savvy bunch who handle the core accounting responsibilities at Google. As a member of this team, you know your accounting principles and the full accounting process end to end. You'll advise on financial reports required by governmental regulations, and you'll review, analyze, and interpret financial and budgetary reports -- and all this sounds like fun to you. Every day is a new challenge, and you're continually looking for ways to help our team get better at what we do, in the most efficient way possible. A team player at heart, you collaborate with our global team, evangelize best practices and roll up your sleeves to pitch in when it's all hands on deck. You move fast while keeping your attention to detail, and you tap into your problem-solving skills to support Google's business objectives.
Consisting of experienced, creative, driven and savvy high performers, our team manages financial risk in Google’s emerging products. We have a preference for those who like to work and play hard, and are enthused to work on collaborative global teams while performing a broad array of financial risk management activities.

Business controllers provide financial risk management support across several of Google’s key business and product initiatives. Example risk areas include pre-launch readiness, post-launch go-to-market and international expansion of new products, acquisitions and sales strategies. 

You are a well-rounded top performer with strong leadership skills, broad financial expertise and the ability to influence across Google.Responsibilities
Partner with Product teams to understand industry, product, and business related trends that pose potential financial risk to Google.
Identify process, systems and resource gaps that jeopardize compliance or product success.
Articulate risks to Product and Finance management teams. Propose solution and secure management buy-in to resolve process, systems and people gaps. Escalate as necessary.
Ensure risk assessment and control frameworks are in place, running effectively and efficiently.
Identify cross-PA portfolio risk. Implement Finance-wide frameworks to monitor and mitigate risk.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of work experience in the telecom, consumer electronics, software or internet services industries.
Preferred qualifications
CPA with accounting firm experience. MBA degree.
Strong working knowledge of U.S. GAAP.
Demonstrated job stability with increasing levels of responsibility and a track record of successfully managing cross-functional initiatives.
Proven ability to work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment and to lead and drive complex operational initiatives.
Superior analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate effectively with senior management.
Collaborative working style and ability to work with vendors and international teams.
title: Business Controller, Consumer Hardware

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, Street View to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. Google products are the lifeblood of who we are. The Google Wireless team works closely with our product team and engineers to guide products from conception to launch, and with our business partners to generate profitable streams.
The Google Wireless team is looking for a talented engineering professional who can lead and be a key in-region focal point of business and technical contact between the Original Device Manufacturers (ODMs)/Partners and the teams at Google.
You will involved in all aspects of product development starting with concept, prototypes, tooling, quality, test, manufacturing, logistics. This includes establishing business and technical relationships with ODMs and overseeing engineering qualifications, new production introduction, production readiness, and product quality. You have a basis for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.
Responsibilities
Provide on-site product development support at key ODMs and Google partners for new and sustaining product design concepts, design quals, prototype builds, quality and process improvements. Support Design for Manufacturability (DFM), tooling bring up, approve first articles, cycle time/process improvements, quality audits. Create, approve work instructions and assembly guides as needed.
Provide comprehensive business and technical support to Google's global manufacturing partners during development and production builds. Assist and oversee implementation of IQC, OQC, Quality Control Plans, PFMEA, Audits.
Resolve product development, manufacturing and field challenges by applying knowledge and skills, escalating design, manufacturing, and product test issues to others within the organization when appropriate.
Identify, initiate, and drive design and process improvements that to optimize cost and yields and eliminate pain points while maintaining exceptional quality.
Support central quality engineering for auditing suppliers, provide on-site support for RMA issues, enabling the production ramps at suppliers per Google standards.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of electronics product development experience.
Preferred qualifications
Proven experience in launching high volume and complex projects within schedule, cost and quality constraints; experienced in leading projects with Original Equipment Manufacturers, Contract Manufacturer, ODM, JDM; supplier selection and qualification (wireless products).
Practical design, development or manufacturing experience in electronics industry.
Proven experience in leading product development, New Product Introduction, supplier development, quality and FATP activities. Expertise in Design for X, Development Verification Testing, Bill of Materials Management.
Strong understanding of product development processes (concept to EOL); proven experience in design and process optimizations.
Proven experience developing solid, effective technical relationships with contract manufacturers, OEMs, ODMs; proven experience in implementing and maintaining product reliability and quality procedures.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in both English and Mandarin. Travel as needed both domestic/internationally (30%).
title: Technical Program Manager, Access, Asia

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
The Product Marketing Manager for Large Advertiser and Agency Marketing (LAAM) is at the forefront of a revolution in Marketing -- a shift from traditional Marketing tactics to new online, mobile and social strategies. Google's advertising platforms provide savvy advertisers with multichannel marketing opportunities, linking online marketing to brand impact and offline sales. The LAAM Manager shapes Google's point of view on the changing advertising landscape and supports Google's growth through effective and results-focused marketing campaigns.
You will drive marketing strategy, planning and campaign execution to support the sales teams in driving advertising business from large advertisers and agencies. This will involve finding innovative ways to engage decision makers, educate the users of our products, promote Google's business brand and equip our Sales teams with the information and tools they need to work more effectively. You will arm the Google salesforce with marketing programs that establish fresh thinking in the industry and deepen engagement with clients. This is a cross-functional role, involving close work with PR and Sales, as well as collaborating with other Marketing teams across Google’s global offices.Responsibilities
Ideate, develop, and execute marketing initiatives that drive Google's business.
Identify and build innovative marketing strategies and plans to drive large advertiser and agency education, engagement and product adoption.
Develop thought-leadership materials, client and executive presentations, case studies and other content designed to accelerate our business momentum and strengthen engagement with Google's partners.
Advocate Google's message, best practices and perspectives to our customers and our industry peers via events, and other client communications channels.
Lead development of large advertiser and agency value propositions, working closely with Sales and various key cross-functional teams.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in Chinese and English fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
5 years of consumer or business marketing experience (e.g. digital marketing) or related work experience from technology, media or consulting.
Demonstrated capacity for developing marketing strategies in a client-facing environment; expertise supporting and enabling a sales organization.
Ability to flawlessly execute large and complex events, and effectively operate in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a dynamic and constantly evolving context. Structured and proactive, eye for constant innovation and improvement.
Demonstrated leadership and a profound willingness to collaborate internally and externally.
Outstanding presentation and communication skills, with creative flair to bring fresh ideas into product positioning and marketing campaigns. Comfortable presenting to audiences of senior decision makers.
title: Product Marketing Manager, Large Advertiser and Agency Marketing (LAAM), China

text:
Google's products are known for their clean design, ensuring users can quickly and easily find what they're looking for. As an Engineering Designer, you leverage your strong technical background and understanding of "good" design to look for ways to streamline the user experience. You work closely with the product managers and development engineers throughout the entire production cycle. You design everything from high-level product flow to detailed UI mockups and then use your expert scripting skills to make your designs a reality.
Google's products are known for merging cutting edge technologies with clean design and autonomous vehicles are an example of this. As an Industrial Designer, you will merge the technical issues associated with complex engineering with the simplicity and elegance of good Industrial Design.Responsibilities
Plan, recommend, and complete design processes leading to innovative solutions.
Work with the cross-disciplinary team to meet the requirement of design goals. Generate ideas and concepts through strong visual/verbal communication skills.
Develop physical design language based on Google’s brand principles.
Participate in producing looks-like and works-like prototypes of the concepts. Participate in transitioning the designs to manufacturing.
Lead ideation as well as proper implementation of ideas. Define all design details based on design directions and execution plan.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Industrial Design or similar field, or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of product and/or transportation design experience covering ideation, product development, and manufacturing from concepts through product launch.
Preferred qualifications
10 years of product and transportation design and development experience. Experience taking a range of products from concept through production.
Proven history of successful design and product development from concepts to production.
Strong design and engineering technical knowledge.
Strong visual/verbal communication and team working skills.
title: Industrial Designer (Automotive), Special Projects

text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.
As the Head of Retail Solutions for Google Apps You will have global responsibility for leading our overall go-to-market strategy for the retail industry. Your main responsibility will be to identify, scope, build and launch business-relevant solutions to drive business growth for Google Apps, Search and Devices for Work. You will serve as the internal and external thought leader in retail for Google for Work presenting at conferences and speaking to analysts. You have strategic planning, program management and customer facing skills. You will positively impact business metrics including business growth attainment.
Responsibilities
Identify, develop and package repeatable retail solutions for sales channels. Drive key areas including market insights, launch planning, enablement, advocating, voice of the customer, and strategic business development
Work with partners, to build the solution elements to complement and differentiate Google offering and represent Google externally at 3rd party events, industry organizations, and analysts
Working with virtual teams across Marketing, Product, Sales, and partners to bring solutions to market
Lead the development of assets and tools to support the Sales channel readiness
Serve as an executive sponsor on strategic opportunities and own Industry Specific Customer Special Interest Groups

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Field sales experience in technology sales or consulting work.
Experience in the Retail industry.
Preferred qualifications
Proven ability to develop, package and launch new solutions.
Able to work independently but within a team environment; goal oriented, self-motivated.
Demonstrated data driven approach and strong analytical skills.
Strong executive relationships and business acumen.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
title: Head of Retail Industry Solutions, Google for Work
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As a leader in the Media Technology Solutions team, you will be responsible for driving business growth for Google’s ad technology platform, DoubleClick Digital Marketing, amongst Australia and New Zealand’s top digital marketers and agencies. With a strong consulting focus and solution oriented approach, you will develop strategies to identify and approach specific verticals/segments, and pursue prospects throughout the sales cycle. You will be negotiating and securing agreements for new customers, and helping ensure customers’ complete adoption and satisfaction with the DoubleClick suite of buying solutions.
The Account Manager role is focused on consulting, solution promoting and change management, interacting with clients at the C-level. The role requires cross-functional coordination with other Google teams, working closely with technical consultants and support teams, Marketing, Billing and Collections teams, all the while ensuring close coordination with the other regional teams.Responsibilities
Meet/exceed business growth targets on customer portfolio (top marketers and advertising agencies in Australia/New Zealand) by maximizing adoption/usage of the DoubleClick Search Platform.
Lead presentations and quarterly business reviews to Key Accounts.
Identify potential/new customers opportunities, structure proposals (including offer, pricing, legal and operational implications) working with internal support functions, negotiate agreements.
Create relationships within the customers organization at all levels including senior executives, direct and indirect users of the product, and usage/repurchase decision makers.
Be the first point of contact for customers around all key areas (training, product enhancement, global/regional campaign) and lead cross-functional effort to identify and solve any issues.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of hands-on relationship management experience, in media, marketing or advertising.
Preferred qualifications
Strong experience in driving new business and/or account management experience in online advertising, or a combination of both.
Experience in building relationships at various levels, with the ability to influence others.
Strong familiarity with digital media buying and selling processes. Solid knowledge of advertising technologies including Ad Serving, Rich Media, Search Management, Real Time Bidding, Demand Side- Platforms, Supply-Side Platforms, and Ad Exchanges.
Demonstrated success at working with cross-functional teams and building strong relationships across internal teams.
Possess and be able to develop business contacts within the advertising, marketing and digital industries in Australia and New Zealand. Proven track record in reaching and exceeding quotas.
Ability to understand and absorb complex technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience effectively. Superior written and verbal communication skills.
title: Account Manager, DoubleClick Search

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Construction Partner Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
Google Fiber is building one of the fastest data networks in the US so users can experience the future of broadband. As a Construction Partner Manager, you will work closely with your Engineering and Business counterparts to develop and execute strategies that will enable the expansion of Google Fiber’s network through close partnership with Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) firms. By drawing on a broad set of technical and business experiences, you will establish cross-functional requirements, develop fulfillment strategies, manage quoting and contracting activities, and manage our partners to fulfill various efforts related to deploying the Google Fiber network. Your leadership across many functional domains will culminate in the completion of several concurrent construction efforts that will be delivered on-time, within budget, at required technical specifications and safely.Responsibilities
Work across organizations and resources based in Mountain View and in-city teams to establish fulfillment strategies that closely complement Google Fiber’s Engineering and Business needs.
Source and manage close relationships with key partners that can scale to meet our Engineering and Construction needs across several US metropolitan areas.
Build a strong internal network with peer groups in Engineering, Finance, Legal, Marketing, PR, Supply Chain, Operations, IT, and in-city teams.
Manage and negotiate contractual agreements and business terms that enable an efficient and scalable execution of our expansion strategies.
Work closely with in-city resources to jointly drive execution.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree with emphasis in technical operations, or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of work experience in operations/supplier management/supply chain/construction management.
Experience with strategic business planning and execution.
Experience managing and negotiating contracts.

Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Direct experience with large scale telecom/Fiber to the Home (FTTH) engineering, procurement and construction efforts.
Established track record of developing and deploying complex outsourced relationships.
Established history of contributing/owning the development and deployment of enterprise-wide systems/tools/IT architectures.
Strong financial analysis capabilities.
title: Construction Partner Manager, Google Fiber

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
As an Operations Manager, you will manage the day-to-day operations of the group. You will develop close relationships with the team members as well as the relevant stakeholders inside Google. You will interact with Engineering Managers/Directors to define needs and develop an operational plan to support it. You will be involved in every step of the way around the engagement with 3rd party vendors from selection to negotiation and operation. You will have a purview into multiple products/tools being developed and maintain a meeting cadence to ensure operational excellence. As part of your role, you will also be involved in strategic initiatives revolving around marketing the team, communications to senior management, growth opportunities, and budgeting. This job entails working with various operations teams around the globe and a wide range of engineering teams to design new tools, automate data analysis, create dashboards, optimize processes, and use the latest of Google's internal technologies to build needed business intelligence. You should possess a mix of technical strength and drive to challenge the status quo.Responsibilities
Manage the operations of a group of software developers while constantly driving value-addition.
Act as a primary vendor/Google escalation point of contact, communicate staffing needs and launch requirements with vendors.
Identify and drive operational efficiencies by setting the right set of processes, metrics and tools.
Drive excellent site performance across critical success metrics through effective governance processes and by developing a strategic partnership with the vendor.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or related field or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of relevant operations experience with vendor management processes.
Experience with software development methodologies Python/Java, SQL and web frameworks.
Experience managing projects under set schedules.
Preferred qualifications
MBA/MS degree in Engineering.
Deep knowledge of local vendor landscape and the ability to conduct vendor due-diligence, identify potential issues and drive resolution before workflow is transitioned.
Proven ability to work in fast-paced, constantly evolving environments.
Strong communication and collaboration skills exhibited in complex operational setting.
Exceptional analytical and structured problem solving skills.
title: gTech Operations Manager

text:
In Audio Visual Engineering (AV Eng), our goal is to make it easy for every Googler to communicate and collaborate effectively across rooms and different offices, all over the globe. For events, our goal is to extend the AV Engineering vision of a seamless technology experience to all attendees (including livestream viewers), press, and partners, as well as create a more efficient and reliable technical environment for event staff and vendors.

As the AV Eng Deployment Manager, you will play a key role in managing the teams that project manage the deployments for Google’s cutting edge AV technologies. You will be responsible for managing high-level relationships with global stakeholders while growing the teams' capabilities in coordination, support, operations, and engineering. You will collaborate with various teams across Google as well as third party agencies.Responsibilities
Staff and maintain a team comprised of project managers who deploy AV installations across the globe.
Focus on automation and process improvement without eroding the flexibility required for executing in diverse regions.
Manage the relationships between multiple stakeholders across various groups like Real Estate, Architects, AV Design, Security, Support Organization, Marketing, Sales, Corporate Communications, Engineering, Network Operations, etc.
Maintain high standards of installation expectations balancing priorities across existing resources.
Role may involve up to 20% travel.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in Project Management, AV, VC, networking, and/or computer systems.
Direct experience in physical technology deployments, with specific domain experience relevant to AV systems.
Preferred qualifications
Strong familiarity with AV, IT, and networking hardware and software concepts and their intersection.
Effortless ability to use cloud-based user productivity systems (Gmail, Hangouts, Drive, Sites, etc.).
Excellence with data analysis and problem solving. Strong interest in AV/VC technology, open standards and open source.
Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams. Demonstrable leadership and organizational skills.
Strong strategic negotiation skills around service delivery and budget priorities, and strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills conducive to team development.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Creativity in discovering actionable results and ability to succeed in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
title: Technical Operations Manager, AV Engineering, Deployment Manager
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
The Google for Work team works to help organizations everywhere "go Google". The Google for Work Inside Sales team evangelizes Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome, to leading companies, schools and government agencies. As a LatAm Assist Manager, you reach out proactively to show these customers how the Google for Work Solutions can help them become more productive, mobile and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
An important lever we have for growing the Google Apps for Work business is our website (google.com/apps) and free trial channel. For most businesses, this website is the gateway to our product: it’s where customers learn, try things out and ultimately purchase Apps. Assist represents a key piece of our customers’ online journey, aiming to provide a delightful, customized customer experience through discovery, education, resourcefulness and action.
The Google Assist team is a team within Google for Work that plays an integral role in optimizing our online channel. The team focuses on not only engaging customers that sign up through our online channel but also experimenting with data-driven, scalable solutions to improve trial conversion rate and customer lifetime value.
As a Latin America (LatAm) Assist Manager, you will manage our growing operation in LatAm, as well as help drive global projects for Assist. You will manage a team to ensure a solid operation with strong results. You will also work cross-functionally with many stakeholders across Sales, Support and Marketing to optimize the customer experience and impact from LatAm businesses.Responsibilities
Manage the LatAm Assist team and grow the team's skills through training and development.
Define go-to-market strategies for new LatAm markets.
Work with cross-functional stakeholders to improve the regional performance.
Create quality assurance measurements and processes.
Develop reporting and metrics to measure performance.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of people management experience with a focus on coaching and mentoring.
Experience in developing team members.
Ability to speak and write in English, Spanish and/or Portuguese fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MBA.
Strong understanding of the technology market and a passion for Google Apps.
Ability to initiate and execute complex, cross-functional projects with minimal guidance.
Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities with the ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines.
Highly analytical with a track record of being a strong problem solver capable of translating analysis and insights into actionable business plans.
Proven leadership capabilities and excellent interpersonal skills.
title: LatAm Assist Manager, Google for Work

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
Google engineers don't simply build our consumer-facing products, they also work to protect the users of those products.

As an Anti-Abuse Engineer, you will build and support the infrastructure of abuse fighting tools to enable a scalable operations organization. You will work with product and engineering teams to develop innovative solutions that improve abuse, spam and fraud fighting infrastructure; learn from decisions made by the operations teams to identify abuse trends, and improve systems for large scale data processing and data mining, through machine learning and clustering of problems.

You’ll have the opportunity to work on challenging projects including web applications (client and server-side) and data-processing backends, with a strong emphasis on building scalable server-side components using Google technologies.Responsibilities
Work on projects that are part of a multi-system project and/or medium to large-size projects of high complexity and impact
Design, develop, test, support and enhance web applications and backend systems.
Build systems to process large datasets in parallel on massive clusters.
Take initiative and ownership to improve impact of projects and ensure overall success.
Collaborate with product and engineering partners to enhance and integrate core abuse-fighting platforms.
Collaborate with operations analysts to detect and prevent spam, fraud and abuse trends, and advocate changes to protect Google’s customers and users.
Increase efficiency through automation, workflow streamlining, and system optimization by working with analyst teams.
Write and review technical documents (including design, development, and revision).
Mentor and train junior developers, including task planning and code reviews.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in CS, Statistics, related technical field (with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature) or equivalent practical experience.
Programming experience in one or more of the following languages: C, C++, Java, JavaScript or Python. Experience with data structures, and algorithms.
Preferred qualifications
MS in Computer Science or related technical field.
Knowledge of database design and other data storage solutions Experience working in Unix/Linux environments and/or cloud technologies such as AppEngine, AWS, Hadoop, etc.
Experience in numerical analysis, algorithms and/or data-mining.
Expert knowledge in one or more computer platforms and browsers.
Ability to identify relationships between parts of complex projects.
Ability to design, implement, test, and maintain moderately complex subsystems.
title: Anti-Abuse Engineer

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
PerformanceX is an exciting customer-facing team based in Dublin who will support and assist Large Customer Sales (LCS) EMEA customers with complex post-sales tasks. This team will work in tandem with the LCS Account Manager (AM). They will provide expert support to some of our most strategic EMEA customers by joining clients calls and providing implementation, optimization and technical consultation across our most complex areas - conversions, attribution, mobile apps, shopping and analytics. This team will also work with Client Side Instrumentation (CSI), Product and the Operational Efficiency team to help incubate new products, opportunities and betas to help determine the best way to scale into the teams. 

Actively grow our customers’ business by helping them make the most out of the web. Working closely with the sales team, you will ensure that customers are achieving their Key Performance Indicators through mobile app advertising and are using the correct mix of tracking and attribution to drive optimal performance.Responsibilities
Work with clients and also support Google account management teams to promote app advertising to clients.
Assist AMs in identifying opportunities for clients to grow their business by promoting or developing a mobile app.
Work closely with sales teams to understand and scale mobile app install best practices from advertisers.
Build relationships with internal technical support teams as well as account managers to bolster the relationship with the client/media agency in order to overcome barriers to implementation and champion new mobile app product releases, internally and externally, incubating betas and assessing their success for future roll out.
Support customers and account managers to track beyond the download and ensure robust performance measurement. Interface with trusted third-party tracking/analytics providers to ensure successful, timely and proper set-up of third-party campaign tracking where appropriate.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with third-party tracking integration and troubleshooting.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working on mobile app campaign, implementation and complex tracking (e.g. tracking via device-specific IDs, app SDKs and complex server side implementation).
Ability to speak and write in English and French fluently and idiomatically
title: App Promotion Specialist (UK/Ireland), PerformanceX Team

text:
As a User Experience (UX) leader, you help define and drive the future of Google design. You identify and set product strategy, envision complex UX ecosystems and inspire teams to push the boundaries of what’s possible. You possess a clear vision of the future of user experience and have the courage to pursue forward-thinking design.
In this role, you will apply your passion for brand, craft, and design fidelity to guide research and design processes, mentor talented members of your team, and collaborate with leaders of other UX and Engineering teams to create innovative experiences across all of Google’s products.
The User Experience Manager for Google’s Display Ads products will bring vision and unrelenting determination to re-shape Google’s approach to display advertising. You will lead and grow a strong, cross-disciplinary team of designers, researchers, and prototypers across multiple product lines and geographies. You will evangelize and champion an exceptional experience for consumers of ads, and inspire your team to innovate and invent by taking smart risks, learning quickly, and optimizing accordingly. You will articulate a UX vision and drive consensus with engineering and product leadership - establishing and advocating for user research, design, and product development processes that result in game-changing experiences. You will develop talent and mentor individual contributors, design and research leads, and managers. You will guide research and design processes and methodologies. You will collaborate with other UX leaders and managers to drive best practices and UX consistency across Google’s Advertising and Commerce products.
Responsibilities
Oversee all phases of UX work: research, conceptual design, prototyping, detailed design, usability testing, and implementation.
Attract, mentor, and retain great designers, researchers, and prototypers.
Partner with Product Management and Engineering to align UX vision and activities with Google’s business goals.
Improve research design, and development processes continually to gain efficiency, remove obstacles, and simplify problems.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a UX-related field (human-computer interaction, human factors, behavioral research, or graphic design) or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience as a designer or user researcher working on web or desktop applications.
4 years of experience managing a UX team.
Experience with design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Flash, Fireworks, Illustrator, Photoshop, Acrobat, Axure, Balsamiq, FileMaker and office suite software.
Preferred qualifications
UX-related experience in Advertising.
Experience designing for multiple device types and contexts (desktop, tablet, smartphone).
Proven leadership in communicating research, conceptual ideas, and design rationale, all within a user-centered design process.
title: UX Manager, Display Ads Products

text:
Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. You will lead and motivate a team of direct reports to achieve amazing performance goals. You'll work closely with the executive management team to set and develop business strategies. You will draw insights from analytics to make our people process smarter and more efficient. You will use your strong communication skills to tell rich, meaningful stories using data and influence decisions. You will develop strong relationships across the organization, working collaboratively with clients, peers and key leaders to drive results for your team, the department and clients.
You are a senior staffing leader who possess a high degree of creativity to lead innovative and cutting edge recruiting practices across several multi-national product groups and teams in one of our most important product areas, Ads and Commerce. You will be responsible for the strategic development, oversight, and execution of the global talent plans in support of our aggressive and exciting growth.Responsibilities
Build a global talent acquisition strategy and execution plan that emphasizes diversity along all pillars including executive, industry, and university recruiting; talent acquisition programs and operations, strategic sourcing, talent mapping, and acquiring.
Lead, both directly and indirectly, teams that will execute against aggressive hiring goals.
Manage and influence complex global partner relationships with a variety of teams to ensure overall staffing objectives are met.
Work closely with business leaders, HR business partners, and Finance to ensure that the staffing organization is able to support aggressive business growth. Create meaningful metrics to measure improvements in the experience, success, and impact on the organization.
Build a compelling attraction and engagement strategy ensuring that we are attracting the highest quality talent with the best cultural fit to increase retention rates and highlighting the product area as a destination of choice.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of recruiting experience, setting strategy, and working closely with business clients.
Experience leading and managing a team.
Preferred qualifications
Experience owning a recruiting function, with a background managing a team and client groups.
Strong track record of solving complex problems, designing creative strategies, and delivering significant impact as a manager; strong domain knowledge and expertise in technical recruiting.
Demonstrated personal accountability and integrity, and an ability to build strong, productive relationships across the business.
Superb ability to consult, influence, and manage clients. Ability to drive efforts and projects through relationships and a broad knowledge base.
title: Product Area Staffing Manager, Ads and Commerce

text:
As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.
This is a hybrid role for a Product and Commercial Associate Corporate Counsel on the Google Cloud Platform and Corporate Systems Legal team.
Responsibilities
Ensure compliance with U.S. and international laws and regulations dealing with cloud platform services, intellectual property, privacy and data protection.
Provide legal advice to teams from Engineering, Product Management, Sales, Marketing and Communications from the initial stages of product development to launch.
Develop and maintain a repository of legal resources that are required for products, such as terms of service, privacy notices and other disclosures.
Respond promptly to legal requests from Business Development, Sales, Marketing and other clients, summarizing and communicating legal concepts that business people can use. Advise business clients, as well as Finance and other company colleagues, on legal issues and risks, complex agreement structures, approval processes, company policies and procedures, intellectual property and negotiation strategy.
Review, draft, and negotiate licenses, intellectual property agreements and cloud platform services and support the continuous improvement of standard form agreements and legal processes customer, reseller, and partnership agreements.
Minimum qualifications
JD degree or equivalent practical experience.
Licensed to practice law in a U.S. jurisdiction.
3 years of relevant work experience in a law firm or in-house legal department.
Experience in advising product and engineering teams on legal issues.
Preferred qualifications
Demonstrated experience advising clients in structuring complex commercial transactions, including sales or licenses of cloud platform services.

text:
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. You'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.
As a Solutions Consultant, you help potential clients determine the right mix of Google's advertising services for their needs. You excel at targeted pitches, thoughtful needs assessments and persuasive presentations. As a liaison between our clients and our technical staff, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations, integrations and troubleshooting for a variety of our product lines. You are a technical expert with an entrepreneurial drive and passion for client management and technology. Your solid sales knowledge and strong technical background mean you can confidently convey the product value proposition to both non-technical and technical audiences. Ideally you're already familiar with online advertising and have experience working within the industry.
In your role, you will work on one of Google’s Platform Products (DoubleClick for Advertisers, DoubleClick Search, DoubleClick Rich Media, DoubleClick Bid Manager, DoubleClick Ad Exchange, Google Analytics Premium) or Google’s Media products (YouTube, Google Display).Responsibilities
Manage technical relationship with selected advertisers' portfolio.
Work with Sales to identify business opportunities, leveraging both display and performance solutions supported by gTech.
Collect requirements and provide guidance and best practices to apply ad products and technologies to achieve advertisers' business goals.
Design and implement complex and customized solutions with a client in their portfolio.
Oversee end-to-end implementations and escalations handled by other Google teams for our named accounts.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in computer science, a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience working with customer engagements (e.g. project management, technical sales, ad operations, etc.).
Experience with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript and HTTP.
Preferred qualifications
MS or MBA degree.
Experience in online advertising industry.
Experience with programming and scripting.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to translate complex product and technical concepts to non-technical and executive audiences.
Creative problem-solving and strong analytical skills.
title: Ads Solutions Consultant

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
At gTech Ads, our mission is to “make it easy to run ads with Google at 10x the scale” through expertise and efficiency. To achieve this, we’re looking for Googlers who can partner with media and creative agencies, advertisers and Google’s internal teams to ensure flawless campaign delivery.

Brand Specialists offer the highest quality campaign creation, delivery and support. You will execute quickly and efficiently on multiple campaigns providing creative and technical consultation, across our most complex product areas - YouTube, Google Display Network (GDN) and reserve buys and engagement ads.

As a client facing expert, with a particular focus on coordinating agency support, cross functional relationship skills are key. Your knowledge of online media, combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities will be essential to shaping how new and existing business grows. You will operate as a key partner re-actively delivering brand campaigns based on agreed customer’s Key Performance Indicators (KPI).

You will have in-depth product knowledge and a strong technical aptitude which can be leveraged to persistently explore and uncover technical solutions to complex business scenarios.

Brand Specialists help provide the voice of the customer to the regional and global Customer Solutions & Innovations (CSI) and gTech Ads Product and Tools teams. Through your influencing and relationship-building skills, you will be essential to driving ongoing improvements to our products, processes and tools.
Responsibilities
Provide technical feasibility assessments and consultation during pre-sales.
Project manage and hands on implementation of media campaigns and programs including: coordination between client, sales, vendor teams to deliver a campaign or program and development of templated solutions (e.g. custom gadgets, dynamic campaigns.)
Advocate Brand Products for Media and Creative agencies externally and internally.
Partner with other areas at Google to introduce new products in market.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of customer facing experience supporting product implementations, digital ad operations or technical sales experience.
1 year of working experience with client side web technologies (e.g. HTML5, CSS, Flash, etc.).
Preferred qualifications
MSc or MBA degree.
Experience with one programming language (e.g. Java, Python, JavaScript, etc.)
Working knowledge of SQL databases.
Creative problem-solving skills and strong analytical skills.
Proven communication skills and ease to explain technical concepts to non-technical and executive audiences.
title: Brand Specialist

text:
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is what you get when you treat operations as if it’s a software problem. Our mission is to progress, protect, and provide for the software and systems behind all of Google’s public services - Search, Ads, Gmail, Android, YouTube, and AppEngine, to name just a few - with an ever-watchful eye on their availability, latency, performance, and capacity. This is an unusual job, unlike others in the industry. Like traditional operations groups, we keep important, revenue-critical systems up and running despite hurricanes, bandwidth outages, and configuration problems. Unlike traditional operations groups, we also have full access to and authority to fix, extend, and scale the code to keep it working and harden it against all the vagaries of the Internet. We hire people from both systems and software backgrounds. Strong candidates will have experience with both. Just as what we do is unique, where we do it is unique too. At Google, we have the good fortune to have developed many interesting systems ranging from planet-spanning databases to near real-time scalable data warehousing to fault-tolerant datastream joining. In SRE, we flip between the fine-grained detail of disk driver I/O scheduling to the big picture of continental-level service capacity, across a range of systems and a user population measured in billions. We own those products in production. We drive reliability and performance across massive scale by mastering the full depth of the stack. We literally do learn something new every day - usually surprising things - that have the potential to transform the lives of billions of our users around the world.
As a Software Engineer on the SRE team, you will have the opportunity to tackle the complex problems of scale which are unique to Google, while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large-scale system design.Responsibilities
Design, write and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Google's services.
Solve problems relating to mission critical services and build automation to prevent problem recurrence; with the goal of automating response to all non-exceptional service conditions.
Influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale distributed systems.
Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning.
Conduct periodic on call duties using a follow-the-sun model.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis and software design.
Experience in one or more of: C, C++, Java, Python, Go.
Preferred qualifications
Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
Familiarity with running web services at scale; understanding of Unix systems internals and networking.
Understanding of Unix/Linux systems from kernel to shell and beyond, taking in system libraries, file systems, and client-server protocols along the way.
Networking knowledge and understanding of network theory, such as different protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, etc), MAC addresses, IP packets, DNS, OSI layers, and load balancing).
Systematic problem solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.
title: Software Engineer, Site Reliability Engineering, University Graduate

text:
Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.With your technical expertise, you create test plans for highly complex platforms (e.g., validating the interaction of multiple pieces of equipment at the networking and subsystem levels), and using your deep knowledge of component design characteristics, you diagnose highly complex hardware or software issues.Responsibilities
Work closely with development teams to understand new project architectures and system components.
Plan, execute, and document tests to verify and validate signal integrity, timing, power, reliability, and performance.
Strive for efficiency and efficacy in test execution, data gathering, data analysis, and reporting.
Investigate test outcomes and participate in root cause analysis of undefined behaviors. Communicate findings and recommendations.
Cultivate good working relationships with customers, component suppliers and manufacturing to further quality goals.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience working in a design verification lab environment.
Experience with hardware evaluation methodologies, including lab measurements, environmental stress testing, performance monitoring, test automation, and data analysis.
Experience with Linux or other Unix operating systems. Experience in Python and MATLAB.
Preferred qualifications

5 years of relevant work experience in engineering test, validation, and leadership role.
Demonstrated technical leadership and mentoring skills.
Strong scripting and/or programming skills.
title: Hardware Test Engineer (Loon), Special Projects

text:
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a Sales manager, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service.
