With the rapid growth of our Small and Medium Businesses (SMB) clients, it's important to have charismatic leaders who guide our markets to success. As a Country Manager for SMB Sales, you are the lead in a market working with your Management team to understand our advertisers’ needs and deliver measurable solutions. You work with the Sales Leadership team to set and implement strategic objectives and represent your market inside Google on market performance, market requirements and future plans, bringing together prioritized asks for global products, policy or business decisions essential for the market. You work with your Management team to develop strategies for coaching high-performing Account Managers. You create a shared vision and a combined growth plan with all SMB teams, driving a One SMB approach across Acquisition, Channel Sales, Global Customer Experience and Marketing. You partner with your Large Customer Sales (LCS) Country Manager and Teams to develop specific areas of collaboration that drive growth. When required, you front local PR, media or events for SMB clients on behalf of the market.
Responsibilities
Represent SMB Sales for your market on all strategic, operational and customer facing issues internally and externally.
Be responsible for business growth and productivity attainment by representing the SMB Sales team in target setting for your market, taking ownership for delivery of targets for your market and program devising strategies to meet quarterly goals.
Work cross-functionally and with LCS stakeholders to develop an ambitious growth plan for your market and execute successfully against it.
Develop and implement innovative best practices for business programs and markets, ensuring that your team is always up to date with the newest advertiser solutions.
Manage a team of SMB Sales Representatives and team leads, working on the growth of Google's advertiser, coaching and managing your team to develop sales and account management skills and contributing to the management of the wider EMEA team.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
MBA.
Experience leading teams, with a strong focus on coaching and mentoring, and demonstrated success developing sales teams and hitting targets
Proven ability to manage multiple projects while paying strict attention to detail. Self-starter who is comfortable with a rapidly-changing environment and working to targets
Ability to think strategically and ability to make changes to meet strategic needs within your market
Strong, established and recognized presence in a regional marketplace with an extensive list of relationships.
Extensive sales management experience in an EMEA online business or targeting the Polish market. Proven ability to leverage account management, relationship building and planning to increase business from existing sources.
title: Country Manager, SMB Sales (Poland)

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
The Google Apps for Work team helps businesses work better together, move fast and innovate. Within Apps, the Demand Management Inbound team is responsible for qualifying all inbound inquiries and passing qualified business prospects to our Sales teams. To be successful, understanding our prospects is key.
Demand intelligence is a fundamental part of our business, and we strive to provide meaningful insights about all parts of demand and lead generation.
As a Google for Work Program Manager, you are responsible for working closely with Marketing to understand our prospects. You will propose changes, work on experiments to generate more demand and develop analytic insights to bring back to the business. You will understand how outbound prospecting works, and you will provide suggestions to improve our targeting.
Responsibilities
Provide insights and recommendations for different Marketing teams on our demand (inbound and outbound).
Be the main liaison between Sales and Marketing, understanding the needs of both sides and translating into projects.
Develop process best practices to standardize across global demand management (DM) inbound and outbound teams.
Execute online and systems experiments to further the team’s success.
Oversee ongoing reporting and metrics tracking to enable stakeholders to understand the state of business.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in consulting, operations or marketing.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Highly analytical with a track record of being a strong problem solver capable of translating analysis and insights into actionable business plans.
Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities and ability to manage multiple tasks with cross-functional teams.
Ability to initiate and execute complex, cross-functional projects with minimal guidance.
Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
Passion for the B2B technology market.
title: Program Manager, Inbound Demand Management, Google for Work

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
As an Android Partnerships team member, you're doing the negotiations that keep Android's meteoric growth going. You work closely with Android Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Legal teams on new initiatives and key strategic relationships. You don't just execute; you're a true thought leader who can see multiple steps ahead and identify industry trends and key influencers. Empowered to chart your own path, you run the process from start to finish. You open doors with potential partners, lead exploratory talks with them. 

You are responsible for leading and negotiating Android-related distribution for Google services with manufacturers, mobile networks, electronics retailers, and other entities participating in the creation and distribution of Android devices and services. Initially focused on smartphones and tablets, the role offers the opportunity to work with industry leading Google partners to secure broad distribution of Android devices with Google services and then manage and nurture those relationships on an ongoing basis. You will be able to work autonomously but also collaboratively with Product, Engineering, Legal, and other partner-facing teams to initiate, support and grow your partner accounts.
Responsibilities
Open doors with potential partners, lead exploratory talks, build consensus with Senior executives internal and external to Google, negotiate complex strategic partnerships that are often first-of-its-kind.
Drive and execute distribution negotiations for Google services on Android devices. Manage partnerships to deliver results and build strong long-term partner relationships.
Identify and prioritize partner targets; become an expert on each target’s organization, business model, and strategic priorities.
Build and nurture strong relationships with third parties, working directly with some partners and through “one-to-many” models to reach large partner ecosystems.
Serve as the ongoing Android relationship manager helping to realize and optimize value from the partnership.
Minimum qualifications
15 years of experience in the mobile industry across mobile device, mobile operator, and/or related start-ups with international experience across Partner Management activities.
Experience with mobile carriers, mobile or consumer electronics manufacturers, and retailers.
Combined technical and product experience across the mobile space whilst delivering high value outcomes for partners.
Ability to speak and write in English and Korean fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with ongoing partner relationship management; ability to serve as an advocate for your accounts internally and work collaboratively to identify opportunities or resolve issues.
Strong negotiator with a partnership approach; ability to represent Google in discussions and structure terms to achieve strong ongoing partner alignment.
Ability to interpret legal documents and work with attorneys on specific contract language.
title: Strategic Partner Development Manager, Android Partnerships, Korea

text:
As a Store Operations Vendor Manager, you will be responsible for process development, as well as scaling and performance management of gTech support teams in close partnership with one or more outsourced vendors and various internal operations teams. In this role, you will have accountability for the performance of one or more outsourced vendor operations. You will be responsible for new process implementation, auditing vendor implementation of training, performance management of the vendor and day-to-day vendor workflow oversight. You will also be expected to contribute to the long-term operational strategy and support model, outsourcing decisions, contract negotiations, vendor selection and continuous improvements of business processes.
Responsibilities
Manage vendor operations in North America, ensuring we set the bar for high scale, quality, efficiency and policy enforcement of our vendor functions globally; ensure we are are meeting a high standard for delivery of service, manage overall relationship with the vendor workforce, monitor cost, quality, and delivery of service. Lead regular business reviews, vendor relationship management activities, workforce planning, and budgeting activities in coordination with internal teams.
Develop scalable solutions and ensure operational execution by partnering with operations leaders as well as vendors directly, and collaborate with various internal groups to understand business requirements, implement new processes, and contribute to ongoing process improvements. Work as part of a broader operations management team to develop the team’s strategy, process improvement, people development and technology implementation.
Manage the overall performance of a vendor workforce in terms of cost, quality and delivery of service, ensure seamless process execution and that all aspects of vendor Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are consistently met. Drive improvements in all relevant metrics, e.g., costs, turnaround time, quality, productivity. Manage, coach and mentor Googlers across the broader operations team.
Monitor daily performance, collect and analyze data in order to recognize process inefficiencies and potential problem areas. Review vendor data, identify process improvement opportunities and drive improvement of vendor performance (SLA compliance, Monthly Business Reviews (MBRs), Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)). Help create a vendor ‘Incubation’ playbook (containing process documentation, QA frameworks, sample reports, governance structure, Best Current Practices (BCP), process improvement methodologies, etc.).
Incubate new and evolving workflows. Set up new teams to pilot nascent and evolving workflows to improve the in-store experience, as well as provide valuable insights to the Sales, Marketing and Product teams to highlight top-issues and improve the service offering.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
4 years of experience in operations, production or supply chain management with accountability to measurable output in a continuous improvement environment.
Experience in managing people, and working with international teams and stakeholders. Experience executing strategies to deliver solutions.
Experience directly managing cross-functional processes. Temp, vendor and contractor workforce management experience.

Preferred qualifications
MS, MBA or advanced technical degree.
Business development experience for any third-party vendors; Experience with outsourcing (including offshore) agreements and running operations.
Strategic vendor management experience at a global scale, with proven success record as well as experience in operations, contracts management, procurement, and working cross-functionally with other internal teams.
Business process improvement and project management expertise; Experience in process management systems such as Kaizen, Six Sigma, or TPS.
Understanding and passion for retail products/services.
Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced team environment with excellent analytical, communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Store Operations Vendor Manager, North America

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include gCareer Program 2015 (Japanese-English Bilingual) - Tokyo.We believe that people are the key to achieve Google’s mission of organizing the world’s information and making it universally accessible and useful. With this in mind, we have designed the gCareer Program. The program aims to attract talented professionals with diverse backgrounds and experiences. gCareer Program is a return to work program for professionals with more than 5 years of work experience who have been out of the workforce for approximately 6 months or more. The program is designed for professionals to be a part of ongoing projects and to contribute directly to these live projects. We hope this program helps you explore new opportunities in which you can truly be yourself and shine the brightest.
 
We welcome your enthusiasm for the Internet, technology and advertising industry, and willingness to step into a diverse, dynamic work environment at Google.
gCareer Program is offered in the following business areas: 
Large Customer Sales (LCS)
The regional LCS teams partner closely with our major advertising clients and agencies to develop digital solutions that help our clients build their businesses and brands. We are in a unique and exciting position to shape how marketing and business are conducted in the digital age. We help our customers connect with their audiences so they get the most out of the web.
Google for Work
As experts of cloud computing, the Enterprise team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter through Google Apps. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.
gCareer Program Application Details:

Program Duration: Application is open annually.

Working Hours: 30 hours per week with flexible work schedule (Excluding Saturdays, Sundays and Holidays).
Location: Google Tokyo Office (Roppongi).
Application Deadline: Application is open annually.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.
We accommodate applicants residing overseas on a case-by-case basis.
Responsibilities
Roles and responsibilities will vary based on the team allocation and project assignment, therefore, specific responsibilities will be carefully determined on an individual basis.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant professional experience.
Business level communication in Japanese and English.

Preferred qualifications
Experience in a relevant field such as sales, market research, consulting, finance or IT enterprise.
Interest in the advertising sales, Internet, technology and/or Google products.
Advanced level of proficiency in spreadsheet and presentation software.
title: gCareer Program 2015 (Japanese-English Bilingual)

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
You are an experienced scientist with a background in protein expression and purification who will work on Google Life Sciences’ projects focused on nanotechnology and continuous health monitoring. You must be highly responsible and organized with strong problem solving skills, and the ability to manage and coordinate protein expression and characterization activities supporting multiple subgroups.
Responsibilities
Coordinate activities of a small protein expression/purification team. Provide expert input and oversight of protein expression construct design. Improve and optimize protein production workflows.
Manage CRO relationships in gene synthesis and protein expression. Express, purify, and characterize recombinant proteins at small to medium scale. Analyze, interpret, and present data at group meetings and in technical reports.
Remain current with relevant technologies and incorporate new methods, as appropriate, with special attention to high throughput expression, purification, and characterization technologies.
Adhere to document control policies where applicable. Contribute to publication efforts in peer-reviewed journals. Contribute to the generation and documentation of intellectual property.
Take on other duties as assigned.
Minimum qualifications
Master's degree in biochemistry, molecular biology, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of industry experience. Experience with bacterial and mammalian protein expression systems.
Experience in purification and characterization of antibodies, antibody fragments, antigens, and fusion proteins.
Experience with biophysical techniques essential to protein purification and characterization (e.g., HPLC/FPLC, DSC, DLS, SEC-MALS, ELISA, Octet/Biacore).
Preferred qualifications
PhD degree in biochemistry, molecular biology, or related field with 4 years or more of industry experience.
Experience with maintaining records and data in an LIMS environment.
Experience in protein formulation/optimization for stability and activity.
Experience in implementation of HTP technologies and use of liquid handlers.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
title: Protein Expression and Purification Scientist (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) grows Google's business with online publishers by helping them utilize tools from products such as AdSense and DoubleClick. Our team is made up of passionate specialists who work with partners in online advertising and e-commerce. We thrive in fast-paced, team-oriented and international environments. On this team, you will identify, develop, and support new and existing partners. In OPG, we strive to exceed the expectations of our partners through building and maintaining long-term relationships.As a manager working for the OPG team, you'll stretch your sales, operations, strategy development and leadership skills by helping us manage our global business. You might be a leader in sales or operations with tremendous people skills and thrive on innovation, driving ideas forward, working cross-functionally and running large-scale programs. You are committed to identifying and tackling new business opportunities, driving new process efficiencies and building high performing teams.
As a Mobile Apps Account Manager, you will be responsible for growing our Mobile Apps business in Singapore, Malaysia, Pakistan and other emerging markets in Southeast Asia (SEA).
You are enthusiastic and passionate with excellent communication skills and a proven track record in growing business. You have an analytical approach in sales and are able to work in complex environments.
Responsibilities
Manage a book of business with top Mobile Apps partners (using AdMob) in Singapore, Malaysia and Pakistan. Develop and go deep with those relationships. Carry out CEO-level conversations and leverage broader relationships within Google to provide “one Google” service to our partners.
Be the key execution agent in driving our Global Mobile Apps strategy in the territory, including driving AdMob as the key mediation layer with our potential prospects, and driving the adoption of our news ads format. You will be part of the SEA Mobile Apps team to develop the overall SEA apps business plan.
Educate and develop the market so as to build the pipelines for AdMob prospects. You will be tapping into the developers community in those markets, evangelizing Google’s offerings, and cultivate relationships with the goal of ultimately including them in Google’s AdMob network. You will be leveraging both the other Google resources (Developer Relations, Google Play) as well as OPG account managers who have relationships/language capabilities for those markets to penetrate and develop the market.
Communicate effectively with teams and clients in English or another SEA local language.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of relevant work experience in sales, product/engineering, digital advertising and business development.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Relevant work experiences in the mobile industry, including handsets, digital services and/or related fields.
Ability to execute quickly with limited guidance on complex, cross-functional projects with a variety of working groups, and able to anticipate changes in direction and scope.
Self-driven, ambitious and entrepreneurial.
Fluency in one of the SEA local languages (Chinese, Malay, Vietnamese, Bahasa, Thai, etc.).
title: Mobile App Account Manager, Southeast Asia

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Product Marketing Manager, Small and Medium Business, APAC - Tokyo.As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. You’ll partner with global and local marketing teams to drive growth in the region. Rigorous testing and experimentation will be critical as you shape regional strategy, spread best practices and help the local team reach aggressive marketing goals.Responsibilities
Work closely with local Sales and Marketing teams, gather data, and report on acquisition channel performance and then come up with new ideas for improvement. Coordinate implementation across the APAC region.
Understand other teams’ goals, seek their input and incorporate their expertise into your plans and gain their commitment and support for your projects and initiatives.
Conduct business and customer analytics to support marketing strategy.
Lead special projects that test new marketing approaches.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant marketing/consulting/related experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working cross functionally and cross culturally.
Knowledge and proven experience creating, executing and continually optimizing successful marketing campaigns in multiple APAC markets
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about complex issues, leading to thoughtful recommendations, action plans, and campaigns that drive high ROI; Comfortable speaking about and presenting data.
Deep understanding of marketing and sales funnel management and optimization.

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome and Street View, to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users.
Google[x] is the moonshot factory within Google. It is the place where uncomfortably ambitious, world-changing new ideas such as such as self-driving cars, Internet from balloons and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. Google[x] projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a better place.
The Makani project, which resides within Google[x], is developing an energy kite that generates more energy at lower cost than conventional wind systems. Makani’s kite uses less material and Makani is looking for an individual with proven success to support our growing supply chain activity. As a Makani Supply Chain Program Manager, you will be part of the supply chain for the fast-paced Makani project. You will support the team’s material acquisition strategy and work closely with the engineering and manufacturing teams to ensure material and part availability. This includes proactively identifying risks, managing schedules and clearly communicating goals to stakeholders. You will be expected to split your time between Mountain View, Alameda and your relevant project sites.
Responsibilities
Support the development and execution of Makani’s global supply chain strategies. Collaborate with Makani engineering and manufacturing to scope and define supply chain needs.
Identify, review and drive cost saving programs in the materials purchasing, materials movement and manufacturing processes.
Drive suppliers to ensure process readiness and material availability (on time, right quantity) are in support of Makani engineering and manufacturing efforts. Measure supplier performance and work with the relevant internal teams to drive improvements and corrective actions.
Understand component/subsystem lead time and evaluate associated supply chain risks.
Build and run optimal kanban processes and systems to ensure material is available, when and where required, to the manufacturing team.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree (STEM discipline) or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in procurement, sourcing or global supply chain management.
Supplier performance management experience.
Experience creating and/or driving material planning processes.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master's degree in supply chain management, logistics.
Demonstrated experience collaborating and working cross-functionally with engineering and manufacturing teams.
Proven ability to perform a variety of complicated tasks with the ability to adapt and excel in a constantly evolving environment.
Innate intellectual curiosity. Team player with a positive attitude. Detail oriented, versatile and innovative.
Excellent analytical, oral and written communication skills.
Ability to travel as required.
title: Supply Chain Program Manager (Makani), Special Projects

text:
Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind every system is the Ad Serving Operations team to make sure that happens flawlessly. As a member of the team, you are a technical consultant with the dual role of being both client-facing and growing systems from the back-end. An expert in our tools and operations, you provide support, answer field inquiries and troubleshoot client issues. Beyond client-facing issues, your expertise also gives you the insight to recommend product and system improvements to our engineering teams. Your interactions on both sides ensure that when clients advertise with Google, their back-end systems never miss a beat.
As an Ads Solutions Consultant, you will lead and execute projects supporting clients who use DoubleClick products, including Campaign Manager, Bid Manager, Mobile, and Rich Media. These projects will include technical assistance on business pitches, product implementations, product upgrades, and custom solutions. With truly entrepreneurial spirit, you will work on multiple projects concurrently, either independently or on small teams. You'll help customers with product configuration and business process improvement, combining your deep understanding of DoubleClick products to provide best-in-class solutions. 

Ads Solutions Consultants have a passion for managing relationships, specifically cross-functionally and with our clients to provide Google-calibre client service. We have a high technical aptitude and in-depth industry knowledge to persistently explore and uncover technical solutions to complex business scenarios. We work on multiple projects concurrently, either independently or on small teams. We are excited to develop and grow our clients business, and ensure success through our best-in-class solutions. 

As the technical, functional and industry expert, you will meet and exceed your clients expectations by proactively providing them with solutions that will have a big impact on their business on an on-going basis. Activities will include: accelerate feature adoption, accelerating cross product usage, run workshops and product audits.
Responsibilities
Support and and partner with Sales, in order to provide functional technical and functional needs assessments for prospective clients.
Create a smooth and easy cross product onboarding experience for the client, ensuring excellent service and consulting to assure a future proof setup of their advertising infrastructure. (This can include workshops with multiple agencies and advertiser stakeholders to surface and match business needs with the platforms functionality, training plans, tag and reporting implementation consultancy and implementation project management.)
Maintain relationships with DoubleClick's biggest agency, advertiser, and trading desk clients providing high-touch, solutions-oriented service from a technical and functional perspective.
Manage reactive client issues sent to Technical Services Associate teams and act as a point of escalation when support teams need assistance.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working in a client-facing technical service environment.
Ability to speak and write in English and Danish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Hands-on working knowledge of HTML5, CSS and JavaScript in online advertising (banners, websites and apps).
Strong Project Management skills.
Online Advertising industry knowledge.
Quickly grasp technical concepts, tailor them for non-technical audiences and present confidently.
Self-starter, able to work flexible in a fast-paced and changing environment
Excellent analytical skills, with a creative approach to problem-solving.
title: Ads Solutions Consultant

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
As a Channel Partnership Manager, you will join our Channel Partnerships Team (CPT) in the early stages of strategy development and team growth. You will have a strong sales focus and work closely with our most technologically advanced publishers and platforms, with a goal of growing our publisher base.
Channel Partners are key partners to Google’s direct sales efforts. We identify partners who work with us on territories or value-added services that Google’s direct sales team can’t provide. This presents an especially large opportunity in Southeast Asia, where Google’s direct sales reach is still limited.
You are enthusiastic and passionate with excellent communication skills and a proven track record in growing business. You have an analytical approach in sales and are able to work in complex environments.
Responsibilities
Develop a SEA and Australia and New Zealand (AUNZ) partnership strategy. You will define where CPT partners should be chosen and why, interview and select partners based on a set of defined criteria that’s in lined with our global plan. You will articulate the business opportunity CPT presents.
Drive strategy into execution. You will sign up new partners, train and educate them about Google’s product and policy, manage partners on an on-going basis and evaluate them partners against a set of defined criteria to see whether they are successful or not.
Grow the overall CPT business for SEA and AUNZ.
Communicate effectively with teams/clients in English or their respective local SEA languages.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of relevant work experience in advertising sales, enterprise sales, business development or sales in general.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Ability to independently identify and pursue the most strategic opportunities, having demonstrated strategic thinking.
Ability to executes quickly with limited guidance on complex, cross-functional projects with a variety of working groups.
Ability to anticipate changes in direction and scope.
Fluency in one of the local SEA languages (Chinese, Malay, Vietnamese, Bahasa, Thai, etc.).
title: Channel Partnership Manager, CPT

text:
As a member of the Global Communications & Public Affairs team, you will work cross-functionally to help communicate with journalists and other thought leaders; devise specific communications materials and campaigns based on understanding of journalists' interests; engage in face-to-face meetings with commentators and other opinion formers; develop print and web-based material supporting these campaigns; and counter misinformation that might interfere with our business and ability to serve our users. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more.As a leader, you will keep your team on track with the overall strategy, giving them direction when it comes to specific product and business area decisions. You will also provide direct communications support for senior executives.
Responsibilities
Work with senior executives in our Ads and Commerce product area and our Global Business Organization to develop and deliver compelling messages related to the perception of our business.
Design and implement initiatives to communicate Google's key messages in relation to its ads and commerce business to media and industry analysts worldwide. Create process and procedures to integrate our business-to-business (B2B) Marketing and Sales activities with public communications.
Manage media relations related to our Ads and Commerce business with team members in the West Coast and New York.
Represent Google’s Ads and Commerce business as a company spokesperson and front-line point of communication.
Manage a broad range of press issues relating to our advertising business, including privacy, fraud, ad quality, competition, and the impact of new technologies.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant experience.
Team management experience.
Preferred qualifications
Solid understanding of, and interest in, products, issues and trends in the digital advertising world, both at high and granular level.
Effective team player who can lead efforts across disciplines; capable of working calmly and quickly in high-stress environments.
Superior communication skills. Persuasive when presenting to larger groups or in regular meetings, both internally and externally.
title: Head of Communications, Ads and Commerce

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
The Project Wing team within Google[x] is working on a delivery service for real customers using UAVs (Unmanned Aerial Vehicles). You can see what we've done in the past here. Join our team to see where we're going next!
You are a Software Engineer with strong embedded skills who will help us build our next-generation vehicle. You'll work in a multidisciplinary environment with direct access to our electrical, mechanical, GNC (Guidance, Navigation, and Control) and Software Engineers. You have designed complete UAV software stacks, participated in end-to-end UAV software designs, or otherwise have hands-on experience with 80% of manned or unmanned avionics software.Responsibilities
Work on all aspects of UAV software, from drivers and motor controllers to vehicle management and mission execution systems.
Participate in the team's software processes, including: requirement and test-plan generation, design doc creation, design and test implementation and review, process feedback and improvements.
Interface with teammates working on other tasks, across several professional disciplines.
Be flexible and expect to maintain or improve embedded build systems, automated hardware test systems, network or logging subsystems, or be partially allocated to non-embedded tasks.
Minimum qualifications
Experience with C/C++ and build systems.
Experience with operating system fundamentals, networking, and Linux.
Experience with at least half of of motor controllers, servo interfacing, driver development, schedulers,hardware abstractions, log data management, voting systems,contingency management, automated hardware and software testing,security and certificate management, networking over reliable and unreliable links.
Preferred qualifications
Experience writing certified software (i.e. DO-178C).
Professional UAV or other aerospace experience, civilian or military.
Elementary understanding of electronics principles, including reading schematics.
Interdisciplinary team focus since you'll work closely with software, hardware, mechanical, and GNC teams.
Comfortable writing code for bare metal or for an operating system. Willing to design and write mission-critical software developed according to a rigorous process.
Ability to create design docs and presentations for team communication.
title: Embedded/Firmware Engineer (Wing) Special Projects

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. You are an engineer who is versatile and passionate and want to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.

You will apply novel technologies and design techniques to create the highest performance and most cost-efficient data networks for Google’s global infrastructure, meeting a wide variety of unique design requirements.Responsibilities
Work closely with team of architects, optical/electrical/mechanical engineers to define new networking project architectures and system components.
Engage cross-functionally with high-level software, firmware, layout, optical and mechanical engineering teams to successfully design, develop, test, validate and manufacture new products.
Investigate validation and test outcomes thoroughly and drive root cause analysis of issues. Communicate findings and recommendations.
Develop and apply state-of-the art technologies to enable new system designs, mentor junior engineers and develop design methodologies and best practices.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in PCBA design including, DC/DC power converters, low noise analog circuits (amplifiers, filters), ADC/DAC blocks, and digital control path circuits. Experience with test equipment, such as high-speed oscilloscopes, network analyzers, logic analyzers and data acquisition systems.
Experienced in digital design techniques and with a wide variety of digital interface standards such as PCIe, MDIO, JTAG, I2C, SGMII, and other high speed serial buses, schematic capture, constraint-driven board layout, and circuit simulation tools experience.
Experience in hands-on verification and debug of high-speed circuit boards, lab characterization and ATE flow development and correlation.
Preferred qualifications
MS/PhD degree in Electrical Engineering or a related discipline with 5 years of relevant design experience with low-noise DC/DC conversion, board-to-chip power distribution designs, low phase noise clock distribution, high-precision analog, and analog filters and signal conditioning.
Experience with medium-voltage board design and high reliability design and testing, working knowledge of optical transceiver standards and discrete optical communications components and experience with optical test equipment and analyzers
Experience with FPGA design, simulation and synthesis (Verilog) carrying complex analog, and mixed-signal designs from definition through prototype and volume production.
Working knowledge of software design in real-time DSP-based systems and control loops, with one or more scripting or programming languages including Python or C++ and MATLAB.
title: Analog/Mixed Signal Board Design Engineer

text:
The Finance Operations team manages Google's cash transactions on a global basis and ensures that Google's incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to manage our complex set of transactions. You thrive on making processes more efficient and scalable, you work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations and you proactively minimize operational risk. Externally, you collaborate with our outsourcing partners and internally, you collaborate across the five areas of the Financial Operations team: Global Revenue Operations, Procure to Pay, Electronic Payment Services, Business Process Outsourcing, and Payroll.
Our team runs “first in class” operations, facing unique opportunities in scaling our varied and growing businesses effectively while enabling our fantastic product and services teams to grow at an unprecedented pace. We have a global focus, designing processes that work internationally while accommodating local needs. We're a fast moving, results oriented team, providing rapid tactical and strategic responses to challenges and ensuring that the positive impact is lasting before moving onto the next project. We're constantly taking on new leadership opportunities, and identifying and executing projects that benefit Google overall.

As the Project and Process Manager, you are a versatile and non-traditional thinker who is able to adapt to quickly changing priorities.
Responsibilities
Drive end-to-end process design and new system implementation, collaborating with Product, Engineering, Finance and Operations teams.
Design reporting and perform analyses to drive effective process improvement, eliminate mistakes and provide quick fixes.
Manage outsourced vendors and processes, ensuring that operations targets are met and identifying opportunities for growth and improvement.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master's degree.
Success working in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment and leading complex operations initiatives
Ability to autonomously drive and prioritize multiple initiatives
Passion for analyzing large data sets (strong spreadsheet skills), formulating recommendations and communicating them clearly
title: Finance Operations Project and Process Manager (Electronic Payments)

text:
As Privacy Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.
Responsibilities
Advise on compliance across all aspects of global privacy law and regulation, including data protection, data retention, data security and data breach rules.
Provide all specialist legal advice and subject matter resources required to support all functions within Google’s global legal team.
Provide specialist consultation and support to other key functions (Privacy Engineering, Public Policy, Corporate Communications).
Assist in the continued development and improvement of all aspects Google’s privacy compliance program (data transfers, processing, privacy policies, staff training, etc.).
Minimum qualifications
JD degree.
3 years of experience in privacy law.

Preferred qualifications
Significant in-depth, related experience.
Demonstrated ability to complete several simultaneous projects on deadline.
Exceptional interpersonal skills and a commitment to professionalism and collegiality.
Flexibility and willingness to work on a broad range of legal matters. Willingness to travel.
title: Privacy Counsel

text:
People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be a champion of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching your clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.
The role of an HR Business Partner is to solve complex organizational challenges through people-related solutions. You’ll be an integral part of the leadership team, so you’ll need to understand every aspect of the business and be a thought leader on People and Organizational topics. It’s your responsibility to create the end-to-end People Strategy that will support Googlers in realizing their wildest ambitions. This will require you to think big, use data to guide your work, be comfortable challenging convention, and in some cases reinvent how work is done.

As the HRBP for Sub-Saharan Africa, you will provide support to a diverse group of Googlers based in multiple offices across the continent. You will act as a champion for the region, provide expertise on HR practices and partner with functional People Operations (POps) teams to execute our people strategy from hiring and onboarding to development, employee satisfaction and culture.
Responsibilities
Develop people strategies and design approaches for diagnosing and enhancing organizational effectiveness and employee satisfaction and ensure effective onboarding of new hires in the environment of remote, small locations
Lead core HR processes across multiple functions and locations operating in Africa and act as an employee champion, addressing and resolving day-to-day HR problems
Organize and facilitate leadership and employee development plan in all African locations; to diversify it accordingly, depending on different functional agendas and business needs
Create and implement general the People Operations agenda for each African office in co-operation with POps functions such as compensation, benefits, learning and development, GPS, etc.
Provide consulting services for the functional leads in Africa and facilitate cooperation between the multiple functions present in Africa, ensuring consistency of the people practices in each location
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
HR or Management Consulting experience with experience in Africa.
Willingness to travel within Africa.

Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master's degree.
Great at influencing through strong relationships, expertise and data and can manage a complex set of stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, ability to analyze data, understand trends, develop recommendations for action based on the analysis.
Great communication skills and understand how to communicate large complex change.
title: HR Business Partner, Sub-Saharan Africa
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
The Creative Insights team helps creators grow their presence on YouTube through the development of creative and audience development strategies. We look to understand what makes content and creators successful on YouTube, package those insights and learnings, and encourage emulation from other creators to drive creator growth. The team is also responsible for teaching strategy workshops, conducting independent research and serving as specialized consultants for our key partners and creators.
As the Head of the Creative Insights team for the Americas, you will set the vision, determine the priorities, define measurable team objectives and analyze and track ROI for the various programs and initiatives while working cross-functionally with Content Partnerships, Operations, Marketing and Product.Responsibilities
Manage the team to work effectively and innovatively with creators to understand what makes the creative itself work, what audience development strategies they implement, and how to inspire creators and encourage emulation.
Package learnings and work with the Scaled Education team to communicate them internally and externally.
Determine team priorities, ensure they are aligned with organization-wide priorities, determine measurable key performance indicators and track return on investment of all programs and initiatives.
Build an efficient team structure, recognize and coach potential and existing leaders, and deepen professional skill sets across the regional teams.
Establish strong working relationships with our cross-functional teams, especially in Content Partnerships, Operations, Marketing, Product and our data teams.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience in media or online video.
Experience managing teams and experience leading operational and strategic initiatives within an online or technology business.
Experience managing projects and working independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Experience managing cross-functional teams.
Passion for the YouTube platform and familiarity with our YouTube Creators/Partners.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
title: Head of Americas, Creative Insights

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Ad Exchange (AdX) Analyst, you will be responsible for developing marketplace intelligence that enhances our clients’ strategies in-market and helps them uncover new opportunities for growth. You will also build close relationships with key stakeholders internally and externally to evangelize key trends in programmatic buying.
Responsibilities
Develop forward thinking, data-driven recommendations that align with clients' business objectives.
Quantify high-impact opportunities with clear traffic, performance and budget recommendations and pitch to clients when applicable.
Partner with Sales and Product teams to develop and test tools, templates and frameworks to streamline and scale client analyses.
Collaborate with the team to educate and train clients on how to best architect and optimize Ad Exchange campaigns and achieve maximum scale.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience managing and optimizing digital display and mobile advertising campaigns for clients.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with performance measurement, ad operations, ad networks, exchanges, DSPs (demand-side platform), private/programmatic agreements and Google platforms.
Experience with SQL and/or creating data visualizations and dashboards.
Analytical work experience with the ability to use data in order to identify trends and make recommendations in the field of digital advertising.
Proven track record of high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Advanced level of proficiency with complex spreadsheets/analysis and creating presentations.
title: Ad Exchange Analyst

text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.
In this role, you will create and execute a business strategy for winning in a highly competitive environment. This requires unique insight in applying Google solutions to government objectives and navigating intricate government acquisition processes. You will bring Google's portfolio into big and small companies around the world, and handle complex customer and stakeholder relationships.Responsibilities
Generate a plan to ensure broad penetration into the large accounts within the territory.
Develop and provide custom presentations on Google for Work solutions to customers.
Develop strategies for winning in a competitive environment.

Work collaboratively with your team to grow the business with new and existing customers.

5 years of sales experience in the Defense or Intelligence software market.
Ability to travel frequently within the U.S.
Preferred qualifications
BS degree in an IT-related field.
10 years of successful sales in the Defense or Intelligence software market.
Experience orchestrating sales with people from varied sales, marketing, and channels disciplines
Excellent organizational skills
Excellent interpersonal skills.

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Support Specialist, Performance, AdWords - Tokyo.At Google, we know building trust with users comes hand-in-hand with the dependable quality and reliability of our products. The Advertising Technology team helps ensure that our advertising products work effectively for our customers. When a Sales team colleague escalates an issue relating to a product such as AdWords or AdSense, we dig in, using our technical expertise to find the solution. You use your strong computer science background to answer technical questions from colleagues, partners and clients regarding ad specifications and technology. Your communication and sales skills come in handy when you break down complex product features and present them in an easy-to-understand manner. With an array of internal tools at your disposal, you troubleshoot ad functionality and display issues, working on higher-level projects to improve the team's operations. All of your efforts go toward ensuring that our ad products are working and our customers optimize them to deliver desired results.
Global Support plays a critical role in Google's success, supporting sales teams, advertisers, and products that enhance potential by consistently providing scalable product solutions and reliable information based on efficient, consultative analysis and timelycommunications. Alongside our support and troubleshooting work, we collaborate with Sales, Product Management and Engineering to focus on developing innovative, scalable support solutions that effectively serve our growing customer base. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.Responsibilities
Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service, troubleshooting and resolving issues from sales teams and Google's advertisers.
Manage sales and customer inquiries by live chat, tickets and other channels.
Develop training materials and documentation.
Engage with cross-functional partners to resolve issues.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Business level communication in Japanese and English.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in customer support, sales, technical support, account or campaign management.
Demonstrated experience with technical troubleshooting and resolving customer queries.
Knowledge of ad serving basics, and knowledge of computer languages such as HTML, JavaScript.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while paying strict attention to detail.
Demonstrated capacity to lead and motivate others around you.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

text:
The gTech Ads team plays a critical role in Google's success, supporting Sales teams, advertisers, and products that enhance business growth by consistently providing scalable product solutions, reliable information based on efficient, consultative analysis, and timely communications. 

As Product Operations Manager, you will collaborate with product management, engineering and sales, to proactively improve the serviceability of Ads products by evaluating product readiness, identifying product gaps, and consolidating product feedback. We are the single point of accountability within gTech to our product and Sales counterparts for the success of the product lifecycle.Responsibilities
Become an expert in one or more advertising products and propagate knowledge to the rest of product operations and services team by providing guidance and sharing best practices.
Compile serviceability assessments to identify gaps and provide feedback to product and engineering. Project manage serviceability of products through entire lifecycle.
Manage the release readiness/defining service model requirements for product launches. Build escalation paths and analyze data to identify improvement opportunities and build supporting business case to product and engineering.
Organize testing of new products and features including User Acceptance Testing. Drive global feature prioritization, process improvements, and tools requirements to improve product serviceability.
Develop effective partnerships with multiple stakeholders to gather product feedback and to drive insights to product and engineering. Communicate product releases and support infrastructure to gTech Ads.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of related work experience.
3 years of experience in product commercialization support or product/program management or sales strategy and operations.
Preferred qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or MBA degree.
Solid understanding of Internet technologies, e.g. HTTP, JavaScript, HTML, AJAX, Flash, cookies, XML etc. Strong design and coding skills in C, C++, Java, Python, Lisp, or relevant programming.
Strong track record in technical roles with Product Management and Engineering. Working knowledge of programming.
Knowledge of advertising market or online ads landscape.
Proven ability to interface and influence Product Management/Engineering teams and partner closely with other cross-functional stakeholders.
Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. Comfortable with internet technologies and working in a fast-paced and fast-changing environment.
title: Product Operations Manager (gTech Ads)

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Merchandising Manager Apps, Southeast Asia and India, Google Play - Tokyo.As a Merchandising Manager in EMEA, you will help build and maintain Google Play's merchandising program on handsets, web and tablets. Based on your digital content retail experience, you will coordinate and launch effective online features and promotions. You bring to the table strong retail instincts, sharp analytical abilities, and impeccable oral and written communication skills. You are comfortable working cross-functionally with product, design, marketing, engineering, and other teams to develop an innovative user experience. It’s important that you be able to work both independently and collaboratively to develop new content features and scalable merchandising processes. You’ll also have a track record for successful prioritization, meeting critical deadlines, and enthusiastically tackling challenges with an eye toward problem solving.
The Global Merchandising Team owns content programming within the Play Store across all regions and verticals (Apps, Games, Music, Movies & TV, and Books & Magazines). As a Merchandising Manager for Google Play, you will impact millions of users everyday by owning merchandising efforts end-to-end for the Apps vertical within your market(s). You will be the expert on the content, user needs, and the local ecosystem. You will work with Merchandisers from other verticals on country strategy, Business Development on understanding needs of strategic partners, and Product & Engineering on supporting new platform capabilities. You will set the strategy for and execute against merchandising and retail promotions for the Apps vertical while continually analyzing performance metrics and optimizing the user experience. You bring extensive Apps experience in an online or mobile business; a fanatical devotion to the user; superb organization and communication skills; and a track record of beating traffic, conversion and business growth goals.Responsibilities
Set country merchandising strategy for the Apps vertical and execute against the global plan
Analyze internal data, market research and industry trends to select content to promote
Drive strategy for content partner co-­promotion opportunities; work with Business Development team and content owners to secure exclusives for Apps vertical
Develop user insight for the Apps vertical, including understanding of customer lifecycles and segments

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in an Apps focused role for merchandising, marketing, or partnerships role in an online commerce or digital content business.

Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience working in function or a company focused on mobile.
Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze research or performance data and apply that analysis to optimize merchandising strategy.
Ability to work with partners to develop co­-promotion or cross-­promotion strategies and campaigns.
Ability to advise on strategies and product requirements to enhance merchandising capabilities.
Strong communication skills and collaborative working approach.
title: Merchandising Manager Apps, Southeast Asia and India, Google Play

text:
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a Sales manager, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.
As a Small and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales Agency Lead, you are responsible for SMB relationships and will spearhead the sales engagement with major SMB agencies in the market. You enable your team to always reach for ambitious performance goals. You and your team work with a wide variety of top SMB agencies delivering the optimal advertising solution for every partner and their clients. Your knowledge of agency landscape, online media, combined with your sales skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing agency business grow. Engaging with executives in key SMB managed agencies, you set the vision and the strategy for how they can grow and transform their business.Responsibilities
Take responsibility for and strengthen executive-level agency relations through key C-level meetings and speaking engagements. Deliver business growth, engagement and client satisfaction targets for a portfolio of top SMB managed agencies in the market.
Recruit, retain and lead the team of SMB sales agency development managers and Agency account strategists, to ensure improved same-store-growth, high agency satisfaction and enhanced portfolio health.
Coach a high-performing team and help them engage with senior stakeholders in the top SMB agencies. Build and actively manage effective long-term agency planning process.
Define the future of at-scale agency management and help develop necessary infrastructure and processes. Initiate and run strategic initiatives to further develop new and existing SMB agency business.
Work closely with country head and in-country agency leads to align with regard to the global SMB Sales priorities.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in building relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Experience in sales delivery/client engagement, operations and partner management.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in digital marketing with platforms, agencies and Partners.
Ability to influence team members and senior stakeholder management.
Demonstrated diverse cultural understanding and be comfortable working with global teams. Deep knowledge of digital media.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong people management skills.
Ability to speak and write in English and Dutch fluently and idiomatically.
title: SMB Sales Agency Lead, Benelux

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. As the Carrier Sales Manager you will be charged with building the Android and Chrome presence through carrier partners and retailer channels to ensure success of Google devices and ecosystems. You will partner cross-functionally with the marketing teams, the partnership group and the product organization at Google. Your performance will be measured by successful product launches, device sales and ongoing development of strategic partner relationships. Lead all aspects of our relationships with our key strategic partners, driving new opportunities for hardware and product distribution.
