text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
As an Online Partnerships Group Account Manager, you will provide strategic account and relationship management to a portfolio of customers that includes many well-known brand sites. You will be responsible for driving our business forward by promoting the full Google suite of publisher and developer products. The primary online advertising solutions you will be promoting are AdSense and the Ad Exchange for desktop publishers, and AdMob for mobile publishers/apps developers. A key focus will be providing the right product mix for a partner across the full range of his/her online properties. You will organize and execute on Online Partnerships Group Partner events, build new partnerships with key online companies in the market and develop innovative new ways to help partners grow with Google. You’ll also contribute to the development of strategies for the market.Responsibilities
Build trusted, strategic relationships with partners and develop a thorough understanding of their business challenges.
Add value to our partners' business by proposing optimal Google solutions.
Provide creative ways for partners to improve their business with Google’s solutions.
Cross-promote new products or features that will have a positive impact on partner investments.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write English and German fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in publisher yield management, ad operations and/or sales/account management.
Knowledge of and a keen interest in online display and mobile advertising.
Detail-oriented and analytical with the ability to prioritize, plan and organize sales activity.
title: Account Manager (German), Online Partnerships Group

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
The Project Wing team is developing an aerial delivery system based on self-flying aircraft (UAVs) operating in commercial air space. Join us as we revolutionize aviation and delivery.

As a Guidance, Navigation, and Control (GNC) engineer for Project Wing, you have excellent technical education and experience in aircraft dynamics, simulation, estimation, and control theory. You also have an outstanding track record of successful development of complex automatic navigation and control systems solutions from concept through successful deployment of the technology into the marketplace. You are versatile and have a proven ability to work within teams of highly talented, diverse GNC engineers through solving tough controls and navigation technology problems that enable valuable business solutions. 

Your primary responsibility includes developing and deploying GNC solutions that enable highly reliable operations of UAVs in cluttered environments with obstacles and air traffic. You are skilled at collaborating with all other Engineering domains' team members to invent and create efficient technological solutions with creative and prolific skill. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive technology development at Google[x] speed.
Responsibilities
Create innovative, reliable, and efficient solutions to enable new and challenging aircraft capabilities in the area of flight control and multi-sensor state estimation.
Have ownership and cognizance of GNC systems throughout the complete development lifecycle, from initial idea to system deployment.
Work closely with systems engineering and a multidisciplinary team to ensure high level performance goals are met.
Perform detailed GNC analyses of system designs and research and development test data, communicate these results to the Project Wing team and external partners and agencies.
Support of development and execution of GNC system integration and test efforts, including flight test.

Minimum qualifications
MS degree in Controls Engineering (or similar) or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in GNC technology including simulation, aircraft dynamics/control, and state estimation.
Preferred qualifications
PhD in Controls Engineering (or similar) or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in bringing a UAV GNC solution to certification by an aviation regulatory agency.
Experience in developing flight critical and safety critical UAV GNC solutions, including redundancy architectures
Strong expertise on all aspects of automation and autonomous systems, with demonstrated technical depth in simulation, aircraft dynamics and control, state estimation and multi-sensor navigation system development, and single- and multi-vehicle path planning.
title: Flight Control, Guidance and Navigation Engineer (Project Wing), Special Projects

text:
Our thirst for technology is a part of everything we do. The Data Center Engineering team takes the physical design of our data centers into the future. Our lab mirrors a research and development department -- cutting-edge strategies are born, tested and tested again. Along with a team of great minds, you tackle complex topics like how we use power or how to run state-of-the-art, environmentally-friendly facilities. You're a visionary who optimizes for efficiencies and never stops seeking improvements -- even small changes that can make a huge impact. You generate ideas, communicate recommendations to senior-level executives and drive implementation alongside facilities technicians.Through your leadership, you use your technical expertise to lead cross-functional teams to develop infrastructure improvements. You manage a team of engineers and assign Googlers to projects based on their capabilities and the project's demands.
You are a proven leader who will be responsible for the development of critical system power distribution infrastructure in HV/MV/LV range, including load calculation, equipment sizing and equipment customization. 

You will have in-depth knowledge in the application of utility, UPS and power generation, including the ability to provide analysis on system stability, and transient evaluation and mitigation techniques on perceived issues.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to demonstrate hands-on hardware design as well as manage a highly cross-functional team of electrical engineers to solve some of the most challenging and novel problems. Also, you will partner with business groups and internal customers to develop new technology to improve the overall efficiency of the our computing infrastructure.Responsibilities
Manage a team of electrical engineers within an innovative and fast paced environment. Be responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of complex technical projects.
Contribute technically to projects in terms of overall architecture, design and development, communication and cross-functional management across the organization. Research new designs, materials, technologies and construction methods of data center infrastructure. Carry new design concepts through exploration, development and into mass production.
Define data center system-level architectures, specify performance requirements and create accurate conceptual design and programming requirements documentation. Produce analyses that ensure designs satisfy requirements, including predicted performance and power quality concerns.
Work closely with platforms hardware designers to optimize the interfaces between the IT equipment and the facility. Define/create the interface infrastructure between the facility and the IT equipment with a view for optimizing utilization, and minimizing the total cost of ownershipand travel to data center sites for engineering evaluations, electrical systems audits, startup testing and full commissioning as required.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of work experience in power and electrical engineering projects for data center research and development.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree or PhD in Electrical Engineering.
10 years of experience in electrical engineering and 5 years of experience with mission critical facilities.
Experience in power system reliability, risk assessment studies and in multiple or all of the areas of high voltage utility connections, customer substations, back-up generators, distribution transformers, switchgear, low voltage systems, UPS, protection systems, power quality, electrical monitoring and control systems.
Involvement in special projects including input into upcoming system architectures as well as the ability to troubleshoot and perform complex business case analyses.
Expert in everything electrical in the area of data center engineering.
title: Technical Lead Manager, Electrical Engineer, Data Center R&D

text:
At Google, we don't shy away from big, crazy ideas--and that's not just in our products. We aim to foster the healthiest workforce on the planet and our Benefits team is behind the wheel, driving these efforts. From retirement planning to financial literacy courses to healthy living campaigns, our Benefits team runs programs that are designed to keep our global Googlers healthy and happy. With more than 60 offices across the world, you're able to swiftly maneuver through the complexity of serving different legal and cultural practices, while also finding creative opportunities for giving our Googlers equitable support. You'll build an understanding of what "wellness' truly means to each Googler, and implement innovative programs as the population of Googlers grows in size and diversity. You are a mission-driven, enthusiastic team player with the creativity to develop and manage benefits programs.
As an Accommodation Specialist, you’ll manage all local disability accommodations for Googlers and candidates with disabilities, including managing vendor relationships. You’ll partner closely with different teams to deliver training, resources and processes. You think holistically and strategically about disability accommodations and are able to multi-task. You establish solid working relationships with peers, cross functional teams, and vendors. You are a team player who is able to cultivate and influence relationships, and you will provide oversight and administration of local disability law, evaluations, and disability accommodations.Responsibilities
Be responsible for activities related with leave of absences, accessibility, worker related injuries, accommodations requests including communications, onboarding Nooglers with disabilities, evaluation, training, tracking, return to work plans, and guidelines for extended leaves. Manage confidential information appropriately.
Provide custom benchmarking across accommodations, assess industry trends, and maintain up-to-date working knowledge of accommodation laws within EMEA. Keep abreast of the current changes in the laws by attending seminars and utilizing the internet and periodicals.
Provide appropriate training to cross-functional teams such as Staffing, Technical Support and HR Business Partners (HRBPs).
Partner with and support Diversity, Staffing, Health and Safety, Employment Legal and HRBPs on all things accommodations/accessibility related.
Handle escalations around all benefit situations and work directly with Googlers, managers, HRBPs, and legal to resolve complex situations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Relevant experience in HR, Consulting or Business.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in managing vendor relations.
Experience in accommodations, return to work processes and knowledge in different accommodation laws.
Experience working in a team environment, while also being able to work independently.
Able to think strategically while managing details.
Very strong analytical skills with ability to analyze metrics, research, and trends.
Skilled at establishing relationships and working collaboratively across multiple offices, geographies, and worldwide time zones often via email and video.
title: Disability Accommodation Specialist
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.As a Product Quality Associate you defend the integrity of Google, its users and partners worldwide by defining and communicating product policies, fighting spam, fraud, and abuse across Google products (Google Search, Google Maps, AdWords, AdSense, Google Checkout, Google Product Search). You are proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, innovative--and able to work well in a fast-paced, global, cross-functional, and team-oriented environment while demonstrating technical know-how, effective communication and getting things done.Responsibilities
Investigate, identify, and prevent/remove product quality issues by reviewing accounts, transactions, user-generated content, advertisements, local business listings, and/or search results in order to enforce product-specific policies.
Identify market trends, identify product vulnerabilities, and recommend strategy adjustments based on market trends and patterns.
Lead and participate in special projects/initiatives: innovate and implement large-scale quality improvements to processes and/or systems by conducting data analyses and making recommendations, troubleshooting technical issues, and refining processes around customer support and product expansion. Increase efficiency through processes and system enhancements.
Manage and respond to escalations from internal and external parties within designated service levels as appropriate. May collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Engineering and Product by exposing product vulnerabilities and providing feedback on systems/tools/process in order to increase automation while providing a better experience for our users.
Become an expert in product quality and educate internal and external users on best practices for improving quality of Google products.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related discipline or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Spanish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with fraud investigations, fraud risk management, Internet advertising, or e-commerce.
Programming skills (SQL/C/C++/Python/PHP).
Fundamental understanding of HTML and JavaScript and familiarity with typical web practices.
Ability to identify workflow pain points and optimize or scale processes.
Solid understanding of how the Internet works economically, socially, and technically.
title: Product Quality Analyst (Spanish)

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Account Executive (AE), you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions. Google has become a leader in this space because we've developed effective products and services targeted to marketers and consumers. The primary responsibility of the AE is to drive and grow new business with Google’s top advertisers. You'll manage business relationships within one of our top accounts to ensure that clients' needs and requirements are met. This will require you to serve as their advocate within Google while collaborating with other Google teams to provide them with a comprehensive portfolio of solutions and options. This is a client-facing sales role requiring deep industry expertise, proven ability and a broad base of industry contacts. A country level AE plays more of a cross-market role to drive global and regional strategy for leading companies. This role will involve travel.Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with a team to drive growth with new and existing customers.
Build and foster long term C-Level relationships with regional client decision makers, as well as their agency counterparts, to be able to build and carry out long-term digital strategies and optimize their advertising investment.
Develop and manage global and/or regional Joint Business Plans across various Google products and services, countries, and channels, working in partnership with local AEs and regional/global team members. Generate business plans to define your strategies and tactics.
Support client(s) with the creation of global/regional large scale advertising programs (e.g., global sponsorship campaigns, cross-market product launch or brand campaigns). Manage multiple cross-product opportunities and projects.
Develop scalable and leading edge solutions for client(s) in order to maximize their use of Google products (Search, Video, Display, Mobile, etc.).
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience in an advertising sales, business development and/or online media environment.
3 years of leadership experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working with advertisers, agencies and/or clients.
Demonstrated ability to motivate and cultivate a results-oriented team.
Knowledge of and established relationships within the advertising industry and the relevant industry vertical.
Knowledge of traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
A deep understanding of the digital industry's issues, a vision for its growth, and a commitment to advance Google's forward-looking strategies within the marketplace.
title: Account Executive, Automotive Vertical, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
The gTech Ads team is a solution-generating force that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.
The Google Technical Services Team (gTech) enables all of Google businesses with advertisers, partners, publishers and users. We do so by providing technical services, tools and operations throughout the lifecycle, from the technical aspects of sales to troubleshooting.
gTech Ads is our group focused on advertising, which lives by the mission: "make it easy to run ads with Google." We offer both high touch technical services to large advertisers and scaled services to advertisers of all sizes. Our high touch services include technical design of customized solutions, implementation of complex ads products, trafficking media products, and troubleshooting.

Collect requirements and provide guidance and best practices to apply ad products and technologies to achieve advertisers' business goals.
Design and implement complex and customized solutions with a client in their portfolio.
Oversee end-to-end implementations and escalations handled by other Google teams for named accounts.

2 years of experience working with customer engagements (e.g., project management, technical sales, ad operations, etc.).

Preferred qualifications
MS or MBA degree.
Experience with programming and scripting.
Experience in the online advertising industry.
General knowledge of web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript and HTTP. Creative problem-solving and strong analytical skills.
Ability to translate complex product and technical concepts to non-technical and executive audiences.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Map product strategy to Enterprise stakeholder requests (e.g. Support and Field Sales), communicate product roadmap to internal stakeholders, external partners and customers (i.e. via web conferencing or in-person at customer meetings, live events, and other internal/external forums) and maintain our short and long-term roadmap.
Maximize product launch results by working with Product Management and Field Sales to define effective launch goals, identify and prioritize launch strategies, assess organizational readiness, and measure post-launch results.
Work with Product Management to understand product strategy and associated projects and provide regular feedback to Product Management about the state of the market, ensuring that Sales, Marketing and Product Management are not isolated from changes in the marketplace.

Preferred qualifications

4 years of experience in a solutions sales or business development role. 4 years of experience with product or strategy, such as product management or management consulting.

text:
At Google, we aim to foster Googley work environments that are collaborative, friendly and fun. The Facilities Management team brings our spaces to life as you oversee the daily operations of our offices. While roles with similar names at other companies can be far more mundane, you're a creative, organized customer service specialist, who takes pride in seeing things run smoothly and efficiently. You go out of your way to make sure your clients are not only satisfied, but singing Google's praises. You're comfortable in a fast-paced environment with the highest standards of excellence. You aren't afraid to have fun with your job, and bring an enthusiasm, dedication and a collaborative spirit to build and maintain office spaces that facilitate some of the world's most cutting edge innovation.
As Head of Campus Facilities, you will have a key leadership role within Real Estate and Workplace Services (REWS), acting as the bridge between the REWS team and Google’s senior management, working to build strong and trusted relationships. You are responsible for connecting resources across REWS to create amazing environments and outcomes for our senior leaders and their extended teams. You facilitate high-level strategic discussions across REWS’ business areas, including real estate, operations, finance, public affairs, and culture. You must build trust in difficult situations, get buy-in and consensus from leaders with diverse opinions, drive decision making where trade-offs are required, and keep information circulating so that REWS can grow coherently as Google expands. 

You will lead the facilities operations and property management teams, as well as collaborate with cross-functional partners such as real estate, security, safety, and food teams. You will assist in cultivating a collaborative, friendly and fun work environment that fosters innovation and productivity. You will need to demonstrate a high level of management abilities, strategic thinking and leadership skills to effectively manage all aspects of the role. You will need to be motivated by autonomy and ownership, yet eager to report to other staff at all stages and work as part of a team.Responsibilities
Leverage broad expertise in REWS subject matter (including real estate, facilities operations, security, safety, employee perks, etc.) and in-depth collected knowledge from all of REWS’ subject matter experts to act as a single point of contact for REWS-related strategy and execution to senior business leaders.
Act as the Single Point of Insertion for all REWS functions at the NYC Campus. Act as a trusted partner, and build strong relationships with business leaders (and their delegates) through timely, relevant, thorough, and tailored communication.
Provide strategic direction and leadership to the facilities team who oversee both building operations (repairs and maintenance, HVAC, janitorial, etc.) and manage the daily operations of the site (reception and mail services, occupancy planning and moves, EHS programs, etc) Be responsible for building management contract for owned asset, including financial and asset management, as well as tenant services.
Create and implement programs the impact and add value to the REWS organization as a whole. Delegate as needed.
Build strong relationships and partner with employees at all levels to enhance the end user experience, including speaking to large internal groups. Communicate departmental mission and strategies to executive management. Work cross-functionally with other internal support organizations, such as IT, HR, Finance and Legal to ensure cohesive delivery of services.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
9 years of combined facilities management experience and real estate project management experience, and service experience with an emphasis on facilities, hospitality, property management, or equivalent office management experience with a multinational organization.
Preferred qualifications
Advanced strategic and operational facilities/property management or real estate project management experience, together with the ability to work in a collaborative environment.
Extensive experience developing and managing budgets with strong financial, vendor and contract management skills. Understanding and knowledge of industry trends and direction.
Enhanced experience collaborating with other business units to meet company goals and standards. Advanced people management and leadership skills.
Ability to meet deadlines and make sound decisions, sometimes under stress. Proven record of effecting strategic change and initiatives where prudent.
Proven ability to interact and work cross functionally within a large organization. Proven ability to influence at all levels.
Ability to think "out of the box" and bring creative, nonstandard, and innovative solutions to the table.
title: Head of Campus Facilities

text:
The Partner Solutions team empowers the ecosystem across Sales, Product and Partners to make Google Shopping work. We provide end-to-end technical, operational and relationship support for partners working with Google Shopping. This includes influencing product strategy, developing scalable product tools, helping onboard new partners, providing technical implementation services to some of the most strategic partners and ongoing partner management.
As a Partner Operations Manager, you will be responsible for the end-to-end relationship with our partners from onboarding to optimization, and be the "voice of the partner" in feature prioritization discussions. This includes working closely with internal teams to create and streamline sales and operational processes, develop detailed documentation and process diagrams, assist partners with their questions and concerns, and increase the overall efficiency of how we implement our products.
Responsibilities
Work with the technical teams, business development and sales to onboard new partners and improve the overall onboarding process.
Ensure success of all partnerships, internally and externally, by ensuring smooth integration during product and feature launches.
Provide high touch account management with strategic partners for partner education, technical troubleshooting, and support within defined Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
Work with Partner Technology Managers and Product Managers to define and prioritize new tools and product feature requests required to improve Operations team processes and performance.
Define, establish, measure and report on metrics across all Operations functions including customer SLAs, support volumes, new merchant launches, merchant turnover, and other related operational metrics.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of project management experience working across cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications
Master's degree or MBA.
6 years of related industry experience; background in retail operations.
Experience leading and implementing high-impact projects with cross-functional teams. Change management experience managing external partners/accounts.
Proven ability to manage multiple, time-sensitive projects and competing priorities simultaneously, work independently and drive projects to completion with minimum guidance and high attention to detail.
Ability to streamline complex processes and implement workflows designed to increase efficiency.
Excellent oral/written communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills. Strong project or program management skills.
title: Partner Operations Manager, Shopping

text:

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
Research is not treated as a separate activity at Google – it happens across the company, on many different teams. This means there is a blurry line between “research” and “product development.” Engineering and research projects alike are done by small teams on a rapid schedule. At Google, we encourage organizational flexibility and the free flow of information within the company (and often outside of the company as well). Nearly all projects at Google are “bottom-up” efforts, started by a few Googlers who want to address a new problem. This team is such a team, trying to revolutionize construction techniques in telecom. 

The Google Fiber Build Labs team is dedicated to driving down the cost of FTTH (Fiber to the Home) deployment and increasing its speed. As a senior engineer for Build Labs, you have excellent technical education and experience in oil and gas drilling, mechanical engineering, electrical engineering or material sciences. You also have an outstanding track record of successful development of complex solutions from concept through successful deployment of the technology into the marketplace. In this role you will be part of a unique incubation environment that spans research, engineering, product and design. You will bring ideas from the top of the funnel through rapid design and prototyping, using strong technical grounding and an intuitive sense of “good” design. 

You understand the constraints imposed by the need for technical solutions to also deliver sound business value. You are skilled at collaborating with all other Engineering domains' team members to develop technological solutions with creative and prolific skill. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive technology development at Google speed. This is an opportunity to solve interesting and challenging problems!Responsibilities
Develop all technology and implementation aspects for faster and cheaper FTTH construction techniques.
Work closely with program managers to ensure performance to schedule and budget, while successfully accomplishing technical milestones and performance metrics.
Develop and manage the technology and implementation roadmap in collaboration with the rest of the build team including Engineering and cross-functional teams to support our goals and strategies.
Design and fabricate test fixtures and test machines. Oversee planning, coordinating, and running tests and be responsible for recording and analyzing data.
Minimum qualifications
PhD in Mechatronics, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in robotics, project leadership and mentoring.
Engineering experience in building and testing own designs.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of experience in technology and product development, deployment and transition into full rate production.
Experience in mechanical test equipment, instrumentation, and data acquisition.
Hands-on experience in a shop, working with mills and lathes and other tools.
Knowledge of CAD (NX, NX Nastran, SOLIDWORKS). MATLAB, spreadsheet software or similar scripting/analysis tool capability. Good analytical abilities.
Proven track record developing new technology with willingness to jump in and get hands dirty.
Good communication, attention to detail, and organization skills. Willing to learn and operate in a fast paced environment with shifting priorities. Self directed.
title: Build Labs Engineer, Google Fiber

text:

The main focus will be on brand marketing and the opportunities on YouTube. The opportunity involves a mix of finding and managing new and existing business relationships and working closely with the Agency Head to develop Google's marketplace inside the agencies and on the media plans. You'll combine digital media and deep commercial knowledge with strong presentation and communication skills. You'll manage the relationships with agencies, and targeting, educating and developing new agencies. This means you have excellent client-servicing and relationship building skills along with the entrepreneurial drive to approach new and existing agencies and their clients with large, multi-faceted media propositions.Responsibilities

Analyze data, trends and agency performance, develop solid strategic sales plans and prepare and conduct presentations.

Champion new product releases, internally and externally.

BA/BS degree or equivalent experience.
Sales and/or media-planning experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Danish fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Experience in a fast-paced media environment.
Considerable experience selling or consulting within the media and agency space.
Substantial experience in business development, client relationship and media-planning.
Established and broad network of contacts in the Danish media industry.
Solid understanding of traditional media and online.

text:
As a the Development Production and Procurement Manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
From the beginning, Google has focused on providing the best user experiences possible. Whether we’re designing a new Internet browser, a tweak to the look of our homepage or the introduction of a retail installation, we take great care to ensure that our efforts will ultimately serve our users and customers well. At Google, we see being great at something as a starting point, not an endpoint. We set ourselves goals we know we can’t reach. Yet. By stretching to meet these goals, we inevitably get further than we expected. Through innovation and iteration, we aim to take things that work well and improve upon them in unexpected ways.

For the Retail Marketing team, our very simple goal is to bring the best of Google innovation - from products and services to partnerships and brand experiences - to even more people around the world. We work internally with teams across the Google organization, as well as in close collaboration with outside retailers, operators, manufacturers and many others, to bring our shared vision to life. Our Retail team are a group of entrepreneurs dedicated to delivering the ultimate pathways for customers to experience the magic of Google. You will be responsible for successfully transforming completed designs into final prototypes supporting Google’s efforts in 3rd party retail / telco environments.

If you have a passion for creating amazing customer experiences and for technology - and want to join a fast-growing team as we embark on this revolutionary journey - then this might be the place for you.Responsibilities
Oversee the development of all three dimensional projects
Lead fixture development, production and procurement of three dimensional projects and understanding the global context, insight, and design realities at retail
Partner closely with the Retail Design and Programs Team, gTech (Operations), manufacturers/installers and is expected to ensure all fixtures and three dimension objects are completed to the highest standard
Communicate any obstacles effectively that would prevent concepts from translating into multiple retail/carrier locations
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications
10 years of fixture production, store development experience with an agency or at a consulting firm with a well-known brand.
Retail design industry/environments and fixture design experience.
Proven ability to perform and apply engineering/production skills.
Proven ability to deliver large complex fixture programs globally.
title: Development Production and Procurement Manager, Google Retail

text:
The Internal Audit team's mission is to call attention to risks and drive actions to address those risks to protect Google and Googlers. The team partners with business and engineering groups to identify areas of risk, make valuable recommendations on controls, and influence changes and decisions. As a member of the team, you’ll have the opportunity to advise on system implementations, product launches and other business initiatives. You enjoy working in a dynamic environment, are passionate about technology, and are able to focus on problems at hand and the details that come with it.
You will conduct forensic audits and/or internal investigations with close coordination with legal, human resources and compliance. Areas of focus include: fraud, embezzlement, conflict of interest, collusion and kickbacks, records falsification and FCPA/anti-bribery. You are a risk master; you intuitively understand processes and are quick to pinpoint risks and gaps. Using these skills, you will provide forensic data analysis, as well as support investigative interviews with company employees, vendors and partners. You communicate clearly, are a self-starter, have exceptional project management skills and attention to detail, and display excellent ethical and business judgment.
Responsibilities
Collect and analyze data to assist in the evaluation of allegations of fraud/irregularities. Apply forensic auditing techniques to identify atypical transactions, deals or behavior.
Participate in fact-finding and admission-seeking interviews. Prepare interview notes and summaries.
Draft concise and timely investigation reports for management.
Identify and define process and control issues and root causes; provide effective recommendations to the business to prevent future issues.
Maintain a database of investigations and analyze data to identify trends to be escalated to the senior management/audit committee.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in finance, accounting or business, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of work experience in an audit, investigations, compliance, security or similar function.
Preferred qualifications
Forensic accounting or investigative experience, including CPA and/or CFE credentials; working knowledge and experience with basic interview techniques for both fact-findings and admission-seeking interviews.
Experience collecting, managing and synthesizing large and complex data sets and information from disparate sources. Exceptional interpersonal skills and a commitment to professionalism and collegiality.
Ability and willingness to take initiative to address problems and make continuous process improvements; ability to independently drive multiple investigations to resolution and handle a large workload.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
title: Internal Audit, Forensic Analyst

text:
As a member of the Global Communications & Public Affairs team, you will work cross-functionally to help communicate with journalists and other thought leaders; devise specific communications materials and campaigns based on understanding of journalists' interests; engage in face-to-face meetings with commentators and other opinion formers; develop print and web-based material supporting these campaigns; and counter misinformation that might interfere with our business and ability to serve our users. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more.Responsibilities
Take responsibility for all communications activities for Google in Mexico.
Represent Google as a company spokesperson for a wide variety of media and blogger inquiries.
Collaborate with Google Engineering, Product, Sales, and Marketing teams to create compelling communications strategies that illustrate the functionality and key benefits of our consumer and advertising products.
Develop close, productive relationships with journalists, bloggers, product reviewers and our key partners in Mexico.
Develop written materials, including story pitches, messaging guidelines, press releases, Q&As, presentations and speeches.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Journalism or Public Relations or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant work experience
Preferred qualifications
Demonstrated ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high-stress environments, as well as ability to escalate appropriately.
Ability to think, plan and execute on multiple projects simultaneously in an organized fashion.
Ability to work with colleagues in different countries and appreciate cultural differences.
Excellent communication skills.
title: Communications Associate

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.Responsibilities
Create hardware block diagrams and design specification documents.
Own board schematic design for complex systems such as multi-layer high speed gigabit buses, interconnects, and optical interfaces.
Implement complex FPGA design using Verilog HDL tools such as Xilinx or Altera.
Develop hardware engineering and qualification test plans for different design phases, and HALT test and screening.
Perform DVT design verification, test, and high speed signal integrity analysis such as ISI characterization.
Minimum qualifications
MS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of hardware high speed board design, board bring-up experience, devices and interconnects such as PCI/PCI-X, PCIe, DDR2/3, XAUI, SERDES, SPI, I2C, MDIO.
Experience with C/C++, and assembly language programming.
Experience with schematic symbol creation for different packages such as dense uBGA, CSP, and custom parts.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with high volume consumer products design.
Experience with shipping volume products and very familiar with MTBF analysis, and DFM/DFT guidelines.
Understanding of manufacturing process flows such as SMT, ICT/JTAG, board functional tests, and system integration.
Familiar with consumer networking and multimedia functions such as Wi-Fi, USB, e/SATA, and HDMI.
Familiar with embedded Linux designs, and in-system tests such as POST, BIST, and diagnostics.
title: Hardware Engineer, Google Fiber

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
As an Android Partnerships team member, you're doing the negotiations that keep Android's meteoric growth going. You work closely with Android Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Legal teams on new initiatives and key strategic relationships. You don't just execute; you're a true thought leader who can see multiple steps ahead and identify industry trends and key influencers. Empowered to chart your own path, you run the process from start to finish. You open doors with potential partners, lead exploratory talks with them.

You are responsible for leading and negotiating Android-related distribution for Google services with manufacturers, mobile networks, electronics retailers, and other entities participating in the creation and distribution of Android devices and services. Initially focused on smartphones and tablets, the role offers the opportunity to work with industry leading Google partners to secure broad distribution of Android devices with Google services and then manage and nurture those relationships on an ongoing basis. You will be able to work autonomously but also collaboratively with Product, Engineering, Legal, and other partner-facing teams to initiate, support and grow your partner accounts.
Responsibilities
Open doors with potential partners, lead exploratory talks, build consensus with Senior executives internal and external to Google, negotiate complex strategic partnerships that are often first-of-its-kind
Drive and execute distribution negotiations for Google services on Android devices.
Identify and prioritize partner targets; become an expert on each target’s organization, business model, and strategic priorities.
Build and nurture strong relationships with third parties, working directly with some partners and through “one-to-many” models to reach large partner ecosystems.
Serve as the ongoing Android relationship manager helping to realize and optimize value from the partnership.
Minimum qualifications
12 years of experience in the mobile industry across mobile device, mobile operator, and/or related start-ups with international experience across Partner Management activities.
Experience with mobile carriers, mobile or consumer electronics manufacturers, and retailers.
Combined technical and product experience across the mobile space whilst delivering high value outcomes for partners.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with ongoing partner relationship management; ability to serve as an advocate for your accounts internally and work collaboratively to identify opportunities or resolve issues.
Strong negotiator with a partnership approach; ability to represent Google in discussions and structure terms to achieve strong ongoing partner alignment.
Ability to interpret legal documents and work with attorneys on specific contract language.
Fluency in asian languages highly.

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As a Google Analytical Lead, you will work with the largest advertising agencies and clients. You'll work as a team member on Google's industry-focused Sales teams exchanging knowledge regarding client and agency needs within specific industry sectors. You will work with Account Planning and Marketing to pitch integrated, data-driven business opportunities based on internal and external tools analysis. You will also work with Account Management and Account Executives to identify business opportunities, such as keyword expansion, improved account structures and ad text.Responsibilities
Develop forward thinking, data-driven recommendations that align with client marketing objectives.
Quantify high impact opportunities with clear traffic, performance and budget recommendations and pitch to clients when applicable.
Partner with sales and sales operations to develop and test tools, templates and frameworks to streamline and scale client analyses.
Collaborate with the agency team to educate and train clients and agencies on how to architect and optimize AdWords campaigns.
Oversee the work of the Account Optimizer to help identify and implement recommendations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of analytical work, working with data to identify trends and make recommendations in investment banking or consulting.
Proficiency with spreadsheet and presentation software.
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Proven ability to work cooperatively and proactively with staff inside and outside the department.
Demonstrated excellence in writing and verbal communication.
title: Analytical Lead, Healthcare Vertical

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Alongside our support and troubleshooting work, we partner with Sales, Product Management and Engineering to focus on developing innovative, scalable support solutions that effectively serve our growing customer base. 

As a Support Specialist, you will work closely with advertisers and the global Sales teams to drive troubleshooting, and implementation support. In this role you will become an expert, focused on handling troubleshooting and/or implementation tasks so that the Sales teams can concentrate their efforts on client-specific activities. This is a specialist role focused on providing the highest quality of support to both our Sales teams and the advertisers they work with.Responsibilities
Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service via troubleshooting and resolving issues from Sales teams and Google's advertisers.
Manage customer inquiries by live chat, tickets, and other channels.
Work directly with large advertisers as well as internal Sales teams.
Contribute to the development of internal products. Carry out one-off projects as required for large advertisers.

Customer focused with client facing experience.
Familiarity with the ad serving industry and internet technologies (JavaScript, HTML, Flash).
Extremely proactive, organized, responsible, with the proven ability to work well with a team.
Strong communication skills.
title: Support Specialist, gTech Ads (Thai, Vietnamese or Indonesian)

text:
When leading companies decide to "go Google," it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. But the Google for Work Sales team can't do it alone. Once educational institutions, government agencies and other businesses sign on to use Google for Work products to make their work more productive, mobile and collaborative, you come in. As a Google for Work Sales Engineer, you assist fellow Sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the Product Marketing Management and Engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google for Work products.
Many of our prospects are looking to resolve business challenges and compete by using modern cloud-based Google technologies – working from anywhere, on any device. As a Sales Engineer, you have skills in drawing out and identifying the challenges these businesses face, and then looking to identify how Google solutions can resolve these challenges.Responsibilities
Engage with prospects, prepare and present demonstrations of Google products, and address technical questions that arise throughout the business process.
Work closely with our product, support, engineering, and sales teams.
Lead the technical track of the agreement, including such activities as supporting responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of supporting technical resources.
Work hands-on with Google for Work's Apps products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Experience serving in a pre-sales capacity or experience in a customer facing role working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team.
Excellent communicator who has experience presenting to different audiences.
Ability to identify customer business requirements, and resolve these with cloud-based solutions.
In-depth knowledge of web and related technologies (HTTP, Basic/NTLM, cookies/sessions, XML/XSLT/XHTML/HTML), including a working knowledge of web application development and integration (REST, SOAP, J2EE, CGI/Java/ASP servlets).
Ability to speak and write in Dutch fluently and idiomatically.
title: Google for Work Sales Engineer, Google Apps

text:
As a Google Technical Lead/Manager, you have not only the technical skills to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty on major projects, but you're also able to manage a team of engineers. You them to grow, optimizing their code while working on your own as well. You have a strong background in software and web technologies, a strong track record in coding, and are highly technically accomplished. 
But more than that, you're a leader. You have the respect of your team, and are able to motivate them to learn new skill sets and to reach their full potential. You'll help them develop tools and platforms for Ads, monetization, e-commerce, Business Intelligence and smart monitoring. Although you'll have a team to rely on, you are ultimately the architect behind each of the technical projects you take on, and therefore responsible for determining a project's plan, implementation, and ultimately, its success.
ResponsibilitiesManage a team of software engineers, including iteration and task planning.Drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.Take responsibility for the overall planning, execution and success of complex technical projects.Contribute technically to projects.Work closely with Product Management team to ensure we're building the best products.Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related engineering field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience.
Programming experience in C++ and/or Java and/or Python.
Preferred qualificationsMS or PhD in Computer Science or closely related field.10 years of relevant industry experience, with 5 years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience (managing teams of 8 or more developers).Transaction processing, payments, and/or commerce experience.Experience shipping successful products.Strong distributed systems and architecture knowledge and experience with multi-tiered mission-critical systems.Strong leader capable of motivating and energizing the very best software engineers, as well as gaining their respect.
title: Technical Lead/Manager, gTech Software Engineering

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
As an RF Systems Engineer, you will join our embedded system design team building Consumer Electronics products. You will have a solid RF systems, hardware board design background, and experience building/shipping CE products. You will also have knowledge of system architecture. As an engineer on our team you will be directly involved in defining overall product architecture, design board, to achieve lowest possible cost and achieve best RF performance.Responsibilities
Define architecture, specification, design and test boards for innovative CE devices.
Design best in class RF (Wi-Fi, BT) system solutions supporting Wi-Fi, BT, WPAN.
Be responsible for antenna and board design for optimal RF performance.
Design for volume manufacturing at lowest cost.
Minimum qualifications
4 years of experience designing RF system solutions.
4 years of hardware architecture, high speed board design, board bring-up experience, devices and interconnects.
Experience of building and shipping CE products.
Experience with factory process and manufacturing.
Preferred qualifications
Knowledge of RF (Wi-Fi, BT) software stack.
Knowledge of Linux programming environments.
title: RF Systems Engineer

text:
As a Quality Assurance Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage various Engineering-specific programs and teams.
Google Life Sciences is focused on shifting health care from a reactive, undifferentiated approach to a proactive, targeted approach by transforming the detection, prevention, management, and even our basic understanding of disease. Google Life Sciences is looking for a Quality Assurance Manager to work directly with a team of experts from diverse fields, including biology, chemistry, physics, electrical engineering and computer science, to develop, manage, and enforce a robust quality function for Google Life Sciences.
Google's users demand the highest quality products. As a Quality Assurance Manager at Google Life Sciences you will be responsible for developing, managing, and maintaining a Quality Assurance/Quality Control Department at Google Life Sciences. You hold your team to the highest quality standards and ensure that all corporate standards, regulations, and other standards are met as applicable. You build processes and act as a liaison between teams to ensure that medical products are designed, developed, and built that allow us to deliver quality products to users.
Responsibilities
Develop, manage, adapt and maintain procedures, templates, forms, work instructions, and training materials that enable: Integration of existing quality and internal processes to applicable standards, innovation, training and development of team members and continuous demonstration of compliance with regulatory requirements.
Assess and assure quality of design, development, and manufacturing across the Life Sciences team and its products.
Perform QA services including audits, regulatory agency inspections, document review.
Prepare technical content for regulatory submissions.
Lead continuous and proactive improvements of the quality management function.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical or scientific field (e.g. Biochemistry, Biomedical, Electrical, or Chemical Engineering) or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of QA experience in medical devices.
Experience with FDA (21 CFR part 11, 21 CFR part 820), ISO (9001, 14385), IEC (62304, 60601), CE marking, Class II/Class III medical devices with software components.
Experience in Quality Assurance with management of a quality system, with experience establishing a quality system applicable to a range of medical device products. Experience managing quality engineers and other QA personnel.

Preferred qualifications
Experience working at FDA.
Experience interacting with contract manufacturers and/or contract test labs is highly desirable.
Experience working with interdisciplinary teams in fast-paced startup environments.
Expertise in Quality Assurance with day-to-day management of a quality system, including establishing a quality system applicable to a range of medical device products and experience managing quality engineers and other QA personnel.
title: Quality Assurance Manager (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.With your technical expertise, you build business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution.
You formulate recommended solutions, partnering with external technology providers and internal product teams to understand decision making and knowledge requirements. You also identify gaps and work with technology teams to ensure smooth deployment of solutions.Responsibilities
Participate in systems implementation projects (Technical Design, Solution Design, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution).
Deliver systems enhancements. Support and upgrade implemented systems.
Develop and deploy solutions to meet the business requirements on time with good quality.
Minimum qualificationsBA/BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent practical experience.Experience with Windchill PLM and PDM systems. Experience with configuration/customization of Windchill PLM across modules, including: PDMLink, ProjectLink and Workgroup Manager.Experience in Java/J2EE, Unix, XML, XSLT, SQL and PL/SQL, Windchill customizations/Integrations in designing and developing eCAD and mCAD integrations in/out of PLM.Experience with MCAD tools ( CREO, Solidworks, Vault Management )Preferred qualifications
Demonstrated ability and strong track record in developing and delivering business systems, technical requirements and process design/optimization.
Demonstrated top quartile performance, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
Domain knowledge in supply chain or related areas.
Ability to manage challenges & evolving changes in the areas of software design, integration, and infrastructure.
title: Application Developer, Windchill PDM

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Public Policy and Government Relations Manager - Tokyo.As a member of the Global Communications & Public Affairs team, you will work cross-functionally to help communicate with journalists and other thought leaders; devise specific communications materials and campaigns based on understanding of journalists' interests; engage in face-to-face meetings with commentators and other opinion formers; develop print and web-based material supporting these campaigns; and counter misinformation that might interfere with our business and ability to serve our users. We're looking for great communicators who can understand complex issues and explain them in person and also via well written, simple blog posts, FAQs, video scripts and more.Responsibilities
Develop and lead public policy campaigns across the full range of policy areas that impact Google and the web. Key issues include technology innovation, free expression, privacy and intellectual property.
Engage directly with politicians and policy-makers.
Build a network of trade associations, industry partners, non-profit groups and others to support policies that will help create/maintain a user-focused online environment as well as an open Internet.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of relevant public policy and government relations experience.
Ability to speak and write Japanese and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Direct experience working within government, think tanks, public interest groups or the field of corporate public policy.
Experience working in high-stress environments and a proven ability to exercise judgment even in a crisis.
Broad policy experience with direct knowledge of the tech sector or the key issues impacting the Internet, like intellectual property, free expression, Internet access and online safety.
Team player who can work with people from a broad range of backgrounds and experience, including leading campaigns and mentor more junior members of the team.
Excellent communicator with great interpersonal and presentation skills, as well as the ability to write well and translate complex issues into simple language that people who are not experts can understand.
title: Public Policy and Government Relations Manager

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
The Head of Marketing for Malaysia is responsible for supporting Google's growth and business generating efforts in the region through effective and results-focused marketing campaigns. You are a flexible, hardworking, experienced individual, passionate about Google, to analyze, measure, position, package, and promote Google’s product and business offerings in Indonesia.Responsibilities
Pioneer the search and online brand advertising markets, supporting Google's growth and business generating efforts in Malaysia, through effective and results-focused marketing campaigns.
Lead the development of Google's marketing plans for consumer, advertiser and publisher products in Indonesia, working closely with the Google Product, Sales, PR and Business Development teams.
Evaluate consumer marketing opportunities and initiate programs to increase awareness of Google products through development of creative programs, brand awareness campaigns and promotions.
Drive the implementation of marketing campaigns including direct marketing, affiliate marketing, online/offline advertising and promotions.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Extensive experience in product marketing, brand marketing, marketing strategy, or consulting.
Proven, successful track record of managing direct and cross-functional teams to increase company business growth and awareness through well-executed marketing efforts.
Understanding of Google's strategic and competitive position, and demonstrated capacity and strong aptitude for determining the optimal way to position products in the market and keen understanding of the search, online advertising, or web publishing markets.
Skill in analyzing products, customers, market dynamics, and working on a variety of product related challenges.
Outstanding written/oral communication skills, strong organizational/analytical skills.
title: Head of Marketing, Malaysia

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
You are passionate, eager and excited to be a part of an important shift in how Google’s Sales teams learn, think and communicate to clients about our performance products. Your goal is to help our Sales Googlers by providing them with resources, tools, insights and best practices that allow them to identify new opportunities with their customers more quickly and improve their chances of success.

You will partner very closely with the Brand Solutions team, which has a similar mandate focused on Branding marketing objectives, as well as numerous cross-functional senior stakeholders, across Sales Operations, Product Solutions Team, Infrastructure and Platform teams, Marketing and Agency.
As the Measurement and Attribution Solutions Manager, you will help activate Google’s commercial business strategy for performance-driven advertisers, are are ultimately responsible for driving advertiser Performance business outcomes and growing ad business.Responsibilities
Bring together disparate measurement disciplines into a cohesive outcome that illustrates the consumer journey to purchase, also leading and influencing across a wide variety of stakeholders across Large Customer Sales, Marketing, Agency, Product and PR.

text:
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and DoubleClick tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide innovative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and proactively identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. Our team helps grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provides account management for users of AdSense, DoubleClick and more.
As a Mobile Product Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for supporting our Sales team and our Partners on our Mobile solutions. You will also work closely with the product team on new features, from gathering the needs, to the commercialization process and full launch . You should have an in-depth knowledge of Apps and Mobile Web Industry. You will consult with the internal sales teams and external clients on Mobile and feel comfortable delivering internal and external product trainings.

The role of Mobile Product Sales Specialist is a unique and exciting role within the Online Partnerships Group (OPG). This is your chance to be part of and directly learn about Google’s Mobile Monetization Business have interactions with top websites/App Developers in the European market. You will focus mostly on our Apps and Mobile Web business solutions.Responsibilities
Support product implementation and help partners in their day-to-day challenges by delivering innovative and scalable solutions to their problems and troubleshooting their issues.
Provide support to address product and technical questions by supplying necessary documentation and technical guidance.
Act as one of our regional product experts on AdMob and mobile business strategies, and be on top of new features and use cases. Develop educational materials for internal and external teams with the ultimate goal of increasing feature adoption.
Improve our product offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams including Product Management and Engineering.
Analyze and optimize the development of existing clients to ensure their success with the Google suite of products for partners.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Apps and/or Web development experience.
Proven experience working with a product team.
Strong skills in common web technologies, such as HTML and HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Java, PHP, Objective-C.
Knowledge of AdMob, Ad Exchange, DoubleClick For Publishers or any competition solution.
Knowledge of the app developers space and/or mobile publishing.
Excellent problem solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills.
