text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.Responsibilities
Manage Google privacy remediation workflows.
Drive internal process improvement projects, including the development and implementation of internal tools.
Provide product and engineering with clear and concise product feedback and feature requests from the client, making sure that the client needs are heard and executed upon.
Support and partner with Sales in order to provide functional promotions, pre-engagement, and technical and functional needs assessments for prospective clients.
Facilitate privacy discussions between different functions at Google including Product, Engineering, Privacy and Legal teams.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience working in a client-facing technical service environment.
Preferred qualifications
Understanding and experience with Web-development languages and concepts, technical background in Web technologies  such as HTTP, HTML, CSS, SQL, and JavaScript.
Programmatic, RTA or RTB Marketing and general online advertising industry knowledge.
Proven ability to prioritize tasks and adapt strategies to changing or conflicting requirements.
Strong data analysis, ability to deal with ambiguity, solve complex problems and scale effectively across a large organization and highly distributed team.
Strong Project Management skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to quickly absorb technical concepts and effectively communicate them to a non-technical audience.
title: Ads Privacy Solutions Consultant

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.Responsibilities
Work with other team members and groups to analyze requirements or potential problems and proactively develop solutions and policy recommendations.
Partner with Google’s internal application groups, and design network infrastructure which meets their networking requirements. Support and lead implementation of Google's growing network infrastructure.
Lead development of Google’s production network infrastructure through published engineering design documents and specifications.
Lead the requirement analysis, engineering design, and solution development of Google’s production network infrastructure.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of IP networking experience in a production environment.
Experience with major network equipment providers.
Experience in network routing protocol troubleshooting in BGP, OSPF, IS-IS and MPLS.
Preferred qualifications
Network certifications (ex. CCIE or JNCIE) or equivalent work experience.
8 years of experience with a service provider or enterprise-level network in engineering or design roles. Substantial operational experience with enterprise/carrier-class routers and switches.
Experience developing networking products, technologies, software and protocols. Strong systems design and analytical skills.
Excellent knowledge of major networking protocols.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to influence others with your great ideas.
title: Network Engineer, Strategic Networking

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google works with thousands of strategic partners across the globe every day. The Google Fiber Operations team is responsible for ensuring that these partnerships run seamlessly. Part financial, part legal and administrative, and part infrastructure, you ensure compliance for Google's Multi-family Dwelling Unit and/or Small and Medium Businesses inside plant construction. You proactively review existing and new contracts, permits, terms and obligations. You coordinate with Facilities, Outside Plant (OSP), Network Operations (NetOps), and Finance to ensure successful project completion. In addition, you will be required to ensure quality control is maintained on all the builds. Your diligence ensures all users and partners have uninterrupted operations and 100% satisfaction.Responsibilities
Manage construction for the last mile deployment of Google Fiber’s MDU, Small and Medium Businesses (SMB), and Community Connection construction across the market/metro area.
Manage project budgets, installation schedules, production and contractor resource assignment and track contractor performance including billing against budget and contract. Support progress reporting, invoice approval, and material handling with the contractors, prioritize and multitask projects and see them through to completion, as individual and team contributor.
Handle daily updates and feedback required for troubleshooting and internal ticketing system. Report field production and other key metrics on daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Work with and communicate progress to internal stakeholders and ensure that projects are scoped properly and handed off seamlessly for network deployment. Work closely with cross-functional teams including Google Fiber OSP/NetOps/Sales/Business/Customer Service in coordinating all project activities, resource requirements and business goals.
Establish and coordinate quality control requirements for Fiber to the Home (FTTH) build. Evaluate vendor performance and manage escalation processes for construction and maintenance incidents.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in Project/Program Management role specific to FTTH construction (OSP/ISP).
Preferred qualifications
Experience interpreting fiber test results and auditing projects for compliance with scopes of work. A deep understanding of inside and outside plant fiber optic network infrastructure, engineering design and construction.
Experience in managing contractors and field technicians.
Knowledge/experience with project management tools.
Knowledge/experience with web applications.
Knowledge of telecommunications and related standards and regulations - an industry insider.
Strong interpersonal, analytical and communication skills. Flexible and able to think quickly.
title: Construction Manager (Inside Plant), Google Fiber

text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.
The YouTube Partner Program consists of tens of thousands of content creators monetizing their videos online. As a Partner Operations Associate in the Content Operations organization you will work with premium TV/Film, Original YouTube programming and Music partners to facilitate content acquisition and management. You will proactively uncover and understand common issues our partners face and work with cross-functional teams to tackle these problems. Managing communications between cross-functional teams is vital as you drive product solutions via development of tools and processes that enhance the partner experience on YouTube.
Responsibilities
Provide operational support to YouTube EMEA Direct Partners.
Work with Strategic Partner Managers and Technical Account Managers in establishing and executing processes, provide support solutions to facilitate the growth of our Direct Partners.
Streamline operational workflow by identifying bottlenecks, improving Partner experience, and developing innovative solutions to scale the business.
Work with a global Direct Partner Operations team located in the US and various locations in APAC.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write English, Turkish and German fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications

text:
Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Business Analysts provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. As a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.
As a Business Analyst on the Google Play Analytics team, you will be working with multiple stakeholders across Play to define metrics and deliver insightful data and analysis. The principal goal of your analyses will be to drive better business decisions that will increase Play store performance for the Digital Content verticals (i.e. Music, Video, Books and Magazine). You will be responsible for translating data into recommendations and, where relevant, implement process improvements. The metrics and analyses you develop will serve as a key input in product development and operations decision-making. You will work collaboratively across Play teams, Business Development, Merchandising, Operations) as well as with teams outside of Play such as Legal, Finance and Marketing.

Responsibilities:

Act as a think partner of insights and metrics for various business stakeholders across Play; review key business metrics with the Play leadership team on a weekly basis; define meaningful metrics and build data pipeline and dashboards to monitor trends; conduct deep dives when observing abnormal trends.
Lead the analysis to drive improvements for Play Digital Content, focusing on product feature and user experience; partner with Product Management (PM) and other Play teams to implement process and product improvements.
Be the strategic partner to the Play leadership team in thinking about the future of Digital Content; conduct competitive market analysis to understand where the industry is heading and where Play can lead or lag with our unique position in the the product and market space.
Work with the Engineering team that creates data pipelines to ensure proper dimensions and metrics are incorporated, and to validate data.
Responsibilities
Act as a think partner of insights and metrics for various business stakeholders across Play; review key business metrics with the Play leadership team on a weekly basis; define meaningful metrics and build data pipeline and dashboards to monitor trends; conduct deep dives when observing abnormal trends.
Lead the analysis to drive improvements for Play Digital Content, focusing on product feature and user experience.
Be the strategic partner to the Play leadership team in thinking about the future of Digital Content; conduct competitive market analysis to understand where the industry is heading and where Play can lead or lag with our unique position in the the product and market space.
Work with the Engineering team that creates data pipelines to ensure proper dimensions and metrics are incorporated, and to validate data.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience with an emphasis on work of a quantitative nature (Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics).
3 years of work experience as analyst or in an analytical role.
Experience working with data visualization tools to deliver results.
Experience analyzing data and creating reports with spreadsheets. Database query experience (e.g., Dremel and SQL languages).

Preferred qualifications
MS degree in engineering, business or quantitative majors.
Experience working with large and multiple datasets/data warehouses and ability to pull from such data sets using relevant programs and coding.
Proven experience in identifying opportunities for business improvement and defining/measuring the success of those initiatives.
Strong business acumen and experience with datasets to construct data analysis in order to answer business questions.
Solid business knowledge and understanding of online App store dynamic. A basic understanding of Android and Play Ecosystem.
Strong communication and presentation skills to deliver findings of analysis.
title: Business Analyst, Google Play, Digital Content

text:
Google's Treasury team is on a mission to optimize the return on Google's financial assets. As a member of this team, you're always looking for innovative ways to help Google invest for the future while limiting volatility and material surprises. In addition to risk busting and asset management, you work collaboratively to administer business insurance programs and stock programs, and provide financial analysis support to our internal teams. You make creative yet calculated decisions that are backed by both experience and your extensive knowledge of the economy and financial industry.
Google’s Foreign Exchange team is a finance organization focused on developing and implementing innovative solutions to manage Google’s global foreign currency risk. As a Foreign Exchange Manager, you will work with cross-functional teams to support Google’s expanding hedge programs and have a major impact on the company’s financial performance. As a key contributor in a dynamic group you will have significant responsibility and extensive opportunity to help shape an evolving Finance organization.Responsibilities
Collaborate with finance and business teams to manage hedging programs and mitigate the impact of FX risk.
Lead analysis and due diligence to identify, evaluate, and forecast global FX exposures.
Develop effective hedging solutions based on business and market conditions.
Execute hedging strategies by trading foreign currency derivatives with banking partners.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in quantitative coursework such as finance, economics, mathematics or accounting, or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of relevant work experience in a multinational treasury organization with focus on balance sheet or cash flow hedging programs.

Preferred qualifications
Significant experience with FX derivative instruments such as forwards, NDFs, and options.
Strong understanding of FX and hedge accounting principles (ASC 815 and 820).
Superior analytical and problem solving skills with a passion for getting things done.
Outstanding ability to combine focus and attention to detail with swift execution in a dynamic environment.
Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
title: Foreign Exchange Manager

text:
This position will be based in Nashville, TN.
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google works with thousands of strategic partners across the globe every day. The Google Fiber Operations team is responsible for ensuring that these partnerships run seamlessly. Part financial, part legal and administrative, and part infrastructure, you ensure compliance for Google's Multi-family Dwelling Unit and/or Small and Medium Businesses inside plant construction. You proactively review existing and new contracts, permits, terms and obligations. You coordinate with Facilities, Outside Plant (OSP), Network Operations (NetOps), and Finance to ensure successful project completion. In addition, you will be required to ensure quality control is maintained on all the builds. Your diligence ensures all users and partners have uninterrupted operations and 100% satisfaction.Responsibilities
Manage construction for the last mile deployment of Google Fiber’s MDU, Small and Medium Businesses (SMB), and Community Connection construction across the market/metro area.
Manage project budgets, installation schedules, production and contractor resource assignment and track contractor performance including billing against budget and contract. Support progress reporting, invoice approval, and material handling with the contractors, prioritize and multitask projects and see them through to completion, as individual and team contributor.
Handle daily updates and feedback required for troubleshooting and internal ticketing system. Report field production and other key metrics on daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Work with and communicate progress to internal stakeholders and ensure that projects are scoped properly and handed off seamlessly for network deployment. Work closely with cross-functional teams including Google Fiber OSP/NetOps/Sales/Business/Customer Service in coordinating all project activities, resource requirements and business goals.
Establish and coordinate quality control requirements for Fiber to the Home (FTTH) build. Evaluate vendor performance and manage escalation processes for construction and maintenance incidents.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in Project/Program Management role specific to FTTH construction (OSP/ISP).
Preferred qualifications
Experience interpreting fiber test results and auditing projects for compliance with scopes of work. A deep understanding of inside and outside plant fiber optic network infrastructure, engineering design and construction.
Experience in managing contractors and field technicians.
Knowledge/experience with project management tools.
Knowledge/experience with Web Applications.
Knowledge of telecommunications and related standards and regulations - an industry insider.
Strong interpersonal, analytical and communication skills. Flexible and able to think quickly.
title: Construction Manager (Inside Plant), Google Fiber, Nashville

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The Small Business Marketing Team’s mission is to make sure every small business gets the help they need to succeed on the web. The team plays an important role in connecting small businesses with the right Google products for their business, as well as supporting Small and Medium Business (SMB) Marketing initiatives.

Leveraging your passion for small businesses, you will be responsible for providing strategic analyses and for driving marketing operations across the Americas. You are a strategic and analytical thinker who can break down problems and drive solutions. The role is highly cross-functional, requiring frequent interactions with the Marketing, Sales, and Finance teams.

Work as part of the wider SMB acquisition team, inspiring and mentoring junior team members.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of progressive experience.
Preferred qualifications
Strong SQL skills.
Proven track-record of cross functional collaboration and leading C-level client engagements in a consultative capacity.
Ability to demonstrate measurable impact of campaign strategy.
Distinctive problem solving and analytical skills, and impeccable business judgment.
Hunger for learning and development, a team player
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Product Marketing Manager, Americas SMB Marketing Strategy and Operations

text:

As you closely support your team, you may find yourself working with multiple groups within the Legal Department, internal clients across Google, and external parties. text:
Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. As a Global Mobility Specialist, you will work closely with the Compliance & Mobility Programs Manager, advising on specific immigration issues, fostering new ideas and supporting the immigration hiring process. You will be part of a truly global immigration and compliance team that leverages company philosophy, technology, your immigration expertise and superb experience as an expert in this area. BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Immigration experience gained in house or through consultancy work.

Strong interpersonal, teamwork, and organizational skills with superior verbal and written communication skills, and an emphasis on tact and diplomacy.

text:
Google's custom-designed equipment makes up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Manufacturing Operations team is responsible for providing the manufacturing capability to deliver this state-of-the-art physical infrastructure. As a Quality Engineer, you evaluate the product designs and create the processes, tools and procedures behind Google’s powerful search technology. When vendors build parts for our infrastructure, you’re right there alongside ensuring manufacturing processes are repeatable and controlled. You collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design Engineers to determine Google’s infrastructure needs and product specifications. Your work ensures the various pieces of Google’s infrastructure fit together perfectly and keep our systems humming along smoothly for a seamless user experience.
Google Life Sciences is focused on shifting health care from a reactive, undifferentiated approach to a proactive, targeted approach by transforming the detection, prevention, management, and even our basic understanding of disease. Google Life Sciences is looking for a Quality Engineer (Software/Hardware) to work with the engineering product team to ensure the delivery of quality medical devices to users. 
Google's users demand the highest quality products. As a Quality Engineer at Google Life Sciences you will be responsible for working with the engineering product team to ensure compliance with the product development and the quality management system procedures for Google Life Sciences products. You will lead the product quality assurance and quality engineering aspects of hardware product development activities to drive inherently safe design.
Responsibilities
Develop systems for the identification, analysis, correction, and prevention of hardware-related quality issues.
Conduct investigations, root cause analysis, and provide corrective and preventive actions based on sound engineering analysis and review.
Be responsible for planning and reporting on hardware verification and validation activities, including development and review of hardware documents (requirements documentation, design documents, test plans, and test reports).
Work with Engineering on all elements of Design Control. Participate in design reviews to assure product subsystem quality, reliability, etc.
Participate in internal and external compliance audits, as needed.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical discipline e.g. Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of quality engineering experience working in medical devices under an FDA QSR-compliant quality system.
Experience supporting or coordinating a 510(k) filing and/or CE technical file.
Preferred qualifications
Experience working at FDA.
Experience working in fast-paced, startup environments.
Demonstrated understanding of and ability to conduct quality engineering activities in compliance with FDA quality system regulations, 21 CFR Part 820, and FDA guidance, IEC 60601, ISO 13485, ISO 14971, and other national and international quality and regulatory requirements and standards.
Self-starter, team-player, flexible to support/prioritize various department needs, successful at managing multiple tasks.
Excellent written, communication and interpersonal skills.
title: Quality Engineer (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Networking Test Engineer you make sure that our massive and growing network is operating at its peak potential. You have hands-on experience with complex networking equipment, a deep understanding of networking protocols, test design and implementation chops and a background in IP network design. It's your job to make sure Google's cutting-edge technology can perform at scale.
The Google Access team is leading efforts to radically improve connectivity and user experiences. We’re focused on increasing performance, coverage and usability in a wide variety of environments including Google Fiber powered homes, public hotspots and more. We build the designs, infrastructure and systems that help turbo-charge internet access environments around the world.
You will have the chance to lead the effort to build test automation infrastructure for both SDN controller and embedded systems. You will be able to leverage Google’s cutting edge test framework to build a test automation environment for the SDN-based wireless access network.Responsibilities
Design and setup test labs, test beds and test automation infrastructure to exercise and test wireless access network.
Build automation framework to allow software engineers and test engineers to create test case, write test script, and execute tests.
Test complex hardware/software systems that push the frontier in hardware design, software design, and system integration.
Minimum qualifications
5 years of development experience in Python, Perl, Tcl (or equivalent).
Hands on experience with automation development environments.
Experience with networking and wireless technologies.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience in testing and debugging in LTE, WiMAX, or Ethernet switches.
Strong scripting proficiency in Linux, OS X or Unix based shell environment.
Solid understanding of networking in Linux and test tools.
title: Network Test Automation Engineer, Access

text:

First-rate personal, political, analytical and organizational skills.

Fluency in German and English.

text:

Depending on business needs, you’ll have the chance to work on some of Google’s most innovative and high profile Advertising platforms, including AdWords, AdSense and DoubleClick.

You will join one of our specific teams who work closely with our external clients. You will eventually become the technical face of Google, working alongside our Sales and Engineering functions, developing the skills to become an expert in your area. You will be assigned an experienced mentor and develop your business and product skills by working on a range of projects, such as building tools to automate and scale business processes, mashup different Google products to create custom solutions, oversee the technical execution and business operations of Google’s partnerships, and provide data driven insights into Google’s internal sales and product teams.Responsibilities

Solve big problems that may involve access and analysis of massive amounts of data and information, help develop massively scalable, distributed software systems and collaborate on different smaller projects.
Come up with new ideas as well as strive for a deep understanding of our products and services in order to continually improve our solutions, and develop a technical fascination for how stuff fits together.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical subject, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more programming languages such as Java, C++, and/or Python.
Experience with web technologies such as HTTP, XML, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript or AJAX.
Preferred qualifications
Business savvy - demonstrated through project work whilst at university, internships and/or other outside interests.
Experience in systems software and algorithms, working with Linux/Unix and APIs.
Database design and SQL Query construction experience
Excellent problem solving, analytical and troubleshooting skills
Ability to adapt your message to the technical level of the audience and comfortable presenting technical materials to internal stakeholders
Fluent in English and French

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. text:
At Google, our philosophy is build it, break it and then rebuild it better. That thinking is at the core of how we approach testing at Google. Unlike roles with similar names at the other companies, Test Engineers at Google aren't manual testers -- you write scripts to automate testing and create tools so developers can test their own code. As a Test Engineer, you navigate Google's massive codebase, identify weak spots and constantly design better and creative ways to break software and identify potential problems. You'll have a huge impact on the quality of Google's growing suite of products and services.You use your knowledge of testing and testability to influence better software design, promote proper engineering practice, bug prevention strategies, testability, accessibility, privacy, and other advanced quality concepts across products.
Skybox Imaging, now part of Google, seeks a talented Embedded Test Engineer to support development of the flight control software for a small, remote sensing satellite. You will be part of a dynamic team that performs testing of spacecraft subsystems to assure it is ready for launch. You will create test plans and test cases and own large portions of our satellite testing effort. You will work with engineers to resolve issues as they are discovered and verify fixes as they are created. You will work on spacecraft integration activities. You may also test ground data system software, participate in launch operations, and help to operate the spacecraft.

You must have clearance to work with ITAR regulated information, which requires being a US citizen or permanent resident.Responsibilities
Test flight software on spacecraft test-bed.
Validate correct operation of spacecraft subsystems including hardware and software.
Create, document and execute test cases.
Occasional use of test equipment to confirm proper hardware operation and gather data.
Work directly with software and hardware developers to troubleshoot spacecraft systems.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Linux knowledge: familiar with Linux environment and some experience as administrator.
Excellent coding skills in C, C++, Java or Python.
Knowledge of various testing techniques and approaches.
title: Embedded Test Engineer

text:
Machine Intelligence is a high impact team within Knowledge that’s building the next generation of intelligence and language understanding for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on confidential projects that utilize the latest techniques in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning (including Deep Learning approaches like Google Brain) and Natural Language Processing. We impact products across Google including Search, Maps and Google Now.We’ve already been joined by some of the best and the brightest minds in AI, and we’re looking for talented software engineers that have applied experience in the fields of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to join our team. As a software engineer in Machine Intelligence, you work on a small team, collaborating closely with other product teams and you’re able to switch projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems. Because you’ll be working with cutting-edge technology, you’ll also get a chance to work closely with researchers across Google.

Develop and improve image enhancement and analysis algorithms.
Write software for mobile imaging applications.
Develop multi-frame fusing methods to generate good quality images in harsh conditions.
Write software for early prototypes.
Minimum qualifications
MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or in related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience.
C/C++ experience.
Preferred qualifications
PhD degree.
Experience in the development of embedded software.
Experience with programming demand-side platforms.
Deep understanding of operation of image processing, enhancement and analysis algorithms

text:
As a Technical Account Manager, you are responsible for providing technical solutions and managing relationships with Google's largest and most strategic online publishers. As a liaison between clients and our technical staff, you flawlessly lead deployments, implementations and integrations of a variety of our product lines (such as Search, Mobile, Video and Commerce). From monitoring product performance to debugging and troubleshooting product code, you are the resident expert that addresses partner needs. You are a technical expert with an entrepreneurial drive and passion for client management.
Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind those systems are Googlers who advise and partner with our users and customers, in order to make it easy to run ads with Google. As a Platforms Ads Solutions Consultant, you will develop innovative, cutting-edge solutions to the business problems faced by the world’s largest advertisers and agencies who use the DoubleClick Digital Marketing (DDM) suite of products. We work as a critical technical partner for our sales teams where your deep product knowledge, communication skills, desire to solve complex problems, passion for scale and big data, and business acumen will all be leveraged to develop answers to questions most don’t even know to ask. Your solutions will take many forms, from prototypes and demos to education and evangelism – all with the technology resources of Google to back it up.

You will be responsible for identifying and prioritizing your own projects. You will see the unique business challenges faced by our largest customers, and you will be given the opportunity to develop solutions no one else has. Working across the entire organization, you will have the chance to leverage your wide-ranging experience and skill-set to find the best solution for the problems at hand.Responsibilities

Work with Sales to identify business opportunities leveraging display and performance solutions for designated clients.
Collect requirements, provide guidance and offer best practices for applying ad products and technologies to achieve advertisers' and agencies’ business goals.
Conduct data analysis to provide actionable recommendations for clients to improve their digital ad campaigns using DoubleClick technology.
Be responsible for end-to-end implementations and escalations handled by other Google teams for named accounts.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience working on customer engagements (e.g. project management, technical sales, ad operations, etc.).
Experience with programming and scripting using HTML, JavaScript and SQL.
Ability to speak and write English and Spanish fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MS or MBA degree.
Experience in online advertising industry.
Creative problem-solving, ability to analyze and use data in order to provide actionable recommendations.
Ability to handle fast-paced environments, managing multiple projects simultaneously with effective time-management and prioritization skills.

Excellent communication skills.

locations: São Paulo - State of São Paulo, Brazil

Comfortable and accomplished promoting transformational ideas.

text:

Whether coaching your clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.
You will join the Tech HR group and be both hands-on and strategic to provide human resources expertise in the areas of employee relations, coaching/development, compensation, conflict management, organizational development and more. text:

Research and create unique audio files.

text:
At Google, our philosophy is build it, break it and then rebuild it better. That thinking is at the core of how we approach testing at Google. As a Test Engineer, you navigate Google's massive codebase, identify weak spots and constantly design better and creative ways to break software and identify potential problems. As a TE on Glass, you will lead the testing efforts for some of the most vital features of Glass. This will involve developing test strategies, guiding test execution, automating test scenarios, and pushing testing upstream in the development process. With a particular focus on the system software side of Glass, you will help to build our foundation for testing critical aspects of the Glass system such as connectivity, power, thermals, and sensors.Responsibilities
Lead testing for critical aspects of the Glass system such as connectivity, power, thermals and sensors.
Lead the test effort from planning and organization to execution and delivery. Develop effective test strategies.
Write moderately complex code to test systems.
Use your knowledge of testing and testability to influence better software design, promote best engineering practices, bug prevention strategies, testability, and other quality attributes across products.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in computer science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with test methodologies, writing test plans, creating test cases and debugging.
Experience with tests automation in Python as well as working within networking and Linux environments.
Preferred qualifications
Experience testing the Linux kernel.
Experience with Linux testing frameworks like LTP.
Ability to work individually and in a team.
title: System Software Test Engineer (Glass)

text:
The Access Operations Team uses Google's data-driven approach to provide critical business insight. In this role, you'll use analytics in order to ensure Google's goals are met in product areas across the company. You strive to help teams push strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. Preferred qualifications

Experience with Salesforce.com and/or databases feeds from external market providers and their overlay onto internal data warehouse. Experience with MapReduce, Hadoop or NoSQL technologies.
Strong understanding of Business Intelligence (BI) technologies and their application, including database warehousing and dashboarding experience.
Successful track record of working with databases in the support of sales and marketing activities. A proven record of managing project plans and collaborating across geographies and functions.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment. Passion for Google Fiber, geospatial analysis and mapping.
Strong SQL-based skills application development and ETL skills (database creation, optimization, data feed productionization, etc).

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
As a Product Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for leading the strategic integrated marketing agenda for the Google Consumer brand in China, driving product awareness and usage. You need to have a strong understanding of marketplace dynamics, design and execute promotional campaigns, work with product teams to launch new products, liaise with partners on co-marketing initiatives, and work with agencies on creative and event-based projects. 

You will work closely with country, regional and the global Mobile teams to build strategic plans, execute high impact campaigns, and track results. You will lead the agency relationship with our media and creative partners to build and execute industry leading marketing programs that build love with our users, and increase engagement with the product. You will also work cross-functionally to ensure flawless execution of our strategic marketing campaigns, and will lead the team responsible for program strategy, execution and analytics.Responsibilities
Partner with the regional and global marketing teams to craft compelling marketing strategies for China. Lead the team responsible for Marketing Operations, Project Management and Analytics.
Deliver best in class integrated marketing campaigns that bring significant business impact for Mobile in the form of increased brand awareness, and increased product usage.
Lead the campaign execution process for Mobile while managing the media agency relationship for China to build innovative, integrated campaigns that span digital, print, broadcast, events, etc.
Develop campaign strategies that effectively utilize the product roadmap and creative platforms for China.
Build and maintain strong relationships with the extended Marketing organization as well as key partners in China to promote Google services.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of progressive integrated marketing experience.Ability to speak and write in English and Mandarin fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Deep experience developing high-impact marketing campaigns across traditional and digital channels.
Solid understanding of the Internet and Mobile industry.
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with a high degree of analytical rigor.
Excellent project management and organizational skills, with ability to manage, coordinate and track multiple simultaneous projects and deliverables.
Excellent communication and presentation skills including ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with senior levels of management within Google and across external partners.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills in Mandarin and English, and business fluency in additional Asian languages.

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
Product Security Remediation is the proactive arm of Google's external security response efforts. With the goal of analyzing vulnerabilities in Google products and preventing them from recurring across the product and the rest of Google. The medium term goal is to make sure the most common classes of bugs in Google products in 2014 will no longer happen by 2020. Mainly, this role is about spending time understanding product team needs, and negotiating remediation plans with the product security team that improve their products security.Responsibilities
Help prioritize, persuade and negotiate different efforts. Work with team to collect, analyze data and quantify risk on Google product security problems.
Manage the work on all security response prevention and remediation. Oversee the timely resolution of all security bugs within the appropriate SLA (Service Level Agreement).
Work as Communications Lead or Incident Coordinator (if needed) on critical-severity bugs.
Promote externally the Patch Reward Program and our Hardening and Remediation work.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in computer security.

Preferred qualifications
Web application security experience, particularly in identifying and/or fixing XSS/XSRF/Clickjacking/SQL injection, etc.
Knowledge of web technologies (HTTP fundamentals, same origin policy, etc.).
Ability to evaluate technical risk and business impact and explain the impact of security issues to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Excellent written communication skills, with a focus on translating technically complex issues into simple, easy to understand language. Strong negotiation, organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization abilities with excellent attention to detail.
Comfortable speaking in front of large audiences (conferences, etc.).
title: Technical Program Manager, Product Security

text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
As a Network Software Engineer in the Wireless group, using your extensive technical background you will be responsible for system level software to enable next generation mm-Wave wireless platforms.Responsibilities
Participate, and lead parts of system level architecture and design for highly complex wireless platform solutions.
Develop software across multiple layers for a wireless platform.
Develop software for Kernel level and User space.
Contribute to software that runs on Google Backend Cloud infrastructure.
Develop Networking management and Network configuration software on Linux and Linux-like operating systems.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant experience in embedded systems programming and developing in C, C++, and Python.
L2/L3 network protocols and network programming experience; Ethernet, TCP/IP, switching/routing algorithms.
Experience designing, implementing, and debugging wireless protocol stacks.
Preferred qualifications
MS in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.
10 years of relevant experience in wireless platforms, deep understanding of Kernel and Network Processor Platform internals.
Experience with millimeter wave system design, and related standards (e.g. 802.11ad).
In depth background developing networking protocol and forwarding stacks in Layer 2 VLAN and Ethernet switching services.
title: Network Software Engineer, Access

text:
Google's legal department is at the center of an information law revolution, and you're at its core. As a Legal Assistant, you are a driving force behind the success of your Legal team, ready to roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, conduct legal research and coordinate communications across the team. As you closely support your team, you may find yourself working with multiple groups within the Legal Department, internal clients across Google, and external parties. You're an independent thinker who isn't afraid to ask questions, and you're organized in a way that never overlooks the details.
As a Legal Analyst in Online Product Support, you will work directly with a fast-paced global team. The Online Product Support team deals with complex and unique legal issues online from all over the world by quickly identifying and resolving internal and external customer concerns regarding Google’s removals processes. Among your many attributes, you are comfortable with a rapidly changing environment. You will field incoming issues that are processed through internal tools based on complex internal policies. All the while, you will also be reviewing a high volume of online content. Additionally, you will work with the Legal team to minimize Google's liability in potential content removal suits.Responsibilities
Process removal requests efficiently and accurately, including copyright issues or government requests. Communicate effectively with English and Korean speaking clients.
Respond to internal and external customer inquiries regarding Google's legal removals processes.
Run training sessions and give presentations to product, legal and public teams.
Facilitate communication of process and policy to internal and external customers.
Create documentation for existing and new policies and procedures.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write English and Korean fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Able to manage numerous projects simultaneously under deadline pressure.
Ability and willingness to take initiative to address problems and make continuous process improvements.
Ability to review or be exposed to offensive content as part of our removal process.
Hard working, well-organized and detail-oriented.
Excellent analytical skills, with a strong ability to review and organize numerous documents in complex legal matters.
title: Legal Analyst, Online Product Support (Korean)

text:
As a member of a fast-paced multi-disciplinary team, you use your creativity and diverse range of engineering experience to explore solutions to a variety of engineering problems. As a mechanical engineer, you participate in the design, analysis, and prototyping of new concepts. You work in a manufacturing and product oriented development environment and collaborate with vendors and outside sources in order to see parts through to manufacture.Responsibilities
Design, analyze, prototype, build, test, and debug cutting-edge manufacturing-related hardware (fixtures, automation, test equipment) across a range of applications.
Develop measurement systems, collect data, and perform rigorous analysis.
Debug subtle mechanical, process and materials problems, and find solutions.
Design assemblies that maintain compliance with operational requirements over a wide thermal range.
Identify and manage vendors that can help us move faster and solve problems.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar field or equivalent practical experience.
Hands on practical experience with designing agile, light-weight, compact, and pointing mechanisms.
Experience in finite-element analysis to evaluate thermally-induced stresses, and structural modes.
Experience in one of the mainstream 3D mechanical engineering CAD software programs.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of relevant experience.
Experience developing automation hardware and software (motors, robots, controls).
Experience with engineering in high-volume manufacturing environments.
Hands-on experience with environmental testing infrastructure (e.g. thermal chambers, shake tables ,etc.).
Strong understanding of statistics and experimental design.
Proven ability to collaborate, follow through and complete project tasks when working in a time sensitive team environment.
title: Mechanical Engineer, Manufacturing (Loon) Special Projects

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
Google Fiber architecture is at the forefront of innovation, tasked with creating the fastest broadband network in the world. Populated by extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented people, our Network Architecture team employ the most innovative networking approaches and equipment to deliver Gigabit high-speed Internet and Google Fiber TV services. We're driven by Google's mission to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful (through super-fast broadband). If you seek to pursue such challenges such as building highly scalable networking infrastructures, bringing great TV experiences into the home or innovating user experiences or the next big application that will change the world, then this might be a perfect fit for you.

You will define and develop a next generation approach to trenchless Fiber-to-the-Home construction. As the Technology Architect on the project, you will work with Hardware Engineering, Robotics teams and external partners to design, prototype, test and deploy systems for small diameter placement of PE pipe for boundary-to-boundary residential fiber networks.

You'll have experience with trenchless build techniques including horizontal directional drilling, auger boring, micro TBM and moling. You will have had the experience of both operating guided trenchless equipment and have worked in the development of drill, guidance and/or locating products.

You will be called upon to create and lead a team of outside plant engineers who will bring your ideas to fruition.Responsibilities
Work with industry to develop trenchless techniques and equipment.
Evaluate emerging technologies and platforms for their inclusion in the Google Fiber network trenchless fiber network.
Act as technical advisor to Senior Management and other Google Fiber teams on topics and roadmaps relating to the trenchless fiber networks.
Minimum qualifications
Master's degree in Geotechnical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, similar field or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience in trenchless product development including directional boring.
Leadership experience managing a team of engineers, developers or product managers.
Preferred qualifications
Operational experience with trenchless technologies such as moles, HDD, TBM and their locating/guidance technologies.
Exposure to the following trenchless technologies and approaches: Auger Boring, Tunnel Boring Machines, Moles, Locating technologies, Pipe thrusting and jacking.
Strong English-language written and oral communications skills with the ability to lead others.
title: Trenchless Technology Architect, Google Fiber

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

We enable, incubate and scale innovation, establish more efficient practices and align functions and stakeholders to help the company continue to achieve its vast potential. Simply put, you will help a business maintain its leadership and help Google define operational initiatives that contribute to the company's growth. Reporting to the Head of Global Apps Business Partnership, you will be confident working in a fast-paced, constantly evolving global environment and be prepared to lead a high-performing operational/analytics team.

Work with the VP, and his Directors and Managers to get support and execute the programs.
Build relationships with Directors and key managers, particularly lead relationships with functional areas like Finance, Marketing, HR, etc.
Lead the Americas-wide team to execute Sales Operations globally.
Share best practices with other Sales Operations teams.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in a management consulting, corporate strategy, or sales operations role.
Preferred qualifications
Strong, demonstrable experience of leading large global programs and consulting projects at a consulting firm and in an Enterprise sales space.
Familiarity with traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
Ability to excite, lead and drive results from a small and high caliber team.
Strong problem solving abilities and organizational and project management skills with excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills.
title: Americas Strategy and Operations Lead, Google Apps for Work

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.
As a Country Marketing Manager you're a flexible, hardworking marketeer with demonstrable knowledge about Google. You will plan and execute major business-to-business (B2B) and business-to-consumer (B2C) initiatives for the Hungarian market. You will be in charge of positioning and promoting Google's business products to achieve measurable business results across multiple channels. Your end goal will be to recruit small and medium advertisers through efficient campaigns designed to increase awareness, education and product adoption. You will also be required to analyze the results of marketing programs to optimize investment.
Responsibilities
Lead the development of Google's marketing plans for consumer, advertiser and publisher products in Hungary, working closely with the Google product, sales and PR teams.
Manage marketing acquisition strategy to recruit Small and Medium Businesses (SMB) advertisers for Google.
Evaluate consumer marketing opportunities and initiate programs to increase awareness of Google products through development of creative programs, brand awareness campaigns and promotions.
Manage third party relationships with agencies and vendors in advertiser acquisition programs
Act as valuable marketing partner and Hungarian market advocate across Google.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
People management experience.
Experience in product marketing, direct marketing, marketing program management or consulting.
Ability to speak and write in English and Hungarian fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Marketing experience including managing multi-channel campaigns, lead generation/nurturing, event organization, creative development.
Practical commercial experience with segmentation, product portfolio and channel strategy development.
Strong analytical skills and proven track record of managing ROI campaigns and measurements.
Understanding of the search, online advertising or web publishing market.
Combination of strategic ability and executive leadership.
title: Country Marketing Manager

text:

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Technical Solutions Consultant, Google Cloud Platform - Tokyo.As a Technical Solutions Consultant, you are responsible for customers success on Google Cloud Platform and managing trusted technical advisory relationships with our strategic customers who have chosen “to go Google”.
You will be responsible for overseeing technical integration, platform adoption, cost/performance optimizations and taking a lead on critical customer projects from start to finish. You will work closely with a cross-functional team to ensure rapid and accurate resolution of technical challenges. From monitoring product performance to debugging and troubleshooting product code, you are the resident expert that addresses customer needs and advocates for it internally. 

You are passionate about Cloud Computing and Google Cloud Platform, including Google App Engine, Google Compute Engine, BigQuery, Google Cloud Storage, and more.

Success in this role involves using your project and product management skills to run multiple projects with multiple customers at the same time, and applying your software engineering expertise to lead the timely execution of adopting the Google Cloud Platform solutions to the customer’s requirements. 

You are an active expert/leader in the Cloud area and strongly believe that you can help any industry build it’s next generation business software in the Cloud.Responsibilities
Manage strategic technical advisory relationships with key partners and customers to ensure that Google Cloud Platform remains their platform of choice.
Establish roadmap and key project milestones for customer engagements, advocate internally for product features and proactively identify technical dependencies and roadblocks to mitigate risks and ensure successful execution of customer projects.
Recommend new and existing product features to Google’s strategic customers in order to promote adoption and migration of existing work loads to Google Cloud Platform.
Deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles and technical presentations adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders.
Identify new product features and feature gaps, provide guidance on existing product issues, and collaborate with solutions architects and engineers to influence the roadmap of Google Cloud Platform.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math (or related technical major) or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one of the following programming languages: C++, Python, Java, Go, PHP.
Experience with Cloud technologies, including open source technologies and hands-on experiences in building multi-tier high availability web applications or services.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree or PhD in Computer Science or Math and/or a technically-oriented MBA degree.
Hands-on experience with cloud storage solutions, SQL/NoSQL datastores, and/or distributed computing technology; Google App Engine, Google Compute Engine or Big Query experience.
Strong network administration and troubleshooting skills with good understanding of Linux system administration.
Superb hands-on technical analysis and troubleshooting skills, ranging from application debugging to system performance optimization to cloud infrastructure design.
Team player, flexible self-starter, and have a strong can-do attitude, with the ability to anticipate the unexpected to succeed in and resolve complex issues.
Able to manage customer expectations and to negotiate in order to influence internal and external stakeholders at all levels.

text:

SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our world-class software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.
You are excited about protecting end users and have a strong passion for building advertising products that balance the needs of advertisers with those of end users. You are excited about building compelling experiences for advertisers, end users, and internal users. You are adept in creating effective relationships through influence and expertise to shape Ads products. You demonstrate analytical thinking through data-driven decision-making and technical know-how. You lead your teams by example, mentorship and charisma to do what it takes to get things done in order to make a difference. You have a passion for Software Development and a proven track record of creating extensible architectures and solid designs that withstand the test of time.
Responsibilities
Set strategy and product vision for the functional area.
Drive definition of platforms used by multiple internal stakeholders.
Build engineering team and grow leaders.

Partner cross-functionally with organizations within Google, and/or with external industry leaders.

BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.

Experience in search and user experience problems.

Experience in fraud/abuse contexts.
Possesses deep understanding of Google's company priorities and technical philosophy.

technology, major companies, and research.

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). The Google for Work team helps companies make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You swiftly problem-solve technical issues for customers to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative and innovative. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Enterprise business and bringing our product portfolio into companies both big and small around the world.

You are a Sales Engineer with excellent technical, communication and organizational skills. Your previous experience with cloud platform and infrastructure products, search products, content/document management repository systems, and SQL-based relational databases will be on display as you engage with customers to understand their business and technical requirements.

As a Cloud Platform Sales Engineer, you will work hand-in-hand with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud Platform to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners to understand the power of Google Cloud Platform, explaining technical features, and problem-solving key technical issues. You will liaise with the Product Management, Marketing, Developer Relations and Engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google´s Cloud products.Responsibilities
Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities and identify key customer technical objections. Develop the strategy to resolve technical impediments.
Take responsibility for technical aspects of solutions to include such activities as supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of supporting technical resources.
Work hands-on with Google's Enterprise Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments.
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google Cloud Platform value proposition using techniques to include whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and RFI response documents.
Make recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution providing “best practice” advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud Platform effectiveness.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience serving in the capacity of a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer facing role (including working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team).
Experience with Big Data, PaaS, and IaaS technologies; Linux; Web 2.0 development platform, solutions, and related technologies (HTTP, Basic/NTLM, cookies/sessions, XML/XSLT/XHTML/HTML). Experience with Enterprise networking concepts (DNS, TCP, Firewalls, Proxy Servers, DMZ).
Experience with web application development and integration (REST, SOAP, J2EE, CGI/Java/ASP servlets, Python)] Software development platforms and solutions experience (Java servlets, JavaScript, PHP, ASP, CGI, Ajax, Flash, cookies and XML).

Preferred qualifications

Demonstrable ability to rapidly prototype proofs-of-concept and technical demonstrations.
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT Technology space.
Confident presenter with excellent presentation skills and the ability to persuasively present Google's product offering.

text:
Applications are due by June 22, 2015 at 11:59pm PST. Our team will review applications on a rolling basis and it's in the candidates best interest to apply early. All hiring will be completed by August 2015. Thank you for your patience while we consider your application"Software Engineers at Google are researchers and developers who yearn to create and implement complex computer science solutions. Our engineers develop massively scalable, distributed software systems and also collaborate on multitudes of smaller projects that have universal appeal - which requires research, awareness, interactivity, and asking questions. You build strong competencies in data structures and algorithms, along with a technical fascination for how stuff fits together. You need to have a solid foundation in computer science in order to consistently come up with new ideas as well as strive for a deep understanding of our products and services in order to continually improve upon them. We focus on being a collaborative, global organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skills and a keen eye for quality.

As a Software Engineer, you will work on our core products and services as well as those who support critical functions of our engineering operations. Depending on your background and experience, you will be working in one of the following areas:

Product and Systems Development
Whether it's finding new and innovative ways to advance search quality, building computing platform and networking technologies, automating the indexing of videos, or continuing to refine and scale complex auction systems (just to name a few), you will be developing solutions to some of the most challenging technical problems out there. You will research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offerings and collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information. Examples of specialist domains: UI development with AJAX and similar technologies, security, embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers).

Engineering Productivity
As a software engineer in the Engineering Productivity organization, you'll use your software design, analysis and programming skills to create innovative automated testsystems. This isn't a job in which you'll simply debug and run test cases, in fact that only scratches the surface. The test team undertakes a broad range of challenges on a daily basis, designing and building intelligent systems that can explore various use cases and scenarios for distributed computing infrastructure. Just imagine trying to design and build an automated testing system for something that's never been done before. There are no text books that can help you learn this, which is why we have some of the best and brightest engineers working in this group.

Site Reliability
Software engineers working in Site Reliability are involved in every facet of Google's production and work on the cutting edge of cloud-based computing. As a member of this elite team you are in the thick of everything involved with keeping Google running, from code-level troubleshooting of traffic anomalies to maintenance of our most cutting edge services; from monitoring and alerts to building new automation infrastructure. Software engineers on this team love to create robust and scalable software that scale to tens of millions of users. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day, and work with just about every other engineering and operations team to provide services and applications that are quintessentially Google - fast, reliable and accessible to all.
Responsibilities
Perform specific responsibilities which vary by project area.
Minimum qualifications
Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science or related technical discipline.
Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in systems software or algorithms.
Familiarity with TCP/IP and network programming.
Knowledge of Unix/Linux or other OS environments and APIs.
Excellent implementation skills (C++, Python, Java).
title: Software Engineering Intern, PhD, Fall 2015
