Our vision for this team is to be a place where Google team members have fun and grow professionally, and to drive positive changes in how OPG functions/works together as a team.
Responsibilities
Understand developments/trends in the digital marketing field, provide analytical support for key and regional strategies, and create/maintain annual plans
Deliver performance insights through monitoring and reporting on business results
Enable team performance by providing “lead lists” to account managers, create/maintain dashboards useful to account managers, and collaborate with account managers to provide feedback to product development groups

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of industry experience.
Experience in the digital marketing field.
Business level communication in Japanese and English.
Preferred qualifications
MA/MS degree.
Project Management Experience.
Business planning experience
Computer science or similar technical background.
title: Publisher Intelligence Analyst, Online Partnerships Group (OPG)

text:
As a member of Google's Public Policy team, you help shape various product and issue agendas with policy makers inside and outside government. In addition, you will help advise our internal teams on the public policy implications of their products, working with a closely coordinated and cross-functional global team. The role requires significant experience either working with or in government, politics or a regulatory agency as well as an ability to grasp complex technical and policy issues.
As our Manager for Public Policy and Government Relations in the UK, you will represent Google externally with government, regulators and third parties, as well as help manage our local public policy strategy and campaigns. You will work with a cross-functional team of Google employees in the UK as well as with a closely-coordinated global Public Policy team to advance policy positions that benefit our users and an open Internet more generally.Responsibilities
Develop and lead public policy campaigns across the full range of policy areas that impact Google and the web. Key issues include technology innovation, free expression, privacy and intellectual property.
Engage directly with politicians and policy-makers.
Build a network of trade associations, industry partners, non-profit groups and others to support policies that will help create/maintain a user-focused online environment as well as an open Internet.
Manage the Public Policy and Government Relations team in the UK.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Direct experience working within national politics, government, think tanks, public interest groups or the field of corporate public policy.

Preferred qualifications
Broad policy experience, e.g. with direct knowledge of the tech sector or the key issues impacting the Web, like intellectual property, free expression, Internet access and online safety.
Experience working in high-stress environments and a proven ability to exercise judgement even in a crisis.
Self starter with the ability to think, plan, and execute large projects.
Team player who can work with people from a broad range of backgrounds and experience, including to lead campaigns and mentor more junior members.
Excellent communicator with great interpersonal and presentation skills, as well as the ability to write well and translate complex issues into simple language that people who are not experts can understand.
title: Policy Manager, UK and Ireland
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
The Inside Sales Organization looks for those next big opportunities that drive growth for Google. You're the human face of how we do business, often working independently, beyond our offices, traveling to trade shows and meeting with prospective customers. You’re a master of Google services, working closely with clients to pinpoint the right mix of products and advertising strategies that suit their needs. You know the industry inside and out, and are always enthusiastic about finding new opportunities to impact the future of our business.
As a New Business Sales Representative, you will be working closely with our advertisers within a specific industry such as Retail, Technology, Finance, Travel, Local, Entertainment and Media. You will promote Google’s AdWords, the leading text-based advertising platform in the world, as well as Google Display solutions to prospective medium-to-large size companies. You will be part of a dedicated account management team who execute a well thought-out campaign that provides advertisers with measurable return on investment.Responsibilities
Assume a leading role in the team, mentoring and coaching new team members
Review opportunities for new accounts in a designated territory and/or industry sector
Develop and execute a business plan to support the most strategic accounts in the market
Coordinate strategic initiatives such as cross-departmental collaboration with marketing, networking, tradeshows and online research

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Spanish fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Experience on client side, digital media agency and/or within ad sales team
Desire to work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment
Excellent written, verbal, and presentation communication skills, including advanced negotiations, influence, and public speaking ability
title: New Business Sales Representative

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
As a Data Center Business Operations Program Manager, you will provide leadership to realize continuous improvement on the application of analytical methodologies to leverage efficiencies and economies of scale. You will engage with senior leaders to design well-constructed analyses and work cross-functionally with analysts, operations, engineers and facility managers to effectively deliver innovative and actionable recommendations. You are a top performer who will have the ability to “crunch the numbers” one minute and critically think through strategic issues the next. This includes (but is not limited to): “buy vs build” analysis; business case development, competitive intelligence and internal/external benchmarking programs. You will develop relevant metrics that unlock strategic and tactical insights through establishment of the appropriate key performance indicators and respective targets. You are also comfortable with operating in a high-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks, manage time efficiently and navigate ambiguity.Responsibilities
Provide strategic, analytical support for all business intelligence activities for Google’s data centers/hosting business by developing work plans and robust recommendations.
Own and manage multiple initiatives and drive programs both regularly and on an ad-hoc basis to maximize hosting operating efficiencies.
Perform business analytics and decision support models, such as resource and headcount modeling, supplier evaluation, and ROI analysis at a minimum.
Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. Clearly communicate highly technical results, methods, and findings. Influence leaders to take action on these findings.
Travel up to 25-30% as needed.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a quantitative discipline such as finance, economics, statistics, science, or engineering,
or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of relevant work experience in management consulting focused on operational and strategic initiatives.
3 years of technical or engineering experience.

Preferred qualifications
MBA or graduate degree in a management field with an emphasis on business operations and strategy.
Data center industry knowledge and experience in areas such as supplier management, project management, global operations, and/or cost controls in industry.
Ability to conduct business analysis with complex data to identify critical issues to the firm's strategic, organizational, and operations needs.
Data driven problem solving skills; ability to identify key issues, gather and analyze large complex data sets to support hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations.
Applied project management skills; ability to create workable project plans with project scope and execute on such plans.
Executive presentation skills; ability to summarize facts and findings in order to develop conclusions and recommendations in a graphical display.
title: Data Center Business Operations Program Manager

text:
Google's Treasury team is on a mission to optimize the return on Google's financial assets. As a member of this team, you're always looking for innovative ways to help Google invest for the future while limiting volatility and material surprises. In addition to risk busting and asset management, you work collaboratively to administer business insurance programs and stock programs, and provide financial analysis support to our internal teams. You make creative yet calculated decisions that are backed by both experience and your extensive knowledge of the economy and financial industry.
Google's Tax and Treasury teams consist of strong, creative performers with deep expertise in their respective fields. We contribute to our company's growing global success by dealing with challenging issues and concepts and then applying them to rapidly evolving business models. In Treasury, we provide funding, risk management and mitigation support as well as investment oversight. The Tax group is responsible for global tax planning and compliance, defending the company in tax audits, and ensuring that the company accurately reports its tax matters in public filings.
As a Senior Treasury Operations Associate, you will help support our growing corporate Treasury Operations function. The role will include oversight of daily operational support across the Treasury landscape, and responsibilities will entail third party vendor management, strategic analysis around Google’s securities lending program, and helping to identify value-add best practices through benchmarking and project managing. You want to excel in a high growth environment, and are eager to take on increasing levels of responsibility. You are a quick learner, highly organized and someone who can quickly change environments.Responsibilities
Manage third party vendors; analyze, manage, and drive to completion open items as they relate to specific vendors.
Analyze, monitor, and facilitate changes in strategy for Google’s securities lending program.
Manage system evaluations and implementations to address changing operational needs. Drive complex operational initiatives with a strategic orientation.
Handle ad hoc analysis, forecasting, and modeling.
Benchmark and implement best practices.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a corporate treasury/corporate finance team with experience in a middle office or trade support role.
Preferred qualifications
Proven ability to work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment, and to lead and drive complex operational initiatives.
Strong aptitude for systems and technology.
Strong orientation toward third party vendor management.
Collaborative team player with a positive attitude and a sense of humor.
Strong analytical, verbal and written communication skills.
title: Senior Treasury Operations Associate, Treasury Operations Group

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include Anti Abuse Engineer - Tokyo.Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
Google engineers don't simply build our consumer-facing products--they also work to protect the users of those products. As an Anti Abuse Engineer, you will work on tools and platforms to allow the product quality teams to identify abuse patterns and prevent spammers from taking advantage of our users. You will work with Google technologies spanning large scale data processing, clustering and data mining. If you are passionate about developing systems to prevent spam and abuse at Google scale, this is a great role for you. Your work will help maintain the reputation of Google's products and make the Internet a better place for everyone.
Responsibilities
Work on tasks that are part of a single-system project and/or small to medium-size projects of moderate complexity and impact.
Design, develop, test, support and enhance web applications and backend systems. Build systems to process large datasets in parallel on massive clusters.
Collaborate with product and engineering partners to enhance and integrate core abuse-fighting platforms, as well as with operations analysts to detect and prevent spam, fraud and abuse trends, and advocate changes to protect Google’s customers and users.
Increase efficiency through automation, workflow streamlining, and system optimization by working with analyst teams.
Write and review technical documents (including design, development, and revision).

Minimum qualifications
BS degree or relevant experience in Computer Science, statistics, or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Programming experience in one or more of the following languages: C, C++, Java, JavaScript or Python; experience with web technologies, programming paradigms, and algorithms.
Experience designing, implementing, testing, and maintaining subsystems, and to identify relationships between parts of projects.
Ability to speak and write in English and Japanese fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualificationsBS degree with industry experience, or MS degree in Computer Science or related technical field.Experience in numerical analysis, algorithms and/or data-mining.Experience working in Unix/Linux environments and/or cloud technologies such as App Engine, AWS, Hadoop.Knowledge of database design and other data storage solutions.
title: Anti Abuse Engineer

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
The Retail Logistics team is looking for a Logistics Associate to help drive forward the hardware business in North America. On a day-to-day basis you will drive process improvement and apply general problem solving skills across our transportation, distribution and reverse logistics functions supporting North America. You will also play a key role in delivering regional elements of global projects as well as managing regional specific initiatives.Responsibilities
Identify, measure and track key logistics metrics to help drive efficiency across North America network.
Follow up and drive day-to-day problem/issue resolution as it relates to forward and reverse logistics, working with other Googlers and third party logistics (3PLs) to resolve customer escalations.
Play a key role in supporting new product launches coordinating with Retail Operations to ensure proper setup, operations and success of launch.
Organize, moderate and lead cross-functional meetings with 3PLs and transportation providers.
Lead regional improvement projects and assist in delivery of regional elements of global projects.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in a logistics coordinator role or business operations role e.g. working in a customer and vendor facing capacity.
Understanding of B2C/B2B, transportation, fulfillment and distribution operations.
Familiar with import and export processes in relation to consumer electronics devices.
Excellent time management skills with demonstrated ability to operate in a fast-paced environment and juggle ever-changing priorities and deadlines.
Willingness to travel 25% of the time.

text:
As Product Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.
You will be the Product Counsel for a mixed portfolio of work across Geo and Google's efforts to make our products more useful to kids. In this role, you'll work with Product Managers, Engineers and other Geo Product Counsels on a variety of Geo consumer and developer products. You'll work closely with teams from a wide range of product areas as they explore products designed to delight and enrich kids.Responsibilities
Ensure compliance with U.S. and international laws and regulations dealing with intellectual property, privacy, content regulation, consumer protection and advertising.
Provide legal advice to teams including Engineering, Product Management, Public Policy, Sales, Marketing and Communications from the initial stages of product development through launch.
Develop and maintain required product legal resources, including terms of service, privacy notices and other disclosures.
Minimum qualifications
JD, or equivalent education, or equivalent practical experience.
Admission in and good standing with one or more State's Bar.
7 years of related experience.
Preferred qualifications
9 years of relevant work experience in a law firm or in-house legal department.
Experience in relevant privacy and child safety laws (including COPPA).
Background in media, communications, intellectual property or contract law, as well as litigation experience.
Demonstrated experience advising clients in the development of Internet and mobile products and services.
title: Product Counsel, Geo

text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
We have a data-driven culture and need to make use of all available information to drive the right decisions for our users, stakeholders and business. You're a hands-on analytics leader that will build a team of analysts who partner with Product, Operations and other teams to answer key questions about the business. In this highly cross-functional role, you are the voice of our users and will problem-solve with the Product, Operations and Engineering teams.
You have a strong combination of analytical prowess, technical aptitude and business judgment. You’re focused on results, are a self-starter and have a demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, progression and excellence in product and operations.Responsibilities
Grow and lead a team of analysts.
Work with Operations and Product teams to identify key problems.
Untangle ambiguous problems and find the insights that drive operational and product excellence.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience at a management consulting firm or on a corporate strategy team for a high-growth technology firm.
Experience in statistics or business analytics.
Experience in a programming language (Python, Java, C++, Ruby, Perl, etc) and analysis tools (R, Pandas, etc.).
Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master's degree in Engineering or other technical/scientific field of study.
5 years of experience building and managing an analytics team.
3 years of industry experience in a consumer Internet, web analytics or closely related analytics role.
Experience writing and maintaining ETLs that operate on a variety of structured and unstructured sources.
Data analysis skills in a business context with demonstrated success in presenting large datasets in a clear and compelling manner.
Basic scripting skills in either Python or R and advanced SQL skills.
title: Manager, Analytics for Consumer Products

text:
Life on the web moves fast, and our millions of users around the world expect nothing less from us. Which is why Google is passionate about developing and releasing software rapidly. As a Software Engineer in Test (SET), your mission is to build the tools and infrastructure to increase our developers' efficiency. You play a crucial part in Google's success by partnering with the software developers to ensure that our code is thoroughly tested to the highest standards. In doing so, you help us secure our business future by creating the next generation of tools and frameworks that make our users and developers more productive.
Responsibilities
Analyze and decompose Google's large-scale cloud services and design a strategy to test this system.
Design and build intelligent systems that enable and validate high quality releases at fast pace.
Invent and extend methodologies for validation of scalable production systems.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of work experience in software engineering or test automation, or related field.
Preferred qualifications
4 years of relevant work experience, including 2 years of industry experience.
A solid foundation in Computer Science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design.
title: Software Engineer in Test

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
Google products play a pre-eminent role in Google being a leader and driving the internet revolution. We're looking for strong Program Managers who can take charge of high performing teams and work with capable vendors to deliver on one or more projects in a region. You will be a leader with outstanding decision-making skills, management experience and flexibility. Most importantly, you will be extremely comfortable working in amorphous situations. 

Besides execution skills, you are entrepreneurial and enthusiastic with the ability to think of smart and innovative solutions. In this fast-growing environment, you will also exercise extraordinary judgment as a key stakeholder in our hiring process of the contractual staff. You are extremely proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, and work well within a fast-paced group. You also use innovative methods to share industry insight and propose product solutions while employing quantitative abilities to make effective, strategic decisions. This is a fast-paced and cross-functional leadership role working with program managers, product managers, country managers, etc.Responsibilities
Manage ongoing projects, vendor relationships and set up large teams including vendor team sourcing/hiring.
Collaborate across offices with multiple stakeholders while managing multiple projects.
Manage vendor/agencies for programs in multiple cities in India.
Influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of
management while having exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Recommend and implement improvement processes and projects, with little or no direction.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical or business related field or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
10 years of experience managing complex, multi-group, multi-disciplinary projects.
Project management experience.
Understanding and passion for online products/services like Maps, local business listings, etc.
Ability to manage large onsite and offsite vendor relationships.
Ability to define projects, execute within timelines and with multiple stakeholders, and deliver projects on time and to budget.
Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
title: Program Manager, Local Data Operations

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
Responsibilities
Lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple simultaneous projects with competing priorities simultaneously. Interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels.
Provide technical direction for existing and future corporate financial infrastructure including, but not limited to, third party developed business critical and highly complex applications.
Handle data collection and automation challenges.
Perform operational forecasting, capacity planning and oversee continuous improvement of infrastructure to ensure implementation meets current and future business needs.
Identify metrics and drive initiatives to improve the quality of Google Services.

Minimum qualifications

B.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical/quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience running projects in the area of business critical applications and services in a highly redundant implementation, including experience in systems architecture and conceptual design of operational support functions.

Preferred qualifications
MBA or MS degree in Engineering.
Project Management Professional Certification.
Experience with one or more of: NetApp or IBM Storage solutions, complex networking environments (Switching, Routing, Packet Filtering), highly virtualized environments and the involved technologies (e.g. VmWare vSphere).
Experience in operations of financial reporting or supply chain systems.
Hands-on technical experience in Systems and/or Database Administration.
Ability to understand technical complex subjects and technologies and relevance to the project.
title: Technical Program Manager, Corporate Applications

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.
Google Play is growing at a rapid pace, serving millions of Android users, both new and existing, with apps and games that are innovative, useful and entertaining. You’ll be part of the Google Play Games Business Development team, which manages the game developer ecosystem and develops relationships with game developers, ranging from small independent developers to the largest game companies in the world. 

As a Partner Development Manager for Google Play Games, you’ll become the primary point of contact for key game partners. You’ll be responsible for growing the game ecosystem on Google Play, through your work with partners and internal cross-functional teams. You'll apply your expertise in the games industry as well as your platform perspective to guide partners to success on Google Play. You’ll develop expert knowledge of game partner priorities and key metrics, and will be an advocate for partners within Google. You’ll focus on sourcing and supporting great indie games on Google Play. We imagine you’ll have fun with it; you'll be working with supportive, highly capable colleagues, and you'll be playing a lot of games with full diplomatic immunity.Responsibilities
Apply game production/management experience to direct full lifecycle support for key game partners.
Become the primary point of contact for key game partners, including outreach programs for new devices and services.
Communicate and collaborate with the cross-functional team (product, engineering, marketing) to grow the size of the game ecosystem on Google Play.
Track and understand key partner metrics, to understand the health of developer businesses.
Provide feedback and market intelligence from partners to internal stakeholders to identify product gaps and requirements.
Minimum qualifications

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience sourcing, managing and negotiating with partners to create relationships.
Preferred qualifications
3 years of experience in games production/development.
3 years of experience in games business development.
Passion for and understanding of games, mobile technology and Google’s products; enjoys playing games.
Strong understanding of mobile games, business models, distribution channels, and competitive landscape.
title: Partner Development Manager, Google Play Games, Indies

text:
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders to guide our client sales teams. As a Country manager, you'll lead and coach high-performing account teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. Sales managers willingly help their teams and roll up their sleeves to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive service. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.
You work with the Sales Leadership team to represent your assigned market inside Google on market performance, market requirements and future plans, bringing together prioritized asks for global products, policy or business decisions essential for the market. You work with your management team to develop strategies for coaching high-performing account managers. You create a shared vision and a combined growth plan with all Small- to Medium-sized Business (SMB) teams driving a 'One SMB' approach across Acquisition, Channel Sales, Global Customer Experience and Marketing. You partner with your Large Customer Sales (LCS) Country Manager and Teams to develop specific areas of collaboration that drive growth. When required you front local PR, media or events for SMB clients on behalf of the market.Responsibilities
Represent SMB Sales for our market on all strategic, operational and customer facing issues internally and externally to Google.
Be responsible for business growth and productivity attainment by representing the SMB Sales Team in target setting for our market. Take ownership for delivery of targets for our market and program devising strategies to meet quarterly quotas.
Work cross-functionally and with LCS stakeholders to develop an ambitious growth plan for our market and execute successfully against it.
Develop and implement innovative best practices for business programs and markets. Ensure that your team is always up-to-date with the newest advertiser solutions.
Manage a team of SMB Sales Representatives and team leads, working on the growth of Google's advertiser. Coach and manage your team to develop sales and account management skills and contribute to the management of the wider EMEA team.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA.
Central and Eastern Europe (CEE) market experience.
Experience leading teams, with a strong focus on coaching and mentoring, and demonstrated success developing sales teams and hitting targets
Ability to think strategically and ability to make changes to meet strategic needs within our market.
Strong, established and recognized presence in a regional marketplace with an extensive list of relationships.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects while paying strict attention to detail. Self-starter who is comfortable with a rapidly-changing environment and working to targets.
title: Country Manager, SMB Sales (CEE)

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
The role enables you to shape the product development process and organize product launches from beginning to end.Responsibilities
Define the strategy to drive consumer adoption for each of Play’s digital content product verticals (Music, Movies, Books, Newsstand). This will include working internally with other Google teams to introduce Play to existing Google consumers as well as tactics to bring new users to Play.
Manage a team of marketers who will execute the marketing strategy.
Seek actionable consumer insights to inform the product and marketing strategy and advocate for the consumer across marketing, product, and partners.
Be responsible for consumer insights, competitive analysis, product positioning, naming, objectives and metrics, launch and marketing strategy, and lifecycle management.
Work with a cross-functional team across Product Development, Partnerships, Merchandising, Marketing Communications, PR, Legal, and more.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of relevant work experience with experience in consumer product marketing leadership.
Preferred qualifications
A great passion for consumers and consumer experiences, with a demonstrated ability to utilize consumer insights and data to improve the customer experience. Experience working in digital entertainment.
Strong leadership and people management skills, with ability to both nurture creativity and drive operational process and discipline.
Demonstrated talent at building collaborative partnerships with product teams.
Ability to analyze research or performance data, develop insights and apply the insight to optimize marketing activities.
Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally across all levels of management, and work on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
title: Head of Digital Entertainment Product Marketing, Google Play

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The External Telesales Operations team is currently looking for a Vendor Operations Lead to support our outsourced SMB acquisitions business in the Philippines. You will be responsible for managing the day-to-day relationship with our vendor partner, and continuing our effective partnership with the country marketing team in Manila and Singapore. You will focus on the rhythm of the business, supporting the vendor management team in running a successful AdWords Sales team, and ensuring the vendor reps have the Google product and internal tool knowledge to be successful. You will be required to work closely with the central management teams (Marketing and External Telesales Operations) in Dublin and Mountain View. This role is ideal if you are interested in a career involving large-scale program management, sales and business development.

ETO is a team focused on acquiring Small and Medium sized Businesses globally for Google’s advertising products using outsourced telesales operations. ETO partners with third party vendors to build and optimize campaigns, and educate our new advertisers.
Responsibilities
Support SMB business through effective business partnering and overall support of our vendor operations. Deliver induction training for new Sales Representatives, especially with regards to AdWords product training, campaign building, and regular product and policy updates.
Serve as onsite Google representative providing Google-specific product and tool support for our vendor partner. Act as a liaison between our vendor and country B2B Marketing Team. Coordinate with relevant internal Google departments.
Review and evaluate the service quality of our vendor against contracted Service Level Agreements. Partner with vendor management team to develop programs for Sales Representatives and campaign builder improvement
Analyze and present weekly performance figures to the ETO management team, participate in weekly updates and monthly business reviews between Google and the outsourcing partner
Highlight and top line key business insights to stakeholders and ETO management on a weekly basis. Work on initiatives and projects that improve ETO operations
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience

Preferred qualifications
Experience in sales and sales management.
Sales force experience with excellent problem solving, project management and communication skills.
Demonstrated product training, business partnering and leadership abilities.

text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.
As a Content Partner Operations Associate you will provide YouTube support to our top entertainment partners in the US and Canada. You will become a YouTube product expert, solve the day-to-day issues of our partners, and identify common trends our partners face. You will also be responsible for advocating on behalf of the partner to cross-functional teams to drive product solutions, development of tools, and processes improvements that enhance internal operations and the partner experience on YouTube.Responsibilities
Provide operational support for direct partners on the YouTube platform, primarily through email communication.
Contribute to scaling Partner Operations for YouTube through innovation, efficiency gains, and root cause analysis.
Serve as a consultant to internal cross-functional stakeholders on the YouTube product.
Identify key metrics to evaluate data both quantitatively and qualitatively. Streamline operational workflow by identifying and eliminating bottlenecks.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree with a focus in Operations Research, Statistics, Economics, Finance or other quantitative discipline or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with Internet technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, Flash, SQL databases and scripting languages such as PHP, Python.
Experience in a customer-facing (external or internal) role. Positive client-facing attitude for troubleshooting and timely resolution.
Track record of being proactive, making constructive suggestions, and coming up with innovative ways to scale.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with a strong desire to learn the YouTube platform.
Ability to manage, track, and analyze large volumes of data.
Impeccable communication and organizational skills with a strong attention to detail.
title: Content Partner Operations Associate, YouTube

text:
The gTech Ads team is a solution-generating force that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. In addition to troubleshooting on the customer side, we work with Sales, Product and Engineering teams within Google to develop better tools and services to improve our products based on the evolving needs of our users. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.
As a Google Analytics Technical Product Specialist, you are the lead engagement owner taking responsibility for the success of Google Analytics Premium implementations. As such, you will lead Google Analytics deployments, optimize implementations and post-implementation support, provide insights for Google's clients and manage the overall technical aspects to set the foundation for a strong, successful and long-term relationship with the client.Responsibilities
Design customer centric analytics solutions by understanding a customer's business and online marketing goals, gathering requirements, defining project scope, and providing technical and product guidance.
Provide superior technical support and build successful long-term relationships with both internal and external clients.
Oversee multiple consulting engagements including product implementations, custom report design, system integrations, and best practice consulting.
Build deep product expertise for Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.
Collaborate with cross-functional partners to ensure the timely delivery of client solutions and lead strategic projects to improve Google Analytics' client offering and internal operation.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Google Analytics and Go-to-Market experience including working with reports and implementing code.
Experience with SQL, HTML, JavaScript and or Unix/Linux.
Preferred qualifications
GAIQ certification.
iOS and Android App development experience.
Advanced technical understanding of Google Analytics and Online Marketing Industry.
Highly motivated and flexible individual with a proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive projects to successful and timely delivery.
title: Google Analytics Technical Product Specialist

text:
YouTube's growing user base provides unique challenges and new responsibilities everyday. Fast-paced, dynamic and proactive, the Content and User Operations team serves YouTube's advertisers, publishers and users around the world. Like a diligent detective, your responsibilities are to uncover and understand common issues facing these groups, and then work with the right teams to tackle the problem. Whether surfacing issues to our technical teams or recommending improvements to the team's processes and tools, you enhance the user experience on YouTube while helping increase our loyal user base over time.
The Global Scaled Services team keeps YouTube growing and successful. We are dedicated to supporting the company's growing base of users, advertisers, publishers in more than 40 languages on a global basis, and providing them with the highest levels of service. Our team members are proactive, motivated, organized, and possess a global perspective - and able to work well in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. 

As part of the Policy Operations team, Policy Specialists are directly responsible for making the internet safer, protecting free speech and defending our brand. You are passionate about cutting-edge policy developments and applications in a digital age. You have an excellent understanding of the social media policy issues, particularly around those affecting the APAC region. You want to help define how people around the world communicate with one another and express their points of view through YouTube. You thrive in a fast, dynamic, demanding environment where no two days are ever the same. You have the ability to interpret high-level policies into concrete and enforceable guidelines and propagate these feedback and training across a global team. You will have exposure to legal, policy and PR stakeholders and will need to help define and implement operational solutions to emerging threats. In addition, you will perform other key Policy Operations functions including driving improvements in the team's processes, technology and tools.Responsibilities
Enforce YouTube policy guidelines on edge case escalations from our Global Enforcement teams.
Implement approved policy changes for the Global Enforcement team, including training, communications with onsite teams, etc.
Provide region-specific policy escalation reviews raised by enforcement or other teams at Google; pass informed, principled, consistent verdicts on high profile or grey-area policy escalations.
Act as point of contact for regional APAC stakeholders on all policy issues.
Monitor and research current and emerging policy issues affecting the APAC region.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience with content policy or anti-abuse operations.
Preferred qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Policy, Politics, Law or related.
Online experience. Familiarity with Internet policy and regulatory environments, particularly within APAC.
Demonstrated capacity for critical thinking and analysis. Strong attention to detail. Highly proactive with the ability to capitalize on opportunities without top level guidance.
Excellent project manager and self-starter, with the ability to work independently and on multiple initiatives at the same time. Ability to work flexibly and to exercise good judgment in a high pressure environment.
Passion for keeping our users safe while protecting free speech.
Competency in spreadsheet software, SQL and other technical skills. Strong written and spoken communications skills.
title: APAC Policy Specialist, YouTube

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
You are an "ideas person" but also an expert at executing and launching programs, and creating tools and programming. Your brain looks at every brand and every product, and thinks of thirty things that they could do to drive more love from their customers and greater usage of their products and services. And you obsess about the role that technology plays in the lives of consumers. You are an amazing partner marketing manager and can be a partner-in-crime and champion for Google Play partners in the Brand vertical (CPG, Airlines, etc).
As a Partner Marketing Manager for Google Play, you will be responsible for building relationships with Brand partners, creating and launching innovative, best-in-class programs and campaigns with those partners to bring more customers to Google Play. You will identify the benefits to Play, the partner, and the user in a way that helps drive deeper awareness and consideration for Google Play, ultimately ensuring every Android device purchaser is a Google Play user from the moment they first activate.
You understand what motivates businesses and brands, and you help partner's understand that by focusing more of their marketing investment on Google Play, their customers will see more value in their product as well.  Your focus is on building deep relationships and engagement with partners. You can talk the talk with partner companies, and influence their decisions by knowing the market, partner companies, users, and the Google Play business inside and out.Responsibilities
Work with brand partners to create new opportunities and programs to increase customer acquisition and retention through partner channels.
Work closely with Business Development and Retail teams to establish ongoing presence at key retailers and carriers in North America and globally.
Help the Product and Business Development teams to manage the operational components of strategic partner campaigns, identifying and driving business growth opportunities.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience creating and executing marketing partner programs.
Preferred qualifications
8 years of product and/or partner marketing in technology marketing (consumer or business) in multinational organizations where you have demonstrated successful partner marketing program development.
4 years of product and/or partner marketing experience.
Strong product and project management skills in helping partners launching co-marketing campaigns and programs.
Strong communication and organizational skills, strong ability to comfortably interface with all levels of management, and to communicate cross-functionally in a structured and clear manner to influence outcomes.
title: Partner Marketing Manager, Google Play Brands

text:
Google isn't just a software company. The Hardware Operations team is responsible for monitoring the state-of-the-art physical infrastructure behind Google's powerful search technology. As an Operations Technician, you'll install, configure, test, troubleshoot and maintain hardware (like servers and its components) and server software (like Google's Linux cluster). You'll also tackle the configuration of more complex components such as networks, routers, hubs, bridges, switches and networking protocols. You'll participate in or lead small project teams on larger installations and develop project contingency plans. A typical day involves manual movement and installation of racks, and while it can sometimes be physically demanding, you are excited to work with infrastructure that is at the cutting-edge of computer technology.
Responsibilities
Install new servers as our Linux cluster grows. Install switches, routers, and other networking gear.
Help test and troubleshoot new server hardware components.
Resolve issues with broken equipment with little to no escalation. Configure and troubleshoot Linux OS-related issues.
Cover on call responsibilities.
Assist in creating and documenting new processes (and in improving existing ones).
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience working with and troubleshooting of hardware/network related issues using Linux based tools.
Experienced with Linux system administration.
Ability to speak and write in English and Cantonese fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Hardware knowledge: very good understanding of PC hardware, comfortable in troubleshooting and repairing servers; Substantial experience in end-to-end ownership of issues and execution of small/medium size projects; Recent networking/Unix certifications.
Linux knowledge: familiar with the Linux environment and experience as administrator.
Networking knowledge: comfortable in troubleshooting network issues, familiar with main protocols and common types of devices and data transmission media.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Must be flexible on hours; weekend and/or shift work will be required. Extensive traveling will be required.
Able to lift/move 50lbs of equipment on a daily basis.
title: Data Center Operations Engineer

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The Global Support team in gTech Ads plays a critical role in Google's success, supporting Sales teams, advertisers and products that enhance business potential by consistently providing scalable product solutions, reliable information based on efficient, consultative analysis, accurate implementations and timely communications. Alongside our support and troubleshooting work, we partner with Sales, Product Management and Engineering to focus on developing innovative, scalable support solutions that effectively serve our growing customer base. 

As a Support Specialist, you will work closely with advertisers and the global Sales teams to drive troubleshooting, and implementation support. In this role you will become an expert, focused on handling troubleshooting and/or implementation tasks so that the Sales teams can concentrate their efforts on client-specific activities. This is a specialist role focused on providing the highest quality of support to both our Sales teams and the advertisers they work with.Responsibilities
Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service, troubleshooting and resolving issues from Sales teams and Google's advertisers
Manage sales and customer inquiries by live chat, tickets, and other channels
Work directly with large advertisers as well as internal Sales teams
Contribute to the development of internal products. Carry out one-off projects as required for large advertisers
Provide emergency expert support during non-office hours when required
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in Korean and English fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
2 years of experience in an online advertising role.
Customer focus with strong communication skills and client facing experience.
Familiarity with the ad serving industry and internet technologies (JavaScript, HTML, Flash).
Being extremely proactive, organized, responsible, and having the proven ability to work well with a team.

text:
This position will be based in Charlotte, NC.
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google works with thousands of strategic partners across the globe every day. The Google Fiber Operations team is responsible for ensuring that these partnerships run seamlessly. Part financial, part legal and administrative, and part infrastructure, you ensure compliance for Google's Multi-family Dwelling Unit and/or Small and Medium Businesses inside plant construction. You proactively review existing and new contracts, permits, terms and obligations. You coordinate with Facilities, Outside Plant (OSP), Network Operations (NetOps), and Finance to ensure successful project completion. In addition, you will be required to ensure quality control is maintained on all the builds. Your diligence ensures all users and partners have uninterrupted operations and 100% satisfaction.
Responsibilities
Manage construction for the last mile deployment of Google Fiber’s MDU, Small and Medium Businesses (SMB), and Community Connection construction across the market/metro area.
Manage project budgets, installation schedules, production and contractor resource assignment and track contractor performance including billing against budget and contract. Support progress reporting, invoice approval, and material handling with the contractors. Prioritize and multitask projects and see them through to completion, as individual and team contributor.
Handle daily updates and feedback required for troubleshooting and internal ticketing system. Report field production and other key metrics on daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Work with and communicate progress to internal stakeholders and ensure that projects are scoped properly and handed off seamlessly for network deployment. Work closely with cross-functional teams including Google Fiber OSP/NetOps/Sales/Business/Customer Service in coordinating all project activities, resource requirements and business goals.
Establish and coordinate quality control requirements for Fiber to the Home (FTTH) build. Evaluate vendor performance and manage escalation processes for construction and maintenance incidents.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in Project/Program Management role specific to FTTH construction (OSP/ISP).

Preferred qualifications
Experience interpreting fiber test results and auditing projects for compliance with scopes of work. A deep understanding of inside and outside plant fiber optic network infrastructure, engineering design and construction.
Experience in managing contractors and field technicians.
Knowledge/experience with project management tools.
Knowledge/experience with Web Applications.
Knowledge of telecommunications and related standards and regulations - an industry insider.
Strong interpersonal, analytical and communication skills. Flexible and able to think quickly.
title: Construction Manager (Inside Plant), Google Fiber, Charlotte

text:
Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services - and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. Your team of Online Candidate Specialists own the first step of the online application process by reviewing all resumes submitted via Google’s online channels to North America's technical campus hiring efforts. Your team will be part of a global resume review team, using assessment skills to identify the best resumes based on defined criteria, hiring guidelines and policies. Their speed and accuracy are critical to ensuring that all applicants are assessed carefully, fairly and in a timely manner, delivering the positive experience that candidates expect from Google. Their aptitude for understanding role-specific qualifications and zeroing in on top talent to match our roles are critical to Google’s ability to achieve its growth goals.
As the lead, you will work with the campus recruiting team to deliver the best technical talent from campuses. You will be responsible for managing a highly calibrated team to deliver strong technical profiles to all North America sites at high velocity. As lead for the Americas, you will align with the global campus screening teams and our screening strategies, taking advantage of both synergies and opportunities.
Responsibilities
Partner with both the wider U.S. team and broader global team to ensure that the Austin-based team is empowered to deliver exceptional service to candidates and clients every time.
Manage the dynamic workload, optimally distributing amongst the team to ensure that the service line maintains continuity, quality and our service level agreements.
Understand functional hiring needs, position specifications and search requirements to act as a resume evaluation expert.
Own, drive and revolutionize Google's global approach to reviewing online applicants from our campus efforts.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of work experience or 4 years of recruiting/sourcing/search firm experience, including using an applicant tracking system.
Preferred qualifications
Experience managing a high performing, fast moving team.
Direct experience working in campus recruiting, understanding the full campus cycle.
Strong analytical skills, a data-driven approach to decision making and a systems-thinking style when problem solving.
Familiarity with office productivity tools, web based recruiting technologies and Google Apps.
Excellent communication, interpersonal and customer service skills and proven ability to take initiative and build strong, productive relationships.
title: Online Candidate Lead, Campus Technical

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.
As an Online Candidate Specialist, you will manage the first step of the online application consideration process by reviewing all resumes submitted by candidates to Google's corporate website. You will be part of a global resume review team, using your recruiting background and ability to quickly calibrate to Google’s hiring standards. You will evaluate and identify the best resumes based on defined criteria in accordance with Google’s hiring guidelines and policies. Your speed and accuracy are critical to ensure that all applicants are carefully considered and assessed in a timely manner, contributing to an overall positive experience that candidates can expect from Google. Moreover, your aptitude for understanding various role specific qualifications and zeroing in on top talent for further consideration by our recruiting team will help make a visible impact on Google’s ability to achieve its ongoing growth objectives.
Responsibilities
Understand functional hiring needs, position specifications and search requirements to act as a resume evaluation expert for engineering and operations groups.
Partner closely with recruiters to derive mutually agreeable selection criteria, receive and action feedback, and deliver a high level of customer service every time.
Monitor, review and take action on the daily influx of candidate resumes, accurately screening against defined criteria and recording the outcome of your review appropriately in Google’s applicant tracking system (ATS). Maintain responsibility for entry, maintenance, and integrity of data in Google’s applicant tracking system.
Partner with recruiters, hiring managers and team members to generate ideas, leverage resources and share information that facilitates an effective screening process.
Focus on continuous improvement by solving problems and producing solutions. Offer suggestions, new ideas or alternatives to improve or modify work processes.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Information Technology or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of experience in HR, staffing or a business environment.
Technical experience or hands-on technical staffing experience.
Preferred qualifications
2 years of work experience or 1 year recruiting/sourcing/search firm experience, including familiarity with using an applicant tracking system.
Proven ability to take initiative, adapt quickly to changing priorities, work with a high sense of urgency and build strong, productive relationships.
Familiarity with office productivity tools, web based recruiting technologies and Google Apps.
Passion for the recruiting industry and a sincere desire to expand your exposure to this field.
Excellent communication, interpersonal and customer service skills.
title: Online Candidate Specialist

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
At Google, we’re passionate about the intersection of internet platforms, connected devices, content distribution, and Education. Our team's mission is to create and support an integrated vision that injects all of the technical and cost advantages of thoughtful ICT into diverse classrooms around the globe. As a Program Manager within the Google for Education team, you will lead efforts to design, communicate, and iterate a unified vision to meet these diverse needs.
