text:
Google's Sales Advertising Operations team is devoted to finding relevant solutions that meet our clients' changing advertising needs. The Technical Production team brings our clients' advertising campaigns to life by working closely with Sales Account Executives, agencies, clients and Sales Engineers to create and operate branded advertising programs. You will handle program management to ensure a smooth end-to-end execution of programs—from supporting pitch development and coordinating with creative agencies to reporting success metrics and communicating timelines with engineering, consultants and media managers. You will identify new creative opportunities based on sales and industry trends, customer needs and ROI analyses.
As a Brand Specialist, you will operationalize new Google Display Advertising products in APAC, as well as support these products on an ongoing technical escalation basis from the Media Solutions Consultant team.

You will take the lead operations role within a cross-functional team including sales product specialist leads, operations vendors, global peers, engineering, advertising technology specialists and product managers to implement new display advertising products at scale across APAC.

You will then follow through and support the implementation on an escalation basis, by being available as a strong technical expert, best practice adviser and vendor operations manager for all phases of executing across the display advertising lifecycle.Responsibilities
Provide technical feasibility assessments and consultations
Project manage and hands on implementation of media campaigns and programs, including coordination between client, Sales, vendor teams to deliver a campaign or program and development of template based solutions - eg. custom gadgets, dynamic campaigns
Advocate Brand Products for Media and Creative agencies externally and internally
Partner with other areas at Google to introduce new products in market
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of working experience with client side web technologies (e.g. HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.).
1 year of customer facing experience, supporting product implementations, digital ad operations, or technical sales experience.
Preferred qualifications
MS or MBA degree.
Experience with some programming language (e.g. Java, Python, etc.).
Working knowledge of SQL databases.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Creative problem-solving and strong analytical skills.
Proven communication skills and ease to explain technical concepts to non-technical and executive audiences.
title: Brand Specialist

text:
Google is a universally recognized name. The Localization team helps Google's ideas and products look, feel and sound natural to users in their own countries. We collaborate with international Engineering, Product and Marketing teams to steer products through the localization process and ensure successful launches across the globe. Our team is an international collection of enthusiastic, creative and knowledgeable people who excel in a fast-paced, culturally diverse environment. You are an excellent communicator who plays a strategic role by building relationships with partner teams to establish needs, deadlines and budgets. You will flex your project management skills in order to ensure that our Localization process runs effectively and efficiently.
As Head of Global Operations, you are responsible for delivering high-quality localized products and content. You will work closely with Engineers, Product Managers, Content Authors, Marketing Managers, and Language Specialists. You are a self-starter, proactive, collaborative and dedicated to meeting deadlines and producing results. You thrive working in a culturally diverse and fast-paced environment. You have a background in people and project management.
The Google Localization Team translates and adapts Google’s products, marketing materials and support content, into more than 75 languages. Localization supports Google’s continuous innovation and fast-paced launch cycles, working across multiple functions and locations. This means that Localization team members need to be proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, and able to work well in a fast-paced, multi-cultural and team-oriented environment.
As Head of Global Operations, you will lead a team responsible for developing and executing a vendor strategy that ensures highest quality localization while driving efficiency and flexibility. In addition, you will identify new vendor strategies to support emerging product needs beyond transitional translation and localization. You are a strategic leader who possesses the ability to work globally and cross-functionally with several internal stakeholders through effective relationship building, influence, and communication skills. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity. You demonstrate analytical thinking through data-driven decisions, and the technical know-how, charisma, and ability to work with your team to provide leadership to do what it takes to get things done in order to make a difference.
Responsibilities
Play a key role in the development and management of our operations by defining success, and set the vendor management vision and strategy for localization across all Google products.
Manage Localization’s vendor operations globally, ensuring we set the bar for high quality, efficiency, and flexibility of our vendor functions globally; ensure we are are meeting a high standard for delivery of service.
Develop scalable solutions and ensure operational execution by partnering with Localization Production Managers and Language Services, as well as vendors directly; Work closely with various internal groups to understand business requirements, implement new processes, and contribute to ongoing process improvements.
Manage overall relationship with the onsite vendor workforce. Monitor cost, quality, and delivery of service and lead regular business reviews, vendor relationship management activities, workforce planning, and budgeting activities in coordination with internal teams, and drive improvements in all relevant metrics (e.g. costs, turnaround time, quality, productivity).
Manage vendor selection process and partner with Procurement and Legal to negotiate and execute contracts; Ensure documentation of vendor agreements and train Localization team on relevant workflows.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience building a global supplier strategy and global vendor network within the internet/technology industry or related field (e.g., software product development, localization, etc.), end to end, including establishment of Service Level Agreements and execution of contracts.
Experience leading and managing international teams and executive stakeholders, and in developing, managing and executing strategies to deliver software solutions.
Experience spearheading and owning product development within an internet technology company.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or advanced technical degree.
Leadership business development experience in negotiating engagements with 3rd party software suppliers; experience managing relationships with outsourcing (including offshore) teams as well as running end-to-end operations with those parties.
Demonstrated executive leadership experience in operations management within a leading consumer technology company.
Demonstrated experience in managing vendor operations globally for a technology company, ensuring a high standard for delivery including SLAs, etc.
Business process improvement and project management expertise.
Fluency in two or more languages.
title: Head of Global Operations, Localization

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
You are responsible for assisting in the implementation and management of clinical trials. You will work closely with study managers, CRAs, research coordinators and clinical investigators to ensure compliance with protocols.

You will be part of a small team, so self-direction is critical. You will help identify projects/tasks and, in collaboration with the Study Manager, you will be maintaining consistent CRF data quality and management across sites.
Responsibilities
Assist the Study Manager in all aspects of clinical trials: develop protocol and informed consent form and other study-related documents using knowledge of GCP/ICH and other regulatory requirements; manage day-to-day responsibilities of clinical studies at investigational sites.
Assist with managing the investigator contract, budget, and payment process, and be responsible for initiating and tracking scheduling, payments and subject compensation.
Develop Case Report Forms (CRF), CRF guidelines and other study forms to be utilized by investigational sites. Co-monitor site visits including pre-study, initiation, interim and close-out visits, and ensures protocol compliance, accurate and thorough data collection, and appropriate study conduct.
Initiate and track device shipments and dispositions, and ensure that device supplies are adequate for investigational sites/assigned studies. Complete data entry and data resolution in clinical database, and perform review of CRF data for quality, completeness and accuracy. Conduct basic data analysis and interpretation, and coordinate and review regulatory documents from investigational sites as well as in-house to ensure compliance with protocol and applicable regulations.
Understand study timelines and manage investigational sites to meet enrollment goals and timelines. Collaborate and drive cross-functional activities in support of studies, and present at Investigator/Study Coordinator meetings, as needed.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a life science, health science, RN, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of industry experience including 1 year in Clinical Research in Diagnostic or Therapeutic Medical Devices.
2 years of direct Clinical Research experience.
Experience in clinical research at either a hospital or Medical Device/Pharmaceutical company. Experience in GCP and FDA regulations.

Preferred qualifications
MS degree in a life science, health science, RN, or related field.
Experience working with Combination Device
Proficiency in productivity software and tools such as Google Apps.
Basic data analysis and interpretation skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills with strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
title: Clinical Research Coordinator (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
The YouTube Video Infrastructure team is responsible for much of the “pipes” of YouTube. We handle challenges in video processing, content delivery and the inner workings of our YouTube players. Our work behind the scenes bring to life new features and improved experiences for our users (e.g. reduced latency). Projects include new format/encoding work for emerging industry trends, scaling the Content Delivery Network for existing and emerging markets, building underlying capabilities for our verticals (Music, Kids, Movies/Shows) features, optimizing our ingest/video processing systems, and rolling out new capabilities to our core player.Responsibilities
Lead or collaborate with the YouTube video infrastructure team leadership on key projects, including identifying and investigating issues, developing project plans, allocating resources, and defining resolution processes.
Identify and prioritize team needs and implement processes, tools, communications to deliver quality, timely results.
Provide project management for engineering and product efforts, cross team integrations, notes, product launches.
Apply technical judgment to efficiently make progress, resolve problems on technical issues with your teams, and determine, gather, and analyze metrics around our systems.
Provide clear communication to YouTube Leads regarding project status, resource requirements, issues, and priorities.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience managing engineering/product projects.
2 years of experience leading teams.
Experience with project management software and Google Docs.

Preferred qualifications
MA/MS degree.
Experience working with video processing/content delivery/player technologies.
The ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously, multi-task, define successful approaches, and proactively solve problems across cross-functional teams.
Ability to find creative solutions to complex situations.
Effectiveness in working across organizational boundaries to define, manage, and prioritize work.
Articulate communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills and the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
title: Technical Program Manager, YouTube Video Infrastructure

text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
You are passionate about Google products and helping them succeed in international markets. The gTech Consumers team is focused on providing outstanding support for Google’s users across multiple products and languages through all aspects of support operations.
As an EMEA Product Support Manager, you will have in-depth knowledge of the product and support a multilingual team of specialists who manage the community and help centers for that product. You will investigate and troubleshoot bugs and ensure consumer feedback flows to the product team to drive improvements. You’ll work to advocate for your regional users, develop the support strategy for your product across International markets and work closely with the gTech Consumers global team as a product expert and end-user champion.
Responsibilities
Develop regional user support experience and strategy for Google’s Geo product offerings based on a deep understanding of products and markets, leading cross functional teams to execute against recommended plans.
Identify, drive, and optimize the operations support plan, leveraging support team members and Google technologies.
Engage and partner with key Product decision makers to communicate and realize regional support goals.
Maintain a pulse on user feedback, provide prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges, and provide meaningful feedback to product teams to make Google products better for market users.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with Internet products and technologies.
Ability to speak and write in and fluently English idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
MBA or other advanced degree.
Experience on Geo-related products.
Experience working in EMEA region.
Ability to work independently on project deliverables in a fast-paced, ambiguous, and global environment with proven success in project management, execution and multi-tasking.
Excellent communication skills in the context of negotiation, business representation to senior stakeholders, and influencing without authority to cross-functional partners.

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
Makani is a Special project to generate clean and efficient energy using autonomous tethered wind turbines (www.google.com/makani). We’re looking for an electrical engineer or embedded programmer to join a small, fast paced group focused on the development of the Makani powertrain, the unit on the Energy Kites that produces both power and thrust. It is a complex subassembly involving electrical design and implementation, control, mechanical design, embedded programming, design for manufacturing, reliability testing, and system performance characterization and optimization.
You are broadly talented and have significant experience in one or more of the above categories, with a particular emphasis on embedded programming and real world system bring up and debugging. You are also a passionate and capable electrical engineer excited to join our team and to help design our next generation prototype. You seek the opportunity to solve interesting and challenging problems on a very unique project. Our primary facilities are in Alameda, CA so you must be willing to spend a majority of your time in the East Bay.
Responsibilities
Program 100kW electromechanical embedded drive systems.
Design, debug and test electromechanical drive systems and control PCBs.
Find suppliers, design and implement environmental test plans, and delve into various other tasks related to designing and implementing new hardware.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience writing, testing and debugging embedded code.
Experience analyzing and debugging analog and digital circuits.
Experience with mechanical systems.
Preferred qualifications
MA/MS degree in Electrical Engineering or related field.
Experience with power electronics or power switching circuit and control design.
Willingness to pick up and improve on unfamiliar analysis tools.
Interest in working on a small, fast paced team where a variety of skills, new and old, will need to be applied daily.
Passion for renewable energy.
Good communication and time management skills.
title: Inverter Electrical Engineer (Makani), Special Projects

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Track and understand key partner metrics to understand the health of developer businesses.

Initiate and execute programs to scale existing partner programs.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience sourcing, managing and negotiating with partners to create relationships.

15 years of relevant work experience.
In-depth experience operating within and leading cross-functional teams (product management, marketing, merchandising, finance, legal, etc.).
Strong understanding of mobile gaming, business models, distribution channels, and competitive landscape.
Passion for and understanding of gaming, mobile technology and Google’s products.
Strategic thinker; able to solve complex problems and develop creative solutions.
title: Partner Development Manager Team Lead, Google Play Games

text:
Google.com Engineering makes Google's internal services fast and reliable  
for Googlers. The team combines software development, networking, and database  
administration expertise to build and run massively distributed,  fault-tolerant software systems and infrastructure. You are a technology expert who loves being in the center of the action, and you will routinely manage complex software and systems issues ranging from distributed change propagation on live serving systems, to designing and deploying cost-aware database systems.

You will assist the team to get to the end goal and manage a part of the huge issues that will arise and make sure it's fixed.Responsibilities
Engineer and run Oracle infrastructure to meet performance, security, high availability and other requirements.
Interact with business analysts and developers to support changes in the existing business processes.
Be responsible for overall architecture, design, development, and support of all Oracle Technology Stack components including, but not limited to, all Oracle e-Business Suite components, Oracle Fusion Middleware products, Oracle RAC and standalone databases.
Support operational activities in the e-Business Suite environments. These will include, but not limited to, patching, environments cloning, database and application upgrades, backups, disaster recovery and monitoring procedures maintenance and improvements as part of 24x7 support rotation.
Implement, support and troubleshoot network, hardware and other system components directly and indirectly related to the Oracle infrastructure in partnership with other teams.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant experience administering Oracle E-Business Suite R12.
Experience with relational database architecture concepts.
Scripting experience in one of the following: C/C++, Java, Unix/Linux shell scripting, Perl, or Python.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.
Experience in running both Oracle EBS 11i and R12 including activities like Patching, Cloning, Replication, System Administration, troubleshooting in HA and DR environments.
Developer Operations experience.
Proficiency working with Unix/Linux platforms with concrete knowledge of system administration/internals.
Proven mastery of troubleshooting techniques and ability to analyze and resolve difficult technical issues quickly in a high pressure environment.
Good knowledge of SQL with Performance Tuning skills.
title: Oracle Applications Database Administrator

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Proven technical ability with customer-relationship management programs (CRM).
Strong communication and persuading skills.
Ability to speak and write in English and Swedish, Danish or Dutch fluently and idiomatically.

Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.

Interface with and manage partners, vendors and manufacturers at a technical level.

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Google for Work helps companies around the world be more productive, mobile and collaborative by "going Google." In this role, you will help shape the product strategy for one or more Google products.
You will influence the product direction and strategy for current and future collaboration tools and will be an expert on a particular market or product. As the the primary interface between the Product Management teams developing products and the Google for Work Sales organization bringing them to market, you will use your insights and knowledge to help guide overall product direction and go-to-market strategy.
Google Apps customers, IT administrators and end users want to automate simple tasks and work processes with simple applications that extend the Google Apps services. The goal of the developer platform is to help these stakeholders with varied level of “coding” sophistication meet their business goals.

Connect the dots on our go-to-market strategy (jointly with other teams) to build a cohesive business strategy.

Experience in the cloud productivity market and ISV ecosystem.

Master's degree.
4 years of professional or academic engineering experience.

Experience balancing execution, agility, and culture at a fast growing business.
Experience working with application developers (IT Departments, System Integration firms).
Experience working with developer platforms and tools.

text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.

You will apply best in class demand generation and skills through outbound outreach to identify new prospects. BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

text:
The Global Support team in gTech plays a critical role in Google's success, supporting sales teams, advertisers, and products that enhance business potential by consistently providing scalable product solutions, reliable information based on efficient, consultative analysis, and timely communications. Alongside our support and troubleshooting work, we collaborate with sales and other operational stakeholders to focus on developing innovative, scalable support solutions that effectively serve our growing customer base. As a Support Specialist you will act as a critical means of support for sales teams and our customers, and have a passion for delivering excellent customer service and improving it all the time. text:
Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind those systems are Googlers who advise and partner with our users and customers. As an Advertiser Solutions Consultant you will support clients using our DoubleClick products, including mobile and rich media. Your projects will include business pitches, product implementation and upgrades, and custom solutions. Customers will look to your expertise on product configuration and business processes, combining your deep understanding of DoubleClick products with industry best practices.
You have a passion for managing relationships, specifically cross-functionally and with our clients to provide Google-caliber client service. You have a high technical aptitude and in-depth industry knowledge to persistently explore and uncover technical solutions to complex business scenarios. You'll provide the voice of the customer to the Product Management and Engineering team in order to make ongoing improvements to our tools. You'll also work on multiple projects concurrently, either independently or on small teams. We are excited to develop and grow our clients business, and ensure success through our best-in-class solutions. 

As the technical, functional and industry expert, you will meet and exceed the clients expectations by proactively providing them with solutions that will have a big impact on their business on an on-going basis. Activities would include: accelerate feature adoption, accelerating cross product usage, cross agency workflow consulting, case study development, creating training plans and cross product network audits.Responsibilities
Create a smooth and easy cross product onboarding experience for the client, ensuring excellent service and consulting to assure a future proof setup of their advertising infrastructure. (This can include workshops with multiple agencies and advertiser stakeholders to surface and match business needs with the platforms functionality, training plans, tag and reporting implementation consultancy and implementation project management.)
Support and partner with Sales, in order to provide technical and functional needs assessments for prospective clients.
Provide Product Operations with clear and concise product feedback and feature requests from the client, making sure that the client needs are heard and executed upon.
Manage reactive client issues sent to Technical Services Associate teams and act as a point of escalation when support teams need help or assistance.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BSc degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working in a client-facing technical service environment.
Ability to speak and write in English and French fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
General knowledge of web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript and HTTP
Strong Project Management skills
Programmatic, RTA or RTB Marketing and general advertising industry knowledge
Working background of a performance Agency or Marketer position
Strong data analysis, ability to deal with ambiguity, solve complex problems and scale effectively across a large organization and highly distributed team.
Proven presentation and communication skills with the ability to quickly absorb technical concepts and effectively communicate them to a non-technical audience.
title: Ads Platform Specialist, DCM

text:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. As a Manager, Content Partnerships for YouTube, you should be comfortable working cross-functionally with colleagues across multiple disciplines to ensure our partners are positioned for success and our users enjoy the best experience possible. You should also expect to initiate and manage day-to-day operations and partner relationships, fielding and prioritizing incoming requests, troubleshooting partner systems around reporting, content management and Content ID and creating periodic reports (external and internal) on partner performance. title: Manager, Content Partnerships, YouTube (Greater China)

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
In this role, you will drive Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) Application Operations Integration engagements as the Technical Program Manager for all facets of acquisitions Development and Production Infrastructure. You will provide leadership and expertise to deliver IT programs and initiatives on schedule and within budget. You will plan and administer both projects and the overall program, and ensure that deliverables are completed correctly and on-time. You will deliver the technical solution to support an organization's vision and strategic direction. You are a leader in the IT organization, and will be held accountable for the success of enterprise-impacting technology initiatives. You will be responsible for driving the workflow(s) knowledge and leveraging your engineering background to lead the program efforts of the support teams to deliver appropriate solutions.
You will be responsible for a specific domain set program (Database Engineering) that will be capable of solving client needs - including appropriate capacity growth and driving efficiency improvements through the teams.Responsibilities
Lead M&A integration deep-dives and analysis, develop proposals and coordinate large cross-functional teams.
Develop project plans and manage technical integration of acquired companies’ development and production environments.
Understand customer-facing technical systems and product implications. Make the connection between information, its impact on the project and what should be done to have the best outcome; Contribute to the technical solution.
Build strong partnerships across Google’s Technical Infrastructure organization and serve as the interface between acquired entities and Google production teams.
Use expert project management skills to build complex project plans or program-level plans to include forecasting, road maps, resource planning, identifying/mitigating risk, delegating responsibilities and coordinating the work of other Project Managers.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical discipline (CS/EE) or equivalent practical experience
8 years of experience in technology.
4 years of experience in program management.
Project management or technical management experience leading technical projects for customer facing systems/products.
Preferred qualifications
MA/MS/MBA degree in a technical discipline (CS/EE, etc.).
10 years of experience in technology. 6 years of experience in program management.
M&A IT or production systems integration experience.
Familiarity with traditional production infrastructure (data center, networking, etc.).
Familiarity with Cloud Computing platforms and concepts (GCP, AWS, etc.).
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and cross-functional leadership skills.
title: Technical Program Manager, Mergers and Acquisitions Production Infrastructure Integration

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. You are an engineer who is versatile, passionate and ready to handle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
Responsibilities
Work with cross-functional teams to develop hardware architecture for next generation systems.
Design, implement, debug and characterize embedded systems geared for mobile applications.
Lead new design concepts through exploration, prototyping, development and into mass production.
Collaborate with other team members, including software, mechanical engineering, industrial design, and outside partners.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience in embedded/mobile system design, hardware architecture, board design, board bring-up, product NPI experience.
Experience with low power and battery powered embedded mobile designs.
Consumer electronics, mobile devices or Wearable devices design experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in designing with FPGA and RTL Verilog/VHDL coding.
Experience and knowledge of broad range of PCB technologies: rigid, flex, hybrid, etc.
Experience in bringing multiple high volume products to mass production.
Design expertise in SoC, memories, power supply, camera, sensors and analog design.
Knowledge of Linux, Chrome OS or Android embedded environments.
Knowledge of embedded environments; familiar with microprocessor and micro-controller design.
title: Hardware Engineer (Glass)

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. Work with cross-functional teams – business, marketing, creative, operations, finance, device software, and device hardware to ensure a comprehensive, first-class product launch
Communicate priorities, risks, and schedules to the Glass executive management team
Track and maintain cross-functional program plans and drive core team accountability to meet committed program plans
Create and execute on life-cycle mapping for the product from development to deployment, driving consensus and accountability across all functions.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Strong in multi-tasking, cross-functional coordination, problem-solving, and management skills.
Ability to influence and lead teams

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
title: Program Manager, Glass

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
An Account Analyst requires a sharp, analytical mind and an entrepreneurial spirit. You will be both creative and quantitative in this role. Armed with deep knowledge of Google products, marketing trends and individual client needs, you will brainstorm, develop and refine compelling, customized marketing plans and then deliver them to the Sales team in advance of client-facing meetings. You identify integrated, data-driven business opportunities based on internal and external tools analysis and work with Account Management (AM) and Account Executives (AEs) to identify business opportunities.Responsibilities
Develop both industry-specific and general market analysis to deliver insights regarding market and competitive trends, auction dynamics, and other data-driven analysis. Analyze client benchmarks, industry snapshots and present client mailshots.
Develop and refine compelling, customized sales stories and then deliver them to the Sales team in advance of client-facing meetings.
Gather and use data from different internal and external sources and turn it into insights that help clients realize their opportunities.
Develop smart, integrated, research-based proposals and presentations to enhance Google's reputation with client(s) as a consultant and partner. Quantify high impact opportunities with clear traffic, performance and budget recommendations.
Together with AEs and AMs, develop scalable and leading edge solutions for client(s) in order to optimize their advertising expenditures and maximize use of Google products (Search, Video, Display, Mobile, etc.).
Minimum qualifications

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting, or media.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with highly analytical work, working with data to identify trends and make recommendations in investment banking or consulting.
Advanced level of proficiency with complex spreadsheets/analysis and putting together presentations.
Proven ability to work cooperatively and proactively with staff inside and outside the department.
Proven track record in high productivity and meeting deadlines.
Demonstrated excellence in writing and verbal communication.
title: Account Analyst, Automotive, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The mission of the Global Brand Solutions and Innovations Organization (GBSI) is to enable Google marketers to earn the love of our customers by helping them build great brands with the best media and technology solutions in the world.
Our team develops and drives commercialization of Google’s made-for-brand “Awareness” products and service solutions: Reservation Video (including Google Preferred), Sponsorship Programs and Packages, Brand-Creator Products (Partner Program and Brand Channels) and Awareness Display (Masthead and vCPM Display).
We're looking for a strategic and forward-thinking individual to help grow the highly critical Brand Reservation businesses. The Reservation Pricing and Strategy Lead serves as the liaison between our product managers and our sales organization specifically focused on Pricing our reservation products, with a focus on Google Preferred. Pricing and Strategy Leads drive deep pricing and monetization analysis of our reservation products, taking that insight and in conjunction with the Business Operations Pricing team, create a pricing strategy and framework for each market.
As Pricing and Strategy Lead you will work closely with product management, engineering, product marketing and the global and regional sales and activation teams to drive product prioritization and global expansion of our Google Preferred Product.Responsibilities
Develop deep product expertise and a strong understanding of the market landscape with specific focus on the in region TV and Video trading practices.
Lead the Google Preferred and Watchpage pricing strategy and framework for GBSI.
Consult with Global Pricing Lead and Regional Brand and Pricing Leads to understand unique market-by-market challenges/drivers in market. Work with regions to develop and deploy the Google Preferred pricing process and framework, ensuring global consistency and regional specifications as necessary.
Facilitate executive level approvals for pricing.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant experience in pricing and planning at a media company.
Ability to travel up to 20% of the time.
Preferred qualifications
Experience leading cross functional groups or projects.
Direct experience with video or TV pricing and planning.
Knowledge of traditional as well as contemporary/online marketing tactics and strategy.
Distinctive problem solving and analytical capabilities, including business opportunity analysis.
Excellent communication, organization, project management and interpersonal skills.
title: Reservation Pricing and Strategy Lead

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with Engineering, Product, Legal and Policy teams to create and improve processes to drive Google Shopping to success
Work on innovative scalable solutions that are efficient and effective. Identify opportunities to implement automation and workflow improvements to efficiently protect our users
Provide a high-quality experience to our users by ensuring the product data provided to Google is accurate, up to date, and compliant with defined quality standards
Develop and share best practices for Enforcement, Spam and Abuse across all Google products globally
Respond to PR, Legal, Product and Sales sensitive escalations from internal and external parties
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related field or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Master's or PhD degree in project, process or business management.
Experience in online abuse and enforcement.
Ability to collaborate globally and work cross-functionally with other teams.
Exceptional internet research skills and passion for web technologies.
A strong understanding of coding principles and concepts.
title: Shopping Quality Analyst, Product Quality Operations

text:
The User Experience (UX) Design Producer shepherds projects through the design process by coordinating the work of UX Designers, Researchers, and Engineers. In this role, you’ll combine expert project management skills with a passion for user experience to help your team design how billions of users interact with our products. You’ll work cross-functionally and collaborate with managers, designers and engineering teams to plan projects, define milestones, assign resources, assess risks, and help projects meet deadlines. As a Design Producer, you will also manage all project-related communications to team members, leaders and other stakeholders. This job requires you to be an expert juggler, a master planner and a flexible project manager who can balance multiple projects that often span continents.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with and support UX team leads in delivering the highest level of trust-building and strategic counsel through all project interactions.
Act as a bridge between UX, Engineering, and Product Management (PM) teams, connecting all three groups and making sure interdependencies are understood and planned for. Identify team needs with regards to process, tools, documentation, and asset management, driving required changes to make sure designers are working at optimum efficiency.
Lead or collaborate with UX team leadership in key project decision-making, including: requirements gathering, scheduling, resource allocation, and coordination of teams and approval processes.
Provide clear communication to cross-functional team leads and senior management regarding project status, resource requirements, issues, and priorities.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience managing interactive, design, or creative projects (mobile experience).
Preferred qualifications
5 years of relevant work experience working within engineering organizations, e.g. working with front-end engineers and keeping them updated on the latest designs and assets.
Strong familiarity with design tools, graphic formats and user interface technologies.
Thorough knowledge of user centered design processes and iterative development processes.
Working knowledge of project management software and proficient with spreadsheet software and Google Docs.
Proven ability to multitask, analyze opportunities, define successful approaches, and proactively solve problems.
title: UX Design Producer, Apps

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
The role enables you to shape the product development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.
Opening date for applications: 24th April 2015
Closing date for applications: 25th May 2015
Competitive salary applies.Responsibilities

Provide implementation of the One Acquisition view globally from the Marketing perspective.
Work with Finance and the Sales team to improve/define reporting.
Measure campaigns and scale them globally.
Drive creative excellence in B2B materials and campaigns.
Establish relationships with key stakeholders and ensure communications.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Marketing/sales background with analytical and communication skills.
title: Product Marketing Manager, One Acquisition Marketing
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
The gTech Ads team is a solution-generating force that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. In addition to troubleshooting on the customer side, we work with Sales, Product and Engineering teams within Google to develop better tools and services to improve our products based on the evolving needs of our users. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh.
The gTech Ads team plays a critical role in Google's success, supporting Sales teams, advertisers, and products that enhance business growth potential by consistently providing scalable product solutions, reliable information based on efficient, consultative analysis, and timely communications. Alongside our support and troubleshooting work, we collaborate with Sales and Product Management to focus on developing innovative, scalable support solutions that effectively serve our growing customer base. As a Product Technology Manager, you will partner with the Product Operations Managers, Global Sales Leads and Product Management/Engineering to oversee the technical execution of Google's online advertising and platform products from design and conceptualization to testing and deployment, to drive customer adoption and satisfaction.Responsibilities
Be responsible for end-to-end incubation and implementation of alpha and beta products.
Consult with clients on technical issues based on in-depth product and technical knowledge. Provide highly technical implementation support in client environment, including guidance on implementation feasibility of cross-product integrations.
Develop technical tools and documentation to expedite client implementation, and improve product serviceability. Collaborate with Engineering to thoroughly test all use-cases and commercialize solutions.
Provide product solution improvement and scaling opportunities to Product Management and Engineering based on early customer feedback and develop fast prototyping solutions.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant programming experience in Java, Python, C++, or JavaScript.
Technical experience in Web technologies such as HTTP, HTML, XML, DNS, and TCP/IP.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in Computer Science or related major.
4 years of relevant programming experience in Java, Python, C++, or JavaScript. Applications development experience, working in Unix or related environments.
Technical sales or field sales experience with strong business knowledge; sales engineering or professional consulting experience.
Knowledge and expertise in Google Analytics, or similar enterprise or web site analytics platforms.
Working knowledge of relational database administration in MySQL or equivalent.
Proven ability to adapt your message to the technical level of the audience, and comfort presenting technical materials to large groups. Excellent communication skills.
title: Product Technology Manager

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
The Network Interface Unit (NIU) Vendor Program Management team is all about focusing on the user. You will be a professional, experienced, and driven vendor manager in the Google Fiber Deployment team. This role will require you to have strong relationships with internal stakeholders across multiple functions. You will drive operational performance by managing a high performing vendor operations team, so that Google can get the best speed and efficiency in our last mile deployment of Google Fiber.
You will have experience in analytics, partner management, program management, operations, and/or other related areas. You will be a top performer and thought leader who will quickly adapt and respond to changes as well as internal initiatives, and you are someone who thrives in an ever-changing, fast-growing operational environment. You will have an operational savvy, a ‘get it done’ personality, the ability to make smart, independent decisions, the ability to explore and execute innovative alternatives to the status quo, an openness to taking direction from internal partners, and the willingness to manage deliverables across teams and priorities. Effective relationship management with external partners is integral in ensuring continued service delivery and customer satisfaction.Responsibilities
Manage the overall performance of operations vendor workforce in terms of quality, cost and delivery of service. Ensure all aspects of vendor Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are consistently met (backlog cost, utilization, etc.) and lead regular business reviews and any vendor relationship management activities.
Determine, communicate, and monitor NIU budgetary needs to the Google Fiber finance team. Provide one-off analyses and input in support of internal teams across all functions within Google Fiber.
Participate in workforce planning activities in coordination with internal teams. Work closely with various internal groups to understand business requirements, implement new processes, and contribute to ongoing process improvements.
Support vendor selection, negotiations, and overall vendor operations strategy (e.g. creating request for proposals and evaluating vendor submissions and bids). Ensure problem resolutions are achieved without compromising the relationship with vendors and company customers.
Evaluate and monitor contracts to ensure vendors comply with contractual terms and conditions. Maintain and review internal/external documentation. Create programs to evaluate vendor performance; organize and run review sessions with senior management and service providers. Communicate vendor performance through insightful metrics to internal teams and senior management.

Minimum qualifications
4 years of program management or vendor management experience.
Preferred qualifications
BA/BS degree. PMP or PgMP certification.
2 years of relevant work experience managing large-scale and dynamic operational projects, with competing resources, priorities and changing workflows. Business process expertise.
Understanding of national NIU vendor landscape and relationships or experience with existing vendors. Excellent analytical qualities to monitor/review vendors’ financial and operational performances.
Basic technical understanding of fiber-to-the-home construction or willingness to learn.
Strong analytical and solution oriented background skills with great people skills. Strong analytical and structured problem solving capabilities.
Exceptional leadership, management, communication and collaboration skills.
Excellent presentation/communication skills to ensure vendors thoroughly understand their contractual requirements.
title: NIU Program Manager, Google Fiber

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.
Google’s Cloud Security team is responsible for ensuring the security of Google’s Cloud Platform, which includes Compute Engine, App Engine, Cloud Storage, Cloud SQL, and many other Cloud computing, storage, and analytics services. Our goal is to ensure customer data is secure, while also ensuring Google’s underlying infrastructure is protected from attack. Increasingly, we are focusing on bringing new security features to the Cloud Platform to give customers more control and insight into the security of their hosted applications and data. We have an opportunity to leverage Google’s unique tools and infrastructure to benefit users and make it easier to secure themselves on our Cloud Platform than on their own infrastructure. This role will be about managing our protection efforts while helping ramp up our feature development.Responsibilities
Manage the development of new security features for the Cloud.
Manage projects, drive consensus, coordinate efforts between teams, and resolve conflicting priorities.
Help prioritize, persuade and negotiate different efforts. Work with the team to collect, analyze data and quantify risk on Google product security problems.
Manage the work on all security response prevention and remediation related to the Cloud Platform. Oversee the timely resolution of all security bugs within the appropriate Service Level Agreements.
Promote externally the security features, hardening, and remediation work within Cloud.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in science or engineering or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in computer security.
Preferred qualifications
MA/MS degree in science or engineering.
Cloud, virtualization, or encryption experience. Experience interfacing directly with external users.
Knowledge of security technologies (authentication, encryption, key management, sandboxing, VPNs, firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention).
Ability to evaluate technical risk and business impact and explain the impact of security issues to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Comfortable speaking in front of large audiences (conferences, etc.).
Excellent written communication skills, with a focus on translating technically complex issues into simple, easy to understand language. Strong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization abilities with excellent attention to detail.
title: Technical Program Manager, Cloud Security

text:
As Product Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.Responsibilities
Ensure compliance with U.S. and international laws and regulations dealing with intellectual property, privacy, content regulation, consumer protection and advertising.
Provide legal advice to teams from Engineering, Product Management, Advertising Sales, Marketing and Communications from the initial stages of product development to launch, complying with company policies and risk tolerance.
Develop and maintain a repository of legal resources that are required for products, such as terms of service, privacy notices and other disclosures.
Respond promptly to a wide range of legal requests from Engineering, Product Management, Advertising Sales, Marketing, Communications and other clients, summarizing and communicating legal concepts that business people can use.
Review, draft and negotiate licenses and intellectual property agreements, services agreements and sales contracts.
Minimum qualifications
JD degree, or equivalent education.
3 years of relevant industry experience
Admission in and good standing with one or more State's Bar.
Preferred qualifications
5 years of relevant work experience in a law firm or in-house legal department.
Background in media, communications, intellectual property and contract law.
title: Product Counsel

text:
Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Mechanical Engineer you design and evaluate our data center systems, identifying product requirements and contributing to research and project planning. From the chip to chiller, you are responsible for designing and optimizing an architecture that will scale with Google's continued growth.With your technical expertise, you lead and manage projects, develop product and process improvements, provide consultation to others and help facilitate training and development.Responsibilities
Architect and influence the shaping of future products by providing mechanical engineering insight into the technology roadmap.
Identify and scope projects around innovation opportunities as well as technology risks.
Develop and execute designs for complex systems backed by thorough engineering analysis.
Deliver robust solutions for tasks such as blind mating of high density interconnects, inject/eject mechanisms and large server racks.
Take responsibility for product design, including requirements gathering, concepts generation and detailed design, analysis and verification testing, cross functional reviews and manufacturing release.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in design and analysis of electronics packaging.
Preferred qualifications
MS in Mechanical Engineering.
6 years of relevant work experience.
Extensive experience in designing complex electro-mechanical assemblies with an expert understanding of mechanical tolerances and ability to perform detailed tolerance loop analysis.
Excellent facility with 3D CAD systems (Pro/Engineer experience) and structural and thermal analysis techniques for small to large electronics packaging systems (FloTHERM and Ansys experience).
Ability to architect solutions backed by business case analysis.
Excellent working knowledge of mechanical engineering and design principles with specific expertise in the areas of design for medium-scale production, sheet metal and injection molding, electrical interconnect systems, heat extraction and vibration control.
title: Mechanical Engineer, System Architect

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
You will work within the cross-product anti-abuse team to prevent abuse on multiple Google products simultaneously. You bring your passion and experience in data analysis to enable the team to solve complex challenges in the world of scaled, multi-product abuse. Using your project management acumen, you lead cross-functionally to achieve ambitious abuse prevention goals, ensuring clear communications and timely delivery while keeping the larger strategic picture at the core of what you do.Responsibilities
Identify market and product-specific trends related to abuse of Google accounts.
Develop anti-abuse programs to solve for cross-product vulnerabilities, and ensure their successful roll-out on a global scale by leading cross-functional teams toward a common, measurable goal.
Conduct data analyses to highlight hidden patterns and trends in account abuse, and recommend system and process solutions to address these abuse trends.
Collaborate with operations, engineering, product management, legal, and other teams to ensure successful deployment of new anti-abuse efforts.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Experience managing multiple projects, working globally and cross-functionally.

Preferred qualifications
Relevant experience in one of the following areas: internet technology, online search, eCommerce, online payments, online advertising/publishing, policy enforcement or fraud investigation.
Experience with statistical and quantitative modeling (e.g., regression, classification, clustering).

title: Program Manager, Product Quality Operations

text:
Help the globe "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. On the Sales Operations team, you help fellow Sales Googlers by performing budgeting, planning, and analysis activities--and your passion for the magic of Google products like Apps and Chrome. Not only do you provide invaluable financial and budgeting input, but you also devise new ways for us to communicate with potential leads and bring them into the Google fold. Your razor-sharp insight means you excel at customer segmentation, acquisition and retention. You marry clean communication with strong analytical skills and a solid commitment to providing customers with a Googley customer experience. You also peer into the future for us; you examine and analyze statistical data to forecast marketing trends and to identify potential new markets for Google for Work. Help Google for Work grow and continue improving businesses the world over.
As an Operational Business Program Manager, you will play an integral part in building the next-generation customer support experience and drive customer lifetime value. Our team mission is to evaluate, develop and incubate proof-of-concepts for big business opportunities and problems. You will be part of a team that leads aspects from concept design, pilot execution, validation through data analysis and A/B testing, documentation and eventual incubation in the global Google Apps for Work support organization. In conjunction you will be responsible for investigating operational business challenges, quantifying them by gathering data and translating it into meaningful interpretations to find solutions and help drive business decisions. 

In this role, you'll develop strong working relationships with a wide variety of cross-functional teams in the Google for Work organization and deep knowledge on every element of the Google Apps for Work operations. You are a leader with strong operational experience and skills, a confident communicator with the interpersonal skills to work across multiple teams, and you feel comfortable operating in a complex and ambiguous environment. You have a strong analytical background and a passion for business models, infrastructure and processes.Responsibilities
Manage multiple pilots and experiments, synthesize learnings, craft data into compelling presentations, and help with the graduation of the experiments and pilots into the wider operation
Work closely with team members to define Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and metrics, analyze and report across multiple experiments and programs, and expand the BI platform
Pull and model data from Google internal systems and data warehouses in order to identify and scope operational challenges and trends and, where relevant, implement process improvements
Build, maintain and evolve strong relationships across the Google for Work business, galvanizing cross-functional teams to achieve customer delight
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent in a quantitative field e.g., engineering, computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics, econometrics, or economics or in business science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as an analyst or in an analytical role in consulting, sales support, financial analysis, or quantitative marketing.
Experience with SQL, R, or Python; Coding experience.
Experience managing cross-functional projects.
Preferred qualifications
Graduate degree in a quantitative field like engineering, computer science, mathematics, statistics or economics or in business science
