Strong hands-on experience with SQL, data warehousing, data modeling, dashboarding and reporting, involving very large datasets and multiple data sources, with ability to interpret data and produce meaningful insights; experience with A/B testing and data visualization
Strong experience with understanding, designing and implementing process improvements; ability to see the big picture and to focus on details when necessary
Experience in identifying business opportunities and defining and measuring success of proposed initiatives
Strong communication and leadership skills, and ability to manage and influence multiple senior stakeholders across the businesses, including the skill of expressing the tracking needs to be implemented/developed in detail
title: Google for Work, Operational Business Program Manager

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.You encourage safe and efficient network operations by leading project teams that maintain and improve network operations. You propose projects that increase network reliability and analyze network technologies that assess implications for Google.
Google's corporate network team is responsible for the design, rollout, 24x7 operations, performance, and security of the enterprise network that provides services to Google's tens of thousands of employees, contractors, and vendors throughout the world. We design and operate the wireless and wired access networks for hundreds of Google facilities around the world, ranging from large enterprise campuses interconnected via dark fibers, to remote sales offices connected via satellite, and everything in-between; we design and operate enterprise data center networks on multiple continents; we design and operate business-class backbone networks to deliver Google cloud services to enterprise users.

As the enterprise cloud network architect, you lead the design of the next generation corporate network that supports seamless integration of on-premise IT services and Google public cloud services. The continual growth of Google corporate network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network secure, scalable and reliable ensures that our business users stay connected with Google applications, tools, products and services.Responsibilities
Work with other team members and groups to develop scalable network designs, solutions and policy recommendations to support the continued growth of Google enterprise IP networks.
Lead the requirement analysis, architecture design, and solution development of the enterprise cloud networking project to ensure seamlessly integration with Google public cloud services.
Analyze and drive key platform decisions and selections, providing guidance to other network engineering and partner teams.
Lead development of Google's growing enterprise network infrastructure through published architecture and engineering design docs.
Work with Google cloud network groups and collectively influence enterprise networking industry to create compatible architecture models and standards to Google public cloud services.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
8 years of IP networking experience in a production environment, and 4 years of enterprise network design and architecture experience.
Experience assessing company campus, branch office, WAN, and data center business needs and pain points, designing and documenting solutions to meet these needs, and driving external vendors to deliver against desired product and software roadmaps.
Preferred qualifications
Master's in a technology domain.
10 years of production IP networking experience, 6 years of large enterprise network design and architecture experience.
Expert-level competence in IP routing/switching and security technologies and protocols including TCP/IP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, AAA/Radius, IPsec, GRE, OpenFlow, and their best-practices, fault-tolerant use at global scale.
In-depth understanding of network segmentation and virtualization technologies such as VLAN, VPN, VRF, NVO (NVGRE, VxLAN) and OTV. Substantial experience with routing platforms from Cisco and/or Juniper.
Excellent written and verbal English-language communication skills, with the ability to influence others with network engineering solutions.
title: Enterprise Cloud Network Architect

text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
You are a software engineer with experience writing server-side code for enterprise web-based applications. You are comfortable with and enjoy working on the full development stack - both backend and frontend. You are also a developer who knows how to create robust, high-volume production applications, and can develop prototypes quickly.Responsibilities

Design, implement, and launch products that enable business success.
Design and develop large scale web applications.
Develop big data analysis tools that detect potential partner issues before they happen.
Write and review technical documents, including design, development, and collaborative code reviews.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in Unix or GNU/Linux systems administration.
Programming experience in Python.
Experience with data mining and analytical tools.
Preferred qualifications
MS degree in computer science or related technical field.
3 years of multi-threaded server-side web application programming experience.
Experience designing and deploying large scale distributed data processing systems; experience with MapReduce or Hadoop. Experience in big data, information retrieval, data mining or machine learning.
Excellent Python skills and object oriented design experience, including working knowledge of core libraries, design patterns, and servlets.
Highly proficient in one or more programming languages, including Python, Java, and/or C++.
Internet and network skills, including HTML, XML/XSLT, JavaScript, JSON, HTTP, SSL, TCP/IP.
title: Software Engineer, Partner Product Solutions Engineering, YouTube

text:
Analytical Linguists work across Google to drive improvements in quality, classification, information structure, and natural language understanding and generation. As an Analytical Linguist you will work both on complex projects spanning multiple products, groups, and disciplines, and on tightly focused efforts to produce specific product components or answer specific research questions. Analytical Linguists work in many different areas and arrive with a wide variety of skills—your specialization might involve natural language processing and understanding, phonology, phonetics, syntax, semantics, ontology, program management, human subject research, experimental design, statistics, corpus linguistics, large scale data acquisition, or any combination. This team is part of some of the most groundbreaking and exciting work at Google. It's our goal to use insights from linguistics and related fields to constantly improve our products.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Linguist at Google, you will collaborate on complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders.
In this role, you will work in a fast-paced environment, partner closely with our Operations and Engineering teams, and use your entrepreneurial drive to contribute to the long-term growth of Google Shopping. As a Linguist for the product ontology for Google Shopping, you will continually enhance the online shopping experience on Google Shopping contributing to a robust product ontology. You will drive efficiency and quality improvements and collaborate across groups to drive the continual evolution of world-class classification technology.
Responsibilities
Learn and build expertise in new processes and technical applications using data and understand processes to manage and drive tool and workflow efficiency improvements and changes of varying complexity through collaboration with Engineering.
Maintain diverse product knowledge on thousands of products through research and analysis of data from multiple channels, and use this knowledge to establish product-specific definitions and grow Google’s product taxonomy; with emphasis on understanding and determining product boundaries and the boundaries between products and features.
Prioritize and manage projects and deliverables effectively, quickly adapting projects tochanging processes and requirements.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of related industry experience in project management coupled with experience in information management, online shopping, or linguistics.
Preferred qualifications
Master's of Library Science or Information Management or a background in Linguistics, Library and Information Science, or other field involving textual analysis and information organization or semantic networks.
E-Commerce or online retail experience; knowledge of Electronics.
Experience developing or using taxonomies, thesauri, or controlled vocabularies.
Familiarity with metadata, digital content management, Google Docs and Sheets
Action-oriented with excellent organizational and project management skills, and a proven ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously, work independently and drive projects to completion with minimum guidance and high attention to detail.
Independent problem solver with natural intellectual curiosity, research, fact-finding, and analytical skills. Adaptable, flexible, and capable of working independently with both local and distributed teams.
title: Product Ontology Linguist

text:
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is what you get when you treat operations as if it’s a software problem. Our mission is to progress, protect, and provide for the software and systems behind all of Google’s public services - Search, Ads, Gmail, Android, YouTube, and AppEngine, to name just a few - with an ever-watchful eye on their availability, latency, performance, and capacity. This is an unusual job, unlike others in the industry. Like traditional operations groups, we keep important, revenue-critical systems up and running despite hurricanes, bandwidth outages, and configuration problems. Unlike traditional operations groups, we also have full access to and authority to fix, extend, and scale the code to keep it working and harden it against all the vagaries of the Internet. We hire people from both systems and software backgrounds. Strong candidates will have experience with both. Just as what we do is unique, where we do it is unique too. At Google, we have the good fortune to have developed many interesting systems ranging from planet-spanning databases to near real-time scalable data warehousing to fault-tolerant datastream joining. In SRE, we flip between the fine-grained detail of disk driver I/O scheduling to the big picture of continental-level service capacity, across a range of systems and a user population measured in billions. We own those products in production. We drive reliability and performance across massive scale by mastering the full depth of the stack. We literally do learn something new every day - usually surprising things - that have the potential to transform the lives of billions of our users around the world.
As a Systems Engineer on the SRE team, you will work on large-scale system design and troubleshooting, and be fluent in systems programming and/or automation. You will have a desire to tackle the complex problems of scale which are unique to Google. Familiarity with running production environments at scale is crucial in this job along with an in-depth understanding of Unix systems internals, and networking.
Opening date: April 2nd 2015
Closing date: May 4th 2015
Competitive Salary Applies.Responsibilities
Design, write and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Google's services.
Solve problems relating to mission critical services and build automation to prevent problem recurrence; with the goal of automating response to all non-exceptional service conditions.
Influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale distributed systems.
Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning.
Conduct periodic on call duties using a follow-the-sun model.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more of: C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Go, or scripting experience in Shell and Perl.
Experience working with Unix/Linux systems from kernel to shell and beyond, with experience working with system libraries, file systems, and client-server protocols.
Networking experience with network theory e.g. TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, etc., MAC addresses, IP packets, DNS, OSI layers, and load balancing.
Preferred qualifications
Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
In-depth knowledge of operating systems (processes, threads, concurrency issues, locks, mutexes, semaphores, monitors and how they work).
Familiarity with algorithms, data structures and complexity analysis.
Systematic problem solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.
title: Systems Engineer, Site Reliability Engineering
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.
Google's Talent and Outreach teams design and deliver programs to anticipate the demands of the company's growth. Our mission is to spread the word about Google's innovation, impact and culture, and to encourage talented people to explore career opportunities with us. We help Google's recruiting and HR processes work effectively by branding Google as a great place to work, engaging potential Googlers at various events and conferences, building long-lasting relationships with universities and communities, and developing programs to promote and celebrate Google's culture of diversity.Responsibilities

Schedule on-campus interview sessions and prepare candidate packets.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in program/event management, recruiting, HR, university relations, or related area.
Preferred qualifications
Proven ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities, take initiative, work with a high sense of urgency, pay close attention to detail and build strong, productive relationships with colleagues and clients at all organizational levels.
Ability to consistently and positively contribute in a high-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks and manage time efficiently.
Affinity to technology, including familiarity with office productivity tools, web based recruiting technologies and Google Apps.
Highly motivated professional with demonstrated program/project management and problem solving with a strong mindset for continuous improvement and using data to influence decision-making.
Exceptional customer service and verbal/written communication skills with an emphasis on tact, diplomacy and producing quality results.
title: Coordinator, University Programs

text:
Help businesses around the world "go Google." Google for Work teams work with schools, companies and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative by using Google cloud computing to get their work done. As a Google for Work Program Manager, you oversee all aspects of the Google for Work sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google for Work program overall is kept on the cutting edge.
Google for Work Technology and Solutions [GTS] mission is deliver simple, innovative business systems that enable our business and partners to thrive. GTS works with our business, partner and project teams to build systems for all aspects of the business: business intelligence, CRM, order management, billing, sales and support systems and marketing.
In this role, you will create and lead the GTS strategic planning process for the systems portfolio of projects. You will drive the creation, management and execution of the GTS portfolio roadmap. You will manage and lead either directly or indirectly a team of systems project managers to deliver systems to our business and partner teams. You will lead efforts to provide transparency to the stakeholder teams for the GTS strategic plan. You will have a passion for collaboration and a drive to deliver systems that exceed your stakeholder’s expectations.
You combine clear communication with strong program leadership skills and a solid commitment to providing stakeholders with an excellent customer experience. Help Google for Work grow and continue improving businesses the world over.Responsibilities
Implement clear and transparent systems strategic planning process for Google for Work systems for a cross functional team including systems Engineering, Product, Partner, Marketing, Sales Operations, Order Management, Sales and Support Operations.
Engage and drive stakeholder management and transparent communications across Google for Work and its partners.
Lead, grow and inspire a team of highly motivated Program Managers.
Foster collaboration across Google for Work business, partners, product development and systems teams.
Drive operational execution of GfW Systems portfolio objectives across the GfW systems organization.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of program management experience in systems or product development environment.

15 years of program management experience in systems or product development environment.
5 years of leadership experience, with the demonstrated ability to motivate and cultivate a results-oriented development team.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment across all levels of an organization.
Ability to lead cross-functional, international projects using a structured approach.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
title: Head of Systems Portfolio Management, Google for Work

text:
With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Field Operations Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You have strong interpersonal, analytical and communication skills. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.Responsibilities

Manage program goals, scope, schedules, budget, contracts and vendor resources to ensure timelines and production costs are aligned across multiple markets. text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
You will join the quality assurance program which ensures that our support operations help real people in the moments that matter. In the dynamic role of a Quality Analyst in our growing Consumer Operations organization, you’ll help set the standards for support operations, ensure all vendor sites meet and exceed those goals, and, most importantly, empower call center agents to amaze and delight every customer who seeks support.
Shoulder-to-shoulder with operations experts, you’ll continuously fine tune the quality framework to yield a positive impact on the customer experience and satisfaction. You’ll get your hands dirty in our ongoing operations by reviewing quality audits as well as guiding our vendor partners to ensure they are upholding the highest standards for customer support. Your enthusiasm will pave your way as you educate our vendor partners and advocate for their needs with internal process owners. You’ll boost our global push for consistently superior customer support experiences that resolve issues not just quickly and accurately, but Googley! Your deep understanding of our quality assurance procedures and scaling approach, and your healthy obsession with metrics will fuel your priorities. This pivotal role pioneers our vision for achieving world-class customer support.
Responsibilities
Build a global customer support quality assurance program, driving consistency and continuous improvement across phone, email and chat contact channels.
Improve key performance indicators for our customer service centers by working with our vendor partners to understand and utilize the quality control program effectively, and teach them how to identify and address areas for improvement.
Build relationships with senior members of the Consumer Care team to represent agent skills, abilities, and motivations.
Perform deep dives on agent quality errors and customer dissatisfaction topics to identify root causes then project manage the execution of the corrective actions.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of relevant work experience.
1 year of experience in quality control or in a vendor management role.
1 year of experience in customer service or call center.

Preferred qualifications
Experience working on process improvement initiatives (e.g., Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing).
Strong project management skills (e.g. ability to plan, coordinate and execute assigned task).
Forensic skills and attention to detail when crafting operations and processes. Ability to foresee and fix process gaps.
Skilled in creating quality assurance processes that accurately audit performance and inform future trainings.
Proven ability to work with our partners (Vendor Operations and service center agents) in a positive, productive way that encourages collaboration.
title: Quality Analyst, Consumer Operations

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media, combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities, shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing, problem solving and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
As an Ads/Platforms Specialist, you will lead in-market product commercialization, market analysis, customers' product needs assessment and day-to-day technical escalations to help maintain the success of our largest Google customers. You have the ability to absorb complex technical concepts and communicate them to both technical and non-technical audience alike, and the ability to interact with product management teams. You are also someone who can identify opportunities for increased efficiencies, and work with a cross-functional team to continuously improve our products and operations. You're familiar with online advertising and have experience working within the industry.
You will work on one of Google’s Platform Products (DoubleClick for Advertisers, DoubleClick Search, DoubleClick Rich Media, DoubleClick Bid Manager, DoubleClick Ad Exchange) or Google’s Media products (YouTube, Google Display, Engagement Ads) or Google Analytics Premium.Responsibilities

Lead product launches (post-beta) in region including training for cross-functional teams. Partner with Sales and client facing teams to scope and collect client requirements, provide guidance on best practices, and apply technology and product knowledge to address customer's business and technology needs.
Collaborate with internal and external technical and developer teams to drive communication, prioritization, analysis, and resolution of customer challenges and issues. Participate in the analysis and research for complex technical issues and work with senior product escalation teams.
Maintain industry, Google product, and customer knowledge to provide successful ad management operational and technical consultation. Lead or contribute to projects that increase operational efficiency by developing internal and external tools.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with client side web technologies, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Experience with SQL, XML, HTTP protocols and one object-oriented language.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
3 years of customer facing experience, supporting product implementations or support engineering experience.
Ability to absorb complex technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience effectively.
Strong analytical and project management skills.

text:
The Inside Sales Organization looks for those next big opportunities that drive growth for Google. You're the human face of how we do business, often working independently, beyond our offices, traveling to trade shows and meeting with prospective customers. You’re a master of Google services, working closely with clients to pinpoint the right mix of products and advertising strategies that suit their needs. Availability for regular travel to local market.

text:
This position will be based in Seattle, WA.
Design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. The job of an Interaction Designer is to envision how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In an Interaction Designer role, you’ll tackle complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of people around the world—from the first-time user to the sophisticated expert. Achieving this goal requires collaboration with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.
Please include URLs for an online portfolio in addition to resume. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered.
Responsibilities
Push creativity, challenge established thinking, and discover new ways of approaching (and solving) a problem.
Polish and continually refine our existing products.
Collaborate with and develop mutual respect and trust with product managers, engineers, researchers and designers.
Develop design rationale and explain visual choices to cross-functional teams; express concepts verbally and visually.
Participate in regular design reviews and other team-wide design efforts as well as participate in user experience research and usability studies.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS, or a related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with visual and interaction design tools.
Preferred qualifications
Experience designing across multiple device types and contexts (desktop, mobile, accessories).
Experience in building relationships at senior levels, along with outstanding written and verbal communications skills.
Proven track record of designing and shipping successful software design experiences.
Strong typographic skills and a clean visual design sense
Knowledge of mapping fundamentals: cartographic representation, projected coordinate systems, data models
The ability to work within a highly technical environment;good understanding of technical requirements and limitations.
title: Interaction Designer

text:
As a member of gTech partner operations, your primary role will be to support Google’s partners, both directly and indirectly, as part of the Google My Business team. text:

text:
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, Street View to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge the technical and business worlds as you design services that our customers love. You'll work with Googlers from Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Finance, to name just a few. You have a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you will be part of shaping Google's next moonshot.Responsibilities
Launch products.
Identify market opportunities and define product vision and strategy.
Understand customer needs and gather product requirements.
Develop new products and enhance existing products.
Engage closely with the engineering team to help determine the best technical implementation methods as well as a reasonable execution schedule.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications
MS, MBA degree or PhD.
5 years of relevant work experience.
Product management or design experience with a focus on software products and technologies.
Entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
Knowledgeable across multiple functional areas such as product management, engineering, UI, sales, customer support, finance or marketing.
Excellent problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills, with the ability to evolve product strategy based on research, data and industry trends.
title: Product Manager

text:
Thank you for your interest in our Summer Trainee Engineering Program, STEP  2015 - Haifa positions. Our applications for the Summer Trainee Engineering  Program, STEP 2015 - Haifa openings have closed. We plan to post our Summer  2016 internship positions in early fall.Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our search engine and tools serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.

Google is invested in increasing the number of future computer scientists and software developers, particularly those who are historically underrepresented in the field. Many aspiring computer scientists could benefit from a program that bridges the gap between academic study and a professional internship. Google wants to inspire these students to continue in the field with such a program.

With this in mind, Google announces that the 2015 STEP internships in EMEA are now open to students who have completed the second year of their university studies by summer of 2015 and are studying computer science or related subjects. This program includes three main components: a software project, skills-based training, and professional development. We will have STEP cohorts in multiple offices this year: Dublin, London, Munich, Paris, Stockholm, Haifa, Warsaw and Zurich.

This program is open to all qualified University students and is committed to addressing diversity in our company and in the technology industry. Students who are a member of a group that is historically underrepresented in the technology industry are encouraged to apply, including women, ethnic minorities and students with disabilities.
This summer trainee program includes:

Software Project: A 12-week development project that you will work on with a team of Googlers and other STEP Interns.

Skills-Based Training: Enhance your coding skills; get exposed to new tools and programming languages.

Professional Development: Attend ongoing technical talks by senior Googlers,
additionally, learn how to enhance your resume, tackle technical interviews, and improve your presentation skills.

Mentorship: Be matched with a Google engineer, other than your manager, to guide you through your summer experience.

Fun: Social activities, community building and networking. Build a relationship with your peers.

Exposure: A unique glimpse into applying your computer science studies in a professional environment.
Responsibilities
Research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offering.
Contribute to a wide variety of projects utilizing natural language processing, artificial intelligence, data compression, machine learning and search technologies.
Collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information.
Solve all problems that come your way.
Minimum qualifications
Have completed your second year of undergraduate studies by Summer 2015 and are currently enrolled in a BA/BS program.
International students who are currently enrolled at a university within Europe, Israel or Africa are eligible to apply. If hired, students will need to provide Google with proof of authorization to work in the relevant country.
You must be available full-time between August 3rd and October 16th 2015, and for 2 days a week the following month until November 13 2015.

Preferred qualifications
Students should have programming experience in either Java, Python or C++.
title: Summer Trainee Engineering Program, STEP 2015

text:

text:

Strong communication skills and collaborative working approach

text:
Security is at the core of Google's design and development process: it is built into the DNA of our products. The same is true of our offices. You're an expert who shares our seriousness about security and our commitment to confidentiality. You'll manage the security staff who keep our Googlers safe and our world-class technologies and facilities secure. You'll collaborate with our Facilities Management team to create innovative security strategies, investigate breaches and create risk assessment plans for the future. You believe that providing effective security doesn't come at the expense of customer service - you will be our bodyguard (and our long lost pal).
An Investigator on the Global Investigations team partners with People Operations (Human Resources), Employee Relations, Internal Audit, Information Security, Legal, Ethics and Compliance, and others to keep Google safe everyday. You have strong interviewing techniques, believe nothing is too small or too big to take on and are comfortable presenting to any level of the organization in a true partnership with our stakeholders. Customer service and flexibility are keys to success in this fast-paced organization.Responsibilities

Conduct audits and other research to identify process deficiencies which could allow inappropriate business conduct, and recommend protocols and policies to address those weaknesses.
Develop strong relationships with domestic and international law enforcement and government counterparts, as well as private sector peers worldwide.
Participate in the planning of company events to ensure a safe and secure venue for participants.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience conducting sensitive investigations in a private sector/public sector environment.
Preferred qualifications
Investigative/Interview Certification through a national or internationally recognized organization.
1 year of experience conducting diverse investigations ranging from work place violence, threat mitigation, financial crimes, corrupt practices, thefts and insider threat.
1 year of experience in supply chain investigations.
Bilingual.

Manage and strengthen primary agency relationships from executive C/B-level down to specific account teams including Media Planners and Buyers.
Analyze data trends and client performance, develop solid strategic plans and prepare and conduct strategic pitches and presentations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant experience in sales or marketing at an agency, technology or media company.
Ability to travel up to 20% of the time.
Preferred qualifications
Local marketing expertise in the broadcasting industry.
Proven success in business development, client relationship and servicing skills, and solution-based selling.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about complex issues and develop recommendations and action plans.
Demonstrated ability to lead and manage multiple projects with a broad range of internal and external constituents simultaneously.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Advanced sales skills.
title: SMB Sales Business Development Manager

text:
Google's legal department is at the center of an information law revolution, and you're at its core. As a Legal Assistant, you are a driving force behind the success of your Legal team, ready to roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, conduct legal research and coordinate communications across the team. As you closely support your team, you may find yourself working with multiple groups within the Legal Department, internal clients across Google, and external parties. You're an independent thinker who isn't afraid to ask questions, and you're organized in a way that never overlooks the details.
As a Legal Assistant on the Trademark team, you will review AdWords trademark complaints from brand owners, and you will address general inquiries related to AdWords trademark policies. This role is high volume and requires close attention to detail.Responsibilities
Process a high volume of trademark matters efficiently and accurately.
Respond to internal and external customer inquiries in person, by email and by phone.
Facilitate communication of process and policy to internal and external customers.
Create documentation for existing and new policies and procedures.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Japanese fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
Excellent analytical skills, with a strong ability to review and organize numerous documents in complex legal matters.
Able to manage numerous projects simultaneously under deadline pressure.
Ability and willingness to take initiative to address problems and make continuous process improvements.
Hard working, well-organized and detail-oriented.
title: Legal Assistant (Japanese), Trademarks

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
gTech for Global Clients and Agencies is a team of technical thought leaders, addressing complex business challenges with cutting-edge technology. We understand our customers’ business goals and are committed to helping them achieve those goals through technical innovation. Ultimately, we deliver simple and elegant solutions to complex, global advertising challenges.
Responsibilities
Lead multi-country and region advertiser campaigns and large-scale programs across many Google products for our Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS) clients.
Create and roll out the process for gTech Ads regional teams collaboration for global programs and campaign executions.
Oversee global implementation of complex and customized solutions developed for our brand clients.
Collect requirements, provide guidance and offer best practices for applying ad products and technologies to achieve advertisers' and agencies’ business goals.
Responsible for implementations and escalations handled by other Google teams for specified accounts and brands.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience working on customer engagements (e.g. project management, technical sales, ad operations, etc.).
5 years of project management experience in online sales, digital marketing or consulting.

Preferred qualifications
MS or MBA Degree, or 2 years of people management experience.
Ability to establish priorities, work independently, successfully execute multiple projects and proceed with objectives with minimal supervision.
Ability to deal with ambiguity, solve complex problems and scale effectively across a large organization and highly distributed team.
Ability to translate complex product and technical concepts to non-technical and executive audiences.
Excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills across several diverse technical and non-technical groups.
title: Program Manager, gTech for Global Clients and Agencies

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
The role of Marketing at Google is to tell the story of the company's products to the world. It will be your job to help explain how we do this, what we do and, most importantly, why we do it. Your role will span both internal and external communications on behalf of Google's leadership, Global Marketing, and will also include responsibility for leading a number of special projects focused on culture, innovation and learning.
Responsibilities
Develop a strategy to communicate Marketing leadership's philosophy, principles and plans to the team, the company and the rest of the world.
Execute strategy via an ongoing series of speeches, events, articles, emails, and social media posts.
Paint a vision of what our strategy means for the Marketing team, helping them to achieve and maintain creative excellence while also stimulating innovation.
Help the rest of Google to understand, support and champion the work of Marketing and ultimately put the user first in their work.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications
Demonstrated ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high-stress environments.
Ability to interact with executives with confidence, and to provide advice on their communications that reflect an understanding of their business and leadership style.
Ability to influence a high-performing team of Googlers.
Interest in and understanding of the digital advertising industry.
Excellent written and oral communication and visual presentation skills.
title: Head of Executive Communications, Global Marketing

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The New Business Sales Team is responsible for driving incremental business growth and acquiring new medium to large size advertisers for Google. As a New Business Sales Manager, you provide the highest level of client service to our advertisers within a specific industry such as Retail, Technology, Finance, Travel, FMCG, Entertainment and Media. You will execute Google's advertising program to prospects of medium to large size customers and then work with account management team to execute a well thought-out initial campaign that provides them with measurable return on investment. You bring a proven background in acquiring new clients and you have particularly adept abilities in cold calling, pitches, creating presentation material, strategic planning and general business development.Responsibilities
Prospect and acquire new accounts for a designated territory and/or industry sector.
Identify business development opportunities, and keep strong relationships with agency influencers and decision makers.
Develop and execute a business plan to acquire the most strategic accounts in the market. Communicate effectively with English and Vietnamese speaking clients.
Coordinate strategic initiatives such as cross-departmental collaboration with marketing, networking, trade shows and online research.
Collaborate closely with agencies and develop partner-building strategies and develop solid pitch strategies that optimize the market potential.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of sales or media agency experience.
Experience on client side, digital media agency and/or within ad sales team.
Ability to speak and write in Vietnamese and English fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in integrated marketing communication sales or media sales.
A deep understanding of the industry's issues, a vision for its growth, and a commitment to advance Google's forward-looking strategies within the marketplace. Balanced team player dedicated to client service.
Knowledge of and established relationships within the advertising industry.
Excellent written, verbal, and presentation communication skills, including advanced agreements, influence, and public speaking ability.
title: New Business Sales Executive, Vietnam

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. We work closely with the Global Product teams to commercialize brand solutions and to drive the Sales organization to take Google’s brand advertising opportunities to their marketers. 

The Mobile Brand lead is a crucial role within the CSI organization. You will focus on Google’s Mobile Brand offering by commercializing the current product portfolio, by developing new points of view around products that our marketers need and by creating activation strategies to enable our sellers to go big in mobile brand.
Responsibilities
Lead mobile product commercialization in North America and influence of Google’s mobile product vision and roadmap based on customer needs and feedback of multiple teams across the organization (Global, Product, and Sales) towards a common goal.
Develop go-to-market strategy to drive business of our mobile solutions, across our customer Sales and Agency teams.
Collaborate with the performance mobile team to ensure that the Google mobile message is clear and succinct.
Navigate Google’s ecosystem to identify key influencers that will support our mobile brand story across the organization.
Drive business growth for our mobile brand business.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of sales experience, mobile sales experience.
Preferred qualifications
Proven track record of success driving business forward.
Effective leader capable of invigorating team with thought leadership and new ideas.
Deep working knowledge of the mobile advertising ecosystem: customer needs; product innovations and limitations; key players, including mobile ad tech; measurement and performance.
Strategic and analytical thinker capable of diving deep into the business and identifying trends to scale.
Excellent communication and facilitation skills, proven track record of building strong relationships with senior stakeholders.
title: Mobile Brand Lead, Americas Customer Solutions Innovations (CSI)

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
Project Loon’s mission is to use high altitude balloons (60,000 feet and higher) to make information more widely accessible and useful to the two-thirds of the world’s population who don’t currently have access to the Internet.
Responsibilities
Develop and maintain the system specifications for Project Loon payload and balloon.
Develop and maintain interface control documentation between all Loon subsystems including battery, solar panels, altitude control, thermal, flight control, flight termination, etc.
Develop and maintain mass and power budgets for the Loon system and for each subsystem.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of industry experience as a systems engineer.

Preferred qualifications
MS in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
5 years of industry experience in systems engineering.
title: Systems Engineer (Loon), Special Projects

text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You champion the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative and mobile. With a passion for Google products, you help make the world a more Googley place.
The Google for Work Cloud Platform team is dedicated to helping customers execute magical new ideas on Google’s worldwide infrastructure. As a Cloud Platform Sales Specialist, you bring Google Cloud Platform to organizations, with a focus on commercial companies. You bring Google's portfolio into big and small companies around the world, and handling complex customer and stakeholder relationships comes easy to you.
Responsibilities
Achieve quarterly goals and generate and qualify all leads and opportunities
Work with Cloud Platform Partners to develop campaigns and drive new pipeline
Serve as the primary customer contact for all adoption related activities
Leverage Google Sales Engineering and Marketing resources and provide input on current collateral materials and ideas on how to improve them
Build and maintain executive relationships with customers, influence long-term strategic direction, and act as a trusted advisor to the customer
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of sales experience
2 years of field sales experience in the technology industry.
Preferred qualifications
6 years of hands-on sales experience with a proven track record in reaching and exceeding goals.
5 years of field sales experience in the technology industry.
1 year of platform or infrastructure as a service experience.
Experience promoting enterprise software and/or SaaS solutions.
Deep understanding of platform infrastructure as a service marketplaces, key players, and technical factors driving competitive landscape.
Understanding of how various cloud technologies work together to be able to drive deeper technology adoption within the existing large account base.
title: Platform Sales Specialist, Google for Work Cloud

text:
Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Networking Test Engineer you make sure that our massive and growing network is operating at its peak potential. You have hands-on experience with complex networking equipment, a deep understanding of networking protocols, test design and implementation chops and a background in IP network design. It's your job to make sure Google's cutting-edge technology can perform at scale.
Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google aiming to deploy next generation, gigabit Internet speeds and services to the home. As a System Verification engineer, you will ensure the quality and stability of the networking products in the network access layer and customer homes. You will work closely with Hardware/Software Development, System and Network teams to validate networking product solutions. You will also create new test tool and automation scripts to explore and validate the functional correctness, performance capabilities, and resource usage of our software, as well as their interaction with other Google systems and infrastructure.
Responsibilities
Design, develop and execute test plans for cutting edge networking products.
Build complex testbeds to perform feature, system and solution testing. Identify, log and reproduce bugs. Verify fixes for bugs and improve test coverage by adding additional test cases throughout testing.
Contribute to the design of new access and home networking systems.
Develop advanced test automation tools and automation scripts for large-scale automation strategies.
Work closely with Customer Quality team to reduce customer-found defects and improve customer experiences.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a relevant technical field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of test experience in testing of network, software or an integrated environment.
Experience with support or execution of testing in multi-vendor, true end-to-end environment.
Preferred qualifications
BA/BS or MS degree in Computer Science or related technical area.
5 years of software or network testing, other related jobs/studies or proven and relevant accomplishments.
Experience with automation.
title: System Verification Engineer, Google Fiber

text:
User Experience (UX) Researchers work to answer the most challenging questions in design. In this role, you will reveal what our users need from our products by conducting primary research, exploring the behaviors and motivations of our users, and working with teams of Designers, Product Managers, Engineers and others to develop new features. You’ll inspire change at all stages of product development by delivering exciting oral, written and visual presentations about our findings. Most importantly, your job as a researcher is to help the UX team understand what would make a user’s experiences feel more intuitive, accessible, fun—and even magical.Responsibilities
Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of how users experience online search.
Work with designers, product managers, engineers, and research managers to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
Evangelize research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and oral presentations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS Degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Psychology, Information Science or equivalent practical experience.
Work experience in an applied research setting.
Preferred qualifications
Work experience, including experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices.
Excellent working knowledge of statistics and the principles of experiment design.
Demonstrated organizational, analytical and influencing skills.
Demonstrated leadership, communication and teamwork skills.
title: UX Researcher

text:
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical chops to roll up their sleeves and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our world-class software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.
Google Compute Engine enables developers and businesses to run their applications in Virtual Machines running on Google's infrastructure. Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily.
You will help deliver an exceptional cloud computing experience to our developer customers. As a manager, you will work with other leaders, product managers and engineers to deliver large, customer-focused PaaS, IaaS and SaaS products. The engineering teams in Compute Engine work on distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, storage and API design, enabling open-source software to work seamless with Compute Engine.
Responsibilities
Work closely with software engineers, quality assurance, product managers and other engineering teams to get high-quality products and features through the software project lifecycle (build, test and release on time).
Manage project schedules, identify risks and clearly communicate them to project stakeholders.
Take responsibility for release schedules and milestones, keeping up a high velocity in a fast-paced environment.
Develop tools and processes to improve software engineering productivity.
Ensure that the customer’s voice is heard in all product and engineering processes.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related fields (e.g. EE/CSE/EECS/Computer Engineering) or equivalent practical experience.
Hands on programming experience with enterprise-level software development utilizing one or more of the following core languages: Java, C, C++, Python.
Experience managing software engineers.

Preferred qualifications
Technical or Business graduate degree (e.g. MBA or MS degree in an engineering discipline).
5 years of experience in leading highly-complex, technically-challenging, cross-functional, software-oriented projects from inception to delivery.
Excellent communication skills.
title: Technical Lead/Manager, Google Compute Engine, Cloud

text:
As a Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales professional at Google, you are always reaching for ambitious performance goals. You work with a wide variety of SMB advertisers to deliver the optimal advertising solution for each client. Your interest in sales and the digital economy and your entrepreneurial drive enables SMB advertisers to expand their businesses with Google's latest advertising products and solutions. Your understanding of online media combined with your commercial acumen shape how new and existing businesses grow. Using your effective communication skills, you are the face of Google to a portfolio of clients whose needs you listen to, and help define the vision and strategy for how their products and services can reach thousands or millions of users.
As the Agency Development Manager, you will provide the management, analytical and sales power required to drive advertiser, acquisition and overall business growth of our Agency portfolio.
You'll collaborate closely with agency representatives, identify sales and business-development opportunities, evangelize new Google products and technologies throughout the agency, and develop and manage strong relationships with agency influencers and decision-makers driving scalable product adoption and business growth across the broader portfolio of agency-managed accounts. Moreover, you will develop the acquisition capabilities of our agencies in order to accelerate acquisition business growth.
Among your many attributes, you are persuasive, gregarious, a natural leader and skilled at solving problems and explaining complex issues. You possess excellent presentation skills at the senior level as well as the ability to work closely and constructively with all areas of the business. You're particularly adept at developing close, one-on-one relationships.
Responsibilities
Deliver against assigned quarterly targets on new and existing business, while prioritizing and delivering an outstanding sales experience to Google's top managed agency partners.
Own and strengthen primary agency relationships from executive C/B-level down to specific account teams including Media Planners and Buyers.
Build compelling, data-driven long term agency plans leveraging internal and third-party data. Synchronize agency plans with your Agency pod and internal cross-functional teams to further develop our agencies.
Be an ongoing thought partner for the Agency Lead on strategic initiatives and agency-level planning.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in sales or marketing at an agency, technology or media company.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in advertising sales, digital marketing, consulting, media specific industry or in a fast-paced media agency environment.
Established relationships and presence within the media marketplace.
Proven track record of developing agency partners and successfully driving new agency business opportunities.
Demonstrated ability to lead and manage multiple projects with a broad range of internal and external constituents simultaneously.
Ability to speak and write in English and Swedish fluently and idiomatically.
title: SMB Sales Agency Development Manager (Swedish)

Facilitate execution of network deployment projects in one or more data center locations in North America.
Coordinate new network technology deployment from NPI to production.
Analyze and present data related to deployment performance.
Develop and drive process and program improvements.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
4 years of experience in project/program management.
Preferred qualifications

title: Data Center Network Deployment Program Manager

text:
The ZOO is an agency-like team within the Global Google Sales organization. Here we help brands maximize the creative power of Google’s platforms and technologies. The ZOO is home to all types: From creative experts and strategists, to technologists, account directors and producers, we do it all. Working side by side with Sales and Marketing teams, we help our colleagues inspire, consult and educate their clients. And with our concentrated collection of artistic and technological kills, we help top brands around the world push the boundaries of Google technology. As part of a team of Creative Technologists, you will generate a forward thinking tech-based vision for the ZOO. You'll regularly be called on to deploy your creative and technical skills on huge projects for top advertisers. In some cases you’ll be refining existing ideas or prototypes for key pitches. In other instances, you’ll have the opportunity to dream and develop cutting-edge creative technology concepts that redefine interactive storytelling. Want to tell brand stories in a whole new way? Come check out the ZOO.
As Creative Lead your role is to excite marketers and their creative agencies with what is now possible to do online. You will be evangelical about YouTube and Google’s other platforms (Maps, Street View, Hangouts, Google+, Cardboard etc.) as tools to help build brands.
While knowledgeable about tech, you believe passionately that technology only drives business when it is harnessed to a big idea. 

Your role is like that of a creative director in that you will be required to illuminate and inspire our clients through your own work as well as through running discussions, seminars and giving talks about the opportunities that abound in the new media landscape.

You will work collaboratively with creative agencies as well as with others in The ZOO to prepare pitches and deliver amazing solutions to business problems. You will be able to talk to C-Level clients and to agency senior managers as an equal, encouraging them to embrace change. 

You have advanced knowledge of digital brand communications through the completion of major and complex projects. You have a recognized standing in your professional field through a portfolio of original and effective campaigns. You will also be able to show mastery of existing and emerging technologies, processes, and practices. You understand and apply managerial concepts and techniques such as work planning, coaching, mentoring, and evaluating. You will know how to bring teams together, define work plans and deliverables, schedule assignments, and then be able to review and evaluate the work product, offering technical direction and guidance to work teamResponsibilities
Work with ZOO planners and Account Managers to conceive and present brand-specific creative ideas that inspire senior clients.
Accelerate understanding among senior marketers of what digital technology can do for their brands and give them the confidence to make changes.
Produce creative solutions of a consistently high, even award-winning, standard.
Provide ‘light touch’ management of others in the creative team as and when appropriate.
Provide leadership and dynamism in helping create a culture which celebrates the transformative power of great ideas and spread the gospel out into the industry at large.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as a Senior Creative/Creative Director in an creative agency environment.
Experience in award-winning creative work.
Preferred qualifications
Possess a thorough understanding of interactive communications and delivery systems as well as industry best practices.
Awareness of design best practices and principles in creating brand-building solutions for global brands.Fluent in English and German.
title: Creative Lead, Creative Services (ZOO)

text:
Applications are due by Frdiay, July 31, 2015 at 11:59pm PST. Our team will review applications on a rolling basis. We appreciate your patience while we consider your application. We will accommodate your school schedule when determining the start date and duration, and relocation support is available on a case-by-case basis.Google invites you to join us for a unique summer experience in a 10-12 week full time paid internship for MBA students. Our MBA interns work on projects that tackle some of the most cutting-edge business challenges in the high-tech industry. Our interns have joined across the business such as Marketing, Advertising Sales and Operations, Finance, and more. For internships, we hire first into job families and then work with successful candidates to find project groups that match their skills and interests. Final decisions will be made based on business needs and your relevant experience.  
Be challenged. Make an impact. Do cool things that matter. To Apply:Click the “Apply Now” button to submit your resume in English in a PDF format (in your resume, be sure to include your expected graduation month and year and availability for internship). A cover letter is not required. Responsibilities
Intern projects will be determined based on the experience, skills, and interests of the student. If you are interested in a particular area, please make sure to include it in your resume
Minimum qualifications
Penultimate year of study in a full time MBA program, graduating in 2016.
Be able to complete a minimum 8 week program at the Sydney office between October 2015 and March 2016
Returning to education on a full-time basis upon completing the internship
Preferred qualifications
Work experience prior to the MBA program in Sales, Advertising, Consulting, Analysis, Customer Service, Marketing, Finance, Technical Operations, or related fields.
Strong interest in the Internet and Google's technology and business.
Demonstrated ability to be a self-starter and independent thinker.
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment.
Problem-solving skills, and ability to tackle highly strategic and challenging business problems
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
title: MBA Intern 2015

text:
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and aren't daunted by the challenge of building something from scratch, then our team might be your next career step.
As an Antenna Design Engineer within the wireless systems group, you will help design next generation high speed wireless communications systems. Using your extensive technical and leadership experience, you will identify and implement optimal wireless solutions to a number of different real world wireless communications problems and use cases.Responsibilities

Work independently, drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Responsibilities

Project manage and implement media campaigns and programs; coordinate between client, Sales, Sales support and Vendor teams to deliver a campaign
Provide specialized support to account managers and internal stakeholder teams, acting as the on-shore Large Customer Sales (LCS) point of contact for Brand reservation and auction campaign implementation. Provide excellent customer service to Google's advertisers. Identify and solve client problems proactively
Establish relationships cross-functionally and with peers, Sales Operations and Vendor managers, to identify and attack growth opportunities and areas for process improvements

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in digital ad operations, account management, marketing or similar experience in online advertising sales.
Preferred qualifications

Strong relationship management skills and experience working in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.
Proactive and responsible, with the proven ability to work independently and manage competing priorities while paying strict attention to detail.
