text:
Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind those systems are Googlers who advise and partner with our users and customers. You will support clients using our DoubleClick products, including mobile and rich media. Your projects will include business pitches, product implementation and upgrades, and custom solutions. Customers will look to your expertise on product configuration and business processes, combining your deep understanding of DoubleClick products with industry best practices.
As a Manager for Technical Product Experts, you are interested in improving the quality of our Ads Products for our users. You're up to the challenge of leading a talented group of technical product experts who sit at the nexus of product operations, engineering, services and sales, and you will sit within the Brand and Platforms Product Operations group in gTech Ads - which covers our product offerings across YouTube, the Google Display Network, and the suite of ad products across the DoubleClick buy-side platform. We are looking for dynamic leaders with exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills to drive the success of this key function for our gTech Ads business.Responsibilities
Develop, motivate, and lead a team of Technical Product Experts that cover a suite of Google’s performance-oriented ad products. Be responsible for providing best-in-class escalation management, regional product and beta incubation support.
Manage resource allocation and capacity across multiple sites, coordinating with leaders in other regions to ensure that appropriate global coverage, capacity, and processes are in place.
Act as senior point of escalation for product issues impacting the region. Manage relationships with regional Services and Sales leadership to ensure alignment around product issues and priorities. Serve as the primary liaison between the global Product Operations team and regional Services and Sales leads.
Align with Engineering leadership to ensure that product bugs are being effectively prioritized and addressed.
Track and report on a set of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure operational effectiveness, provide mentorship, career and skill development, and recruit talent.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of people management experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
Experience in services, operations and/or sales with focus on process and system improvement.
Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
Ability to grasp and communicate technical product issues.
Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management within Google.
title: Manager, Technical Product Experts, gTech Ads

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
At Google, we’re passionate about the intersection of internet platforms, connected devices, content distribution, and Education. Our mission is to create and support an integrated vision that injects all of the technical and cost advantages of thoughtful ICT into diverse classrooms around the globe. As a Program Manager within the Google for Education team, you will lead efforts to design, communicate, and iterate a unified vision to meet these diverse needs. Expect to take a leading role in solutions definition and architecture as we bring platforms, connected devices digital content to impact Education around the world.
Opening date for applications: 12th March 2015 
Closing date for applications: 11th April 2015
Competitive salary applies.Responsibilities
Lead the Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) team to support a range of educational institutions or industry in developing plans to improve network infrastructure, integration of ICT technology, and the deployment of Google solutions.
Lead the business analysis, solutions architecture and deployment management of integrated solutions for education and industry - including Google and third party systems.
Support and drive engagements as needed with educational institutions, governments and technology partners. Drive ecosystem development and reference solutions in EMEA.
Lead program management initiatives across the team. Participate in projects that help scale the group, implement best practices and improve methodology.
Manage internal and external cross-functional relationships to improve the impact of education and ‘go-to-market’ initiatives within the organization.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelors degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Program management experience.
Preferred qualifications
Ability to multitask and get things done in a fast paced environment.
Strong project and program management skills.
Excellent organization and communication skills.
title: Program Manager, Access and Infrastructure Initiatives in Education (EMEA Lead)
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
As a UX Engineer, you live on the front lines of our products and build features used by millions of people every day. The work is challenging, fast paced, and always changing. You have strong analytical skills, an unwavering commitment to quality, a collaborative work ethic, and cutting edge coding skills. You live and breathe the fundamentals of JavaScript (not just jQuery), CSS, and HTML, and Python scripting. you also command an impressive portfolio of web technologies new and old - all in order to launch innovative features to a global audience.
Responsibilities
Work closely with UX designers, project managers and back-end engineers to implement versatile, front-end solutions to tricky web development problems.
Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practices in order to push the limits of what a browser can do.
Manage your own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team.
Launch, iterate and make a difference. Provide front-end coding expertise, and be ready to make our products better for our users.

Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in visual design and user experience. Experience with JavaScript, Python, CSS and HTML.
Experience with mobile development, including responsive design.
Experience with Google App Engine and Google Analytics.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with MySQL.
Knowledgeable in Python with Jinja2 templating and Babel .
Knowledgable with AngularJS or Closure.
Knowledge of usability and accessibility issues.
Keen eye for clean UI implementation and knowledge of website design best practices. Excellent attention to detail.
Excellent communication, project management and organizational skills. Highly collaborative team player.
title: UX Engineer, Front End

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Camera/Imaging Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.
You are outstanding camera/imaging engineer who will take part in ground-breaking, early-stage technology development. Your responsibilities will include researching, designing, prototyping, developing and testing camera modules and other novel imaging systems, developing custom circuit boards, and integrating multiple hardware components into a single system/device.
Responsibilities
Design and implement custom camera modules (electronics and optics).
Develop and implement camera characterization and validation test plans.
Work closely with cross-functional teams on camera system integration, image tuning and camera-related software.

Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Programming experience (C/C++, Python).
Experience working with MIPI CSI, I2C, LVDS, or related protocols.
Analog and digital circuit design and simulation experience (OrCad, Altium Designer, or Eagle).
Preferred qualifications
MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field.
Experience in optical design using ray tracing software (Zemax, CodeV).
Experience in data analysis/statistical analysis.
Familiarity with camera sensors, camera ISP and camera module design.
Good communication and collaboration skills.
title: Camera/Imaging Engineer, Research and Development (Life Sciences), Special Projects

text:
The Google for Work team is on the front lines of helping the globe "go Google."  As a Google for Work Direct Sales representative, you evangelize Google tools like Apps, Search and Chrome to leading companies, schools and government agencies. You will coordinate with your aligned sales colleague(s) to approach the assigned territory and accounts strategically. You will apply best in class demand generation and skills through outbound outreach to identify new prospects. You will work cross-functionally with experienced sales representatives and marketing managers.Responsibilities
Manage a large volume of daily outbound interactions with prospective Google customers via phone and email - qualifying, educating and connecting them with our sales teams in order to deliver personal business targets.
Engage with representatives and senior managers on our Sales, Marketing and Operations teams to design and execute campaigns, and help continually improve our product, marketing and sales processes.
Analyze and report on our demand generation business sales and marketing stakeholders.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in sales or business development at a high-tech company.
Experience as a representative with prospect/customer outreach in mid-market accounts.
Ability to speak and write English and French fluently and idiomatically.
Preferred qualifications
Selling experience in software sales.
Able to work independently but within a team environment.
Ability to work in a fast-changing environment and deal with ambiguity with limited guidance.
Goal oriented, self-motivated individual who is confident, thorough, and tenacious. Fast learner with strong interest in technology.
Analytical, detail-oriented and able to “zoom” in/out from the big picture to the minutiae. Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal
title: Sales Development Representative (French), Google for Work, Apps

text:
When it comes to evaluating a Mergers and Acquisitions opportunity, the M&A Finance team plays a critical role in providing the tool kit for making sound business decisions. Working in close partnership with Legal, Corporate Development and People Operations, this team provides the financial analysis, forecasting and modeling to help decision-makers assess the strengths and risks involved in a given acquisition opportunity. As part of this team, you not only have strong finance and accounting background, but you can harness this knowledge to navigate complex financial issues to find creative solutions. You're willing to dive deep into the details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture.Responsibilities
Work with our Renewable Energy Team, Asset Management, and Legal teams to determine the scope, resources and timing for due diligence, technical accounting and on-going operations.
Influence the transactions from initial term sheet draft through due diligence, agreement structuring, integration planning, accounting for the investment, and post-close maintenance.
Manage internal and external financial diligence teams through the delivery of a summary of findings for renewable investments and determine guidance for internal staff on agreement structure and accounting and financial ramifications of deal terms.
Gather, research and process data to determine accounting treatment, create journal entries and determine consolidation structure and mechanics, and draft technical accounting documents to describe all aspects of executed transactions.
Collaborate with the SEC Accounting group to ensure timely and accurate financial reporting.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
9 years of experience in public accounting and/or private industry, including relevant energy or utility industry experience.
Preferred qualifications
Understanding of complex accounting issues e.g. VIE and consolidation considerations. Familiarity with tax equity investment structures.
Attention to detail, organized and thorough, with desire for continuous improvements.
Strong computer skills, including proficiency in spreadsheet software and complex financial models.
Strong leadership skills and proven ability to effectively manage people.
Excellent multitasking and project management skills.
Excellent planning, analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.
title: Finance Manager, Mergers and Acquisitions, Renewable Energy Investments

Your primary responsibility is to drive and grow new business with Google’s top advertisers. You'll manage business relationships to ensure that clients' needs and requirements are met. text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
As a Marketing Manager in charge of Lead Generation, you will be responsible for generating leads (i.e. companies who are potential advertisers) to aid our customer acquisition efforts across all segments of the business, from small "Google My Business" candidates all the way through to high potential prospects. This includes developing a vision for long-term growth of the mid-market space, defining the overall market opportunity, tracking market penetration, partnering with Sales to accurately capacity-plan, working with third parties to build innovative sourcing strategies, and tracking leads through the sales funnel, checking their quality and iterating towards future improvements. This may also include performing analyses on non-routine problems and working with engineers to develop better marketing databases and tools. Managing fast-changing business priorities and interfacing with marketing managers, product managers and engineers are required for success.
Responsibilities
Develop lead management strategy to meet the needs of multiple marketing campaigns and sales efforts.
Develop technology-driven pilots to test and track innovative approaches to prospect management.
Define and develop signals and indicators to find the right prospect, at the right time, for the right team.
Work with regional Marketing team, High Potential central team and other regional prospect management managers to continually refine and iterate our processes, best practice sharing and testing across markets and regions.
Manage third-party data provider relationships including budgeting, scope of work and day-to-day management of deliverables. Work with Engineering, Sales and Marketing to build consistent quality, and engagement tracking and metrics to drive improvement over time.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant experience.

Preferred qualifications
Sales or marketing experience from a high growth firm or experience with a leading consultancy or financial services company.
Experience in corporate strategic planning.
Experience using SQL.
Ability to work on virtual/global teams dealing with multiple, cross-functional team members and stakeholders.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
title: Lead Generation Marketing Manager, SMB Marketing

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.
The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR easy and intuitive for Googlers. Our global team optimizes people processes from problem definition to execution. We partner with teams across People Operations and in Engineering to bring innovation and technology to the way we attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide.

We focus on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers, and work in Google’s fast-paced environment to deliver operational services, manage the contingent workforce and implement HR programs across over 70 countries. Regardless of location or level of experience, members of the Operations team have the opportunity to create, develop and implement some of the most complex global operations around the world.Responsibilities
Manage one or more Google People Services (GPS) processes, and assume responsibility for operations, management, and continuous improvement of these processes.
Operate processes that may include highly-reliable data entry around employee information, customer-friendly handling and resolution of user inquiries, questions, and problems, auditing of process data, analysis and resolution of problems and special cases, and communication with HR Business Partners (HRBPs), recruiters, and other stakeholders.
Manage processes including definition, collection, and analysis of process metrics. Cooperate and communicate with relevant stakeholders (other People Operations teams, Finance, Legal, HRBPs, Staffing), along with relationship and contract management with vendors and outsourcers.
Improve processes including identification of problems and opportunities for enhancement of process parameters (quality, error rates, turn-around time and customer satisfaction, etc.), definition and assessment of improvement options, and execution/project management for the respective initiatives.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.

Preferred qualifications
Human resources experience (in particular HRIS/HRMS administration operations).
Experience with enterprise type applications. Experience with process automation utilizing IT applications and tools.
High level of creativity, perseverance, and openness to change.
Affinity to technology, including intermediate to advanced spreadsheet and word processing skills, Web/Internet/HTML.
Exceptional attention to detail and solid time management and multi-tasking skills.
Excellent customer service skills and a welcoming and helpful attitude.
title: Operations Coordinator, Google People Services

Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. As a Process Engineer, you will be responsible for the manufacturing of devices containing flexible substrates, microelectronics, and custom sensors. text:
At Google, our philosophy is build it, break it and then rebuild it better. That thinking is at the core of how we approach testing at Google. Unlike roles with similar names at the other companies, Test Engineers at Google aren't manual testers -- you write scripts to automate testing and create tools so developers can test their own code. As a Test Engineer, you navigate Google's massive codebase, identify weak spots and constantly design better and creative ways to break software and identify potential problems. You'll have a huge impact on the quality of Google's growing suite of products and services.
Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google, aimed at enabling next generation gigabit Internet connectivity. The Google Fiber team is deploying a Fiber-to-the-Home network capable of delivering gigabit connectivity and enhanced TV products to consumers, and the Network Operations Project Team guides the deployment of networking equipment, the integration of software systems to the network and the delivery of new network products and services.
The Test team works closely with the architecture, network engineering, software, network and product engineering groups of Google Fiber in order to deliver new markets and services efficiently and on time.
As a networking test engineer you will be responsible for unit and integration testing of new network devices, management systems and their interactions with OSS/BSS systems. You will also develop and execute test plans, and test cases to ensure a high level of quality in the solutions deployed to the production environment. You will work closely with the software, network engineering and architecture teams to validate the planned testing, and operations to ensure that their test needs are catered for. In addition, you will work with hardware and software vendors to resolve defects and plan retesting for fixes.Responsibilities
Write and execute test plans, test cases, and/or test plans in medium-sized projects of moderate complexity.
Lead the test effort of small-sized project from planning and organization to execution and delivery.
Demonstrate intuition and knowledge about how to test networks and systems by finding bugs, and apply this knowledge with measurable results and impact the quality of the product.
Demonstrate an ability to write test plans that scale, and to find bugs that require a complex analysis.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in a relevant technical field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of test experience in testing of network, software or an integrated environment.
Experience with support or execution of testing in multi-vendor, true end-to-end environment.

Preferred qualifications
BA/BS or MS degree in Computer Science or related technical area.
5 years of software or network testing, other related jobs/studies or proven and relevant accomplishments.
Experience with professional concepts and company objectives.
Proven project and team leadership skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills. Outstanding organizational, prioritization, and multitasking skills.
title: Network Test Engineer, Test and Test Infrastructure, Google Fiber

text:
As a Marketing manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google products. Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.
As a Strategy and Analytics Marketing Manager, you'll be involved in building Retail Marketing at Google, an increasingly important driver of business strategy for the company. You'll be part of an early team that's helping shape and execute marketing strategies around mobile and retail.

You have demonstrated top performance in your prior roles and are someone who can work in a rapidly changing industry; you tolerate ambiguity and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight.Responsibilities

Gather data from industry sources, build estimates, and develop models and analyses to shape executive decisions.
Manage key operations processes for running the team. Drive all regular strategic communication and updates to executive leadership.
Help team members or project objectives when necessary.

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience at a consulting or banking firm, or equivalent strategy and operations, analytics, or finance experience.

Experience in retail strategy, growth strategy and marketing strategy within the consumer or electronics/hardware industry.
Experience with structuring ambiguous problems, identifying analyses and creating appropriate presentations and story lines to influence executive decisions.
Experience planning for and managing large-scale, interrelated, complex projects, and coordinating and collaborating with cross-functional team members to deliver quality results within the project deadlines.
Comfort working with and manipulating data, building models, running scenarios or sensitivities, and summarizing key takeaways and insights. Highly analytical.
Strong presentation and presentation design skills.

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
Machine Intelligence is a high-impact team within Knowledge that’s building the next generation of shipping products, intelligences, and language understanding at Google. We create and impact products across Google including Search, Maps, Photos, and Google Now. You will collaborate with Engineering, UX and Product teams, and you’re able to switch projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. Because you’ll be working with cutting-edge technology, you’ll also get a chance to work closely with researchers across Google.
You will need to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems. You are keen to reinvent photography, comfortable handling serious levels of complexity and ambiguity, and want to work on software that pushes the boundaries of photo capture and output. You should be able to coordinate and program manage our teams working on machine intelligence, computer vision, computational photography, iOS and Android apps, cloud storage, and wireless connectivity. For us to ship a hit product, you will need to keep all these trains running on time and in sync by identifying blocks, specifying milestones, facilitating communication, and doing whatever it takes to keep moving.
You will project manage machine intelligence, computational photography, computer vision, app development, cloud, and other technologies. While you will work across all of these teams, you don’t need to be an expert in all of them.
Responsibilities
Create a unified project plan and schedule from today through Version 1 (v1) launch. Drive a multi-quarter software roadmap and prioritize features for inclusion in our v1 release.
Manage internal systems and stakeholders related to launch planning and releases. Track project milestones and control project issues to ensure timely delivery of solutions.
Identify blockers and find solutions by fostering collaboration and decision-making across relevant Software Engineering teams. Define processes for bug triages, monitor crashes and regression and put measures in place for timely resolution. Define and drive an automated continuous testing framework to ensure quality across our systems.
Mitigate launch risks by sizing risks, identifying hedges, and managing team expectations. Create new automated processes and tools to help the team scale across a growing list of projects.
Lead communications with privacy, security, accessibility, legal and other cross-functional teams related to software development. Collaborate with multiple locations and engineering leads across multiple locations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of program management experience managing technical efforts.
Preferred qualifications
Experience developing software for a v1 product.
Experience coordinating multiple different software teams towards a single shipping product.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a focus on translating technically complex issues into simple, easy to understand language for a broader audience.
Strong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization abilities with excellent attention to detail.
title: Technical Program Manager, Intelligent Photography

text:
The Internal Audit team's mission is to call attention to risks and drive actions to address those risks to protect Google and Googlers. The team partners with business and engineering groups to identify areas of risk, make valuable recommendations on controls, and influence changes and decisions. As a member of the team, you’ll have the opportunity to advise on system implementations, product launches and other business initiatives. You enjoy working in a dynamic environment, are passionate about technology, and are able to focus on problems at hand and the details that come with it.Responsibilities
Design and execute financial and operating audit programs to address relevant risk and audit assertions. Interpret the significance of audit findings, conclude on findings and make practical recommendations.
Assess new or changes to existing processes to identify financial and operating risks before launch and recommending improvements.
Prepare audit reports to document audit scope, procedures, findings and recommendations.
Manage work requirements and budget to meet assigned initiatives.
Communicate with and educate process owners, including non-finance individuals, on the importance of controls, an effective control environment, and the role of Corporate Audit.

Minimum qualifications

BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting or related degree, or equivalent practical experience.
CPA or equivalent.
4 years of experience in internal/external audit.
Preferred qualifications
Ability to multi-task, plan, execute and deliver on projects in a timely manner.
Leadership skills (ability to take charge, motivate others, confidence to interact with all levels, set objectives, and drive to results).
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work with a wide variety of departments including Legal, HR and Engineering.
title: Financial Auditor

text:

text:
Successful sales in today's online advertising space require minds that can not only keep pace with rapid technological change, but stay one step ahead. As a Product Technology Manager, you will lead cross-functional teams of Engineering, Sales, and Product management members to leverage emerging technologies for our customers. From design and conceptualization through to testing and deployment, you will oversee the technical execution and business operations of Google's online advertising and platform partnerships. You will work on developing product and technical strategies as well as prioritize projects and resources to assist our account management team and partners. You're able to balance business and partner needs with technical constraints and love bringing new products to market and to our partners.
Product Technology Managers within the gTech Scaling and Business Intelligence (BI) group are responsible for driving the strategy and technology that allows the sales and support for Google’s products to scale. You will look at the “Big Picture” within gTech, identify similarities between vertical service teams, and ensure that projects and products that are built within the organization have a widespread, cross-vertical impact. You will be responsible for prioritizing and managing the automation projects performed by our main internal partners, the gTech Engineering team.
As a Product Technology Manager within gTech, you will represent a cross-functional team and work closely with various product areas to deliver tools, products, platforms, and capabilities that directly affect how efficiently Google’s various products scale. You will also ensure that we have the BI capabilities to ensure frictionless interaction with our partners, and a deeper understanding of our products and verticals. You’ll be working with some of our biggest and most successful products and partnerships for Google and our most strategic partners.Responsibilities
Identify business improvement opportunities, define product vision and strategy, and all elements related to the business case. Build and execute product roadmaps including infrastructure necessary to support our goals.
Initiate and prioritize projects within gTech Engineering, assist in determining the best technical implementation methods as well as a reasonable execution schedule.
Break down barriers across groups to launch products and iterate - Sales, gTech Business Verticals, Finance, Strategy and Operations, and Customer Support.
Work with gTech Engineering and internal clients to track and communicate product development, and to develop product launch plans.
Be the primary point of contact for gTech’s products, and advocate the use of these products within Google.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Experience designing software products (web or mobile) and managing the full lifecycle from conception, to requirements gathering, to development and then deployment.
Experience with systems design and web technologies.
Preferred qualifications
Experience managing cross-functional teams and new products. Comfortable working in collaboration with software engineers on a daily basis
Experience as a Technical Product Manager, or demonstrable Product Management skills
Competent in C/C++, Python and/or Java
Excellent knowledge of web technologies (HTTP, HTML, JavaScript)
Excellent technical project management and business negotiation skills.
Excellent business acumen, written, and oral communication and interpersonal skills with experience interacting with senior-level executives.
title: Product Technology Manager, gTech Technology and Business Solutions
locations: London Borough of Islington, London, UK

text:
As a member of Google's Public Policy team, you help shape various product and issue agendas with policy makers inside and outside government. In addition, you will help advise our internal teams on the public policy implications of their products, working with a closely coordinated and cross-functional global team. The role requires significant experience either working with or in government, politics or a regulatory agency as well as an ability to grasp complex technical and policy issues.
You'll work on key issues, ranging from data privacy and security to ads, competition and controversial content. You will need first-rate analytical and organizational skills, the ability to communicate effectively in person and writing, an aptitude for learning and the discipline to manage different projects to tight deadlines simultaneously. No two days at Google are the same, so flexibility and a willingness to try new things are essential.

Develop and lead strategies and campaigns to support Google’s users, our business and the wider web.
Monitor and research current and relevant emerging policy issues, and work cross-functionally to develop policy positions for review by Google's Policy, Legal, and Management teams.

Draft collateral and other materials for internal and external consumption.
Advise our Product and Engineering teams on the policy implications of their products.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience working within national politics, government, think tanks, public interest groups or the field of corporate public policy.
Preferred qualifications
Master's or PhD degree in business, law, public policy or related fields.
Familiarity with Internet technologies and the surrounding policy environments, or an ability to quickly get up to speed on complex technical and regulatory issues.
Team player with a sense of humor and the ability to exercise good judgment in a rapidly changing and sometimes stressful environment.
Excellent personal, political, analytical and organizational skills.
Great communicator, in person and in writing.

text:
Google's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. Strategic Partner Managers have the unique opportunity to create a long-lasting relationship with our top partners. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to see win-win opportunities with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.
Our Hardware Sales team lead an important piece of Google’s mission. It is tasked to manage all of the hardware devices through which our consumers experience our services. The team oversees the commercial aspects of all products made by Google (i.e: Chromecast, etc), all products made with Google (i.e: Nexus, Chromebooks, etc) and all of the products made using Google (e.g. Android, Wear, etc). 

As the Retail Sales Manager, Nordics you'll be responsible for implementing and optimizing relationships with retail partners in the region/country that distribute hardware built using our Android and Chrome platforms, and enhance the proposition around those products and platform. You'll be the primary partner contact, driving the implementation and optimization of our collaboration and driving tactics designed to improve the usage and distribution of Google’s hardware, platforms, applications and ecosystem services. As such you will need to have a deep understanding of Android, Chrome OS, and related hardware (e.g. Chromecast, Nexus, Chromebook) in addition to Google’s ecosystem of applications and services such as Play Content, Search, and other Apps. You'll track and analyze key metrics, proactively resolve business and technical issues with our partners and identify new partnership opportunities. Some of the attributes you'll bring to this job include strong attention to detail, outstanding communication and negotiation skills and a collegial personality. 

This is a cross-functional role: you will be working closely with Marketing, Operations, Product Management/Engineering, Sales and PR teams in country as well as across the region and globally.Responsibilities
Manage the business of our hardware products and the business growth from Google’s ecosystem services such as the Play Store, and use of promotional budgets to ensure targets are being met and exceeded.

Work with our legal team to negotiate and execute complex agreements with key partners.

Has an existing network of C-level relationships.
Sharp analytical and detail-oriented skill with ability to clarify and summarize complex issues
Superb communication skills, with the ability to comfortably interact with our partner's and Google's executive management.

text:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our world-class recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of scrappiness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.Responsibilities
Evaluate skill level and manage offer process including reference checks.
Ensure hiring manager and team are prepared during the interview process and that interviews are conducted in an efficient and professional manner.
Manage candidate process and act as a candidate advocate.
Develop client management expertise.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant staffing experience.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with recruiting information/applicant tracking systems
Experience in developing client management.
Experience from an executive search or a well known agency, especially experience in markets/industry mapping.
Demonstrated strong administrative skills; proficiency in spreadsheet software and documents.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on tact and diplomacy.
title: Recruiter, Global Business Organization

text:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII) or HTML version of your resume to jobs@google.com.
Important: The subject field of your email must include SMB Sales, Business Development Manager - Tokyo.Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The Traditional Media Agency (TMA) Team is responsible for driving incremental business growth via our full-service, creative and media agency partners. As a Business Development Manager, you will focus on strengthening long-term relationships with our top managed traditional media agencies and drive growth through agency-managed accounts with large brand and performance opportunity. 

You provide the highest level of client service to our agency partners. You will develop Google solutions to drive business growth for high opportunity customers and then, with your account team, execute campaigns providing a measurable return on investment. You bring a proven background in promoting brand and performance solutions and you have particularly adept abilities in pitches, creating presentation material, strategic planning and general business development. 

You will gain broad exposure to many Google products and cross-functional teams as we identify and implement solutions that best suit the unique needs of these agency partners and high-opportunity customers.Responsibilities
Deliver against assigned quarterly goals while prioritizing and delivering an outstanding experience to Google's top managed agency partners.
Collaborate and consult with major agencies with the goal of extending relationships, increasing the client and agency base and optimizing their advertising investment.
Own and strengthen primary agency relationships from executive C/B-level down to specific account teams including Media Planners and Buyers.
Analyze data trends and client performance, develop solid strategic plans and prepare and conduct strategic pitches and presentations.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant experience in sales or marketing at an agency, technology or media company.
Ability to speak and write English and Japanese fluently and idiomatically.
Ability to travel up to 20% of the time.
Preferred qualifications
Proven success in business development, client relationship and servicing skills.
Demonstrated ability to lead and manage multiple projects with a broad range of internal and external constituents simultaneously.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about complex issues and develop recommendations and action plans.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Advanced sales skills.
Local marketing expertise in the broadcasting industry.
title: SMB Sales, Business Development Manager

You'll manage business relationships to ensure that our clients' needs and requirements are met. Responsibilities

text:
The gTech Content Operations (gCO) team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google’s users by ensuring compliance of content across various Google products. We strive to maintain a healthy ecosystem for the company’s expanding base of advertisers, publishers and users across the globe by adhering to quality standards. If you have great passion for understanding software products and making them more purposeful, the Product Solutions team in gCO is the place for you!
Your work will affect tools used in the Content Review space, which is the first touch point of Google to many who advertise with us. In this role, you will need to understand ads review tools and its users. You will design solutions, brainstorm and troubleshoot with Engineers/Product Managers and make the ads review process a seamless experience for all.Responsibilities
Design, build, and enhance ad review and related support tools and infrastructure across Google ad products.
Work with analyst teams to detect and automate tasks by building front-end and backend based solutions.
Work on improving real time systems for large scale data processing, machine learning and clustering problems to identify review trends.
Work with product and engineering teams to improve ads review operation infrastructure.
Lead conversations with multiple Engineering teams on designing ideal solutions and lead technical teams on 
several projects.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in object oriented programming language Java, C++ or Python.
Experience in data structures and algorithms.

Preferred qualifications
MS Degree in Computer Science or related field.
Experience working in Unix/Linux environments.
Knowledge of SQL, relational databases, and other data storage solutions
Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively.
Fluency in multiple programming languages.
title: Lead Tools Development, gTech Content Operations

text:
Google's technical leads develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a Technical Lead, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward.With your extensive technical expertise you take initiative to independently design and implement new systems, designing, implementing, and testing multiple features with little or no direction from tech lead or manager. You collaborate with key stakeholders to determine future direction of work.
YouTube aims to become the destination for music lovers, and a place for music artists to build and manage their careers.
We are a fun and dynamic team, and operate like a mini-startup within YouTube. As a Technical Lead on our team, you like a fast-paced/iterative development model, enjoy full-stack development, take risks on innovative features/ideas and are willing to collaborate with other teams in YouTube, Google Research and Play.Responsibilities
Provide leadership to a group of engineers in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
Manage and drive complex technical projects from the planning stage through execution.
Take responsibility for the overall planning, execution and success of complex technical projects.
Work closely with the Product Management team to ensure we're building the best products.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of direct experience with leading technical projects or engineering management, and experience interfacing with business teams.
Experience with distributed systems and architecture.
Preferred qualifications
8 years of relevant work experience, including 6 years of industry experience.
Strong development experience in C++, Java or Python.
Strong analytical skills with experience working with complex data sets.
Background in Web applications, data mining, information retrieval and multi-tiered systems.
Demonstrated expertise in problem solving and technical innovation.
title: Technical Lead, Music, YouTube

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
Google's advanced corporate network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. As a Network Security Engineer working within the Corporate Network Engineering team, you'll be a key player in the security roadmap and consulting efforts that address Google's diverse needs for network communications and connectivity.
Your job will span traditional enterprise challenges, including access policies, third-party customer connectivity, and the rise of 'Bring Your Own Device'; you'll also face down the uncommon challenges, including security policy design for special-projects labs, Wi-Fi networks where our customers are designing the next generation of mobile devices, and security architecture for a global enterprise with a highly diverse set of WAN providers and increasing levels of network segmentation. You'll have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of other teams beyond corporate network engineering, including security operations, systems engineering, hardware operations, backbone network engineering, and many others. Ensuring the network secure means that our employees stay connected, and that our engineers can focus on creating the next generation of public Google products and services.Responsibilities
Ensure the Google enterprise network is secure. Define and document the security road map for the Google enterprise network.
Participate in leading and defining best-in-class security practices for enterprise networks consuming cloud services.
Partner with key customers of the enterprise network to ensure security compliance across the entire enterprise domain.
Author security policy and lead initiatives to ensure their execution.
Minimum qualifications
BS degree in a technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience in network security or security-focused network engineering or software development.
Experience with network fundamentals (e.g. TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, IPTables, IPv6).
Experience with design and implementation of campus or multi-site wired and wireless networks.
Preferred qualifications
MS or other advanced degree. CISSP or similar industry security certification.
Experience with network and application security in a network serving 10,000 or more users and a global footprint.
Architectural experience with common components of an enterprise network security system: firewalls, application layer gateways, AAA servers, segmented networks; experience automating deployment or utilization of these systems.
Experience with security design for multi-service enterprise Wi-Fi networks with multiple classes of users.
Proficiency in Python or similar general-purpose scripting environment.
title: Enterprise Network Security Engineer

text:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.
Google Fiber is an exciting business for Google, aimed at enabling next generation Internet connectivity. The Google Fiber team is deploying a Fiber-to-the-Home network capable of delivering gigabit connectivity and enhanced TV products to consumers. The Network Operations Team is responsible for the design, deployment, and operation of the network equipment, facilities, and systems needed for this leading edge broadband project.

As a Network Engineer, Access, you will be a key part of the team for creating the Google Fiber access networks. Your responsibilities will include access network capacity forecasting, platform selection, and new platform integration. You have demonstrated skills in the design and operation fixed and wireless broadband access networks. Your skills will also be called on by the network test teams who will ask you to review their test plans prior to release. You learn quickly and adapt to changes.Responsibilities
Develop network design from reference design stage to design completion. Improve network designs based on test results.
Create and present network design summaries including methodology and rationale.
Contribute to platform test requirements and test plan documentation.
Assist with vendor equipment selection, including OLT, CPE, and other access platforms.
Represent the Access team in cross team architecture and engineering release planning.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in EE/CS/CE or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in an Internet service provider using fixed or wireless broadband access technologies.
4 years of experience creating detailed network design.
Experience with fixed-access technologies like GPON, EPON, DSLAMs and Ethernet for Broadband Access. Experience with Broadband Forum TR-101 architectures.
Preferred qualifications
Network certifications such as CCNP/CCIE/JNCIS/ALU SRC/JNCIE.
Experience with Wireless access technologies including 802.11x (Wi-Fi).
Comprehensive understanding of the planning and commissioning of access network equipment. Network routing protocol troubleshooting skills in all of DHCP, RADIUS, BGP, OSPF, ISIS, and MPLS and knowledge of TCP/IP, IPv6, and Multicast.
Detailed understanding of IEEE and ITU standards and implementations around FTTH technologies. Understanding of multicast and video transport.
Understanding of MPLS and MEF service constructs including VLL (ELINE), VLPS (ELAN) and IP-VRF.
title: Network Engineer, Access, Google Fiber Network Operations

text:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.
As a Program Manager you will develop and support the technical infrastructure and create innovative solutions to meet the support and analytical needs of the gTech group. You will be directly involved in a number of high profile launches that have strategic importance for Google. This job entails working with various operations teams around the globe and a wide range of engineering teams to design new tools, automate data analysis, create dashboards, optimize processes, and use the latest of Google's internal technologies to build needed business intelligence. You should possess a mix of technical strength and drive to challenge the status quo. You will work closely with other support and software engineers and members of the operations teams.Responsibilities
Project-manage a number of software projects simultaneously.
Design, implement, test, and launch internal technical solutions.
Maintain existing tools and hardware infrastructure.
Assist with operations metrics analysis and develop reporting dashboards.
Analyze work processes to determine inefficiencies and opportunities for automation.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with Software Development methodologies and tradeoffs.
Experience with Python/Java, SQL, and web frameworks.
Experience working in a consulting environment.
Preferred qualifications
Proven ability to work in fast-paced, constantly evolving environments.
Proven ability to manage projects under tight schedules.
Exceptional analytical and structured problem solving skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills exhibited in complex operational settings.
title: gTech Program Manager

text:
This position will be based in Nashville, TN.With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people.
Google is always striving to innovate our Fiber-to-the-Home program. We're building one of the fastest national broadband networks to deliver next-generation Internet and TV content to users. If you want the opportunity to work on a state-of-the-art high-profile program, look no further than this opportunity to help create the future of broadband.
As a Customer Service Supervisor, you will ensure that Google is focused on our customers at our local brick-and-mortar location. You will be a product expert with detailed knowledge of our constantly evolving service. This position is responsible for supervising all functions of the Google Fiber Space, including customer experience, facilities management, performance planning, inventory, and product-related functions. You will help develop a vendor team focused on driving customer retention and satisfaction while ensuring excellence in customer service with every customer contact. Additionally, you will be an escalation point of contact for all in-market partners and ensure that the experience remains consistently excellent for the customer.Responsibilities
Help create and maintain an environment for discovery in the Google Fiber Space that sparks new ideas for using Google Fiber services, such as high-definition programming and high-speed Internet.
Establish and maintain a professional and courteous support culture within the Google Fiber Space while promoting an interactive and engaging experience. Interact with other in-market teams (Construction, Sales, Marketing, etc.) to build a strong working relationship and be the local voice of Google Fiber’s customer and our support organization in cross-functional decisions.
Support employees in problem solving and address escalated internal and external customer issues in a responsive, timely, and accurate manner to achieve maximum customer satisfaction.
Be a self-directed, passionate leader who is customer focused and acts with a sense of urgency to proactively address issues, obstacles, and shortfalls that may impact performance.
Oversee the inventory that is contained in our Google Fiber Space. Help build processes to improve the tracking and storage of Google Fiber equipment, as well as marketing/sales items.

Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in a customer service role (in person) and 1 year of people management experience.
Ability to work non-standard work hours as needed.
Ability to travel as required.
Preferred qualifications
Proven technical troubleshooting background (wireless networks, Windows, Mac OS, email).
Local market expertise.
Comfortable reporting technical issues to engineers in descriptive terms.
Creative and passionate approach to addressing opportunities and challenges; and an enthusiastic, self-motivated, positive can-do attitude that relishes delivering best-in-class customer service.
Ability to communicate effectively with customers and employees of the organization.
title: Customer Service Supervisor, Google Fiber, Nashville

text:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
The Small and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Channel Sales team focuses on building and managing long-term relationships with our channel partners. Our partners are a diverse group of businesses through whom we empower millions of small and medium-sized businesses with Google’s AdWords and other Google technologies.
As a Sales Strategy and Operations Manager, you will be responsible for growing the Channel Sales business through identifying key business drivers and opportunities, and working with cross-functional counterparts to grow these opportunities. Additionally, you will drive operational improvements in the areas of process, workflow, communication and strategic planning.Responsibilities
Lead analytical deep-dives to understand business drivers and opportunities for improvement.
Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop solutions to develop new business based on analytical insights.
Identify and implement metrics and reporting tools to measure business results and success.
Lead quarterly planning and cross-functional engagement, and drive improvements in process and reporting infrastructure.
Present results of analyses directly to senior executives through high-quality presentations.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in a role that leveraged data analytics (strategic planning, management consulting or analysis).
Experience with data modeling.
Preferred qualifications
Advanced degree (MBA, Master’s or PhD).
Experience from a top management consulting company or investment bank, with relevant work experience.
Project management experience.
Self-directed. Ability to thrive in an unstructured environment; comfortable dealing with ambiguity.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, superior ability to present to executives and communicate with diverse stakeholders.
title: Sales Strategy and Operations Manager, SMB Channel Sales

text:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Product Quality Operations team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
Working on Strategy and Planning, you will demonstrate excellence in project management, business judgment and analytical problem solving. You will become a cross product expert while communicating key insights to senior leaders. You will understand Product Quality Operations' (PQO's) product suite by communicating key “state of the business” metrics and driving the planning process with team executives. You are a self-starter who can work in a rapidly changing industry, and you tolerate ambiguity and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight.
Responsibilities
Understand Google's product policy, enforcement, and risk strategy in order to identify key policy and enforcement operational successes, risks and inconsistencies, and opportunities for improvement; partner with cross-functional teams in PQO, Legal, Product, Engineering, and Sales to mitigate such risks based on impact.
Lead complex and time-critical projects for senior leaders by quickly understanding context and developing a prioritized approach for resolution.
Become an expert in the data available in disparate sources, and use this data and your knowledge of statistical methods to execute sophisticated quantitative analyses and advanced models to produce actionable insights.
Communicate initiative findings to senior leadership by preparing polished presentations and identifying key takeaways.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
SQL/DB querying and spreadsheet software experience (pivot tables, Google Apps Script, etc.) handling large data sets (1M+ rows).
Preferred qualifications
MBA or graduate degree in management, technical or engineering field.
6 years of experience identifying risks and opportunities for business improvement by sourcing problems, analyzing data and driving business strategy, as well as measuring the success of those initiatives.
Experience in project management and independently scoping, prioritizing and executing initiatives.
Experience in the online advertising and/or consumer products industry; emphasis in policy and or enforcement.
Proficiency in R or another statistical programming language. Familiarity with programming languages (Python, Shell scripting, Google Apps Script, Java, PHP, JavaScript, C, etc.) or with internal data-mining tools.
Demonstrated excellence working globally and cross-functionality, ability to influence while demonstrating maturity and objectiveness; Excellent communication skills.
title: Associate Principal, Product Quality Operations

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. Google's line of products and services never stops growing. As a Strategic Account Manager, you will develop Google's relationships with our most strategic publisher partners in the Apps, Music and Gaming vertical by helping them manage and optimize the monetization of the full breadth of their ad inventory. In this role, you will contribute to Google and partner business growth by driving usage of both DoubleClick ad serving technology to support direct sales and various monetization products (Ad Exchange, AdMob, AdSense) to enable indirect business growth. 

You will understand partner monetization needs across channels (mobile, video, desktop, etc.) and work hands-on within our solutions to optimize yield. You will take responsibility for managing, renewing and promoting an existing book of business while identifying new business opportunities within named accounts. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to resolve contractual, technical and financial issues with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs. You will be a key member of a larger support team to ensure Google’s top partners receive excellent account management and strategic consulting.Responsibilities
Understand full scope of partner monetization business including inventory trends, direct and indirect channel priorities, and competitors used. Understand how monetization fits into larger business strategy.
Act as conduit between DoubleClick product and services organizations to clients.
Optimize usage of Google’s monetization suite in consultation with partners based on performance analysis (e.g., block list management, CPM thresholds, ad positioning).
Expand Google’s platform and monetization growth by identifying new inventory, emerging channels and products that support partner business growth goals.
Analyze monetization and platform performance, and present findings to key clients, influencing partner strategy by highlighting key opportunities to increase business growth through additional product usage; bring data driven insights to support recommendations.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
Music, gaming and/or mobile app industry knowledge.
Broad understanding of the online advertising (i.e., ad serving networks) and of unique challenges specific to advertising within mobile applications.
Demonstrated analytic ability, including the ability to understand monetization metrics and apply these to potential optimizations.
Comfortable operating in a rapidly changing, fast paced industry with the ability to manage an evolving product set and client needs.
Demonstrated partner relations, account management, and sales skills.
title: Strategic Account Manager, Media Distribution Partnerships

text:

Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.
As a Publisher Quality Analyst you will fight click, impression, and conversion fraud. You will be solving complex problems across large data sets, bringing your analytical skills together with the power of Google’s technology to find invalid activity occurring on Google’s ad products, and ensure that advertisers are not charged for fraud. You will also work with product and engineering teams to make sure that new products and features provide a good, safe experience for advertisers.
You are proactive, motivated, organized, responsible and innovative. You're able to work well in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment while demonstrating technical know-how, effective communication skills, and efficient execution.
Responsibilities

Work directly with multiple Google teams to resolve invalid click cases.
Enhance our operational workflows via process improvements.
Identify automation opportunities and lead projects to execute on those ideas.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Science, Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of work experience.
Preferred qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related field.
Experience with fraud investigations, fraud risk management, Internet advertising, or e-commerce.
Experience with coding and scripting (Python, C++, Java).
Solid knowledge of querying languages (MySQL, Dremel, etc.) and database structures.
Ability to work independently and complete projects on time.
Strong data analysis skills.

text:
