You have hands-on experience with complex networking equipment, a deep understanding of networking protocols, test design and implementation chops and a background in IP network design. It's your job to make sure Google's cutting-edge technology can perform at scale.As a Network Infrastructure Test Engineer you will be responsible for unit and integration testing of new network devices and management systems. You have hands-on experience with complex networking equipment, an understanding of networking protocols, test design and implementation chops and a background in IP network design.You will work closely with the Network Engineering and Architecture teams to validate the planned testing and operations to ensure that their test needs are catered for. You also ensure that network operations are safe, efficient and reliable by monitoring network, coordinating maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues.Responsibilities
Design, develop, and execute test plans and infrastructure for networking features, equipment and system solutions.
Support and lead implementation of Google's growing test network infrastructure.
Work with other team members and groups to analyze requirements or potential problems and proactively develop solutions and policy recommendations.
Lead test efforts for small-sized project from planning to execution and delivery.
Handle escalated issues and work closely with the internal and external teams to resolve service issues.

Minimum qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or related engineering field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of testing experience in networking area or an integrated environment.
Experience with networking systems including TCP/IP, Ethernet, IPv4.
Experience with support or execution of testing in multi-vendor environment.
Preferred qualifications
Network certifications such as JNCIS, JNCIE (or equivalent training/experience).
Automation experience with frameworks, network platform and in scripting languages such as Python.
Experience involving configuration, manual and automated testing using test platforms such as IXIA or Spirent.
Hands-on experience deploying and operating a large enterprise network.
Experience or familiarity with testing of service class routers and switches of IOS-XR or Junos based platforms.
Network routing protocol troubleshooting skills involving BGP, OSPF, ISIS, MPLS as well as knowledge of TCP/IP, IPv6, PIM/IGMP, Multicast.
title: Network Infrastructure Test Engineer, Google Fiber

text:
The Operations Order Management Logistics team makes sure physical deliveries happen on schedule so Google's virtual world keeps humming. As a member of the team, you help manage the logistics and transportation of vendor deliveries. From global deployments of servers to the delivery of networking gear, you need to make sure the right equipment arrives at the right location at the right time. What you oversee is often overseas, and you work with international governmental organizations to ensure imported equipment arrives smoothly. You also work with internal customers to measure and define processes, constantly using data to improve our systems.
As a Strategic Vendor Manager, you will join Corporate Engineering at Google. You have world-class supplier management skills, and will be responsible for a variety of key supplier relations, including providers of hardware, software, telecom and professional services. You will attain value from supplier relationships, while ensuring contract terms are adhered to. In this role, you will be the front line to our suppliers and drive our suppliers to deliver optimal value to Google.Responsibilities
Identify and prioritize key supplier relationships.
Partner with various stakeholder groups to understand requirements.
Develop and negotiate agreement terms and provide contract interpretation. Develop metrics to manage provider performance.
Manage providers to deliver highest caliber of service, efficiency, and flexibility.
Drive providers to improve, including quality and process improvements. Coordinate new services, projects, and system implementations as needed.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
10 years of related experience.
Demonstrated ability to think globally and strategically, influencing change across a complex organization.
Proven negotiation and influencing skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas in easy to understand business terms.
title: Strategic Vendor Manager

text:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.Responsibilities
Create hardware block diagrams and design specification documents.
Own board schematic design for complex systems such as multi-layer high speed gigabit buses, interconnects, and optical interfaces.
Implement complex FPGA design using Verilog HDL tools such as Xilinx or Altera.
Develop hardware engineering and qualification test plans for different design phases, and HALT test and screening.
Perform DVT design verification, test, and high speed signal integrity analysis such as ISI characterization.
Minimum qualifications
MS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of hardware high speed board design, board bring-up experience, devices and interconnects such as PCI/PCI-X, PCIe, DDR2/3, XAUI, SERDES, SPI, I2C, MDIO.
Experience with C/C++, and assembly language programming.
Experience with schematic symbol creation for different packages such as dense uBGA, CSP, and custom parts.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with high volume consumer products design.
Experience with shipping volume products and very familiar with MTBF analysis, and DFM/DFT guidelines.
Understanding of manufacturing process flows such as SMT, ICT/JTAG, board functional tests, and system integration.
Familiar with consumer networking and multimedia functions such as Wi-Fi, USB, e/SATA, and HDMI.
Familiar with embedded Linux designs, and in-system tests such as POST, BIST, and diagnostics.
title: Hardware Engineer, Google Fiber

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The Google for Work Partner Success Manager is responsible for driving sustainable business growth according to annual local targets (set by Operations and Sales teams) by managing the relationship between Google and a designated portfolio of partner organizations.
You will drive short and long-term execution with partners. During the plan’s execution, you work with all function areas within Google for Work to attract and recruit, then support partners to grow their business. You will build leadership, project management competence, acquire customer references, and establish technical and implementation capabilities.
You help focus and manage our Partners’ execution to ensure growth and capture market share for both Google and our Partners.Responsibilities
Orchestrate different resources within the organization to support capacity planning and partner recruitment activities to create and maintain a long-term, scalable channel model.
Develop and maintain business plans with focus partners, establishing clear, mutual commitments around marketing, readiness/skills development and Sales, and incorporating the rhythm of the relationship clearly. Review this plan in quarterly business reviews with the partner to monitor progress and establish corrective actions as needed.
Drive execution across activities involved in the completion of commitments and goals established in the business plan, including coordination of the Google investments, lead generation-related activities, training and readiness, and certification of technical and sales resources. Constantly maintain a clear view of the return on mutual investments.
Work with partners to maintain a healthy pipeline as indicated by velocity and coverage ratio versus the established sales goals. Organize regular pipeline reviews to ensure pipeline information is thorough and accurate according to Google’s solution selling stages. Hold reviews with Partner Sales teams to identify best practices to leverage or lessons to be learned.
Broker internal resources, tools, references and/or investments needed to execute on the business plans in order to help partners meet the set goals.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of success track record of managing sales cycle and/or channel sales working with resellers/partners.
Preferred qualifications
Qualifications in business, IT or equivalent work experience.
Broad, relevant experience in solution selling to major enterprises, potentially gained within a major software vendor. Experience selling across a wide set of industries (i.e., retail, manufacturing, services, etc.).
Proven ability to deliver consistently against business goals and to grow a sales business beyond expectations.
Ability to work independently, but within a cross-functional team environment with a thorough and tenacious attitude.
Comfortable operating at the highest level of large, complex organizations.
Ability to present complex information to customers and colleagues in a clear and appealing manner and credibility at all levels.
title: Google for Work Partner Success Manager, Philippines

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
The Global Agency Data and Analytics team works with our agency partners on data integration and consultancy projects that will accelerate growth. We work with agencies to help them better understand how to leverage Google data and build technical solutions that combine their data with our data in meaningful and impactful ways.

As a technical analyst for the Global Clients and Agency Solutions (GCAS) Agency Data and Analytics team, you will be an expert on Google data and systems, working cross-functionally with internal teams to build and manage datasets for use in external facing data projects. Using your relationship-building and influencing skills, you will work with product teams and data owners to manage data pipelines and find new compelling ways to leverage our datasets. You will prototype new, compelling ways of using Google data to help agencies and act as a data consultant.Responsibilities
Work with Sales and our Agency partners to identify opportunities to implement Google data solutions into agency planning tools.
Help customers understand and better leverage existing data sets.
Identify data sources and design database models for use on our projects.
Write and maintain the business rules, logic and SQL queries that surface the appropriate data outputs and insights.
Work with the Data and Analytics team to prototype new features for agency data projects, and work cross-functionally with other Product/Engineering teams on data initiatives.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Database experience in architecting, designing and developing backend databases, including experience in SQL coding across standard relational environments (e.g Oracle, Teradata, MySQL, etc.)

Preferred qualifications
MS or MBA Degree.
Product and project management experience. Front-line sales and service experience.
Familiarity with programming languages (Java, Python, JavaScript) and tools ecosystem (App Engine).
Advanced analytical, quantitative, and statistical problem solving skills.
Ability to build strong relationships and work effectively cross-functionally and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate with highly technical team, as well as non-technical stakeholders.
title: Data Architect, Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS)

text:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
With a rapidly growing array of sales teams, it's important to have seasoned, charismatic leaders who guide our client sales teams to success. As Head of US Hispanic Audience Sales, you will lead and coach a team that works collaboratively with Large Customer Sales LCS to grow our US Hispanic audience business. You will use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that address the US Hispanic audience. You will also work with the Sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. You will help teams deliver on ambitious targets and partner directly with clients to exceed business and merchant growth targets across markets and verticals. You are an excellent communicator with a proven ability to train and motivate a large team, and you take an analytical approach to sales management.Responsibilities
Manage the core sales team and engage with cross-functional talent to deliver insights, ideas and customer service that drives business growth for our clients and for Google.
Develop and foster C-Level relationships across the book and the US Hispanic advertising ecosystem.
Analyze data trends and client performance, develop solid strategic sales plans, and lead preparation and delivery of strategic sales presentations and narratives.
Partner with leaders of other teams to develop thought leadership on the US Hispanic audience to deliver game-changing business growth.
Attract, develop and retain the very best talent in all roles across the team.
Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience with sales management in technology and/or advertising/Internet.
Management experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Spanish fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications
MBA degree.
6 years of experience in the digital industry, in marketing, brand management or advertising sales.
3 years of sales management experience.
Proven team management and US Hispanic media experience.
Strong knowledge of, and established relationships within the Multicultural and US Hispanic media industry both and the client and agency.
title: Head of US Hispanic Audience Sales, Agency Team

text:
Google's Consumer Operations team is on a mission to delight the hundreds of millions of consumers who rely on our flagship products like Gmail, Android, Chrome and Google Play. We're an operational team that focuses on delivering excellent customer care and being there for consumers when they need us most. Our team engages consumers across the globe through our online resources and communities, social outreach, and 1:1 care. We represent the voice of the consumer and work closely with cross-functional partners across Google to make our products and policies better. We're looking for people who are passionate about focusing on the consumer and helping them get the most out of Google. So if you're excited about representing Google and delighting our consumers, join us!
As an Online Help Platform Configuration Specialist, you’ll help Google scale its user support and product education initiatives to our users worldwide. You'll partner with our consumer support teams to develop innovations that support and delight our users. You'll also oversee integration of our Online Help platform by partnering closely with editorial, engineering, and webmaster teams to ensure a consistent experience for our users. You're able to grasp technical concepts quickly, can successfully lead and manage multiple projects at a time, and have a strong passion for helping our users and driving product usage.Responsibilities
Collaborate with Google operations support teams to develop and execute product-specific online help strategies.
Build, maintain and improve Google help centers.
Analyze metrics to identify user pain points and improve online support channels.
Document best practices for implementing innovations.

Minimum qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in online operations and/or web development.
Experience in CSS and programming (HTML, JavaScript, etc.).
Preferred qualifications
Ability to work globally and cross-functionally in an ambiguous environment.
Capacity to deepen technical and functional skills in a fast-changing online help environment.
Distinctive problem-solving and analytical capabilities.
Excellent leadership, project management, communication and teamwork skills.
title: Online Help Platform Configuration Specialist, gTech Consumers
